review_body: All I can say is wow. Their staff is friendly the price and location are awsome. Their rooms are clean and we have great view. We have city view from 1 window and beach view from the next. Decently recommend it.

Had a wonderful time for the last 2 weeks here at Park Shore Waikiki. Special shout out to all of the front desk associates! They all were so accommodating and knowledgable on everything! Also, Robert, the security man was loads of fun to chat with! Thanks, Robert, for all the good stories and ideas!The location can't be beat! Just accross the streat from the famous Waikiki Beach and beautiful sunsets every night!We've come to Waikiki several times in the past and would consider this trip as one of the best, thanks to all at Park Shore! Not to mention all the good times and great food, with views at Lulu's Restaurant connected downstairs! Having an ABC store attached was also extremely convenient!!!Thanks to all!Colette & Dave

Great staff: Roxy Manager, Allan, Lito , Loreto and maintenance staff were all very helpful and efficient when I had problem with shower . They made me feel welcome and happy.Hotel is in a great location, steps to the beach and zoo, Catholic Church and stores are all walking distance.

When we arrived, the check in was fast and friendly. Our room was pretty clean except for the desk top was sticky. Reported this and another issue to the front desk and they handled it immediately and worked with us until we were satisfied. Also did not know place was under construction but it was finished a day after we arrived. So overall this is a great place. Can't beat the location, the staff were all really friendly and helpful and there are many places to eat and shop near by. I would stay there again and I would recommend to anyone looking for a nice place to stay.

Rooms are quite small, but the Hotel is in a great location. Renovations to lobby and pool area are nice. Front of hotel is also nice and has stores and restaurants adjacent to and in the actual property. Like most properties in Waikiki, they charge a resort fee and have a valet charge that is quite high. The hotel is a good deal if you want to be right on the beach or close to the zoo and Diamond head. If not, I would spend a little bit more and stay at the other end of Waikiki. Valet staff were friendly and helpful. Rest of staff was just okay. They were still semi-friendly, but not above and beyond like you’re used to in Hawaii. (No issues though)Air conditioning worked well and bathroom was okay size.

Only stayed 1 night at this hotel located near the Zoo end of Kalakaua Ave.The ground floor is currently under renovation . Lifts dont need your key card to get access to the floors unlike all other hotels we have stayed it .Rooms smell mustyand bathrooms sure need an update . Some of the carpet in the through fares are ripped .Staff very great .

You really can’t beat this place for the value! Lobby was under renovations still in January; this did not affect our night at all. Luggage hold available the next day as well as free beach towel and floaters for the beach which is directly across the street. 10/10 location. We came in before our Norwegian cruise and got to explore Waikiki before embarking. Staff was super friendly with great suggestions. Rooms could use updating but the pros vastly outweigh this. I don’tThink I’d stay anywhere else!

I feel stolen from. It's dishonest to sell one thing and deliver another. The pool offered a block away at The Aston was completely shaded &UNUSABLE until 2 pm. Nothing offered to compensate nor any discount offered. Would this kind of bait and switch be tolerated anywhere else? Would management accept a cloth sofa if they ordered and paid for a leather one? I don't think so. Also be aware the entire cost of your stay including tax and resort fees will be held on your credit card for the entire length of your stay the minute you check in. I'm glad I didn't need to use it to rent a car. The room was nice but it was really dirty. The bath fixtures looked like they hadn't been wiped in months. I couldn't take a bath. There was an actual outline of the bottom of the coffee maker left on the counter top the entire two weeks I was there. Yuk! There is no soundproofing from the hallway so expect to be woken up by 8 am. I got to actually use the pool the last two days and it was much nicer than the Aston Hotel. Unfortunately they BLASTED annoying music the entire day. Everyone has their own music, so why???. They need to ask their guests what they want.Never Again!

I have no complaints in fact I loved my stay. We got a room that was ocean view and loved the view. It was a little small. Originally when we checked in they gave us a partial view room but my wife was not happy and I did pay for ocean view so we asked them about it and they found us a room that was for the handicap. My wife is handicapped so it actually worked out better for us. Just a little on the small side. But we slept great. bed was one of the best we had slept in even compared to more expensive hotels. And the view was a million dollars. The staff all of them went above. The construction didn't bother us. But know that going in. THe pool was closed during our stay. Not sure why because only once did we see anyone there working on it. and that was to pant the rails. But no worries the ocean is only steps away. the water was 73 degrees in Feb during our stay.

We have stayed at this hotel between 10 and 15 times. For this trip we again reserved the Diamondhead suite as we have for most other stays. Although a Diamondhead suite was reserved for this stay, we were given a room well below suite standards with balcony adjacent to other rooms to look into ours. After much discussion we were given a standard Suite for the remainder of our stay. Upon arriving, the hotel did not have power and on day of leaving no water was available for the top floors. We were required to use another room to shower and prepare for our flight home. We question whether we will stay at the Par Shore again!

I have stayed at the Park Shore for almost 30 years. I arrived on Feb. 17th only to find that the pool area was entirely closed. I had booked directly with the hotel as I usually do. I told them how much I enjoyed the pool floor and how we have stayed in that area of the hotel on previous visits. They never mentioned that it would be closed. When I arrived, management "apologized" but would not discount my rate. The rate was not what I bargained for. I was very surprised that no consideration would be given even though we stay at the hotel almost every year and have been for almost 30 years. The manager did not even have the courtesy to call me as I had requested. The front desk clerk & guest manager were condescending and truly unapologetic. I went to another hotel. I realize now that this worked out for the best because there are many other hotels with better facilities and more competitive rates. Park Shore is not what it use to be.

Booked this hotel knowing it was under construction only after reading a review. Figured it couldn’t be too bad. I was mostly going to sleep and shower there. I was wrong! Very disappointing stay. The entire lobby was blocked off which caused for a lot of congestion. Was never made aware that the pool would not be available during my stay. WiFi was terrible. Paid resort fee to have access to 1 beach towel and a chair that sank straight into the sand. Oh and that was on top of the $45 per day parking. Multiple homeless people hanging out on the sidewalk outside at all times of the day. Don’t stay here unless you are getting a huge discount.

Location is perfect - beach across the street, buses within 2 minute walks, 5 minute walk to Aquarium, Zoo and shops. Concierge staff were a little pushy with shuttles and did not provide accurate information regarding buses vs shuttles.

Disclaimer: This hotel is currently under-going renovations so it may not look the prettiest in the lobby. However, I didn't hear any noises from my room so it didn't affect me too much. The only inconvenience is that their pool is out of order during this time as well but they do allow you to use their sister property's pool next door. The hotel is perfectly situated facing both the Zoo/Diamond Head and the Beach/Ocean so depending what room you get, you will be facing either or. For my room, I had a view of both which was amazing! The rooms are a bit tight and compact but they have everything you need. The King bed has nightstands on both sides which have OUTLETS in the lamps (super important for a business traveler like me)! There is a small desk in front of the bed (where the tv is mounted to the wall so unfortunately you cannot watch TV and do work at the same time) and you have your closet, restroom, fridge/coffee station right when you walk in from the entrance. I appreciated having a mini-fridge to keep my drinks cool during the day. The balcony is nice and spacious to relax on if you'd like. I was able to take some great pictures from my balcony during my stay.On the 3rd floor, they have a microwave if you want to heat up any of the food you keep in the fridge. Also, they have reef-safe sunblock and aloe vera for you. There is a charge for parking (they only have Valet) so if you only plan to stay in Waikiki Beach area, you don't need to rent a car. You are literally at one end of Waikiki Beach and you can walk to the other end if you'd like within 20-30 minutes. It is also nearby a public bus stop if you want to head out to different parts of town (downtown honolulu, north shore, etc.) without having to rent a car. Overall, I think it's a wonderful property right on the beach. Can't wait to see how it looks once the renovations are completed!

The Park Shore was a great place to stay. I travelled with a friend and moved to the Park Shore after a different hotel stuffed up our booking. We stayed in a room with two double beds, which were comfortable. The room was spacious and allowed us to both have our suitcases laid out and still have room to freely walk around and continuously add more shopping to the room everyday. The staff were helpful and friendly. There is a bus stop right out the front of the hotel which is very handy as most buses go to major attractions from this stop. The beach is viewable the moment you step out of the hotel and the hotel also supplies beach towels.

We originally was booked for the lanai/deck room but they were renovating the area and was upgraded to the Diamond ahead Suite which we had an awesome view. The staff were accommodating and was easy check in and check out! We’ll be back again!

We arrived on Friday Feb 7, on Sunday Feb 9 while riding up from a relaxing time at the pool another guest told me the pool was closing on Monday until sometime in late March or April. I called to the front desk to ask about this and they said it was true. I was very frustrated. They indicated we would have access to the pool at a neighboring building. I asked why this was not told to me when I checked in on Friday. The “supervisor” at the front desk indicated they had posted signs in the elevators. I asked to talk with the manager. He indicated he was the person in charge for Sunday and the manager would call me on Monday.I checked the elevator for the sign and it indicated the bathroom on the third floor was going to be closed. No mention in the announcement about the pool being closed. I contacted my travel service that I booked the room through, they spoke with the hotel and were told the only thing they would do was allow me to leave by noon the next day and they would not charge me the cancelation fee. So we decided to stay. I was very disappointed the next day when I went over to the pool and there was no sun on the pool deck this time of year until about 2 PM. One of my main reasons for staying at the Park shore has been the pool. The manager never contacted me and I decided to not let it ruin my entire vacation. When I checked out today Feb 16, I was still charged the resort fee even though the pool area was closed. If you have plans to go here between now and April 2020 and are looking forward to the pool, make sure to ask about it and find a different hotel if it’s not available. We have stayed at this hotel every time we are in Waikiki and we will never stay here again.

Excellent hotel at quiet end of Waikiki and great views. The employees at the front desk and valet service were terrific. Although the hotel was under renovation it remained quiet and they were overly considerate of their guests. The views of both the beach and diamond head were spectacular. We would definitely stay there again.
the staff was really nice and kind.Everything was up to my satisfaction but the ongoing construction because of the noise. My friends and I did like staying here so we might stay here next time too!!

Really lovely staff (99% of the staff). Super friendly. Great location, super close to the beach. Great views. Quieter end of Waikiki but able to get around easily. Hoping to be back. Mahalo Park Shore

So glad we only had to stay two nights before our cruise. Room was clean yet rust all on bathroom shelving for towels etc. Drapes water stained! The best part Starbucks 10 ft away. Only stay if you must

This s a great place to stay because it is across from the beach and the zoo.....very quiet at night......and even has a pool if you want......is under renovation at this point and the price was very reasonable.......Valet parking with a moderate cost compared to other hotels......with places for snacks next door and easy to walk along the main strip for shopping.......nice clean rooms ....i had a great view......helpful staff ....free beach towels ......

Ocean facing room with a great ocean view. Friendly helpful staff. Good location at the south end of the main strip in Waikiki Beach. Room quite small, no table, chairs, minimal luggage space. Outside noise into the room. Stayed in Dec so air con was adequate.

Staff not bad, not great. Hotel is getting renovations so appearance to be expected again not bad not great. It was clean though. The hotel is a bit dated hence the renos but the location is EVERYTHING!! We had a pool side room on the 3 rd floor deck! It was awesome to wake up to the beautiful Waikiki beach views and sounds out front and to the left a gorgeous view if Diamond Head. The hotel has an ABC Store attached, a Starbucks on the street level and an excellent restaurant above the Starbucks! Everything you need pretty much right out the front door! Highly recommend this hotel. Had a few issues but nothing that would make me not want to book here again .

A million dollar view, very comfortable beds, clean and well maintained room, right scross from a beautiful beach and views of the diamond head, what more could you ask for!! The staff was all very friendly we actually received an upgrade to an ocean from room on the 8th floor! It was perfect and we recieved more than our monies worth!!! Aloha Park Shore and thank you for our great anniversary memories!

Had a great time here, spotless clean and absolutely loved the location nice and quiet while only 5mins walk from centre Waikiki pool area was fab nice and quiet view amazing views our room didn't have a view but sure I fairness wasn't in it much, if I'm honest thought the $39 a day resort fee was abit much as was $420 on arrival which would be a big blow had we not known but I did so was prepared for it however would be a chunk of spending money for someone if they didn't know however as I said had a ball friendly staff also

My wife and I stayed at Park Shore for five nights and could not have been more satisfied. Clean, tasteful and very comfortable room, and with a very friendly and helpful staff. Extra points for the proximity to the beach, of course, and that guests can borrow chairs, towels and much more before going there. Highly recommended.

Just returned home from a wonderful 9 nights at the Park Shore. We had booked an Oceanfront room and was given room 1507. It is a corner room overlooking the beach and Diamond Head. The views were spectacular. Staff were great. Hotel was clean. Bed was comfy. There wasnt much bathroom storage but we made it work. It is at the very end of Waikiki, which made driving to the H1 very easy. We did have a rental car and used the Park Shores valet. No issues there at all. The only complaint I had was the resort fee. I know all the hotels seem to have a resort fee, but I found the Park Shore pretty expensive for what was included. Guests were supposed to receive a "coupon" for a drink daily at Lulu's restaurant located on the second floor. We got our coupons on the day we checked in. Never got them again. We went to the front desk daily to ask for them and they were always out. But other than that, the hotel was great!

At the quiet end of Waikiki beach. Hotel lobby was under renovation. No bar or food service at the pool. Good staff service and view of Diamond Head and ocean with an ocean view room. Convenient assess to all of Waikiki.

Park Shore Waikiki is a great Hotel, its location is perfect, close to shops and beach, people are very helpful and rooms are nice. The view of the beach and the diamond head from the hotel are amazing...Highly recommended!!!

I had a wonderful stay with ocean view.  This nice hotel is at the eastern end of the Waikiki beach. Along the coast across the Kalakaua Ave.I stayed in the corner room with roll-in shower on the 9th floor.It was a room with great views of both the ocean and Diamond-Head from the bed. I was able to check-in early at 11am.Of course, the reception a staff are amazing.(Especially, the white female staff always had a full smile.)And the staff at the bell desk were also kind.On the second floor, there is a restaurant without glass in the window named “LuLu’s”.Open from breakfast to midnight drinks,it was very convenient for me.The number one hamburger shop in the hamburger section of ranking for 14 consecutive years is nearby.There is also an open-air and friendly LGBT bar is in same building.To the center of Waikiki, It is about 10 to 15 minutes on foot.Bus stops for The bus and Pink bus are conveniently locate nearby.Several biki stops are also nearby.Kuhio beach in front of this hotel is surrounded by a breakwater, so It is recommended because families with children also can rest assured.This is the cheapest hotel at the ocean front in Honolulu.But I thought it's worth more than accommodation costs.  I am thankful for a memorable stay. Thank you very much.

Calls to the hotel ahead of time to check on room check-in, transportation options, etc, were never returned. Front lobby was a mess due to construction; bed sheets being used to partition off work areas, etc....Front desk personnel seemed to have a cavalier attitude when dealing with guests. I would not say that they had a hospitality approach to dealing with guests.Paid extra for ocean view and got the worst view of all possible ocean view rooms. It was tucked into an inside corner of the building so the ocean view and diamond head views were partially obscured by the building's walls.Room smelled musty and felt damp the whole time. The a/c felt like it was a swamp cooler so while the room did cool down, it felt very clammy and damp. On Day three the A/C did not work well enough to get the room below 70 degrees, despite building maintenance's efforts, and so we had to have a room fan.Building power went out in the middle of Day 2 for 90 minutes so no a/c or lights, and down to 1 elevator we were asked to not use.LuLu's servings and service (possibly they have nothing to do with the hotel) was bad, slow and indifferent. Despite getting free drink tickets, we stopped going there.Resort fee is an expensive and bad joke. It gets you slow wi-fi access, free towels and sunscreen at the pool, and some discounts on outside services.Would definitely use a different hotel next time.

Great Location, if you don't want the noise or inconvenience of staying in the center of Waikiki. Good for Kamaaina stays. Ask for discount and resort fee to be waived. Valet parking ½ price, etc. Front desk gives daily free drink coupons for Lulus. :)

expensive but a good location , it is a very old building that could use a total restoration and become on of the if not the nicest buildings on the strip. I think it is the best location on the strip..

This was my husband and mines second trip to Oahu but our first time staying at the Park Shore. We loved the location at the end of Waikiki strip but still very walkable to all the shops and especially the beach. Our room at Park Shore was always very clean during our 5 day stay, the staff were very helpful, we loved the free use of boogie boards / beach towels / beach chairs and took advantage of all. The location of Park Shore to an amazing beach right across the street made this a great choice for us. One thing I will mention is that the hotel is older but I felt it was always clean. The valet car service was a pricey $45 per day but in the area was comprable to other hotels. We would definately stay at Park Shore again.

This was an excellent place to stayed. Great location, excellent staff service and the oceanfront room was well worth the money as the views were amazing and not to mention to cleanliness of the rooms for the price you pay!

The room was a perfect location to enjoy the lovely Waikiki beach. It was as if I stayed with the living window-sized canvas that reflects the Beach during the vacation. The Diamond Head was also available to watch from the corridor outside of the room door.

Our stay at the Park Shore Waikiki was disappointing. The hotel is situated in an absolutely beautiful location central to everything in Waikiki. We booked through Expedia and thought we would be getting either a West or South facing room with ocean views off the lanai. The room we were provided upon check in was neither of those options. For the price we paid this was a huge disappointment. There are several issues with this hotel. First, the furnishings, carpeting and overall appearance of the hotel needs updating and is looking tired. Second, there was rarely enough pressure in the shower and the toilet made an awful noise everytime it was flushed. Third, daily parking was not included in the overall rate and was too expensive. Fourth, the room smelled of mildew and needed maintenance. We will stay elsewhere next time we are in Honolulu.

Elevators were frequently out of order. Our rooms was on the 11th floor it was a pain to take the stairs. Rooms were small and amenities were minimal. Overall the value was not worth the cost. Only good thing it is a across from the beach.

Staff were lovely but the hotel smelt musty,and looked dirty, noisy being next to the road, dated and expensive . Pool area good views were brilliant from room but lots of charges/taxes, good location re Honolulu and views of the park

The staff is tremendous at the Park Shore Waikiki especially James at Front Desk. The rooms are very clean and they have outstanding views of Diamond Head Waikiki Beach the city in the mountains. The lobby is nicely appointed the valley is very friendly and efficient the bellman were fantastic the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. I just live down the street by the water pipe blew up in my apartment so we had to move into the Park Shore Waikiki James Front two days while it was getting fixed and I couldn’t be happier.

Friendly staff, clean rooms, amazing views and perfect location. The beach is one of the best in Waikiki, not crowded and very close to Diamond Head. Walking, Biking or running are all easy to do right from your hotel. We have stayed multiple times and will be back soon!

Was expecting much more and got tired of being told it had new management and that's why things we expected didn't happenOnly service we got for our service tax was beach towelsLocation was great and close to so many places Room waa swamped by King sized bed...no room to move around though it did have a nice balconyHad to ask for a jug to make tea and tea bags

Park shore has a great service. Employees have smile always. And they borrow beach towel for free a day. And the room is clean and the bed is big and comfortable. And especially room is very quiet so you can sleep tight.

Having stayed at the park shore many times we thought we were getting the same experience as before. Sadly we were not. This is a 3 - 3.5 star hotel that used to offer good value for families looking to get away and enjoy the quiet side of Waikiki. The value is no longer the same with the loss of the shuttle, coffee/juice bar, increased resort fee and a pool that's not a clean as past visits. Would I ever visit again...maybe!

Great location at the eastern end of the Waikiki strip - by Kapiolani Park, the zoo, the aquarium and the beach. Get an ocean view or front room for breathtaking views of the beach, Diamond Head and surfers.Rooms, pool and hotel are okay, certainly not deluxe, but you don’t come to Waikiki to stay in your room and not go to the beach.Very busy street activity, with lots of cars, buses and unfortunately a steady stream of delivery trucks that idle out front for very long periods of time. One company came ever other morning from about 6 to 730 am. Another guest who was bothered by the same truck, told us there was a 3 minute max idling time, but that everyone ignores it. Bring ear plugs!

Nice little hotel with helpful staff. Needs a little tidying as decor made the rooms quite dark. The first room they offered us had a mouldy smell but they moved us without argument. It’s at the quieter end of Waikiki which is a bonus.

I was concerned about some of the reviews I saw online but I am glad I booked the hotel.My husband was there on military orders and he was at Scofield Barracks through out the day (40mins away). So I wanted somewhere I could walk to things. This hotel was the place! Convenient to everything in walking distance. Great military rates! I will return to Hawaii and stay at the hotel again, God willing. I did not use the services of the ticket office because rates were better at military base. Note, the ticket office says closes at 5:30pm but the office was closed earlier than stated. I was impressed with always seeing staff vacuuming, elevators, painting the trim of doors, adding fresher to elevators was great idea since guest are always on and off while wet returning from the beach. Will say not a fan of the on site restaurant. Great people but the food was very over cooked. This was after they served me the wrong dish. So, I was disappointed with that. Perhaps it just was a bad night for the cooks. The waitress took full responsibility of entering wrong dish. I can say, it was always busy; bar and grill setting. I miss being there already!

If you are looking for a place to stay that is quite but still in the heart of Waikiki Beach area this should be the place for you. Within walking distance to all the shops and restaurants. Relax on their roomy pool deck or grab your surf board and head to the ocean and catch a wave. You will not be disappointed.

Location was very convenient. Staff is friendly. Valet was great. Joey from valet is a perfectionist. Brian at reception was very nice. The Japanese restaurant in the hotel has great food. Tucker and Bevvy shop attached has great food as well. ABC store attached and detached was super convenient. Maid staff was not too friendly but efficient.
user_name:
raven41885
New York City, New York

review_body: You are not going to spend a fortune here for your hotel but you are going feel like you should have paid much more. The location can't be beat for view, beach and attractions. Three restaurants open to the lobby ( lulu's was our favorite for over the top breakfasts but also good for other meals and drinks). You won't find a better place for just walking around with zoo, aquarium, shops and sand with both plenty of sun and sun.Swimming on the safe side of a breakwater or not is less than 300 feet from the hotel's front entrance. One last thing the staff could not be more accommodating! It is not difficult to make my case for the go to place for a visit to Waikiki!

It is an ideal location for fun as well as business. Worked out perfect for my trip. It's centrally located easy for friends to come visit with us . Restaurants located close by..Beavy and Tucker is ideal for snacks and drinks. Lulu's is a great restaurant located on premises.

What a find! Delightful hotel off of the beaten path. The customer service is wonderful and the staff is extremely knowledgeable. It’s connected to LuLu’s on the 2nd floor, where you will find a variety of meals and libations - all meals eaten there were delightful with great customer service to match!

My room was a partial ocean view room with a king bed. Room is smaller but it didn’t matter at all. The lanai is quite large and my partial view is gorgeous and more than what I thought a partial view would be. I love that there is a large safe and a fridge in the room. The bed, including the pillows was really comfortable. I absolutely loved the fact that you can stream through your tv from your phone through Comcast. So cool. The pool area has sun exposure all day too which is a bonus. I would gladly stay here again.

On our 4th trip to Hawaii, we chose a different accommodation this time. The Park Shore was a little less pricey than the others we had stayed in previously. We knew nothing about it except for reviews and research as we usually do. Being on the lively and much desired Waikiki Beach location in Kalakaua Avenue helped us make the decision. The Hotel is situated opposite The Honolulu Zoo. In fact, if you are in a certain spot, you can hear the monkeys chattering together. After a 10 hour flight from Australia, it was a pleasant surprise to find our room ready at 6:30 am! when we arrived. After an initial slight issue with our cards, all was well to proceed to our Ocean View room, with the added addition of Diamond Head, beyond the Zoo. There is a resort fee payable of $39 per night extra. If you are from Australia, don't forget to add tax! Our room was pleasant if basic, with the usual facilities. Hawaiian Paradise coffee in a pouch which makes two and a half cups each day and was disappointingly luke warm. No milk is supplied which is fine because there is an ABC store right through the lobby and a Starbucks outside the front door. The ABC shops cater for everything. We were fortunate to obtain a south facing room on the 8th floor as the rooms facing the beach (west) directly had the full force of afternoon sun. The Hotel has a rooftop pool. It was relatively quiet as the pool closed reasonably early and unlike other Hotels, there was no bulk air conditioner noise to keep us awake so we slept well here. We liked the Hotel. The staff were pleasant and accommodating. The foyer has rocking chairs facing the street which guests seemed to appreciate. There is Lulu's restaurant upstairs where we spent our mutual birthdays, sipping on Pina Coladas and a Mai Tai. Ah the scent of plumeria wafting inside and the sound of waves crashing to shore. We recommend The Park Shore and thank them for another positive reason to visit Honolulu.

Me and my partner are currently staying here. We have had numerous issues with our aircon, it keeps turning off, doesn’t cool our room down until early morning, you can hear everything that’s happening around you including a door that slams every 10 minutes or so at night time, I’ve even walked out to try find the person who is slamming the door but can’t seem to find where it comes from. Not sure if they allow people to smoke in their rooms but our aircon is blowing out cigarette and marijuana smell everyday so clearly someone is smoking in their room. The gap under the door to the hall way is pretty large so at night it lights our whole room up, you can see people walk past at night. Every day we have come back to our room at the end of the day and our room still hasn’t been touched (must be lacking staff).... the view is lovely and WiFi is good. I wouldn’t stay here again, not to mention there are a lot of homeless people that hang around this side of Waikiki (they are of no harm) but I wouldn’t bring kids down this end. I’ve stayed at the outriggers on the beach and I didn’t want to compare but their service is beyond amazing, lovely staff, very helpful so this is a major downgrade for us. I can actually currently smell cigarette as I write this blowing out of our aircon :|

My wife and I came off a cruise and booked Honolulu four nights. Upscale living had been done on the cruise, and we were looking for some beach time, hopefully not too busy/crazy beach time. Park Shore Waikiki was an outstanding location for us. 10 out of 10 for location. Our room looked out at Diamond head as well as the beach. Balcony was located so we got enough shade most times of the day.... but the unobstructed view of the zoo park and trees, Diamond Head, and the beach area (across the street) were a huge bonus. Just far enough down from the noise and mayhem of 'Honululu Central.' That being said, the hotel facilities are definitely three star, and could use a serious update, but all was clean, service was very good. For amenities, there is a good coffee shop, an ABC market ... good for most needs, and also 'Lulu's' restaurant and sports bar essentially downstairs in the hotel. The hotel also does a nice job at supplying towels/chairs/beach floatie things that folks can take to the beach, which is literally across the street. Terrific protected and safe beach swimming for the kids. Also, if you walk just a few hundred meters south along the beach sidewalk, and into the park type area, lots of local families enjoying the water, picnic's going on .... fun and safe. If walking along beach towards busier part of 'Lulu, yup, the typical homeless folks sitting or laying about, but all seemed safe, and the police are very visible, and on top of things ..... from what we could see. Again, a three star place with a top notch location from our perspective.

On the edge of Waikiki so less people. Beach a few places from lobby. They give you towel coupons. Lulu's nice for breakfast. Valet parking is a necessary expense to consider. Within walking distance to shops

You get what you pay for.Ocean Front Room on the 7th floor (ice machine broken for years), room was pool front, rooftop front, street front, ocean front. Room is small and it is horribly hot midday until after sunset. I ask for a fan at check-in, we were told no. We approached the desk again with my husband dripping sweat, they sent someone up. Repair man shot a little temp. gun into the vent and said it's 64, lol. I then pointed out to the repair man that you can see around the entire door to the room (which doesn't open into a hallway but an outdoor walk) and there is literally a 6x1 gap under the door and the sliding doors for the balcony are just glass. These sliding doors heat up between midday and sunset like an oven, the heat radiates a good 3' from them even with all the black out drapes pulled. He agreed and said all the fans were gone, they had a small fan in an office. The 39 resort fee that every hotel on Waikiki charges and people say what is it for? It's for nothing, lol. I had read that this property furnished chairs and umbrellas for this fee, they do not have umbrellas and the chairs are limited and they are squat chairs (little tiny keep you butt of the ground things that you might use in a small fishing boat). The moral of this story is you get what you pay for, even though they charge a high price, in general, it is at least $100 a night less expensive than any other property on Waikiki. Manage your expectations, it is a good location, it is clean.

My son and I stayed at the Park Shore for seven days in October. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. The staff are fantastic, they go out of their way to help and make your stay memorable. We left an item we purchased in our room, they found it and posted it back to us! It was above and beyond what we expected. Highly recommended place to stay. The hotel is great value and a fantastic location, so close to everything. We cannot wait to go back.

Customer service and location couldn't have been better. Roxy and Kanai stick out at the front desk with plethora of Waikiki knowledge and everyone at the bell desk was very friendly. My room had unobstructed view of Diamond Head and the ocean and it was clean and quiet. This was my first time here and I will be back!

The hotel was wonderful. Great location, right near the beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our only concern was that we felt the hotel was in need of some major remodeling. The rooms were very clean but we found nicks in the walls and the curtains had stains.

We've been staying here since 1994 and love it. Just got home for 18 perfect days here. Best views of any hotel on Waikiki. Rooms are clean, staff is great. My only 'complaint' is the $45 a night to park the car. I think it's a bit high. The hotel is convient to everything, lots of great restaurants nearby. It's at the end of the 'strip' of hotels and has views of Diamond Head and the Pacific. We always get an ocean view room on the 15th floor or above for the best view. When you want to leave and take a drive, it's very easy to get out of town and go along Diamond Head Rd to see see the gorgeous views of the island. We do love this hotel and will be back ASAP!! Thanks for a great stay...again!! Five stars isn't enough.

The rooms appeared neat and clean but a musty odor was noted. Maybe the carpets need to be replaced. I could hear traffics in my room with the window closed and door shut. It would have been nice to check out without having a front desk person to appear and close out my account.

Had a very good start to my vacation by being upgraded to a ocean view suite. Michelle at the front desk was very nice and helpful made our welcome that much better. She even gave us a box of chocolates as we mentioned it was our anniversary. Room was very clean and big modern and up to date! This hotel is close to everything! Location perfect!

This was a great experience. Our first time on this island was made even more rememberable because of our hotel. This hotel had upfront beach access the front desk not only offered 24 hour assistance but great amenities from free drinks at a local restaurant to beach chairs at no charge. Our room had a beautiful view and like I said All we had to do was walk across the street and our toes were in those. The recommendations of the staff let us to great restaurants locally and on the Half to a rememberable vacation. You're within walking distance from anything you could think of food shopping we're touring. The pool overlooks the ocean and the restaurant is right off second story all attached to the hotel all included. I was even able to use a go pro and scuba diving at no charge. We will really be returning!!

We arrived around 9am and we had a 6 hour wait before checkin. So prior to checkin, the hotel only circulates between guests 2 bathroom keys which, as more guests arrived, access to the bathroom slowed down and became an even bigger issue. Reception told us there are only 2 keys available! So you either hold on or go to public facilities. Great view from our room though and close to the beach.

We stayed in a diamond head suite room. It was a stunning view! We could see blue ocean and green Diamond head from the window. 有名ホテルのシティービューより安く、ダイヤモンドヘッドと海の見える部屋に泊まれます！しかもレンジもミニシンクもありました。スタッフは英語のみですがとても親切でした。豪華さはありませんが、とても便利で清潔なホテルです。

My husband and I had booked 6 nights at the Park Shore in a Diamond Head view suite and were very excited for our room, especially given how much we were paying (we had decided to splurge on the hotel). The hotel lobby was not impressive but the staff were friendly and quickly got us checked in, including offering us free bottles of water.When we got out of the elevator on the 14th floor the hallway was dark, hot, and a little grimy. We were still optimistic that money had been spent on the rooms instead of the hallways. Unfortunately we were wrong.The room was an extreme let down. It was dark and also grimy, with extremely dirty curtains. The bathroom was small and was not very nice. There were two ceiling tiles in the entrance to the room that were slightly open, exposing the duct work above. When we opened the curtains, we discovered that we could only see Diamond Head from our "Diamond Head view suite", if we stood on the farthest side of our balcony on our tip toes.We decided to tough it out, stay one night, and see how it went. However, we quickly discovered (as many other people on here also have) that the a/c did not work at all. It blew out air, but the room stayed between 74-76 degrees the entire time we were there. I went down and talked to the front desk, who sent up a maintenance worker. He showed me how to turn the a/c on and off again, and then left. The front desk also sent up a fan (the speed with which they offered this solution made it clear they'd heard this complaint before) which we didn't use because it was so dirty.We stayed one night and then went down to the front desk and asked about the cancellation policy. The staff were very nice and since we'd already paid for one night, we could leave without any other costs.Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Accessible to everything. Great customer service. Cheaper than the rest of the hotels. Staff are welcoming and no long lines on checking in/ out and valet. The amount you paid is super worth it and you’ll never regret

We stayed here two years ago and once again it was a perfect stay ! From the check in to check out all was great ! The staff is exceptionally helpful and friendly even when they are busy. Our room was a partial ocean view and it was always clean and balcony is large and great view of beach ! I appreciated the chocolate and wine for our 45 anniversary ! The hotel is close to the Barefoot cafe , Starbucks, subway and bus stops . I love the protected beach area with the jetty that breaks the waves . It’s right across the street . Beach towel card works great and easy to use . Free chairs are a little small for the average person but useable . Our trip was perfect with getting to watch the Sunset on the beach with Hawaii five O and a great hotel ! Thanks park shore !

Great location. Even when Kalakaua is closed for special events, you can still get in and out of the Park Shore. This is very important to me. The staff is also very friendly and always willing to help out with suggestions of things to do. Great people!

I've stayed at the Park Shore many time but stopped a few years ago when they had their renovation and raised their rates. But as time went on, their rates became more acceptable. So I gave them another chance earlier this month (Sept. 14-23, 2019). Our first room, Ocean View, was nice but the A/C just couldn't keep the room cool. So the next morning we upgraded and moved to an Ocean Front room with spectacular views. But even with the A/C set to 65 we could not get the room cool enough to enjoy the room during the day. But by the time we were ready to turn in, the room was close to acceptable for sleeping. I know that Hawaii was having record heat but that is why a working A/C in necessary. I ran into a woman from Australia in the elevator and she said that she didn't think any of the rooms on the 17th floor had working A/C. And to add to our discomfort, this Ocean Front room, #1807 had a teeny bathroom with only a pedestal sink -- with almost no space for cosmetics and toiletries. Also, there is a huge daily resort fee that covered almost nothing of interest -- not even a newspaper! On our way out, the bellman told us, when we complained, that most of the room's A/Cs didn't work well and that there were only two options left: A major remodel or to tear it down and build a new hotel on this prime site. Plus the hotel changed hands recently and is no longer run by Aqua. Also, the help, all pleasant, mostly worked to hide the poor A/Cs in the rooms. Sad. I cannot stay there again I'm sorry to say, because the location and views are so great. Mahalo and Aloha.

We were a family of 5 ordering 2 rooms; 1 room for 2 persons and 1 room for 3 persons, superior room with seaview. There is no doubt that the rooms are not designed for having an additional bed as we could hardly move around and therefore cancelled the room service. However, besides this, the hotel was great. Situated cross the Waikiki Beach, and close to almost everything. Many good places around for gitring breakfast. The staff was Nice and very friendly, and you could always get could water at the reception. If I Will go back to Honolulu, I would never hesitate to spend the days in this hotel.

This trip was a 75th birthday gift from my grandaughter & husband. It was amazing & all at hotel were very friendly & assisting. Exceptionally nice & clean hotel. Things around it were a Starbucks, ABC convenience store,Waikiki Zoo, Waikiki Aquarium & of course the beach. A nice restaurant Lulu,s accessible from hotels 2nd floor & pool on 3rd floor. Picture was taken from my room.

Coming up on our 8th year here I can say we’ve seen good and bad changes. We started coming before the hotel did a remodel about 7 years ago. The rooms have become date and show signs of their age now. The new owners have not only taken some things such as free newspapers and the end of the bed cover away but now the hotel charges well beyond the original $25 a day Resort Fee. Now it’s about $39 a day yet your not getting anything more the the $14 a day increase. Free coffee and water downstairs is gone. The comfortable chairs to people watch out now wood rocking chairs.If you must stay here then do so but if you can find another hotel I’d say stay there.

Service was excellent. Rooms were fine and very comfortable. I stayed for two weeks and the only issue I had was the pool being closed for three days due to pool maintenance. Normally not an issue, being so close to the beach but my room was at pool level and the pool area was meant to also be my balcony area, which I was also denied access to for those three days of my stay. However, in the scheme of things, that was just an inconvenience. Did it ruin my holiday or stay at the Park Shore Waikiki, definitely not!

We stayed here for a work event as well as a little family vacation. The location is perfect. Right across the street from the beach and zoo. Super convenient to shopping and restaurants. The staff were super friendly and professional. Our room was spacious and had a spectacular view. Daily housekeeping was efficient and kept us well stocked in amenities. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a really nice and clean hotel at a super great price.

We received the warmest reception when we arrived at the hotel. We were informed of all the perks the hotel had to offer. The staff was very friendly and eager to help. The check in was flawless. We were shown to our room so the relaxing could begin. We had an oceanview room. The room and balcony was very spacious. The hotel paid attention to every detail on the room amenities. It is conveniently located to shops, entertainment and restaurants. It has parking and valet....for a fee. I would totally stay here again. I will also recommend this hotel to my family and friends. This hotel gets a 5 Star rating.

A nice no frills hotel. Clean and modern. Easy to borrow stuff and not have to go buy things that you have to drag home. Excellent location and staff that provided great suggestions and information but wasn't too pushy and didn't try to sell a bunch of things that we weren't interested in. Love staying here!

My husband and I stayed at the Park Shore for two nights at the beginning of our honeymoon this August. Michelle at the front desk checked us in and she was amazing. You can tell she loves what she does. Check in was smooth and Michelle’s update attitude had us started off right. We received a room upgrade. Our room had amazing views of both Waikiki and Diamond Head. Our room wasn’t huge but large enough for a king size bed without feeling cramped. Room was clean no complaints there from me. My husband’s only complaint was the shower height, but he’s tall. He was still able to get in no problem and get clean. At the end of our stay we really wanted to cancel our other reservations and just stay here, but our reservation was non refundable:( We definitely want to stay here on our next trip. Oh, and the location was great for us easy beach access and at the slightly less crowded end of Waikiki (it’s Honolulu, it’s a city, it’s always busy). We loved this place and loved Michelle and the rest of the staff also very friendly and helpful. The photos were taken from the balcony of our room.

My husband and I have been stay this hotel every summer for 13 years. Overall, we like this hotel. Excellent view, cozy room. But only one thing we were suprised that 18th floor's ice machine was out of order still this summer! It was out of order last summer too. This year, 14th floor ica machine was out of order too. I wonder if this hotel has a special offer for repeat customer. Before they had one because they belonged to AQUA group, but they don't anymore. Besides small things, we love this hotel, excellent view and a location.

Enjoyed our stay at this fantastic hotel. It’s located near to the zoo, beach, and a great breakfast joint, Lu Lu’s. It’s not a luxury resort, but it’s clean, comfy, and a very good location. Our room was on an upper floor with amazing views. We would stay here again.

This is an amazing Hotel in a great location. Get Ocean Front. You'll be glad. Zoo is about 300 feet away. Aquarium 10 minute walk. The beach is across the street. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.

Great location, rooms are quiet and king bed was very comfortable. Room didn’t cool well but we requested and received a fan which made a huge difference. Everything was very clean. Good water pressure.

Park Shore was a great hotel on the quieter end of Waikiki steps away from the beach and The Honolulu Zoo. Easily walkable to lots of restaurants etc. We had an Oceanview room and the view was beautiful. Staff were friendly and readily available.If you're looking for a big hotel with lots of restaurants, shops etc this is not it. The pool is on the 3rd floor right off the street and is open until sunset.We would definitely stay here again.

We are returning guests at the hotel and initially we were apprehensive of the hotel having new owners. However we were impressed with the new management’s initiatives. Our room had been refreshed and the foyer was brighter and well laid out. The staff were helpful and courteous. Michelle in particular, at the front desk, was very friendly and went out of her way to ensure our stay was enjoyable. We did appreciate it. Eric in reservations was another staff member who made sure our requests were catered for and he was always prompt in returning my emails. He was great as well. The swimming pool area was much more inviting and the beach chairs had been renewed.Overall we were impressed with what was happening and will certainly have no hesitation in returning.

Just at the South end of Waikiki beach, it has great ocean view rooms with some having partial views of the famous beach. It has a nice small pool and deck with plenty of room to sun or paddle. Just across the road is the beach with a protected lagoon deep enough to swim in for all ages. Easy access to plenty of restaurants and shops. Very friendly staff.I will happily return.

Excellent hospitality, staff was very welcoming, very courteous at all times. Right across the street is the BEACH!! Shopping, restaurants, coffee shops, all waling distance from the resort. They have a swimming pool, they provide clean fresh towels each time you feel like running to the pool or the beach, which is right across the street. They even provide you with sunscreen and after sun. We really enjoyed our stay! Thank you for your hospitality. Aloha and Mahalo.

We loved that it was across the street from the beach! It could be updated a bit but it fit our needs. The hotel is away from the craziness of Waikiki but close walk to everything. Tucker and Bevvy next to the hotel has amazing acai bowls! We got them in the morning and sat on the beach to eat our breakfast!

We had a very shaky start with an unhelpful valet attendant. He refused to let us park our car for 5 mins in their underground car park ( the pull up drive outside the entrance was closed due to roadworks) whilst we checked in...and he was extremely rude to us too. So if you turn up with a hire car, you’ll need to have a bag drop off plan and scope where you will park before you check in. The streets are packed and it’s unlikely you’ll get a place to park nearby.That said, the rest of the hotel staff are amazing and super helpful! We had a room on 16th floor, so fantastic views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Room is adequate but you get what you pay for in Waikiki! Pool area is lovely, downside is that loud tacky music plays all day. Could do with a couple more shade umbrellas for the loungers. Great location if you prefer to be just outside the hustle & bustle ! There is cute cafe and ABC store right outside the hotel and everything you need in walking distance. Nice beach / swim area across the road too.Hope they can come up with a better solution for guests with a car checking in than the treatment we received !

The hotel is nice and have great location. Unfortunately I don't feel to be fair to charge resort fee for things like WiFi or water in a lobby, daily newspaper? Really? Those things are usually included in the room prices anyway. This is the common practice in Hawaii so make sure you check their resort fees before booking. Some hotels are trying really hard to justify the resort fee rip-off.Parking in the hotel is expensive but you can park for free on the street nearby.
user_location: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
user_name:
petersonpol
Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom

review_body: Booked in the 11th hour as we had to leave our other hotel. This place is located right on the beach, has Starbucks and an ABC store right below it. Has free use for towels and chairs at the beach. Rooms were fine, a bit small. Two doubles for adults is rough. The bathroom needs more ventilation as well. Room has safe and mini fridge along with a small coffee maker. Would stay again!

Great hotel, price are good, convenience, closest to the beach, staff friendly, cleanedswimming pool is big and easy accessthe arrived staff is taking care of business fast and friendlysome floating device and sun block available for free

My husband, daughter and I stayed here for five nights after a cruise from Sydney we stayed in a water view room overlooking the pool and the beach. The room was clean, it not fancy. We were conveniently placed near bus and trolley stops. It was also an easy walk to Waikiki beach shopping and restaurants and Diamond Head. Service was adequate. We would stay here again but only in a water view room.

This was our second stay at the hotel this year. The service is outstanding. The location is perfect. The property is older and the rooms are smaller. However the cleanliness is good. The employees are very nice. It’s across the street from the beach. What more could you want?

We stayed at Parkshore for 9 nights in July to celebrate my 40th birthday.I had read reviews before our visit and was getting slightly concerned by the negative reviews. I even emailed the hotel before our visit because I was concerned, and they assured me I had nothing to worry about.They were right!! We stayed in room 1611 and it was perfect.The views were amazing. We had views of both diamond head and the beach, we also overlooked the pool.We had absolutely no complaints about the room at all.Check in was fast and simple. We even had a bottle of sparkling wine and chocolates left in our room for my birthday.The staff were friendly and helpful. We booked 3 excursions from the desk in reception. The island circle tour, the Chief luau, and shark cage diving. We’re thoroughly enjoyed all of these and highly recommend.We mainly ate in Lulus with is adjoined to the hotel. The food was amazing!! If we were to visit Oahu again then we would have no hesitation in staying at Parkshore again!

A reasonably priced hotel right across the street from the beach. It is at the end of the strip, so it is a little more quiet and easier to get in and out of. We had a patio style room with doors that opened to the pool deck.

Over the past five years I’ve stayed at this hotel 6 times and each time has been a pleasant experience. Their location is one of the best, because it’s located right across the road from the beach and is the very last hotel on the Waikiki Beach strip, which in turn makes them a very quiet hotel, away from the noise of the strip. The hotel is just across the road from the Zoo and Queen Kapiolani Park, so in the early morning hours the birds and singing and your views are countless trees, Diamond Head and the ocean. The front desk staff is very pleasant and helpful and the beds are quite comfortable. The lobby is open air and the rooms are small, but clean and have very good air conditioning. While the hotel is a little dated, they still offer an pretty acceptable product. About a year ago the hotel became part of the Aston hotel group, so they’ve cut back on lobby and room amenities and have instituted a resort levy (as most Hawaii hotels have) at a staggering $39 per person, per day a day. This allows you free internet, free local and long distance calls (on your iPhone its also provides you free domestic calls back to the mainland), the use of a beach chair and towel, a packet of free coffee to use in your room coffeemaker and free sun tan lotion - all for only $39 each!. Nevertheless, in spite of the resort levy, you’ll be hard pressed not to find similar resort fee charges elsewhere. So, in spite of their shortcomings, I have to recommend this hotel because of their great location and relatively affordable rates compared to other Waikiki hotels and would recommend this place to family and friends.

We had a room with a view on the 17th floor overlooking Mountain Head and the zoo in front of us, and to the side an expansive view of Waikiki Beach. The hotel is located really close to great restaurants and nightlife so you don't need to travel far to enjoy a great night out. I would definitely recommend staying here and try and get a high floor if possible so you aren't overlooking the pool area (our preference anyway).

A great hotel for the price. The staff is great & extras like beach towels & “floaties” are nice. The only negatives are $45 per day for parking and the pool isn’t lit, so it closes early. We’ll be back!!!

I spent a week at the Park Shore Hotel. I have traveled to Hawaii at least once a year for 15 years but this was my first stay at this hotel. I agree with other reviewers that the location is great, not just because it is near so many restaurants and close to the beach. It is the last property before a park and zoo so there are no buildings on one side to disrupt the view or cast a blanket of shade on the pool (in contrast, for example, to the Outrigger Reef). Also, it is across from arguably the best part of the beach. Due to erosion some of the high-end hotels (e.g., Sheraton) in the center of Waikiki have virtually no beach. Despite the wonderful location, this hotel may not appeal to people who are used to a five star resort where everything is shinny and modern and exclusive. In addition, it may not meet the expectations of kids who are used to big pools with slides and water falls (good luck finding one of those in Waikiki, the only pool that comes close is at the Hilton Hawaiian Village). This hotel is more of a place for a family or couple on a budget, or someone traveling alone who wants some down time in a safe location. The rooms are small but adequate. The AC works well. The shower works well. There is a fridge and a drip coffee maker (just one small pack of coffee, sugar and powered whitener daily but there is a Starbucks and another coffee shop right outside the hotel). The bed is comfortable but lacks the poofy duvets that you would find in a higher-end hotel. More than half the rooms have beautiful ocean views. Those on the park/zoo side have great views (my pic was taken from the 8th floor, farthest room from the beach and closest to the elevator—I paid for a “standard” room). Rooms on the other side of the building are near the Aston Waikiki and some look like they catch a much narrower angle of the ocean. (The Aston was another property I considered so I checked it out. Will make comparisons below). The pool at the Park Shore is usually quiet and the pool area is well maintained. There is no restaurant to draw a crowd (Lulu’s is on the street level) and the hotel does not monitor bringing in food or drinks. Consequently, people bring their own food/drinks and no one seems to take advantage of that by leaving a mess or getting drunk. There are vending machines, sun screen dispensers, and a microwave to use in a small room accessible from the pool deck. An ABC store is downstairs accessible through the hotel lobby with lots of cold drinks, salads, snacks. From the pool you can see the ocean. This is rare in Waikiki. Also, though the pool looks relatively small, it is not particularly small by Waikiki standards. Those who prefer the beach can borrow small folding chairs to carry across the street. The beach is beautiful and the surf is safe. The chairs are not very comfortable, however, and I don’t think anyone over 200 pounds could fit in them. (I strongly encourage the hotel to purchase better beach chairs. The ones from the Queen Hotel two properties behind the Park Shore look better, but I’m glad I’d didn’t stay at the Queen because the location isn’t nearly as nice as you have to go by some sketchy side streets to get there). Now to compare the Park Shore with the Aston next door. Both hotels are very open air, so no AC in the lobby or halls (not unusual in Hawaii). The Aston has a restaurant and also a take-out counter by the pool, but the Aston’s pool is much busier and there is very little view of the ocean pool-side. The public can walk right in to the Aston (as I did) to access the restaurant (Tikis) and enjoy the view. The amount of people around the Aston pool and the ease of buying food/drinks probably appeals to some more than the quiet of the Park Shore, assuming they can find a lounge chair at the Aston. No need to save chairs at the Park Shore. The Aston looks like it offers slightly more rooms with views, but with buildings on both sides their pool is shaded longer and at least some rooms’ views toward Diamond Head are obstructed by the Park Shore. Note the sidewalk outside the Aston and Park Shore is under construction, but there is minimal noise from that. Most of the noise in the area is traffic and easily ignored at night with the patio door shut and the AC going. I will definitely return to the Park Shore. It is relaxing and convenient and an excellent price for the location.

- Awesome location over looking Diamond Head and Queen’s Beach and Waikiki- Brilliant; accommodating; extremely helpful professional staff (any issues talk to James and Po as these two were fantastic)- Rooms are large; clean; well equipped and the balcony is a brilliant place to chill over breakfast or watch the sunset- Access to fresh beach towels; pool floats; GoPro cameras all included in the cost- Close enough to the action but far enough from the noise to be perfectly peacefulYou would never regret booking a stay in this hotel!

Lower cost hotel with good size rooms with balcony looking inland or over main street. Accommodation reasonable but recommend going out for all meals. Clean rooms well serviced. Friendly staff with conscierge service available

This place is great! If you get it for $170 or less, you will find great value - perfect location across from the best stretch of Waikiki Beach, across from park and zoo, nice pool w killer view. Rooms are modest, but who cares? You’re paying for what counts w this place.
user_name:
Doug W
South San Francisco, California

review_body: This hotel is in a great location, across from the beach and near a small park but still quite central. We booked a poolside room, but I wouldn't book one of these again. We had patio doors that opened out onto the pool area, but we didn't like this area. It was concrete slab floors and very basic. Needs upgrading or something. Nothing nice about it at all. No bar area or anything. The pool was small and seemed ok but we didn't end up using it. Book one of the higher up rooms, they all had a nice balcony. But the room itself was nice and clean and a good size. The hotel staff were great and we had a hire car which they parked for us every day. We ordered our car in the morning and it was brought to us in about 5 min's. Very efficient. All in all, a good hotel for the money but the major plus is the location.
user_name:
Joanne S
Greater Manchester, United Kingdom

review_body: We travel frequently to Oahu to see family. Since we are so numerous, we need to arrange accommodations while we're here. This hotel is in the perfect location. The staff is amazing, it's right on the easternmost end of Waikiki across from the zoo. Highly recommend to others traveling to Oahu. You won't be disappointed.

We booked six months in advance through Zen Hotels and Expedia. Park Shore wouldn’t honour confirmed prices from Zen that we were provided. Park Shore said they had raises in prices since we booked. We’d booked six months out.

Good value. Excellent views from the diamond Head suites and ocean view guest rooms. Small in size, but clean and very convenient to beach and restaurants. Can not say enough about the friendliness of staff. Thanks for a great first visit to Hawaii!

The rooms were quite. Staff was attentive and friendly. The Beds were comfortable and provided a perfect nights sleep all week. The location was absolutely perfect! Walk to the beach in under 5 minutes. The balconies provided a nice Waterview

We had an ocean front room on the 9th floor and it was amazing! Breathtaking unobstructed views of the ocean and down the beach toward Diamondhead. The noise from the traffic, especially the busses on the corner below was very loud while sitting on the balcony. Thankfully it was not noticeable with the sliding doors closed. Thankfully it did not disturb me enough to not want to use the balcony to enjoy the spectacular views. Being across the street from the beach was also very nice! I would classify our room as average, but the room was clean and we spent very little time in it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel stored our bags for us when we got there until our room was ready and stored them again after check out and before we took the shuttle to our cruise ship. Definitely stay here for the amazing view and location, but if you are looking for a luxury room, you may be disappointed. We would stay here again.

Had a good time here. Location was execelent and staff extraordinary. Room not large but adaquate. My view was the best, ocean, Diamondhead and park all right there with no obstructions. Read complaints the place was aged, but aging gracefully. Looks like upgrade in progress.

We traveled with 2 other couples and arrived at around 9am.. The staff allowed us to check 1 couple in 1st as they had a room available which was great as it gave the other two couples a place to put luggage and chill for a bit. The other two rooms became available around 1pm which was way ahead of the 3pm check in time. Rooms were clean and serviced daily with the usual amenities (safe is in the room on top of fridge) Ice machines on several floors which was handy for cold drinks to take to pool area on 3rd floor (just dont take glass drink containers to pool)2nd floor has direct access to Lu Lus restaurant and there's an ABC store and Japanese restaurant in the lobby.Resort fee was $25 (when we booked it) and now $39 - Towels/beach chairs/inflatable pool toys/international calls to landlines/mobiles. All in all we were all impressed by the level of service and would recommend Park shore for anyone wishing to stay there.

The photos show a beautiful lobby - and it was lovely, the staff were friendly, the location was great but the rooms were terrible. Really terrible. They are very dated but the worst thing is they were smelly and musty. I have no idea how this hotel ever got 4 stars. You can definately do way better.

This hotel is very close to the beach and across from the zoo. The staff was pleasant. Our room had a balcony with a view of the beach. The room was clean and adequate in size. The bed was comfortable.Lulu's Waikiki is the restaurant associated with the hotel. It's a nice place during the day but not a good place for a quiet dinner. It's mostly a raucous bar at night.There was an unexpected mandatory "amenities" charge of ~$30 a day which appears to be an almost standard way for hotels to charge more per day than the rate shown on Hotels.com.

We wanted to stay on the strip and the Park Shore is perfect at the end of the strip with beautiful views of the Zoo & Diamond Head . Across the road from the beach with easy access to everything . If you want to go anywhere the bus service is excellent. The hotel while not 5 stars is perfect place to relax with great food and wonderful staff .Thankyou John for posting back my parcel I left there at no charge .

Great location right across from Waikiki Beach. Big lobby with high ceilings and very inviting. Valets were courteous and helpful. Front Desk able to help us get situated with room change and was polite. GM always available to answer calls

Everything at this hotel is exceptional---superb location, professional and courteous staff, cleanliness standards by housekeeping, condition of the hotel, and breathtaking views of the ocean from the rooms.

Thought the location was great and the staff were so helpful and friendly. Both the aircon and the shower seemed to have 2 temperature settings (hot or freezing). The Chromecast was handy. The daily room fee was more than we were originally quoted and it didn't seem like great value but the beach was over the road, the zoo and aquarium were nearby and the bed was comfy and the staff were great.

8th time to Hawaii 4th time at this hotel and we keep coming back because of value, service ,location.the staff is very helpful, you are right across from the ocean, and you are walking distance to restaurants and convenience stores .

Great service, staff very helpful and knowledable. Very happy in our room. Requested the sea view and very happy with the resultGreat location, centrally situated with great views, will stay again on our return.

$39 a day plus tax what a rip off when you don't get much on offer We stayed for 5 nights and although the Park Shore is a great location we were hit with this what they call Resort Fee which includes a pod of coffee in each room, beach chairs and towels which we didn't use all we used was the internet.

Wow! What a quick decline from the last time I stayed here - and I've stayed here ever time I've come to Waikiki!The hotel is under new management - per the front desk -and no longer an Aqua Aston property - it is Highgate Hotel property. All the online hotel photos are outdated as amenities have been omitted. Even the pictures of the bedding are misleading. I guess the old management could not turn a profit on the place so the new management slashed away taking the hotel caliber significantly down.Yes the rooms are small and worn. Yes the hotel has zero amenities aside from pool towels.But my biggest complaint is that the rooms are serviced poorly - no regular vacuum, no wipe down of counters- just new towels and the bed made. I have never experienced such poor room service - especially AFTER I talked to the front desk about it.Yes the location is great but it can't be the only thing carrying the place anymore. Staying here will sour your overall Hawaii experience and make you wish you stayed elsewhere. My fondness of the Park Shore is no more.

We were very pleased with the location mostly based on easy access to the beach. Hotel is opposite a safe swimming beach which was very easy for kids to swim in with no surf. If you want surf you can go over the wall, so suits everyone. There is pool at the hotel which is ok to cool off in & sun loungers. Our daughter (9) enjoyed it. The room was very small for 3 of us (2 adults & 1 child). It was uncomfortable to spend time in it other than to sleep. No chairs in room or on balcony. Maid service was slow & they didn’t get to our room until about 3 or 4 pm. Staff very friendly. Reception staff friendly & efficient. Able to answer questions but not forth coming. Facilities not explained to us & found out about beach chairs in last few days. Easy walking distance to restaurants & we particularly enjoyed the Barefoot cafe (10min walk along beachfront) & the small cafe just outside hotel foyer. Not sure what the resort fees cover as this is a no frills hotel, so was surprised at the cost vs benefits. I would stay here again for the location but would try to stay in a bigger room than the standard.

The location of this hotel is perfect for beach goers. The rooms were ok nothing fancy. This is a budget friendly hotel. The location next to the zoo and shops is a definite plus. Everybody was friendly.

The staff was friendly, the rooms and hotel were clean and the location was fantastic. This was our second time staying here, the first was just as great. The restaurant connected was convenient and the food was great. I like that they allow guests to store their luggage if they arrive prior to check in time.

The hotel met my expectations based on other reviews and my research. View and location to the beach was great. The hotel staff was very pleasant. We had a variety of places to eat and ABC Store was right off the lobby. We ended up with a room on the pool level so I think we had a bigger room than some. They had beach chairs available to use.Just some minor things - I wish they had more dresser drawers to put our clothes for our 10 day stay. We only had 2 drawers for 4 people. We had a minor issue with ants in our room but once reported, the staff took care of it. And I swear all vehicles that backed up had loud backup alerts and the garbage pickup came early morning.I know some other reviews talk about the disappoint of the pool closing by sunset ~7:30p but I was fine with that. We had been outside all day in the wonderful weather and by that time at night, we just wanted to relax in our room. The pool was never overly busy which we loved.

This small hotel is located down near the Honolulu Zoo so away from the majority of tourists. The only issue I have is the cost of the resort fee and what this is suppose to cover. It was not obvious nor did anyone advise us what that was. If you want a smaller hotel with less crowds then this is one to look at. It is about a 15 minute walk to all the main eateries and the trolley's are all handy and close.

We had a great time -- walked up and down the 'Strip', got sweet ocean and Diamond Head views from the room. Could walk across the street in the morning to the beach. Hotel staff is very friendly, relaxed, with aloha. Would definitely come back. Thank you!

I want to preface my review positively by saying we loved our stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. The location at the quieter end of the Waikiki strip cannot be beaten. The view from our room was breathtaking. Granted the rooms are small and a little dated, but that's ok. The beds were comfortable and housekeeping kept our room spotless. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and professional. The family friendly pool deck with gorgeous ocean views was a relaxing way for everyone in our party to wind down.Through reading TripAdvisor reviews I learnt the expected Amenity Fee had increased from $25 to $39 a night. A big jump, especially for travellers on a budget.Unfortunately many of the amenities we expected had gone. The Managers Reception by the pool, complementary daily newspapers, water and coffee in the foyer. Even the promotional in room video was advertising amenities no longer offered. The hotel information booklet in the room listed a welcome beach tote bag for guests. When I enquired with the front desk about not receiving this I was told they had run out. Promotional material still show Hawaiian Tropic toiletries in the bathroom, even these have gone for some generic hotel brand.I accept a change in management means making changes but it's very poor management to still be advertising amenities no longer available.As for the $39 fee? Apart from the beach towels and beach chairs I'm still struggling to work out what we actually payed for.

I quickly learned what the difference between a $200/night Honolulu hotel room and $400/night Honolulu hotel room is. The $200 ones are buildings that are 40+ years old, have a musty wep carpet smell inside, are terribly out of date, and are simply old (with an insect or two here and there). If Park Shore charged $99/night I might put up with it. Since it doesnt, pay more and stay at a higher end place, if you like super clean and modern. I checked out 20 minutes after I checked in, went to the Hyatt Centruc, and felt safe and clean in my room each night. If hotel age and cleanliness are a concern, pay more to stay elsewhere.

The Hotel was excellent value for money, the only problem we had was not being able to access our room till 3:30 pm. We had arrived in Honolulu at 5:30 am and after a 10 hour flight from Sydney Australia we were in need of a "Lie Down" .

Along with many hotels in the States the resort fee is becoming the normal. Why don't you just include it in the nightly rate as you doing have the option of declining it?Also don't use the car park option they offer. Park in the one opposite when even at $1.50 an hour is cheaper

Roaches, faulty alarms, misleading info, oh my!Do not stay here. This is a poorly renovated hotel that suffers from cut corners and style over substance. Let’s start with the absolute worst: faulty fire alarms. I’m writing this after being awoken 4 times by the very intrusive alarm sounds. After requesting further information, it was blamed on the rainy weather and “open lobby”. That is a serious design flaw in a tropical region. The humid rainy weather set off your alarm? The horrible design choice of an open lobby, affects your alarm system? What on earth?? Additionally, this is a known issue. I found reviews going back at least one year with this same faulty alarm. How has this not been addressed yet???If there is one thing a hotel should provide, it should be secure sleeping arrangements! I am paying to sleep here and I will be compensated for my lost services. The open design issue contributes to the roach problem (which was dismissed as normal for an island). It is a huge security risk as well! Anyone can walk in and interact with our rooms. Unacceptable. I am livid. This will be reported to all regulatory bodies in the area.
