I will be seeking to have this place forced into action for renovations to fix the issue.

Centrally located, comfortable bed, close to the beach and clean room. There’s a casual restaurant / bar on the 2nd floor. Don’t expect to check in early unless you are willing to pay additional fees.

We started our Hawaiian vacation with a few days on Oahu so we could show our kids the sites. This hotel was a good value and a good location for that value. Right across the street from the beach and easy walking distance to a better beach and great shopping, we walked a lot and enjoyed the beach chairs, sand mats and towels provided by the hotel. The disappointing part was that on check-in, the hotel would not honor the stated parking fee (half what they charged us) on our reservation. They did honor the amenities fee stated but that difference wasn’t much. In addition, we had to ask for the complimentary beach bags listed on the amenities list (we saw this the next day) and the managers reception on the hotel video loop on the TV no longer exists, nor is the hotel guest discount at the neighboring restaurant (also on the video) honored any longer. They need to update some things. The rooms are ok...small. Not good for much more than two people (we got two rooms for five of us). But we didn’t spend much time there and the location made up for it. If we return to Oahu, we will probably spring for something nicer.

No washer/dryer, no microwave in room, no room service. The lobby drifted between sweet fruity smell and trash/sewage. Outside the hotel was no parking for food delivery which unacceptable given the lack of room service at the hotel as well.

We stayed for 2 nights at the Park Shore in April following a cruise. Waikiki is expensive with many hotels in the moderate price bracket, receiving very mixed reviews. We therefore took a long time trying to find a hotel with good reviews within our budget. I usually book through one of the well known booking companies as they are usually cheaper, however, when I looked on the Park Shore website they were doing an advanced purchase deal. This was reasonably good value in an expensive location. The hotel is not perfect but, it is at the lower, quieter end of Waikiki beach, near the zoo, so you have green open spaces, the beach across the road (amazing at sunset!) a fantastic view of Diamond Head, sometimes with rainbow, a basic but clean room, very friendly, helpful, reception and an ABC store leading from the lobby area, which is great for provisions. Most hotels in Waikiki (especially near the seafront) seem to charge the dreaded amenity fee, which seems to have been increased following a change of ownership/management at Park Shore. This is a shame as it seems to have effected the previously good reviews, as guests were not made aware of this until they came to check-in. I hope that when this is all straightened out the Park Shore will once again be regarded as a good/reasonably good value hotel (in Waikiki). We would definitely stay again.

it was a great location! close to all the restaurants, bars and beach! the hotel itself was good, I did not like the visually shared balconies - no privacy - to close to each other.hotel is a lil outdated.

Stayed in an oceanfront room on the 8th floor. Staff were friendly, pool was clean. At the very end of the Waikiki strip so I was kind of nice not being quite as congested. Not a top of the line hotel but a very good deal for someone who is budget conscious I would definitely stay here again. Hotel offers beach towel service as well as beach chairs. Definitely get the oceanfront room!

The staff was casual, helpful and comfortable.The Diamond Head Suite had a great view. I felt happy just looking out of the room. Also, the Japanese restaurant in the hotel was delicious. Good ingredients are used and the taste is good. The restaurant called T & B at the entrance of the hotel used bread, salad and so on every day.Also, I would like to stay at a hotel.

Good location. Close to beach and parks. While cheaper than some other hotels with similar locations. there are even fewer amenities for the $39/daily resort fee than before. The staff are very helpful and friendly.

Even though we settled on this hotel for it's lower rate (as we were staying a while) and close location to beach - you could say "you get what you pay for" but not in this case. The so called amenities fee is such a rort! For a start the $25 a day fee has been bumped up to $39 under new management, but we're still not really sure what we paid for. For example, when I asked about the free service to Ala Moana - staff at reception did not know what I was talking about. Items promised in travel brochure also non-existent. No access to bathroom facilities in lobby (even guests have to ask for key each time) and no access to pool restroom. A bit wiffy in lobby too. Reception staff (apart from a couple of lovely ladies) were quite aloof or you felt like a pain for asking questions. However, the view on top floor is what made us persevere - amazing long views of Waikiki beach in one direction and Honolulu zoo (we could see flamingos and elephants from our room).

I normally don't give anything a 1 star. this is not because of the location or their staff. These people straight up lied to me to my face. The girl at the front desk told us that we are charging you a refundable deposit for amenities. This place has no amenities, no gym, no spa, no bar NOTHING. Pool i saw one person use it in 8 days. When we were leaving they charged $400 USD for something I didn't receive. When I told this is what the girl said when we arrived. Verbatim I was told "oh maybe she didn't know". ALSO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS IS absolute bs email address, you can't send anything to do. its waste of time to email that. parkshorerooomscontrol@parkshorewaikiki.com

I saw several negative reviews of this property, but we took a chance on it anyway. This was mainly for the location and price for an ocean front view. We were so happy with this hotel. The room itself was a little underwhelming, but who spends their time in the hotel room when you are in Hawaii? As long as it's clean and comfortable, i'm happy. Which it was. The view itself made this hotel stay incredible. We were on the 10th floor corner, and could see Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach out the sliding glass doors and balcony, and Waikiki Beach/Ocean out the other window. It was breath taking. The location of this hotel is perfect, you have everything you need around you. There is an ABC store connected to the hotel, making getting additional needed items a piece of cake. Valet parking is $45 a day, which is pricey. Especially since they also charge a $25 resort fee. They told us you can park in the zoo parking lot, but that's metered, so I don't think that would even really be an option? The valet guys always did a great job. We didn't eat at the restaurant or visit the pool, so I have no review for that. They do however provide you with beach towel cards, which is nice.

We have stayed here with several family members off and on thru out the years and probably can say we stayed her at least 30 nights off and on. Most recently, we had the ocean front room which is great with one of the closest rooms to the beach and it is a corner room including the view of diamond head (room numbers ending with 07 on any floor is the corner room are the best to us.) Michelle is exceptionally cheerful and greeted us with a great big smile. She did a great job checking us in.. She also remembered us. There are a few suggestions I would like to offer since it would make some of the guests that gave negative reviews to return perhaps. The little things are important and we noticed the new owners have cut back on a few areas.* No complimentary local newspaper - it used to be located on each floor where they have the counter space by the elevator*Hawaiian Tropic Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash is much preferred than the ones provided. After all this hotel is in Hawaii. The ones they now have is not up to par.*The introduction video on TV in the rooms to the Park Shore amenities is outdated as they promise free complimentary coffee in the lobby and used to give juice, also mention on the video is the wednesday social which I am not sure they still have since I am checking out on a wednesday. *Yoshitsune Restaurant is the best Japanese restaurant in Waikiki and it should be promoted more in the rooms to the hotel guests.However, we still gave the hotel a excellent rating since the location is excellent. It is our favorite hotel in Waikiki due to the fact the beach is right across the hotel with the best views. Also, Michelle greeted us and welcome us with such enthusiasm and helped us out. The valet staff provides excellent service.

I stayed at the Park Shore for three nights over the Memorial Day weekend. I requested and was given a quiet room on a high floor. The advantages of this place include: it’s one of the cheapest hotels in Waikiki across the street from the beach; swimming pool has a partial view of the beach; room was quiet, clean, smelled good, and was in excellent condition; bed was clean and comfortable; pleasant open-air lobby with high ceiling; and reasonably fast elevators (when not interrupted by intermediate stops). There is an ABC Store open 24/7 in front, with a back door linking directly to the hotel lobby. Now for the disadvantages, which is what we all read TripAdvisor for. The single biggest one is the raise in the resort fee to $39 after my booking with no concomitant increase in amenities to compensate. I would have given this place a rating of five but for that one issue. The resort fee was already way too high at $25 because this place does not have free newspapers, a gym, complimentary continental breakfast, free parking, or all the other usual perks that hoteliers usually deploy to justify such fees. Fortunately, I already have a 24 Hour Fitness nationwide subscription and was able to stay fit during my vacation at one of their Honolulu gyms. However, I can see how people without that option would be really annoyed.The lobby is very nice, but upstairs, the hallways are dimly lit and kind of depressing. The room was really tiny. As a solo traveler, I was fine, but a family would find it to be horribly cramped.I asked for a quiet room and I was happy to get a very quiet room facing away from the street, but with not much of a view because I was facing north towards another hotel (the Aston). But I can see how people facing the beach or the park would not be happy because of the heavy bus traffic on Kalākaua and Kapahulu Avenues. When I was swimming in the third floor pool, I could hear the buses and traffic going by below. I finally understand now why the hotels half a mile north are so much more expensive—they’re next to all the best shopping and restaurants. If you stay farther away, then it’s a long walk, or you have to put up with riding TheBus. At least Google Maps is very reliable at predicting bus arrival times. It’s a long walk to board TheBus on Kuhio or Kapahulu Avenues, but when coming back, several routes literally stop in front of the Park Shore. Overall, I liked this place and would definitely consider staying here again when I return to Waikiki another decade from now. But keep that resort fee in mind when shopping around.

3 minutes to the beach, they Provide towels and you can change them daily. Beach Chairs. Pool. Good views, friendly staff, Restaurants and shops nearby. Bus stops nearby. All you need 5 minutes to the zoo

Had 8 nights here in May. Booked the suite some months ago, with resort fees @ $25, upon arrival found they had gone up to $39. The perks like shuttle, managers reception, coffee etc were not provided due to sale to Highgate. The room was a little shabby, but hotel in good location. Water in shower ran hot and cold, tiny fridge that barely cooled. That is all I can say about it. Would not return. Waiting for Visa Card bill to come, so I can block the resort fee or at least drop it to $25.Beware of the rip off !!

This hotel has been in place for many years but the rooms are clean with some updates. Staff are helpful and east side rooms provide awesome views of Diamond Head, the Zoo and the beach from the balconies. Good to have the fridge to keep fruit and other edibles. Linens and towels adequate and in good condition. A great location for catching several local tours, for accessing Waikiki Beach and next to quick essential pickup stores. Hotel had lawn chairs for quests to use on the beach and towels for pool and beach. Lots of eateries around too. Recommend Wolfgang Puck's express just a few doors away. Only complaint was that use of the pool and access to just using the loungers on the surrounding pool deck were all closed off at sundown (about 7PM). This was not long enough for those who have been out touring all day and hoping for a relaxing swim before supper. As the pool is not supervised at any time, this seemed to be a bit extreme. We understand closing it say after 9PM, when some guests might want to go to sleep, but 7 PM seemed to only accommodate maintenance staff schedule and not the wishes if the guests.

Nice location at the far end of Waikiki. Nice to be away from the busier end of Waikiki  Across the street from the Zoo and beach. Easy access to 2 ABC stores, Starbucks, and several little shops. Nice Wolf Gang Pucks express.

The room was on the small side, which may be normal in Waikiki, but was clean and modern. The only downside was that, compared to other resorts in Hawaii, there was little provided in return for the resort fee - eg very few activities, no parking and no bottled water in rooms.

Great location out of the busiest area of Waikiki. Staff were fantastic and room was cleaned well. Great views from our room and would stay in this area and hotel again if we returned. We stayed in a room with a partial ocean view.

great experinece. the hotel was nice in a great location and the price was amazing for the overall things. There were some issues with the room such as some rusty stuff in the bathroom and the not clean windows which someone might.not care

This was a great hotel for the price. We had a balcony room with an ocean view and stayed 4 nights. It is a 3 minute walk to the beach. There are numerous restaurants within a 5 minute walk. There is a Starbucks within a 1 minute walk of the hotel. And there is an ABC store right in the lobby where you can buy everything from food, drinks, shampoo, sunblock and souvenirs. If you are going to the beach, they have beach chairs, beach mats and beach floats that you can borrow free of charge. The pool area was nice. There are not a lot of chairs at the pool and of course there were the rude people who put towels on the chairs to reserve them even though they weren’t actually at the pool. The room itself was bigger than we had expected. (I had read other reviews that said the rooms were tiny, so I was expecting really small, but it was a normal hotel room size.) We had issues with our refrigerator when we first arrived, but someone came up right away and got it working. We needed extra pillows and towels during our stay and someone came up to our room right away to give us what we needed. Our balcony was fabulous and we used it every minute we could to enjoy the view.There were a couple of down sides. First is the street noise. The hotel is at a busy intersection which includes a bus stop. You constantly heard traffic noise in your room even with the doors closed. Second, the balcony does not have a lot of privacy. You can almost shake hands with other neighbors that are out on their balconies. Third, is the resort fee. When we booked the room, the resort fee was $25 per night. Sometime after we booked the hotel it got new owners and they changed the resort fee to $39 per night. When we checked in they wanted to charge us $39 a night. After arguing with the clerk for awhile he got a manager who changed the fee back to $25. The night before we were to check we got a printout of our bill and it said $25. The morning of our checkout they changed the fee back to $39. Once again we had to fight about the fee and they insisted they were going to charge us the $39 even though we had a printout that showed $25. Eventually they changed it back to $25 but I think only because we were making a big scene in a very crowded lobby.Overall we were impressed with the quality of the hotel even though it was reserved at a lower price point.

One of the best experiences we have had on our travels. Michelle at the front desk was terrific. Answered every question we had and gave us additional information that we hadn't thought of. Location is perfect. Walk across the road and you are at a beautiful beach. Cleaning staff does a fantastic job of looking after the place. All in all, the staff made it a super stay. Everyone of them were awesome.

We came here to Hawaii 10 years ago for our honeymoon. Been wanting to come back to Hawaii but we decided to explore the world and decided to only come back to Hawaii for our 10th anniversary. And we did. Booked a good deal online for an Oceanfront room for 4 nights. We explored the other islands before Oahu. We arrived at about 11am and I was glad we could check in. On the form I noticed I was assigned room 1507 but got 707 instead. I assumed that it's because I was checking in early thus another room was assigned. As long as the room was Oceanfront, am good. Check in was average. Was done by a rather new staff. No information given about hotel facilities, what the resort fees cover. I had to look for the info in the room and not sure what the exclusive bag is but I didn't get it.The Ocean front room we got was spacious and the balcony faced Diamond Head, Waikiki and the ocean. Views were amazing! Higher floor would be even nicer. When I went into the bathroom, I realised it was a bathroom with handicap facilities. I have stayed in such rooms before usually just for a night for work. Didn't really mind.However, I realised the bathroom doesn't work when there were two of us. Water from the shower was flowing everywhere and made the toilet wet. The toilet has a sink with no space except for toothbrushes. After the first shower when we checked in, I wanted to change room especially since we were staying for 4 nights but the hotel was full. Enquired with staff again the next day but we were told it was a full house all the way.We had to shower and at the same time prevent water from seeping out but was unsuccessful. The bathroom mat was wet and squishy all the time and it's inconvenient to get it changed everytime. Toilet was wet all the time. At one point, I nearly slipped while carrying the pot of coffee to throw into the sink. The shower curtain should be placed further inwards to prevent water from water flowing down from the curtains onto the floor. My booking was not for a handicap facility room which I am very sure of. Some hotels do sell these rooms and indicate while booking. However, it would be good for staff to inform guests about the room.Staff and service wise, felt it was average. Coming from Asia where service is more formal, always felt the Americans were very friendly and chatty with their service, didn't feel so at the Park Shore. Walking from the lift to the exit or vice versa, you won't meet any staff up close at all because the reception and bell desk are right at the corner, and you will tend to cut across the lobby.However, we still did enjoy our stay at the Park Shore despite the wet toilet. We loved that our room was very private, has a large balcony that faces Diamond Head and the ocean and another window that faces the ocean. We saw the sunset every evening and even a rainbow after it rained! The location is very good with a restaurant, Starbucks, 2 ABC stores and cheap parking just 11 o'clock of the exit, across the street at $1 a minute. (Sorry but the $45 valet is too expensive) and oh the pool floats were cute and the beach chairs were so comfortable.We would still come back to the Park Shore if we manage to get good rates, book an Ocean front room with a normal toilet. We hope to come back soon, just that we need 18 to 20 hours just to fly to Hawaii!

Asked for coffee brought to my room, simple request. Snails move faster than Sarah at the Front Desk, she is clueless. Nice property location, however. It is right across the street from Waikiki Beach & Honolulu Zoo.

Stayed three nights, and it was wonderful! Staff were nice and courteous, rooms were pleasantly appointed, and we had a very nice view of Waikiki Beach, the ocean, and Diamond Head! The location is near the end of the beach, so there was a bit less traffic and tourists in the area (still tourists, just not as crowded as the main parts of Honolulu). We were several floors up from the pool, and it was nice to just get out on the lanai every once in awhile to enjoy the scenery and weather. We had the breakfast package and would totally recommend it, especially if you're looking for a Japanese-style breakfast (Yoshitsune Restaurant in the lobby is great!). Would absolutely stay again!

Disappointed in our visit to this hotel. Stayed three nights prior to our cruise departure and did not feel this hotel was a good value or had good service. Concerns we had on our stay were: Parking $45 per day - ouch. Did finally park across the street at the zoo parking for $1.00 hour. Good location near the beach but at the East end of Waikiki. Hotel changed their locks but did not notify us prior to attempting to get into our rooms on the 2nd night. No ice vending on the floor we were on. Rooms are clean but very basic. Only partial view of ocean from room, great view of rooms across the alley looking back at you. At the price we paid for our room I would have expected more. Not a good value.

Poolside Lanai Room was quite large and the location was Excellent.Bed was reasonably comfortable but the noise from the garbage pick up at 5.00 am woke us every morning.The cleaning of the room was a bit sloppy some days.

Right across from the beach at the far end of Waikiki away from all the traffic and tourist congestion. There are spectacular views to Diamond head and the beach. This place does not offer all the expensive add ons you get in other places, which is just perfect if you are the sort of person that likes to make your own fun. There is a hefty resort fee which covers towels and beach chairs so make sure you add this into your calculations. Car parking is also outrageously expensive but you can park for free on the nearby streets if you do a bit of investigation. They charge for early check ins and and late check outs so plan for this also. The staff are really friendly and there is no attitude.

Park Shore is your hotel if you want to be in a great location and intend to not really be in the room. It's a totally basic, mainland kind of hotel (compare to a mainland Hampton Inn). Clean, $45/day to park the car (mandatory valet, come and go all day). The pool is elevated, so you can sit overlooking the beach, and the beach is literally across the street. They are right at the end of the wall, so you can choose to swim in the coral-free, calm area of ocean or sit on the other side of the wall with coral, waves and surfing. It's right at the bottom of the main strip, so you can walk to all the shops and restaurants. There's a bus stop a couple blocks behind it and one block behind is a tour stop (where all the tour bus companies pick people up). It's also right next to the zoo, with a clear view of Diamondhead from either the pool deck or your room (depending on what view you bought). They also let you borrow towels, beach mats and beach chairs. Only real complaint is that the bathroom did not have a fan, so it got pretty steamy in there during showers.

The Park shore is in a great spot, beach directly across the street and the staff are friendly. The room was clean and the wifi was great. Thats the end of the positive feedback as the rest was not so good. We were told there was a $25 per day amenity fee and that this included beach towels, sunscreen, orange juice, daily paper, coffee, shuttle to Ala Moana etc. When we arrived we discovered that this fee had gone up to $39 per day and when I questioned it (because I had $25 in writing) I was told a new owner had taken over and they couldn't do anything about it. What was worse was that there was no free shuttle, no orange juice, no coffee, no daily paper - all you get for this fee is a beach towel and some sunscreen!!!!! On top of this dissappointment, we had 4 people in our room and were only given 3 towels for the shower and not enough toilet paper.

Very average hotel but good location. Ocean view rooms are nice city hotel rooms are dark and small. I had 2 rooms one of each for our family of 6. Wifi did not work in hotel room. Maid service late every day always around 3pm..but the worst thing was the resort fee... there are no amenities at this hotel, no gym or laundry.. pool very basic!! But I had confirmation from when I booked in February that there was a fee of $25 per night per room.. on check out I did question this fee as I did not have coffee in room wifi did not work fridge froze everything.. the list went on and I had notified the hotel during my stay.. then to be told the fee had increased to $39 per night per room and that even though I had confirmation from my booking they could increase it at any time. This is such a lot to charge for no resort amenities... and to give you some idea the 5 star hotels in Waikiki charge $38 resort fee. They did in the end negotiate this fee with me but I will never stay at this hotel again... my advice shop around there are a lot of better places
user_name:
Tania R
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Just like the reviewer “globetrotter714” stated in his review everything he is saying is true! We are currently here on a 10 night stay and are experiencing the same situation! No shuttle bus..no hospitality suite..no Wednesday night managers cocktail party! No water or coffee in the lobby etc...Funny though all these inclusions are still advertised in their in room tv hotel channel! High gate are the new owners of this hotel and couple others nearby. The area is central and lots of restaurants close by and the beach across the street from the hotel is amazing! My advice is to save your money on all the extra fees and stay in a condo or a hotel where the fees are less!

If you we're to take a quick scroll through the reviews of the Park Shore, two things would ring consistently throughout. Friendly staff & amazing location. I gotta say I've stayed at many hotels in my life and the Park Shore's staff are definitely one of the nicest I've encountered. Roxy and Michelle were a delight, and a gentleman with a Hawaiian name too. I can't remember his name. However, the staff can only do so much to contribute to the overall experience of a vacation. Upon arrival I was unwillingly charged an insane amount for my amenity fee and vallet parking. When I booked, my confirmation stated a $25 amenity fee and $28 vallet parking. When I checked in however the agent explained to me that the hotel had recently gone under new management and they would not be honoring my set agreement. Now I know the staff is just doing their job, but I thought that was a real shady way of running a business. When I agreed to the rate at the time of booking I expect to be paying that same amount when I arrive. Not honoring that gave me the impression that all the hotel cares about is making money. Not a very good first impression for a lot of guest I would imagine. The amenities were lackluster at best and in my opinion did not validate a $39 extra fee a night. The hotel is in a great location for sure, but if you carbon dated the place I'm pretty sure it would put this hotel at 60+ years of age. And it shows. You would think with all money they we're squeezing out of guests they would use some of that to spruce the place up. It's in need of major revitalization. Housekeepers were surprisingly friendly, when they were around. I was constantly having to call down to get my room cleaned. Every time I did I was asked if I had left my "do not disturb" sign on to which I responded no. According to the front desk agent I'm supposed to get DAILY room cleaning service which clearly did not happen for my room. Maybe my Harry Potter cloaking spell finally kicked in and the maid skipped it who knows. Check out was interesting, left around 7am only to be greeted by a Beyonce concert worthy line. I felt bad for the guy working the front by himself. Never have I been to a hotel where they scheduled one staff member during peak operation hours. Maybe someone called in sick, but the front desk seemed to be understaffed every day. I grew a beard standing in line one time just waiting to ask about good restaurants in the area. Went back to my room to shave, and when I came back down I think someone in the line passed out from dehydration. Kidding, but you get the point. All in all if you're looking for a hotel with amazing and helpful staff, great location, and an breathtaking view, look no further. If you're more accustomed to the lavish and modern decor of the Ritz, this ain't it.

Stayed one night. Room was rather small and hotel is not in best location. Hotel charges a 39 dollar resort fee along with a 45 dollar parking fee. When you add the cost of room with fees your better off staying up the road in a more upscale location.

Excellent location near food and shops. Easy walking distance to international mall.. so many places were nearby. Staff was very friendly. Room was clean and stocked. Even was quiet for me.. I will for sure stay their again. I had a partial view oh the ocean. It was beautiful. Just walk down to the beach. And there it was..

We have stayed here many times, but never again. They have new owners. They have cut staff. There was no bell hop, when we arrived. Manager told us they don’t have staff at night. Only the one front end person. This made me nervous as there are lots of homeless outside the hotel. They sit smoking on the wall outside. The day we left the cops were there dealing with one. Friends who came on same flight and stayed in other hotels had a bell hop meet them at the shuttle and there were 2 front end staff on. Maid doesn't show up till 3/4pm,when you are returning to your room. I had to find her at 4pm one day, so I could get dry towels. Coffee and juice have been removed from the front desk.Coffee was never replaced in room. Manager said we can come and get more at any time. HELLO!!!! Isn’t this what that $37 resort fee is for??????. You shouldn’t have to go and get it. The resort fee included a beach bag and water bottle. We weren’t offered either. Can’t sit at pool for the dust and noise of the construction right outside the hotel. Even if you could sit out, this is a small area and you have to sit right next to other people. The loungers are taken by the people in the pool view rooms. (They leave them outside their room, with a towel on). You can’t get a place to sit, if you go in the afternoon. No shuttle bus, but their website still advertises it. I Was told to walk a few blocks and we can get it for free. We walked down and were Informed by other guests that it doesn’t show up. They stood for up to an hour and got the city bus, several times. Myself, many friends and family members have stayed here in the past and loved it. It’s a shame the new owners have increased the rates and taken away lots of other good things the hotel had. Every day we were there someone was complaining to the staff/manager about something. Everyone at the pool was complaining too. It’s very sad. It’s not the staffs fault. This use to be a great hotel. We have stayed many times. Now it’s so run down and short staffed. The photo is to show the construction. It is right below the pool. All you can hear is beeping from the machines backing up and banging from them drugging the old road/side walk to. I can’t see this ending soon.

Room 1408 had a wonderful view! Hotel is well maintained. Great location if you want to be central without all the noise. Easy access to diamond head and ala moana. Literally right across the street from the beach. Also Starbucks is right downstairs and opens at 4am.

My family & I stayed here for 8 days located right across Waikiki Beach and Honolulu Zoo. Very clean rooms & perfect for families. We found the location perfect. We were able to rent towels, beach chairs, umbrella & boogie boards! Starbucks and ABC stores located next door as well as a cute sandwich shop. Walking distance to everything you may need or want to do such as Diamond Head Hike or checking out all the shops/restaurants. Will stay here again.

Park Shore was in a great location, just across the road from Waikiki Beach. Good rooms, not really big but still adequate for a couple. Friendly and helpful staff. Beachtowels provided and they smelt clean. Bed pillows were amazing.

We spend 3 nights in the Park Shore hotel. And we absolutely loved the location of it. Just in front of Waikiki beach. The swimming is a nice area. Maybe they should make a sundeck at the upper level at the pool area. That would be awesome with the view on the beach!! The lobby is very welcoming and the room is very fine. I loved the bed and pillows. Only the airconditioning was a little old and noisy. Oh and for the longer persons under us, the shower can be a challa ge when you are taller then 1.75cm. But the pressure and tempature are great.We definitly recommand this hotel.

Worst 1 week holiday ever. Pro’s... location... that’s it. Cons....first room, garbage, right at the entrance of the 3 elevators. Asked to switch... 60 US per night extra.Amenities fee 39 US per day... most of the staff could not even tell us what amenities there were. Tried to use the go- pro they offer for free... but, have to have it back by 6 and we were touring the North Shore and weren’t returning by 6 just to hand that back. Then.... 45 US to park your car.... so an extra 144 plus tax per day... go stay somewhere . Rooms are brutally small, bathrooms even smaller. .... TO TOP THIS OFF, A MUGGING ON THE 10th FLOOR.... guy shows up at the elevator, duct tape around his neck and hands, bleeding from his head. Apparently a drug deal gone bad. Hotel has new owners and they have jacked the prices on everything..... so disappointed we chose this place....

Perfect hotel for beach, tourist spots, shopping & restaurants. Our room had a great view - 329.Shuttle available on request. Zoo on adjacent corner.Our room was clean & well presented. Staff very friendly.

This is a great hotel - super friendly staff, nice amenities, and the view from my room was outstanding. The room was also very comfortable, and I slept better than I normally do when I travel. Great location, great hotel.

Stayed at this hotel for four nights during a tour. Overall the hotel was ok but no more despite its fantastic location. The only major issue was the noise from the ventilation in our room (1818). It felt like you had a car with the engine running beside you in bed! I reported it and for one night it was ok after that the noise came back. I was not offered a change of room but did not ask which I now regret. Minor issues :-On arrival had to get maintenance to unlock safe.Had to phone reception for coffee for machine. Not left by housekeeping.Went for beach chairs at 8.00. Was told there were none.( this is part of amenity charge.)Paper on floor of room never moved during stay (was there when we arrived). View from room was into another hotel. I appreciate I didn’t pay for sea view but was told at checkout that hotel was nowhere near full. On the positive side the pool area was good.At checkout amenity charges were halved which they did not have to do. I was also told that hotel had recently changed hands and new owners were keen to improve and wanted customer feedback to help them.I hope my comments assist them.

Lovely location, we had an oceanview room on a corner so had views of Diamond Head as well. A little shabby in places, however it was clean and had a good bed.Staff friendly and helpful, original deal honoured including breakfast in Lulu’s.Charged original 25USD for amenity fee, would not have been if that had increased by 50%.

This was my second stopover stay at the Park Shore Waikiki, the first being over two years ago. I nearly didn't return as I didn't like the room at all last time, and so have stayed at three other Waikiki hotels on stopovers. I enjoyed the Park Shore Waikiki hotel more this time as we had a sea view room. The view from the 17th floor was fabulous (room 1709). You don't look straight out to the sea, but up towards Diamond Head and out. There are rooms with views looking directly out.It was also pleasant looking across the zoo and parkland. It's better than being in the middle of Waikiki looking at another building and hearing the road noise. The road noise wasn't as bad.The room was very small and the furnishings are a little outdated and worn.The bed was surprisingly very comfortable given the rest of room wasn't plush.I was not impressed with the room's cleanliness.I would possibly stay again if we have an ocean view room again.

We spent a week at the Park Shore Waikiki and absolutely LOVED the hotel. It is located at the far eastern end of Waikiki, away from the throngs of people who swarm the western end. Right across the street is beautiful Queen's Beach, a delight for surfers and snorkelers (I saw an Octopus, a Lion Fish, a Yellow Trumpet Fish, many varieties of Wrasse, and tons of Unicorn Fish), and Kapiolani Regional Park, a 300-acre expanse of grass and trees that also houses the Honolulu Zoo, where we saw many animals we'd never seen before (like the Fennec Fox and the Marabou Stork). The rooms at the hotel are clean and very comfortable, and the views are amazing (our Ocean View room afforded fabulous views of Diamond Head, the park, and the beach). The hotel pool is on the 3rd floor and shares the same views, so you can sit at the pool and see the ocean at the same time. It's kept sparkling clean and there are plenty of lounges and tables with chairs where you can relax. The entire staff was genuinely warm and friendly, and we especially appreciated Michelle, Brian and Paul, who were particularly helpful. Michelle is an absolute delight! We were so happy we chose the Park Shore, and can't wait until we can visit there again. Mahalo!

We booked the hotel before the new owners took over but everything on my package was honoured including a free room upgrade. Rooms were small but adequate were in 509 which has a great view. The pool closes at 6 pm thought it could have been a little later say 8pm. The new owners are placing a $39 room fee which I think will hurt not sure there are enough amenities to justify but as we all know it's a cash grab for all the hotels in Hawaii.

We stayed here for 9 days for our honeymoon. Upon arrival, they upgraded our room as we were honeymooners. It is super clean and the staff are very friendly. The cleaning staff is very efficient and always make us feel right at home. The pool is gorgeous and they offer free drinks by the pool-side one day a week (awesome). The balcony was very large. there is a safe in the room for valuables. the bed was so comfy. the view from our room was magnificent!. you are right across from the ocean peer where we walked every morning to watch/listen to the waves. The location is superb! you are near a Zoo, so you can occasionally hear animals and birds from your room, its wonderful (not annoying). you are directly across from Waikiki Beach (1 minute walk). and there are so many stores and restaurants nearby. We will DEFINITELY go back and stay at this very hotel. The day we left was the start of box jelly-fish season which I'm told lasts about a week or so. so check into that before booking anywhere, the beach was full with stinging jellies the day we left to fly home.

people who work here are helpful. You have access to the internet and a pool. Some nights there are snacks around the pool. The bus stop is right outside which is very convenient. The accessible room is very nice. It is right across the street from the beach and near the zoo.

We bookies this property through bookings.com and had received emails confirming booking up to the day of departure. Unfortunately when we arrived the hotel advised us they had no booking for us . They said they would check and after a 3 hour wait and continue request from me to reception we finally got our room . There’s was a change of staff which resulted in no communication between them of our situation. Every time I approached staff in that 3 hour wait all I got was a big smile and “ hello do you want to check in “ .Thus infuriated me beyond words . Finally got our room which was a bit of a disappointment small balcony facing the building opposite us , 2 double beds when I asked for 1 large and decor a bit dated. The only good thing was the proximity of the beach right across the road and the excellent service of Leimomi Baker the hotel concierge for you bookings,such a beautiful and friendly lady . Also as there website states free courtesy bus to Aloana shopping centre this is no longer available . So to sum this hotel is it’s a bit outdated carpets need changing , reception needs to pull there socks up and most importantly PLEASE confirm you booking with hotel before arrival

Big, big disappointment for the hotel located in Honolulu and Waikiki area. I was expecting a lot more from the hotel in so famous place.There is no bar or restaurant in the hotel, so they don't serve breakfasts!!! However they have so called "resort fee" for service you don't even use! Like newspapers, coffee or water in the lobby which is not even available all the time - I did ask once where can I get the water and I have been told to go to the supermarket and buy water!!! But they charged me for the it!!! How bad is that?!! Welcome oshibori - never happened! We didn't use beach towels or free shuttle to the shopping center or discount in one of the shops, but they charged us for this! I've never stayed in the hotel where I have been forced to use and pay for the service I didn't want or need!!! When you walk out of the lift the smell is just unbearable - the reception\lobby area smells musty even though this is open area without door!! The carpets and the furniture are outdated and absolutely disgustingly filthy!Rooms are claustrophobic and there is barely space to put your suitcase on the suitcase stand. Also the patio doors do not keep street and AC fans noise out. We got room 1818 and first night I had a problem to sleep as the noise form the bathroom vent was unbearable. I went at 3am to change the room and got one on 9th floor, I went to check it and we have moved the rooms in the morning. Room was exactly the same, but there was no annoying noise from the bathroom. However there was much louder noise from the outside. I didn't change the room again, as there was no point - all the rooms were the same, but fortunately I could sleep in the second one.The only good thing about this place is location - across from the Waikiki beach and the zoo, however it is the furthest hotel in the Waikiki beach area. There is also beautiful view from 18th floor at the mountain, the zoo and the sport pitch behind.I wouldn't stay in this hotel again in my life!

First,the one star rate is ONLY because the room.We booked a diamond head suite.They checked us in room 1415.Mr. manager:Please go to room 1415 and take a look on the balcony.Can you honestly tell youself this is a diamond head suite?We PAID for a diamond head suite and what we got is a view of other room's balconies.And this was a really good view of balconies.We even had a good chat with our neighbour 1421 from our balconies one night.This was a fun experience and in fact was the highlight of our stay.But this could give you a sens of how close we were.Once again Mr. manager we paid for a diamond head suite means you sell the view to us.If you can't honestly tell youself this is a diamond head suite why list it as one?It's the second high price room catalog of the hotel but 1415 is worse than many other rooms.Maybe rooms higher than 1415 could be better?

Took a birthday trip to O'ahu. First night I arrived tired and sick after a 5 hour flight from the mainland. At 2 am the fire tones woke us up and an announcement went off to 'return to our rooms'. A few seconds later MORE tones went off that instructed us to evacuate the building due to fire and to get outside.Startled and not feeling well I threw on a sweater and walked down FIFTEEN flights of stairs!! Once outside there was NO ONE directing us or telling us what was going on. After about half an hour in the drizzle seeing no fire trucks arrive or any signs of fire we approached the check in area and were told it was a glitch/false alarm and that they were still searching to see which alarm had gone off.Needless to say I was NOT happy.The next morning I felt even more congested and sick due to lack of sleep and walking outside at 2am!The supervisor on duty (Jonathan) told us he would 'comp' us about $100 for the inconvenience. I feel the whole 1st night should have been credited! There is also a $45 per night parking fee if you have a car and $25 per night resort fee in addition to your hotel rates.Location is good right across from Honolulu Zoo. Waikiki Beach is across the street.Beds are average covered in just cotton sheets and a light blanket.There is a coffeemaker and mini fridge in the room. Housekeeping is great and staff is friendly.I don't believe this is a 4.5/5 star hotel at all.

The room was great and when we booked in at 2am, they provided English Tea and Macadama Nut Biscuts, just what we needed for a good nights sleep. Room was comfortable and had a sea view. Next day very helpful in assisting us getting to the Cruise terminal. Very helpful reception Staff.

Premier location. Right across the street from Waikiki beach. Many restaurants and shops close by. Lovely room with great views. Staff very courteous and helpful. Shower did not have adequate hot water

During my stay I had to deal with my mothers death, which occurred during my stay in Hawaii. The staff who helped me were so understanding. They made my stay here peaceful and went out of there way to give me support & empathy. thankyou I am returning this august to have the holiday I didn't get in 2018.

Great location and value for the area. Very well maintained and helpful, friendly staff. Right across from Waikiki beach. Expedia rep on staff to assist with outings and recommendations. Great access to restaurants and easy to walk in the area. Shuttle stop right out front to take you to popular vacation sights.

Waikiki beach views from the lanai, and Diamond Head views out of the front door. Gorgeous! The staff was friendly, and the bed was comfortable. It is across from the Honolulu Zoo which was okay (not a lot of the animals were seen).

Facility and rooms are a bit older and could use some updates but overall it was very well maintained and also very clean. Location was great. Close to restaurants and Starbucks right next door - opens at 4am for those early birds. They have a free shuttle to & from the Ala Moana Shopping centre. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly book there again in future.

In our opinion this hotel is somewhat overrated. The location is good and bed was very comfortable. However, the location is extremely noisy day and night (trucks, buses, cars, motorcycles), rooms are not very clean, no bar service at pool, no room service. Overall it was several notches below the places we usually stay.

We love staying here. Our partial room had an amazing view of Diamond Head, Queen Kapiolani Park, and the ocean. I "lived" on our balcony. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Being just across the street from the beach, it was a perfect location for us.

We enjoyed our stay, the rooms were a bit small, but you are not in Waikiki to stay in a hotel room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The property is clean, and the location is amazing. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for 7 nights in an ocean front onnthe 10th floor. The view was amazing! Diamond head on the left and Waikiki beach/ocean in front. Clean, comfortable w microwave, refrig and coffee maker. Great friendly service, valet parking but cheap parking in zoo lot across side street. Beach towels and chairs complementary and 5 min walk to beach. Walking to a million restaurants and easy drive to the whole island. My fav morning ritual was getting a fast a latte and biscotti from Starbucks downstairs and sitting on our balcony watching the sun come up over Diamond head and the early morning surfers. Hubby took a 45 min beach walk. Cant describe the beauty. Sunsets were amazing! Just a great place and location.

I live on the neighbor island of Kauai and travel to Waikiki several times a year and have always stayed at a Marriott or Hilton. The Park Shore Waikiki is now my favorite and I will book all of my future visits with Park Shore.

I travel to Oahu at least once per year for work and always stay at the Park Shore Waikiki when I am in Honolulu. The hotel has the Hawaiian feel, and the staff is wonderful. The location is perfect for whatever your activities will be while on the island, and it is right across the street from the ocean. I love walking into my room for the first time and hearing the Hawaiian music playing on the radio!

We were 2 families, 2 nights. We had to wait our rooms 3 times, totally 4 hours from 2pm onwards. They even tried to put rest of us on lower floors saying no rooms available. There were rooms - it was all lies. No apologies, just rude and cocky behavior by a young front desk boy. First and last time in this resort. Beaware!

Older style accommodation. Could do with a refurbished everything we needed for our holiday Very clean and super friendly staff close to everything. Will be back. Services everyday. Perfect for family

Not sure what the others rooms are like but room 1407 had the best view ever! The front desk friendly, helpful. The building itself dated, not like a huge Marriott or Hilton which I liked. The room small, the shower a bit goofy, went off and on but nothing horrible, waking up to diamond head and ocean views spectacular!

What I liked best about the hotel was its proximity to Waikiki Beach and the Honolulu Zoo. Main disappointment was that there was no self service laundry room. It was an 8 block walk to a public laundry.

I stayed at this hotel same time last year and loved it. Right across the road from the beach but at the end of the strip so you don’t get the noise and chaos. This time was a bit more disappointing. One pro was our rooms were bigger than last year.Cons-were that whenever we went to the beach they were either out of beach towels or they weren’t ready yet. They would instead substitute a bath towel which barely keeps your body off the sand. I had to go buy my own towel. -last year I enjoyed the guava juice in the lobby, this year a lot of the time I went to get some it was either empty or gone. -LuLu’s was a bit louder this year. I can understand on a Friday or Saturday night but on our last night which was a Monday, we had a hard time sleeping and we were staying on the 17th floor!I’m not sure I will be returning for our next trip.

Could not have been happier with our stay. Comfy beds,TV, air con, spacious and clean room & bathroom. Right across the road from the beach. Hotel offer daily beach towels and small deck chair for free. We did not even see the pool. Right beside the zoo and on the main strip for bars and restaurants and shopping. The hotel staff are all friendly and helpful. The hotel offers free yoga at sunrise - its a must. No complaints, would definitely return and recommend.

This hotel is in an ideal spot. I had no problems at all throughout my stay. Housekeeping was great and gave me my space. I was staying for a week so I didn't need them everyday. The staff was very helpful . The guys at the bell fest noticed that i had been waiting for my tour group for a while and decided to give them a call for me. As soon as he startrd calling, the bus was pulling up. The location and views were everything. I had a view of diamond head and the beach and could watch the sunset from my balcony. All I had to do was walk across the street to get the the beach. I honestly have no complaints. The price was a little steep but they do offer a government discount. That with the location, I just couldnt pass up. My flight landed earlier than expected and I was able to check in early.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we were very pleased that we chose the Park Shore. The location was perfect for us. Adjacent to Kapi"lani Park and directly across from Waikiki Beach. And, for our needs, we appreciated that there was a Starbucks next door.We booked a partial ocean view room but, since the park was so close, we had a pleasant, relatively open view of the park and beach. Our room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable.....just a bit small. We had a refrigerator but no microwave. The front desk staff could have been a bit more friendly. Depending who was on duty during our 5 day stay a few made us feel that we were interrupting them if we approached the desk. If we return to Oahu we would definitely consider returning to the Park Shore..
user_name:
Linda N
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: What you are paying for is the formidable location: just walk across the street to the beach. It's also at the quieter end of Waikiki. The decor of the hotel is pretty basic and uninspiring but it's clean and well-maintained.

We stayed at the Park Shore for 5 nights and found it great for all our needs. It was very clean and had modern ammenities. The Check-in process was great and the safe were all very friendly.Lulus restaurant downstairs has the best filled French toast.There are plenty of shops and restaurants near by.You can catch the pink line bus just around the corner and that takes you around town.Hotel also has a free shuttle to the big shopping centre.There is a shuttle bus to the premium outlet mall which costs around $13 p/p.

Everything about our stay at the Park Shore was first rate. All of the staff we met were very friendly and knowledgeable. The little things such as providing beach towels, beach chairs and beach umbrellas for guests gave new meaning to customer service. We did wish our room had a microwave, rather than having to go down to the pool floor to use the one there.

Lobby furniture needs steam cleaning. Rooms need to be deodorized and spell better. Views of the ocean and Diamondhead are the best of any hotel in Honolulu. Prices are reasonable and hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.

Only complaint is the height of the shower head. I’m 6ft and had to do the limbo just to wash my hair. Other than that great staff, beach is just across the street. Had a corner room so even though it’s classified as a partial view we had a great view. Close to good restaurants

This hotel is a hidden gem. Great location at the quiet end of Waikiki with the beach across the street. Ocean view room is a must. Lanai is a nice size. My room on the 11th floor had a fab view of the ocean, Diamond Head and Kapiolani Park. Room was spotless, safe in room is large enough for a laptop. Pool on the 3rd floor has a view of the beach and gets sun all day. The staff was great - made you feel welcome.

Good value for money beautiful view within walking distance to zoo aquarium and lots of good restaurants. It’s all about location. We had a beautiful view of diamond head and Waikiki beach. This is the last hotel on the strip facing both.We stayed on the 16 th floor it was very quite.

Very pleased with hotel. The location is at the quiet end of Waikiki and only 5 mins from the beach. Staff were all very pleasant. Room a bit on the small size but more than adequate for my needs. They were cleaned every day and were of a good standard.

Great location, we had a view of Diamond Head and the beach. Staff really friendly, service is good, very easy check in and check out. Rooms appear a little tired but then we were out most of the day so not a real problem. Would definitely stay there again

Definitely an older hotel but it's in my favourite part of Waikiki - the quiet end! Splendid views of Diamond Head, easy walk to everything along Waikiki and about 2 metres over the road to the ocean. Super friendly staff, a mixup from Air Canada vacations was rectified on the spot and the pool was delightfully refreshing and quiet. Barely spent anytime in the hotel so didn't upgrade to a room view of the ocean etc. What's the point in being somewhere so fantastic and being sat in your hotel room....go outside!!!!!!!! Housekeeping were great over the busy Christmas/New Year period and loved the Hawaiian Tropic toiletries. However, it was post stay that this hotel REALLY won me over....being a bit sad to be leaving Hawaii once again, i somehow inadvertently left my gopro and all of the contents on it behind! Thought i'd lost it somehow en route back to Canada but nope...housekeeping had found it and it was sent back to me wrapped up securely via FedEx. Mahalo to the whole team at Park Shore for going above and beyond to make a guest SUPER HAPPY! :D

Picked this property for a few reasons: Proximity to the beach and access to free parking by the zoo. I’ll give a run down further in the review.We checked in late, around 22:00 at night and had a special rate we booked through the website. We were tired and stressed out and driving through a foreign city had worn our nerves thin. We had planned on trying to find street parking but getting in that late and how tired we were we just handed our keys to the Valet. Check in was a breeze but someone had the same last name as we did, and almost had their reservation but my wife caught it. Simple mix up. You’re given two towel cards with a $30 penalty if they’re not returned. Our room was on the 16th floor and on the non ocean side (I think they call it the city view?) and it was a standard room. I’ve read that there is a bunch of street noise but from the 16th floor we couldn’t hear anything. There is a sliver of ocean from these views and it wasn’t that bad. I believe this was the standard room. For the rate that we had the room was ok. It had a fridge and safe, but only had two double beds. The room size is listed at 234 feet and man did it feel like it. The balcony was probably 30 SF and really small. Nice enough to take in some air but not large enough to even hold a chair and have coffee. The real kicker for us was the two double beds. The next day we opted to pay the upgrade fee and move to the Ocean View room. Others have written this and I had disregarded it and I shouldn’t have. Totally worth the extra money. This time we were on the tenth floor and the road noise was noticable. Not a dealbreaker, but I can see that if you were on a lower floor that it could be disruptive.The room we had did not have a bathtub but that wasn’t a deal breaker for us. I really liked the shower amenities included with the room. Water pressure was good. The WiFi was fast and free. The coffee on the lanai with the free paper was really nice. King Bed and pillows were firm and on the nicer side that I’ve had in a hotel. Personally, I’m big on the ‘resort’ feel and from what I saw on the internet, Waikiki struggles to match something like Las Vegas. Rooms are smaller and amenities are not quite as sophisticated. Park Shore managed to squeeze a ‘resort’ feel into a small package. For example, there are only three elevators and they double as the staff elevators. In a giant property this would never fly but at Park Shore we never waited long for an elevator and the staff were always very kind to us as far as giving us priority if the elevator was full.Park Shore does not have dozens of restaurants inside but it has enough to get the job done. There is an ABC store (like a versatile 7 eleven that sells everything) both attached to the property and another right next to it, a Starbucks, a small coffee/sandwich shop called Tucker & Bevvy, a Japanese restaurant (Yoshitsune which we did not eat at), and Lulu’s which I think is the crown jewel of Park Shore’s venues.Lulu’s is a breakfast/lunch/dinner restaurant/ sports bar/ night club all rolled into one. It’s open air looks out over the ocean and it manages all of these different personalities without being overdone. We watched NFL playoff games one afternoon, had drinks there another night, and visited it on Monday night when it morphed into a nightclub and each time it was well done (I wouldn’t give it a 10 in any single category, but for hosting dancing millennials, loud sports fans, and family’s with children in the same venue it did a hell of a job.)I mentioned earlier that they give you a towel card that you can exchange for beach towels. I didn’t think I would be using it, but I was wrong. Park Shore is as close as you can get for this level of pricing and the beach towels were a godsend. Additionally they let you check out beach chairs which was really cool. Waikiki is not the most beautiful beach, but it is literally 250 feet away from the front door and it’s very popular. Having towels and chairs right there was awesome. There is a walled off section of ocean in front of the hotel that is the most artificial ocean I’ve probably ever swam in: terrible for snorkeling PERFECT for small kids, those that can’t swim or just lounging around in. And if that doesn’t suit you, you can walk a few feet away over the pier and be in the regular ocean. It’s wonderful. I had planned on street parking but after using the valet the first night I realize that my patience and the stress were not worth it. It was so nice to be able to drive up, hand the keys to the valet and simply walk away. Likewise, we were able to walk up to the valet, show the tag, and grab some beach towels and chairs and throw them in the back of the car and be off.The pool is one the 3rd floor and was always clean and comfortable. During the end of the day at sunset, the pool sits in a little too much shade but there’s not much that can be done about that. The vending machine is here and for those desperate for a snack the vending offers some microwave meals (there’s a microwave there too/ and the rooms have mini fridges so your leftovers could be eaten this way) among the standard chips and candies. Oddly enough, there were no diet sodas in the vending. Not a huge problem with the ABC store on level 1, but still an odd thing not to have.Comparing this property to a five star Las Vegas resort is not fair, but it succeeds in being incredibly cozy and offering a smaller version of pretty much everything you’d get at a five star with the exception maybe of a spa. For me, getting off the elevator onto a lobby sets the tone for the property and this one did not disappoint. It’s not a giant cathedral by any means, but its large glass walls, open seating and gentle front desk all do the job. There are well appointed couches and juice, lemon water, and coffee as well as an activity office all present in the lobby area. Staff told me the property was fully remodeled about 8 years ago and it seems to feel about that old. Meaning, the property was built in the 70’s and remodeled in the late 2000’s and it has some signs of middle age. Bottom line, the proximity to bus (the Biki-app driven bikes, the moped place right behind the hotel, the free parking across the street), the quiet side of Waikiki, the amenities provided, the breathtaking view, and the fact that it was literally right across from the beach, meant that this property was exceptionally comfortable (for the price) and I highly recommend that you put it on your short list. I would whole heartedly recommend this property and I would stay there again. (I will try to post photos and edit this comment out later).

This was my first visit ever to Hawaii. We went to Oahu as it seemed to be the most recommended place for first timers. We wanted a place that was budget friendly, fairly accessible, and central. With Parsk Shore we were able to get just that. There was nothing extraordinarily fancy, but it was just what we needed; a place to sleep at night while enjoying the beautiful island of Oahu during the day. Nothing pretentious, complicated, or an excuse to charge customers extra. The staff were super friendly, professional, and super helpful. We loved that this was right across a beach, where I can go for a morning swim every day. Additionally a lot of what we wanted to see and do was walking distance. If I ever have the chance to return to the island I’ll be doing my stay here again.

Other than the above-mentioned comments about the lobby furniture replacement fabric, I think the Park Shore is a great value in a prime location. The employees are knowledgeable and friendly. I will recommend the hotel to others but all new lobby furniture is non-negotiable.

I booked this hotel whilst in resort for a few days , room very nice , service from staff great.Rooftop pool perfect for sundowners!Great location as on end of strip & easy to access Zoo & thunderhead mountain.

My wife and I stayed here for 11 days. We were very happy. The location is great...right across from the beach, zoo, transportation, restaurants. Everything about the hotel was great. Great view from our room, very nice furnishings, housekeeping very nice, front desk and bell service very accommodating. We had a late flight so we were able to check out late (for a fee), which allowed us to go to the beach one more day. We'd highly recommend.

Stayed for 10 nights with friend's. Excellent location and plenty of eateries and things to do well within walking distance. Pool pretty good. Staff friendly and helpful and amenities pretty good. Hotel a little dated and could benefit from a bit of modernisation but overall, very happy with our stay.

The hotel is a great value. We stayed in a partial Ocean front and had a pretty good view of Diamond Head and the Ocean. Walking distance to everything! We enjoyed walking to Dukes for several meals. Check that place out for Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner. Live music and great vibe. Morning Yoga is a great perk. The mattresses could be a little more comfy but over all excellent value.

Stayed 2 nights. Booked on their website.joined and received an upgrade to ocean view. Good room.comfy bed.handy spot for us with the car. Cheaper than other places which is what we needed being Australians. Thursday manager welcoming was nice too. Lovely staff.

My circumstances weren't the greatest. However this stay was a refresher. The initial contact was great and it continued throughout my stay. There were perishables left behind under the bed, I had my son with me, I just ended up throwing them away.

Good location but room too small. Bed is very old and uncomfortable. No laundry in facility. Hotel needs major renovation. Not relaxing at all. I do not recommend this hotel. The room and bathroom had a musty smell. The refrigerator froze our water and milk.

Most happy when we arrived early and we could check in early.Our room was not ready and we were given another which was fine. All aspects of the room suited us. VERY tidy and clean. Bed Comfortable.We are not travellers who spend a lot of time at a Hotel and we found Park Shore was ideal. Examples : Close to Start/Finish of Merrie Mile race which we participated in. Easy hike to Diamond Head. A quieter area of Waikiki right across the road.

Our room was lack of cleanliness, hairs were spotted everywhere. The shower drain was clogged up. We left the note in our room to ask fixing it but was ignored. The amenities ware never replaced enough.

We had 2 seperate bookings 2 days and a further 10 days. On checking in again with Michelle on our 10 day booking commencing the 12/17/18 at approx 10:30am, I requested to move to a different room not right next door to the Diamond Head tower. Michelle advised that unfortunately we couldn’t move rooms as the Park Shore was fully booked apart from a 1 bed room unit due to the holiday period although this was prior to 12pm where a change to room allocations could have easily be done. Although after liaising with other employees and viewing hardly any lights on in most of the other rooms and the Hotel appeared fairly quiet during our stay it was clear the the Park Shore was not fully booked. It was really disappointing to find out this was not the case during our stay which made us feel let down.

Right beside zoo. Amazing Diamond Head views. 2 minutes to kid friendly beach. We've stayed at a couple hotels in Waikiki, and this is our favorite. Relaxed Hawaiian feeling and friendly staff. Away from crowded city like feel of other hotels just down the street. Best of both worlds.

Most girlsh I've started in have some industrial air conditioning that can get the room down to 65 even if it's 110 out but the AC in my room struggled to get it to 70 even though it was only 80 outside. Doesn't seem like a big deal but I can't sleep well in warm rooms. On top of that the pillow was hard and the bed was lumpy. The bathroom fixtures were rusting and the handles to turn the water on in the bathroom was wobbly. Plus the water never got very hot.All in all not the worst girlh I've stayed in but not one I'm likely to return to.

Awesome view, good location, relaxing pool & comfortable bed! Everything you need is not far away. ABC stores are close (with one in the building) the staff are friendly & helpful & there is a free courtesy bus to ala Moana centre. I would definitely stay here again!

Had a great time...location of hotel was best on beach....not to busy at the sand/ocean compared to the far end of the beach....zoo and park next door....great.... room was good could use a bit of an update on furniture....over all nine out of ten.....

More tables or writing area would be nicel Location next to a bus stop was great. Now a Denny's restaurant is nearby which makes it really nice., not to mention the Honolulu zoo is just across the street.

This hotel needs to be upgraded and modernized to be more competitive. The location and the staff are its main selling points. The on-site restaurant Lu Lu's has really gone downhill in quality since we were here 4 years ago.in

Loved the location staff and amenities. The room was very nice and the price very reasonable. Loved the location right across the street from the beach. The shuttle service is a great way to get around and is a life saver for tired people!

We really enjoyed our stay at Park Shore, the location was impeccable. Right across the street from the beach, and on a quieter corner of Waikiki Beach, slightly away from the tourist zoo. We had an oceanfront room and the view from the balcony was stunning! Walkable to everything in Waikiki. Service was very friendly overall, we enjoyed the beach chair and towel service and valet was great. My only complaint is that the rooms could use a little updating. The bathrooms seemed to be a bit dated, and our shower was hard to dial to the right temperature.

There were no important problem. Our stay was very comfortable. The location and the ocean view was very nice. It was very convenient that ABC store was directly connected to the hotel. I used the store three times during our stay for 4 nights.

Dream vacation in Waikiki going to an Airbnb with amazing views, not so much! We ended up in a bad situation and three days into the vaca we found ourselves abandoning the deplorable airbnb. Park Shore got us in quickly, for a good price, and within 45 minutes of booking we were checked in! They got us a room in the morning, gave us chocolate covered macadamia nuts upon welcome, and were extremely friendly and helpful through the visit. Is the hotel new and luxurious, no. Great views, no, unless you like looking at the neighboring hotel (obviously other rooms with good views but ours was a view of concrete). Amazing pool area, no. None the less I give 5 stars as they saved our vacation!

We reserved the hotel for 12 nights. Nice hotel with a very good location and a nice view to Diamond Head. We got a sea-view room with a excellent view. The room was cleaned up daily. The hotel employees were always helpful and the valet-parking was quick and with 28$ okay.

The customer service was absoulty horrible! Way over priced for how old it is. Hawaii was amazing except my experience with this hotel. They tried to upcharge me when i was already paying 1600.00 for my stay. Never again will i be booking here

We have just completed a 9-day/8-night at the Park Shore and here is what I hope will be a helpful review to those considering a stay here. And just to clarify we are very experienced travelers and have typically stayed at properties ranging from 3.5-5.0 stars depending on how overall expensive our destination city might be.So first of all, this is not a 5-star "Westin" caliber resort but they are also nowhere near the cost that someone would be required to pay for a 5-star property. That being said I would place Park Shore squarely between a 3.5-4.0 star rating based on the following categories.1) If you book a stay here join their "A-list" club and book directly as they will not only (typically) have the lowest price but you will be given a free room category upgrade when you check-in (yes, it is based on availability but they will go out of their way to honor and accommodate it). Also when booking direct with the resort if the price happens to drop (at least 72-hours prior to your check in) they will honor the lower price if you contact them immediately and inform point out the lower price. This happened to us and the price dropped enough for us to book 1 room category higher and still get a few bucks credit. This great deal allowed us to get bumped up to a corner view room (#1407) with an amazing view of Diamond Head, the Honolulu Zoo, and all of Waikiki Beach plus the Pacific Ocean which was enhanced by the fact the corner rooms have a second window facing the other direction so you can see the rest of the beach and city!2) Service.....starting with the check-in process right through the end of the stay the entire staff at Park Shore was nothing less than exceptional in how the responded to all requests! This is an area I would gladly give them 5-stars!3) Location......another 5-star rating for this category! They are right on the beach (cross the street from beach but completely unobstructed) and also at the quiet end directly across from the Honolulu Zoo. 4) Resort building quality....this in all fairness is only about a 3-star rating because it is definitely an older property that has been taken good car of but nevertheless could still use some more upgrades (but please remember you are not paying Westin prices so don't expect to get the Westin). The building is kept very clean but a lot of the decor and furnishings certainly are dated.Our goal when we travel is to find that "sweet spot" which means getting as many perks as possible without breaking the bank (this approach allows us to afford a lot more vacations). The Park Shore in our opinion is an absolute steal for anyone who wants a great beach location, great service and a great price. I did a ton of pre-trip internet research on Waikiki resorts and our amazing ocean view room was priced significantly less than many other resorts "city view" rooms that were "walking distance" to the beach. If I wanted to pay $300-500/night you bet we could stayed at much fancier place but I am beyond happy to have paid under $160/night for our room and would not hesitate to do it again. That savings (which in our opinion was no room sacrifice at all) afforded us several great dining experiences and island tours than we may have normally done and we still came home way under budget!Well done Park Shore......well done!
user_name:
Lew V
Vancouver, Washington, United States

review_body: We paid extra for an ocean view room and it is worth the cost for sure. Why come all this distance and not be able to throw open the curtains each morning for a look at the beach and ocean and Diamond Head?! The room was not large, but clean and more than adequate. The bathroom was clean. There were two electrical outlets in the base of each bedside light that were most welcome. The wi-fi was excellent, the pool off the third floor was large and inviting. Beach towels and chairs were available from the front desk (and the beach is literally across the street). The location was perfect. There is a large pub-style restaurant called LuLu's that is part of the hotel complex that has a 3-6 happy hour and in any case decent prices. We also enjoyed CheeseBurger in Paradise for pub style food (and another happy hour) a short distance down Kalakaua. A little farther down Kalakaua we had wonderful dinners at Dukes and the Hula Grill in the Outrigger Waikiki Hotel. We highly recommend this hotel. Oh, and the staff at the front desk were consistently friendly and helpful.

This Hotel which was at the end of the strip was Right across from the beach. Starbucks a few minutes walk ABC store down stairs for snacks n juice. Lulus for Breakfast and some evening meals. All you needed really. The staff on reception were very friendly and helpful. On arrival we were given a back room where it felt you could touch the hotel next to it. There was no table or chairs on the veranda. We went straight back down stairs and requested a sea view and what a view we got. Paid a lot extra for it though but worth it. Having spoken to a few people throughout the week the same thing had happened to them. The rooms were excellent. Stocked up every day with fresh towels even though we hadn’t left them on the floor for changing. The toiletries are replenished daily too. All Hawaiin Tropics too. Which smells amazing. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Chose this place as a starting point for a cruise two days later. Great location at the quiet edge of Waikiki Beach, right across from the zoo. Check-in went easily, with the clerk being absolutely right about the service fees (I mistakenly thought they had been paid, but credit card statement verified her correctness). Room was spacious with nice travel-sized shampoo, conditioner and lotion bottles. Fridge held drinks nice and cold (even a milkshake). Did I mention the great location? Plenty of restaurants, attractions, beach, and Diamondhead nearby.

We had an excellent stay at this hotel. The location was perfect for our family with a 3 and 5 year old. right across from the hotel is a protected swimming area that the kids loved. The pier was fun to walk down in the morning to see all the fish.The pool was an excellent space and never busy during our week long stay. Great spot to sit by the pool and you can people watch the waikiki strip and zoo area. The room was clean and comfortable. Our view was lacking as we stared across into other rooms and over an alley. In the hotel's defense, we booked a standard room. When we asked about a better room, they let us check out a room that overlooked the pool and could see the beach.
