However, we did not want to pay the $65USD/night and opted to stick with our room since we were out of the room from sunrise-sunset.Beverages and snacks are available at decent prices in the ABC store connected to the lobby. There is also a starbucks outside the lobby. Lulu's, the restaurant attached to the hotel, was a fun atmosphere with good food. the breakfast portions were huge (we split an omelette) and the kids got the $4 pancakes. Great tv's and bar for watching sports while hanging out. The hotel is excellent for those that want to be on the strip but not in the middle of all the noise. It was always a pleasant arrival to get to the end of the strip and enjoy the chill vibe around the pier. Look forward to staying there again

i stayed at this hotel for two nights. There was a mix up with parking. I have a broken foot. Kanai not only fixed the parking problem but took parking charges off tge bill for the two nights of our stay due to my broken foit and difficulty walking. His helpfulness really made a big difference in this stay and i appreciate his great service.

I have no complaints with this hotel. We found it clean, staff was friendly and when we did have an issue with our room they took care of us right away. The location is right at the beach and close to shops and restaurants. They provide a shuttle to the shopping center but we choose to walk so I can't comment on that service. They provided us with beach towels and chairs which is a great feature.

I stay at the Park Shore Waikiki every time I work or vacation on Oahu which is about 6 times per year. The people who work there are very kind and helpful, and they make you feel welcomed. The rooms are clean, and the location is great.

A very clean hotel. Very comfy beds.I was allowed an early check in for a small fee - quite nice after a long flight.Level 10 has hot water problems so best check this before you get a room on that level.We were given a complimentary change to a semi water view room when we asked about changing rooms for the view - this was very kind.Overall a great location, friendly staff, comfy beds. Would stay there again.

Location is excellent, at Diamond Head end of Waikiki, across the road is the beach and side street is the Zoo. Easy walk up to main Waikiki shopping area and free shuttle to Ala Moana Shopping centre. Starbucks and ABC shops close to entrance of hotel. Room was comfortable and good size. Pool was very inviting and lovely watching the sunset from the pool area.

The hotel and staff are very nice. However I feel very let down by my room. We paid a premium for a Diamond Head Suite, which is promised on the Hotel website to have "Breathtaking View" of Diamond Head, Our room (1415) had virtually no view of Diamond Head. I guess it could have been classified as a partial ocean view, which I could have booked for much less than I paid. I wiil try and post a picture of the view.

This is our second stay at the park shore, great location,The zoo I’d directly across the street . With in walking distance to lots of shopping Room are clean staff is friendly .Pool is nice with a great view of the ocean

Spent two nights and thought this hotel was a hidden gem. It was in a wonderful location...at a quieter end of Waikiki (next to the zoo) and had a wonderful view. We were is an end room so we had full views of the ocean and Diamond Head. The staff at this hotel is also first class and very helpful. It is probably not the most recently built hotel on the strip but very well maintained and clean. We loved our stay there even purchasing a bottle of wine and a pizza for dinner our last night so we could enjoy the sunset on our balcony.

As its name suggests the Park Shore Waikiki hotel is conveniently located near the beach frontage. My wife and I stayed here in September, our comfortable room with balcony overlooked the beach to our right and the pool below with views to the mountains in the distance. All the shops and restaurants were an enjoyable walk along the frontage. Helpful staff in reception, ordering of cabs, assistance with luggage and informative regarding places to visit.

The hotel staff were helpful and booked us in even though we were early after a long flight. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the hotel location was wonderful. Not too noisy! The pool area and view were great as well. I felt the charges were a little high - but then everything in Hawaii seemed expensive.

+ Really good location, Starbucks next door at the corner, Zoo and Waikiki beach in 1 minute walk+ Affordable price+ Decent room quality (also there's coffee machine, coffee and nice cookies)- Can be busy with the many tourist around some time

I have stayed at many resorts and b&b's and hotels but for some reason, I sleep so well on the bed here! I went for work and it's so easy to get to, great staff and Starbucks around the corner! No room service but you are close to all ths food you could want. They also have great showers with a rain shower head.

Staff very helpful go out of there way to make you welcome.Good location beach across the road near the zoo excellent shuttle bus service to the mall.Rooms are ok tv ,safe, bar fridge neat & tidy good shower rates are reasonable.

We stopped in Waikiki on way home from mainland USA to chill & break the long haul flight home to Aus. 4 days was bliss.Booked a room with absolute ocean views and they delivered. So relaxing!!!On checking in the staff were helpful, polite, and friendly. Gave us clear instructions that if at any time we needed any assistance to let them know and they will do their very best…….which they did.Free beach towels & beach chairs available from front desk upon request.Room was airconditioned and large enough. The bathroom was a little on the small side with no shelving to store toiletries. Maybe something the hotel could look at in the near future. On second day the plumbing also starting making noise due to the age of building. Thankfully we didn't stay in our room too long.Have no hesitation recommending this hotel to fellow travellers. Still wish that hotels would give you a full price - not one where at the end you have to pay for bed tax, traveller tax, etc.

Hotel located at the edge of Waikiki which is good. Balcony with sideways sea view and comfortable room but on the small side, with small balcony - however overlooked. Bathroom spacious. On site snack bar T&B underneath great for breakfast or lunch (opens at 6am) and LuLu’s restaurant from 2nd floor – live music good food. Beach towels and chairs included. Complementary coffee in reception in the morning. Good WiFI and a safe.Would definitely stay here again.

Reasonable price in a good location! A little bit outdated but had an antique look to it. Service was good and helpful except for the part that they charged us parking fee even though we did not have a car. Good thing that my husband had the charged notification thing with his credit card so he was able to informed the front desk. I loved the location since the Waikiki beach was literally across the street and Diamond Head was 10 mints drive and the airport was 20-30 mints drive. Bus 19 & 20 stops in front of the hotel! ABC store was in both corners and 5-10 min walk to good restaurants and local food. Starbucks was next to it and McDonald's is close by. Designer shops and local shops are 15 mints walk. They have an activity person in the lobby if you want to booked last minute Laua or any Hawaiian Fun activities. They also have a shop for surf board rental or lessons and if you want more choices just walk at Waikiki beach ( right side)for more surf rentals or lessons are offered. They do have pool in the premises. They have a sushi bar in the hotel - didn't get to try it but it is in front of the elevator and when we passed by, it was full. Room was comfy and good size! Cleaned sheets and well functioning air-con. TV was annoying since it does not st in one channel after you turn it off but then again we weren't there to watch or stay in the room all day. I really liked the experience it this hotel, I would recommend it since we have a pleasant stay! Comfortable and good location without breaking the bank!

Park Shore Waikiki is a quaint hotel in the best part of Waikiki. Directly across the street from the zoo and Kapiolani Park. The view from this hotel is amazing! Lulu's restaurant is connected to Park Shore Waikiki and is fabulous as well. The rooms are clean and hotel staff amazingly friendly. Will definitely be back!

great location to ocean and Waikiki beach. abc stores close by and deli in lobby excellent. fantastic views of diamond head mountain and zoo and park and pacific ocean. beds excellent for sleep. good house keeping and front desk staff

Parking was cheap at neighboring zoo. Front staff are friendly. Room cleaning is cleaned everyday, and amenities are filled every day. It would have been better if there was a toothbrush and toothpaste.

We started our Hawaiian vacation staying here a couple of nights and couldn't have been happier. It was steps away from the ocean and great beaches. The zoo was across the street and shops and restaurants were in walking distance. Sat out by the pool and could view the ocean, couldn't ask for anything more.

I've stayed at this hotel before and it remains a good choice. Because we were only staying for a night, we didn't bother paying for a room with a view - but we still had a glimpse of the water. The check in staff were pleasant and the room, albeit small, was pleasant and clean. I like the idea that you just walk across the road and you're in the water. And the shuttle buses stop here as well.

First off, I don't love Waikiki. It's not as clean as it was in prior years and night time can make us a little nervous. However, the room was clean and we had an incredible view from our patio. The staff were always helpful...especially valet parking. The outside of the hotel rooms (since it's open to the elements) could've used some attention (painting, etc.), but you just pass through there.

Best location in Waikiki. Across from beach and across from the Zoo. Quiet location and can easily walk everywhere. The hotel is very comfortable & clean and the staff made us feel so welcomed. Really appreciated the spacious rooms and very friendly housekeeping staff. Loved the great ocean view and beautiful sunsets.

Rooms were clean and accessable. The hotel itself is located at the end of Waikiki beach so is out of the main touristy bits, a bit of a walk if you want to go see the big resorts etc. But as it is located near the zoo and park is very convenient for these, the beach etc. There is a bus stop out the front which took us to pearl harbour, and we walked to Diamond Head (a bit of a trek but easily dooable in half a day). Pool was good. Highly recommend the Japanese restaurant in the lobby (best Japanese outside of japan IMO).

My husband and I stay here every summer vacation, almost 14 years. The best is the view from a lanai. It's speechless. I do anything for a cup of coffee on this lanai with this view. But because of this excellent view, it is located a lillle bit far from the center of waikiki.

Parkshore is the perfect blend between in the middle of things and outside of them...just a few steps from diamond head and the parks and going the other way you're on the beach or in the shopping and dinning area .It's not fancy, but the rooms are nice and clean. The only area that has serious room for improvement is the 2nd floor hallway going to the attached restaurant and pub.We made it our Waikiki headquarters after trying a few locations more and less expensive .

If you are looking for a hotel in the middle of the action but not in the middle of the hustle this is the hotel. The staff and Valet service is second to none! Lance, and June were the best and deserve the recognition. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Bit small but who goes to Hawaii to stay in the hotel?

this hotel needs a total do-over old outdated we had a great room 17 th floor corner room awesome views no room service no bar  other than LU LU 's which is very loud, the staff here are great, across the street from the beach which was not busy lots of room quiet end of Waikiki we would prefer to closer to the main part of Waikiki

The Park Shore provides a friendly family environment, a pleasure to stay at this hotel. It's location at the quieter end of the Waikiki strip is ideal for families with the zoo close by and the sheltered beach area for smaller children.

We stayed for 4 nights recently; the only positive we took from it was the smart TV in our room. Our room faced onto the 'park ' hmmm more like a dirty alleyway with guests from a neighbouring hotel able to see directly into your room. The beds were rock solid and decor like something from the 60's. Good luck trying to get a sleep when all night youll gear people going into their rooms and the elevator arriving. Stained carpets in the hallways and elevators. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone nor would we stay there again.

PositivesHotel is in a superb location away from the major Waikiki buzz, it has an open aspect overlooking the Zoo, and Park and with stunning views of the Ocean and Diamond Head. It appears that most hotels in this area are so tightly packed in that even ocean front rooms only have a view of the ocean and the hotel next door. Very efficient Bell Boy Team transporting and storing luggage.Direct access to Lu Lu's Restaurant and only minutes walk from many more.Direct access to an ABC store where you can buy everything you could possible need on holiday.Vending machines at poolside selling snacks and micro meals alongside a microwave oven.Complimentary coffee available in the lobby in mornings and water and juice throughout the day.Complimentary beach chairs available (but no parasols)NegativesDon't Rely on the photos on their web site, we booked an Ocean Front room that appeared to be directly facing the ocean and with a large bathroom with lots of shelves only to find that some ocean front rooms (in our case room 1507 on the 15th floor) had superb open views of the ocean and diamond head but side on to the ocean, there are other ocean view rooms directly facing the ocean but are set further back on the far side of the hotel. also the bathroom was quite small with no storage space for toiletries. The above inaccuracies in description were pointed out to the reception supervisor on the first day of our stay and she agreed that it was wrong and that they had been reported by other guests and was under the impression that they had been changed and would report it to management and come back to us, we eventually received a discount but only after pursuing with the reception staff a day before our departure, not good management procedure, they should have come back to us!Due to the hotel's location directly above Lu Lu's Restaurant there are permanent cooking smells when sitting on the balconyThe hotel advertises a courtesy room for early/late arrivals, we arrived four hours before official check in and were kept waiting about for five hours and were told that this room had been discontinued long ago.The hotel makes a major point of inviting guests to a weekly Manager's Reception which was a bit of a letdown as the manager was too busy to attend and the reception consisted of two staff members handing out nibbles and alcoholic/non alcoholic fruit cocktail from a trolley tucked away at the side of the pool for one hour PROMPT but made no effort to connect with the guests.The hotel group encourages guests to sign up to its "A Plus Insider scheme" which offers benefits such as free gift on arrival, we had to ask for ours and were given it the day before departure (this gift was a very useful small cool bag containing water and snacks) which would have been a bonus if presented on arrival whilst waiting for our room!!!Overall we enjoyed our stay, but travelling so far (from the UK) for a once in a lifetime experience and relying on the information on the hotel web site it could have been so much better with good management procedures

We stayed here for our anniversary in late September, early October. Super fast, no wait check in and check out. The room was nice but nothing too fancy. It did have a nice patio and I wished we had a nicer view as we were facing a building. All of the staff was super friendly. There was a free shuttle bus to the Ala Moana Mall. The hotel location was perfect! Steps away from the beach, restaurants, Starbucks and shopping stores. I would definitely recommend to others based on price and location, location, location!

We upgraded to a full sea view and had a corner room so we could see all the way from the zoo/Diamond Head to the beach - it was just amazing...the room itself was not 5 start perfect but was big and we had enough room for us, air con was great. The room safe was not brilliant but didn't spoil our stay, the TV guide that included the hotel guide wasn't working one day but they fixed it. This hotel is in the perfect location at the end of the beach and not too far to walk to restaurants etc. Great having 2 ABC stores so close too. Only took an hour to walk to Ala Moana shopping centre and got the bus back right to the hotel.We used the beach towel service so we didn't get sand on our own towels, wifi was excellent all week, we could have borrowed beach chairs too but it was too hot to sit out for too long. Free juice and free wifi in the lobby if you wanted it. We knew we would have to pay the amenity fee so no surprises there.The lady on reception was really good and helpful

Had 3 nights here at the start of a Hawaii trip. Good location right on the waterfront. Some noise from the road outside but its a busy tourist spot so to be expected. Rooms are average - mine was very small compared to other hotel's in Hawaii. My friend had the same category and was about twice the size! Reception could do with more staff as seems to take a very long time to do anything. All hotels around here are expensive so this is probably about the best price for the location.

Great location, incredible views, friendly and responsive staff. May not have the newest facilities or be the most modern hotel in Waikiki, but we would return there in a heart beat for the more important reasons outlined first.

Terrible experience. Cockroaches in the room, unprofessional staff, and fees for amenities we didn’t use. When we arrived, the front desk guy thought we were staying for two nights but our reservation was clearly for one. That was just weird. Worse, most of the time he was distracted, obviously talking on his desk phone with a friend. We heard all about how he might get off at 11, plus he said something about the hotel’s future that I would guess isn’t supposed to be public info. It was so rude—can’t you just text your friend on your break?When we got to our room, there were two twin beds when we’d been expecting a Queen. We went back down to the desk and asked to get a Queen room, only to be told that those rooms are not guaranteed and because we checked in at 9pm we had no other option. I’ve never had that problem at a hotel, especially one of this size. The desk guy offered us an ocean side room for an extra fee, but after we didn’t back down he finally admitted there was a queen room available on the third floor! So why did we have to go through all that?We went to our room and first thing found a huge, twitching cockroach in the shower, followed by another small cockroach on the floor. We got rid of them and by then, too tired to complain, we went to bed hoping there weren’t more bugs. But the hotel couldn’t resist making our stay even worse; when we checked out, they charged us an amenities fee of $51 for beach towels, etc. I explained we were only there for one night and we didn’t use any of the amenities, but the guy at the desk said it was a mandatory fee. So beware because you will be charged for those things even if you don’t use them.I’m so glad we only had to deal with this place for one night. Save yourself the trouble and don’t book at all.

The Japanese Restaurant has the best japanese cuisine food ever....must try it. This hotel is close to the beach. Just don't get room near the street since the bus stops there and it will wake you up on the morning. It is noisy. I requested upon check in to ask for a room on the other side or middle is okay

My husband and I just spent 8 nights here.Location is perfect, handy to everything. It's clean but tired looking. Time to get rid of the brown and brighten up the paint work.Michelle on reception was extremely helpful, but other staff just seemed tired.My main criticism is that there was nowhere to hang any washing. Surely they could put lines up in the bathroom.Courtesy coach to Ala Moana is great.Free beach chairs is a lovely touch.

Stayed at Park Shore at north end of beachfront strip. Hotel is good value for money with beach across the road. Hotel staff were efficient & friendly and no issues with hotel however rooms are a bit on the small side & due for refresh.

Stayed here for 10 days, location amazing, beautiful view.Staff were accommodating and always helpful.Interior of building dated, needs better lighting in hallways, lobby always smelt from Japanese restaurant!Pool closed for 2 days, never enough deck chairs,managers drinkscancelled and never on, ran out of beach towels and given bath towel not bid enough for beach!Hand towel welcome doesn’t exist, if you go on shuttle bus always full as at the end of the line! Even thou the amenity fee is cheap and the internet good, did expect better!

Definitely a 3 - 3 1/2 Star hotel, but in a great location, next to Waikiki beach. Our party had 3 rooms, all with balconies and ocean views. Free internet in main foyer, and an ABC Store on the ground floor, handy for purchasing snacks, lunches, and alcoholic bevvies. Room fridge was empty so plenty of room to stock up. Good choice of accommodation if you’re on a budget.

Older hotel with FRIENDLY staff and GREAT ocean views. Michelle at the front desk was super nice on the phone and in person. Lance, the valet, was super too. The view overlooked Queen's beach and the activities, very convenient!!

The Park Shore is not the fanciest hotel on Waikiki, but it does have some of the best views. Many (if not all) rooms face either the ocean or Diamond Head ... and both in some cases. I definitely recommend this hotel if you like the view but don't need the frills. Bonus: the japanese restaurant in the lobby is the super authentic and delicious.

Interesting visit as the hurricane threatened. Almost everything closed including food outlets! Luckily it was only a bit windy. The hotel was good but maybe could have been more helpful regarding food supplies. We were simply told to stock up .

We really enjoyed the view overlooking the water and the zoo - it was nice to be on the edge of Waikiki but not in the heart of it. All of the staff were really friendly and we luckily stayed on a high floor, so it was very pleasant. They provide beach chairs and towels to walk across the street to the beach, which was easy and nice. I'd recommend this hotel. EXCEPT Monday nights are Industry night at Lulu's (the bar on the corner next to the hotel), with loud music until pretty late. We tend to stay up late, so it wasn't a huge issue, but I could see it bothering some. This was not told to us upon check-in. Besides that, this was a fantastic hotel and highly recommended.

Pros: This hotel was so accommodating! The staff was so helpful and nice. We were able to go to a Luau. Across the street you have the beach, Honolulu Zoo. Free shuttle to the mall. My only con room was kinda small.

We have stayed there four times and on our recent visit in September 2018 weren't disappointed at all with the location, cleanliness, service and friendliness of the hotel. What was new from our previous stays was the party held at the club in front of the hotel on Monday nights which went on until 2 am and was very noisy. People had queried animal noise before which has never been a concern, but the noise from the club was. If we stayed there again, and we likely would, we would request a room back from the front of the hotel and choose the cheaper city view rooms as they are away from the bulk of the noise from the club. It's a shame about the club noise as it would also impact on the comfort of people in other hotels. The service desk person said the noise was always Monday nights and looked very disappointed about it.

We had to change our flights as our current hotel could not accommodate us. We decided to book the Park Shore and could not have been more pleased. We were given a corner room that had an unobstructed view of Diamond Head and the Ocean. They were very accommodating. We had returned from a walk and were caught in a rainstorm when we walked by the friend desk we were offered towels to dry off and told they offered umbrellas. (Both were a very nice touch). After they learned the story of our flight situation they sent up some bubbles and chocolate. I have stayed in Hawai'i many times, without a doubt this is the best view I have ever had. Bryan at the front desk was nice and friendly. Michelle also was outstanding and very accommodating. They are lucky to have her. Thanks to the entire staff, You were amazing.

I was pleasantly surprised on our arrival of the lobby, they have excellent friendly staff, valet parking and help with the bags. The interior Lobby looked clean and the staff fast for the check ins. The room wasn't as spectacular as I was expecing (the beds sagged a bit in the middle) but it was very clean and the view made up for it. The partial ocean view was incredible! (ask for the one facing Waikiki beach and its on the cool side). There is a incredibly nice view of Diamond Head from near the elevator and you can walk outside and take pictures so you don't need the full Ocean view room neccessarily. Very very gorgeous views. The staff really are wonderful and the cleaners as well and they really seemed to vaccuum good and clean very well. The tub is shallow but the shower head was awesome! The Shampoo and Conditior they have there are wonderful. Some of the best i've ever used in a hotel. It can get a bit noisy on Waikiki at night and you can hear everything but it didn't keep me awake. Great location to stay at and they have coffee and ice water for guests in the Lobby. Right next door to starbucks as well and they give you beach chairs and umbrellas if you want. I was going to give a very good, but I think I will give an excellent. I found the price a bit high and thats why I was going to say good but they really were so nice so I will give an excellent! They do have a fridge and a Safe which is nice as well.

To be fair, it's a good location. My parents had always stayed in this hotel for the last three times they were here. Unfortunately, now, we won't choose here again. NEVER.I would have given them a higher score, maybe a 2; however the last impression I had of them after our 11 days stay, was ruined by a lady (probably in her 40s) at the desk, as we checked out. Usually when I get myself to leave a hotel, I like to check under the bed(s) to see if I missed packing anything. Guess what I found? One big bag of empty beer cans under one bed and one pair of shoes under the other bed. They were not mine and I stayed there for 11 nights. VERY CLEARLY, they don't clean the room, otherwise, this large bag of empty beer cans wouldn't have stayed under my bed all this time, unless someone 'accidentally' brought it into my room and left it there.When I said mentioned this to the lady at the front desk, in a very irritated and disgusted tone, she said, "Why didn't you tell us earlier?" Is it my fault now because I didn't have the habit of checking my bed before I leave the hotel? Her attitude was completely rude. I'm extremely disgusted, not only by what I found, but also by her attitude. Yes I also did miss that big bag filled with empty cans under my bed for 11 days, but because we, as customers, pay the money to sleep in a hotel, NOT to clean? Is this not the house keeping's job? If it is, HOW COULD THEY HAVE MISSED IT? Even if they don't clean the room entirely during my stay, before a new customer goes into a new room, should they not clean the ENTIRE room? I still can't believe what I saw; even more, I can't believe how their customer service representative reacted to my complaints. Extremely rude, condescending and unprofessional. My parent stayed in the room next to mine, let's see what was broken: the fire alarm the first day, and gradually in the next few days, one by one, the safe box broke three times, the refrigerator either froze all the food in there or leaked, oh and the last few days, the toilet didn't flush properly. To be fair, they reacted to those repairment requests quite promptly, and they gave my parents...25 dollars off for 3 nights (we stayed 11 nights). This other person who listened to what we said reacted much more professionally. Please, don't blame the situation on the customer when it's clearly the hotel's fault. It does not help with your customer service, nor does it help the situation.

I found this excellent hotel years ago through TripAdvisor, and it has gotten better with each stay (we have been back four times). It has unobstructed views of the beach across the street and beautiful tropical park grounds next door with Diamondhead in the background. Uniquely each morning you can hear the monkeys and exotic birds in the adjacent zoo as they wake. This comfortable hotel is cozy, with all the conveniences of Waikiki but less hectic, and staff so personable. The pool is modest, but with beautiful views. Small but well appointed room with balcony lounge chairs to enjoy morning coffee from the pot in the room with the local paper stacked conveniently on each floor in the elevator lobby. Walking distance to all, shopping, restaurants, sites as well as trolley or bus shuttle to sites.

I loved the entire experience at the Park Shore Waikiki. I definitely recommend the Poolside unit if you are traveling with children. The rooms are very spacious, clean, and comfortable. The front desk, valet/bell, housekeeping, and maintenance were really welcoming and efficient with whatever requests or interactions we had during our stay. We didn't want to check out it was so wonderful thank you!

Great location! Views second to none. Very friendly staff. We had a wonderful stay at this property, were there for 2 weeks. There is a free shuttle between this property and the mall, major plus! We will be here again!

We thought it would probably be our first and only trip to Hawaii. We wanted something special for our 20th wedding anniversary. It's a long flight(s) from New England, and Hawaii is expensive, so we wanted to make sure to book the right hotels on Oahu and Maui. We did a lot of research, including on Trip Advisor, and decided to book the Park Shore Waikiki Hotel.The Park Shore Waikiki Hotel is wonderful! The location is the best spot on Waikiki Beach! Close to everything, but you're not in the craziness of the crowds. It's located on 2586 Kalakaua Ave. When you cross the street, you're right on the beach. On the other side of the hotel, crossing Kapahulu Ave is Honolulu Zoo, and in the distance beautiful Diamond Head. Public transportation/bus stops are nearby.The entrance is welcoming and beautiful with fresh flowers, you can get beach towels and chairs every day from the front desk, free coffee and water in the lobby each morning, with juice and water in the afternoon. The Wi-Fi worked well, and we were pleased with the mini fridge in the rooms, as well as the microwave that was available on the third floor, close to the pool area, next to vending machines. They also offer hypoallergenic pillows, which was really great, and not every hotel does so.All the staff was wonderful and kind, from the front desk staff to the house keeping staff to the bell staff! But to us, Kana'i was the star! (Mah man! We bonded over ukuleles )When we arrived at the hotel, two front desk staffers were busy checking in guests. One of them caught our attention. The way he was interacting with the guests was so welcoming, and giving them great tips on sightseeing. He was so pleasant, and we hoped he would be the one checking us in. His name is Kana'i. Such a nice, truly friendly person!When he found out it was our anniversary trip, he offered a free upgrade, which would be available two nights later. The upgrade was the best room in the hotel: the corner unit on the highest,18th floor, with on one side a view of the ocean & beach, and on the other side a view of Diamond Head. We felt like royalty :-)We highly and happily recommend the Park Shore Waikiki Hotel and its wonderful staff!We'll be back!

I just returned from a 6 day stay at Park Shore and I have pros and cons. More pros than cons so that's great!!! I was on the 8th floor over looking the pool and Diamond Head! I paid the $188 price to have a semi-ocean view on the hotel website.Let's start with the cons and end on a high note!Cons:1) On Weds, I waited for the free appetizers, and drinks near the pool and that never happened. So I was bummed about that. The elevators had a sign that said this would happen and it didnt.2) I asked for a beach umbrella from the valet employees and they told me they dont have beach umbrellas. But the TV says they do. The valet folks said, its regular umbrellas, not beach umbrellas. It's been really hot the past few days so umbrellas on the beach are a must! They do have some freebies if you ask for them. Like beach umbrellas, beach chairs, floaties, boogie boards....guests leave them at the hotel and other guests can benefit from them! <just a tip>3) The elevators were sometimes VERY slow. I found myself waiting for elevators the whole week.4) It would have been really nice to have our own bar near the pool. Just a suggestion.5) On Labor Day evening, Lulus must have had a big party because loud and booming music was going on until past 2:30am. It was so freaking annoying! (This wasnt the hotels fault by any means, but the hotel advertises for them and they should have said something that night.) I didnt get any sleep until the music stopped.6) My BIGGEST COMPLAINT was that the hotel television channel said that the hotel offered a complimentary guest room equipped with air conditioning, TV sofa, etc. My flight didnt keave until 6pm! Check out was at noon. I checked out before noon and asked the front desk to use the guest room so I could continue to use the pool and hotel amenities. She told me they DIDNT have a complimentary guest room for me to use! WHAT??? But the hotel television channel..She stops me and says she knows what the TV says. But they dont have one! I told her that I was depending on that room! I just paid $1,200+ to stay here! I was livid! She told me I could still use a towel and use the pool a d could use the bathroom on the 2nd floor to change. Gee. Thanks. Later when I had to take a whiz, I asked for the key and she ended up giving me my room back free of charge. I was totally relieved! Why wasn't this done in the first place? I was still thankful!Pros: This hotel was one of the cheaper hotels I could find so close to Waikiki. This hotel is absolutely in a great location! I couldn't have been more happy with the location! It's close to the beach, the zoo, the aquarium, Starbucks, shopping and so much dining! I enjoyed Lulus which is right next to the hotel even though their music was so loud I couldn't sleep one night. Location was everything for me so this was perfect!The room was really nothing special, but it had everything I needed. My bed was so comfy cozy and my room stayed nice and cool! I got a balcony overlooking Diamond Head, the pool, and the amazing beach view! I was SO impressed with the view! It worth the few extra bucks! The room had a fridge, a safe, and a blowdryer. My room was perfect! I heard others who got a higher level room could see some of the zoo animals, so maybe request a higher room? One thing I loved was the free shampoo, lotion, conditioner, and shower gel by Hawaiian Tropic! Smells just like the sunscreen so this was a treat for me because I love the Hawaiian Tropic smell! I loved the shower. I could tell it was updated! The staff were all very friendly and inviting! The WIFI worked in my room during my whole stay! The pool seemed clean enough to swim and it was so nice to get in on a hot day. There seemed to be plenty of loungers and chair for everyone. The beach view from the pool was incredible. I people watched all day! I would totally stay here again and/or recommend this hotel to my family and friends!

I totally enjoyed my stay here in - would definitely return on my next trip back - from the beginning of checking in all the staff were so helpful & very friendly!!! The room was great & everything was clean & tidy. Away from the hustle & bustle but still close to everything in walking distance - loved it & felt very comfortable & @ home here

Just checked in today - our 3rd time at Park Shore. Lovely staff,friendly & accommodating - nice vibe,across the road from the beach & fairly quiet.Looking forward to a great week.Lulu’s eatery down stairs is a great location too,very convenient & excellent food....

This is not the fanciest hotel but is very good value for money. It’s clean, friendly, well located to the shops and trolley buses. Lulu’s, next door, is great for breakfast with a view - and the hotel pool also has a fabulous view of the beach and the volleyball. The hotel is across the road from a water break area - great for swimming if you have young children or aren’t a confident swimmer.

I am currently staying at The Park Sore Waikiki, I would rate it 5 stars but it just doesn’t have all the amenities, and we did have a few issues, in the end everything is great and I would definitely return. KANA’i at the front desk is an asset to this hotel and turned a not so great situation into a wonderful one!!. The location is amazing and our view as far as I am concerned is the best you can get in Waikiki. See below. I am kamaaina traveling from Maui, I had to fly over for surgery because they don’t do this surgery on Maui. I’m here for a week and wanted a relatively nice place with a lanai and awesome view to recover as I will be spending quite a bit of time inside. I booked the holoholo kamaaina rate directly on the website which waives resort fees and gives you a complimentary one category upgrade based on availability. When I checked in the girls at the front desk were talking to each other but did eventually acknowledge us with a smile after a few minutes. The girl was unfamiliar with the rate, the no resort fee, and the upgrade, and tried to charge me the full amount with no upgrade. She told me “I did not book that rate”. After 10 minutes of convincing (and I had my reservation conf with me in my hand which stated the deal) she finally agreed to waive the resort charge and gave us a partial ocean view room. The view was awesome way more than your typical partial OV, at first glance the room looked like it did on the website, CUTE CLEAN AND BEDS ARE SUPER COMFY! However this particular room was at a strange angle and we had a room 2.5 feet away looking directly into our room when they were on their lanai which they were. We decided we’d be ok and give up the privacy for the awesome view. We walked in the bathroom and there was a giant roach upside down still moving, and brown sticky stuff inside our mini fridge, the fan in the bathroom didn’t work and our screen door would not stay shut unless locked and the AC would keep shutting off. I called the front desk to explain and the the same girl offered to send up housekeeping and engineering. Housekeeping showed up immediately cleaned and apologized and were very sweet. Shortly after engineering showed up and told us that the fan didn’t work because the vent needed to be cleaned but he could not clean it, he said he needed a new strip to fix our screen door to lock. We left for the afternoon and came back 4 hours later and the door was still broken and so was the fan in bathroom. I called down to front desk and got the most wonderful, professional, understanding, kind and full of true aloha young man. **** I WANT TO RATE KANA’i AT THE FRONT DESK 5 STARS******I could hear Kana’i’s smile through the phone. Before I had spoken to him I had spoken with 2 other associates who were ok but not very concerned. Kana’i actually listened to me and his concern was real. I explained about my surgery, and that I just wanted a quiet room with an ok view to recover in. He was beyond understanding, apologetic and really took care of us. I am not just saying this because he apologized and gave us a beautiful room, it was his attitude and his concern and desire to solve the issue quickly.We did arrive early and they did check us in, 95% of the staff are very friendly, the location is the best, beach across street, next to zoo and park, plenty of food options, short walk to the madness of the other end of Waikiki. I would definitely return, wonderful service recovery KANA’i. MAHALO NUI LOA KANA”I

Loved the location, right across from the beach, perfect for pick up and drop off for major attraction and transport. Lots of places to pick up food, and grab a quick bite. Wish the hot water was available in the morning and evenings.

Surprised my husband with his first trip to Waikiki, Honolulu with a stay at the park shore waikiki, and I must say it was a fantastic pick. The location is absolutely phenomenal with a quick walk across the street to the beach at the end of the touristy waikiki strip. Park shore had a few restaurants and an ABC store inside for little items and of course Starbucks just below - so plenty to eat and do. We stayed on the 11th floor and had an awesome view of the beach and pool with a clean, modern room. For those into water activities as us, surfing was easily accessible with the HH surf school/rentals located inside.Shout out to Brian at check in reception for getting us in nice and quick into our beautiful room and giving us and great local recommendations.ONLY disappointment was one fellow at concierge who advised us incorrectly on going to Manoa falls as when we arrived it was closed (and they were advised of the closure via email two days prior because he checked after asked about it....) expensive round trip cab ride. Cant fault an entire hotel for one dudes mistake though. For those who are new to vacationing in Hawaii, keep in mind this is not an "all inclusive" vacation spot, however there are great places to grab food for every budget (holla at mcdonalds for the 15$ beach bundle) All hotels charge daily amenity fees for wifi/pool/etc usage even though they arent actual resorts - park shore charges 25.00usd which is average.All in all, would and will be returning!

Such a cool place to stay, across the road from the beach, really friendly staff who are so helpful, you can see the beach from the swimming pool and watch what is going on while you swim. Lulus is so handy as is Starbucks, hotel shuttle leaves for Ala-Moana shopping center every 1/2 hour. Our room was lovely, housekeeping came every day, we will definitley stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Was very satisfied staying at this hotel. Location was excellent to restaurants, shopping and of course beach across the street. Front desk and staff very friendly. Highly recommend to friends and family. Mahalo Mahalo

This hotel exceeded my expectations! They have the nicest oceanfront views. Ask for room 24 on any of the high floors, they have the best view of the ocean and diamond head. The staff are really friendly and sweet. They had to move us to a different room on our 3rd night because of a (internal) water leak. Nonetheless, we couldn't be happier of this hotel. Free breakfast if you book directly through their website, it is so worth it! Would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

Even though I requested the room as our 25th anniversary many times from November 2017, they assigned the room far from my request. Moreover the stuff didn't give us any explanation about that. Our anniversary should have been the best one....

We stayed here for 2 nights prior to, and 5 nights after, a Hawaiian cruise. The room was very spacious, and the view was fantastic. The counter staff were very friendly and got us into our rooms as soon as they could.

Great loation at the northern end of Waikiki. A little bit away from the hustle and bustle, but witin easy reach.Rooms are a bit basic, but they are clean and comfortable and the airconditioning works (very important).

ProsHotel has great views of ocean and Diamondhead, is across the street from beach, has a lot of shopping in walking distance. The Expedia tours rep (separate from hotel staff) in the main lobby was outstanding - helped us figure out options for Pearl Harbor. Nice staff, especially porters who held our luggage after checkout. Room was clean and had a mini fridge Reasonable nightly rate. ConsLobby furniture is worn and tired. Entry makes you feel like hotel is second rate. New furniture would go a long way. Not a great start to our honeymoon. After traveling from NYC we just wanted a quick shower before going to dinner, but there was no hot water in our bathroom. Management sent up a technician, but he couldn’t fix it, so we were given a new room, and, to their credit, a decent bottle of sparkling wine for our trouble. Unless this hotel was updated, wouldn’t stay here again.

We really lucked out when we chose Park Shore for our visit to Waikiki. The staff was so friendly. The consierge service was great. The accommodations were even better than advertised. We were across the street with a perfect, unobstructed view of the ocean and within walking distance of shopping and dining and the Honolulu Zoo. It was perfect for our second honeymoon in 42 years.

The location was right at the end of the main beach area so if Retail Therapy was in order everything was some distance away. It was looking a bit tired and it lacked atmosphere. One major plus if the beach is your thing it was an easy walk.

Unable to provide the arrangements we booked over 3 months in advance for, no notification, poor quality room, particularly shower did not get hot, bed uncomfortable, elevator extremely slow, hotel management was completely unable to provide a solution or resolve any issue, would never recommend, despite the great location - do not try to save yourself a few bucks by staying here instead of a more reputable hotel

Stayed here in April 2018 for 7 nights. I didnt spend too much time here, only to sleep and shower!! Zoo is right across, plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Waikiki beach right outside the hotel. Definately loved that starbucks was right next to the hotel as im a coffee addict! Room was abit small but other than that it was great! Definately recommend them as they are quite affordable.

Walk through of hotel. Parking is Valet only, anytime. I loved this. Front desk staff was friendly. Tried for an upgrade but 60 more a night. I passed. Elevators were having issues. One was down most of our stay of 9 days. Slowed others down considerable. Pool on third floor. We were on fourth. Ice machine around corner near stairs door on third floor. Easier to walk and get ice. Pool is average. Hotel has sandwitch/juice eatery in lobby. Japanese food. Very Excellent. Then second floor has in house American food. Our friends visited and just 10 bucks to park for 4 hours. Just have to tell them our room number and name. Wife and I had burgers. Just average. ABC convience store access from lobby. Another next to hotel. Freddy burgers next to ABC. Great for late night snack. You get beach towel cards. Beach is just across street. Their is a protective barrier and makes for great swimming with little ones. Even a public shower very close to wash sand off feet. Their is a miniature pier also to walk on. Other place for guests to park is the zoo lot. You can even add time via internet. Zoo a walk away. Hard to compare because we are from San Diego and have annual donor level passes. Maids were very accommodating with our schedule. Got room cleaned at different times each day. Our room had mini frig. Didn't turn on TV. So not comments. Overall great stay for the price and location. I would come back

The is at the very end of the Waikiki strip, across the road from the Zoo. We loved the location and beautiful views from our ocean view room. We were on the 4th floor and had slightly obstructed view because of the clock tower in front, so would suggest you request a room on the 6th floor or above, if you want an completely unobstructed view. Was able to request a kettle to make tea in the room, as the room only provide a coffee percolator.

Reasonably priced for what you get there is an actual balcony you can stand on with table and chairs. Views very lovely. AC needs some help, room stayed muggy. Valet parking among the best priced in area. Close to the beach and park and zoo.

My husband and I searched for months trying to decide on a hotel that would suit our needs. We don't mind the crowds BUT we also didn't want to be in the thick of them either. This was our second trip to Honolulu. The first time, we rented a car and stayed in Kailua in a VRBO. We quickly realized we are NOT VRBO people. We like our privacy, amenities of a hotel, and the ability to walk everywhere to get our food, go to the beach, etc. Having to drive everywhere in Oahu traffic was not something we wanted to experience again. So this time, Park Shore Waikiki fit the bill.We stayed in late Feb-March 6. Park Shore has THE BEST location for us. Not only did our room on the 10th floor have partial ocean views but when we stepped out onto our deck, we were looking at the peaceful Kapiolani Park/Honolulu Zoo grounds. We had treetop views which were stunning at all times of the day. A HUGE shout out to Michelle who put us in our room. We signed up for the Insider email before booking our room online which gave us 10% off the room rate. Part of the perks of the Insider rate is an upgrade upon check in (which Michelle did for us) and a cute little vinyl type bag cooler with a couple granola bars and water bottles. I think there were Hawaiian chips and cookies in there as well. Our vacation was really starting on a high note!! We only encountered a few minor issues that may bother some people but didn't effect us much.1) The room doors slam loudly--we just held ours until it shut in consideration of others2) There is noise from the street but that's to be expected with 2 major roads out front. The beach and park are right there so I just focused on those things3) They have coffee and juice in the lobby--coffee was not very good. The juice was refreshing after being at the beach, pool. However, I found the ABC Store #66 that faced Waikiki Beach (basically it's located in the lobby level of the hotel) had the most delicious self service drip coffee all day long (they had a Signature Blend, Moana Dark and my ADDICTION all week long, Vanilla Macadamia). For a large, it will set you back $1.46!!!! Starbucks is also right outside the hotel but I was happy as a peach with my Vanilla Macadamia.4) No bathroom fans---self explanatory5) There was an "industry night" party during one of the days we were there. Lulu's Waikiki was hosting it and it kept my husband up all night (3-4am). Even with a noisemaker to drown out noise, it was incredibly loud for him. I didn't know anything was happening so I guess it depends on if you're a light sleeper or not.We are already planning a trip back this January. We won't go anywhere else. We know what works for us and it is the Park Shore. We encountered friendly staff and it's location to restaurants, beach, more restaurants, etc is second to none. I also spent time in their pool, which is small, but it's on the 3rd floor level and with great views of the park and the beach so no complaints there. You also get a beach card upon check- in which allows you to check out towels and a small chair for the beach. Just return them and you get a card back for the next day. It was super convenient. Can't wait to return!!!

We had a great corner room (number 1424) with views from our balcony over Waikiki Beach and the Pacific Ocean on one side and Diamond Head on the other. The staff were very friendly and helpful during our 4-day stay. This is an older property which has been nicely furnished and well maintained. The location is perfect with very easy access to the beach and to the many restaurants and shops along Waikiki Beach.

Waikiki was one of the highlights of the trip. The hotel is in a great location and had excellent views of the beach and ocean. The rooms are very comfortable and had everything you expect. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for good quality accomodation.

Nice room excellent location. Very clean and well maintained. Had a few minor hiccups during check in but staff handled it like pros with a smile. Fixed all issues above and beyond our expectations. Opt for the free breakfast if it is available at booking. It makes this hotel an unbelievably good deal. Lulu's has an amazing breakfast. Stay here for beach front on a budget. Trolley stops right next door. Waikiki beach walls across the street offers a good area for swimming with children. Bring water shoes to avoid injury on rocks.

This was my first trip to Hawaii and this hotel made the trip even better. Stayed here twice in ten days due to Island hoping. The staff are great and really helpful. Helped us get taxi’s and buses. Rooms where really comfortable and clean. Our room had a great view. Plus great internet access.Planning to go back to Hawaii and this hotel again.

I visit the island at least once per year for work, and have been doing so for the past 5 years. I always stay at the Park Shore Waikiki due to its location, friendly staff, and overall Hawaiian feel. I highly recommend this hotel.

This is an excellent location! The Back of our room faced diamond head and overlooked the Honolulu zoo, the front of our room faced the famed waikiki beach. Their is an adjacent starbucks, ABC store, healthy food restaurant, and Lulu's. Right around the corner you can catch the pink line for 2 dollars which takes you all over waikiki. Our room was beautiful. In our room were kona coffee and macadamia nut cookies. The bath products smell beautiful-hawaiian tropics. I highly recommend this hotel.

From when we arrived everyone here is friendly! The restaurant we ate in is a Japanese restaurant called Yoshitsune, had great fresh papaya and delicious salmon bento with miso soup! Fresh veggies to go along with the meal! The room we stayed in was pool level so the kids just ran out the sliding door and into the pool!

The view of the oceanfront is incredible. It is one minute walk to Queen's Beach, and above all, the Japanese restaurant Yoshitsune is also wonderful.However, I am disappointed by the unfriendliness of the front staff.

Had a wonderful stay at the hotel. Great location across from beach and and by the zoo and aquariim. Everything you need is within walking distance. Front desk team was amazing from check-in to questions asked. It's a bit older property but rooms are spacious and very clean! And great ocean views!

The hotel is st the quieter end of Waikiki, closer to diamond head. Whilst a lovely 10 night stay and can’t fault the hotel or staff. The only reason I’ve given a 4 star rating and not 5 is that the hotel is a getting a little dated and is probably due for a refurbishment. There is an awesome massive ocean pool in front of the hotel. Everything in Waikiki is in walking distance

Very nice hotel and great location. Positive, professional and helpful staff. We walked across the street to the beach where there is a nice swimming area with all sand. The pool is nice with a view of the ocean, and they have comfortable reclining patio chairs and umbrellas. Our room on the 15th floor had such an awesome view, both of the ocean and of diamond head. It was clean and comfortable with everything we needed. There was a Starbucks on site. Also a convenience store on site that has everything you could possibly need or want. Short walking distance to restaurants, the Catholic Church, International Market Place and tons of shopping. We enjoyed our stay at this very nice, comfortable and clean hotel. The staff was really nice. We would like to return to this hotel again if the management could somehow get rid of the "Monday Night at LuLu's" which has extremely loud music until 2am on Monday nights. Other than that, it's very nice and comfortable.

I was very disappointed when I arrived. On top of already paying for my room at $225.00 per night, when I arrived I was also hit with a $210.00 amenities fee along with a $210 fee for parking my car as they did not have their own parking structure. I understand the valet parking as it was discussed with me before hand. But, the amenities fee was not discussed. This was not in my budget, and I was on my honeymoon. There was no room service, there was no breakfast, which meant we had to go through the Hassel of leaving the hotel every morning for breakfast just to come back when done.  I went swimming, and cut my foot on a rock in the water and was bleeding pretty bad. Came back and asked the front desk for a bandaid, and was told "go to the ABC store and buy your own Band-Aids". My wife and I had leftovers after eating out one night and wanted to eat them for lunch the next day as a way to save money, but there was no microwave in our honeymoon room. I am very disappointed in the service that this hotel provides. They charged me a huge amentity fee, but wouldn't even give me a bandaid. I find that white ridiculous.

Rooms are small and minimalist. Need exhaust fans and AC in bathrooms. Feel like you need a shower after shower. Needs an in room chair. Staff was friendly when spoken to. Housekeeping staff friendly. Beach towel/card system is ridiculous. Recieved embarrassing lecture from front desk for improper use of system ... though we observe other guests doing same thing. Basically you get what you paid for.

On our first night at the hotel, exhausted after a long day of travel to get to Hawaii, we were woken up in the middle of the night by a fire alarm. The hotel had to be evacuated. Not the hotel's fault, but annoying nonetheless. Then, after being let back in the hotel, the fire alarm briefly went off two more times, preventing us from getting back to sleep. "Oh well," we thought. However, the fire alarm was really just a sign of things to come.Throughout the trip, we were CONSTANTLY woken up by loud noises. We knew the hotel would be a bit dated based on other reviews (which it was), but we did not expect the hotel to be so loud. Numerous people on our floor would play music loudly, slam their doors shut over and over, and yell in the hall during the night. You could also hear a ton of noise from the street. Worse, the hotel was not the least bit soundproof -- you could hear everything through the walls and the doors. We could never sleep well due to all the noise, and therefore, we felt terrible throughout our vacation.The noise didn't end there though. On a Monday night, the hotel restaurant/bar (Lulu's) decided to have a DJ with extremely loud music until 2am. Music was blasted and we heard constant screaming people as well. The noise made it impossible to sleep, and several police officers showed up on a couple different occasions throughout the night. We complained to the front desk, but nothing was done. We were told that the bar did turn down the music (which they absolutely did not), that no one else had complained about the noise (even though there is another reviewer who states that they complained about the EXACT SAME THING), and that the bar was just a "vendor" and so the hotel had no control over them (despite the fact that the bar is listed as a restaurant on the hotel website). This DJ night thing apparently occurs every Monday night, so beware!To be fair, when we left one day early, we were not charged for the following night. Additionally, we were able to receive a refund for one night's stay due to the noise. However, this took a lot of arguing with the hotel manager, and it was a small consolation for our vacation being ruined.On top of the incessant noise issues described above, we had other issues as well. The AC in our room rattled and smelled like mold, and we saw cockroaches run across the floor! There was a strange and unpleasant smell in the hotel lobby. One of the three elevators was out of service for the majority of the time that we were there (which is apparently a recurring issue, based on the other reviews). Because of this, it took a long time to get up to our room or down to the lobby, and we overheard several other guests complaining about this same issue. Housekeeping was rather poor, as they did not come to our room at all at times, things were not changed properly, and we found items from previous guests under our bed. Our stay was so bad that we decided to end our vacation a little early and return home. I cannot overemphasize how much of a disappointment the hotel was. Instead of our vacation being relaxing, we were constantly dealing with some type of stress related to the hotel. The only reason I'd recommend walking into the hotel would be to go to the Yoshitsune restaurant, which was delicious. Otherwise, I would never step foot in this hotel again!

This hotel is located on the end of Waikiki strip, right across the street from the Honolulu Zoo. The staff is friendly and the guest rooms are good size. There’s a local restaurant - Hula”s - in the hotel, as well as a Japanese restaurant, a Starbuck’s coffee and a newly renovated ABC Store. The location is great because it’s reasonably quiet because its next to the zoo and in the morning there’s a symphony of chirping birds pearched in the trees of Kapiolani Park just across the street.

You just can't beat the price/location for the Park Shore. Have stayed there 3 times now over the last 12 years and just love it.Across the street from the beach and a park! Great location!Also attached to Lulu's, my personal favorite breakfast spot along the main street.I would go for the Partial Ocean View or above if you can afford it though, as the regular rooms do just look into the hotels next door.

Just left Aug 1st.. we booked our reservation through AAA and Pleasant Holidays...we are on a family vacation and specifically requested 3 rooms that are next to each other..got to Park Shore and were told they didn't have 3 rooms next to each other which I did not believe...no lavender dipped oshibori towels either..no big deal but it was presented to us as such. Beach was great for kids if I had kids i would def come back to Waikiki because of the beach would def stay somewhere else next time. Some front desk people were not so friendly...ignored you while you are standing there. Fees were outrageous and they list complimentary coffee juice and water but that's only til 6 PM each day which wasn't aware to us til we went at 7pm for fresh juice and it was gone. Also pool closes at 7pm each day which is absolutely stupid but pool was afterthought. Beware unless you get an oceanview shore room your view is of balconies of another high rise. Overall I was shocked how dirty Waikiki was bottles all over the beach, bums everywhere..the only reason I would come back is the wall in the ocean makes the waves calm and perfect for little ones!

This hotel was included in a package with a cruise line. We were astounded at the location-right across the street from Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head from the back of the room. It was a nice room, very comfortable and clean and the location was perfect. I would definitely go there again on my own.

We booked 3 rooms with double bed for a party of ten, months before. At our arriving they did not have double bed room available for 2 out of 3 reserved rooms.they say double bed request are consider suggestion and they do not guaranty availability. They upgrade us onto beach and partial beach view. For the first night we end up having 2 teenager sleeping on cot bed and none couple adult sharing bed. The second and third night we were move into double bed room. Very poor service after 15 hours flight. but there were simply no more double room available at our late evening arrival 10 pm.

Loved the staff, location, and amenities. I’m a concierge on Maui. I’ve stayed all over Waikiki this has been one of the best stays. Location was at the end we had and incredible view of Diamond Head, the Zoo, and ocean. Was well equipped with variety of restaurants the only thing missing was a hot tub but that was not necessary for us.

Great location across the street from the beach. Everything is within easy walking distance. Only downside was that I was there on business and the internet was slow and not reliable. The concierge desk was extremely helpful and we loved the excursions he suggested! Hotel itself is older and the rooms seemed slightly dated, but the bed was very comfortable! I would stay here again! Mahalo

This is a decent hotel in a prime location. Staff is nice. Rooms are small, but you're not in Hawaii to stay in your room.ONE BIG CATCH. When checking in we were hit with a $210 "amenities fee" for our week's stay. I said I had never heard of this fee and was told "It's in the fine print when you get your email confirmation."I asked what the amenities fee covered and was handed a printed page of explanation (I'm assuming they get this question a lot so keep these copies handy) ... It actually list things like an ice machine as an amenity. By the way, this fee is in addition to paying $29 a night if you want to park your car.The parking fee is expensive, but this is Waikiki and they disclosed the fee when I made my reservation. But the surprise amenity fee didn't sit well with me. When I communicated my feelings, the staff member told me to take it up with corporate. Won't be staying here again.

We stayed at Park Shore Waikiki in May as part of our honeymoon. We received excellent service from the friendly reception staff throughout our stay, nothing was too much trouble. Definitely recommend an ocean view room. Great location at the end of the ‘strip’ with lots of lovely restaurants fairly nearby.

We booked a partial ocean view room and if you book one of these ask for it to be on the Diamond Head side of the hotel otherwise you could be looking straight out at another high rise hotel. The view from this room was pretty good (we were on Diamond Head side) However when we first walked in to the room we were a little bit disappointed in its lack of appeal. Quite small, the bathroom floor needs replacing and peeling paint around the door handle of the bathroom. All in all still adequate. After two nights we were moved to an Ocean Front Room due to a flood occurring somewhere nearby. This room was much better, larger and not in need of repair. We were very happy with this room.The hotel provides free beach towels and beach chairs. They also have a free return shuttle to Ala Moana Mall. Free coffee is available in the hotel foyer between 6.30am and 11am. Then free juice (watered down) from 11am to 6pm. There are free newspapers daily, outside the lifts on each floor. Toiletries are provided but no shower cap, so bring one if you need it. On Wednesday they have free drinks and snacks by the pool at 4pm.The hotel is is a good location with the beach just across the road and it is a nice beach, less crowded than further up towards town.

Great pricing, great location, everything easy access to shopping, to foodie places, fantastic views from the rooms, friendly and helpful staff, pool excellent. Thoroughly recommend Park Shore Waikiki.

So I've been coming here for the last 10-+ years. But tonight changed my choice. On a Monday night/Tuesday morning they had the loudest party in the restaurant I have ever heard. It made the walls of my room shudder. I called the front desk at 1:15am to ask when it ended and they said 2am. Really? They said they would notify the party and ask them to turn down the volume. Twice! Do you think that happened? Of course not. I have seen at least 15 police cars and an ambulance off my balcony. It's 2:20am and there are still hoards of loud drunks yelling and police cars down below. I will pay more next time to be someplace where I can sleep!

The rooms are old and tired need to be remolded. The smell of mold was coming from air conditioning the views and location were good. The staff was pleasant enough and the location to diamond head was right out the back

The hotel is in the end of Waikiki beach and the beaches in this area is not so crowded. Seawiev from the suites are fantastic. Very friendly and relaxed hotel. We really enjoyed our stay. Restaurants and shop is in the building.

The hotel located sea shore, the beach view in room very good and their other service also very good.the hotel located very near to the waikiki beach HONOLULU. beach towel available complimentary.best hotel for beach activities.reasonable price their restaurant.

Park shore Waikiki is a good place to stay. Your at the end of the main strip near a park, and just a walk across the road to some amazing beaches and swell to try your hand at surfing or using a boogie board. They can be hired on the beach directly across the road. We had and ocean view room with a balcony. We spent several hours here just watching the world go by. So much happening. It was worth the extra money for this room.The beds were comfortable, but we had some issues with the hot water during our stay. The first night we were there we only had cold water available. Other nights the water sometimes was luke warm. The front desk seemed to be aware of an issue but were not very concerned or helpful. A very disappointing start to our stay.The other downside of this hotel, is that they do not provide a guest laundry where you can do your washing yourself. You need to walk to laundromat 10 minutes away. The hotel room had a safe and bar fridge, with an ice machine on selected floors.Overall the location is good, but better service and some modern revamps to the rooms would be appreciated.

This property is at the quieter end of Waikiki and the sand and surf is amazing. The views are fantastic and you can hear the waves at night. great local dining. Lulus restaurant for sunset is awesome and direct access from the hotel. Pool area has views of the beach and Diamond Head

Our experience with the front desk on arrival wasn’t the best but other than that it is a great family option. We particularly liked the rooms on level 3 as you get a great space around the pool and you get the pool all to yourself after 6pm. Rooms have been upgraded recently and the location and price is great for a family.

The comforts of home away from home with a brilliant staff who create an atmosphere of Aloha! The property and facility is perfect and accessible to all that we wanted to enjoy. Our mini summer vacation getaway was amazing and memorable. The friendly and courteous staff created an environment that will bring us back again!

We had a large family group and had reserved 2 rooms, double beds. Arrived and staff gave us rooms that were one king in each. Returned downstairs and staff said to us (and to others also checking in) that they had not gotten our room preferences, which was not accurate as I had checked. After a few minutes, they gave us 2 correct rooms on the same floor but not near each other. The rooms were very nice, clean and had a great view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. The pool was very clean and towels were always available. We paid a $50 a day amenities fee but really did not use anything. We were too busy out in Honolulu to watch tv or movies. We used the ABC store several times that is off the lobby. Room was quiet and air conditioning was just right. Would stay here again. The location can't be beat!

Comfortable rooms with nice views in a great location.The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel could use more amenities you would expect to find in a hotel in a vacation location. Having a gym, laundry facility, and coffee bar and grill would be a big improvement on the overall facility.

Stayed four nights in Waikiki, and as per my rating, it is an average hotel. I certainly can't rate it as "very good" or "excellent". Our room on the 10th floor was quiet, and so we had good quality sleeps. Overall the room is basic, and our view was of the neighbouring hotel. If you went out on the small lanai, and looked left, you could see the ocean between the two buildings. I really don't like the daily $25 resort fee, as I'm not sure what you get with that. We didn't use the pool, and other than a beach towel service, I think it's a bit of a scam done by a number of Waikiki hotels. Coffee maker as part of the resort fee - please give me a break. So average rating, the staff were pleasant enough, and we slept well, but this is a basic hotel overall.

Don't stay here, the furnishings in the foyer are old and and stained, as the carpet was. Unhelpful staff,had hoped the room would be better. It was so smelly, old and unclean. I was shocked when I walked in. No bench in the bathroom. Again, stains all over the carpet.Not even a spoon ! Bedding all old, not fresh at all.Curtains didn't close properly, very poor lighting. One lamp was broken. It was so neglected. Tried to change rooms. I was just told, we are full. Staff didn't care. Nightclub downstairs at night. Very hard to sleep. Then on check out you are hit with an obscene amenities fee. Stay anywhere but here.

This is a top notch hotel, from the staff to the room and location. A bit overpriced, but it is Waikiki. Clean rooms with breathtaking views of the oceans Diamond Head. I can’t say enough of how much our whole family loved the Park Shore Waikiki. We can’t wait to go back next year.

This hotel is located at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, with a fantastic view from the room. The hotel staff were very helpful and the room was extremely comfortable. We enjoyed being near the beach and away from the hectic Waikiki area. Will definitely stay here again.

We found the Park Shore Waikiki turned out to be an excellent choice. It is located directly across the street from the beach, which we could also watch from the balcony of our room ... as well as the pool and Diamond Head. You can then either walk along the beach of sidewalk all along the Waikiki area or jump on the City Bus ($2.75 one-way or $5,50 for an all day pass which will take you anywhere; and depending on thw bus you take the most you have to walk is one block. While the room was not huge, we spent little time there and most of that we was on our balcony, Staff excellent and upgraded us at no charge. These a a good, open-air restaurant with excellent views of teh beach and sunsets.

Couldn’t ask for a better location. As it is directly opposite the zoo it doesn’t feel so crowded as you look out over a park. It is a quick walk across the road to the beach and easy to drive to via Kapahulu Avenue. Staff were helpful and friendly.

Poor customer service very unwelcoming front desk. The decor is dated and the location is right at the end of the strip. The lift/elevator is from the 80s and takes a few minutes to arrive and if you are on the top floor it is a real pain.

Front counter staff were not friendly and helpful but the bell service and security men were very friendly and happy to help and chat. Hotel needs updating the pool umbrellas were all broken and the foyer furniture looked dirty and needs refreshing.

We stayed at the Park Shore as it was on the beach and it was fairly priced. As soon as we arrived, we felt comfortable, the foyer area is relaxing and not overbearing and the staff were friendly. I must say the macadamia chocolate nuts that were handed to us at check in were very welcome, as they were delicious. Our room was large and had a view of the pool area and Waikiki Beach, what more could you ask for, we were over the moon. If you like to walk along the beach, then this is the place for you, as you cross the road and you are on the beach. We walked the strip most nights, but as you will find there are many places to eat and drink in Waikiki. The hotel is quiet considering it is Waikiki, but what makes it a winner is that it is at the end of the strip, Go ahead and stay at the Park Shore, you will thoroughly enjoy it.

This hotel located at the quieter north end of the beautiful Waikiki beach.Unfortunately the condition of the premises is very disappointing. From the moment you enter the lobby of the hotel you realize that the place is dated and tired. The carpets and furniture are old and stained. Not a nice welcome.The room is quite specious and looks better then the lobby.The overriding problem in Waikiki is obviously the very high cost of accommodation. So this hotel maybe a more modestly priced alternative, as long as you are happy to accept the drawbacks listed earlier.

Out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Wake to ocean, diamond head, and the zoo, & Kapiolani park Food, services all there. Shopping short stroll. Beach pier and contained swimming area right across the street.

I have stayed at this hotel before over 8 years ago. To come back and see the upgrade to this hotel. AMAZING! I love that it is across the street from the beach (literally right across the street). During my stay, Jaden Smith (Actor Will Smith's son) came to the surf shop in this hotel for lessons. Clean and open. I recommend this hotel. I will be back again.

This hotel must have one of the best locations - right on the beach, at the far eastern end of Waikiki, with a beautiful unobstructed view of the coast and Diamond Head crater. It could be so good - and its slightly pretentious lobby suggests it will be - but the accommodation has more in common with a cheap motel. Yes, various shades of orangey brown, with plenty of tacky synthetic fabric - which thankfully we could ignore by stepping out onto the balcony which had a stupendously good view. The corridors had more in common with a prison. Why? When it could be the most desirable spot in Honolulu? It was reasonably comfortable, but given we paid in the region of $675 for two nights, it should have been. We spent much of our time in the hotel thinking how lovely we could make it if we owned it...which is not really the idea. Lulu's Bar, the main food/drink outlet is ok - there are great views of the beach if you sit at the front, but it is more industrial dining, rather than thoughtfully prepared food. Breakfast is big - one between two is fine - but despite being in the US's only tropical state, the orange juice was straight out of a can. Overall, could do so, so, so much better.

We have just returned to Australia after spending 15 days in Hawaii ( first time in Hawaii). I am so pleased we chose to stay at Park Shore. The location is fantastic- not as busy as further down the street, however, everything such as shops, restaurants, and beach activities are still close by and easy to walk too.
