Further, the ocean, garden and Diamond Head views are absolutely stunning.We stayed in a suite, it was so beautiful! The room living area, bathroom, and bedroom were large, beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable. The heated toilet seat was a lovely bonus novelty!I particularly loved how the hotel didn't try to gauge more money out of you for beach chair hire, a lovely surprise. There was also always plenty of shade and available lounge chairs at the pool area. The pool area was not the most dramatic and aesthetic compared to some of the pools at hotels we stayed. Also because there is no restaurant or catering at the hotel you could not order snacks or drinks to enjoy poolside. But really the beach is amazing and just a stone throw away, with either garden grass area to sit on ( if you hate sand) or sand areas to sit at, so this is the preferred place to for swimming.The reception staff and concierge were extremely friendly and helpful whilst retaining a casual disposition, always giving a smile and a friendly wave.Oh, and by the way don't be put off by the foyer. Personally, upon arrival, I thought it looked a little tired. For example stained carpet in areas. The day we arrived we one lift wasn't working and there was broken furniture under the stairway. This was all fixed within 12 hours of us staying there. We are already talking about going back to Hawaii and will definitely stay at Park Shore again!

Property is everything you will love! Right across the street from the beach. Steps from restaurants, shops & Starbucks! Plus the zoo is across the street. Staff is friendly & helpful on all occasions. I use the stairs and every time the staff had to unlock stairs for me and never any issues.

I enjoyed my stay at the Park Shore my room was great. At my first view of the ocean was awesome and people friendly. I enjoyed all the sights and food. I would recommend the Duke restaurant to everyone. The only thing I would recommend that the shower pressure changing when showering was a little nerving I thought I would get burned or cold water would come out. I understand with so many people taking showers at the same time mayi difficult to change. Thank you again for the wonderful experience.

Flew from Vegas to Honolulu - Hawaiian Airlines are just so nice, they really look after you. Could not believe how old the airport is - but it did not take long to get our bags and away to our hotel. We are so pleased that we stayed at this hotel. We had a room on the 18th (Top) Floor, overlooking the Zoo and the beautiful Diamond Head. The room was a nice size and we had a small kitchen area, with coffee maker, microwave and fridge. The bathroom was small but adequate and the bed extremely comfortable - more so than the Bellagio in Vegas. It was about a 10 to 15 min walk to the centre of Waikiki where there are lots of very large hotels. Waikiki is very clean but we were shocked by how many homeless people there are, but then when we went on the Island Tour it was explained to us how expensive it is to live there. Visited Peal Harbour, very humbling seeing the Arizona Memorial and a great experience going aboard the Mighty Mo (USS Missouri). The weather in Hawaii can be changeable, we had some rain and a lot of cloud. Not sure if this was because of the Volcano erupting on the main Island which was around 100 miles away. As in Vegas food and drink is rather expensive but we had a lovely meal at the Surfriders Hotel to celebrate my birthday and the staff really made a fuss. If you like walking - you must walk to the top of Diamond Head, what a sight, it can be a bit dodgy underfoot in places and you have to walk through a tunnel nearer to the top which is not so nice when there are lots of people going each way. Get there early to avoid the crowds but more so the heat. Make sure you have a drink with you too. I would like to visit Hawaii again but maybe try a different Island.

We stayed here for 4 nights as a couple at the end of a 16 day trip to 3 islands. We had stayed our first 5 nights in another hotel, which was closer to the centre of Waikiki. Consequently, it was very busy out on the street at night. This hotel is located across the road from Waikiki beach and across the road from the lush, beautiful Queen Kapiolani Park. This is a great location and quieter than our previous hotel. The Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium are a 5 minute walk from here. We had a room on the 6 th floor with a part view of the beach, the park and Diamond Head. Perfect. The rooms are smallish but adequate and have a balcony. Ours overlooked the good sized pool. The hotel staff were friendly and courteous. Beach chairs and towels are available from reception. An ATM is located in a corner of the lobby. There is an ABC shop for basic grocery items and Tucker and Bevy at the base of the hotel- very convenient to grab some healthy breakfast and lunch food options. We would happily stay here again, a good reasonably priced hotel in a quieter location than some others.

Cheapest ocean view we found. Older building and small rooms. Tiny bathrooms. LuLu's isn't that good, but Hans surf lessons are great (Hans was there with us). The down stairs services are pretty sparse and we didn't try the sushi. They gave us a nice bottle of champagne for our anniversary and some macadamia nuts. Asked for a restaurant recommendation of the front desk and didn't really get a knowledgeable response. If you're expecting 5 star concierge then go else where. If you are out doing activities and eating out and come back to sleep and wake up with nice view and good coffee, then this is a good value. If you are renting a car this place is great because of the zoo parking across the street. It is about 10-15 minute walk to Central Waikiki.

The hotel was very good. Room was clean with a great bed and ocean view with a balcony. Right across from the ocean. Lots of good restaurants and easy transportation via taxi, shuttle or bus/trolley. Didn't eat in the restaurant but did buy from the small take out area.

Stayed for four nights in January, booked through travel agents so wasn't sure what to expect. Its lovely, very clean and tidy, nothing is to much trouble for the staff. Its right by Diamond head, opposite the beach. Staff were only to happy to sort transport out and give advise. Definitely recommend
user_name:
Becky S
Birmingham, England, United Kingdom

review_body: The Park Shore is located 3-4 mins walk from the beach and very central to some great Waikiki spots. We really enjoyed the casual atmosphere as we walked along the beach, frequenting bars and shops along the way. Reasonably priced hotel and would recommend staying there at the right price.

1st thought was the Lobby was nice so the room had to be nice, well it wasn’t the best but it wasn’t bad, rooms was small and not roomy I was traveling with husband and daughter. Bathroom didn’t have vents but seemed to be upgraded but still small . We was given a upgrade which wasn’t on then 3rd floor which opened to the pool area which was ok pool was average sized with a good view and the 2nd floor was linked to a restaurant which was nice also (overpriced). I was disappointed that no laundry service was available. Hotel is in good location and across the street from beach Starbucks and other shops and park and zoo. Oh yea no microwave and very small fridge and the vending machine wasn’t filled. Overall I would stay again for the location and view. Oh yea I received fresh towels and a clean bed every day which was plus for me

I thought this hotel was great, until I got home and found they’d charged my credit card a second time for the accomodation some days after I checked out. After the hotel insisting at check-in on a hold on my card for far in excess of the entire cost, lying by saying the credit card company makes them do it, then charging my card again later, I would never trust them again.

Nice place to stay, clean and close to beach and zoo. Lots of places near by to eat. Swimming pool beautiful and always clean. Buses close by so up can use public transportation. Friendly staff and great room service

Arrived 10am was informed offical checkin time is 3.30pm but then offered a room if we pay $90. No explanation of where we could change or freshen up. Front desk staff were actually quite rude. We went away for a few hours came back at 2pm room still not ready then sat and watched others checkin. Positives about this hotel us the location. Waking distance to shops and restaurants. Across the road from the beach, and down the quiet end of Waikiki. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Not kettle in room but if you ask for one it will be provided.

As a former Island resident, I was aware of it's terrific location, close to beach activities, and zoo, and free shuttle to Ala Moana center. Also the free internet was used as well. would recommend it to all people looking for a great deal.

Last hotel on strip of hotels on Waikiki beach next to the park. Small quiet partial ocean view room with balcony. Nice big TV. Fridge no microwave. AC blew ice cold directly on to bed. Walk to aquarium ,shops, restaurants. Be prepared to add $50 a day plus tax and tip for resort fee and valet only parking. Not bad for the money for the location.

This hotel has what I would consider the best views of Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head. The minute we walked through the door into our ocean front room it was evident that this was a place you could sit and watch sunrises and sunsets, and with great views of the beach and views across the gardens to Diamond Head (not distant views like other hotels). It was my husband’s 60th birthday and they had a bottle of champagne and chocolates in the room when we checked in; very kind and thoughtful of the hotel staff. The concierge staff were very attentive, along with the Bell Boys/Girls. On the seventh floor we only had to walk past a few rooms to get to the ice machine. The bed was comfortable, the balcony was a great place to watch people on the beach and the streets and the bath was a great way to relax after a day of touring/swimming/shopping. The room was cleaned daily. I can’t comment on the programs on the TV as we never put it on, except on arrival which had a welcome message for us. Having a shuttle to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre was a plus – no taxi fees and a phone ap that will show you where the shuttle is so that you can estimate what time it will be at the bus stop. All hotels have amenity rates, taxes ect (that you don’t normally pay for in Australia as a separate cost), which you have to expect, although when searching for a hotel I found their fees to be one of the cheapest. People comment that the pool is small but very few people use it and it does get a lot of sun (although we preferred to be on the beach as opposed to the pool). Whilst the rooms are a little ‘tired’ (need to be ‘refreshed’ a little and the pool needs a little attention); if you are going for ‘price, location, views and service’ I am not sure any other hotels could beat it which is why I have given it a 5-star rating. Would I come back here again – absolutely – it is away from the other end of town which is very busy and noisy but still any easy walk to many restaurants, shops and hotels and with a view like this you can’t go past it. Also an ABC shop is next to the hotel where you can buy a wide variety of food and drink and put in the fridge in the room (there is no mini bar in the room) , as well as purchase souvenirs and clothes. Definitely worth staying here as opposed to the more expensive hotels that cannot give you the same views.

We had 4 days in Waikiki at the end of our Hawaiian holiday. we chose Park Shore because it wasn't right in the middle of Waikiki. Park Shore is at the end of the main strip, opposite 2 great beaches. One is surrounded by a sea wall which makes it perfect if you have children &/or you are not confident in the surf. Short walk to the shops etc.We stayed in 1807 top floor corner room. Views directly to the ocean from one window & from the balcony 180 degree views from the ocean, diamond head & the mountains. It is opposite the zoo & we could watch the pink flamingoes around the pond & hear the animals. Overall we enjoyed our stay & will stay again.

Location. Location. Location. This place is located in an awesome spot. Directly across the beach. Several restaurants nearby and close to shopping. We didn't rent a car and were fine. We had an ocean view room with a balcony that looked down onto the pool and you could see the beach across the street which was beautiful. The door we entered the room from was outside with a motel type entrance but that view was beautiful as well because you could see Diamond Head off in the distance if you ignored the other buildings to the left. We were in room 421. We were near the elevators but never heard any noise. We could go down one level to the third floor to access the ice machine that was also located outside. Because of the motel type entrance, I did notice some ants and bugs got in the room but nothing bad. We were able to get free water from the lobby each day so make sure to bring a thermos or water bottle. We were also able to borrow beach towels for our beach day. The lagoon across the street has a protective barrier so it perfect for families with young children. My six year old and I had a great time playing there. I did the 90 Day Advance purchase so I was able to get a great rate. The room fit our needs and is a great option if you don't need a hotel with a ton of bells and whistles.

We stayed at this hotel based on the pricing and reviews found online. While the price was right, the reviews for this hotel are curious. Most were above average, something that this hotel is not. The area of the hotel is on a nice section of beach and close to the zoo however; the atmosphere around the hotel is on the "low-end". You get a lot of open drug use and the "down on your luck" seem to surround the hotel. With the open lobby, we didn't feel safe leaving our teenage daughter in the area and even coming back up to the hotel room felt sketchy at night. The hotel front-end staff were less than friendly and gave bad advice and directions on more than one occasion. The housekeeping staff were always friendly and made sure to say Hello each morning and offer a warm smile, very nice. The room was clean but the mattresses were absolutely horrible. Caved in middles and musty smells. Not good. If you can afford a few more dollars, it's worth it to move yourself more to the middle of the Waikiki "Strip".

The Park Shore Waikiki is not flashy, but provides a good location on the beach. Rooms are clean and as we were paying a low rate, we had just a tiny view of the ocean. But this hotel is right across the street from the ocean, and also across the street from a park containing the zoo and aquarium. Great walks emanate in both directions down the beach after just a walk across the street. Also handy is the Starbucks off the lobby which opens at 4:30AM, making jet lag a little more bearable in the morning.....coming from the East coast. People at the desk were most helpful with the bus schedules as well as locations to visit. Yes, it’s not flashy, and lobby furniture is a bit worn, but this is a friendly, comfortable hotel with an Hawaiian flare.

We stayed a Park Shore Waikiki from 5/28/18 to 6/2/18. Mixed reviews had me a little worried about what our experience would be here. First impression of the lobby was that it didn't quite measure up to the pictures. We had two rooms, first was a king Ocean View and the second was a two doubles Ocean Front. The king room was tiny...reminded me of NYC. Room with two doubles was much larger. We weren't "wow-ed" by the rooms, but they were clean, comfortable, and functional. Paying an average rate of $250 a night (with airline package) can make for higher expectations, but that rate is probably slightly below the average Waikiki rate and probably much lower than the oceanfront Waikiki rate, which you get from this property.As others mentioned, location was PERFECT! Quiet at night. Great views of the beach and Diamond Head. Enjoyed the Barefoot Beach Cafe down the road for an affordable beachfront breakfast each morning. Tucker and Bevvy (attached to lobby) was also good to grab quick food and head out the door. Lulu's (second floor) has great views and sports if your team is playing (Golden Knights were playing...), but food was mediocre for the price. Queens beach across from the hotel had the most space and pretty good snorkeling.Park Shore turned out to be a pretty good option for oceanfront waikiki. If it is in your price range, give it a shot!

Fabulous views from this hotel. Though not very big, the Ocean View room was very comfortable with good amenities. The staff are very helpful friendly and the property is in a perfect location with many options nearby for meals. The only disappointment is the pool area where there are not enough lounges, not much greenery and generanot very inviting.

To be fair we had a wonderful beachjust across the road.The housekeeping staff lost my pyjamas, as they were white like the sheets, which get changed every 3rd day,something I didn't realise until it was too late. Also a standard room can never be upgraded unless you pay $60 extra

Loved the hotel and staff - from the front desk to the surf shop and the restaurants. Room and Hotel was clean, great location. Go to Lulu's! We will be back and will stay here again, thoroughly enjoyed he hotel and location

My mum was turning 60, so we decided what better way to do so then to go to Hawaii! Her number 1 must have was a nice hotel with a beach front view. This hotel certainly delivered with that!The rooms were comfortable, clean and just what we needed. A few minor things including the really noisy air conditioning and some street noise but other than that we have no complaints.Would definitely stay here again :)

We stayed for 11 nights and were very happy with our choice. The Park Shore is in the perfect location...across the road from the beach and the zoo and beautiful parklands. Lulu's and a Japanese restaurant on site, starbucks and an ABC store out the front, another ABC out the back (we favoured this one). Front desk staff (especially Michelle) were very helpful. After emailing, our friend was given the room next tour ours. Expedia booking desk was handy and booked us on a couple of tours. Rooms a little on the small side and a bit dated but comfortable enough. Beds good but if you find feather pillows hard to sleep on you may find a foam one in the wardrobe that is softer. Coffee maker in the room but as a tea drinker I needed an electric jug.. no problem.. a few minutes after calling housekeeping it was delivered, along with some teabags. Fridge worked well thankfully as hotel only supply powdered whitener (yuk), milk available at ABC store (along with anything else you might need). We were in a standard room on the 5th floor and if we stood on the balcony and looked left we could see a sliver of the ocean. We didn't have time to use the pool but you can borrow beach towels from the front desk and we took some on our island day tour. The only downside I would say was the noise from the aircon/ventilation systems from our hotel and the one nextdoor... if we left the balcony door open we couldnt hear the tv.. a higher floor may lessen this. A chair to sit on instead of the stool would be nice as sitting on the bed to watch tv gets uncomfortable. Easy walk to shopping and restaurants and the aquarium, free shuttle to Ala Moana Mall and a bus stop right out the front. A great place to stay.

We’ve only had two nights in Waikiki this trip, to break up our journey home from California and I was keen to try the Park Shore. (We've had the pleasure of visiting Waikiki many times.) They sent me an email reminding me of my booking a couple days before, as many hotels do, but they worded it so well. Saying get excited, etc! And you know what? I *was* excited!Unfortunately, the hotel was lacking when we arrived. We were told we had been ‘upgraded’ to an oceanfront room but when we got inside the room it was a slightly depressing twin single bed room. I called the desk and said I’d booked a King room, and they said there was nothing they could do. After pressing to speak to a Manager, and having to practically beg, we were given a King room with a partial ocean view which we thought actually had a better view and was a little less depressing.Of course on booking the Park Shore, we knew we weren't booking a luxurious resort where we could laze our days away poolside with a cocktail in hand however the hotel in general and the rooms in particular were shabbier than I was expecting. The bed was lumpy and uncomfortable, the refrigerator didn't work, and the shower pressure was awful. The pool isn't great, but a couple of minutes on the Internet can also tell you that. The resort fee was weird - not sure what that is covering.On the positive? The hotel is in a great position at the end of Waikiki, and right opposite the beach. Lulu's downstairs is a great restaurant/bar. I liked the Hawaiian Tropics amenities, that's a cute touch and the view from our partial ocean view was exceptional, from Diamond Head to the ocean and it was certainly the room's redeeming factor.Would we stay again? Probably not, but I'll add a disclosure; I believe I had the misfortune of significantly overpaying for this room, judging by other reviews and searches of the hotel since then. I'm not quite sure what happened as I was comparing the hotel to 2 or 3 others we've stayed at before that were within the ballpark of their regular prices.

Stayed here for 13 nights in May. From the time we arrived to the time we left all the staff were fantastic and super helpful. We stayed in a ocean view room and had a fantastic view of beach. Room was clean and reasonable size. Bed was comfortable. Air con was awesome after being out in the heat. Pool area was clean and tidy. Right across from beach and close to lots. Lulu's is really yummy and so is Tucker Bevey. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks to Park Shore staff for making our holiday awesome.

No complaints with this hotel. We had a wonderful unobstructed view of the beach and Diamond Head. The beach towel and beach chair service was an excellent idea. We could literally walk right across the street to the beach. Easy walking access to lots of restaurants and shopping. Valet parking was very easy and quick. Room was comfortable (bed slept great) and balcony was great. Zoo was right across the street and aquarium is easy walking distance. Would definitely stay here again if in Waikiki.

We have just returned from spending 6 nights at Park Shore. If you're looking for a luxurious resort where you can laze your days away by the pool with a cocktail, this is not the hotel for you. If you're looking for a well located comfortable bed to return to after your daily adventures in Oahu, then Park Shore may be perfect.Park Shore is located at one corner of Waikiki beach which makes it close enough to the action but probably a bit quieter than if you stayed in the middle of it all. The pool area isn't great - very small, dated and overlooking a busy intersection - not exactly a tranquil environment. But the beautiful ocean is just across the road and there's so much to see and do in Hawaii that if you're spending every day by the pool, you're doing it wrong!We had an ocean front room, which was lovely (and worth the extra money). We also had a great view of Diamond Head from the entrance to our room. The rooms themselves are dated and a bit on the small side, but again - this doesn't matter when you're spending your days out and about. It's an old hotel, but it would be easy for them to make some small improvements - an extra towel rack in the bathroom (one that doesn't hang over the toilet) would have made a big difference and a shelf under the bathroom sink to keep your toiletries on would also be good and make the bathroom more functional. But they are minor things. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and the staff were friendly. The wifi was fast and worked well throughout the hotel. There was also free coffee in the lobby until 11am each morning and water/juice all day. Like other reviewers, I do question the resort fee, but this seems to be a thing at every hotel we looked at in Hawaii.Bottom line - everything in Hawaii is expensive. Park Shore was a clean, convenient and more affordable option for us so that we had more money for tours and activities, which is where our priorities were. I would happily stay there again.

So glad to have picked the Park Shore Waikiki. Its location at the quiet end of the beach by the zoo is ideal, easy to walk to everything else but more scenic and less crowded. The restaurants in the building are excellent and others nearby are good as well. You can walk to the zoo and aquarium as well as everything else in Waikiki. Choosing a shore view room is well worth it; we had a two-sided view including both beach and Diamond Head.

Excellent location and our ocean front room had a fantastic, unobstructed view of the water and of Diamond Head. Yes the hotel is older/dated, but it is very well maintained and is very clean and tidy. Staff are friendly and helpful. There are amenities such as ice machines, vending machines and even a microwave in the communal area near the pool. Housekeeping did a fantastic job. I wouldn't bother with paying for 'breakfast included' next time as there are so many options of places to eat within a couple of minutes' walk. Pool is older and not especially large but again very clean and tidy with a view out to the ocean. We did hear some noise from Lulu's on the Monday night when they had a DJ but we were only affected one night out of 8. Would recommend Park Shore and I'll be staying here again.

This hotel is in the quieter end of Waikiki Beach. It is right on the beach, and opposite Honolulu Zoo. Room was very comfortable and quiet. The free shuttle bus was very handy in getting around. Check in and out was really easy and the staff were very pleasant.

First time to Honolulu and felt that we should stay in Waikiki. The room smelled somewhat musty. Beds comfy, shower pressure was great. I did like how the location was on the far end of Waikiki. The beach itself—a lot of homeless people. The drive to the hotel—very beat down shady areas. Just be aware of that. Never felt unsafe but was surprised how beat up some of the areas were. Free coffee in lobby as well as free juices. Went to the Abc store next door and got $2 bottles of rum to mix with the free juices. Pool was very clean, albiet small. Most likely would stay there again if we go to Waikiki Beach..otherwise I recommend staying on the East side of the island

Wonderful place to stay just out of the mainstream though still walking distance to downtown. Found our room and service excellent with an outstanding view of the beach and Diamond Head. Had no trouble parking the fental car we had as we used the zoo arking across the road at $1 an hour.

There was a bar next to the Hotel, the food was good and lots of it, the drinks were expensive. The sea looked inviting (but I can't swim) and fun looking at the surfers. There were plenty of buses to jump on and off.

my wife and i came on a three day trip, I found this motel on a web search, just kept looking, then i looked on google maps... long story short, just what the doctor ordered... great location, great staff, no problems, older building but everything was satisfying unless you expect more than offered... the food was great at LULU'S I will stay here again in Sept 2019 when we return to see how he later part of the year is... we loved it in May of this year 2018...

Loved the location and view from our ocean view balcony. Only downside was the addition of $28/day for valet parking. But the valets were great, fast, friendly, and on the job 24/7 for those of us with early flights. Room was a little dated but that was not a problem.

The hotel room was clean but tired looking. We were situated on the side of the building facing another hotel so didn’t have a view of the ocean. However, it was very quiet considering the location. The pool was small and unfortunately when it got crowded no chaises were available. Location was great. Right across from Waikiki beach and walking distance to restaurants and shopping. Also right across from the hotel was the zoo and a lovely park. For the adventurous, a hike up the mountain from the hotel was possible

This hotel is great value for money, the location is perfect, close to the action of Waikiki, and also close to local eateries away from the main strip. The standout for this hotel is it's view of the green parkland as well as the ocean, much better than a view of another high rise. Staff were always helpful.

We paid a bit extra for an ocean view and were glad we had. It was stunning. The room was clean, comfortable and a good home for our week there. It is not the newest or most updated hotel, but we were quite comfortable there.

Having emailed the hotel about our 15 day stay 2 days before we arrived and asked for a high room we were dismayed to learn it was not acted upon. We had booked a full ocean view room to celebrate a 50th birthday. We were put on floor 5 - we would have seen more ocean had the room pointed the opposite way.After bitter complaint we were moved to floor 9 which was much better.Twice during the stay our room was not made up. Again the subject of bitter complaint.The hotel is at the very end of Waikiki near the zoo. It is on a busy intersection. It is very very noisy even 9 floors up. Also this is where all the crazies gather. There is begging shouting and hassle every day & nobody will do anything about it. Indeed the homelessness around Waikiki will shock non Americans.A lot of staff do their best but seem to be let down by inept management.The rooms are ok but small.Prices all over Waikiki are a rip off - my tip - decide how long you want to come for - halve it and spend the same amount of money in that shorter time. You will know what I mean when you get here.

We have just returned from staying here, we found it so handy to everything. Right across the street from Waikiki beach, shops , restaurants, Honolulu Zoo across road too. Beach chairs and towels courtesy of hotel for beach . Courtesy bus to Al-Amoana shopping centre . Rooms a little outdated but lovely clean , serviced daily. Great views on both sides of resort, mountains or ocean. We had partial ocean view which was fine but opt for full ocean view next time. Friendly helpful staff Definitely recommend staying here, and we will stay here again too.

I liked this hotel even though it is dated. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the TV was just the kind we like, it had a sleep timer. We have gotten into the habit of falling asleep with the TV on so this is the only time of the day we would even consider watching TV - but it was appreciated. The view was awesome. All hotels on Waikiki are now crazy expensive , especially with the US dollar being so high. So we were thrilled that the hotel recognised our anniversary trip with an ocean view upgrade. Thank you management! I was a little surprised that we were charged a $26 USD/ day resort fee; I thought this only happened in Vegas!

Everything was great. Great location, with the zoo across the street on way and the beach across the street the other way. Located at the end of waikiki everything is well within walking distance. With a plethora of options for food and shopping with prices to match everyones pocket book.

We recently stopped at Park Shore Waikiki to acclimatise and re-adjust to the new time zone after flying to Hawaii from the UK to start our Honeymoon. Park Shore appeared to be in a great location - at the end of the Waikiki Beach. This means that the rooms either have an Ocean View, or a Partial Ocean view with a view of Diamond Head. We had the latter, and actually we think this was the better option: we could sit on the balcony and see the golden shores of the beach, and also the rather impressive Diamond Head crater. The room was a reasonable size, with a king size bed. The bathroom as a little cramped though. Being on the end of Waikiki Beach was good because the hotel is adjacent to Honolulu Zoo, so it’s not overlooked on that side. You’re right next to the beach, so it’s easy to walk down, and then along the coast. There was some traffic noise in the mornings, and late at night.The service and staff were really great: there had been an unexpected error in the dates of our booking, but on checking in the staff sorted this out without any issues and were friendly and polite. Where the customer service really shone through for us was when we borrowed the lobby phone to call the airline who had lost one of our bags in transit... when we returned to the hotel room later on there was a bottle of Champagne on ice after the lobby staff had heard our stressful situation. This *really* helped our honeymoon get off (from what seemed like a rather unlucky start with a lost bag) to a great start. (And yes, the bag did turn up!)

Loved it from the location to the service and to the cleanliness. It is just what we needed tome our stay amazing! It was easy to access and in a prime location. The beach was close and so was the shops.

Awesome hotel right at Waikiki Beach. Easy walking distance to the area and the zoo. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I cant wait to go back! They have beach chairs for you to use when you go to the beach. Lots of great restaurants around the area as well.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Park Shore hotel. The location is terrific. The staff were always helpful and the room was very clean. The housekeeping staff were great. The people at the front desk were very helpful and there is a refreshment station in the lobby which is a great idea. Great value for money.

What a superb hotel. We visited as part of our honeymoon tour. Champagne and chocolates just after checking in was a lovely surprise. Comfy big bed and lots of fluffy pillows in a clean room. Staff were very helpful and we caught the shuttle bus to visit the shopping centre at Ala Moana which is worth a visit if you like shopping. Great location across from the beach, slightly quieter with views of Diamond Head. Small, clean pool with pool towels available daily. Coffee in the lobby during the morning and juice and cold water in the afternoon. I would highly recommend this hotel as customer service was great and made a big difference to our stay.

Spacious and well appointed accommodations we enjoyed for a few days before a cruise of the islands. Friends who stayed at the same hotel enjoyed a room on the top (18th) floor - also with great views. Waikiki Beach pier is directly in front of the hotel, the last hotel before a park, zoo and Diamond Head. This made for a less hectic atmosphere than we observed along the line of hotels stretching in the direction of Pearl Harbor. The staff was friendly and efficient. Two ABC stores nearby made it easy to buy snacks, etc. We chose to eat at a serene Japanese restaurant in the hotel rather than the beach bar Lulu's, which always drew a crowd.

My husband and I stayed here two nights after our cruise ended. I wish I had stayed longer. This hotel is literally across the street from Waikiki Beach and the Honolulu Zoo. The hotel loans you beach chairs and towels for the beach. They also have a free shuttle to the mall and an Expedia section that helps you with tours. A very nice young man booked my husband on a fishing trip. I do not have a single criticism of this hotel. The staff, the room, the hotel, the lobby, the bell people, all excellent. The price for this hotel was very reasonable and much lower then other hotels. I paid a little extra for an ocean view balcony and was worth every penny. I booked through Expedia. Don't look any further, just book this hotel .

This property is very well located and our room had a wonderful view of Diamond Head and the shoreline. That said, THIS IS NOT A RESORT! But they do charge a hefty resort fee anyway, sadly. (We were in town for a wedding and some in our party changed locations mid-stay). I called to speak with the GM and never received the courtesy of a return call (sad again) and we were there a week. This property is a fairly basic hotel, in a great location and with a gracious staff overall. If they'd loose the poorly named "resort fee" it would get a much better rating!

If you need to stay right on Waikiki beach and don’t want to pay $300+ per night take a look at the park shore. It’s a great location looking over the zoo to diamond head crator. The beach is right across 5e stree5. The downsides include:- rooms don’t get cleaned until late afternoon unless you ask- small rooms with basic amenities - $25usd per night for “resort fee”. Not sure why- snack machine off pool was out of order all week. - no clean beach towels available the first day. - wifi slow and spotty except in lobby or pool area. - pool area has a lot of traffic noise from busy corner- rooms with views of water or diamond head cost more Upsides:Good valueGreat location Free shuttle to mallHave beach chairs and rain umbrellas to borrowCoffee maker and small fridges in room. Microwave off pool Nice view of diamond head from pool area

Stayed at the park shore for 8 nights . Found the hotel to be good value relative to other options in Waikiki. Liked the location, a little away from the centre but beach is across the road as are the zoo and parks. It feels a little more relaxed at this end of the beach.Staff are lovely and housekeeping very professional.A good place to stay if you don’t need to be right in the heard of the tourist zone.Only complaint is the pool, which is very busy and pretty undersized.

Booked a high floor room for a couple of nights in April, and was not disappointed. We ended up with a 16th floor corner room with a view of the ocean. It was perfect for our two day stay on Oahu. The room was nice, not fancy, but comfortable. The hotel's location is perfect. It was nice being on the quieter end of Waikiki, but still within walking distance to everything. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Excellent service and courteous staff. Good location close to all ammenities. Walking distance to the main happening area. Reasonably priced and clean environment. Could see the beach from the hotel room

The location is perfect in an ocean front room. Looking at ocean and park, not another building. We had clean comfortable room with decent toiletries and balcony. Beach chairs readily available each day. Would be nice to have free breakfast or discount on nearby restaurants.

We were welcomed upon arrival. Room was very clean . Had a view of Diamond Head and the beach. Pool right below us. Zoo and park across the street. Hotel employees were excellent, very helpful, glad to make our stay memorable. Hotel's location was perfect as it was at the beginning of the shopping Blvd. Perfect place to start out around the island

The location is good, especially if you have young children. The zoo and beach are across the street. Waikiki trolley also next to hotel. I stayed in a partial ocean view room, which was perfect for my needs. Staff was friendly. Swimming pool is very cold. Daily parking is on the higher side plus it's valet only. To enter the hotel via car, take Kapahulu Avenue driving towards the beach. I set my navigation to Leonard's.

We stayed in the hotel for the first time on our numerous trips to Honolulu. We were a bit hesitant since the hotel is located on a busy corner of Kalakaua Avenue. But, the location turned out to be the best we could have asked for. There is a very nice beach just across from the hotel that is good for swimming and is suitable for small children since it has a concrete wall that block the waves, thus making it into a lovely large swimming pool. There is Starbucks on the street level of the hotel, plus three other places to eat - Lulus, Tucker and Bevy and a sushi place right in the hotel.

This hotel is straight across from the beach and pier and adjacent to the Waikiki zoo with a beautiful view of Diamond-head.It is close/ walking distance to many eating establishments, stores & shops.

Great hotel with a great location and a great staff. Close to everything in Waikiki, but secluded enough away from the hustle-bustle of Waikiki. Superb service from ALL staff members. Excellent housekeeping and excellent room conditions. Great views. Truly a gem in Waikiki!

Nestled at the end of the Waikiki strip, right across the street to the entrance to the Honolulu Zoo, is the Park Shore Hotel. Michele and the staff did a wonderful job taking care of us. That included, the ability to book a late departure. (We had an 8pm flight back to the mainland) Directly across from the beach, beach towels included, chairs included, and Lu Lu's Restaurant right next door on the second floor....there is nothing more you could need. Tell them you heard it from us....and thank Michele again for us.

A terrific location, easy access to surrounding amenities and exemplary staff makes the Park Shore a go to location while staying in Waikiki. The hotel itself is clean. Staff are quick to respond to even the simplest of requests.

Me and my fiance stayed at the Parkshore Waikiki for a weekend getaway. We weren't expecting much due to the mixed reviews online. Glad that we give them a try and they exceeded our expectations. The valet, frontdesk and housekeeping are always smiling. Also, our oceanfront room was spectacular that we ended up spending more time in the hotel. This a little gem in Waikiki.

Had a great time. The room smells fresh and clean. The staffs are friendly. The beach are just a walk away which is very nice. Also the view from our room is fantastic. Would love to stay on this place again. Its like a home away from home.

Stayed here twice with my family and it was a wonderful experience. The people in the front desk are nice and would always make us feel welcome. The rooms are clean and spacious. Just want to let everyone know, it's located by Waikiki strip and across the beach so basically there's many things to do! Also they have a restaurant on the 2nd or 3rd floor that serves breakfast to dinner. This hotel is my vacation stay whenever we visit.

I didn't like it here at all from the degenerates outside everywhere to the valet and front desk. The room had clean sheets and towels but there was hair and pee on the toilet in the bathroom. Gross. The views are definitley the high point. First morning I went to valet and the guy at the desk was on his phone didn't acknowledge me at first once he did he was extremely rude I didn't have my valet ticket he insisted I had it. I've stayed at tons of hotels and always forget my valet ticket and they always let me go because I know the last name and what kind of car it is. Brian at the front desk huffed and puffed when I asked him questions when he actually had to get on the computer and do something he was extremely upset and showing it. Basically just a very low class Hotel. Like a Motel 6 with ghetto service and good views with a Starbucks downstairs that was a highlight forsure! Super low budget with horrible customer service. I will never stay here again cheap prices aren't worth the treatment you receive.

We stayed at this hotel 2 weeks ago on a Thursday and Friday night. The lobby and front desk were a welcome sight for two weary travelers from the East Coast. The staff was super friendly and answered all our questions. I booked almost a year in advance and requested a Diamond Head view. What we ended up with was probably the best view ever! We had room #1805. We spent most of our time on that balcony looking at that stunning view. The bathroom was just fine with plenty of counter space. The room has a fridge but no microwave and the coffee maker worked perfectly. LuLu’s Restaurant is attached so no need to walk far for a bite to eat. I will do a separate review, but I highly recommend their breakfast. The ABC store attached had everything you could possibly need. We did use the pool towels given and took them to the beach. I suggest walking down to the right to get away from the rocks. We didn’t use the pool, but it looked inviting. There is a trolley stop right at the entrance and we used that to get dropped off at Diamond Head. Check out was a breeze and while we were waiting for our cab driver, we were asked by the staff several times if they could assist. I highly recommend this hotel for the location, the beautiful views, and the amazing staff.

This hotel is located at the end of the Waikaki hotel strip, with only the zoo and park next to it, so it’s one of the most quiet and scenic of all the beach hotels. The housekeeping staff are a delight and most of the front desk staff is very nice and accommodating.

Spent the last week in Honolulu at a nice hotel, but end of week experience is what left a lasting impression and not the Island beauty. First a shout out and kudos to the gentlemen who kept the pool area clean each morning. They were friendly and cleaned up after some of the messy guest. Folks clean up after yourselves, take your trash with you!!!!...Housekeeping staff were very good too. As I am not a sloppy guest it wasn't necessary for my room to be cleaned daily. They did stop by each day and most days I happened to be there and traded a towel for a fresh one...nice ladies. Now one evening I had a panel in my room start to leak water puddling on the floor and called the Front Desk. They did send up a gentleman to look at the problem. He opened the panel looked around went and got a ladder and dry wet vacuum. Looked around again wiped up the water and said should it happen again call them. Got that right. I spent a nice amount for this room with a view and never did the Hotel Manager call or leave a message or note about my issue. They at least could have apologized for my inconvenience. I was bit put out as I have frequent here many times and have had friends stay here too. I know you might think well it was just water but what if I just so happened to be out of room for a longer period of time what than? Anyway, follow up customer service in this situation was lacking big time and for that I call em out. Recommending family and friends in future we'll see.

My stay was pleasant. It is right opposite the Zoo and acroos the road from the beach. It is nice to be just a short walk away from busy Waikiki. Rooms are clean and most staff are helpful. It was lovely sitting around the pool with a view of the beach could do with a few more deck chairs. I arrived exhausted at 8am after a long flight. There were no standard rooms ready but was told I could upgrade at an extra cost to get a room immediately with an ocean view. I took this because I needed a nap but felt a bit conned. The room I upgraded to only had a view of the beach if I stood on the balcony. Had the bed been on the opposite wall I may have had a view. Overall it was ok but not sure I would stay again. It was a lot of extra money for nothing special.

While overall, we had a pretty good experience, there is still some room for improvement such as better water pressure, water temperature, and pool area upgrades. The smell in the lobby was also quite unpleasant which seems to be due to the Japanese restaurant.

Pros/Cons:-Pros: good location, friendly staff, and full breakfast included from Lulu's, free use of beach chairs and umbrellas, great views. -Cons: low water pressure in shower, shower randomly cuts off, stinky lobby, small and very cold pool for the size of the hotel, collateral required to use restroom on 2nd floor (they wanted to hold my husband's drivers license, sunglasses, and room key in exchange for the restroom key), parking fee $28/day, resort fee $25/day, beach umbrellas are not sturdy (ours turned inside out with just light wind), not enough seating at pool.

Stayed in Parkshore Waikiki Hotel for a week & loved the location. Everything you need is right around the corner! Only downfall was I paid my fees at check in with cash & reception failed at communicating with each other because later they took it from my account (which is still pending!) Bell desk could be a little more professional, about 3-4 of them stand in the corner chatting and laughing which kind of makes it uneasy to approach them for something. Other than that great stay! Thank you.

The hotel is situated at the far end of Waikiki just across Honolulu Zoo. Though located at the end of the strip, it provides a more relaxed ambiance and provides a fasconating view of the sea and mountains. The room size we got was just right for us. We loved the balcony that allows us to view the beach and Diamond Head. The corridors seemed to be dated but welll maintained. The bathroom has basic amenities. The room rates are cheaper here compared to other hotels in the area.

Good point: Because it was a corner room, we saw the diamond head and the ocean and it was the best and wonderful scenery. The interior is clean and you can spend comfortably. The staff was friendly and cheerfully responded.Bad place: There is no coin laundry facility.I hope it is a short stay, but I will not stay for a long time.

I like the view and it is so relaxing breezy wind on the lanai. I have to say Park Shore exceeded my expectations! The part of Waikiki it is in is perfect not to crowded the zoo right next door the beach across the street easy access to the highway! Everyone is super friendly ! Icouldn't ask for more.

Stayed here for a family trip to Honolulu. Had a beautiful view of the ocean, room was clean and A/C worked great. Comfy beds and pillows, excellent friendly staff! It was nice to be on the quieter side of Waikiki too. Price was decent compared to a lot of the other hotels on Waikiki. Decor is a little dated but really we had no complaints! Would stay here again.

The hotel is located on the beautiful end of Waikiki. It has great views of Diamond Head and located across the street from the beach and the zoo. The beach has a family friendly side that is closed off by a wall from the high surf, but on the other side, there is open ocean and waves galore. The best of both worlds. Starbucks and several restaurants really close, made it easy for lunch and dinner. Free coffee in the lobby in the a.m. and pog in the p.m. was a nice touch. Chairs and towels to take to the beach was great.

Nice hotel next to Honolulu zoo. Short walk into the centre of town. Gorgeous beach. Hotel room view lovely. Room bit tired and bathroom small but very clean, bed comfy. Would definitely recommend to anyone. Good 3 star hotel. Friendly staff, very helpful. Photo taken 6am so beach quiet.

This is our second trip to Hawaii. Our first trip we stayed in the Hyatt Regency which was a four star hotel on the main strip of Waikiki. We wanted to remain on the strip but on a good price point and discovered Parkshore. We were located on level 8 room 820 we booked the Park Shore rooms The front foyer was open well presented slightly dated require some minor refurbishments and upgrades, Our rooms were adequate for our needs as we were out from early mornings and back in the hotel in evenings. The park rooms felt a little small slightly dated however clean enough. We had a small gap of ocean view. The staff were very friendly and always has a service with a smile. Free beach chairs and towels were a great addition. The location is pretty obvious on the maps easy access to the beaches and the main strip + many more. Excellent location if you want the savings and want to be on the main strip. We will probably stay in a different part of Honolulu for our future trips

We decided to stay here on our most recent trip to Hawaii. Based on information found on their website, we thought that the location, the room and the amenities offered were OK. When we arrived we liked the location of the property, at the eastern end of Waikiki, away, but not too far away, from the hustle and bustle of the Waikiki strip. The staff were always friendly and helpful. It’s location next to numerous eateries and just across the road from the beach, park and zoo was very good.The hotel offered daily activities included as part of the amenities fees. We didn’t take advantage of most of these activities, but we thought the $25 amenities fee was steep for what was on offer in the week we were there. The one amenity that we found very useful was the free shuttle to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. The hotel building, elevators etc were very dated. The rooms were in good condition but very very dated. The air conditioning worked well. The shower and toilet worked well. The TV and wifi worked well. Towels were good quality and plentiful. There was a coffee percolator in the room but with only enough coffee for two cups per day. We had two packets of biscuits (2 biscuits in each packet) on the day we arrived. We asked for biscuits on the following days to have with our coffee but were told that this is only provided on the first day. Really! They must be expensive biscuits.We were given a family room, with two double beds. We would have preferred a queen or king size bed, but not for the additional $60 per night being requested for this option. We are not large people, but the double bed wasn’t wide enough for both people to lay flat side by side at the same time! The pillows weren’t great.We would recommend this place to fellow travellers as long as you are not fussy on your surroundings in the hotel. We thank the hotel staff for their service during our stay, but for us, we will probably look for accommodation elsewhere on our next trip.

This was a Christmas gift to my son and daughter in law. They absolutely loved it! It’s hard to book a room online to a place you’ve never been, but I trusted others’ reviews, and I’m glad I did. They loved the hotel, and Hawaii! Their comments on the hotel: Beautiful views. Quiet end of Waikiki but close to everything. Very nice room, plenty of space, balcony was wonderful, bed very comfortable, and people were very friendly. Loved it! #DiamonheadSuite

Staff friendly, located at edge of busy strip, beach across the road, plenty to see and do. Hotel was good, a bit dated, rooms a bit tight for space but did the jo fine. Has a small pool. Best thing for me was location. Would go back of I could afford another holiday in Hawai'i which is in many shops and bars an expensive rip off and overpriced compared to majority of other places I've visited. Streets have lots of beggars, tramps and vagrants which I did not expect but they are mostly hassle free.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Park Shore. We have visited Honolulu a number of times over the last few years and came across Lu Lu's bar, so we booked into the hotel mainly because of its association with Lu Lu's, which may sound bizzare, but it makes perfect sense.. if you have ever been there. We were only in Honolulu for a couple of nights, after spending most of our time in Hawaii on the Big Island and Maui, so having a good hotel in this area was key, we were not disappointed, the hotel met ever expectation, perfectly.Recommended!

1st time to Hawaii & stayed at Park Shore. Staff were friendly & accommodating on arrival & throughout the stay. Location was perfect with the zoo & Diamond Head one side & the shopping district the other was great place to stay for attractions, shopping & dining experiences.

I guess it’s not so secret how very well situated this hotel is in Waikiki. It’s on the southern edge of the main drag. Half of the rooms gets just a strip of the view of the ocean front for a bargain price and the other half is significantly more expensive but with spectacular views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Everything on Waikiki Beach is just a few minutes walk away. The zoo is practically next door to this hotel and there’s a huge park where you can exercise or jog. You can rent bicycles on the street. There was an exercise schedule with one hour of you got included for hotel guests. We were not this hard core so we didn’t take it vantage of this. The classes, four out of five times of the week Monday through Friday, started at 8 AM. On Thursdays class started in the afternoon. There were no classes offered during the weekend. Breakfast, lunch and dinner places are abound in Waikiki.There is a Japanese restaurant in the hotel, which is very famous for its authentic Japanese breakfast for a reasonable price; the club on the second floor serves breakfast with the view; there are two ABC stores flanking the hotel; there’s a health food place on the ground floor as well And the Starbucks is just on the other side of the health food place, about 15 yards away.The towel and small beach rentals are included in your room price.The rooms are a decent size, very clean and fairly modern. The air condition works beautifully. Since the hotel doesn’t have a kitchen, no room service can be had.The only complaint I have is that the hotel coffee maker is wreaking of plastic smell and taste so even the hot water that I ran through it was horribly plasticky. Very cheap coffee machines. We absolutely love the location. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed in Park Shore for 4 days celebrating our babymoon. The location of the hotel is at the end of Waikiki beach, few mins short walk to all the actions - food, drinks, shopping you name it. There is beach access right across the street that is perfect for family as well as surfing/yoga. The check-in process was smooth, everyone was nice and helpful. The only downside was the room - we have updated to ocean front, while the view was breathing taking, amenities in the room was outdated. Especially the shower head. It kept on switching from shower to bath, we had to switch it back at least 2-3 times per shower. Overall, it was a lovely stay and I would def recommend my friends and family.

We stayed at the Park Shore for 5 nights in March 2018. It was our first visit to Hawaii and we were very happy with our awesome view over the ocean and Diamond Head. Go for an Ocean View if you can, well worth it. We arrived at 8.00am and were able to check into our room for an extra fee of $90 which was worth every cent. Breakfast was included in our rate and we thoroughly enjoyed both the view and the food at Lulu's on the 2nd Floor. Always great service with a smile as well. We were pleased with the location across the road from the zoo - where we spent a great few hours. Also had a view of the flamingos from our room which was special. Easy walk to the main hub of Waikiki but plenty of restaurants and shops close by. Beach across the road with beach chairs available in the lobby. Booked a Pearl Harbour tour with the agent located in the lobby with no problem. Highly recommend and will be back!

This hotel is a great value for the price, but do not expect 4 star quality. Overall we enjoyed our stay. Cons: Rooms with 2 beds have double beds, which any two adults will not really fit on. Our daughter was with us so we had to get a 2 bed room but sleeping was difficult for us and we are thin/normal size adults. I think the rooms are to small to allow 2 queens to fit. The bathrooms are very basic. Standard shower inside a tub, with basic counters/faucets and fairly small. The hotel walls and floors creak and move a lot. Not sure if the building is swaying or if there is a wind tunnel, but it happens very frequently and all the doors rattle and the floors shake when it happens. Pros:Directly on the beach when you cross a two lane road. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. Staff is friendly and hardworking. Michelle at the front desk was always great to us and the valets were always fast and professional. Lulus restaurant was fun and had good food. The beach area in front is great and not overcrowded. You check out towels and chairs and can take them outside of the hotel. Location was good to be on the slower side of Waikiki but only a 10 minute walk to be at the center of it all. Conclusion:If you get a good rate it’s a nice place to stay. Make sure you request a 1 bed room and also pay for the view upgrade because some of the rooms have only a view of a nearby hotel tower/parking garage. We didn’t use the pool.

Convienent to the beach, located on a bus stop and the rooms rooms are clean and have a pleasant decor. The staff is helpful and knowledgeable. They must enjoy working here because the all seem happy?Again, your site did not allow me to enter hotel rating so, service 5, cleanliness 5, location 5.

Sure, it’s out-of-date, decorated in the ugliest of colors in the small rooms, and adorned with super small lanais that don’t have chairs, but the service and staff make this place worth it! Not to mention the prime location - a block from the beach and a block from several yummy restaurants. It’s on the main drag where there is tons of shopping and on the south end of waikiki beach, so you’re closer to Diamond Head, Koko Head, Hanauma Bay, the Zoo, and the aquarium.The staff was always helpful and friendly, and they even waved our late check out charge after finding out I was traveling with my elderly grandfather with a late flight out.If I could go back to O’Ahu, I’d stay there again.

We just returned from a 6-night stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. We choose this hotel based on the reviews and were extremely pleased and recommend this hotel. The location, selection of stores and restaurants, views, service and beach are perfect. We stayed in the standard room and for 3 of us it was okay, but a little small (2 adults, 1 teen). We had no view, we looked at the hotel beside us. Next time we might get a better room, but we spent very little time in it so you have to decide what is important to you. This was our first time to Waikiki and we noticed this end to be quieter and more enjoyable and less lineups and crowds. The beach is very close and you can enjoy riding the waves to the left of the pier or have nice calm water to the right of the pier. You can buy an inflated tube at ABC store for $4.99. The complimentary beach chairs from hotel is a nice option. The hotel offers complimentary morning yoga on the beach. The pool is a nice place to relax with great views. The hotel lobby has free coffee and water in morning and juice and water in afternoon. The park has beautiful trees and you can easily walk to another small ‘pier’ to see tons of beautiful coloured fish and crabs. The zoo is across the street and is lovely (plan about 2 hours or more if you want to relax there). The aquarium is a 5-10 minute walk and was nice (takes about an hour). You get a discount on the aquarium entry for kids by showing your hotel room key. If you can only do one, do the zoo. High end shopping and street performers are within 2-4 blocks. Farmers market Tuesday and Thursday. The Buffet at the Hyatt Regency is amazing and worth the money. Lulu’s and Tucker & Bevy at the Park Shore are both good. We didn’t try the Japanese restaurant. There’s also a Teddy’s Better Burgers around corner and a Subway close by. Two ABC stores and a Starbucks right at hotel. According to Google there is a Safeway store 1.6 kms from hotel, but I didn’t know until last day. We liked this hotel and we won’t stay anywhere else when we go back. It was perfect for us.

Great place if you're going to Waikiki. Steps from a beach that is more private than further down and across from Honolulu Zoo and walking distance from Honolulu Aquarium and Ala Wai Golf Course. Lu Lu's is right around corner and offers great food and atmosphere. Sun set views from here are breathtaking! Hotel service is super and concierge to plan your trip is tailored to you. You won't forget this hotel and we will stay here again.

A bit disappointed that with 3 months notice of our arrival the correct bedding was not available which then required a room move the following day. Some recognition of my 62nd birthday and our 40th wedding anniversary was also not recognised. Otherwise not a bad place to stay.

Hotel rooms were not as good as I expected. A bit outdated. We had a poolside room and when we asked if we could move was advised it would cost extra. The bathroom was tiny but had all amenities you need. Bed was comfortable and tv was a good size. Fridge in room was empty so you can put your own drinks in which are easy to buy from the many ABC stores nearby. The location was good with a nice beach across the road. Getting around is easy as you can walk the main strip or catch pink line bus for $2 a trip. Day trips can be booked in lobby and that was great. Wouldn’t stay here again as we prefer a nicer room but not a bad stay.

Great hotel and location, the main bar was great for snacks and cocktails, and the newest restaurant in town opened while we were their so got to experience it the grand opening. The food was great but a little slow to get your food, we (4 of us) all got our orders at a different time.

Nice location, great view, very friendly. Beach was right across the street and they had beach chairs that were available and convenient. The pool had a great view, mountains one way and beach view the other. It makes the perfect location for an office with a view!

We visit Park Shore often and this was another nice visit. The location is perfect for us. The ocean view room is so beautiful .We also tried a poolside room this time which we didn't care for. All in all I highly recommend Park Shore.

There were some incidents that made us not want to visit Park Shore ever again. We have stayed at Park Shore every year. 1) we didn't realize it was so noisy. We couldn't rest well this year 2) our door was left open after housekeeping 3) we had to call the front desk twice regarding towels not being replenished; coffee cups not being replenished; our rooms not being made until 4-5pm. 4) the last incident that made our decision not to visit was when I called to ask just for 30 minutes grace period to check out and we were told no and if so then we would be charge $35. The front desk was very dry and rude 5) we were not asked how our stay was when we checked out.
user_name:
toribaxter328
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Older hotel but clean and close to amenities. Staff are helpful and friendly. Shuttle service to Almona mall. Right on main street where all the hotels are and shopping stores. Lots of restaurants to choose from casual dining to Iron Chef Morimot’s, Rumfires etc just to name a few.

I choose this place as at the far end of Waikiki. Directly across the road from a quieter beach and a safe lagoon for kids.Views not blocked out by other highrises like in central Waikiki.Pool area is nice and over looks the beach. Check in was a bit painful hence not 5 stars. Did manage to get an upgrade to a beachview room but had to pay $60 a night extra.Lulus attached is a great for drinks and yum food but is really busy so be prepared to wait for a beach view seat.Our room attendant was A1. Always so clean and tidy and cool when we returned each day. Great aircon and large balconies i sat there everyday and night soaking in the views and sunsets.Would stay here again and recommend it to others.

My only complaint about this hotel had to do with the location of my room, which I was told was the ONLY WAY to guarantee a room with two beds- a poolside room with direct access to the pool area. Sounds great, doesn't it? It's not.When I first made the reservation, I requested an ocean view room with two beds. After I made the reservation it read, "one or two beds". I messaged the hotel and they told me the only way to get two beds was to take the poolside room on the 3rd floor which also had ocean views and views of Diamond Head. I agreed.I'll add here that I have stayed in hotels in 15 different countries and have never had an issue with getting a room of my choice with two beds.We checked in, went up to the room, and had to walk above an alley to get to room 323 (see picture).Our room overlooked the pool. I could see the ocean from our room. But no sign of Diamond Head. Maybe I had to out to the pool area to see it.These particular rooms are like being in a fish bowl- unless you keep the drapes closed, you will feel like you are on display to everyone outside your door at the pool area (see pictures).Even worse, deliveries and recycling start in alley at 4:30am on a couple of the days. It's noisy.

I come to Oahu about 5 or 6 times per year for business, and always stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. The Staff is like family as everyone remembers me each time I visit. Very friendly and good people. Comfortable Hotel.

Stayed here in 2017 for two weeks, needs a good renovation, at the end of town close to,the zoo. But right in the heart of the beach for swimming. A few eateries attached to the hotel, they are also in need of a good update.

So　wonderful　view.　I　Think　there　Is　very　best　view　hotel　IN　WAIKIKI.　The　room 　was　clean 　and　useful.　It　is　the　only　problem　that　is　the　parking　entrance　is　not　found　easy.　Maybe　I　will　visit　there　again.

We have stayed at the Park Shore Hotel three times now over the past 6 years. As always the location is fantastic close to the sea, the park and the local Hawaiian restuarants. This is why we chose this hotel.This time there was a lack of generosity of spirit and I felt they were out to squeeze every cent out of you. After a long night flight from Australia I arrived at the hotel around 11am. Although the room was available I had to pay an early check-in fee of $80. In addition I had to pay an additional $26 each day for use of wifi (unsecured), beach towels, shuttle, yoga classes etc. All of which I did not necassarily want. There were also taxes. All this costs made for a very expensive stay.This trip Honolulu was disapointing and if you are not into shopping you need to go further afield on the island.

Pros: clean, comfortable bed, nice view, good location to beach and restaurants, shopping, and bus line, staff is helpful if you ask a question but not necessarily forthcoming with info unless you ask. Cons: room was really small but we were out sightseeing most of the time so it was doable; no microwave in room so that’s a little inconvenient but there is one in the common area on 3rd floor; the staff didn’t tell us that the beach chairs are included in your resort fee and we didn’t figure that out for a few days. The biggest complaint is the noise coming from the neighboring nightclub where they whooped it up until 2or 3 in the morning on one of 6 nights of our stay. If it had been a regular event I would have had to move from this hotel. We are small town people so if we were to come to Oahu again we would look to stay somewhere much quieter and less hustle bustle than Waikiki. But if you want to be close to the action this hotel is a good choice.

Reasonably priced hotel in great location. Over the road from the beach. Great views of the beach and ocean. Valet parking. Some rooms had direct views of Diamond Head Next to Honolulu Zoo. All sorts of shops and eating places nearby

The room was clean and the bed was ok. We had a view of the ocean which was my favorite part. The room smell like fresh cucumber which was nice. I wish the hotel had a free breakfast but there are a lot of restaurant near the hotel. The hotel is also close to the Waikiki beach and shop.

Across the street from beautiful Kuhio Beach. Adjacent to two ABC stores, a Starbucks and a small upscale sandwich shop. Just outside the hotel you have beautiful views of Diamond head. Also the location of Lulu's restaurant and bar which has a great atmosphere and service.Waitstaff Jill, Drew, Lindsay were great.

I stay for 4 night is excellent people beautiful views from my room to the beach.I felt like at home the bed are comfortable the staff are very friendly everything was close to the hotel I recommend it a lot

The location is on the East end of Waikiki. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Housekeeping are very thorough and keep the room nice and clean. The rooms are decently sized, and we had a good view of the ocean. The pool is average. Its small, but clean. Parking is expensive, but comparable to others in the Waikiki area. The hotel does also have a resort fee. They will let you have beach towels, chairs and also the occasional boogie board etc.

Stayed here with my partner in February for three nights. Really good spot and right on the beach front. Friendly staff and would stay there again. Also received a free upgrade to the suite and it was luxary!

It's at the end of the Waikiki strip so it's not insanely overcrowded but it's close enough that you're still included. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. We came to celebrate our engagement and we got to stay on the third floor (pool deck floor) - I recommend if you get the chance. The pool and patio is a nice place to hang out on a hot day when you don't feel like going to the beach or if the beach is packed. Our only issue during the stay was that we left an empty Starbucks container in the garbage bin in our room and within an hour it was infested with ants. I called the front desk and they dealt with it immediately, someone came to clean the basket and spray around the outside of our room. We still had ants hang around the rest of our stay though, I'm not sure if they were there beforehand and just I didn't notice. Just be careful of what you put in the garbage/leave around. The hotel itself is nice and well-kept, I would go back again.

From check in to check out the Parkshore staff were wonderful again. The service was how I remembered it and the room was functional and well appointed. I managed to get to the Managers welcome reception this time, which is held poolside with the free Parkshore signature cocktail and nibbles. The room was quiet even though it was close to the lift we heard very little corridor noise. The free towel service is great - no wet soggy towels - you just exchange your wet one for a dry one. I'll be back next time

Park Shore Waiki had everything to meet our expectations. Beautiful ocean and park views with Diamond Head as well. Three fast elevators, great staff and cleanliness all over. We would definitively stay here again and highly recommend this to others.

We stayed here for 10 days and were very pleased with this hotel. We upgraded our room as the original booking room was too small for a lengthy stay, would have been ok for a day or two. There was no problem upgrading and staff was friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel was perfect for our needs. Walking distance to the zoo and aquarium. Also within walking distance to catch any transportation required, plus many available right at the hotel. Waikiki Beach directly across the street from the motel with all amenities for surfing etc. Two restaurants in hotel, and several other eateries within a block radius. Pool area was great and well maintained, rooms were clean and housekeeping staff was very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again. Rooms were very quiet even with all the traffic noise. The only con to our whole stay was the fact there were no drawers to store clothing and bathroom had no vanity, but we made do with the two small stands available. The attitude of the entire staff at this hotel was commendable. A pleasure to say here. We felt very welcome.

The accommodation in this hotel is basic, but you don't go to Hawaii for your hotel room. It was well maintained, and up to date. The staff were very friendly, and the decor was nice.The location is what really makes this hotel. It's the last tall building in Waikiki before Diamond Head, and it's right on the beach. You can walk anywhere in Waikiki, the beach and zoo are both right across the street, and the view of Diamond Head is fantastic.

Once you get to your room you can tell it's an older building but it has been updated and very well maintained. The staff is friendly and accomodating, a/c is cool, beds are comfy and its in a relatively quiet location but still close to everything.

Yes, everything is expensive in Hawaii - the sooner you accept this, the better your vacation will be. So this hotel was expensive but not too bad, considering its excellent location - right as the end of Waikiki, so it was comparatively quiet but still central. The staff was very helpful, the room comfortable and clean though not exceptional. Good restaurants close by, with the beach right across the street. I'd stay here again, absolutely.

I arrived at my "confirmed, and paid for" hotel, NOT the Park Shore, to be told that "sorry, but we can't accommodate you even though you're confirmed"..... I felt fortunate that a hotel across the street did have room for me but couldn't accommodate me for my whole stay so I spent several nights there which gave me breathing room to figure out where I would stay next..I NEW I was fortunate when after spending two nights at the other hotel, I lucked into a last minute sale for an "oceanview room" at the Park Shore. This hotel was very comfortable, a much better view than previous place but for clarification, the view was not facing the beach but looking down the beach towards Diamond Head. Not a big issue but something one may want to clarify at any hotel claiming "ocean view". Don't expect unobstructed 180 degree views ! The view was still beautiful, but it was more accurately, a partial (but substantial) ocean and beach view looking towards the zoo that is across the street !!! This is not a complaint and I wouldn't hesitate to stay in the same room again, I'm simply clarifying what "ocean view" may mean.The staff was super friendly and helpful, the trolley stops and The Bus stops are very convenient with one of The Bus stops being right in front of the hotel. Starbuck's is literally next door and that particular location opens at 4am. I have put the Park Shore contact info on my phone and fully intend to stay there again in the not-so-distant future. I definitely recommend this hotel.

We Had A Great Stay and we had never been to Hawaii this hotel was AWSOME and the location was GREAT. I would recomend this hotel it was clean and everyone was helpful and I believe for price the room and location it was a great deal . We extended our stay from 4 days to 11 at PARK SHORE. Thank You Park Shore staff for a great staff !!!

Stayed in two double rooms during a family vacation. We were offered upgrades at check-in, which gave us great rooms. If you stay, book a partial or ocean view room; the standard rooms face the hotel next door and feel very tight. Our rooms had ocean views and balconies. Literally steps from the beach and a great hotel. Had yoga at the beach, which was great. The bellman who brought our car out was a great source of information for local Hawaiian restaurants, etc. On check-in Kana'i was extremely helpful. Can't wait to return!!

We had a perfect room, arranged by a cruise planner, and we were thrilled to be at the end of Waikiki, directly across from the ocean, beside the zoo and almost to Diamond Head. You do have to pay for parking but the guys were so helpful. We found the little Waikiki Beachside Kitchen on Lemon Street that fixed a delish breakfast for $5 and the Barefoot Beach Cafe that served a fabulous dinner buffet with live music, both in walking distance of the hotel.
