Also walked to the Kuhio Beach free show on Thursday night - very good! We would definitely return to Park Shore Waikiki!

Very much needed vacation, though a brief one. Once I checked into my room, I felt my stresses melting away and I was ready again to fully take advantage of all the beauty this city offers. Hotel was perfect for me as a single traveler. Many dining choices. Comfortable room. Pool area very special with views of park and beaches.

Room was awesome and clean. AC was cold in this humid weather. Will come back. Staff was friendly and location if perfect close by the beach. Starbucks near by and the Honolulu zoo is right across the street.

The receptionist lady and bell boy were all very kind and friendly. The room was very clean and comfortable. Japanese reaustrant was very delicious. We definitely had a very pleasant time during our stay. Ms. Imai, the receptionist, recommended and we made a reservation a year ago and I am so happy that we made a right choice. It was a pity that we didn’t have a chance to see Ms. Imai. Hope this special price will be applicable again!

Loved staying I at this end of town away from the crowd. Enjoyed the beach close by and walks through the park. Views from the 17th floor were amazing and lovely to sit on the lanai and watch the lighting change on Diamond Head and the sea

My first time to Hawaii and couldn't have loved this hotel more. The staff was wonderful and the location was absolutely perfect. It was on the farther end of Waikiki, so less hustle and bustle-yet steps from the beach. The rooms are on the smaller side and I would recommend paying a little more and get one with a view. We had a wonderful view of Diamond Head and the ocean. Very peaceful and relaxing.

This hotel is really a 3-star hotel. You are paying for the location and the views. It is at the quiet end of Waikiki beach right across the road from the beach and the zoo and great views of Diamond Head. It’s walking distance to everything. I’m from London so we felt safe walking on the main street at night as it was fairly busy.Ocean views with 2 double beds are only on floors 3 through to 6. Our room, on the 3rd floor, was a partial view with view of the tower and a dirty rooftop. We wanted to get the view we paid extra for. The first person we spoke to was not that helpful. He kept saying it ‘technically’ was an ocean view room and that we could upgrade to a suite for £45 more a night. As we booked through a ‘3rd party’ (booking.com) he couldn’t (more like wouldn’t) change our room at a lower rate.We complained to booking.com that evening and they spoke to someone more willing to help us on the front desk and in the end, were offered an ocean front view room after the weekend when it would be available, which we decided to take. The first room on the 3rd floor was spacious, with a big TV and a bathtub with shower. The Oceanfront room on the 11th floor only had a shower and the bathroom was smaller than the other room. The water pressure was low in the Ocean Front room and we had issues with hot water, which were fixed after we told the front desk and the TV was smaller. You do get all the cable channels in all rooms.We had no issues with the a/c in either room.Lulu’s restaurant/bar is next door. It was pretty quiet all the days except Monday where they played music really loudly till 2 am. It was like a massive rave was going on and police cars and an ambulance turned up. So I would recommend a room away from it if you want a fairly quiet night on a Monday.The hotel was safe. Coffee and drinks in the lobby in the morning. They held our bags with no issues. You really don’t need a car. There is a bus stop right outside and you can walk to all the shops and restaurants on Waikiki beach.Apart from the issues when we checked in, this is a good hotel to stay in while you discover Waikiki beach and Hawaii.

This hotel had a great location just off Waikiki. You could walk to the beach and all of the stores and dinning on Waikiki. Roxy at the front desk was amazing and upgraded our room to the corner top floor where we could watch the sunrise over Diamondhead. This hotel was a good budget option. I Would stay at this location again but would make sure to have an upper level ocean front room.

Great location and faboulous view from the Ocean front room. The Expedia agency and the Hans Hedemann surf school situated in the lobby were fantastic too. They totally upgraded our stay at the hotel!

Staff at the Hotel were very helpful. We arrived 0830 and they gave us an early check In to a great room overlooking Diamond Head and Waikki Beach.Convenient position and free shuttle to the large shopping complex.Great area to walk around, beach right opposite.On our departure I left a jewelled bracelet in the room, I rang the Hotel and when we returned 7 days later it was waiting for us.on check In.Thats what I call service.A Tip when going from the Hotel to the cruise Port contact Star Taxis (Reception will look up the number for you) its a free call from your room as are all local calls.Fare is a flat $18. Normally anywhere from $26 - $40 depending on traffic or taxis.Excellent service, they may even do the airport but not sure on that one. Check them out on the internet.

Had booked a partial ocean view, was given a room with the view of the parkade and a dirty roof top. Eventually we were able to move to another room with an ocean view for the remainder of our trip, which was very nice.

Hotel was nice, reasonable price, accommodating, great location, and great staff everywhere. I chose this hotel originally for its location. Right across the street from the beach! The hotel staff was very accommodating from checkin to checkout. Housekeeping should get a raise as my family unfortunately would always leave sand behind! The hotel is also located near some great restaurants.

This hotel 's location is very good. It stands near the beach,and it is easy for us to go to the beach and take a walk along the seashore . On this trip my mother ,85 years old went there with us. She took a walk every morning and enjoyed swimming . The view from the window at that hotel was very beautiful.

Loved the location, staff was friendly and accommodating. Loved it and would stay again! Only thingI think they could improve are the comfort of the beds.. Restaurants and stores right there, Super convenient! Beach and pool amazing! Could not ask for better overall experience! Stay here if you get a chance, reasonable prices! :)

Although the room was a little smaller than we expected, everything was fine.Could have done with more info about the area and hotel in the room.It was a reasonable walk to the main shopping area of Waikiki, but the shuttle to the Ali Moana Centre was great. Could do with more loungers in the pool area. Some people would stay there all day and nobody else got a look in.

My husband suddenly past away and my daughter was alone at Hawaii University @ Manoa. On top of all that my 19 year old also experienced a missile threat all on the same day. We were stressed, I made the reservation that day and took the 14 hour trip to Hawaii Waikiki . When I finally made it to the hotel the staff could not have been friendlier. They upgraded my room to a beautiful view of course that was appreciated. They approached my daughter and I with care and concern. They demonstrated especially the head clerk at the front desk, the aloha spirit. This was my first visit to Oahu but I’m sure it won’t be my last.
user_name:
Joanne P
Wading River, New York

review_body: This is not a 5 star hotel. However, I love the location. It is right beside Starbucks. The pier is across the street to watch the sunrise. Park is close by, zoo is close by. But I love that out in the ocean is a big barrier reef, which to me deters the sharks. HaHa Enjoyed my stay in September, 2017.

Only a short stroll to the beach, the zoo, the aquarium and Lapiolani Park. You can also walk or take the bus to the Diamond Head Monument, about 1.5 miles away. Although the hotel shows some wear, the ocean view room with balcony was very comfortable and the daily room service was excellent. Would definitely stay here again.

loved the location, almost across the street from waikiki and literally across the road from the park and the zoo .. also made it easy to get to the freeways and other parts of the city. had a great time and the staff was very helpful

This was my second time staying at the Park Shore Waikiki hotel.Really like the renovation that they did, nice to see the hotel updated.We had an ocean view room on the 14th floor, and the view was amazing! Beautiful view to wake up to, gorgeous sunsets, and we saw whales from our lanai!! Amazing!My friends had never stayed at Park Shore before, and they loved it. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our rooms, and the valets are very helpful and really friendly.Parking is by valet only, no parking garage. Extra charge daily for valet service. I loved the convenience of having a Starbucks downstairs, and an ABC store, and the cookie shop had amazing chocolate dipped shortbread cookies.There is also a Subway sandwich shop, Jamba Juice, and a shop that sells picnic type foods. We loved staying at the hotel and having views of Kapiolani Park and Diamond Head. Waikiki has changed a lot since my last visit, 10 years ago. Many of the things we loved are now gone, like the International Marketplace...it is now a huge shopping mall with stores like Christian Louboutin, Saks 5th Ave, Coach, etc. Not what we go to Hawaii for. (On the bright side, there is a FREE hula show there nightly).Our room was fairly quiet at night. Air conditioning worked well and was easy to use. During the day, you've got street noise and beach noises, but it's not bad with slider door closed.Beds were very comfortable, I usually wake up hurting in the morning, but didn't hurt at all.Good showers, water pressure would dip occasionally, but then came right back. Loved sitting on our Lanai. Only downside was how close the other rooms lanais were to ours, they are not private. Waikiki has a large homeless population, they are everywhere you go. We love the beach with the enclosed seawall, making it safer to swim and not have to worry about waves. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to Ala Moana Mall.

The prime reasons we like the Park Shore Waikiki: 1) Spacious rooms, 2) Good views of the ocean, 3) Excellent location at the end of Waikiki, 4) Near the zoo, beaches, and restaurants, and 4) Helpful, courteous staff.
user_name:
painted_10
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed here for two nights in November, had an amazing room, fantastic views and bed was very comfortable, stayed for another three nights later the same month, room wasn't great, payed for sea views had the sea views but backed onto the back of the Hotel, not a nice outlook, bed was terrible, was definitely an older room than the first one we stayed in, wont go back there, very disappointing as it was our 25th wedding anniversary.

The location was great for taking off for walks on the beach or the Waikiki area in general. It's only a few minutes' drive to the highway for exploring the rest of Honolulu and Oahu. The room we had (double bed plus sofa bed) included a kitchenette (basically sink + minifridge + microwave) and a balcony with a great view of Diamond Head and the beach. The downside was that the room was very small for three adults. It was supposedly an ADA room, which we had requested because we had one person who uses a cane, can only walk limited distances, and needs a walk-in shower. The ADA-accessible shower was nice, but the room was on the 15th floor, so I can't imagine how we would have gotten our person with a cane down 15 flights of stairs in case of an emergency. Back to the positives, the pool area was beautiful (with a view of the ocean), and had a good amount of seating.

If you're not going for fancy, and just need a place to sleep after being out all day, this place is great. The staff are friendly. The rooms are clean. It's across the street from the ocean. The location is perfect.

The close prximity to the beach, ocean views, lovely lobby, surrounding restaurants and services all make this hotel ideal. The entire staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms nicely put together, everything convennt and clean. Bed and pillows very comfy.

We had a room with a "view of surrounding neighbourhoods". This apparently means the wall of the hotel next door. The room was clean and comfortable. It had a small frig. and coffee maker. Water was provided daily. Members of staff were very obliging. We arrived before check-in and left long after but our luggage was looked after. Checking in early/staying after check out time is possible at a rate of $10/hour. There are several small restaurants close to the hotel The pool deck is a pleasant place to lounge. I thought that the daily charge for beach towels and chairs was a complete rip-off. We used the towels for about an hour on 1 day.

My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in January. The hotel is on the small side which I like. We booked the Ocean View room which was amazing. The room it self was small(did not matter) with a King bed and small bathroom. The Lanai was big and the view was bigger. The location is perfect if you dont mind a little walking. You can park your car across the street at the zoo for $1.00 an hour day and night. There is free parking around the corner but it is impossible to get a spot. The hotel lobby has Juice and Coffee in the A.M. and you can also find the Expedia activities desk where you can book any activities. They are very nice and informative people. Free shuttle to Ala Moana mall. Towels and chairs for the beach. Overall an amazing place

We stayed at the Park Shore hotel and got a beautiful room, 908. It faced Waikiki Beach and from our room we saw spectacular sunsets. The hotel room was not large but it served our purposes well. It was clean and bright, close to restaurants and right beside the beach. I highly recommend this hotel.

Some of our rooms were very small , no dresser to unpack your clothes. Small desk with 2 small drawers. It was clean though. Brian helped us get one poolside room on day 4 . We had requested 3 poolside rooms close to each other. Hotel said they did not know about our request? Good location. If you are on a lower floor on garbage can alley there will be a smell , so you will not want to sit out there. 2 of our rooms did not have a chair in the room or on the small balcony. When you book your room be very clear about what room you want and make sure you get it when you get there. Because of the location to the beach I would stay here again. Other than the small rooms I do not have any other complaints about this hotel.

The Park Shore was a great place for a group stay. Even though our arrival was a bit of a mix up, the hotel staff very eager to correct our booking. All staff was very pleasant and helpful. Lulu’s and Tucker and Bevvy were excellent options for all meals.

Great location, friendly service team, clean room, amazing views and easy access to all Waikiki has to offer! Kana i, Kim and Michelle at the front desk were so kind and welcoming and that attitude carried out throughout the hotel and throughout my stay. Many great restaurants attached to the hotel and I enjoyed the all. Also, do take advantage of the manager's reception at the pool and the shuttle to Ala Moana for wonderful shopping. Mahalo for everything!

It was my first visit to Hawaii by myself. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful, the location is superb. Definitely stay again. One thing, the air conditioner is noisy, but I turned off while my sleep, so it’s not much annoyed. On Monday night, Lulu’s cafe is noisy till midnight.

Hotel is good, staff is friendly. Minor issues with room clean-up.Overall location is great, closer to beach and other facilities, restaurants, bars, shops. Honolulu Zoo is just cross the road.I would recommend this hotel

Great place to stay right opposite the beach. Room 1024 has the most amazing views of the sea and Diamond Head. Easy access to restaurants/shops etc, but nicely located on the fringe of the crowds. Good value for money as this came up as a special. Would stay in this room again.

Very good experience. Staff was friendly, bell service, check-in desk was great. room was indeed Sparkling clean. the bed was very comfortable. good beach towel options and pool and sundeck. overall just very good

Aloha, Nice hotel, good location away from the crowded area of Waikīkī right opposite the beach. Good pool and bell staff great. John at the expediate desk very helpful with booking tours. Great weather, Mahalo

Hotel is steps from the beach! Rooms are rather small, but I didn't come here to stay in the room, I was here to see the sights, have fun with my family and enjoy Hawaii. Having quick access to ABC stores and Lulu's resturant was great, and being across the street from the Zoo was nice as well.

This experience was poor due to the outdated furniture and fixtures. The restroom had rust on the shower rod. The bell hop was a bit aggressive with determining if hotel parking would be used when pulling up to the hotel. Recommendation is to Update furniture and fixtures and do a bit of training.

Only a 4 star hotel, but the view made it a 10! We ask for a ocean view room, open the door and the view was amazing! Staff were very helpful, the rest of the hotel could do with a up date. but the view made up for everything!

I went on a trip to Hawaii for my wedding, honeymoon and husband's birthday celebration purpose.I made a reservation to celebrate my husband's birthday with a fireworks of NewYear, but it was sent to another room by double booking. It was a very expensive room.The correspondence of reception at that time was also the worst. It is very lazy.Please return our honeymoon.Everybody are better not to reserve if you do not like staying lodging on that day.

We reserved an ADA poolside room with two queen beds. We also called at least a month before our arrival to confirm. Room was not available when we arrived. We were put on 15th floor which would mean our handicap traveller would not have been able to evacuate in an emergency. We were told it was a better room because of the partial ocean view and nothing else could be done to get us in an ADA room poolside (3rd floor). We had also reserved a room with two queen beds and the 15th floor room only had one bed and a sofa sleeper. Not only was our handicap traveler in danger, we had an adult now sleeping on a pull out instead of a real bed for a week.

The location of this hotel was excellent- directly across the road from a great section of beach for swimming and sunbathing. It is at the end of the main row of shops and restaurants – so you might need to walk a few minutes to get a meal if you are fussy – but it isn’t far. The room was clean and modern with great air con. We booked a partial ocean view room. We could see the beach and the pool from the balcony, but we were also quite close to some other balconies.

Excellent hotel located right opposite Waikiki beach. Bed was comfortable. It was quiet at night. Close to everything you need. Great shuttle service to the Ala Moana shopping centre. Make sure you go to Lulu’s next door also. Loved this place. Good and service was excellent. I will be back!

The nightclub in the hotel was ridiculous. Music going to 2am so ni chance of getting any sleep. Very disappointing. We did nit go to Hawaii to listen to nightclub music. After our third visit I think next time we will choose a quieter location.
user_name:
Brendan M
New South Whales Kirrawee

review_body: It is good visit and nice location for honolulu maraton.If there were coin landories ,it is much better visits for us.And If there were more japanese speaking staff,we enjoied much better durring our hotel life.

Stayed here previously, this time with partner. Had a wonderful time and couldn't have chosen better accomodation for location or price! Very close to the beach and some delicious restaurants. Staff are very friendly and helped us out a lot.

Really liked staying here overlooking Diamond head, beach, zoo and on the park a lot quieter then in the middle. Easy walk to centre 10mins maximum across road from beach great restaurants nearby. We really enjoyed this hotel they staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was lovely rooms cleaned daily and had beautiful views. Highly recommend this hotel.

The location is great: your cross the street and you are on the beach. There is also a decent pool on the beach side of the hotel if you prefer a deck chair to lying on the sand. There are also a number of shops, bars and restaurants within walking distance on Kalakaua Avenue. And Ala Mona Mall is just a 10 min bus ride away, if you want to go shopping.There is a restaurant in the 1st floor on the beach side. The breakfast and the lunch are OK, but nothing special. In the evenings this place turns into a music bar. The volume of the music is very high. You pay extra for a room on the ocean side. But if you want to sleep in the evening, book the cheaper room on the back side. Your view is just another hotel, but that side is quiet.The service is prompt and friendly. We used the front desk, valet parking, concierge, restaurant - and a nice little detail - picked up beach towels at the service desk in the lobby - everyone was very friendly. The WiFi was good, fast enough.The rooms and the hotel corridors are shown some wear, they look "tired".Because of its location, and its price, the hotel is good value for the money.

good location, good staff member, good view on Diamond Head and the beachrooms are old, it must be renovatedpool tool small, water too cold. misses some activites near the poollack of equipment in the room, such as kettle,etc..

A great hotel at the end of the Waikiki strip. Perfect jumping off point for exploring Honolulu and Oahu. An efficient room that was well-equipped for our family (with a toddler). Hotel offers beach-chair and towel rentals, and valet parking for $28/night.

The fourth star is just for being in Waikiki. The hotel is centrally located and many attractions, especially the beaches, are within walking distance. The staff is super friendly and the lobby is beautiful. The hallways upstairs are clean and well maintained, but look like they’re out of the 1960's. The rooms are smallish, but comfortable and lack storage for clothing. There isn’t a microwave and the small fridge is in a hot, closed cabinet. Despite my request at the desk they have not yet fixed the noisey AC unit. Turn it off and sleep quality on our king sized bed was good. Housekeeping was wonderful. Our view from the balcony, where we even brought in dinner one night, was great. For $250 a night not as pretty as the all inclusive resorts in Mexico, but I would recommend.
user_name:
Lou V
Carle Place, New York

review_body: Plumbing leaked the whole time. We reported it several times and it was never fully fixed. This led to the room always smelling musty. There was constantly noise around the property from ventilation. This made the balcony unpleasant. However, the location was good.

I have been to Hawaii 14 times & always loved my stay there mainly staying the the Sheraton or Outrigger. After travelling the USA for 4 weeks we finished off in Hawaii for 5 nights & I thought I would try the Park Shore. The rooms are old & small. There are much better places to stay. I asked for a room change and they said they would get back to me but never did, I would not stay there again so many better places to stay

Service was accommodating. Staff was professional and helpful throughout our stay. I would consider staying again. Excellent access to the beach with lots of shops and restaurants near by. I would recommend dinner at Sansei.

The hotel is the last on the hotel zone. It has a great view of the diamond head. Because of its location, the room is quiet. However, it is further away from all the shopping and most of the restaurants. As a family with young kid, we are not into shopping. I have stayed in central Waikiki before. It was too noisy and hectic for me. So I like this location better.This hotel is across the street from the zoo and a beach park protected from waves. Another plus for family with young kids. Our kid really like the drink in the hotel lobby as well.We asked for a room on a higher floor to be away from street noise after booking. We did get one. The facility is just an average hotel. If you enjoy staying by the pool or spending a lot of time in the hotel. This is not the type of hotel. The room is really small. The pool is small. Elevator is supper slow. WiFi is also slow.

It was a great location. Walking distance to the beach, food, drinks, shops, etc. We were upgraded to partial beach view which was a nice little surprise. Bed was super comfy. Cons: only valet parking $28/day, no breakfast included, & beach towels $30/day.

Great... Arrived late-night. Checked out @11 the next day to cruise home to Australia.But what a FABULOUS location. Being on the end of the strip (the Zoo is across the road) means VIEWS. And we were lucky enough to get an "Ocean View" room, which means that when I woke up and threw back the curtains, THERE WAS WAIKIKI.And DIAMOND HEAD.A bit peeved at the "resort tax" but from what I read, those are becoming standard add-ons. Next time, I'll avail myself of the features, like grabbing a towel before taking a dip at the beach, or using the pool...

Was an amazing yr9 and 10 school trip well organised by VET and teachers. Me and my girl extended it for another week which was great as we had done most of the tourist stuff with the school in the first week so we could relax and spend some quality mother daughter time shopping and doing the stuff we wanted to do. Loved it so much saving for the next trip

Great hotel in a great location overlooking the beach. Fantastic view from the oceanfront room, with the ocean right in front and DiamondHead off to the left. The 12th floor was perfect! Staff were friendly and helpful. Easy and good breakfast at Lulus which is inside the hotel. Walk a few steps down to the beach. Will definitely be back!

We last visited this hotel 4 years ago and the hotel was just as good as it was the last time we were here. Last time we had a 1 bedroom suite but this time just had an Ocean View room which still had great views. The staff were as friendly and helpful as we remembered from last visit. If we ever come back to Honolulu I would definately stay here again.

This hotel is right across the street from the beach, and next to a beautiful park and the Honolulu Zoo, the location is great. Rooms are super clean and comfortable. Great shower with tub, and a pretty good sized bathroom with lots of counter space. We enjoyed dinners on the lanai which had two chairs and a small table. Lobby is beautiful with lots of comfortable chairs, and coffee is served in the AM and juice in the PM. Beach chairs and towels are great. Everyone who works at the Park Shore is very friendly and helpful.

Excellent hotel for price!! Location, location, location!! Super clean, quite friendly, and car valets super helpful. I would definitely stay here again and would refer others without reservation. Looking forward to our next trip to the islands!!

Nice hotel, we enjoyed. We have been in this hotel twice and the location is good. Staff was helpfull and no breakfast was needed in this location. Iwould recommend this hotel to others too.Hotel in near the beach also

Loved our stay at this hotel ! Close to everything and steps to the quiet end of the Beach. Front Desk was polite, friendly and very helpful. Reserve an oceanfront room on a middle to upper floor and you will not be disappointed ! Great view and location for your money !

Good stay good value for money. Make sure you know about the resort fee at $22 plus tax per day of your stay no doubt to cover things like pool, towls and chairs for the beach. Thr guava juice in the lobby is great on a hot day. Staff are great

My husband and I booked this week-long trip through United Airlines vacation planner, so the cost of the room was included with our plane tickets and it was actually quite reasonable. Being from the mainland it's hard to get used to lobbies that don't have doors or even permanent walls. Many hotels just have an open lobby with an entrance area, like this one, but there's no way to close it off ever. There is very little room for loading and unloading, so that's a bit tricky if you have a car. The parking is expensive at $28/night, but if you're lucky you might find un-restricted street parking and the zoo across the street is just $1.00/hour.The room itself was very comfortable, great big king sized bed, shower with a tub. And of course, Hawaiian Tropic toiletries. Like my husband said, it's weird at first to use shampoo that smells like sunscreen! Nice flatscreen TV for quiet nights in, but we couldn't find a channel guide anywhere, so it was always a guessing game. They were very generous with the towels. There was not much noise transference from other floors, but we could hear the next room's TV often.The location is great, it's one of the last hotels before the end of the busy Waikiki beach. So not too crowded on the beach, and not too noisy from the nightlife. If you want to be close to the craziness, it's an easy fifteen minute walk. There are lots of great restaurants and shops nearby, but if you can get even just fifteen minutes inland from the beach and find a grocery store you can get things to stock your fridge and shelves without spending half of what the local convenience stores charge.We had an "unimpeded beach view" room with a balcony. If you care about your view then it's important to check on what kind of "beach view" you have. You may end up with just a sliver of beach between two other hotels if you're not careful! We faced the Honolulu zoo, and to the right of our balcony was the tail end of Waikiki (just blocks from the aquarium) and to the left in the distance was Diamond Head. Gorgeous view. We were able to watch the Pearl Harbor Day Remembrance Parade from our balcony too. Visiting Honolulu in December was wonderful, not too hot. The room's AC only turns on when the balcony door is shut, which is logical, so make sure to check if your room seems warm. There is a mini-fridge in the room which is quite convenient, but there's no microwave. There's only one microwave for the entire hotel, in fact! It's in something they called "the break room"(?); it's not really a room at all. It's just the end of the hall near the pool with a microwave on a bookshelf and some vending machines.The hotel channel runs an advert for the hotel that mentions a hospitality room with a sitting area and even a shower that you can use after check-out before you have to go to the airport. They no longer have that room available, you can only use the hall bathrooms or sit in the lobby; despite what the advert says. It would be a wonderful idea for them to bring that back; we had a late flight out and a noon check-out, we wanted to spend our last day at the beach. We did anyway and changed in their hall bathrooms.The hotel loans out towels (1 per guest only) and when it's wet or sandy you can exchange it for a new one, no limits on how often. You can even keep it after you check out if you have a late departure, which was nice. They have chairs to loan too, but not loungers, just tiny little folding chairs that sink into the sand if you are more than 150 lbs. Still better than only having a towel. They offer yoga on the beach most morning; the card they hand out says "just come to the lobby," but you actually have to sign up in the lobby so make sure you do. It's at 8 am most days and about a 7-10 minute walk with the instructor to a site that's near the beach, but in the grassy area and not on the sand. There is a yoga class almost in front of the hotel in the sand and surf every morning, but don't be intimidated. That's a master class with some locals and not the hotel's class! We did a very nice and easy yoga session that was perfect for beginners or those experienced in yoga.The pool was chilly, but it is December! It's not heated at all. It's a nice way to rinse off the residual sand before going back to your room from the beach, and of course they vacuum it out every morning. Our balcony looked right into the pool. It was never crowded, even during the "manager's reception" (I think it's Wednesday night). It was a 2-hour free punch and snacks by-the-pool session, but I never saw anyone from the hotel (like a manager!) who was there to talk to anyone. Nobody really interacted with anyone but travel mates.
user_name:
CMH-FC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Location, view, service, amenities and everything else is great. Only issue is the lower floors in Ocean Front rooms get all the road traffic noise and this can be very disturbing as starts early hours of the morning until late at night. If you are a light sleeper, you are in trouble. I had room 824.

Located alt the North End of Waikiki right across from the beach. The hotel was is pretty good shape with good views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Good restaurants on site. Got a very good value for the price by going directly through the hotel website.

We were pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel was. The price was good and the service was top notch. The beach was just across the street with a nice pier to go out on at night. It is nice that the hotel is adjacent to a park so it feels more open than if you were in the center of Waikiki.

I was in town for the Honolulu Marathon. The location was great, the beach was right across the street. The shuttle service runs every 30-45 minutes and got us to places that were a little to far to walk. Everyone was friendly. I will be staying here when I return in 2018.

In Waikiki for honeymoon. Hotel located at bottom end of the main strip so it's well placed if you want somewhere a little quieter for your stay. I'm not keen on the additional resort rate fee on top of the room rate it's just an excuse to take more money from you. The hotel is a touch dated but the rooms are adequate enough even if the aircon runs a touch loud in the room. We didn't get acknowledged as a honeymooning couple on check in but were told the next day we had been upgraded when we went to the desk to enquire about our booking. Also requested an early morning wake up call on day of check out that didn't happen and got a poor apology at reception and no reason why the call was never made. The staff seemed fairly disinterested in offering us any decent service at all.

From check in, to check out, staff was excellent! Front desk, housekeeping, engineering, bellman's, and even the management were kind, courteous, and helpful!I had a quick weekend getaway with my girlfriend. I remember having a problem with the T.V., called the front for assistance. The engineering dude came up and realized the plug was unplugged and he plugged it in for me. We laughed about it and he apologized, but told him that I should have checked. I feel bad I forgot his name.

My second stay this year. Not a luxury property with spa, gym, etc. but the location of this property is ideal. If you want a great value and clean accommodations, friendly staff - this is the place. It’s across the street from the beach. They provide beach chairs, towels, WiFi, coffee, water and juice (In the lobby). There is a shuttle which will take you to various locations in Waikiki to explore, shop and eat. This is not my last visit.

A nice stay in the quieter end of Waikiki. Great staff makes you feel welcome and all the amenities of Waikiki ( beach,restaurants, coffee, shopping, surfboards) are close at hand. Rooms are clean with nice beds for a restful sleep.

hotel is on a corner one side beach the other parkland with a zoo which gives it a great location, excellent views, friendly staff, we got a poolside room which the kids just loved . There is a great safe beach opposite the hotel one side is sheltered from the surf by a low wall and the other open , . public transport was excellent the bus stop right outside the hotel main entrance very easy to get the main mall at a great price . had a great holiday.

Hands down, THE most convenient location to stay for runners. All the qualities you need; quiet, clean, and friendly staff. Good value overall. Will stay here for next year's races. Only downside: WiFi Internet connection is poor and unreliable.

Very good location, awesome people people. Next to the Zoo, and all the restaurants we went to were in walking distance. Right across the street is the beach. or you can go to the pool. I would recommend this hotel

This was a wonderful place to stay. The internet was not that great but, if you are out and about, enjoying the sights, who cares!! The staff was WONDERFUL and very attentive. We could not get to the hotel during the Dec. 7 parade, but we just further toured the island.The hotel is centrally located and very accessible to bus service if you want to tour the island that way. It was great and homey, not too touristy.

The best Hotel I’ve stayed in at Waikiki. Everything about it was quality, cleanliness, best location and great staff. Breakfast with a view was stunning. The tour desk service made our plans so much easier and staff where very helpful.

The location of the hotel can not be beat. Located on the zoo side Our overall experience was good. The property is older and has seen a couple of Reno’s The lobby is very understated The hotel was clean We had the 9 th floor suite. The only thing that was weird was that you had to go through the separate bedroom to the bathroomThe bath room has a Toto washlet toilet seatThe double balcony’s were great with the view of Waikiki beach

This hotel was in excellent condition even though it appeared to be an older hotel. The location is excellent as well. I would recommend this accommodation. We enjoyed our quiet stay. The service was excellent and the rooms very nice. It was easy to get to other locations of the city from this location.

We stayed at his hotel Nov 23,24 prior to our cruise Nov 25/17. We had the ocean view room on the 6th floor. Across the street from the Honolulu Zoo. Sandy beach and an excellent pier to watch the sunsets. Fantastic location. Easy to get to from airport. Great price if you book ahead, valet parking service. Located at the very end of Waikiki beach with the terrific sand and park like setting, but none of the crowds you would find mid-beach. Lu-Lu's - a great restaurant overlooking the beach on the 2nd floor. ABC store in lobby. Pool and sun deck on the 3rd floor overlooking the beach. Walk 3 short blocks and you are in the thick of Waikiki. Leave the hotel, make a left turn and you are on the road to Diamond Head without any traffic. All of the staff was polite and accommodating and most helpful. This is a hidden gem that I would recommend without hesitation. The only hotel I will consider when returning to Hawaii.

This hotel location is the best one near waikiki beach and Sansauci beach park and also zoo, at the bust stop so it's quite easy to hop on hop off theBus to anywhere on Oahu island, walk to the beach or enjoy wildlife in the zoo. The service of hotel is of its standard with friendly staffs. The hotel is near beachside shopping center too.

Loved the location across the street from the beach and park. Very friendly staff. Proximity to everything I wanted and needed. The valet parking staff were outstanding! A very friendly welcoming environment.

Staff was friendly and helpful, location is perfect for the beach and for walking.Hotel showing some wear and tear,could use some glasses and cups in the rooms rather than styrofoam .Bed was comfortable

A nice reasonably priced place with great staff and nice setup on the Far East end of the Waikiki strip. Closest to the zoo and aquarium and Diamond head. Easy pleasant walk to the far west end. The beach out front is quite nice. Plan on swimming in the kiddie ocean pool...behind the breakwater, its not just for kids. The fish school just inside the breakwater, for snorkeling. Be aware, you are renting in the city (best part of city), whereas most of the best of Hawaii is country, so allocate your time accordingly.

We got an "oceanfront" front room and it was perfect. The view was our top priority, and it did not disappoint. We were given a corner room on the 7th floor that faced the ocean and the southern part of Waikiki. No tall buildings obstructing the view at all! Valet service was excellent and staff was nice. Room was slightly bigger than expected. Area was noisier than expected (front door is on a balcony of sorts, with little sound insulation) but it only helped to get us up earlier in the morning :)

Pros: great location and good serviceCons: Building and rooms needs an update. Our sheets/bedding felt damp as if not properly dried before placing on the mattress. Nightstand light kept going off, and thermostat made the room either too hot or too cold. Felt like more like a cheap motel than a 3 star hotel. Would like to stay again due to location, good service, early and late check-out options, but probably won't until rooms/bedding gets an update.

Great staff, good location, not so crowded area. This was a quick trip to do holiday shopping, see friends and enjoy the Aloha spirit. This hotel is perfect; close to other hotel venues, not in the middle of everything, wonderful staff, excellent sunrise and sunset views.

Fabulous location and views. The staff were so kind and friendly - this our second visit and is the reason we came back this year. A great option for a couple looking for close access to the beach and lovely views of Diamond Head and Queen's Surf beach.

Stayed here for 5 nights in June with my wife. Check in was pleasant enough, got to the room and was very disappointed. Very outdated, noisy aircon but clean. Opened the fridge to find leftover sushi and beer (the beer wasn't so bad). A few days in, we got back to our room to find a huge plastic shield around the room opposite with a tube running over our door out across the hall over the balcony. Obviously being fumigated for something (no idea what!!). Location was decent, over the road from the beach, but I would not stay here again. If you are looking for cheap and not so cheerful it would be OK.

The hotel itself is in the perfect location. It's literally 2 mins away from the Waikiki beach and has all the shops and restaurants you could possibly want within the walking distance. The rooms were cleaned daily, and the staff nice and friendly. I'd definitely come back to park shore.

Very disappointed after a long day of travelling to be dinged $30.00 because I was a hour early on my arrival. It is just a money grab and I will consider it on my next trip. I recommend you drop the resort fee for those that don't use it and the early check in money grab

This was my second stay here within 12 mths. I love the location at the “quieter” end of the strip and the close proximity to the beach. Staff are so friendly and willing to assist in any way. Rooms are clean and serviced well - my only complaint is the quality of the mattress - very lumpy and uncomfortable and would like more than one pod of coffee daily

If you want a "no frills" convenient location with pretty good views and quick walk to the beach...this is it. It is dated, but the beds were comfortable and coffee pot, fridge in room was convenient. View of ocean from most rooms as well. Price was very reasonable.

From check in to departure we are always made to feel at home with the Park Shore.Our room is always ready and clean. Staff is amazing and we look forward to seeing them all each return visit. Great value.Can not beat the location......right across from the beach!!

This was a great hotel with amazing views of Diamond Head and the ocean. Staff was great as well as check in and check out. If you qualify for discounts you need to do that at the time of booking...they won't do it at the desk. Shuttle won't take you to surrounding areas so limited dining or shopping unless you bring walking shoes.

Liked the location of the hotel and use the shuttle to go to the shopping mall, and Walmart ect which was every half hour.Rooms where clean and tidy, balcony with partial view was great floor 12 room 1219.Staff were friendly and helpful.

Park Shore offers a great location as well as a comfortable and clean hotel with friendly staff. It's view of Diamond Head and the ocean is wonderful. Beach access is great. I love to sit by the pool and be able to look out over the ocean. We have stayed there many times, wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Hotel was not luxury.It was neat and tidy, with a poolIt had a free shuttle service to Ala Moana mall.With many amenities close by.there were two ABC stores 1min away, for all your travelling needs food drink, sun tan lotion. souvenirs, and loads more.The best part of Waikiki beach across the road.On the other side of he road the hotel is on is the Honolulu zoo.The hotel is located on the shopping, restaurant strip.Starbucks downstairs and also LuLu's restuarant.Tours to all over the island can be arranged from the tour desk.No complimentary upgrade, but had the fee for an extra adult waived.For a small price we could check in at 8.00 in the morning.really happy with the spot would stay there again.

Clean and tidy hotel, at end of the Waikiki hotels but nice and quiet. Some rooms overlook the zoo which is really lovely.The pool area is large and clean. Roxy was amazing at check in, would recommend this hotel.

I find that the location was not to my liking as beach access was a challenge. I did not feel welcome when I arrived as the Bell service did not come out to get my luggage for me. My room was not ready in spite of my notifying the hotel ahead of time that I needed an early check in and I was willing to pay the additional charges. I am glad I upgraded when my sister informed me that the regular rooms are small. The Diamond head suite was very comfortable and had great views. I stayed 7 days with my son and his family and I had a good nights rest every night. I would have expected the suites to at least provide water in the rooms which was not the case. You have to bring your own toiletries like toothpaste and toothbrush etc..the hotel does not provide it, even in the suites.

We stayed here a couple of weeks ago. It's an older hotel but great place to stay. Fantastic location, right at the end of the hotel strip, so you overlook the ocean and parklands (Zoo) and some rooms also get an unobstructed view of Diamond Head, plus just across the road from the beach. The staff are friendly and helpful, it's nice and clean, overall a good place to stay. The pool is also a nice spot to cool off on the 3rd floor. Complimentary cool drinks in reception for guests is a nice touch also, especially if you're waiting a while for check-in.

OK so firstly I have to acknowledge that I booked this as a secret hotel on Hotwire, and ended up with a complimentary upgrade to an Ocean View room. So the room I received for the price paid was much better than expected, but even so, I still think this is a great property. It is much more affordable than many other hotels in Waikiki but without compromising on location or quality. I didn't use many of the facilities such as the pool, but the room itself was clean and perfectly adequate, and everything worked as expected. In addition, the woman who checked me in was so friendly. I arrived early in the morning and wasn't able to complete check in at that time, but when she saw me come back later in the day she remembered my name and called me over by name to finish my check in and give me my key. Unfortunately I didn't think to get her name as I wanted to let her manager know, but I'm happy to provide more details so management can work out who it was.

Close to the Zoo and a few minutes walk to the Aquarium ( a must see) this hotel is located at one end of the strip and probably at the quieter end- which suited us. Right across from the beach and only a few minutes walk to all the great shops and cafes.

Very happy with my stay here...3 nights. Room was oceanfront. Beautiful location. Room was a little smaller than expected. Bath was needed some counter space...there was none! Requested a bath tub for husband, ended up with a shower, but decided to let it go. Bed and bath linens very comfortable. Room also very comfortable. A good value. Front desk folks always friendly and helpful.

My sister and I were at the Park Shore for 4 nights and had the most wonderful stay. We do a fair bit of traveling, and we both agreed this was our very favorite place. The staff were both outstandingly friendly and actually knowledgeable about their jobs; they were able to accurately answer any questions and quickly solve any problems we had. When we arrived we were offered a free upgrade to a suite, which sounded great but wouldn't work for us because the suites only had one bed. Right away the young man (whose name I wish I could remember) offered us a roll away bed free of charge for our stay. We were dubious, but not wanting to turn down the extra room of a suite, we said sure; and what a great decision that was. The room was big, beautiful and had the best view of the ocean I'd ever seen. The roll away bed was brought up right away and was quite comfortable, but as it turns out it was almost a non issue because the original bed was so huge, and firm and blissfully comfortable that both of us could have slept in it without bothering each other at all. I would 100% stay here again!

Great location and friendly staff however the property needs some love and care due to its age and guest expectations. Surprised that an extra daily charge for a shuttle service and pool towels whether used or not were levied on check out.

The hotel is in an excellent location, the service is good and the hotel is clean, the rooms are clean but in my room on the top floor there was always a smell of food and pastries because of the proximity to the chimney, even though the windows were closed and it made me sick.

Very clean and well kept hotel. Enjoyed the quietness of the overall property. If you are looking to relax down in Waikiki, I strongly suggest to stay at this property. You will not regret it! From the valet/bellman, front desk, housekeeping, you just felt at home.

As the 3rd time for this place and hotel park shore. me as a single traveler can only give positive words for this stay and place :) polite humble and a lot of hospitalities from all the crew :) Always around when i needed the smallest thing and support of all .. A beautiful area with a lot of possibilities around the hotel and a great view from the top of the hotel.. waikiki beach in front and to the right .. and diamond head in front row to the left :) perfect place for a hotel in my eyes. a beautiful view at the pool deck. a perfect place to be at this time of year cause of the sunset is just in the front of the pool deck.. a beautiful place to be for the last sunlight of the day :)

Great location at the end of the busy strip. Lovely views of the beach, zoo and diamond head. We upgraded to a beach front view as they are so much better than the city views. The staff were very friendly and helpful with any issues.The only minor problem is that one or two of the lifts were out of service so it took a while to get up and down to our room

Nice place. Good room for the value. Great views if you get Ocean view or Partial Ocean View. Nice location on the less crowded end of Waikiki. Good restaurants close by. Easy walking distance to most everything. And you can hear the Peacocks from the zoo.

Very convenient location. Easy to access off Kapahulu Avenue instead of driving through Waikiki. Room was clean and front desk very friendly. The lobby is very open and lends itself to an outdoor feeling.

Can’t beat the view from this hotel. Super convenient location. Always book direct with hotel for best room results. Across street from beach, soon and bus route. Close to acquarium. Walking distance to Diamond Head.

Super nice location, great view and friendly staff. Room was really clean and tidy, front desk and valet all ways ready to help us out when needed and were all ways friendly. Being right next to the beach and the zoo was really nice too

This is 5th time of stay. I absolutly choose this hotel when I stay Hawaii. Price,location,service...Can go few steps to the beach and zoo! Stay couple,Family and solo. I'm sure you can enjoy stay so realy recomend to stay.

Had a nice weekend stagnation for my girlfriends birthday weekend. We had a great weekend with a great view of the ocean and a full on view of diamond head. The staff was very helpful and very friendly, from the front desk to the whole staff.

Another fantastic stay, can't wait to return again and receive the same great service and best possible rates you directly provide. The staff are amazing especially Roxanne who helped me with my booking.

Best location of any hotel we saw. The pool overlooks the ocean and has the view of the zoo.Pool got sun all day long. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Right across from the beach.

Awesome location! Hotel is really well situated to the parks, beaches, shopping, and everything you want. Rooms are smaller but being recently renovated, very clean and well equipped!Staff are VERY friendly here, and I have stayed at many hotels in the state of HI... kudos to you all for this!Do stay here if you want a great place to stay,... and the Japanese restaurant in the hotel is very authentic...closer to what you would find in Japan...not quite to a high end restaurant in Japan but very good!

good for quick get away .. no frills though. This hotel is good for a room close to the beach for a good price. it is a no frills hotel, pretty much the basics. Our room and bathroom clean and fresh but minimal in size. WINDOW was very nice, wall to wall to accent the good view if room is ocean view. There is no room service. No hot tub. small pool. you pay for resort fees but this place is far from being a resort. one small japenese resturant off lobby, was prtty good but hidden. between the vslet parking fee, resort fee, taxes and any tips the room fee is about $75 a day more than room charge. The location is the best part of the hotel. front desk STAFF was OK, but housekeeping had a very curtious attitude. one elevator of three was out. no one worked on it for at least 4 days while we were there, someone was working on it monday on fifth day. left us waiting a lot since we were on 17th floor. would I stay again? maybe.

The room had a beautiful view of Diamond Head and a side view of the ocean. The room was very small for the price. We never received housekeeping except for the last day, we finally went out and got towels from a staff individual in the hallway. There was a very loud event/concert on the beach that we were not advised about that kept us awake for one of the nights. Bell staff did not help us at all, or even offer, and we were not able to get a shuttle to the airport even though we followed the instructions of the front staff. The hotel was made aware of the problems that we had, especially the lack of housekeeping, and nothing was done about it. We were told that we would receive breakfast each morning for a certain price along with our package but, this was not honored by the hotel and we ended up having to pay significantly more for breakfast each day. I would not pay this much to stay in a place with such poor service and with such small rooms.

Lovely staff, clean, fresh rooms with beautiful toiletries.Bell guys were a laugh and the travel guy downstairs was so helpful!!Lets face it... Hawaii accommodation isn't cheap but this place was not too bad compared to some and perfectly located.

Said it all on the prior statement. I already said about the bed, pillows room service parking and the employees. lax of some things no micro in the room amenities charges are way out of line and there is no reason for this charge given. Lulus restaurant music was far to loud and to late after 10M .

We stayed for only 4 nights but really enjoyed this hotel. Staff were very friendly & the location was excellent. Although it is an older hotel the rooms were clean & comfortable. Would recommend. Hotel has a shuttle that takes you to the largest shopping centre &I the bus stops right outside the hotel.

Seventh visit, still a Great beachfront hotel for the price! Friendly service & oh that view. Quite end of the strip, not far from the action. The rooms are clean and adequate. The courtesy bus is a nice touch as well as the refreshments in the foyer. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

Ok hidden charges not explained on booking. Lulu'a bar very noisy and can be heard even on the 12th floor. Many nights, especially Monday nights party went on until 2 am or longer. Also there are many transient people on the streets and the police had to be called on many occasions. My wife felt unsafe after dark going for coffee, mostly early am, and had to stay close to the valet parking for her cigarette breaks

Great staff very friendly and happy to help any way they can. We were upgraded to a room that opened out to the pool it was a good size and very comfortable. The rooms were clean and wifi was good. Good location opposite the beach with a free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre. Would definately stay here again.

Close to Waikiki Shell, the Zoo and aquarium. Right across the street from a beautiful sandy beach. Great value, friendly and knowledgeable staff. I highly recommend this hotel. We definately will stay here again!

This hotel pretty average. It is at the end of Waikiki beach near Diamond with unobstructed views of both. I️ loved the fact that it was right across the street from the beach to the north and across the street from the Zoo on the west. It’s also a 5 minute walk from the Waikiki Aquarium, which also hosted the Luau I️ attended. It’s less crowded and busy than the hotels near the shops on Waikiki beach, which was definitely a bonus.Check-in We were a group of 30 and arrived at the hotel around 11 AM. The front desk allowed us to check in early. My sister’s birthday was the week of our stay, so the front desk upgraded our room at no additional charge. Upon check in, we received a beach towel card that allowed us to check out complimentary beach towels. Failure to return the towel results in a $30 charge. We left a credit card number for incidentals which is par with every other hotel. We had a hard time getting up to our room due to elevator problems which was annoying. Our luggage arrived at our room pretty quick despite elevator problems. The Room The room was on the 3rd floor and our patio doors opened up to the pool and amazing views of the beach. The hotel room was average but the overall hotel does feel dated and needs to be upgraded. Lulu’sOn the second floor there is a restaurant called Lulu’s. The food is decent but the views are amazing! They have live music at night which I️ really enjoyed. Make reservations if you want to sit in the areas with the best view during breakfast. PoolThe pool is small and could be better compared to other hotels that have a private beach and/or an infinity pool right over the ocean. Room serviceI️ didn’t order food but I️ did request tea and it came within 5 minutes.StarbucksThere’s a Starbucks and a nice sandwich / picnic food shop in the lobby of the hotel. Definitely a plus! Expedia ActivitiesThere’s an on-site Expedia coordinator to help book activities in the lobby. I️ booked a sunset dinner cruise with but didn’t receive any discounts. Overall the hotel is okay. As stated, it needs to be upgraded.

Our 3rd stay here and Park Shore didn't disappoint us. Had a lovely room with partial ocean view and beautiful view of Diamond Head. Loved having the free Ala Moana shuttle.Not sure why you would charge an early check in fee - was surprised at this.

We stayed at the ParkShore for 5 nites as a prelude to joining a cruise,and what a greatChoice,this property is a visit to yesteryear Honolulu which unfortunately have almost disappeared,it was a privledge to stay there the staff exceptional in our experience and it’s proximity to all of Waikiki and uptown Honolulu well served by foot or shuttle,publictransport.ParkShore we will return in a heartbeat.

Love this place. Amazing location by the beach and zoo, quiet spot still on the main stripWe have been here 4 times and it never disappoints (and I’m not usually a repeat stayer anywhere)Incredible views, clean comfortable rooms, and great service.It’s excellent value for money, and has great services nearby (starbucks, restaurants/bars, surf school in the foyer)Its not exactly luxurious (its a hotel not a resort) but has had a refresh so is quite modern for Hawaii. We will be back
user_name:
wilminskyj
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

review_body: During a recent trip to hawaii we stayed at the Park Shore hotel prior to a cruise on the Pride of America. I was a bit hesitant about this hotel as it had received mixed reviews, and was fairly old. however it was one of the cheaper options and seemed to be ideally located (opposite the beach up near the zoo). It was showing its age but apart from a lift that did not work it was clean,the staff friendly and helpful and a great location opposite a walled part of the beach which made for great swimming for families. Try the bakery attached for great Panini,Starbucks attached and Lulus upstairs for a great breakfast overlooking the beach

We stayed here one night prior to a lengthy cruise, then returned for a 3-night stay at conclusion of cruise. This hotel is located at the end of the busy commercial strip in Waikiki beach. It is directly across street from the beach and next to Honolulu Zoo. Within short walking distance to Aquarium and a host of other locations that vacationers frequent. The housekeeping staff were superb. Front desk and bellman staff were the best. We had an absolutely wonderful time here and will come back again. I have already recommended this property to friends who will be traveling here in the future.They have a free shuttle to Ala Moana Mall and other locations. There is no downside to this property.

A great place to stay. An amazing view close to everything you needed. The beach was literally right there across the street. We were expecting some leis when we arrived but it's all good. That small detail didn't ruin the trip

We didn’t stay at the Park Shore, but walked in to go to the restaurant. We only saw the lobby but were surprised that it was so shabby and unappealing. The restaurant wasn’t open for dinner yet so we sat down in the lobby to discuss our plans. All of the upholstered furniture was very worn and shabby, even the part of the chair below the cushion was bulging out. The lobby was enough to make us really glad that we weren’t staying there.

Flight to the mainland was cancelled. You were nice enough to get us a one night stay.We checked in early evening by a very friendly Front Desk agent - who gave great information about what to do and where to go.Checked out the next day after a pleasant night's sleep on Oahu.Would like to stay longer on our next visit..

Love this place. Love this place. Love this place.this place Love this place. Love this place. Love this place Love Love this place. Love this place Love this place. Love this place. Love this place Love this place. Love this place. Love this place Love this place. Love this place. Love this place

Great location right across from the beach, awesome views and really helpful staff, willing to go the extra mile - especially Roxy and Kana'i at the Front Desk - you guys are the best! Such people make all the difference and make it a memorable stay. Thank you, Park Shore!

The staff are friendly, efficient and helpful. The room was small, comfortable and very clean with all facilities. Free shuttle bus and plenty of public buses stop outside of the hotel. Close to a number of restaurants/ cafes. Opposite to the zoo and an excellent beach. We would stay again.

Front desk and bell staff were very friendly, efficient and helpful. When we reported that the TV wasn't working the morning after arrival it was fixed within minutes. Location is great just across from the beach and at a quiet and more peaceful end of Waikiki beach. Lulus next door connected to the hotel for breakfast is fine - wouldn't hurry back for their evening meal service though.

What a great position, "just" away from the hustle & bustle, adjacent to a lovely beach, a short walk to several eateries along with the Zoo and if you are fortunate enough to catch Michelle behind the reception desk, you will be greeted with a smile from ear to ear.A real well presented Hotel with friendly staff always willing to assist, nothing was too much trouble.Although the room we had was small, it had all the essentials, was clean, well fitted out and should you require larger accommodation, there is a room to suit all tastes.

it was a very good place with nice people and pool deck was clean and maintained nicely, lobby was nice with easy access to all things, good location made it easy to do everything. front desk staff was really nice.

Hotel is right across the road from a good section of Waikiki Beach (which has sand). Excellent Ocean and Diamond Head views if you book a higher room classification. This end of Waikiki beach is much quieter than the other end, where there are large crowds and less beach access, but the other end does have all the high end shopping.

This hotel great for the location and price. The front desk line is almost always long and took us awhile to check in. The staff was also unorganized and did not have our reservation correct. If there is a manager around for check in you may have better luck.

Grounds needs improvement, but the staff is very friendly and if u want reasonable prices and being on the wakikiki strip this is the place to stay. When we visit Waikiki my family and I are never in our hotel so we didn’t utilize any of the amenities, but definitely the place to stay for good prices and friendly service.

I absolutely love coming here, particularly for the convenience and location. I love coming here as well because they have these two ladies named Risa and Roxy who just the best!.We stayed in room 1615 and had an amazing view of Diamond Head and the ocean. To wake up to this view for 9 days, every morning was truly amazing and inspiring. The room is well kept, clean and spacious for us. The hotel is near the zoo and we got to park there over night for $1/hour. This was a huge savings for us. I believe that coming here is well worth the money. They don't have much to look at, but if your just needing something that allows you the convenience of getting in and out of Waikiki then, this might be a great choice for you. However, if you want to see all the bells and whistle inside a lobby area and appreciate their wall art, then this might not be a place for you. They have plenty of 5 stars down the street that will kindly take your money. The experience is truly up to you and you spend your time in Hawaii. Park Shore Waikiki provides a great comfort and gorgeous views of Diamond Head. Look for Risa and Roxy- these ladies are amazing.

I enjoyed a very pleasant, brief stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. I was in Honolulu on business and checked in late. I asked for a late check-out the next day, so as to get some pleasure out of an overnight in Waikiki. The front desk person was very kind and arranged for that as well as for a complimentary upgrade to my room. The room was lovely, with an awesome view of the Waikiki beach. I also enjoyed a couple of meals at Lulu's the hotel restaurant.

Our new favorite Waikiki hotel. Great location and friendly staff, starting with Risa at front desk, Joeye at Bell Desk and Nilda,the chamber lady, at the 12th floor.Room 1219 has partial ocean view, fridge, coffeemaker and safe.You get chair and beach towel to take to the beach, across the street.ABC store and restaurants all around.Good quality bedding and AC is quiet and efficient.

Clean reasonably priced hotel across the street from the beach bring some footies lots of coral hidden in the water at the beaches ABC Store is a good place to buy supplies Starbucks is right on the corner views are good

We recently stayed at The Patk Shore Hotel. The location was perfect, right across the road from the beach, the views from the hotel were amazing, service was excellent. We would recommend this hotel for anybody looking for somewhere to stay in Waikiki. We missed one of our buses to go on a tour and the concierge was able to organise a cab for us to catch up with the tour so we didn't miss out. The hotel is also close to shops and restaurants. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will most likely be back in the future.

Stayed 6 nights at this great hotel. Slight misunderstanding/ mistake at check in with our room upgrade though - but all was fantastic after that. We had requested an upgrade as we did not want to look at another building when we sat on our balcony to eat breakfast or have a drink before bed. We were told the upgrade would be $50 a night for a partial ocean view/ Diamond Head view. We accepted and went to the room, however the room was on the corner of the two buildings which looked right onto another balcony and couldn’t see Diamond Head at all. When we went back to reception we were told we were charged too much for that type of room, it should have been $35. So they moved us to another room (which was actually slightly bigger) and after that, everything was perfect! They apologized and gave us a box of chocolates - I guess it’s just lucky we said something! To me, the location was perfect. Across the road from the beach and within easy walking distance to everything Waikiki has to offer. We didn’t eat at any of the restaurants around the hotel but they seemed nice. Rooms were very bright and cleaned well. I noticed they changed the shower curtain daily. I haven’t noticed that at other hotels before so I thought that was a nice touch to keep the bathroom fresh. The hotel can organise a shuttle service to the shopping outlets, and to the airport. They also have a free shuttle to Ala Moana - but we decided to walk, roughly 45 mins. I have already recommended this hotel to a friend traveling there in December and wouldn’t hesitate staying there again myself when I go back!

We stayed for 5 nights on our way home to Australia. We found it relaxing and a good place to thaw out after having been in a cold climate for 4 weeks. The location is great and within walking distance of Waikiki beach. Good shopping is all within walking distance.

Hotel is located at the quieter end of Waikiki across from the Zoo. Beach right across the street was great. We were booked in a standard room for 6 days here (gift from friends). Our room was on the 4th fl. The rooms are small from a Mainland perspective but are average for Waikiki. We've stayed at a 5 star hotel up the street and the room wasn't much bigger. Remember you're on an island and real estate is expensive. Our view was of the hotel next door with a slice of the ocean if you stood out on the lanai (no chairs). As one reviewer said - you don't spend much time in your room while in HI hopefully!I had to work part of our time there and we like to hang out on the lanai so the next day we asked about upgrading. Michelle at the front desk was so amazing and full of aloha! She helped find us a 1K ocean view room and for a nominal fee to upgrade we moved. Our new room had an amazing view of Diamond head and the ocean! Great choice! Mahalo Michelle! Everyone we met from the front desk to the guys at the bell desk was friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but very nice, very clean, and have small frig and coffee maker. Housekeeping does a great job! Used the hotel beach towels. Did not go to the pool but it looked nice. We ate at Lulu's twice for breakfast and the food was very good. ABC store(s) right next door were great for water and snacks. We walked down Kalakaua/Kalia to go to other restaurants. Teddy's Bigger Burgers is also right around the corner for an inexpensive meal. We had a car so did not use the shuttle. Getting into the valet space in front of the hotel is a bit tight. The entrance is actually on Kapahulu Ave just after turning from Kalakaua. There is a $20 resort fee and $28 valet parking only. They cut the parking rate for military. All in all a great hotel, very nice rooms, in a great location with great staff.

This place is a hidden gem! It is on the south end of the touristy part of Waikiki. Great access to beach, Diamondhead, and not overcrowded. The staff was amazing. Price was perfect for Oceanfront room! They provided towels and beach chairs. The wind was a bit rough, causing some larger waves, but we were just across the street from "The Wall". It was perfect for swimming and even a little snorkeling.We cannot sing their praises enough. If you aren't happy here. It's your own fault.

We stayed at the Park Shore for one week. The location is perfect with the beach just across the street. Staff was super friendly and helpful! We had an ocean front suit and our view was spectacular. Pool was clean and maintained every morning. Everything was great! Parking is the only one negative thing, it's overpriced; however, you don't actually need a car because everything is walking distance. Small tip, if you are looking for a free parking you can find it along the Monsarrat Ave. :)

We really enjoyed our second stay at Park Shore. It is close to the fun of Waikiki but a far enough out with gorgeous views of Diamond Head and the Zoo and the amazing ocean!! The staff were really friendly, helpful and efficient!

Go smoothly at the time of check-out because it is not a big hotelIt is really great scenery And there the sea in front of the eyeAlso IThere is also in front of the bus stop after Zabasu want to go by all meansI think that I spend a fun time

We stayed at the Park Shore for one week during our anniversary trip. Everything was great! The location and access to the beach was awesome. We see people lugging their beach chairs and floating water toys from blocks away and all we had to do was cross the street. Staff was great! Everyone was very helpful and friendly, they always had a smile on their face. Our view was amazing. We were on the 6th floor facing diamond head and the beach with pool view below. Pool was clean and maintained very well every morning. Beautiful views from all angles. I could've sat on my balcony during our vacation and be happy. Everything was walking distance. They have a shuttle to the Ala Moana shopping center which was appreciated as we didn't have a car. Very convenient location all around. Will definitely stay here again.

Handily located opposite the Zoo end of Waikiki Beach. We were booked in hassle free & our room was clean with 2 double beds & big HD tv screen together with nice A/C & nice shower. Our view was looking at next door hotel & if you peered off the narrow balcony you could see the sea (you can pay extra to get the decent sea views I'm sure) There is a coffee making machine in the room & there was free coffee (am) free juice (pm) in the LobbyStaff are polite & helpful (they were quickly up to show me how the Shower & Coffee M/C worked!) DOWNSIDE: The lifts are AWFUL. One was barriered off & the remains 2 are SLOW. You would wait many minutes at a time for it to arrive esp at busy times when it became simply frustrating watching the numbers inch down as it laboured up & down. Get that sorted & you'll have a Hotel doing its job satisfactorily

Our 2nd stay at this hotel and it's as good as the first. Superb staff, great cosy atmosphere, wonderful views and you just can't beat the location!Having a room on the 3rd floor so that we're poolside meant the area became an extension of the room - extremely handy when you have kids!The staff are the heartbeat of this hotel and you feel the Hawaiian aloha the minute you pull up to those glass doors/walls. Thanks to Roxie & Rissa for 'keeping it real' - you're all freaking awesome!

It is located at the southern end of Waikiki. Beautiful beach across the road. Beautiful park beside it. ABC stores everywhere. Plenty of restaurants, bars, stores within walking distance. Room is small. But clean. Nice balcony. Ours overlooked the pool with a view of the beach and Diamondhead. Hotel even has beach chairs for use free of charge!

I'm pretty sure some of these reviews on here are fake, there's no way some people could consider this place to be a good experience under vacation circumstances. While the price is fairly cheap there are some things that just should not be overlooked when running a hotel on one of the busiest vacation spots on earth. Things like,Running water - every time we took a shower the water would shut off for a brief period of time. I told the staff about it and they quickly jumped on it, but it never got fixed. At that point we just dealt with it because we only had one more day there and we didn't want the hassle of changing rooms. Working elevators - apparently their whole elevator system is on the fritz. They had one elevator shut down for maintenance while the other two were just limping along. Every time we tried to go up to our room on the 12th floor it would take us about 10 to 15 minutes to complete the mission. The kicker was when i was trying to come down from the room and all the elevators stopped working for about 15 to 20 minutes. I was stuck on my floor trying to get down. I ended up using the stairs. What a crock. Clean rooms - You expect a room to be clean when you first enter and expect turn-down service to clean your room when you're gone for the day. Right? Well apparently they forgot about this. When we first entered the room it seemed fine but upon closer inspection things like the Refrigerator still had old food in it from the previous guest, the slider was left open and we had bugs in our room. The kicker was we left for the day to go explore, we came back around 530pm to clean up and our room was not cleaned by maid service. WTF! I immediately called and asked for towels and reminded them our room has not yet been cleaned. It took them an hour to bring towels btw. lol. The only upside to this place was the location and the staff was pretty friendly. I understand all of these mishaps are not their doing but the owners doing.I really hate writing these type of reviews because Hawaii is such an amazing place, the people are so great and warm, and you just can't beat the atmosphere of the islands. Even tho our hotel experience was complete crap it didn't put any doubt that Hawaii is one of the best places in the world to visit. <3 itSo future guest, please spend the extra $40 a night and stay in a nicer, better run hotel. You wont be sorry.

I had a great experience staying at this hotel. First off, the location is great. Right across the street from the beach, with a Starbucks attached and an ABC Store, close to a bunch of restaurants.
