The room was a bit small but clean, and the beds were very comfortable. Air conditioning in the room worked a little too well. Even set at 75 it was freezing! All of the staff was extremely friendly. The valet even gave us cool Park Shore luggage tags! They also gave us late check out for no fee since our flight got delayed. The only bad thing about this hotel was the elevators. Only 3 elevators for an 18 floor hotel, and one was broken the whole time, so it was not unheard of to have to wait a few minutes for a car, or to have a car full of people. But everything else about my experience there was great. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again for sure!

Our room has a great view,but it is only partly ocean,hotel style room, but very clean and comfortable.Staff are very friendly and helpful.walk across the road to ocean pool or beach.sand OK to walk on.It is the opposite end to where we stayed last year, but great to explore some different places.Bring some good walking shoes.The hotel has a pool to and there are plenty of places to eat close by,and ABC shop (for essentials) next door.They have a free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre, and you can catch the pink trolley bus in the next street outside the Aston Waikiki.Do your research before booking tours as you can get some really good deals.

My husband & I stayed at the Park Shore beginning of September & had an amazing holiday. We arrived at hotel & were able to get an early check in as we had arrived on an early morning flight from New Zealand. Michelle the receptionist was just so lovely & made us so welcome. We spoke to her & other staff often when we wanted to know about anything & they were all so friendly & helpful. Being able to just cross the road to the beach was an absolute bonus & it was not as crowded as closer to the main part of Waikiki. Plenty of places to eat beside & close to hotel & an easy walk to the busier part. We both like our cup of tea so an electric jug was delivered to our room along with tea bags which were replenished each day. We can highly recommend this hotel & would certainly love to come back some time in the future. I booked this holiday as a surprise for my husbands 80th Birthday which he celebrated mid August. Wonder what he will do for mine ha ha !!!!

We have just returned from another great stay at the Park Shore. The hotel is very clean and has modern, spacious rooms. Last time we stayed in a Partial Ocean View room and had a fantastic view of the beach, however this time we knew we wouldn't be spending much time in our room so we opted for the basic "Hotel Room" which looked into the neighbouring hotel. The location of the Park Shore is second to none - at the very end of the strip beside the Zoo and a park. This makes the general area and the beach opposite a bit quieter but is still only a 5 minute walk to the shops. Tiki's Bar & Grill is also right next door (at the Aston Hotel) which is one of our favourite places to dine (fantastic views, cocktails and food). The pool area is also a favourite feature of ours - it has great views of the beach and Diamond Head and is usually very quiet. We will stay here again next time we are in Waikiki.

Booked a Diamond Head Suite with Lanai for 4 nights .What a find this hotel is just across the road and straight onto the beach and pools.A 10 min walk to the Westin .On the 16 th floor we looked straight across the Zoo and parklands to Diamond Head and the ocean.Our room was large and comfortable with small kitchenette and lounge with large TV plus good air conditioner plus very comfy bed.Lovely having coffee on the balcony with such a view.Eateries next door also yes an ABC shop each side of the building.Check in was execellent . Really all the staff were friendly and helpful.Bonus is the free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping mall.We usually stay the other end of Waikiki .Just thoroughly enjoyed The Park Shore.

Other people on this forum have complained about not having a room with a view. We were in a room with a view of the next hotel. Thing is, I don't care because I don't come to Hawaii to sit in a hotel room! The beach is 50 yards away and that's where I went. My wife and I were out and about all day. When we wanted to sit and look at the ocean we went to the bar attached to the hotel (Lulu's) and relaxed there.Our room was fine, the pool is okay - again, a great location and good view from the pool. You can lounge in the pool and look out on to the beach.The hotel is in a great location. It's a 10 to 15 minute walk to the main shopping strip but I gladly traded that for the better beach.I'd stay here again in an instant.

Everything was perfect except for a fire alarm that woke us all up at 4:00am making it impossible to get back to sleep. Lack of sleep made the next day not as enjoyable... Not hotel's fault though I guess. Everything else, was superb. Extremely helpful and friendly staff, good quality of the facilities and conveniently located. The genuine Japanese restaurant at the lobby is a must. I highly recommend this hotel.

Great hotel, love the location and the friendly welcoming atmosphere. Addition of Tucker & Bevvy for healthy light meals and Smoothies etc was great too. Second visit as good as first, don't think we'd stay anywhere else in Wakiki. Perfect way to end busy sightseeing trip in UK and mainland USA with six days at Parkshore Waikiki.

Perfectly positioned. Away from the busiest part of Waikiki but near to everything. Across the road from the beach but still quiet. Spotlessly clean. Would definitely recommend staying here as long as you don’t need really up market

We were satisfied with both facilities and services. If we return to this area, we will return to this hotel. and we will recommend this hotel to others. We were satisfied the room we used to use. Thank you!

We had a view of both the ocean and of diamondhead. There was guava orange juice and iced water in the lobby the pool was clean and overlooks the ocean and zoo park. Our bed was just fun enough and just memory foam perfect. Staff so friendly. We played scrabble at night in the lobby. Everything clean sparkling

I've stayed at the Park Shore twice now and would recommend it in a heartbeat. You simply can't beat the value or the location, and the fact it's connected to Lulu's, an ABC Store, right next to a Starbucks AND across from Waikiki Beach is just incredible. Plus the rooms are clean, the bed is super-comfy, and most rooms have a good if not great view at some angle. Will definitely stay here again on my next trip.

Love this hotel, excellent location, abundant amenities, great, friendly staff. Second visit, will be back again. Had a late check in and early check out. Did not wait long for valet or bellhop. Soft towels & great views from our lanai.

This is a nice, clean, friendly hotel located directly on about 5 bus lines making it easy to get around the city. Not new nor luxury but well maintained. They offer an airport shuttle but didn't mention that it wasn't their shuttle nor was it free. For a party of four, a taxi to the airport was faster and less expensive.

Not real ritzy. Very conviently located. The hotel Is old but pretty well kept up. The staff was very friendly. Disappointed with the shuttle service the hotel offered. The prices were not very accomadating.

Location was great. Staff were very friendly. Complimentary yoga on weekdays was a great surprise, I especially loved the sunset yoga overlooking the beach. Free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre. Unfortunately WiFi was unreliable.

Location was great, price was reasonable and the staff were very friendly close to the beach. Our room had a great view of the beach and diamond head. Balcony was excellent we used the pool and patio area was very pleasant

Great location. Quiet away from hustle and bustle yet within walking distance of all major restaurants bars and major shopping Great view from room overlooking Waikiki beach. Rooms were good size. Highly recommended

The first consideration when I set up a hotel is the location.In that respect, the Park Shore Hotel was perfect. There was a beach front, a panoramic view on the left with a diamond head, and a 10-minute walk to the T Galleria on the right.And the bedding was perfect.

Elevator was down for maintaining and caused many customers to wait and no ventilation in it very hot. No shuttle service as promised the concierge would state it was coming and never did. Room we stayed in had amazing views. Bathroom needs more cabinet space for toiletries.

We stay at this hotel almost every year for over 10 years. I think you can't find a room with this specutacular view in Waikiki. Also we really love the pool which is in the sun all day. The location is a little bit far from the center of Waikiki, but that's why you can enjoy the gorgeous view.

Lovely, quiet property in a great location. Friendly and professional staff. Clean rooms with modern decor. Easy access to everything Waikiki, Honolulu and the island has to offer. Short walking distance to shops, restaurants and more.

We enjoyed the hotel. Had wonderful views of the ocean and Diamond head.However, the A/C struggled to keep the room cool. This was disappointing. Room also only had one chair (a desk chair). Hard to share, use bed or use patio furniture inside.Deadbolt on door didn't work and although reported to front desk, didn't get fixed.Staff was very friendly and housekeeping kept room very clean.

The staff was truly amazing! Front desk crew friendly and helpful. Valet staff personable and prompt. Housekeeping staff helpful, punctual and accommodating. The location of this hotel is perfect. Mahalo

Are you a normal person who requires only an affordable, comfortable room in a quiet, central location providing everything you might need while on your vacation? Are you not a pretentious 1%er? Then I definitely recommend Park Shore Waikiki. It's not an over-expensive resort - it's a quiet, affordable hotel with everything you could possibly need - the rooms have a fridge, an iron, a hairdryer, air conditioning, wi-fi...if you're not an overly picky person, or, basically, if you're a regular middle-class human looking for a fantastic vacation, then Park Shore is perfect for you. It's nothing like the uber-fancy resorts in Waikiki that charge $50+ per night in "resort fees" - Park Shore charges only $20, which is small compared to most Waikiki hotels. It's without pretension, because it doesn't need to be a pretentious hotel. It is literally across the street from the beach. Like, for serious, you cross a street and you're in a perfect swimming beach. You're also literally across the street from the Zoo and Kapiolani Park. My first day here, I was able to walk to the zoo, the aquarium and Waikiki beach, easy peasy. If you do not require a room that opens directly onto the beach, if all you want is a nice place to stay that isn't loud, where a "partial ocean view" means having an unobstructed view just from your window and only slightly obstructed from the balcony (and by "obstructed" I mean there's another hotel over there to the right. Oh no?) then you'll want to stay here. If you're on a budget, if you're not a picky rich 1%er, if you're content with a room that has everything you need without frills...stay here. Basically, if you want to enjoy Hawaii without spending an arm and a leg, stay at Park Shore. It's fantastic.(I must say, the WiFi did go out for almost a full day while we were here, but the problem was resolved in less than 24 hours, and if you're not a business traveler spending your whole vacation in your hotel worrying about the WiFi, then you have more problems than just "the hotel's WiFi broke." Chill out. Go to the zoo. Go to the beach. Go get your WiFi at the Starbucks next door.)

I have recently returned from a 2 week holiday in Honolulu, staying at the Park Shore Waikiki Hotel, we stayed the entire 2 weeks here, it was a great location, right across from the beach, near Honolulu Zoo, up the Diamond Head end, it was much quieter at night, and lovely staff, clean rooms and very comfortable beds, we stayed in a Ocean front room, on the 11th floor,which I would recommend, if you can possibly do this, the views were spectacular, and the sunsets could be watched, away from the crowded beach, from your rooms balcony, the hotel is an Aqua brand and offers a courtesy shuttle bus stopping at other Aqua hotels along the way, ending up at Ala Moana shopping centre, although we did find it somewhat unreliable, at times, as to waiting time for pick ups, very reasonable room rates, not many amenities, free cold drinks in lobby through out the day and coffee in the mornings, WI fi, and a small swimming, pool, the Resort fee of $20.00 Us $$$ plus tax,a day per room is not ideal, but it is one of the cheaper resort fees in Waikiki, the only negative we found with our stay was the younger Bell boys, need more training as to haw to get somewhere and even if that place is still open, we wanted to go to Hilo Hattie's, and was directed to pick up the free trolley at a nearby hotel, only to walk their, and find this shop and trolley had not been operating for almost 5 years, just a little update needed for them, just good we had been here on a holiday before and knew our way around, otherwise good service from the tours desk also, the hotel also has a bar and diner attached, which I found a bit noisy at night when they had live music, even with the door closed, you could still hear the music, and they do look after you, just some things could have been better, I would defiantly recommend staying here, and if I am fortunate enough to ever go back, I would consider staying here again, great holiday hotel.

My partner and I stayed here for a week. Great hotel located right on Waikiki beach. The pool was quite small but when you have the Pacific Ocean a stones throw away in front of you why bother hanging out at the pool all day? The zoo is next door although we didn't visit this I'm sure this would interest most people. The hotel mainly had couples here didn't seem many families I'm guessing this is because of the pool situation and that there is no child entertainment. The hotel provides you with a card to pick up some beach towels for free which is ideal when you can't wash your own beach towels. Staff were friendly and very informative we arrived back at the hotel late one night and wanted something simple to eat reception was happy to suggest a few places that did take out food late at night. There are 2 convenience stores on the hotel along with 2 food places. The hotel offered some yoga classes which I'm sure would interest a lot of people. Coffee was provided every day for us after the maid cleaned the room and changed the glassesAnd cups every day too. The free toiletries were Hawaiian tropic which in the U.K is a pretty decent brand so that was a nice little extra. There's a free safe, hair dryer, ironing board and iron too along with vending machines and microwaves provided on another floor the air con was decent too. Only thing I would change is they could of provided some chairs for the balcony although we picked a standard room two chairs could of easily fit on the balcony. Wifi was also really good and kept us connected while on the beach right out side the hotel ideal for face timing home to make the family jealous like we did ;). All in all would definitely recommend this hotel especially if it's your first time in Oahu as all the amenities are very close by. Mahalo park shore for making our holiday comfortable.

Oceanfront! Great position at reasonable prices. Views do not get any better - wide beach, Waikiki Wall and enclosed swimming area all in front of the hotel. Great views of Diamond Head and the ocean! In a quieter position at one end of the hotel strip on Kalakaua Avenue, the hotel offers more relaxed surroundings with mountain and greenery views than the centre of the strip. If you want action, it's just a 5 minute walk straight along Kalakaua to be in the middle of everything. Hotel staff were cheery and always helpful. Room housekeeping was excellent. Clean beach towels available at front desk, activities assistance available in lobby. Rooms were clean, large enough and had great air conditioning! Shops and restaurants within and adjoining the hotel. Internet booking service staff were extremely helpful - all went super smooth! We will certainly stay again on next visit.

We stayed at this hotel which was not the most luxurious we've ever stayed at nevertheless and sort of pleasant stay. The rooms were small and dated but it is what you would expect from a 3 star hotel.The main pool area was facing the main road so was quite noisy and not so relaxing. The beach however was stunning with clear blue waters but crowded in places. Worth a stay of you aren't staying for too long. Plenty of restaurants and bars a short walk away.

Great Location ---- We stayed 1- pre-night and 1-post night our Hawaiian Cruise ----- the Front Desk Employees where outstanding -very helpful and nice and friendly - so where the Bell Hop Staff .We had a Group of 28 staying at the Hotel - and NO Issues

Great location, beautiful views from balcony, nice clean room, helpful front desk. Walking distance to zoo, aquarium, beach, restaurants, everything! Quieter part of Waikiki beach. Would definitely stay there again!

Staff was nice but room and mattress smelled like piss. Couldn't get a different room due to booking. We were with a group of twenty eight people. Location was nice close to beach and zoo but the smell overrides a good review.

This was one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The room was awesome, the location was walking distance to shops, restaurants, the beach, attractions. The bus stop was right outside the hotel entrance. The room/lobby was clean. The services (beach towels, beach chairs, luggage storage bf check-in, internet, etc) were very much appreciated. There was always someone at the front desk and the bell hop desk if we had questions.

This was our first visit to Hawaii and the hotel was close to the sea and had a good sized pool as well everything was good from the friendly staff to the good sized rooms.The constantly refreshed complimentary drinks was a nice touch.

this hotel is at the quiet end of the main street .Our room had views of the beachthe room was clean and were serviced every day .The staff were very nice and helpfulit is walking distance to every thing and the beach is across the street perfect and there is a ABC store also .There is also a place you can book surfing lessons and book day activities in the hotel lobby

Booked via booking.com. Lots of hotels to choose from in Waikiki Beach area, some very expensive and in the centre of the main area. We preferred to be at the end of the Main Street where the beach was much less crowded and the noise level was low. Right on the front overlooking the beach, given a complimentary upgrade and bottle of wine for our anniversary. Porters there to help on arrival, receptionist provided speedy and efficient check in. NOTE they provide free pool towels, we didn't realised and packed our own. Upgraded to a dual aspect partial sea view, rooms contained 2 double beds, plenty of space, filter coffee machine with daily replenishment and ware on arrival, plus fridge and full range of Hawaiian Tropic products including body lotion. Everything was replenished daily. Reception offers free coffee in the morning and water in the afternoon. Hotel directly opposite the beach which was quiet and absolutely stunning! Pool in the hotel surrounded by loungers, not the biggest pool but big enough, ice making machine on the same level (3). ABC stores either side of hotel ideal for water, snacks, alcohol and souvenirs. Attached to the hotel is a restaurant open for breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks, great service and views of the beach. Approx 30 mins walk to Diamond Head, right next to the zoo and 5 mins walk from aquarium. There are other more upmarket hotels like the Moana but they are really busy, the beach in front was packed and is more crowded in that area. The Park Shore is a perfect stroll past many shops and restaurants into the busier area, that's if you want to go as there is plenty on food/drink on your doorstep. I would definately stay here again!!! PLEASE NOTE there are extra charges, the tourist tax and the resort fee to add to your room rate, all USA hotels apply or include this in their rate.

If you don't t up grade your room to a view Don t bother .The standard room faces a large building and all you see is into 100 other rooms .Tried to get moved more than 2 times with a bad attitude each time .So more that half the rooms here will be staring at another building .Other hotels at least overlook the city or diamondhead this one not so much.The pool closes at around 6pm so if you are out for the day and come back its closed also no hot tub either.They charge what the good hotels charge for a resort charge 20.00 a night but Don t give you much for it .Its also the very last hotel on the strip quite far from the strip 2 miles from the Hilton village.

We were only here for one night, so we didn’t get to experience a lot the hotel had to offer. However; the staff was amazing and the location was outstanding. The view from our room was breathtaking.And although our room was comfortable, and was supplied with the basic amenities, it was very small and somewhat cramped. The AC in our room was struggling to keep our room cold during the middle of the day.That being said, we were satisfied with our room.

We knew we'd be busy with activities so just wanted a nice bed close to the beach. Staff was incredible and the location was great. Not too noisy or crowded as could be found a few blocks up the street. Rooms were clean & although a bit small but we all 4 fit. Tips: we used booking.com then cancelled days before the trip & booked through the hotel saving $40/day. Keep an eye on fluctuating prices. Don't rent boogie boards if you'll use them more than 1 day; buy some at Walmart then leave them behind, it is cheaper. Waikiki beach has rocks once you get into the waves; careful not to cut your feet.

We have stayed here numerous times. Never disappoints us. We have had pretty much every kind of room. Location location location. We have yet to go to the pool it closes kinda early and usually has many people around. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Towels and beach chairs available easy check in and out. Access to Lulu's restaurant from inside hotel.

The very last hotel on the main boulevard before the Zoo, and across the street from the beach. I've never heard of this hotel before (despite having been to Oahu like, 8 times) and was a bit skeptical booking it, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's an older property built in maybe the 1960s or 1970s, but the upkeep is really good, and the place is clean. It's a skyrise hotel, but the front desk is small and usually staffed by one or two people. Yet, we never had to wait long for checkin, checkout, or beach towel service. The standard room we got was slightly smaller than I had imagined, but it was still plenty for two adults. Besides, on a beautiful island like Oahu, our hotel room was just a place we kept our luggage, slept, and used the bathroom. My favorite shopping and dining places were within easy walking distance (5 or 10 minutes). I am happy to have chosen Park Shore Waikiki because it is actually quiet at night since it is not in the center of the bustling noisy part of the strip. The only true concern I have is that the door to your room is very heavy, and I had to help a wheelchair neighbor get into his room a few times because it is hard to hold the door open while getting yourself in... Also, there really isn't a self parking lot, and valet was $28/day. Valet service was very prompt, however.

This is out third stay at the Park Shore Hotel. Again, a good stay. Friendly check in and service, and no worries about our request of a room change. The shuttle to and from Ala Moana Centre is really useful and Earl, the driver, was fantastic. He a pleasant commentary on all local attractions.It's a quiet hotel, good standard of cleanliness and close to the beach. The zoo is not a problem at all. If we visit Honolulu again, we will stay there.

This hotel is located on the Diamond Head end of the Waikiki Strip so is a little removed from the main hustle and bustle which for me is a bonus.Friendly and efficient staff.I had an ocean view room on Level 12 and it was a great view. There was also an awesome full side on view on Diamond Head on the balcony as you went from the lift to your room.I would stay here again.

If you choose ocean view room, you might be able to see Diamond head too! ( sorry if not but I tried three times and always can enjoy both mountain and ocean )They are always helpful and kind.Easy access to go anywhere.

Location is phenomenal. Unobstructed view of Diamond Head. Across street from Waikiki Beach. Surf school in lobby, lessons just a few steps away. You can choose either the water that's protected by a wave break (good for small children) or without it (good for surfing). Free hotel shuttle takes you to Ala Moana mall. Two ABC stores downstairs and a Japanese restaurant. One of our rooms was big enough for the king-sized bed and not much else (17th floor) but had superb view of Diamond Head. Other room had two queens and more room, overlooking pool and beach (5th floor). That room got very hot in late afternoon, even with a/c on. Staff incredibly accommodating.

convent location, very nice people, easy public transportation from this hotel.. nice a close to the beach and good restaurants. walking distance to many great shops and other resorts. Most likely would come back to this location. great views of the beach and Diamond Head.

Stayed here for 6 nights in mid August. Great location right next to the park and minutes to the beach. Hotel staff were pleasant and courteous and check in was quick. Rooms were very clean bed was very comfortable and room cleaned daily to a high standard. However I would say that the Reception and the hotel corridor and lift could use a facelift as it looked tired and old fashioned. The rooms were of a good standard and I think have been decorated recently. Toiletries were provided daily and the air conditioning worked really well. For a mid priced hotel it was a good find and I would recommend it.

This hotel was a nice surprise. It's a 3 star but with its service and proximity to water and cleanliness I would rate it close to 4 stars Very happy we choose to stay here.You get beach towels and can borrow beach chairs

Best location in Waikiki, easy walk down to shops, restaurants, beach and then also walk to Diamond Head. Just far enough away from the busyness. Friendly and helpful front desk staff, free hire of beach chairs from front desk, free wifi. Small but clean rooms. As its the last hotel on the front strip before Diamond Head we had uninterrupted views over the beach and Diamond Head. Spectacular.

Park shore is located on Waikiki strip, just across the street from the beach. The staff were very helpful and always out to please. Room was just what a tourist requires, bar fridge, safe and coffee maker with coffee supplies. Daily cleaning and stocking of towels and toiletries. Lobby has ice water and juice throughout the day and coffee in the morning.Great place to stay and would definitely go there again.

This is a great hotel at the far end of the beach but still in walking distance to it all. The staff are magnificent (especially Risa) and the hotel amenities are pretty good for the price. The views over the ocean and Diamond Head are great too.The pool is small but the deck area is large and there are plenty of sun beds if you want to relax. Service was excellent from all staff I came into contact with and the lifts are quick to arrive too. Knowledgeable front desk staff are happy to help.The room was very clean and comfortable. The balcony is large enough to comfortably dine on and they provide furniture out there too. The bathroom is small but functional although there's hardly any room to put your toiletries anywhere. The bed was comfy but as our room as on the top floor the air conditioning was noisy.All in all I thought this was a good value choice - especially good for those who want to be near the zoo.

Park Shore is the hotel at the very end of Waikiki, right next to the zoo and with a fabulous view of Diamond Head. (Because this is not in the centre of Waikiki the hotel rates are a bit more moderate, although the hotel is certainly just as good as the others.) The staff is very nice and always helpful, the rooms are spacious and very clean. The beach is just across the road, it is a three minutes' walk. All in all, this is a great place to stay.

This was our first time visiting Hawaii and we were so happy with our choice of accommodation. You are literally just a pedestrian crossing away from the beach which was fantastic. It's at the quieter end of Waikiki which was fine for us. Our standard room was fine for three adults and if we needed anything extra in our room, reception was very quick to service our needs. We will certainly be coming back here!

We stayed for 10 days at The Park Shore in a Sea Front room and were very happy with everything about it. It is across the road from Waikiki beach, the open beach and a rock pool area. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and a good size with a nice balcony that looked over the beach and pool. It was a real King Size bed which was very comfortable and our room was serviced every day.It is located on a busy corner, which during the day can be very noisy, but after 6pm and before 6.30am the traffic was all but non-existent. The other issue which did not just occur here was the very strict 3pm check-in time. I contacted the hotel a few weeks in advance to inform them of a 11.30 arrival, we arrived on time but still had to wait until 2pm to get access to the room. As I said this happened in LA as well. So I suggest that if you are going to arrive early, pack a change of clothes, so you can drop your bags off and go for a walk or swim.they do offer towels and chairs for the beach at no charge, which came in very handy.Overall a great place to stay

We stay here once a year, every year. Good for families. Enjoy the complimentary coffee in the morning. Love the poolside lanai category, ocean view of Waikiki Beach from the pool. Close to restaurants and shopping. Clean & great value.

We were extremely happy with this hotel. The staff was very accommodating to us ,courteous and very helpful with ideas of where to eat and sightsee. I would highly recommend This hotel being so close to the beach, stores to shop, and restaurants to eat . The staff went beyond our expectations to make our stay there memorable.

We like the park shore when we go the okinawan festival. As a family with three rooms we were put all on the same floor. It would have been better if they had connecting rooms to help families with children. They did before but seems like they got rid of them when they did renovation a few years ago.

We chose this hotel due to proximity to Diamond Head yet near the beach. And we didn't want to be in the noisy hubbub of the more touristy area. Beach was literally across the street with easy access. Though in our mid-60's we opted to walk to Diamond Head, which wasn't bad at all. Be sure to go early as it starts getting warm and crowded really quickly. Hotel room was nice. However, they had a weird fire alarm that came through the phone. Apparently there was a fire alarm, but the phone rang as I think we couldn't hear the alarm too well. My memory is sketchy as it was 8 months ago. But I do remember thinking receiving a phone call was unusual.Overall we were pleased with the room. Our room looked at the beach without balcony. But there was a balcony that faced south on which one person could sit as it was quite small. You can see the beach from there, but I don't know that it was worth the extra money for balcony, especially since you're not in your room that much plus the fact we could see the beach by just standing and looking out the window. Usually we were out walking or ON the beach - not looking at it from a window/balcony.

My wife and I have recently spent a week here in one of the one bedroom suites and I'm pleased to write this review. This hotel is a 3 star hotel and doesn't pretend to be anything else. It is clean and the staff were all great. The best thing about it is its 5 star location. First, it has the beach right in front, the same beach the locals head to. Next, on the left side of the hotel there is a park and the zoo, so the view to either Diamond Head or the water is clear and uninterrupted. No buildings to look through. Thirdly, it is at the quiet end of Waikiki so there are no crowds. There are plenty of stores and cafes at the door step and the main part of Waikiki is only a $6-10 Uber ride away or a gentle stroll. Whilst the pool area isn't flash, the pool is beautifully clean and the lounge beds and furniture all in good shape. The best compliment I can give is that we'll be bringing our kids back next year with their partners and we'll be booking at the Park Shore.

Poor bathroom cleanliness, very good location, they discontinued the brilliant courtesy room which was perfect for customers who want take a shower after checking out and before a long intercontinental flight

Location could not be better! Across from zoo. Restaurant next door is amazing. Pool is nice. Staff were fantastic! Very helpful and friendly! They made us feel like family and remembered our names after one time! Always a cheerful greeting and good recommendations!

This hotel is a wonderful place to stay! Easy to get in and out of Waikiki and it is located right across the street from the beach. Staff is so extremely friendly, I don't stay anywhere else when I am on island for business. Looking forward to going back next month.

This trip was originally planned to celebrate my wife and her twin sister's 40th birthday. Unfortunately my sister-in-law lost her battle to illness and so we jetted off a few months post this with heavy hearts but knowing this would be an important time to be together as a family. There were 13 of us with three groups booked in at the Park Shore. We had travelled to Waikiki a couple of times and were aware that most hotels can't check you in until 3pm. I had written ahead and liaised with the wonderful Roxy and she said that they would do their best to accommodate an earlier check in and were able to do so for one of our groups immediately on our arrival at 9am. The rest of us were able to check in shortly after 12 and were very grateful for this. From the airport if you book ahead, use Charley's taxi service which has a flat rate of $29 from the airport to any hotel in Waikiki and this is significantly cheaper than trying to get a cab at the airport. We requested and secured an ocean front room (1007) and our lenai (balcony) faced Diamond Head to the left and straight out to the wonderful Pacific Ocean. The extra money was most definitely worth it. We could also look down over the pool area. We requested two double beds and had two adults and two children and this was fine during our 14 night stay. The room size was fine and the balcony gave you an escape (and what an escape). The room was immaculately cleaned daily and new sheets were provided every third day. There was a safe and fridge and coffee facilities available. Situated either side of the hotel are ABC stores and there is also a Starbucks (though the best coffee was either Island Vintage Coffee which was a ten minute walk North bound on Kalakaua Avenue near the Royal Hawaiian Centre or a five minute stroll to Kai Coffee located in the Hyatt Regency. There was a walk through from Level 2 to Lu, a restaurant/bar which is a great place to take in a sunset over a drink. Hotel also offers 15% of breakfast, lunch or dinner there. The hotel is situated at the end of Kalakaua Avenue adjacent to the zoo and it's a 10 minute stroll to the heart of Waikiki. This made for a relaxing stroll home from the many restaurants that are in the heart of Waikiki (particularly after a large meal)!The hotel offered a free shuttle bus that would go to Ala Moana shopping centre and departed at 30-40 minute intervals throughout the day and would also pick you up and drop you back at the hotel. It was very convenient. We stayed at the Outrigger last time (heart of Waikiki) however for value for money and for tremendous views and friendly and attentive staff, we would have no hesitation staying at Park Shore next time and recommend it highly! Mahalo.

Park Shore at Waikiki is located across the road from the beach and the zoo. The hotel is old, as I guess a lot are here. Some renovations (bathrooms and lobby) would not go amiss but it is clean and functional. We upgraded on our second stay to an ocean view balcony room and loved it. Great for sitting out with morning coffee or late night sippy. Staff are friendly and helpful. Recommend this hotel.

We stayed in an ocean front room overlooking Waikiki beach. The room appears to have been recently renovated. The location of the Park Shore hotel is ideal. It is located on the south side of Waikiki beach. There are numerous restaurants and ABC stores nearby. There is a shuttle that takes you to the shopping district. We preferred to walk and enjoy the scenery.

We loved this spot, everything at your finger tips. Shops, resturants, the beach and the Zoo across the road also. Great staff, helpful and friendly. I would stay here again. Nice lobby and pool area. Free drinks in the lobby daily, juice and coffee/tea.

We loved our stay here. It is clean and tidy and in a handy location to everything that we needed. They offer car parking (at a cost of $26 US at day if you have rental car) which was something we needed. The staff were friendly and always on hand to help. The pool area was perfect when you have a 7 year old and the others staying there were always friendly. I would not hesitate to stay here again on our return. Really good all round location and there were families, honeymoon couples or just those that wanted a great deal/location. The beach is across the road where it has a great surf/boogie boarding area and then across a brake and they have an area that has a break wall that is calm and perfect to swim, relax in. We had stunning views of the ocean and Diamond Head from our room and we paid for for this and it was worth it but next time with our son we are just going to say in a pool side room so that he can just walk out the door and go for a swim and we can see him from our room. (pool side rooms are way cheaper). We had a room with two double beds and there was three of us that used this being our 7 year old son and my partner and I. Perfect for us.

We stayed here for about 5 days on our honeymoon. The room was fairly small but the beachfront balcony was definitely worth the price. It was key that Tucker & Bevvy is located in the lobby. The towel rentals were great and the short walk to the beach was also ideal.
user_name:
mmitche8
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My wife and I have been to Waikiki a number of times - most recently this past July ( 2017). While there are other hotels that sit directly on the beach, in our opinion, there is no other hotel that gives you grater value for your money than the Park Shore. It has an ideal location across the street from the beach and beside the Honolulu zoo and Kapiolani park. There are lots of amenities next to the hotel like the pool, Starbucks, Lulu's and a Japanese restaurant and of course the ubiquitous ABC stores. The hotel also features a surf shop as well. My wife and I really enjoyed going for walks at nearby Kapiolani park and having supper at the Barefoot Beach bar café where you can breathe in the salty air of the ocean and watch the amazing tropical sunsets.The hotel itself is very clean and very well kept. The lobby has nice tropical flower displays and we really liked the openness of the space and floor to ceiling windows that let in so much light.The staff is extremely helpful and friendly both at the front desk and the cleaning staff. A nice touch since we were last there is the free wifi in your rooms and the beach towel and chairs the Park Shore makes available.We will be returning to admire the views of Diamond Head and the vistas of the blue Pacific ocean you can see from your room. We recommend the "ocean front" rooms - well worth the extra dollars.All in all a great tropical bang for your buck !

This hotel is fabulous. We enjoyed every aspect of the hotel. The staff take this hotel to the next level. Nothing is ever too much for any staff member at this hotel. Facilities are fantastic you don't need to travel too far for necessities. We love this hotel.

Park Shore feels like home to us! This was our second stay here. First of all, we love the location--it is towards the end of Waikiki (by the zoo) which means less foot traffic and just feels a little more laid back. The hotel is attached to an ABC store, which was super convenient for any late night or random necessities. There is also a Starbucks right outside and a great restaurant/bar right outside too (LuLu's). The pool is big but there is no hot tub. The only thing about the pool is that the lounge chairs are a bit worn, one tore when I plopped down on it and I am about 120 lbs... but no big deal because we go to Hawaii for the beaches! Speaking of which, the beach is right across the street from the hotel, that one is the "wall" beach, right by Waikiki pier-- better suited for kids, very, very mild waves but you are just steps away from additional beaches. The hotel provides towels using a card check out system and will also provide chairs (we used them last year but not this year). The hotel does additional little things to enhance your stay. They have a welcome reception I believe on Wednesdays and have yoga on specific days. There is a Japanese restaurant on the first floor and a surf school along with an Expedia adventure desk. The hotel provides a coffee/punch/water station throughout the day. We were in room 1014, room is a good size, king bed, and includes mini fridge, coffee maker, and additional standard amenities. The bed and pillows were super comfortable and clean! The housekeeper did a great job of maintaining the rooms clean. I believe all rooms have a lanai. This particular room has a partial ocean view, the only downside is that it also has a view of the building right across the way and the alley/garbage cans below. We would definitely book an ocean view/pool view next time. The bathroom has dual sinks, a tub, and I love that they use Hawaiian Tropic toiletries. The staff was friendly and helpful whenever necessary, we called ahead of time and were able to secure an early check in but they do have a hospitality room if they aren't able to do so. Overall, this is a great place! Clean, comfortable, in a convenient location, friendly staff, and feels homey. We would definitely stay here again.

Park Shore is a mixed bag, it's not the place to have a cocktail beside the pool but on saying that it's a great location, great staff and meets the normal standard of American hotels.I picked it for the view of the Pacific Ocean, the short walk to sheltered and unsheltered beaches. There are great places to eat close by but also a 15 minute walk to the main shopping and dining area. The walk is great after the large American meals. Great place for some rest and relaxation.

While not directly in Waikiki Beach, this hotel is one we've stayed at multiple times including this trip. It's a literally across the street from our favorite part of the beach (fine sand, calm and clean waters, shower, bathrooms within walking distance) and you can even catch some waves on the other side of the barrier. The price is good and generally cheaper than the big name hotels on the beach itself. And the value is good, they give out free beach towels and beach lounge chairs for you to use. Did I mention they helped me adjust my dates when we arrived a day earlier than what I booked, no added cost or hassle? (A mental mistake). All while greeting us with cups of cold guava juice during checkin. Lastly, the view. The ocean view (even the partial ocean view) is pretty darn awesome, with no hotel in the way to block that view.

I wish I could remember the name of the sweet girl who checked me in! She knew this vacation was really special for my husband and I and really went the extra mile! I also highly recommend Lulu' on the second floor, great place for a drink!

Nothing fancy, but if you are looking for a nice, clean, comfortable hotel right in front of a nice part of Waikiki Beach, this place is it. Pricing good, team/service friendly, and in a quieter section of Waikiki, next to Honolulu Zoo so there is green park on one side. Would gladly stay here again.

Arrived at 10am after travelling for approx. 24 hours, only to be told we could not check in for anotber 5 hours!!! We came from winter and were not dressed for the heat. We were tired and in need of a shower. Not happy that we had to just sit it out and wait until exactly 3pm before we could check in. Surely if the room was prepared we should have been allowed to go up. Put a spoiler on the start to our holiday.

What can be said about the Park Shore that hasn't already been said ?The staff are awesome - check The views are to die for- checkThe rooms are clean and well equipped- checkThe pool is awesome - check Weekly cocktails with the manager - checkYoga in the park- checkBig comfy beds - checkABC and Starbucks on site - checkIs this a big resort with a huge pool with 3000 screaming kids and all fancy shops and restaurants? No ! And thank god it is not! This is a quieter property just far away from the hustle and bustle to keep you sane but not so far that you cannot walk there easily. It is not fancy or luxurious - but it is clean and comfortable. If your are expecting the best of everything then pay double or triple or more to stay at the Moana or Sheraton with everyone else.The price is right and the view is the best on the strip.Special shout out to Ethan and Michelle who always make you feel welcome and are so helpful!

Our family stayed here for the night while our son was in a surf competition. We were greeted with the most friendly staff and they went out of their way to help us with everything we needed. I would highly recommend this resort for the cleanliness and friendly customer service let alone the value! great place to stay and oh the views of Diamond head and waikiki! Amazing!

Out of the 4 hotels we stayed at this one had to be the best. The check in staff were efficient and amazing and they upgraded us to a ocean view room at no extra cost.With Lulu's restaurant and Hula's next door the noise was not heard from the room.Rooms were clean, spacious and ever single staff member helped us when we needed it, showed us that famous Aloha spirit the world hears about while giving you the privacy you need.When we come back we are spending our entire trip their as the location is at the bottom of Kalakaua avenue where it is just as beautiful but not as busy, everything was walking distance and those famous ABC stores you see, well they had two there so if you couldn't find one at your hotel you walked next door to get what you needed.Pool was really relaxing as well.Highly recommended

This 3 star hotel is ideally located just across the road from the beach and about 500 meters from central Waikiki. While showing its age the hotel itself is in reasonable condition- good pool with several restaurants to choose from. The main restaurant ( Lulu's) is noisy with average food . However the Japanese restaurant food was superb located in the foyer. Tucker and Bevvy , also in the foyer is a deli offering fresh sandwiches, fruit etc.Hotel staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. Our room was about 20 sq meters - quite small but adequate. No cooking facilities except for a coffee maker. Small fridge . Apparently a communal microwave was available down stairs. We had room 511 overlooking the pool, the zoo , Diamond head and the beach- perfect ! Lots of Kiwis and Aussies stay here -at $200 USD a night its not cheap but the location makes up for it

Had the best experience in this nicely renovated hotel with a beach front view. I enjoyed every minute of our stay. On the last day of my stay as I look out the window i came across a beautiful rainbow on the ocean. It was simply breathtaking!

Oceanfront room had beautiful unobstructed views! What a great value! It's an older building but clean and comfortable. Our balcony felt very private. We were also happy to be on the quieter end of the strip with a Starbucks right next door. We will be back!

Stay here to be close to Kapiolani park and beach. Hire companies are right on hand. Do the Hawaii Turtle Tour for $99 per person. 8-5pm today. Great.Book a partial sea view to watch the action each morning. Great.Wai Lana Coffee House for best pancakes.

very good position, just in front of the beach. Beach towels and chairs are complimentary. Valet parking is very efficient, my room was standard but could see the ocean partially. Very efficient front desk at check in and check out. In general a well maintained property. Food shops and Starbucks at the ground floor.

Great location at the bottom end of Waikiki beach next to the zoo. It's much quieter at this end of the strip but only a short walk into the main town. We were originally offered an 18th floor standard room but it looked directly into the hotel opposite which was literally just a few feet away! For an extra $55 a night we upgraded to a corner room overlooking Waikiki beach and the Diamond Head crater. We could watch the sun set in the evening from our balcony and it's well worth the extra money. The balcony was also larger with the upgrade. My advice would be not to accept the first upgrade that you get offered and see what other rooms are available.

I loved staying here, we were on the 18th floor. The pool was on the corner of the third level and looked out to the Honolulu zoo on one side and the beach on the other. It was convenient that Lulu's was accessible from the 2nd floor- we ate breakfast and a dinner there, casual and fun. The Park shore staff were very helpful and there was a free shuttle to the Alamoana shopping centre. The Zoo is across the road and the Waikiki Aquarium was a 5-10 minute walk along the path beside the beach. This accommodation ticked all the boxes for a relaxing finish to an amazing holiday.

Wonderful staff and location... Starbucks is on the main level plus the beach is right there!! LuLu's restaurant is attached to the hotel and has great food plus overlooks the beach... LuLu's has lots of large flat screen televisions so I can watch sports while the wife looks at the ocean!

Great location and unreal view from the rooms and pool area.Beds could of been a bit more comfy but were still good.Super friendly and helpful staff.Super easy to find your way around waikiki from the hotel including public transport and tour shuttle pick ups and drop offs.

Our first stay in Hawaii and the first part was at Park Shore Waikiki as we wanted to stay in Waikiki but not in the crazy busy part of town. Had a great stay and can recommend this to others without hesitation.

It was a nice hotel. Beds were really nice. We had a good view. They have Hawaiian soap, hawaiian coffee and hawaiian cookies when you check in. The towels were nice and yoga class aswell. The cleaning is very good.

Location location location! This hotel has the best location in Waikiki easily accessible by locals to visit family staying at the hotel. The staff are friendly and made us feel like family. We arrived early and Ethan at the front desk made us feel particularly welcome and took great care of us. The room was beautiful and comfortable with an amazing view. The bathroom amenities went the extra mile and were a fancy Hawaiian brand. We really enjoyed the Hawaiian cookies in the room and the Hawaiian juice in the lobby. We have stayed at many hotels on Oahu and the extra touches, location, and customer service like what Ethan provided are what make this hotel stand out.

I enjoy staying at this hotel for its value, location and valet parking.The checking in and checking out process is easy and swift.The beach is only just across the street and Diamond Head is only minutes away.

We stay here once a year for mayjah rayjah concert at the shell! The park shore is the best choice always. The location is prime to the Waikik shell with in a 5 min or less walk. I love hanging out by the pool and checking out the waves at the same time. The sun is perfect for tanning when at the park shore pool

I chose Park Shore because it was reasonably priced and right across from Waikiki Beach I'm so glad I did it was in a wonderful spot, nicely located on the edge of the touristy area. A couple miles from Diamond Head⛰ across the street from the Zoo and couple blocks to the Aquarium there were lots of shops and plenty of restaurants coffee shops☕️ and convenience stores within walking distance. They have a shuttle to the Huge Mall The Rainbow Drive in was a half mile walk away My room was cleaned daily and stocked with a nice supply of toiletries. They had a nice little pool. There was a Night Club the next hotel over that was happening I would stay here again for sure

Picked the Park Shore based on the value for the room and location.. Everyone on the staff was helpful, courteous, and cheerful. The room was clean and comfortable. We would definitely recommend this hotel based on the value and location.

First of all, just know that if you tell anyone this is an Aqua Hotel, no one will know what you're talking about though the hotel seems to work hard to promote this identity. By 'no one', I'm talking about the airport shuttle service, any cab driver, bus drivers, etc. Initially when we arrived, I was not impressed at all. The lobby has the feel of a remodeling project that ran short of funds. It feels incomplete with an overall feel of modernity with fringes of forgone tackiness. Everything is carpeted which really seems gross for such a humid, tropical environment. Also, the entrance into the lobby is open to the outside thus there is no central air conditioning which means it is very humid, musty and warm. After all the traveling were had been doing, it's not a welcome relief I was hoping for. There was really not much that was inviting and warm about it. On the day we arrived, the hotel was in the midst of a huge transition with many guests checking out and about a 100 more guests checking in. Unfortunately, we had to wait until EXACTLY 3pm for our rooms to be ready (we arrived at 9am). So, I would plan that out better. The rooms were actually better than I expected. We didn't get an oceanside view (although I had made the reservations months in advance). Our views were directly into rooms of other guests at an adjacent hotel! The rooms were clean and functional. There is a small restaurant LuLu attached to the hotel thru the lobby that bears mentioning because I loved it. This restaurant/ cafe saved me. They offered healthy good food at a convenience and a good price. Overall, the location of this hotel is great. It's practically on the beach and is along the strip. It's location & price makes up a lot for some of its shortcomings.

The hotel is very nice and in a Great location at the end of the Waikiki strip. Staff is friendly and it was nice that beach towels are provided. Room was nice though the bathroom could use some updating. However location on the back of the nldgnis loud in the morning.

We had left behind an SD card with multiple videos and pictures in our room, we called the front desk from the airport as soon as we realized it was left behind. A wonderful employee by the name of Ethan Tmodrang, retrieved the SD card from the room and immediately sent it out to us. You have a excellent staff with the true sense of Aloha at this hotel.

We recently stayed here for 5 days in July. The location is perfect for the price. It is across from a nice spot on Waikiki beach and swimming cove. We had the top floors with great views of the ocean and Diamond Head. It was very quiet at night which we appreciated. The bests were the only downside, not that comfortable. I requested a kettle so I could make my morning tea and it was delivered right away.

Nicely located, right across the beach where you can swim and surf. There is a surfing school right in the hotel. There is access to an ABC store at the hotel as well so very convenient. Walking distance to restaurants, and Diamond Head is only half hour walk from the hotel.

We visited Honolulu recently and stayed at the Park Shore Waikiki Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised at how conveniently it was located. We were on Oahu for The Mayjah Rayjah 2017 concert which was being held at the Waikiki Shell. What a surprise to find out it was within a short walk from the hotel as was the Honolulu Aquarium and the Zoo which was literally across the street. Waikiki Beach was within view of the hotel too, just walk by one building and crossing a street and you are there. Would highly recommend. Staff was very friendly and helpful.The view of Diamond Head from our room was breathtaking...

Best pricing, location, views and amenities! Edge of Waikiki allowed for unobstructed views of Diamond Head and the gorgeous Pacific. Loved our 14th floor room with views of both. Bed was super comfortable, too. Location couldn't be better with a delicious, upscale and healthy breakfast and lunch place attached, the beach just steps away, and many other food and shopping options close by. A memory to last a lifetime!!

Risa- Well groomed, warm smile, and a wonderful personality. Risa made sure our accommodations were met. My family and I felt her aloha from the other side of the counter. Our stay at your hotel was a relaxing and comfortable one. Risa is the face of Park Shore Waikiki.Roxy- When Risa was not there, Roxy made sure that we were still taken cared of. Her pleasant smile made us feel welcomed, as Risa did. Roxy was able to assist my daughter with extending her check out time. I appreciated that she was able to do that for it was my daughter's anniversary.Ethan- He was able to accommodate my daughter's last minute request to upgrade her room to a pool side. Ethan's gentle smile made us feel that if can then can if no can then at least he tried, but Ethan made it happen. My daughter was greatly appreciated. Kana'i- As we walked into the hotel all we could see was his bright smile sending positive energy to the guest as we walk through the lobby. Kana'i was ready to assist guest as they checked in although it was a bit busy. As we left the hotel to enjoy our evening he bid us "Have a great time, have fun."Po'okela- As we were coming back from our event, with an uplifting smile, Po'okela asked if we enjoyed our night. Although it was a late night shift, he still had a positive attitude and bit us a good night.Chad- He checked our car in with quickness, suggested then assisted my family and I with our bags to our room, Chad introduced himself and advised us that if we needed anything just give him a call.OVERALL, OUR STAY AT YOUR HOTEL WAS A PLEASANT ONE. I ALSO WANTED TO THANK YOUR FRONT DESK CREW FOR THINKING OF MY FAMILY AND I, AS THEY SENT CHAMPAGNE AND CHOCOLATE TO MY DAUGHTER'S ROOM FOR HER ANNIVERSARY. FOR THAT I AM SO GRATEFUL FOR ALL THE HOSPITALITY, AND WARM ALOHA THAT YOUR TEAM HAS MADE US EXPERIENCE THROUGH OUT OUR STAY. I WILL HIGHLY RECOMMEND PARK SHORE WAIKIKI TO MY FAMILY AND FRIENDS. DEAR SIR, YOU HAVE AN AWARD WINNING, 5 GOLDEN STAR CREW. MY OPINION THEY DESERVE A RAISE.

This family trip was def a memorable one!!! I will be making it out twice a year and staying at the Park Shore Waikiki for sure. Perfect location and Awesome Staff!!!! My family has been satified the entire trip.

Great views of Diamond Head and beach. Easily accessible to local restaurants and freeway. Friendly and personable staff with good service. Convenient valet parking with prompt service. Across from the beach and the zoo. Somewhat costly parking and amenity fees.

Excellent location just steps away from Waikiki Beach! Comfortable beds, tiny rooms, clean bathrooms and a mini fridge. This is not a luxury hotel but it is comfortable and friendly and has tons of shops (ABC convenience store located in the hotel), restaurants (Lulu's has an excellent view and is great for breakfast) and activities (the zoo and aquarium) nearby. I would say this was a great hotel for families BUT the rooms are SO small! We had a king size bed and ordered a crib for the room and barely had room for our two suitcases. The pool has a great view of the beach and has plenty of chairs, and umbrellas. Beach towels are readily available at the front desk. Valet parking is $22/night and a pain but necessary considering the location. Try to book on the hotel website for better deals and perks.
user_name:
neverhome007
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: So glad we paid for front facing sea view. Our room was on 11th floor You could people watch all day. Surfers were out from sunrise to sunset. Ideally placed for beach. Zoo. Transport. Restaurants. Trolleys. Hotel was clean. Friendly staff lovely pool Can't fault it

This is my 8th stay at this location. Staff is friendly, location is great, view is wonderful. I'm not one for staying in the heart of Waikiki. Waking up to a unobstructed sunrise over Diamond Head is breathtaking. Listening to the birds as the sun rises and sit on the Lanai looking out over the ocean horizon is magnificent.

We enjoyed our stay at Park Shore. It was central to everything in Waikiki, and the views from our ocean front room was beautiful. The hotel is a little bit older, however it is clean and comfortable. Be aware there is a lot of noise from the street as you are located on the main road.

Hotel is in great location. It is a little outdated but the location and semi-affordable price make up for it. Close to Diamondhead and beaches are great for kids. Tons of restaurants nearby. Buy a float and relax in ocean!

I won't bore you with all the details, but if they reward you with an upgrade for partial ocean view - RUN away! This happened to us and the front desk ladies were laughing telling us that a free upgrade was ours. It turned out to be a handicap room with no chance for us to enjoy the room with hair on the bathroom floors and absolutely no where to put your toiletries let alone to have a chair for two people to sit on. The view was tremendous but you can't sleep or take a bath with it! Annie the day clerk the next day was as friendly as your worst enemy when trying to discuss the arrangement. Leaving my wife there for the afternoon while I had to do a business meeting, she had to endure the dirtiest lobby furniture we have ever seen. I know we are spoiled to the point we moved to the nearest Marriott and paid for 2 rooms to just get away and save the early cancellation fee. It was well worth the extra money for the amenities that anyone should have minimally! I hate this type of review but the only positive experience was with Jesse the concierge.

We chose this hotel because it was one of the more affordable ones for us as honeymooners. The staff was so welcoming and accommodating. The room was clean and had a beautiful view. Everything was within walking distance, and it was directly across the street from the beach.

This was the second year in a row that we've stayed at the Park Shore Waikiki during the weekend of the Ukulele Festival at Kapiolani Park. This is the BEST location if you're attending any event at Kapiolani Park or the Waikiki Shell. It's a very short walk and no worries about parking.All the staff that we encountered were pleasant and welcoming, especially the valet and front desk. Our room was comfortable and spacious with an awesome, unobstructed view of Diamond Head and part of Waikiki beach.If you're an "A-list" member (Aqua-Aston membership program) and reserve your room 3 months in advance, you qualify for a special nightly price.We'll be there again next year!

My first time to Hawaii so wasn't sure what to be in for and definitely wasn't prepared for how busy it would be!! Coming in their summer break and winter in Australia, there was a massive convoy of Aussies, Kiwis and of course Americans! I booked at Park Shore as I had friends already booked. It was rated 3.5 stars in the accommodation book I looked at. Which was fine considering I thought I wouldn't be in the room much. The lobby is bright and airy with friendly staff. Complimentary coffee and cold drinks are on offer with internet use in the lobby also. Free wifi throughout the building. The rooms are clean, nice beds and sheets. Plenty of towels etc in the bathroom with shampoo etc topped up daily when the room is serviced. There is a safe in the room and a huge variety of tv channels! My room had a great air conditioner that was very efficient. My balcony had a small view of the beach. I took a room on the side of the hotel, as a beach view was going to cost me an extra AUD$1000 and I bought I wouldn't be in the room much to enjoy the view so decided to save the money. Besides, the beach is only a short walk 30 meters away! The pool area is ok, sunbeds and chairs and tables there. It's clean with toilets adjacent to use that also are kept spotlessly clean.There is a beach towel service, that you swap a card for. So you can get a fresh towel when swapping your card or get another fresh towel. A great service when you go to the beach and then go to the pool.The hotel is situated at the end of the main strip, Starbucks underneath and a healthy little shop with fresh fruit, yoghurt, sandwiches etc on offer. ABC stores are located to the left and ride of the hotel. There are a few restaurants also located close. It was nice to be out of the action, but only 100m up the road and you're in it! I would definitely come back and stay at Park Shore hotel. It's is great value for money!

Stayed for three nights, hotel is a short walk across the road from the quiet end of Waikiki beach. Walled area from pier makes beach perfect for children with no high waves and shallow waters. LuLu's is easy to walk through from hotel for a decent breakfast and great views of the beach. Rooms comfortable and our beachfront sea view had views of beach and Diamond Head. Very windy on floor 12, watch your hat as you round corner from lifts! Hotel price was 90 day advance notice rate for almost $900 so not cheap, but everything in Hawaii is quite expensive. Would probably choose this hotel/end of Waikiki beach again as its hectic at the resort end and its an easy 10/15min walk along at night enjoying the sunset and views.

My partner and I have stayed at Park Shore for 4-5 nights. Our ocean view room was BREATHTAKING. We even got to see Diamond Head from our room! I love the area as well, very convenient and close to Starbucks/Jamba Juice.I recommend renting a car with the hotel, they have the best deals! I will definitely come back and stay here again!Ethan was the best! 5 Star quality service. Be sure to greet him and you'll gain a friend for life :)

Nicely located in a quite part of Waikiki, close to the pier and zoo. However we found the staff lacking in warmth and helpfulness. So many answers to questions were "I don't know". I am sure we asked the standard touristy stuff. Plus we paid for a ocean view and got an obstructed view with about one third ocean. Hidden daily fees for "amenities" was really annoying and a bit of a shock....another couple of hundred U.S dollars we did not cater for. It was next to a pick up point for most tours which was an advantage. Overall, nice, quite, comfortable accommodation but we felt ripped off by hidden fees, lack of help from staff, obstructed ocean view and the distance from shopping, dining etc was a problem.

We had a great stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. You can't beat the location - right by the beach, the park and the zoo. Buses and tour pick-ups right around the corner, hotel restaurant/bar with a view right over the beach.

Love this place, especially after the upgrades. Great pool deck and near all the action. 3 elevators so no waiting. Fresh juice, coffee and ice water available in the lobby and an ABC Store, Lulu's and Starbucks just outside the door. End of the strip but close to everything and the complimentary shuttle is super-convenient. Just walk to the nearest Auq-Aston hotel and they'll come around. Especially handy after a nice dinner or a few drinks.

Lovely well located hotel in front of beach and can take partial or full beach view. Loved the stay and warm welcome and good staff. Restaurants also near by with stores and other amenities. Overall experience was excellent.

The Park Shore is at the southern end of Waikiki beach. This end is quieter but has less to choose from so you'll find yourself walking north regularly for shops, restaurants etc. The hotel is 3 star and a little tired, but the staff are helpful, the rooms clean and the pool is pretty good and usually not crowded. The comparison rate to other hotels is good but fair for the 3 star quality. For my 13yo son and I the only downside was you cannot get any cutlery, bowls or plates for your room, so having some food inside is not an option. This forces you to eat out all the time. In Waikiki, getting good food for a reasonable price is basically impossible. Getting out of Waikiki better food is available but if you don't have a car that's not so easy. Having now come to Waikiki I probably wouldn't come back, however if you do want to do a trip here this hotel is worth considering.

We have stayed at the Park Shore a couple of times. The hotel is in a great spot, on the edge of the Waikiki strip, it has a nice pool, the rooms are quite spacious and very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the hotel has a more laid back atmosphere to it, compared to some of the larger properties There is a regular shuttle bus that takes you to and from Ala Moana shopping centre.

We were overwhelmed by the location, comfort and the aloha we felt here at the Park Shore. I am sad to say that our hotel bed was more comfortable than the one we have at home. But the best part was the views from the Lanai,and the location. Close to everything in Waikiki but not in the craziness. It felt like being in old Hawaii at times. Add in the friendly staff and the experience was great. We will definitely stay with Aqua and at the Park Shore again.

Stayed here with family in two partial ocean view rooms. This hotel was great, even though it was Summer you could always get a lounge at the pool. The lobby was beautiful facing a large park. Very relaxed atmosphere. Free coffee and juice in the lobby and complimentary newspapers and wifi (all inclusive of resort fee) This hotel gets my vote because of position. Opposite Honolulu Zoo it is quiet and tranquil. ABC store in the lobby along with Starbucks both very convenient for anything you may need and both open really long hours. The rooms were a decent size as was the bathroom. A desk in the room was helpful for our lap top. It is about a 10 minute walk to the International Market Place. Personally I like being a bit out of the craziness that is Waikiki in Summer. We would stroll in for dinner and shopping and back out again when we had had enough. There is a free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre every 40 mins or so and return. The Bus stops right outside the lobby and you always get a seat because it is the start of the routes. Staff were friendly and always had a smile. We caught a cab to the start of Diamond Head trail which took about 7 mins and cost $12 we walked the trail and then walked back to the hotel. The walk back to the hotel from the end of the trail took about 25 mins. This is not a flashy hotel but was very clean and the rooms not small. There are 3 lifts and we only ever had to wait a minute at most for the elevator. This hotel would be my choice next time I'm in Waikiki.

We just returned from a family trip. The staff was very friendly and moved rooms around to make sure we were near our girls. The location is great, overlooking Diamond and the beach. We ate a Lulu's quite a bit, enjoying the views of the park and the beach. There's also a public parking lot right across the street which was very convenient for loading our rental. Park Shore on the end of Waikiki, so not quite as crowded on the streets and beach, which is used more by locals. It's also a quick walk to the zoo and aquarium and easy for Uber pick up, which we took to Diamond Head. Also, I have neck problems and found the pillow and mattress comfy. Rooms were nice with safe, mini fridge, decent toiletries. The pool area is OK, honestly we didn't use it, but being on the 3rd-floor roof, nice views.

Customer Service was excellent. A variety of food options attached to the hotel. Convenient location right across from the beach and the zoo. My only complaint would be that we had to pay an additional $150 Resort Fee upon arrival.

Great hotel, excellent customer service, location right next to the beach and at the quiet end of Waikiki. The most comfortable beds and pillows. Beach towels and chairs to use at your leisure and great food at your doorstep ABC shops and Tucker & Bevy outstanding

My mother and I spent 4 wonderful days at Park Shore and had very good service while we were there. My only complaints are that we could never get anyone to give us more of the welcome cookies and the cord on the hair dryer was WAY to short, you would have to be a contortionist to use it.

All staffs are friendly and very professional. The location is excellent which is located near Kapahulu Ave because we rented a car and very easy to access to anywhere outside Waikiki. Only one night we got interrupted by club located down the hotel made very loud music even after midnight and couldn't sleep much that night. But just for one night. Otherwise excellent hotel！Highly recommend to everyone！

This hotel was good value for money.We had an ocean view room on the 14th floor.While the room was not huge, the view was amazing and worth the extra money I believe.Up on the 14th floor, noise was not a problem.The hotel was across the road from the beach at the quieter end of Waikiki.The room was clean and tidy and serviced daily.Only issue I had was that the supplies or teas and coffee were not always replenished each day. Several times we had to ask for more supplies.While I found the hotel good value for money, I thought that the towel and deck chair levy was a bit much, especially since we only used the towels once.Also, an early check in option would have been good after a long flight. 3.00pm was late for us after arriving on an overnight flight.

Absolutely loved our stay at the Park Shore! Our room had a beautiful view of Diamond Head, the pool and the beach. The bed was super comfortable, not to mention massive! The bathroom was lovely as well with a really generously sized shower and beautiful coconut scented shampoo, conditioner and bidy wash. The beach is a 30 second walk just across the road and there is an abc store, Starbucks and health food cafe at the bottom of the hotel to grab something on the way to the beach! I loved that the hotel is across from the park so you don't feel surrounded by high rise buildings like other hotels further up the strip. I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip and would highly recommend it to anyone going to Waikiki!

This was our first visit to Ohau and I chose the park shore due to the good reviews, price and location. I was not disappointed! We stayed eight days and from check in it was all good! The front desk welcomed us with cool towels and friendly smiles. They were helpful all week with our many questions. They took our suitcases to our room and when I opened the door it was just perfect. The beds slept really good and it has a little area with a frig and safe and coffee maker. The tv is large but we didn't watch much tv while there. We had a corner balcony oceanview room so we could see the ocean and Diamond Head from the balcony. The pool was always clean with plenty of chairs, There is a microwave in the pool room and some soda machines . Wednesday was a manager party and it was also nice with snacks and friendly staff. I couldn't believe the beach is right across the street and I mean right across. There is a pier which divides the water/beach area to a surf side and a protected wall side. I have some physical problems so the protected side was great for me. They have free beach chairs and towels. I loved their system for the towels. You get a card for a towel and you give them the card and they give you a towel. When yu return the towel you get the card back. It worked perfect all week. The cleaning ladies did a good job too . I loved the Hawaiian Tropic soaps and lotions too. The zoo is on one side of the hotel and it was very nice too. We toured it on our last day since we had a late flight. The hotel will keep your bags locked up for you free of charge also. The park is right across the hotel and great for a picnic . The best part of the hotel is the staff and the location. The bus stop is right on the corner and our tours picked us up only one block down from the hotel. There are many places to dine depending on your budget, Mcdonalds, subway and burger king, beach café, Lulu are also really close . The abc stores are great for gifts and snacks and lunches and are connected to the hotel. They had pineapple that was really good. We used the bus system and the bus drivers were so helpful and helped us find our snorkel spot for only 2.50 a person! We did a lot of walking to the end of waikiki beach . The hotels in that area are all nice to visit and check out. I love Hawaii 5 -0 so we found the original badge and current show spots. There is so much to do and the hotel is in the perfect spot. The people at the Park Shore really made our trip so special. I couldnt have chosen a better room myself and I found that every day they answered questions and smiling. One morning they helped us find Leonards for those famous Hawaiian doughnuts. We walked it from the hotel and it was so worth the walk! When I return to Ohau I plan to stay here again. It was Paradise to us!

We enjoyed our stay. The position of this complex is fantastic, close to beach and quiet.We feel this complex is in need of carpet and curtains replaced as colours of these are very out dated.Staff very overall obliging when asked however most could make more of an effort to engage with clients, making eye contact and maybe just a ' good morning' or 'how is your vacation going' Micoh at the travel desk was outstanding with his service.

we have staid six nights at ocean front room. it was excellent room and great view. people who work at the hotels are very much friendly. we love the hotel. we had stay at several hotels at Waikiki,but we think the vest hotels at Waikiki. we definally chose this hotel to stay next year vacation.
