This is our second time here, the room smells musty or mold. they tv would not connect a tech had to come up and "shake it on". The toilet would not flush my husband had to take the tank off and manually flush it. The bathroom door would not close completely. no chair on the balcony to sit. then here's another $121.00 in fees.....?

Great location, good restaurant on premises.Hospitality room is no longer that was diss appointing as being able to have a shower on arrival makes a big difference after a long flight. Room not available till 3pm was a long wait

Stayed for 6 days and also had rental car. Exra to park car, but staff friendly and prompt to get and take car, help with directions. Hotel supplies beach towels and chairs. Beach just a couple hundred steps away. Great sandwich, picnic, breakfast place just off the lobby called Tucker and Bevvy. Very helpful concierge/ tour desk

We stayed at this hotel for a week. We were traveling in a party of 6. Yes it's a bit bigger than a normal 1 bedroom stay however I did find it a bit strange that we were on different floors, even though we were all on the same booking and had booked this back in January. Never mind we managed. Be aware if you are traveling from Australia and you arrive at 6am you might not be able to get into your room until 3pm. We had to pay a bit extra to get all of us into a room. While the adults went for a wander around the teenagers were able to have a sleep. The hotel itself is well positioned and the rooms are very clean. I was able to call down and get. Kettle sent up to the room so that I could make myself coffee in the mornings. All of our room were beachfront rooms well worth the bit extra I think anyway.As I said at the start of this review it is a nice hotel and I would stay again.

Great Location so close to the beach and shops, absolutly breathtaking ocean and Diamond Head viewsGreat Front Desk and House keepingBell Desk needs more people on staff especially during check inValet needs help

What a beautiful location and hotel. This is a gem. The hotel is beautifully done and the staff is very nice and accommodating. Our room was very nice and had a partial ocean view. My husband and I stayed here for three days before our cruise. Study the photos that are provided on the hotel website. Hubby and I walked everywhere. Try Lulu's for breakfast. Sit at the open bar area and enjoy. There is a very good burger place around the corner from this hotel, and of course much food everywhere.This is a great area to explore and not the city feel you can get from downtown. Hubby and I did lots of take out and sat on the beach. There is much free entertainment at night on the beach ,and by the shopping malls, and never a dull moment. I was glad we stayed at this end of the beach.

Stayed 2 nights (stopover) on our way to Anchorage via Seattle. Had a nice room and all the Hotel Staff were very pleasant. Located in quiet end of Waikiki opposite the park and zoo right across the road from the beach. Great location, highly recommend. Also try Lulus Cafe & Bar upstairs for Brekkie ( Jenny ) our waitress with the beautiful smile was fantastic. Gave us some recommendations on the menu, had a great brekkie and view across to the beach really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Also try the Tiki Bar & Grill just down the road for lunch or dinner. Another great spot upstairs and (Cat) our waitress looked after us with great menu & excellent service. Had the Longboard Lager Beers and went down well. Cat provided outstanding service. Returning to Maui & Waikiki for 10 nights on the way home to Brisbane. Love the Tiki Bar, highly recommend the place, gets very busy for dinner but always got a table. Enjoy, Aloha.

Upon our arrival we got the most pleasant greeting from a lovely young lady named Risa. From then on in got smiles and hellos from all the staff, we stayed here for 5 nights in a Poolside Lanai room and I think this hotel was a great choice for our family. We have a child with high functioning autism. The door is heavy settled to the Lanai so hard to open for a child. I felt it was safe friendly and a lovely atmosphere with helpful staff around us. They were genuine, normal.Pool towels were easily available and there were plenty of food options especially a cute little breakfast place in the alley way behind.If you want a quieter end of Hawaii opposite the zoo, beach, grassed area the Parkshore is a lovely choice . I would stay here again. It's down to earth and its meets your needs. Our needs were met with our kids it is a relaxed hotel, and does have everything available nearby if needed.The pool is simple but the view is amazing. You can paddle in the pool ,chin on your arms and look out to the ocean and watch the waves beyond the palm trees, across the road. Cab to Diamond head $14-$12 each way. The zoo across the road and the return local bus stop outside the door. The whole 5 days we were here we never had an issue. They also provide a free bus with Aqua to Alamoana shopping centre.There is a room just off the pool area with a microwave.Being at the end of the shopping strip We found it quite rewarding. it was quieter and we could see the fireworks at the Hilton strIght out on the beach on Friday night.( the closer hotels don't get this view).We will be staying here again - recommended. Very happy.

First time in Waikiki, the hotel is very well maintained. I loved we could open the door and enjoy fresh air on the balcony. Towels and beach chairs for the beach are provided from the bell desk. Walk up to Diamond Head for exercise and quiet beach views. If you want to do the Pearl Harbour Tour you should book in advance and the local bus ride is a long one.

Park Shore was probably the ideal hotel for us in this price point. It's in a great location, at the far end of Kalakaua Avenue, making it close enough to be in all the action but also not directly in the center of the madness. We were in an oceanfront room on the 14th floor and the views were spectacular. Our room was kept clean and everyone we encountered, from front desk employees to housekeeping, was very friendly. The room was a bit small but it was just my mom and me staying so it was plenty big for us. To be honest, we were barely in the room other than to sleep. While the amount of space didn't bother us at all, we did have a small complaint about the lack of storage space in it. There was only one dresser with a few drawers and we had quite a bit of luggage so we had to really live out of our suitcases a lot. Other than that, my only other small thing to mention is the parking. We rented a car for the entire time we were on Oahu and it was valeted by the staff at Park Shore at $25/day. The location and angle of the hotel entrance is kind of awkward and it was really difficult to get in and out during certain times of the day. All in all, Park Shore is, I think, the best for the price. We would definitely stay again.

Hotel located opposite the beach at the quieter end of Waikiki, but within an easy walk to shoppng and dining options. Friendly staff, clean rooms, excellent value for money. Would definitely stay again.

Great Location! Excellent views from our hotel room. Love the beach right in front of our hotel!! Front desk was very helpful. They helped with the Luau reservations. We had a suite and it was perfect for us!

This is an older hotel. Our room was small, but clean and comfortable. The location was great! Right across the street from the beach. We had an ocean front room and we really enjoyed sitting on the balcony. A park, zoo and aquarium are only a few blocks away. There are also many restaurants nearby. Staff was great and very helpful. I would stay here again in a minute.

Good hotel and localization. Parking extremely expensive. Nice crew and cleaness. Internet could be better. Bedrooms are a little bit small. At all, worthile, by price and location.Nearby the best attractions of Waikiki

The staff were all very friendly. The location is great. Right across from the beach. Our room had a really good view of both Diamond Head and the beach. We left our doors open at night and could hear the waves roll in and out. It has connections to stores and dining areas for easy convenience. They provided beach towels and were there with a friendly greeting every time we came in. The only bummer was a valet parking for the time there. It was also close to the Shell and the Zoo.

When we first arrived we were greeted by a lovely staff member at front of house (RISA), that was the last time we enjoyed a pleasant experience for the next 10 days.The staff at this place go through the motions and are not engaged!Noisey corridors, poor lighting, small rooms, unpleasant staff, no chairs on balconies, poor ventilation, no clothes airer, very little hanging space and storage.This place doesn't represent good value for money considering location.

All your Staff was most accommodating and always willing to help, nothing was too difficult for them to handle. You truly made as feel welcomed. Not to take anything away from any of the staff of the Park Shore however I would also like to make special mention of an exceptional employee who help me from the time I arrived to the very last day of my stay and was most professional and personal in understanding what we were looking for. Her name is Risa and would like to say a big thank you to her for her attention to detail in making us feel most welcomed. It has been a stay I will not forget and share with everyone I talk to on my experience in the Park Shore.A Big Mahalo!!! Until next time.

Beautiful, comfortable, perfect location. I really love this place and wish I could just live there. There was an abc store you could get to without leaving the building. If you can get an ocean view room then do it because it's SO worth it. It's just breathtaking.

My second stay at this hotel, rooms are basic and small, but clean maintained everyday. Location is what this hotel is all about and price, when you consider the other properties and also the connection fee which can be an extra $300 plus on top of your accommodation. Overall for the amount of time you are in the room it is well worth the stay.

I've stayed at this hotel before & I have no complaints except for the general manager who would not be reasonable with a vital & reasonable request. The hotel is clean & comfortable & that's all I really need.

My husband and I stayed at Park Shore Waikiki in June 2017 for our 1st Anniversary/ Honeymoon. It was a great hotel, small, at the end of the Waikiki beach area hotel line. The staff was extremely friendly, from the front desk, the the valets, to the construction workers (there was a little construction on the 7th floor), to the cleaning staff. On your check in, you receive a beach towel card per person. Every time you need a new, warm, beach towel, just turn your beach towel card in to the desk. To get your card back, just turn in the used beach towel. There is no continental breakfast but water, juice, and coffee in the lobby. Also, numerous restaurants nearby. The Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium are within walking distance but I didn't visit. I did valet parking as Honolulu parking is atrocious and there is no parking lot for the hotel. The parking garage is hidden lol. Also, no door to this hotel, just walk in and out but that's the way with all the hotels in Waikiki. Very happy. Free WIFI

A good place to stay. Clean room, close to beach and everything is in walking distance. Valet service is required while you are there for an additional fee. I did not feel i knew this in advance, but adjusted quickly. There is a fee for this service. Our refrigerator had not been cleaned out from previous traveler. The staff was kind to rectify this concern. The valet staff was super quick to get us our car.

This hotel was in a wonderful location, close to all our tour pick ups, across from the beach, close to shopping and food outlets. Rooms were nice and clean, wifi was good. Pity no meal deals included in room rates

My wife and I have visited Waikiki several times before, but our stay in an Oceanfront Room at the Park Shore was our best visit yet. The room had everything that we needed, comfortable bed, good hot shower, lanai with a view of the beach and ocean, and within easy walk of all our favourite restaurants and shops. If you can, pay a bit extra for the Oceanfront room, as the view is quite amazing. Also the Japanese restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel is worth a visit, the Teriaki Tuna is well worth trying and an additional $5 will turn it into a 4 course meal that includes dessert. The staff are the jewel in the crown of this hotel and will go the extra mile to make your stay a memorable one. We will be using this place for all our future visits to Waikiki.

Good Location, pool was clean however very old. No atmosphere, front reception staff not willing to help - arrogant girls who were rude. Rooms are old and out dated, view was very nice however. Very basic hotel

Great place to have a great experience. Closed to all of the shopping and attraction on beach. Easily accessible by all of the tour guides and services. Walking distance from many restaurants and other hotels.

Some construction going on our floor, but never bothered us. Stayed in a Jr Suite, had a king bed, pull out couch and a kitchenette that had a little fridge, microwave and a small sink and comes with plates/cups/silverware. Perfect for a family of 3/4. View from 14th floor room was beautiful! There is a 18th floor lookout and that has an awesome full view of diamond head & the ocean, great place to take pictures. Hotel is in a great location if you want away from the hustle and bustle, but a quick walk to it. Aloha!

It is close to the Waikiki beach. A good place to go! The room is clean and enough for one. Just step down the hotel,and the beach is with you. They provide beach towl and bench. It is nice to stay on the beach. Be careful of the sun shine. It may burn your skin.

I guess my girlfriend & I lucked out! We arrived from a late flight to Honolulu when we were told that we got a double upgrade. We booked a standard room and ended up getting a full ocean view. Having drinks out on the balcony while looking out at Waikiki was definitely a trip highlight. We were suprised again when fireworks started going off one night for a cosmetic company's anniversary dead center from our balcony view. This place is great for those of us who pretty much just use the hotel to unwind when we're not out sightseeing. Although this makes the resort fees a little frustrating when you're never really utilizing them. If you're looking for a resort to lounge around poolside all day, consider elsewhere as the pool is just so-so. I picked this hotel to be close to the world famous Waikiki Beach and the location did not disappoint!

We had the pleasure after reading all these reviews to stay at this hotel for a 2 week stay in Waikiki. Not only did the hotel come highly recommended from the travel agent also , which is a massive understatement , the reviews on here and other sites praise this hotel.So we arrived in Sunday morning only to be greeted in the foyer , now in their welcome book they say that upon arrival you get a hand towel and a drink, this did not happen, we were told to wait in the foyer , 3 children and 4 adults and after being on a flight from Sydney , we were tired and wanted to rest . So we waited, kids started to get antsy , so we went for a walk , no indication from staff what so ever where to go and what to do . Thank goodness that there was 2 ABC stores downstairs and we went there to waste some time ... go back to the foyer room still not ready, needed to shower and just relax still no recommendations from the hotel staff were to go and what to do to relax and freshen up. Thank god for Lance , one of the bell staff , he came over and said to my husband and I take the kids to Ala Moana they have a play centre there .. on the shuttle we went as our room still wasn't ready . We went and came back even more tired than just waiting at the hotel, as our room was not ready until 4pm .. sorry but I'm coming from overseas my room at the latest should be ready 2 hours after my arrival not 6 . The on,y thing we did was get our room key go up and shower and sleep . I woke up and wanted to eat and so did my son and I went to reception to ask where to go. I got a blunt answer "around the corner " .. Being still jet lagged and all off I went and we found the place . So the next couple of days we wanted to do some activities so we spoke to the Expedia travel guide , where he comes highly recommended from the hotel to make a profit . We wanted to do a grand island tour and he wanted and was insisting we do one for 120.00 per person plus taxes close to $800USD for the 7 of us . Luckily we searched online and found one and we got on the tour the next day . I went to ask as to how to get directions to the Hilton Hawaiian as we have been there before and want to take the boys to see the lagoon and swim there , so I ask reception again I get a blunt answer of, "take a taxi". No elaboration on what else I could do it but this was the only way as taxi vans charge about 45.00 for a 30 minute walk trip . Asked about if the trolley goes there and once again got the blunt answer . So this is where I told reception exactly how I feel. I said I am on holidays I don't know what the best way is and you need to elaborate not give me one sided answers . The young man that was at reception couldn't really care if I had to say something or not , like it was too hard for him to offer some customer service. So the room... hmmmm.... very very very outdated and very small. The vanity in our bathroom had a crack right through it and my mums room had no hot water even though we mentioned it to the front desk still nothing was done about it .The chairs in the pool area are rusted and there is not cushions to sit in the hard wrought iron lounges which are also rusted. The coffee and drink stand is tucked away in the kiosk and there's only coffee and drink , nothing else like other hotels ie Hawaiin cookies etc . So for two weeks and for two rooms, we payed close to $7000 and all I have to say about this hotel is don't bother . The view from the pool is great , the pool is very average and so is the amenities room where there's only a microwave and some vending machines. There isn't even a laundry room and the nearest laundry mat is 4 blocks away... to say the least I will be coming back to Hawaii but I will not be staying here and I will definitely not be recommending this hotel to anyone I know . Not only are the staff rude and unwilling to help , the rooms are so outdated that the only thing that makes them some what 21st century is the TVs.

We enjoyed our 6 night stay at Park Shore Waikiki in June. Location excellent, although road facing rooms can be noisy. Beds very comfortable. We hope to come back before too long and overall do recommend this hotel.

I would recommend this hotel for its location alone.It is right on the end of the strip which means it is not as busy as most of the other hotels, however, it is close enough that you can walk to just about anything. The hotel features 4 restaurants onsite - Lulu's for more American food, Starbucks, a Japanese restaurant, and Tucker and Bevvy for a more healthy, picnic option. If none of these are what you are looking for, there is plenty of other options right around the corner.There are really two beaches divided by a short pier right across the road. One has a wall to break the waves, leading to a more family oriented calm waters experience. The other has larger waves which may be better for surfers and body boarding. These beaches do get busy, but we never had any trouble finding a spot to settle.Rooms are an alright size, however, I highly recommend paying a little extra for the partial-ocean view. We started off with the basic room and found ourselves upgrading mid trip. I know we were in Oahu and we probably should not have spent much time in the room (and we didn't), but the view was terrible. We really had a view of only the parking garage below us and the hotel across from us...not to mention the garbage bins. The partial ocean is the way to go, you get a sensational view of the ocean from one angle and from the other you can see Diamond Head. This is the last hotel on the strip so it is an undisturbed view of Diamond Head.Service was very good. The staff was helpful and attentive. Michelle at the front desk was very accommodating and helpful. John at the Expedia desk was also very personable and knowledgable of the island and helped to steer us clear of disappointment as we planned to tour on our own for part of the trip.Hotels in Waikiki are expensive, and this hotel is no exception, but after doing my research I would recommend it a option that is more moderately priced then the big names down the beach.

A great location across the road from the beach on the quite end of Waikiki but still plenty of eating locations, general shops and bus services, taxis and other transport. The staff are very friendly, rooms are tidy and the housekeeping staff are friendly and attentive, front desk staff were always helpful and friendly (Michelle was very friendly and helpful). My tip would be get an Ocean front room for great views of the beach and ocean, some with views of Diamond Head as well.

My family and I enjoyed another stay at the Park Shore. Staff is friendly and helpful, and the location is perfect. The reasonable price will keep us coming back. I stayed in a room without an ocean view this trip, and found it was just as enjoyable. Enjoyed walks and easy access to the beach, Kapiolani park, and Kalakaua Avenue. Lots of great dining and shopping options nearby.

Wonderful place to use as a base for enjoying Waikiki. In the Beach Walk area with plenty of restaurants and shopping but fresh rooms and pool for relaxing. Service terrific - Nobu gone but wonderful "Pop-up" restaurant in it's place and the morning buffet breakfast still as good as ever - don't forget to check out the omelet station and enjoy the banana pancakes made to order also. I will return!!

Park Shore had an Ocean View special going on so I called and got our rooms booked. We've stayed here before and everyone is so nice, gracious, friendly and lots of aloha. We're from Maui so we bonded with the local, yet professional, vibe of the hotel.The rooms were clean, bathroom was clean and stocked perfectly. The ocean view was lovely, as well as looking out to Diamond Head. Valet was friendly and efficient. Always greeted us warmly when we returned.This hotel is near the zoo and great restaurants that's in walking distance as parking if pretty difficult in Waikiki.We will be returning to this hotel on our next Oahu trip! Mahalo Park Shore Waikiki!

Excellent service from the staff and the yoga classes were my highlight experience from the hotel. I would recommend your property to all my family, friends and co-workers the next time they travel to Honolulu.

We loved the location of this hotel...End of the strip - not in the middle of busy Waikiki, but a short stroll away, if we wanted to shop. The beach was directly across the street. The Honolulu Zoo was next to us so no other hotels cluttering our view of Diamond Head & of the beach. The staff was very friendly & helpful. We would stay again.

Great location! The rooms are very clean and they are small, but who cares since you just sleep there. I would not hesitate to book this hotel. There are great restaurants in the hotel as well as a Starbucks. The entire staff is very helpful with recommendations for the area.

This hotel is in a great location and had amazing views of the beach. Rooms were adequate and staff were very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends for its location and laid back atmosphere.

Perfect location! Right across from the beach. Pay a little more and get the beach view. I regret not getting it. My brother and his wife did and it was well worth the extra price.. Very friendly staff. Excellent maid service! Pool is nice and it was not crowded. We could sit at the hotel and watch the surf rolling in. Price is very reasonable. Bus stops are close by for city and local tours. Restaurant in the hotel is the only down part. Staff not very friendly and it took forever to get served. I stayed here with my husband on our anniversary a few years ago and knew when I went back with my Mom and brother that this was the place! Great prices! Only problem was the $20/fee per day that is required. Just put the $20 on the regular price.

This is a wonderful hotel which is in a great location and reasonably priced. This is the second time we stay here. There are many hotel choices in Honolulu but we found this gem and keep coming back!

We stayed here for three nights. The hotel is located at the East end of the Waikiki strip, right over the road from the zoo and right across the road from the beach. The hotel is a little older, but is well maintained and clean. At ground level there is an ABC convenience store, Starbucks coffee shop, a little organic shop doing great coffees and toasted sandwiches, a surf school, and a Japanese restaurant. Lu Lu's bar and grill are located on level two with views over Waikiki beach. There is a pool, and you can get beach towels and chairs from the concierge desk. It is only a lazy 5-10 minute stroll to the heart of the Waikiki strip where there are plenty of restaurants and shops. You can walk everywhere. We had room 1715 which had fantastic views of both Diamond Head and Waikiki beach. We could even see the Pink Flamingos in the zoo!

This is our second visit to the Park Shore after staying there about 3 years ago on our honeymoon. We booked an Ocean Front room again as the view is amazing and were celebrating our Anniversary. On check-in we were surprised to find we've received an upgrade to a Ocean Front Suite. The upgrade was amazing! The additional living areas (lounge, kitchen facilities etc) and extra balcony made our stay much more enjoyable. There was one night where loud music was playing i'm assuming from Lu Lu's below (we were on the 10th floor) which disturbed our sleep however can't really fault the hotel. We'll definitely be staying for a 3rd time as soon as we can make it back to Honolulu. Mahalo to the team at Park Shore Waikiki.

My husband and I stayed for 8 nights and couldn't fault anything with the stay, in fact everyone went out of their way to smile and say good morning. The location is the quieter part and I would highly recommend as it is lovely to wake up to the views so the beach and Diamond head, Lu Lu's the restaurant that is attached is the best restaurant we tried and wished we'd had all our meals there. The Japanese is lovely too with excellent food and service, they have a sandwich shop which makes lovely fresh sandwiches to take away for the day. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. There is a free shuttle to take you to the local shopping mall daily and the ABC attached to the hotel the best place to get snacks and drinks. We would love to come back to Hawaii, this trip was to celebrate my 55th birthday and we've both wanted to visit since childhood days watching Hawaii 5 0 I would definitely stay at the Park Shore and would highly recommend to travellers to this area, special thank you to Ken and Risa....we miss you!

We booked only for two nights and wished it had been for more. Only a limited view ot the beach, but we did not mind as you only had to walk across the road and we were standing on the beach. Really close to everything and the staff were helpful. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. Can't complain about anything. We are having a problem re our pending account and hoping that it will be sorted soon. Really nice hotel.

we booked using airmiles so not sure of true value but for us it was ideal. The location couldn't be better at one end of the beach, right by the zoo. Restaurants and cafes are very close. We took city buses to sights that weren't nearby, an easy/cheap solution.rooms were comfortable and quiet, we had a corner with a beautiful view of the ocean from our bed.Staff were very friendly and helpful.

We stayed here a few nights during our trip to Oahu. I was immediately charmed by he open air entrance (no door) and the tropical paradise of being in Hawaii. Our room was great. We had a lanai (balcony) with a great view of Diamond Head and Waikiki beach. The towel service was great. We could get towels and leave our keys at the desk and cross the street to go the beach. Great hotel in a great location!

This is our 3rd stay at Park Shore. We love it! The location is great! Steps to the beach. Restaurants and coffee snacks all right there. The zoo is across the street. We were surprised with an upgrade to a suite upon arrival! The suite was roomy, clean and had two ocean view balconies. Housekeeper was so sweet and thorough. Checking in and out was a breeze. Riesa was so nice and helpful! Two Tv's in our room. Coffee and coffee pot, good size refrigerator, microwave, sink, dishes, silverware. Separate living room with couch and chair desk coffee table. Nice pictures on the wall. Soaps shampoo and conditioner lotion, in room safe. 2 closets dresser. Pool but we haven't used, Like a small apartment! We are returning in 6 months! This hotel isn't a big high rise like some and not fancy but for us we really love it. Price is very good for the value. We are seniors our family stayed at a different hotel that had a toddler pool.

This was my first trip to the island, my other half's 8th. This is the first time we both stayed at the Park Shore. Check in was easy and the staff was very helpful when we got there. We had no issues checking in, even though we arrived a little early. The room was a bit on the smaller size, but I have stayed in a lot smaller in Europe and paid a lot more. The cleaning staff did a great job every day cleaning the room. One day we were not ready for them and they were willing to come back later and clean the room. While the rooms are a bit dated, they were clean and had everything you needed to have a great vacation. Besides, who spend their vacation in a hotel room in Hawaii. The views were well worth the money. Diamondhead and the ocean just outside the windows with nothing blocking the views.The hotel is located at the far end of Waikiki so you don't have a lot of noise. The only exception was Monday Nights. A local club hosts a service industry night and its kind of loud. But unless you are a really light sleeper or you sleep with your slider open I don't think it will bug you too much.If I ever get the chance to get back to Honolulu, I will be looking to stay at the Park Shore.

Our rooms was clean, the employees were friendly and the location was perfect. A little far down the main strip which was nice. Our room had a great view of both the ocean and diamond. A quick walk to almost anything you may need. The hotel shuttle drives were also friendly and very helpful.

Very nice hotel. It was a older hotel but very well kept up and clean. It was right across the street from the beach. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the beach. They upgraded us for free. Would stay here again if we come back to Hawaii.

This hotel is reasonably priced for the location. But you get what you pay for. If possible reserve a room at the end with views of the beach Diamond Head. No complaints for the price, just don't expect a gym or other similar amenities.

Stayed May 2017. Hotel is at the end of the the Diamond Head end of the beach area and right opposite the zoo. It was away from the noise and hubbub of the main area around the Moana hotel but only 5 minutes stroll along the beach side road and literally over the road from the quieter beach. Hotel had a grand entrance but the rooms didn't quite live up to the promise. Our room was a bit tired, although comfortable with a king bed, but there was a tiny wardrobe, with a handful of hangers and only ONE draw. We had 3 weeks of luggage with us and had to live out of our suitcases for our 5 night stay.There are no breakfast facilities directly in the hotel, although there is a cafe next door which has a walkway through. It was easier to get cereal and muffins from the numerous ABC stores (sort of 7-11s) and eat in our room, and an awful lot cheaper! There is a Japanese restaurant in the hotel but we didn't try it. We had an incident when the sprinkler system went off in a lift at 4 am and the whole hotel was evacuated, supposedly to outside in the rain. None of the staff really new what was going on and most people stayed in the foyer during the incident and it wasn't until a customer asked if it was safe to go back to our rooms an hour later that anyone actually said anything. We then had to walk up 20 flights of stone steps to the 11th floor, as the lifts were out of service. Apart from that we had a pleasant stay and would probably use the hotel again if we went back to Waikiki.

My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at the ParkShore hotel. While it doesn't offer some of the amenities many of the large resorts offer (spas, business center, fancy pool and gym ...) it's a wonderful choice for tourists. Rooms are clean and spacious, help was attentive and friendly, and the location and view are perfect. Located on the Diamond Head end of the beach walk you are near the zoo, aquarium, restaurants, and the protected section of the ocean ... The ParkShore was perfect for us, at a much more reasonable price than many area hotels that charge for inclusive services we knew we'd never use :)

The view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach are amazing and picture perfect. This hotel is close to the Honolulu Zoo, Kapiolani Park, Waikiki Beach and the Honolulu Aquarium. If you like to jog Kapiolani Park is an excellent place to run and its right across the street from the hotel. All of the staff (bell captain, front desk, maintenance, housekeeping, valet) were extremely friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel

Had an ocean front room on the 12th floor with an incredible view of both Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head from the lanai. You can pay a whole lot more elsewhere and not get anything like that. Everyone from the front desk staff to housekeeping was friendly and helpful. Easy access to Lulu's for good food and the ABC store for snacks. Also the location is right across the street from a sea wall protected beach (nice for swimming and you don't have to worry so much about your kids). Also is directly across from Kapiolani Park where there seems to be some kind of festival every weekend, and also the Honolulu Zoo. The room was nice, not fancy, but very clean. Beach towels and beach chairs for no cost. The crib for our little one was also no charge. Would I stay here again? YOU BET! Very good budget friendly hotel.

I've stayed at Park Shore Waikiki in 2015, 2016 and 2017 for holidays. The hotel is fabulous! Their swimming pool overlooks the ocean which is my favourite place to relax to watch the sunset. As the hotel is at the end of the hotel strip, next to the zoo, it is a much quieter part of town. Shops and restaurants are all close with the beach across the street. Park Shore staff are very welcoming and friendly. I used the tour desk this trip, they were fantastic. Highly recommend this hotel.

This was my second time staying at this hotel. It filled all my needs. The rooms are comfortable with standard amenities. It also has a mini fridge. The view of Diamond Head, the zoo, Kapiolani park, and of course, Waikiki Beach is amazing. It is located right across the beach on the corner of Kalakaua and Kapahulu so I doubt there are any rooms with a bad view. I love staying near this end of Waikiki because the ease of getting in and out of Waikiki is excellent via Kapahulu Avenue. Highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again.

I was in a room on level 5 and had a view of both the park/zoo and beach, I was also overlooking the pool. The room was very modern and quite nicely furnished and the bed was really comfortable. The bathroom was quite small - it was just me staying there, so not so bad for one person. The air conditioner was quite noisy and I always turned it off to sleep. The room was not very soundproof and I quite often heard other people out in the hall or closing their doors (which close with a thud). I did find that everytime I called the front desk they were engaged, so it always took awhile to talk to someone.The staff were all quite nice and even helped me when I needed to cut my stay short by one night. It is close to everything and made and good base.

Let's start with the good points. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel has a great position with most rooms having a view to diamond head and the beach. The pier was directly in front making it a quick walk down for some sun set photos. Shops etc were a short walk or quick bus trip (on 'the bus' the Waikiki public transport bus - which by the way will take you just about anywhere if you get the right one). Rooms are very clean and have a mini fridge, decent size balcony and big comfy beds. - there is no kettle or iron so you need to ask if you want there things. There is a great pub with live music, smoke but nice food and a great out look next door called -Lou Lou's. There is also tow convenience stores where you can purchase most things including basic food, drinks, alcohol and many other things either side of the foyer. There is also a good breakfast/juice bar near the entry that makes many breakfast and lunch items at a reasonable price. A coffee is also obtained at the Starbucks next door(actually a reasonably good coffee - and we are a bit fussy about coffee). However, The hotel has an out of date feel (like much of Waikiki). Due to a water leakage there were two lifts were out of order while we were there so the wait was long. The island ambiance we had thought about was not really there. It's hard when you are part of a city that is on tourist steroids. Maybe a revamp of the downstairs lounge and some traditional music might be good. First impressions last. The pool area was straight out of the 70's and was not overly inviting. (All rooms look down on it as well).

Everything is about location, its right at the end of the best area (so walking distance to everywhere) of waikiki and right across from the beach. We got what I think is one of the best rooms, on the 3rd floor with private exit to the pool and view to the beach. It has the perfect pillows and bed was VERY comfy. Many places to go around, restaurants, local stores, shopping. Also has a surf rental at the lobby, expensive compared with some others we found but very convenient for us. If I ever go back I'll stay there for sure.

The rooms have a mini fridge which is nice for keeping drinks cool. The hotel lets you rent out beach towels and exchange them for fresh ones whenever you want. Fresh coffee and juices in the lobby every day. Valet parking is expensive like all other hotels in Waikiki, but you can park across the street at the Zoo for $1/hour. I like the location at the eastern end of Waikiki where it's more quiet. The hotel is right across the street from the beach. Next door you can rent a car from Enterprise at the Marriott if you wish. The rooms were comfortable, and you can't beat the view of Diamond Head. This place was a great home base while we rented a car and explored the rest of the island. There's also some shops and restaurants on site. We never used the pool as we were at the beach the whole time. There's some construction going on, but we didn't notice it. Not trendy nor particularly stylish, but comfortable and reasonably priced for the area. Staff skews young but all are pleasant.
user_name:
Helen S
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent two nights here at the beginning of our Hawaiian vacation. Great location right across from the beach and next to the Honolulu Zoo, so you have some green space near you rather than another building. We splurged on the Oceanfront room and had a fantastic time watching people and waves. Friendly staff - even when we checked out at 4:30 in the morning!Comfortable beds, mini fridge, safe and a lanai made this a very comfortable stay.

Location is great, we rented a car and had no problem street parking. Furthest we parked in a 4 night stay was about a 5 minute walk. Waikiki beach is right across the street. Few points:Key cards didn't work twice and had to reset itRoom directly opened up to the outside and we could hear the outside cars and people late at nightNice toiletries from Hawaiian Tropic
user_name:
jchong8250
New York City, New York

review_body: Perfect location at the end of the strip!! Conveniently located right above Starbucks, two ABC stores, and Tucker & Bevvy (which has the best smoothies ever) We were on the 18th floor, and although an ocean view room wasn't available we had a beautiful view of Diamond Head, which was no more than 10-15 minutes by cab - would definitely recommend this as well, the view from the top is unreal. The beach is literally on the other side of the street as you walk out of the hotel lobby, perfect if you want to roll out of bed and catch some sun! Or simply walk down the beach/street and visit the many shops and restaurants located nearby. Overall we had an AMAZING time in Hawaii; the food, the people, honestly just about everything! We cannot wait to go back and would definitely stay here again! Do not spend too much time in the hotel however, because there is truly so much to see in this beautiful place! Mahalo Park Shore!!

We stayed here 5 days before our wedding. It catered to our needs and was in a prime location with the beach across the road and yummy eateries every direction we would wander. The staff were exception and upgraded us to a partial ocean view room which made our experience so much more enjoyable. This is close to public transport and had valet parking on site. I found the staff extra friendly and they all knew my name by the second day. We had everything we needed in our suite and loved that we could just pop downstairs to the ABC store on site if we realised we had forgotten something. Would recommend to anyone, especially those with families as the beach across the road is fantastic and safe for children. Thank you Park Shore for making our time so enjoyable, we will be back. Sending love from New Zealand.

Great value in a perfect position with great ocean views. Staff provide excellent service with no query too small and all service given with a smile. Hotel next to Honolulu Zoo and a great bar next door. Easy access to shops and directly across from Waikiki beach which is maintained in pristine condition. There is a heavy presence of law enforcement officers making the location extremely safe for families. Room was spotless and beds are amazingly comfortable. A beautiful park area is right next door!

We spent 7 nights at this lovely hotel. It has a perfect location at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki Beach. It has great access to a good part of the beach and is not far from all the Waikiki beach action. Staff were friendly and helpful and the room was comfortable.

Just came back from spending a week at the Park Shore with our 4yrs old and loved it! The staff was super nice! Being so close to the beach, zoo and aquarium made it practical as well. We would definitely go back!

Very happy with our recent stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a King Ocean View room after booking a standard room (it pays to book direct). The front desk staff were exceptional on our check in day Sunday the 23rd April and they continued to be a pleasure to deal with throughout the week. Very convenient location. We were able to easily walk across the road to the beach with bub and return to the hotel with ease. Valet parking was good most of the time, but seemed slightly understaffed at times. Overall very pleased with our stay and would definitely return and recommend to friends and family.

Park Shore Waikiki is in a great location right at the end of the strip. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. However, I did have a number of problems during my week-long stay which you should probably be aware of if you're looking to book this hotel. Some of these seem to relate simply to poor management and maintenance:1. When I first checked in, I was put in a room where the balcony was inaccessible due to construction. More importantly, there were construction workers moving up and down in front of my window the entire day, 9-5. After complaining to the front-desk, I was moved to a better room. But I should not have been put there in the first place. If the room is not entirely accessible and there is no privacy, the hotel should not be putting their guests in those rooms. Fix your hotel first.2. An errant sprinkler system went off on my floor at 4:00am one morning, along with the fire alarm. After 2 hours outside, we moved back to our rooms, but the floors of the floor were soaked. They immediately started vacuuming the water with shop-vacs for several hours, which made it impossible to catch up on the lost sleep. For the next two days they had giant vacuum cleaners and dehumidifiers going on full blast, which made the floor very noise and much less pleasant than before. Of the three elevators, they only managed to get one back to working order for the entire hotel, and this stayed the case until I checked out some 3 days later. We would either have to climb 17 flights of stairs in the Hawai'i heat, or regularly wait 5+ minutes for the single working elevator to show up.3. When I was checking out, I was hit with an "amenities" fee of more than $200. As far as I could tell, this fee was for using their beach towel service and not much else. I was never made aware of this fee prior to checking out, so it felt like a hidden-fee money-grab. And while they insisted on the fee being paid despite little value being provided, they did nothing to compensate for the other inconveniences.If not for those problems, the stay would have been great. I have nothing but good things to say about the staff, and the friendly atmosphere. If you are the kind of person who doesn't mind complaining and making an issue out of these types of problems, you should be able to have a very pleasant stay here, as I certainly did despite the problems.

Park Shore staff took care of me and my fear of heights by upgrading me to an ocean view room, everyone from the cleaning, maintenance, front desk and bell hops were so bright and cheerful. Special shout out to Michelle for allowing us to stay in our room an extra hour before returning to North Carolina it may seem a small gesture but it prevented me and my son from killing an hour in our rental car it really was a big deal to us.

Was hesitent about staying but so happy we did Po'oahi at the front desk thanks for showing your ALOHA! Rooms very clean up dated there were cookies in the room buy the coffee make I thought that was a nice touch! I saw beach towels being handed out very impressed!

I love this place staff always friendly and helpful . Right on the beach no hotels in front of it looks over the zoo and diamond head too . Stayed at many Waikiki hotels but this is my favourite by far . Rooms are clean and nice , get a higher floor a quieter stay due to restaurant downstairs.none of the just another face customer service here either .

The hotel looks good when you pull up to check in but as soon as you step through the door the first thing I noticed was the smell of old carpet. It is the same in the elevator, hall ways and room. Our room, without a view, had a strong mildew smell. Very difficult to sleep there and there is no screen on the slider so we couldn't keep the door open. The public women's bathroom on the first level was really dirty. The place needs a major facelift. We have no complaints about the staff. The bell person and valet attendant were both very customer oriented. The proximity to the beach and shops is excellent.No, I would not recommend this hotel.

My husband and i stayed at the Park Shore for 4 nights. Upon check in they didn't have the room we had previously upgraded to available so we were upgraded to a suite for no additional charge. The staff at the front desk are great! Would highly recommend the Diamond Head Suite. Spectacular views! The beach is right across the street and the hotel provides towels and chairs. From the hotel you have direct access to Tucker & Bevvy and ABC stores which was very convenient.

I visited in October 2015 for my honeymoon. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Ideally located, next to the zoo and right in front of the beach. Easy to access the mains roads when you want to visit the restaurant island. Great ocean view. Room was a bit small and decor is average but great value for the price. I'd be back in a heartbeat.

Stayed here at the end of our holiday for a week. Just across the road from the beach.. tea coffee making in room close to everything great food around loved the bar and food on the corner..great to sit and watch the sunsets with a cocktail. Lovely staff and really helpful.bed really comfortable with a balcony so we could have fresh air instead of air con. Loved the shuttle to alamoana shopping centre. And pool was great in the afternoon Highly recommend not the flashest hotel but great value at an afforable price

We went on a vacation package through West Jet and found the hotel well located close to the beach. Since we checked in late (10.30 pm) as per schedule, we requested that our check out be extended until pick up time (6.30pm) at no extra cost, since our flight was leaving HNL at 10.30 pm.However, they provided 1 hour extension until 1pm as complimentary and the remaining hours had to be spent in the lobby using the common washroom in the 1st floor of the hotel. Understand they charge $10 for every additional hour of stay after check out time. Since it was a vacation package deal our request could have been considered given the fact that it was a late check in and they had our tour itinerary in detail much ahead of our arrival.

I wanted to give kudos to the staff and all the employees at Park Shore Hotel in Waikiki. I just returned from a week vacay there and it was fabulous. Great location, views, staff, etc. My husband and I could have not been any more pleased anywhere else. Thank you for your kindness and making our 41 anniversary so special.

Great views of Waikiki from our oceanfront room. Room was clean but quite small. Located at the quiet end of the Waikiki beachfront. Only issue was noise coming from a nightclub located next to hotel. Loud music until 2am. This only happened one night out of our 6 night stay.Hotel offers free beach towels and beach chairs that you can take across the road to the beach. Free wifi also.A Starbucks is located underneath hotel and an abc store attached to lobby. Very convenient for snacks and drinks to enjoy on your balcony enjoying your view!

Location is the best thing about this hotel. It's away from the busy part of Waikiki but still an easy walk to get there. Rooms are quite small with very little storage space. Beds and pillows are not that comfortable.

I've read numerous reviews of this hotel some saying it's dated. Maybe it is a little but that does not detract from location and quality of staff. Location:It's situated at far end of Waikiki strip away from all huddle and bustle which also gives you easy access to the beach. Perfect short distance from the sandy beach which has calmer section one side of the pier for small children then the more boisterous side for old kids and parents alike. Free beach chairs and free beach towels refreshed each time you hand them back. It's also opposite the zoo. It has an ABC store inside of lobby which sells absolutely everything. Also a Starbucks about a 30 second walk away. Facilities:Pool on third floor adequate always spare free loungers and umbrellas. Again free poolside towels. Free tea and coffee till about 10 then free fresh water melon juice till about 7pm. Free basic wifi so emails can be checked if required. Japanese restaurant looked good and busy we didn't try it. Rooms:We had two double beds for a family of three. Decent wardrobe a safe a hairdryer a small fridge decent drawer storage and we had a balcony with views of diamond head and the beach unbeatable views for me. Rooms are a little dated but really pretty much what I expected. Staff:Couldn't be helpful enough check-in was hassle free and we were upgraded as some repairs going on on one side and this was dealt with superbly (thanks Ethan). All staff were friendly wether you bumped into them in the lift the lobby or on your floor. Room cleaned by cleaner really well everyday fresh towels and room cleaned well. Overall this hotel was perfect for us and if we are ever lucky enough to return to Hawaii this is where we will stay.

Had a great stay the staff very friendly beautiful outlook over beach, park and views of Diamond Head. Staff were always friendly and extremely helpful. Clean handy to everything but out of the way. Lulu's restaurant underneath had the best food and we favoured this even after visiting a lot of the well known ones which were recommended. I would definitely recommend and return to Park Shore. Thanks again for our stay. Mahalo.

We have stayed at the Park Shore Waikiki 5 times. The last 2 times, we didn't even shop around online. It has been remodeled recently, with beautiful bathrooms and well-outfitted rooms. The staff go out of their way to be helpful. Location is great, across from the beach and the zoo. Spectacular view of Diamondhead from many of the rooms. Lovely clean pool. Easy walking distance to a variety of restaurants. Convenient valet parking and an easy drive to interesting restaurants and 2 grocery stores. Reasonable price for a wonderful place. I give it 5 stars because it is a true gem, we feel welcome, our family loves to keep coming back!

So glad we stayed here. The location was excellent, the room was comfortable, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the view from the balcony was almost perfect, We paid more for a “beach front” room, which was a pretty standard room without a lot of space but with a balcony that had a beautiful view of the beach. (Minor complaint: The view was blocked to the right by the building jutting out with balconies close enough that we could have conversed with other hotel guests on them without raising our voices much. But we got over that disappointment pretty quickly just by looking straight ahead or to the left.)The location couldn't have been better (another hotel I almost booked, the Queen Kapiolani, had essentially the same location, but without the direct view of the beach.) If you wanted to, you could easily spend a week or more here without renting a car, just hanging out at the beach and pool and eating at a different restaurant for every meal. I almost wish I had done that.If you do rent a car, there is an Enterprise car rental in the next block over along the beach (in the lobby of the Marriott Hotel.) There are also a couple of convenient alternatives to the hotel’s valet parking. You can park for free for as long as you want on Monsarrat Avenue, which runs along the other side of the zoo, if you don’t mind a 5-15 minute walk to your car. Or you can park across the street in the zoo parking lot (all day and overnight) for a dollar per hour. I did both at various times with no problems.There is an excellent Japanese restaurant in the hotel lobby that we went to one night and got take-out from the next night because we wanted to try some of the other dishes. They give a discount of 10% to guests of the Park Shore, so that’s worth mentioning when you order.If you want to buy (expensive!) groceries, there is a Safeway about a half-hour walk up the road away from the water.If I go back to Oahu, I would definitely try to book here again. We had a wonderful stay!

I had a short window of time to reserve a hotel during spring break vacationers. I did not expect much, but the price was good. The hotel does not look exceptional from the street. However, once inside it has a large well decorated lobby with lots of comfortable chairs for people watching or waiting for a friend. The rooms are large enough, clean and have a mini fridge. I was there on business so did not stay of the ocean view side. The staff is friendly and helpful. There is a Starbuck's around the corner. There is also an adjacent restaurant, Lulu's, on the second floor that has a varied menu for breakfask, lunch and dinner at reasonable prices. In the evenings, it is a little loud for older people, but you can sit out in the ocean breeze.

Five star staff at a 2 star price at this end of Waikiki basic but fully amenitied 3 star hotel. If you are looking for a low key, safe, hotel without sacrificing convenience, this is it! It is located at the very end of the stretch of hotels, hence there's little foot traffic and crowd. You won't be sacrificing convenience or the beach experience, you'll just have more of it! There's a protected ocean area, shallow for kids and the timid. Right next to it, is a popular beginner's surfing area, where you can sign up for lessons in the Park Shore's lobby. There are cheap eats and solid dining options in or adjacent to the hotel (subway, mcdonalds) and Honolulu favs Egg and Things and Rainbow Drive in are walking distance. The hotel also has a free shuttle that will allow you to explore Waikiki, including the incredible food court at Ala Moana, where you can walk across the street to another protected beach area. The best part is the staff here. One employee of note is Miriam at the bell desk. She went above and beyond to search for transportation that saved us over 60% and met our schedule. I was ready to give up and not Miriam. She was persistent, professional and pro-active...a big factor in elevating this hotel from bare basic to top notch value. Definitely a hotel alternative to the jam packed resort area of Waikiki.

Arrived, made to feel really welcome, no stresses, easy going staff and perfect position. Motel not brand new which suits us but rooms big and comfortable and the whole atmosphere of this Motel is just wonderful. The other guests we met have have returned numerous times and we all agreed in the pool that this place was pretty good.  It is right on the beach so across the road from the ocean and next to the zoo. Perfect. I have rated it highly as it is a happy place! Many other new motels do not have the "feel" of this place.

We stayed for 5 nights in March over our spring break. We are a family of four (14 and 12 year old children)The customer service is great from check in (making sure we had pool towels) to the Bell service that was a great resource for questions. There is complimentary juice, water and coffee in the lobby. We were on the 3rd floor that opens to the pool area. The pool area has several tables with umbrellas that we used to eat several take out meals. These rooms have queen size beds. We always travel with a blow up twin mattress too. The room size was fine. We also always bring earplugs which worked out good as there is street noise in the morning. This location was Amazing!!!!! Across from the beach with included beach chairs. We also went to the zoo (across the street) and took a taxi to the start of Diamond Head for a hike to the top. The views of diamond head unobstructed from the pool area were fantastic!!!! We loved that we had our own hotel entrance to the ABC store on the ground floor. Lulus is on the second floor. We ate here once at night but the live music made chatting impossible. Tucker and Bevy is also accessible from the hotel. We had breakfast here a couple of days. Smoothies are $3 add on to sandwich. We would definitely stay here again! We also appreciated the extended late check out (depending on availability) for $10 per hour (we checked out at 5 pm) as we had a late flight and could really take advantage of the time on waikiki.

This was our last stop of the Hawaiian Islands and it was great. We paid for a sea view room and boy did we get one. We had wonderful views of the beach and sea on the right and the Diamond head on the left.We used to have breakfast on our balcony overlooking them or finish off in the evening with a drink over looking them.We used the pool on one day and then went on the beach the other day. You can pick up beach chairs from Reception and take them over to the beach,Staff are helpful. We asked about places to eat and they gave us great ideas.

3.5 stars is a bit of a push in my book. Just above backpacker! Rooms are tiny and not serviced well. Would seem housekeeping can only do one or the other on any given day. I would have preferred some sort of notice board about local activities for the day. Dated decor and we where advised we had been given an upgrade. So glad we got the upgrade! Heard every noice from the back alley to the guest above who sounded like a heard of elephants. Our 2nd trip to Hawaii, our 3rd will be to a different hotel. In hindsight we should have paid the extra $70 a night and went 5 star. Staff are friendly enough.

A warning to all considering this hotel...the restaurant beside the hotel turned into a night club during our stay. We were completely surprised because all the reviews we read talked about how "calming" and "quiet" their stay was at this hotel. My husband and I have visited Waikiki on several occasions and we have usually stayed at either the Outrigger or Hilton Village. Because we now have a 3 yr old, we chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the zoo and aquarium - we completely regret our decision. On our first night, our family was subjected to hearing terrible karaoke singing from the restaurant below. Then the next 2 nights, we had to endure heavy base music with the DJ shouting into the microphone trying to pump up the crowd. What added to the noise was the crowd shouting, laughing, and occasionally fighting outside the club. When I spoke with the receptionist, I was advised that the club would be closing at 2 am. I did not get any impression of sympathy from her. I finally sent an email to the hotel on the 3rd night to complain that my family couldn't sleep because of the noise. I didn't receive any email back but the music finally stopped on the 4th night. When we were checking out, the receptionist did not acknowledge my complaint. Our stay at this hotel was extremely disappointing. While the proximity to sites and the beach was convenient, the lack of sleep and poor customer service we experienced due to the club noise just ruined our trip.

Stayed here for 5 nights for a business trip. Good location, nice but small rooms. Updated decor. Very clean and staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel has towels and chairs to check out and use at the beach for free. Short walk across the street to the beach. Beautiful views. Not very good parking.

This hotel is fantastic, spacious rooms, great staff, awesome views, fantastic pool. It's at the quiet end of Waikiki, just across the road from the beach and the Waikiki wall. The staff are super friendly and helpful, I arrived at 0730 and wasn't looking forward to hanging around all day waiting to get into my room - but my room was ready. They do offer a hospitality room so you can shower and access to the pool if your room isn't ready. The hotel houses three eateries all good and is in easy walking distance of many more. Travelling alone I always felt safe during my stay and was greeted on return each day inquiring about how my day had gone. The lobby also houses a tour company that are fantastic at organizing all sorts of tours and activities. You do need to be aware that quite a lot of O'ahu's homeless hang around the Starbucks and ABC stores trying to beg money or cigarettes - but the Police will quickly move anyone being a pest along and at no time did I feel unsafe. They will also provide a Kettle if you want. The room was quiet even though close to the elevators and the bed was super comfy.

finished our us trip with a stay here has to be best value hotel on strip enjoyed our stay and hopefully will be backyou are directly opposite beach and only a short walk to centre of strip basically has everything you need without the cost.pleasant way to finish a holiday

We stayed at Park Shore Waikiki in March 3017 for 7 nights as a group of 3 friends. We had booked a standard hotel room but on check in we're able to upgrade to a Pool Side room for a reasonable charge. So glad we did as the room and location were fantastic! The room was very clean, well kept and modern. All amenities were working and new. The TV was a great large size. Bathroom and shower all great. Being able to walk straight out to the pool was beautiful! Many an afternoon spent by the pool watching the gorgeous sunset. The staff were all friendly and very helpful. Nothing felt like too much trouble for them. Check in and check out was efficient. The location is amazing. Across from the Zoo so out of the main super busy blocks meant the night noise was minimal. Simply cross the road and you are on the beach. Having StarBucks, Lulu's, ABC shop and more at the hotel was excellent. Would highly recommend this hotel to all. Will certainly stay there again.

An excellent location opposite Waikiki Beach and a short, pleasant, safe walk from Waikiki's main shopping centre and the iconic beachfront cocktail bars - the ideal spots for sunset viewing. Service was friendly, professional and caring. The standard room was very clean and spacious with a small balcony offering a part view of the ocean. There are restaurants at the hotel, an ABC store on site and plenty of dining options all along Kalakaua Ave, beginning at Park Shore. The hotel pool is pleasant with plenty of loungers and umbrellas. Best feature is the location. Room cleaning is a high standard. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will recommend it to my friends.

I have enjoyed my stay at this hotel room was always clean, smelling wonderful and locals truly friendly. Staff was always professional as well as always requesting if assistant is needed for anything. As our last day arrived cleaning staff, staff at luggage check out made sure that everything was ok. GREAT EXPERIENCE
user_name:
workingwomen99
New York City, New York

review_body: Outstanding location and service. Front desk and bell/valet staff always had a smile and greeted us whenever we returned to the hotel. Convenient access, being on the Diamond head side of Waikiki. Great beach, very relaxing. It is evident that the staff is well trained in guest service, displaying the aloha spirit. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel if you are planning a vacation in Waikiki.Our room was clean, nice amenities, and we thoroughly enjoyed the Japanese style washlet. I would also recommend the Japanese restaurant in the lobby ,authentic Japanese food and service, reasonably priced.

I love this hotel so much. Yes, it may not be a flashy as some of the other hotels but there is nothing that I don't love. The location is great being at the quieter end of Waikiki but still within walking distance to everything. Our room had the most stunning views ever. Incredibly comfy bed, great air con too. We had the corner room on the 11th floor so and views of Diamond Head as well as the stunning ocean views, we could watch the sun set every night if we had wanted to. We also love Lulu's bar which is right underneath. Only one night out of 8 nights were it was quite loud.

This was a great little hotel at the end of the Waikiki beach. Had the ocean front view and it was amazing. Small pool, but did not spend much time there as the beach was right across the street. I plan to stay here again.

We stayed at Park Shore Aqua from Jan 22 to 28 2017. We had a corner suite on the 11th floor and a view of Diamond Head across the Zoo Park one way, and the other way to Waikiki Beach.Everything was conveniently located, 2 restaurants and a convenience ABC store right at the hotel.Pool deck was easily accessed, and plenty loungers.

We stayed at Park Shore from March 9th-16th. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view/Diamond Head view right above the pool on 4th floor which was amazing. Room was small but we weren't there a lot and it fit our needs. The doors to hotel rooms shut very loudly and that woke us up multiple times during our stay from neighboring rooms, but that would be only complaint. Pool closes at sunset, but you can still hang out on patio. Wifi worked great. Safe had low battery and maintenance fixed immediately after we called. Very friendly. Great location as it's last hotel on strip, so not as crowded outside as others. Short walk to all entertainment and restaurants. Zoo is right across street. We walked to Diamond Head, but I would suggest taking uber or bus because it's about a 2 mile walk before the actual hike.

Enjoyed our one night stay, check in was fast and courteous, free 1 hour late check out and luggage storage. Great location, enjoyed Lu lu's for food and happy hour. Great people watching from the beach facing seating.

This hotel was right across the street from the beach and near everything you could need in Waikiki. We had a partial ocean room and the views were incredible with the ocean in front and Diamond Head right beside us. We were able to walk to dinner or grab breakfast and lunch located right next to the lobby at Tucker and Bevvy. The service was incredible! My friend and I had a late flight out of Hawaii and they held our bags for several hours after we checked out at no extra cost. They also offer towels and chairs for use at the beach. Last, sign up for the A List insider before booking your room (which just includes giving your email address) and get a free room upgrade at arrival. Very satisfied with this hotel and would definitely stay there again!

Just across the street from the beach, at the end of the row of hotels, the Park Shore has unobstructed views of both Diamond Head and the ocean from most of its rooms. With Starbucks, a convenience store, and restaurants only steps away, the zoo right across one street and the beach right across another, the location could hardly be better. The staff is friendly, and the rooms are clean. Because it's in a prime location and located close to so many desirable places, you do have to contend with limited parking (a $28/night fee), traffic and the noise that comes with it, smaller room sizes, and many neighbors. Still, the lanai (balcony) with its views of both mountains and ocean are wonderful, and much of what you come to Hawai'i for. Highly recommended.

A fantastic spot right beside the zoo and park. Felt like we had a bit more space being Dow the end of the Waikiki strip. The staff were friendly, and the standard room clean and perfectly functional. Would happily stay there again!

We chose this hotel based on location, as we were in town for a beach volleyball tournament held across the street. We were very happy with the location, the facilities, the friendly staff and especially the view from our Ocean View room, which overlooked both the beach and the volcano. The room was clean and comfortable and well maintained our entire trip. We liked being a little out of the way at the end of the beach to avoid some of the crowds, and found the Park Shore exactly what we needed. There was a little wait to check in as several parties arrived at once, but otherwise, we were very pleased with our stay. The manager's welcome at the pool and the helpfulness of the bell staff with transportation and beach chairs were nice touches. Every member of the staff was kind and friendly and greeted us with a smile and Aloha. We were close to stores and restaurants and were able to walk to anything we needed within minutes. We highly recommend the Oahu Park Shore for family and couple vacations and would definitely stay here again if we return to Honolulu.

The hotel was nice right across from the beach. the only issue we had was it said free WI-FI and when we checked out they charged us $20.00 for it and to use the pool was another $20.00. We were not told ahead of time about these hidden fees as we didn't even use the pool or the beach and we wouldn't of used the Wi-Fi if we new there was a charge.

The hotel is very close to the waikiki beach. Just 2 minutes walk. Hotel staff provides beach towels if you want to have fun on the beach. It has three restaurants with three different styles of cuisines.

Thank you Park Shore - for the most wonderful week's accommodation! When we arrived at 7am our bags were grabbed from us by the porters, and happily stored until our room was made ready for check-in. Our initial first impression of the foyer area was that it was tired and outdated. We therefore expected our room to be similar but were pleasantly surprised.Nothing was too difficult for the Park Shore staff and we had the most wonderful time, and would not hesitate to stay at Park Shore next time we visit. Roxie on reception, made a fuss of my husband's birthday, he was given a box of Macadamia chocolates to celebrate. Bathroom was nicely refurbished and our room booking was upgraded to the pool deck - walk outside the sliding door, straight onto pool deck. Ice machine, microwave for use of residents - all wonderful.Our only wish is for such a wonderful hotel, (seemingly with everything needed for a fantastic holiday) to be given a foyer refurbishment. It is currently dowdy and outdated - really daggy actually. But get past that and you will have the most wonderful holiday - especially if Roxie has anything to do with it. Thank you Roxie!
user_name:
Jenny S
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: The location can't be beat, if you want a quieter end of Waikiki. We went down to the beach / grassy park between Kalakaua ave and the sea, and we had a nice day. The beach farther north, Waikiki proper, is body to body crowded. The hotel provides towels and beach chairs, and that helped make a day at the beach more comfortable. We had a king bed ocean view, and the room was smallish, but fine for a couple days. Mini fridge and coffee maker, so we bought some milk for coffee. Well worth it to upgrade to ocean view to watch the the world go by. We spent some nice evenings on our balcony with a drink. Loved the location. Walked to the more local restaurants and shops on Kapahulu Ave. sliding glass balcony door blocked most street noise, so a good night's sleep. As for the resort fee, I agree, cut the nonsense and raise the overall price. It is a silly pricing scheme.Desk and bell station were outstandingly nice. Staff in the shop, Tucker and Bevvy, were rude and clueless to customer service. The staff at the ABC shop on property were cheerful and welcoming. Would definitely stay here again.

Right from check in we felt welcome. Michelle at the front desk and the guys at the bell desk were very nice and helpful. Our partial ocean view had amazing views of both the beach and Diamond Head. The room was plenty big enough with a comfy Beautyrest mattress. Maintenance was super fast at helping us with programming the a/c, lending us a fan and showing us where the temp control for the mini fridge was.[ Beer wasn't cold enough] HaHa. 2min walk to the beach,pier, zoo, starbucks, ABC stores, Lu-Lu's and thee awesome Teddy's bigger burger. Free stuff- beach towels, mango juice and shuttle to Ala Moana Mall with pickup every 30min till 8pm. I wish our Canadian dollar wasn't so crappy, or we could have stayed longer. Mahalo, Park Shore!

In close proximity to the beach and shopping areas. Enjoyed early morning swims in the ocean which is just across the street. The hotel was fully occupied with most of the guests heading to the beautiful blue water of the oceanThe staff were very friendly and helpful. All in all had a nice stay enjoying every minute of the beautiful sunshine and the great souvenier shopsThe hotel could use a little bit more updating but the staff make up with their friendly attitude

This hotel is in a great location towards the end of the beach.The staff must be the most polite and helpful one could wish to meet.The hotel room we stayed in was quite 'tired' and the bathroom was in need of refurbishment. We were on the 15th floor and the smell of cooking from outside was unpleasant. One couldn't open the balcony doors because of the smells. Even keeping them shut the smells permuated via the corridor.Lovely hotel, but I would only stay here again if the the odours were addressed.I did bring this to the attention of the desk and they were very very obliging and offered to move us, but we only had two nights left and could not face the disruption of moving

closest to Waikiki Beach and you can rest easy enough.No bus noise, no night light pollution.It is not the best at Waikiki.But the most reasonable hotel.Although it is a non-smoking area in Starbucks, I feel sorry for the reckless smoking of smokers.

This hotel is in a great spot. Close to beach and walking distance to good shopping. Needs a bit of updating but in general was clean and comfortable. Looking out at the beach or the zoo was great - my room had no other buildings looking in so I was very happy. The pool had pretty short hours of access but the ocean is just right across the road with an area that is sectioned off for swimming which makes it great for familys with children.

The Park Shore was a breath of fresh air as soon as we checked in! On arrival we were greeted by a very lovely receptionist who was really welcoming, the rooms were clean and modern, and nothing was a problem for any of the staff. Perfect location (Starbucks and Lulu's right next door), central for bus pick ups/drop offs, beach, restaurants and shopping, but our room wasn't noisy at all. Pool area has a lovely view and shade umbrellas FOC!. Would definitely stay at Park Shore again :)

Awesome property. My friend and I were so pleased with Park Shore. The room was immaculately clean, staff were so friendly and helpful. Can't fault it. 10 out of 10 will stay here again! Perfect location and excellent value for money.

Location is great. Very friendly employees in every position. Would have loved having a somewhat comfortable chair in our room. Would stay here again. Maybe some updating would be in order. Good bang for the buck!

The hotel is dated however I think that's part of the charm. Perfect location by Waikiki beach at the end of the street. I was pleasantly surprised by what a great view our room had.Customer service was excellent. Comfy bed. Starbucks and ABC store next door. The zoo is across the street through the park.Overall we had a great stay here. I would book it again.

I've stayed at this hotel several times and have enjoyed each of my stays mainly due to it's location. It's at the very end of the hotel strip in Waikiki Beach and is located just across from the Honolulu Zoo. The views of the ocean and Diamond Head are great because there are no other hotels between you and what you are looking at. Also, because of the many huge trees in the park just across the street, in the very early morning hours the sound of hundreds of birds chirping will surely be music to your ears and is such a magical way to start your day in paradise.
