The staff is very friendly and accommodating and the hotel is clean and well maintained. I recommend booking either an ocean view or ocean front room, otherwise you will get a nice room, but your view will be of the hotel next door.

We spent 3 nights at this hotel in February. The hotel is located on the south end of Waikiki beach, everything is within easy walking distance. Great location. The staff (especially Risa) was very efficient, friendly and made us feel welcome.The rooms are quite large, the bed was comfortable. However, if your room is on the lower levels, you will definitely hear street noise. Other than that, a standard hotel room. While some parts of the building have been renovated, there are still some areas that look very used.The hotel provides a towel service (beach towels), which we appreciated. As everything in Waikiki, the price for the room is quite steep - especially for this style of hotel.All in all, a very average hotel made better by the staff. Not sure if we would stay again.

Stayed at Park Shore Waikiki for three nights in February. Ocean Front room had been nicely remodeled, and the view was amazing! Will definitely return again. Best surprise was having chocolate covered strawberries on Valentine’s Day! For convenience, there’s Lulu’s, Starbucks, and an ABC Store at your doorstep, and a Wolfgang Puck’s around the corner. Quick and easy access to the beach, zoo, and Kapiolani Park. First time we’ve stayed on this end of Waikiki Beach, and definitely prefer it better.

This is the second time I have stayed at Park Shore & I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The location is fantastic as it isn't in the busy part of Waikiki, the Zoo is just across the road so you don't have any big hotels blocking your view or looking in on you. We always get an Ocean View Room & the views are amazing especially the sunsets which are breathtaking from your balcony. The reception is lovely & not busy like in other hotels down the road. If you haven't stayed here I highly recommended you do as I have stayed in other Hotels in Waikiki & they are not as nice as this one & the price is very reasonable. Also a BIG thank you to Annie for all your help with our booking & room, your customer service is amazing. Park Shore Waikiki we look forward to staying with you again Thank you for another wonderful stay

This is a great hotel right across the road from Waikiki Beach and the Zoo, The staff are amazing! Everyone there is more than helpful, from Roxy to Ethan, you will not be upset. From the exterior you know you're going to have a great stay. Lulu's is on the second floor and the view from there, looking out onto the beach is something from the movies! There's also a Starbucks just outside the hotel lobby. The open concept lobby is beautiful as well. I ate the Japanese restaurant on the main floor and it did not disappoint! Amazing food at a reasonable price.

The Park Shore was an 'okay' hotel - but the real draw is the convenient location. Right by the beach, and the main strip. Short walk to Waikiki beach.Staff were very friendly. Room was clean. Very basic hotel room, nothing special. Nice pool with a great view.

First thing was accessing the hotel. Sure you have to get through traffic and turn in, but you cannot avoid that. The entrance is on Kapahulu so there were less cars and people to wait for, so it was easier than most places on the strip. Upon entry, we were greeted by a large clean room with welcoming staff (Po at the front desk was especially helpful!)The room was standard size, clean, but could have used a more updated bed for comfort. We lucked out with views of the zoo, the crater, and the beach!The pool deck was always clean and offered a variety of chairs and loungers, as well as umbrellas. It's not huge, but adequate for the amount of people that were swimming at any given time. Would have loved to have a drink and snack bar, but at least you're allowed to bring your own. There's a starbucks, tucker & bevvy (prepackaged sandwiches and snacks), Yoshitsune (sushi), and Lulu's (best happy pricing i found!) on site for your convenience. Beach is right across the street, and they are happy to loan you towels and/or chairs. Lulu's is an open air bar, and there's another at the hotel right next door, which is great. Unless you are a light sleeper and don't like the sound of live bands almost every night. But Waikiki is a busy place. You'll have to get used to noise!Quick easy access to everything.. Beach, food, shopping, zoo, aqaurium... You really can't go wrong!I would stay here again and would also recommend it :)

This hotel is my all-time favorite on Oahu. It is located near the Honolulu Zoo, on the end of Waikiki Beach. You can walk to Diamond Head or to the center of town. The beach is right across the street, and there are ABC stores in close proximity. We always choose a room with 2 double beds (also includes a refrigerator).... go with an ocean view room to get a balcony with a view of the ocean. (You could get a pool-side room on the 3rd floor, but with an ocean outside your door......). We have stayed on the 4th floor and the 6th floor - so far the 6th floor room on the corner facing Diamond Head and the ocean was our favorite. Staff is friendly and extremely helpful - Risa, Ethan, and Poouahi have been AMAZING! (Looking forward to seeing them again!) Restaurants are plentiful and within walking distance. Valet parking is available, but we have not taken advantage of this option. Bell service is great when you check out and need to leave your bags for a later departure. Towels and beach chairs are available, as well as wi-fi (included in the $20/daily resort fee).

Loved this Hotel !!!! Location was Perfect , Beach was across the road.The view from my Room was amazing . I have had Front ocean View . Some many restaurants to choose from. I stay there again. The Staff very friendly and helpful.

First, you're on Waikiki Beach, and so you're paying for location. The room was very small and had we been there longer than 3 nights, it would have become annoying. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. Also, we arrived a bit early after a very long flight from New Zealand, and the lack of flexibility on letting someone in a room early negates any friendly staff. Everyone knows that all of the rooms do not miraculously become clean at 3:00 and there weren't many people there early, it would not have any major detrimental effect to let people in, if the room is ready. Although I was warned about the valet parking charge, the $20.00 amenity fee was a surprise. Both of these fees push the cost of the room over what it was worth. And be aware, if you're looking for a place to drive "in" to the hotel, it is only a couple of parking spaces in the very front of the place. We ended up missing it the first time around and with all the one way streets, it was very stressful to go around again. The beach towels were handy to have.

Great location, right across from the beach and 5 min walk to the centre of town. Slightly quieter end of Waikiki. Staff were fabulous, so friendly and helpful! Rooms were standard size but very clean and beds were comfortable.Will definitely be staying there again and can highly recommend it to everyone.

My husband I have have stayed at many hotels on Waikiki, but we LOVE the Park Shore. and have now stayed here several times.We are not going anywhere else.The location at the end of the Waikiki strip cannot be beat and the Oceanfront Room has views directly over the beach.The best sunsets are right on our lanai.Ask for the lovely and helpful Risa at the front desk!!

Our main complaint was that our room was beside the elevator so woke up early to the ding, ding, ding of the elevator announcing its arrival. Also annoying was the big bang the doors made when closing....also a waker-upper late at night or early in the morning. Maid service was excellent as she kept an eye on when we left each morning and cleaned up promptly. The free juices in the lobby were a nice touch. Didn't like how our room's balcony was facing the building right beside us so people could look in our room (kept the sheers pulled when inside). The beach chairs available in the lobby were very welcome. Thanks for that! More information about your free shuttle to the mall should have been in our room...we didn't find out about it for the first week (maybe on check-in it was mentioned, but since we did that at 1am we likely were half asleep). Staff all very courteous. Since it's been 35 years since we'd stayed in Waikiki, not sure if this hotel is over-priced or average. Would be better, of course, if the Canadian $ was worth more, but we just have to swallow that!

Arrive tired and weary and faced by the usual welcome policy of not being able to check into the room until 3 pm. Little or no flexibility shown and then a request for a $40 early entry fee. Then stung for a US$ 20 /day amenity fee. Hotel rooms are adequate. The pool is not much to speak of. My recommendation though is go up market if you can. Welcome to America!!
user_name:
RichardBB_13
Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea

review_body: The room was clean & adequate but small. The reception counter staff were somewhat friendly & helpful except for Roxy who was very exceptionally helpful. The foot traffic in the area was quite busy so if you don't care for that I would recommend a hotel a bit further from the beach. We took a tour with Makani Kai Helicopters with pilot Jim, had a great flight with lots of information. Over all it was a good holiday but expensive.

Lovely,reasonable, hotel walking distance from Diamond Head, across the street from Waikiki Beach. Close to everything, shopping, dining, beach. Front desk Staff goes above and beyond to be helpful. Rooms clean and comfortable.

Stayed for 10 days. Staff were excellent. Great value as room was clean and staff were very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay there again and highly recommend. Great views from pool terrace and not overcrowded like a bigger chain hotel. Great location at end of strip next to Zoo and Park. Very close to nicer beach on Waikiki

This hotel is good value for money and located centrally with only 5 minute walk to the beach. Healthy restaurant adjacent to hotel. Comfortable bed and clean room, enjoyed my stay. Lobby is super modern and cool.

Right on the main strip. Walked to all stores and restaurants. Stayed here night before Pearl Harbor. Clean, room was newer,valet ($28 a night), has pool, and towels for beach. Would stay again. Not far from airport

Nothing bad about this hotel, it just needs an update if it is to continue to charge at the higher end.The good:At the quiet end of the beach, good views of Diamond Head and the beach, adjacent to the zoo, clean, comfortable,friendly an efficient staff, fast free wifi.The ordinary:In need of an update - decor is very dated.Pool area not inviting- a plain concrete deck.Small roomsNoisey air conAt US$330 + resort fee per night, I expected something a bit better.

We stayed for 14 nights last October, a family of two adults and one child. We have been staying at Park Shore for 8 years now including the year we brought all of our wedding guests and other years when we book multiple rooms. Considering all of the fantastic loyalty schemes we have in Sydney hotels, it has always been disappointing to not be rewarded for return visits (6). And this time we encountered the new $20 resort fee since the hotel merged with Aqua I guess. I know it seems to include plenty but having stayed many times before, much of this was already included at this hotel which is one of the reasons we loved it and the extras cost extra anyway. The shuttle is included but not the tip so it works out the same price as the trolley. The chairs require a tip so better off buying one from ABC and the yoga requires a tip. So coming from a non-tipping country (and can I say we always tip when in Hawaii) these bonuses are actually costing money. Of course, the location is fantastic, the rooms are lovely, the staff are mostly helpful but I think the price is getting a little high. We also paid a lot more to upgrade our room this year than previous years. I see there is now an "insider" rate but I can get that rate through AAA so there is still no "reward" for return visitors. When returning this year I will be checking out other hotels for value.

One of the best hotels close to waikiki beach. Only a few minutes to the beach.Pool available, free internet. Small small fee can stay in the room for the departure to the airport. Very clean rooms, very friendly staff, medium price class Is organized as well as day trips.Restaurant in the house.Until of Starbucks, ABC stores, surf school.We always come back to this hotel, is very centrally located.

We visited Park Shore Waikiki last May 2016 to celebrate my Baby's 1st bday.. We arrived at hotel with a very warm and very nice greetings from the employees.. Beach view room was perfect.. Nice soft bed and very clean room.. close to to the Mall, beach and the famous Diamond head Monument.. hope to be back there.. Awesome stay..Thank you Park shore waikiki!!

so close to the beach and incredible value. really great staff and loved the sport bar Lulu's for breakfast and pupus. Will definitely come back on my next trip to Waikiki. Make sure to go to the manager's reception -- great drinks and its complimentary.

The hotel's premium location is convenient for anything and everything you could possibly need while on your vacation in paradise. The staff presented themselves brilliantly! Really great experiences as they were all very helpful. Especially Risa, Micah and Annie.

This was a Costco package deal with airfare, airport transfers and hotel. There is a lot to recommend this hotel and a few things you need to be aware of. The pros: great location, very clean, friendly staff, nearby Starbucks. The bed was fine. Shower was hot. Internet worked. TV was good. AC worked well. The rest: small rooms, no comfortable chair in room, small bathroom, no gym, no laundry on site, dated furnishings (but always clean). You can hear the ocean but also the street noise. They don't have computers and a printer (as advertised).Conclusion: I liked the place. Just don't expect Hyatt or Westin quality.

My friend and I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and price. We booked it on line, and when we got to the hotel, we asked about discounts- senior, military, AAA, AARP and the young man at the desk told us we couldn't get a discount because we had already booked on line, but after we protested sweetly, he changed the room price! So we were very grateful to him. We had a great view, right across from the beach, it's a nice, safe area, and several nice restaurants within walking distance. We were thoroughly delighted.

We stayed at the Park Shore for two weeks in late January - early February 2017. Our booking was easy and a couple of requests were granted including a paid upgrade to an oceanfront room - thanks Randy. The $20 daily resort fee was included in the original booking cost, so no nasty surprises at checkout. Fee included use of beach chairs, wifi internet, cold water/juices, coffee or tea in the lobby, daily newspapers, daily cleaning and service of our room and use of beach/pool towels.Our time at the hotel started early as we arrived at 8:30am. Rooms are not generally available until 3pm as was the case for us, but they allowed us to use the hospitality room next to the pool to freshen up. After the 9 hour flight from Sydney this was great. We were also able to use the pool area - towels provided. Our bags were stored until our room was ready - no charge all part of the service.At 3pm Roxy checked us in and we went up to or room in one of three elevators. Our room was lovely (14th floor) with views from Diamond Head , Kuhio Beach around to Waikiki Beach. We could see this vista from the balcony or lying in bed. The room was quite big with king bed, flat screen TV and plenty of power points.The facilities in the Park Shore were very good - everything was immaculately clean. The pool was big enough for the size of the motel and seemed enough deck chairs to cater for number of guests. Lulus - the bar/restaurant on the first floor was excellent and is open for breakfast through to 3am some nights. Caters for all tastes. There is an ABC shop (convenience store) on the ground floor - excellent place to get anything you might need, cheap as well. Starbucks has a store onsite. The Aussie inspired "Tucker & Bevvy" sits off the foyer and has wonderful fresh food. Finally the Japanese restaurant also accessed from the foyer is one of the top picks in Waikiki.The hotel is across the road from Kuhio, Waikiki Beach and the Honolulu Zoo. We could see flamingos from our balcony. An easy walk to the main shopping centre and restraints of Waikiki. The Waikiki Trolley leaves from the block behind the Park Shore, a one minute walk. There is bus stop out the front. We have holidayed in Waikiki a number of times staying at The Sheraton, Hyatt Place and The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel. This is probably the oldest hotel we have stayed in but also the friendliest and quietest. It is hidden on the far eastern end of the Waikiki strip but we found that to be a definite asset.We will definitely be back.

Stayed at Park Shore for 8 days in January for our 1st family holiday in Hawaii. We landed at 6am, checked in around 8am after a 10hour flight. We booked our 2 rooms in June 2016. We were charged an early check in fee of $70 per room ($140 in total). I didn't expect it to be waived, but it would have been "nice" though since we did book so many months in advance, made full payment at the time of booking and front desk did see our tired children. Despit the tiredness at check in, our family of five were still very cheerful to just be in Hawaii! If it wasn't for us being exhausted, i would have opted to leave bags in a room and check in at 3pm. Having the early check in fee waived would have been "nice". We requested rooms to be 2 beds and the other 1 King. Both rooms were 2 beds (so hubby and i had seperate beds!). Did not bother to bring this up with management because as i said earlier, we were too exhausted from our flight and just left it. Personally, i just didn't want to deal with the unfriendly desk manager. We also paid $25 per day for valet parking - the bellboys were polite, courteous and always very friendly. Not so much front desk. We never saw anyone from front desk say a warm hello or even crack a smile. Both check in and check out was served by the same "manager". Though she was just doing her job, i did not find her "warm" or "friendly". That might just be me. The rooms were clean and the beds were made daily. But that's expected when you pay a resort fee. Rooms were small, but bearable. Enjoyed our stay in Hawaii, but probably wouldn't stay here again for the reasons stated above. The only thing the hotel has going for it, are the welcoming and friendly bellboys/concierege. May i suggest a customer service and empathy course for its front desk manager?

This hotel's locations couldn't be better, right at the beach and in front of a bus stop. There was free juice and coffee every day, plus they provided free beach chairs and towels. Also, there was a shuttle right to the Ala Moana shopping centre. The room was basic but had everything we needed.

For the price I paid, I was very disappointed in the room. Average. Small. outdated. Old mattress that caved in. Hard pillows. They said they "upgraded" me to a room with a view. That's about it. In addition to the price of the room, add on the taxes, a "resort" fee of $20 (I used none of the items listed) and parking fee.....can't remember the amount per day, but $25 per day sounds about right. Small swimming pool. I complained several times, therefore the "upgrade" to the room with a view. After several complaints, I was given 50% off the resort fee, which equalled $10 per day.

This hotel definitely exceeded my expectations. My husband and I traveled here for our honeymoon in January, and knew we'd be spending a lot of money during our trip so didn't want to splurge on a hotel. This hotel was awesome, and it was much cheaper than others we looked at, especially for the value we received. We booked directly from their site and even got a newlywed discount, so definitely check that out if you are looking. The service was great - super friendly staff. They have a hospitality room and luggage storage if you need to check out way before your flight leaves, which we did. The amenities such as free coffee in the lobby every morning and beach towels were a nice touch. Our room was nice, kind of small but it provided what we needed. Comfy bed, clean, nice shower, and most of all amazing view. We booked a king ocean front view, and I would suggest doing that for sure. We had a perfect view of the ocean as well as Diamond Head. Made for great mornings drinking coffee on our balcony! The location was also great. It was right across the street from the beach, and close to the zoo and aquarium. All of the stores, restaurants, etc. along the Waikiki beach walk were easy to get to, and it was also nice to walk the other direction for some quieter beach areas. If you are considering booking this hotel, do it!

Stayed here two nts. Good price (for Waikiki) and location, within easy walking distance to zoo and aquarium. Nice lobby, slightly creepy hallway to rooms on our floor, lots of electrical outlets in room (a plus), seedy elevators (1 out of commission during our stay). The hotel has a shuttle to some other hotels and the Ala Moana shopping center that proved very unreliable for me. No regular schedule, it seems. I wound up taking the #8 bus back to the hotel after waiting 20 minutes beyond the time the driver said he'd be back. (I had to be back by 5 and made it just in time.) Another drawback, particularly for a hotel that says it was recently renovated/updated: who still uses full-size beds anymore? Don't want to end this review on a negative note, however: Hotel staff here is very nice and tries to be helpful, and the Japanese restaurant (Yoshitsune) off the lobby was a delightful cultural experience.

From the great front desk staff to the bellman and cleaning staff we had the best treatment. Fantastic view of ocean and Diamond Head. Stayed 13 nights. Great location and park and Honolulu Zoo across the street.

Crossed the international dateline on my birthday and we stayed here for a week whist exploring the island.We then departed for a weeks cruise aboard the Pride of America Great room, great team on reception and they gave us rooms with awesome viewsMalhalo

My wife and I stayed at the Park Shore last week. We had a fantastic experience. We originally chose the hotel based on the rates and location. We booked on their website with their promo to get an upgraded room if available. We booked a normal room with city/mountain view. When we got to the hotel we were upgrade to a ocean view! It even had a mountain view too. Definitely recommend doing this if available. The location was the best part of the hotel. It's located at the end of the hotel strip on Waikiki beach. This was great because it was less busy at that end, while still in walking distance of all the shops and restaurants. Also the beach, which is across the street, is less crowded too. If you head left once coming out of the hotel there are no resorts and not as many people on the beach. If I had to choose a negative it would be the room itself. It wasn't bad, but little things that seemed outdated. Some chips in some wood. This is not a deal breaker. In Hawaii you aren't spending much time in the room. Again if I had to say something negative about the stay, but it's really nitpicking. One tip that turned out great for us. I took surfing lessons, but not from the place in the hotel, from the hut on the beach directly across the street. It's only $40 for an hour lesson (trust me you won't need more, it's more tiring than you think!). Don is really a good instructor and they took pictures and put it on a flash drive for you. The flash drive with pics was $45 and they used a really nice camera to take pics. I got 100+ pictures of me surfing for the first time, it was definitely worth it!We did not rent a car and glad we didn't. Valet I think is $20 or $25 a night. We walked places or took Uber/Lyft. Plus talked to the local drivers and learned the best places to eat. All in all, I would definitely recommend the Park Shore to anyone staying on Waikiki beach and would definitely stay there again if I go back.

From the moment we stepped out of the taxi, we knew we made the right choice. There stood a mountain of a man, named Joey, who welcomed us by name. From then until we left two days later, our experience with this hotel was superb. They helped us with tours, transportation, shopping ideas and local attractions. Sits at the end of hotel row with views of the zoo park, ocean and Diamond Head. Room was clean and welcoming--but not anything super fancy. BTW, there is a resort fee of $20.

We stayed at Park Shore for 8 nights as a family of 4. We stayed in the pool lanai room which is suitable for our family size. Perfect location, walking distance to everything and beach just across the road, also provided free beach towels and beach chairs and free freshments in lobby. Free courtesy bus was a bonus! Room service was done and daily and we always had fresh towels. All of this is included in the resort fee. ABC store and Tucker & Bevvy Cafe next to lobby of our hotel, where they have fresh juices, smoothies and yummy on the go foods. Ethan and Annie at the front desk and the bell boys provided exceptional service and were very friendly and informative. Overall would highly recommend staying here!

Room was too small. TV reception was poor. No place to put my laptop and no chair to sit on. No view. Location was the only savings grace. Reduce the price by 1/2 would make the room much more enjoyable.

Went to Park Shore with my husband and son for 5 days. Fairly small room but nice and clean. Elevator is slow, so you spend a lot of time in it when you are staying on 18. floor. Location is great, beach so close and Starbucks just next door.

I recently took my daughters to Oahu getting 2 rooms and stayed at the Park Shore for 7 nights. Here are some pros and cons.ProLocation of room was ocean front and I had a great view of Diamond HeadClean and QuietThe hotel staff was always helpful and friendly. Volunteering information on places to go and eatNice lobbyLuLu restaurant is attached to hotel and his good inexpensive (for Waikiki) breakfastConRooms are small with limited close spaceRooms are showing there age and are in desperate need of being updated. Carpet must have been at least 10-15 years old, furniture is pretty beat up and beds for me they are to hard

First of all, I’ll admit the view we had from our room was amazing but not we did have a few problems upon staying at this resort….When we first arrived we dropped out bags off with the bellboys and were told to go see reception. We knew it was before the check in time but we were told to go see them anyway so they knew we had arrived. We did this. While we waited in line, there were two people on the desk working. The lady exclaims she is going to lunch and walks off. That’s fine, people need to eat right? Anyway, only a few moments later she reappears and seems a bit annoyed. As she serves us, I explain that we’re here to check in. She angrily announces that check in isn’t until 3pm and we’re way too early and that a room won’t be ready until after 3pm. We arrived just after 1pm and I already stated to her that I knew this. We didn’t even want to get into our room, we just wanted to leave our bags so we could go across to the zoo. After a few words were spoken, she finally got me to write out the forms and then told us again in her own words, ‘Do not come back until after 3pm.’ It wasn’t until after that I wished I had gotten her name so I could make a complaint.Fast forward a few hours, we arrived back and were allowed to check in properly and were given the keys to the room. We had requested two beds but instead were given one. When we asked the question we were told that no such thing was on our booking yet it was all over the paperwork we were given. We were also told if we wanted to move rooms we could but we would have to give up the view we had. Mind you, we booked and paid for a front ocean view room with two beds. We decided to let this go as we didn’t want this to hinder our vacation. I must add we were never offered the towels or refreshments that were stated on the website that we would get on check in. It was only three days into our vacation that we found out where they were in the lobby. Most of the stay was okay and problem free but a day before leaving we left for a tour only to come back to our room with a few of our toiletries missing and someone had tried to use one of the iPads we had in the room. We only know this as originally the iPad was off but was turned on with a notification saying wrong password had been entered. So if you do plan to stay at this hotel please keep in mind that your personal belongings may either disappear or will be touched/used etc. We didn’t bother reporting this as we were treated badly in the beginning so we figured there was no point.

I'm currently here for a month and a half on business with the Army. When traveling, I quickly get tired of eating fast food and running around after I'm off work, just trying to get a meal before I turn in for the night. This hotel has only a small "cube" fridge, and no microwave in the rooms. This is most likely due to the hotels embedded restraunts, the Japanese place on the first floor, and another place upstairs. So, shopping at Walmart and bringing food back to the room to eat after work isn't going to work. Around the Waikiki area, there is also no parking, so driving somewhere to eat will require going across town, to the area of Wheeler AAF to be able to park and shop, or eat. Also, the only availablr parking at the hotel is a valet service, that will cost you $30.00 per day, over and above the already high cost of the small room you'll be staying in. Yes, there is the Zoo, the Beach, a burger joint around the corner, etc, but plan on walking everywhere to do anything else, as parking is little to nil. The Hotel Staff are pleasant to deal with, especially the Valet guys, who seem to be very cheerful. Overall, as a tourist, this place would be ok. For business, not so much, especially if it's an extended stay. As mentioned in the Hotels pitch description, every room has a "private Lanai", and I have attached pictures of the view from my room. Nice, if I had any voyeuristic tendencies. Otherwise, rooms with Ocean views will set you back much more than the $161.00 that this particular room costs each day. Overall, if there were somewhere closer to Wheeler AAF, I'd be there. The rat-race of Waikiki isn't worth the frustration, especially for business travelers.

The hotel is closed to zoo, walking distance to Diamond Head and Waikiki. The location is good. We booked an ocean view room through United Airline Vacation package. Upon we arrived to the room assigned by the front desk on 12/30/16, we found that the room is partial ocean view and more mountain view. You have to dig out your head at balcony to see the Waikiki Beach. We asked for changes for the room because it doesn't match to what we booked. The front desk claimed that the hotel were full plus that was what the hotel category was for ocean view - partial ocean view and view of Diamond Head. The front desk changed another room for us and said they would give us a real ocean view room on 12/31/16. On 12/31/16, they gave us another room with different floor only, still not ocean view. We asked the front desk why, the front desk manager Ethan said the ocean view for Park Shore hotel was supposed to be partial ocean view and partial mountain view, not ocean front. "If you think ocean front is ocean view, I am sorry about how you feel. We don't offer refunds or exchange. You should talk to your booking agent if you have problems of the room." The way how front desk manager spoke with customers was rude and mean. This guy is not well trained for customer service.

Very old property this is more like 3 star hotel service is very friendly they charge extra for resort fee so they give you towels and chair for the beach, they also offer transportation to only the mall and one of the bus is super cold we ask for the driver to turn the ac off but he ignored us, they have somebody from Expedia to sell excursion and car rental and I think we over pay so shop around before buy anything

The location was very good and reasonably priced. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were a good size and the pool area was clean. We could not hear traffic noise at night so we slept very well.

We have stayed here twice now and have enjoyed both our stays. We picked this hotel as we liked the location at the end of the hotel strip, it's Oceanfront location with uninterrupted views to Diamond Head also. The hotel is quite pricey but we felt the cost was worth it. Both times we stayed in an oceanfront room on the corner with views of the ocean as you see on their website. Rooms are clean and tidy with good quality bathrooms and a convenience store is located below the hotel. We will certainly be back.

We stayed in an Ocean Front Room with superb views of the Beach and Diamond Head.The Rooms were large and clean.Great location and the most amazing customer service in particular from a lovely lady named Roxy on the Reception desk who always had a smile and willingness to help. The shuttle service was also a great bonus. We will definitely satay here again.

Pleasant enough. Front desk staff not particularly friendly...no smiles...bellboys were more helpful. Great location. Very sad xmas tree in reception. Everything is a bit worn down and used looking..could do with a revamp all over.

Lovely hotel with very clean rooms and accessible to most of Waikiki. It sits right opposite Waikiki Beach & Honolulu Zoo. And, right next door is Starbucks. Thanks to the Parkshore team for taking care of us really well

We found Park Shore Waikiki to be a very nice hotel to stay near Waikiki Beach - and by near I mean across the street. I had been warned not to stay in the Waikiki area because it was a traffic mess and too touristy. But I'm very glad we did and traffic was not bad at all over the holiday weekend. Valet parking was $25/night and worth it - Very easy and quick service. Park Shore is near the end of the strip of hotels and shops - across the street from the zoo. We were there over Thanksgiving and got to enjoy a parade from our balcony. We enjoyed walking the streets, seeing the street entertainers and going to Duke's to eat. The room was nice and rates reasonable. We would stay here again if ever lucky enough to get to Hawaii and second time.

We spent 2 weeks at the Park Shores at end of Nov/early Dec. and enjoyed our stay very much! To us location, location, location is most important and since we wanted to be on the beach (across the street) with a great view of the ocean, green space, AND Diamond Head, and be at the quieter end of Waikiki, yet close to lots of good restaurants, shops, Aquarium, the canal, etc, this hotel was perfect! My husband enjoyed his daily walk along the quiet waterfront, through the huge park or along the canal. Our room was on the smaller side, with a small 1 person bathroom, and no comfortable easy chair in the room, just one desk chair. Also no eating table, but a little patio table on the balcony where we had our breakfast every morning. It was a little small for a 2 week stay but then we weren't in our room much. We had #1609 on the taller tower, 1 room from the end. If you want this nice view, get floor 12 or higher, then you look above the lower tower and see all of Diamond Head. If you want to face the ocean completely head on, then you have to get a room in the lower tower or the front end units of the taller tower, But we still had full views of the awesome sunsets from our balcony! The fridge was nice to have and the bed was comfortable (linens changed every 3rd day.) We only swam in the smallish pool a couple times as we preferred to swim in the ocean. You have the choice right in front of the hotel, to swim in a calm protected area or in the waves in the ocean. Used their beach towels & chairs every day and took them with when we drove around the island to other beaches. Be prepared to pay $20/day extra for 'resort fee' and also $20/day for valet parking. There is public pay parking across the street by the zoo which you can prepay daily but it works out to $20 a day too. (DO NOT PARK -UNPAID WHERE YOU'RE NOT SUPPOSED TO! THEY ARE VERY QUICK TO TOW AWAY YOUR CAR IN HONOLULU -ALSO BREAK INTO YOUR CAR OR EVEN STEAL YOUR CAR! WE HAD OUR CAR IMPOUNDED FOR BEING 10 MINUTES OVERDUE IN A TOWAWAY ZONE. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! NO MERCY!) Wed aft there are free drinks & snacks from 4-5:00. The ABC stores (which are on every block!) were right downstairs and were handy for food, drinks & snacks. Staff were very helpful and courteous. Expensive, but what isn't in ocean front Waikiki?

Great value for money, especially on the beach front. Hotel is very clean, the service is amazing - lovely staff, and the photos do not do it justice! The little cafe under the hotel is very handy for convenient healthy food - delicious sandwiches, salads, smoothies, juices etc. Will definitely be booking at Park Shore on our next trip to Hawaii.

Excellent beach front location,near to transport ,clean friendly and helpful staff .Would definitely go there again .Right near the zoo which is not a good attraction ,but close to shopping and restaurants .and one small block to pink local bus .$2 a trip to other end of town .

Stayed here because of it's great location near the finish line of the Honolulu Marathon. The rooms are alright, with small fridges and comfortable beds. Staff was friendly, and the location is very convenient to the beach and attractions at the Zoo end of Waikiki. For downsides, the elevators are sometimes slow, and the room wasn't spotless when we checked in, though not dirty enough to call down to the front desk. The pool was also adequate but nothing special to write home about. Overall a good place to stay, especially for the marathon.

We booked this hotel for the views, beach proximity and price and it didn't disappoint. Very helpful staff, handy to have an ABC, Starbucks, Tucker & Bevvy for healthy picnic food, a great grill / bar overlooking the beach and a very good Japanese restaurant all in the building. Great location for views over Diamond Head and Queens Beach. The rooms are not large, no lounge furniture, but comfy beds, lanai with comfy outdoor chairs and great showers. Priced accordingly - pay the extra for an ocean view or ocean front room - well worth it for the uninterrupted views.About 10 minutes walk to International Marketplace, city branch of Macy's, Cheesecake Factory etc. All the Aston & Aqua properties offer a free shuttle service to Ala Moana shopping centre running every 40 minutes or so.

Loved being on the quiet side of Waikiki. It was right beside the Zoo. Plenty of restaurants located close by. We had a beautiful view of the beach on the 8th floor. The Park below us had a concert and we had perfect front row balcony seating. The pool was clean and a nice retreat from a hectic day of sightseeing.

At the end of the Waikiki main drag, so a bit quieter and less touristy. Across the road from the beach and close to Waikiki Trolley bus stops.We paid extra for a room with a view and it was worth it, fantastic views.Room was clean and well serviced.The staff were all very nice and good at their job - front desk and lobby/luggage people were very helpful and welcoming.

We booked this hotel based on reviews and location. We were not disappointed! Staff are friendly and great, always helpful! Rooms are small but really why do you need a big room in Hawaii? Rooms are super clean, beds are comfortable (we are picky bed people too). The rooms are updated and nice, wifi works perfectly! We had a room on the fifth floor facing the beach and overlooking the pool it was perfect to sit out on our deck while our daughter napped. On Wednesdays the managers offer drinks and snacks by the pool which is really nice, wonderful friendly people! Joey is our favourite guy at the bell desk! Always getting our little girl to smile. The value for this hotel and the location is a major plus. The pool is great the lounge chairs are perfect. It is a small pool but it's all you need because the ocean is right across the street. We spent some days by the pool as our daughter is at the age when she just wants to eat sand. The beach chairs you can take to the beach are great and convenient really all you need! A major plus is the two ABC stores and the Starbucks. We ate breakfast many times at the little picnic shop attached to the hotel which was always fresh and yummy! We will stay here again in an instant. We have been to Waikiki many times and didn't see the need to stay in the core. This was a quieter more enjoyable end to stay at. We still walked everywhere and it is only a ten minute walk from the new international market place. The free shuttle to Ala Moana is a plus as well! I can't say enough good things about this hotel we were very happy here!

This hotel is older but has been remodeled and is clean, simplistic and right across the street from Waikiki Beach. We only stayed one night because we had spent the bulk of our vacation on the other side of the island; however, we had no complaints at all with the facility. Our room was small, but was very clean and updated and we literally spent no time in the room except for sleeping. We could look out from our floor and clearly see the ocean as well as Diamond Head. The staff was very accommodating. We found the price to be very reasonable as well. Definitely not as upscale as some of the other hotels in the area but not as expensive either. We chose the valet service but there is public parking across the street next to the zoo where you pay in advance at a cost of $1 per hour.

Disappointed with the room and their policy. Arrived ahead of check-in after our cruise to be told yes room is ready BUT it will be and additional $10 per hour up to check-in time which would have equated to an extra $50. No view but extra $50 and you will be given a room with a view. Room was a twin and not a double and the bathroom needed upgrading. No guest laundry either. Tea and coffee not replenished daily as advertised and their mandatory hospitality fee was dearer than the other we had stayed in before the cruise. The other hotel we stayed at prior to the cruise was so accommodating. We arrived ahead of check-in time and we were able to go to our room without any extra charge and also able to have late check-out without an extra charge. They even had a guest laundry but we did not need to use it then. The only good thing about this hotel is that the Honolulu Zoo was across the road and Starbucks just around the corner. Have given my feedback to the travel agent and informed them of this. I will not be staying there again.

Good location on east end, close to ocean an swimming. Not as crowded as others places further east. Ocean view is good.  You can arrange for a massage through the hotel, a good service. I had one hitch on a soiled sheet, that almost ruined my trip. But it was worked out with the hotel.

The hotel is the last hotel in the waikiki stretch. It is just across the street from the waikiki beach, a few steps away from the honolulu aquarium and zoo and also a good trek to the the diamond head crater. Overall a great location! As its at the edge of the stretch is kinda quieter then the hotels in the central area. Thats something I really liked. The rooms are good and gives a partial view of the sea unless of course you choose the sea view rooms. We had 2 rooms and one of them was sea view with a balcony. It was a great place to just sit and relax. The rooms are good. The hotel is old and its shows. It is good comfort but not luxury and offers a good value compared to other hotels in that stretch. There is a ABC store (Like 7 11) and starbucks and eateries just at the ground floor so in a few steps you have a lot of convenience. If you get a good deal then definitely choose this. Good friendly staff. Great help with beach towels, beach stools and umbrellas!

This was the first time to Hawaii and Oahu and WOW what a view we had on our first morning of our Honeymoon!!! On check-in we were asked if we were on a special visit and mentioned we were on our honeymoon and my sister-in-law's Birthday the follow day, On getting to our rooms ( staff couldn't be more apologetic on not being able to give us rooms next to each other) within two minutes we had a knock on the door and a staff member had bought us a bottle of champagne and a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts :-)The view we had was stunning from our room, Waikiki beach to the right, Diamond Head mountain to the left and Honolulu Zoo straight in front below our 13th floor. Hotel was fairly basic but with the views, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff and the location, the basicness never really came into question. Room was clean and well maintained and whatever was not in the hotel, ABC stores, close restaurants and gift stores were just a minute or so walk. We would love to go back to Waikiki and The Park Shore would be on the top of our list of hotels. Expedia expert in lobby was a great help too, her suggestion on chief's lu'au was a fantastic experience.

I have never loved staying in Waikiki until this trip at Park Shore. We stayed in Room 1108 which was fantastic. The rooms are a little on the small side, but this is Hawaii and you shouldn't be spending much time in your hotel room. The beach is directly across the street. Pool is on 3rd floor and overlooks beach. Starbucks, ABC store and a great juice/smoothie shop are adjacent to hotel. I HATE big hotels and this is not one. The front desk staff is so nice and helpful. This is definitely the place I'll stay at when vacationing in Waikiki. Thanks for a great stay. Don't bother renting a car. Lyft/Uber are easy to find and very reasonable.

I spent one day here when I returned from a cruise, I needed a place to stash my luggage until my flight that evening. This hotel is across the street from the beach, and they provide beach chairs and towels for free. they also held my luggage after check out and provided a hospitality room that I could use to shower in. I had stayed at the Outrigger earlier in the week, I wish I had known about this place, it offers nearly the same amenities for a much better price. The rooms are nearly identical.

Booked an ocean-view room with 2 double beds. Room was small but had a decent sized bathroom and balcony to sit out in the morning or evening. Comfortable beds, clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The view from our corner room was more of Diamond Head instead of the ocean and was informed that 6 was the highest floor you can book when needing 2 double beds. View from top floor was much better, but still a nice hotel experience. Beach towels and chairs are available at desk for free. Mini-fridge in room, shared microwave on one of the floors. Convenient Starbucks next door to hotel.
user_location: North Tonawanda, New York, United States
user_name:
DeannaS09
North Tonawanda, New York, United States

review_body: This hotel is nothing flash, it's fairly basic by Australian standards, but hotels in Hawaii are not as good a value as in Australia, and it's difficult to get accomodation that seems fair value.The Park Shore delivers an overall good package. The hotel is well located at the far end of Waikiki near the zoo, its handy for everywhere, has bus stops near by, a curtesy bus to the Ala Moana shopping centre (although I did have an issue with a long wait for this service), the rooms are fair, with a fridge and AC, the pool area is adequate, the property is opposite the beach, pool/beach towels, beach chairs are provided free of charge.Lulus bar / restaurant is located within the property offering affordable meals and drinks and some entertainment, with good service. Staff are friendly but not necessarily very informed. A Starbucks and a great sandwich bar are located adjacent to the hotel and an ABC store selling almost everything at cheap prices also next door.We asked for an upper storey room in case of noise, but didn't hear any complaints from anyone staying in the hotel.All in all a very satisfactory package, but if you want luxury you will have to pay more to get it.

This hotel has a terrific location and view! The rooms are average but decent for the price. The view from our balcony was beautiful, we looked over at Diamond Head and turned to look at Waikiki beach. This hotel is located at the end of a long strip of hotels and restaurants. Across the street is the zoo and the aquarium is a short walk. We easily walked most places. The front desk staff and bell hops were always helpful.

This is our second time at the Park Shore. The first time was in 2015. We picked it in Expedia not knowing what to expect. It is not the fanciest place but for the price, you can't beat it. Both times we stayed in a standard room but still had a view of the ocean and the mountains from the balcony. The staff is friendly and the place is clean. From the deck near the pool you can see Diamond Head to the east and the beach to the south. It is also close to everything in Waikiki so that you can walk to where ever you need to go.
user_name:
robertmO790DK
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I arrived early from the Pride of America cruise and got into the Park Shore Waikiki around 10. We inquired about the availability of our room being ready. They said a room was ready but there would be a 10 dollar an hour fee for that convenience. Check in was at 3 so that would be an additional 50 dollars. Same goes for late check.. 10 dollars an hour. I have been to many hotels and have never been charged an additional fee for either early check in or late check out. We opted to put our luggage in the storage room and came back at 4 pm. The room was ok. Nothing great about the standard room but we didn't plan on being in the room a lot. The next day we left the room at 8:30 am and came back at 3:45 pm. The room had not been cleaned up. We planned to be in the room just to freshen up before we went to a luau. We wanted to leave around 5pm. At 4, maid service knocked at the door and wanted to clean the room. I asked her to come back at 5pm and she said she was done for the day at 5. I asked for clean towel and to replenish the shampoo. She quickly serviced the items I asked for in the bathroom and then left. Beds were unmade, trash baskets not cleaned. Used glassware not replaced. I was not happy with that situation. Also, I personally do not like using elevators. I would rather use the stairs. From the lobby you can not use the stairs for access to or from your room. There are alarms on exit doors on each floor below floor 3. You can go into the stairwell from an upper floor but can not get out of the stairwell without tripping an alarm below floor 3. Before coming to Hawaii I researched a number of hotels. I thought Park Shore Waikiki would be a good choice but I was wrong. Before going on our cruise we spent 1 night at the Hyatt Place Waikiki. Gave us complimentary late checkout and they had a great free breakfast. About the same price as Park Shore. Go there.... it's a much nicer place ( it's just a few blocks away)

I was dismayed when I entered my room at the Park Shore Hotel- the entire space including the bathroom was smaller than my bedroom at my last Airbnb condo accommodation. It is tiny... However, the view from our room is AMAZING!!! I don't want to go out with that view... but I did - to the great beach across the road.... to the fantastic shops nearby... to the great restaurants I discovered, including an awesome ORGANIC restaurant about 15 minutes walk away... and a VERY good Japanese restaurant in the lobby.

Hotel was in a great spot. Our room was on the 7th floor with views of ocean and zoo. We paid extra for view and worth it. Two disappointing things about the hotel was the staff. Rooms still not cleaned at 3pm, after being out all day. Happened three times. Also the lady that is on the ground floor that is there to help you with tours was very unhelpful. When we said we would like to tour Pearl Habour her response was you have over 100 tours to choose from which one do you want to do (with a tone in her voice). We then said what do you suggest and again tone in her voice. We ended up leaving going to our room and looked up a tour on tablet. We didn't know what tour to do, I thought that's what her job was to help us and maybe suggest a few. Also pool was in need of a clean, lots of floating things in it , but it had a great view. This review sounds negative but we did like the hotel itself. Staff needs to be looked at.

Clean rooms...no view, but we knew that when we booked and didn't feel the need for a view when we only used the room for sleeping anyway. Friendly staff. Just across the road from Waikiki beach. Good pool area if you don't want to go to the beach. Yoga offered during the week and on a Thursday night in the park. Shuttle bus every hour to Ala Moana shopping centre (which is large and has everything you could want.....well almost. We eat plant based foods so finding that was challenging). Efficient valet parking. Park Shore is convenient and quiet. We slept with our doors wide open and were there for two weeks. Very restful and peaceful.

Really amazing hotel and location. Very simple nothing fancy but for the price top. We were really surprised and impressed all around from the hotel to the staff. Super location very clean and comfortable beds.Great view. Beach towels and chairs also provided with all the basic necessities. Highly recommend this hotel Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach not to mention the Honolulu Zoo in perfect view. Why pay an arm and a leg when you have a hotel like this!

I've stayed here twice. I'll definitely have more stays in the future. It's tough - I really want to stay on the other side of the island in a condo rental to be near my favorite beach, but the VIEW and kindness of the staff keep pulling me in.Let me preface with this ICYDK fact if it's your first time in Honolulu:Lanai = balconyOcean View = Could be a smidgen of blue beyond a sea of high risesPartial Mountain Views = a smidgen of green beyond a sea of high risesMountain Views = Not what you thought you wanted when originally planning your Hawaii trip, but offers a pleasant surpriseFull Ocean View = Exactly what's expectedThere are a few rooms at Park Shore that may be small, but offer the grand daddy of all views. The Lanai walks out to an unblocked view of Diamond head. Sit on the Lanai and enjoy and unblocked Ocean view AND Diamond head. AT that moment, nothing else matters. It's simply breathtaking! I've had local friends come visit me, reluctantly, since it isn't one of the more posh - well known establishments they suggested, and had their jaws dropped to the ground at the sight of the view. I can't say much about the pool - why go to the pool when you have one of the most famous beaches a few steps away? There's an ABC convenience store located on premise and right outside, There's a restaurant that I haven't tried. I"m telling you, it's all about the view. The room itself is clean with modern decor and amenities. Wi-Fi works great. Parking is valet only and is extremely efficient. The staff is amazing. They truly make you feel like Ohana - as cheesy as that sounds. There's a free shuttle that takes you to the Ala Moana Mall. It's across the street from a huge park and the zoo. It's the last hotel on the major strip that runs parallel along the beach, so you are walking distance from everything, but on the more quieter side of the waikiki strip.
user_name:
Fabulousniki
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Staff were great and friendly, nothing too much trouble. Location is great on the end of Waikiki near the zoo. Not as much noise as other hotels I stayed at in Waikiki. Overall I will be back at this hotel. We were a gay couple and staff were great and positive towards us making us feel relaxed.

We stayed in a standard room for 10 days and were very happy. The Hotel is a bit older and away from the strip but you don't go to Hawaii to sit in your room. The beach beach is just across the road.Facilities were good, staff very helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean had plenty of space.Pool area is great and you are more that welcome to take a beer out there and watch the sunset over the beach and Diamond Head.

First time at this hotel, found staff were very helpful and great location close to beach, restaurants and shopping. Clean hotel rooms with coffee makers, mini fridges, and option of tea kettle. We did find room noise from above and beside quite loud from people talking, tvs and alarm clocks. Note: additional cost for resort fees and valet parking (no free parking)

Wonderful hotel with great views. It's on what's considered the quiet end of Waikiki, although still very crowded! Hotel was very clean, a/c a little temperamental. Staff was friendly, not overly helpful.

Nice hotel, cleaned, close to downtown and a few meters from waikiki beach. Parking nearby (zoo) or vallet parking at the hotel. Very kind staff. You can borrow towels for the beach. Many restaurants nearby, avoid the one at the first floor of the hotel since it takes quite a long time to be served and food isn't so good...Enjoy sunsets on waikiki beach, have a good trip!!!

I booked 2 ocean view rooms and it was lovely! We got the view of the ocean and Diamond Head. We arrived early and the staff was really nice, friendly and helpful as one room was ready and the other was still being cleaned. They allowed us to use one room for the time being. The rooms were clean and had all the amenities: small coffee maker, refrigerator, TV, pool, etc. Parking is pretty bad around there so they do charge you a $25 a day parking fee. There are lots of things to do and see right around the hotel too so I highly recommend talking a stroll around there. Will definitely be back to visit!

We recently got back from our honeymoon in Hawaii and stayed at The Park Shore for 7 nights. We had a stunning view of the ocean from our balcony and then Diamond Head out our side window, beautiful! The location was perfect for us, close enough to walk down to the centre of Waikiki but far enough away to be a little quieter on the beach and at night. The beach was stunning, especially having the walled in part to swim in without the surf and the water was so warm! The hotel also loans out beach chairs which was brilliant. The onsite restaurants were both fantastic and having an ABC store right in the hotel lobby was brilliant and very handy.We would highly recommend and wouldn't stay anywhere else when we return!Note - because the corridors to some ocean view rooms are open air you do hear the wind whistling quite a bit, however apparently it was windy season when we were there. Nothing you can do about it and it didn't hamper our stay at all.

This hotel was recommended by my flight centre agent as she had had good reviews. It is an older hotel right at the very end of waikik but even so it was pretty good. The rooms were compact, older style, bathrooms had baths (oh I do enjoy a soak) ....and the pool deck was pretty good. It is very close to the beach and towels and chairs are provided. It is very clean, staff are friendly and helpful, all in all good value for money.

My second time here and I love it. I would be awesome to have a hot tub for those sore lacrosse players after the tournament and the beds could use a mattress upgrade. Other than that it’s lovely there, friendly staff, close to the Honolulu Zoo, shopping and restaurants. We will be back! Great for kids ages 11 and 9.

This was the first time for us at this property - overall the ocean front room was comfortable - but the bathroom is really small - no counter space at all - the staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had a late night flight and were happy to find that they offer a hospitality suite for those who have late flights.

Stayed from Oct/27/16-Oct/30/16. We arrived at the airport 10am and called the hotel if we could check in early. They were very happy to accommodate us and get us in early which I think was just awesome. We've been coming to Hawaii about 3 times annually for the past 6 years and stayed at the Aston Waikiki, Aulani, AirBNB, Hilton Hawaiian Village, Moana Surf Rider and many others. We decided to try Park Shore Waikiki for the simple fact that it was towards the end of our favorite part of the strip as far as getting in and out of Waikiki Strip. We originally booked a room facing the Aston Waikiki with no ocean view since it was within our budget. We started to think that we really wanted some type of ocean view, so we asked the front desk receptionist, Roxie, if there were any upgrades available and how much extra it would cost. Roxie was able to accommodate our request and not only did we get ocean view, we also got the view of Diamond Head in room #1509!! So thank you Roxie for making our anniversary that much more special and memorable. After checking in and getting to the room, there was a knock at the door about 15 minutes later and we had a surprise visit from one of their staff with champagne, wine glasses and a box of macadamia chocolates! This was sure looking to be a great start for the weekend thanks to the efforts of Roxie and her crew. Our room was clean and the balcony views of the outside were really gorgeous and breathtaking. The bed was comfy, the shower was great and the room itself was cozy and perfect for the both of us. We definitely prefer it over the Aston next door from the staff to the room--not to mention it's corner location of the strip! We will definitely stay here again and recommend it to all of our family and friends who love to travel to Hawaii as well. I would encourage anyone to give them a shot and you might be surprised with them. Especially since their staff at the front desk is amazing--just as long they have people like Roxie and Riza warmly accommodating you upon arrival! Of course not everyone will love it as much as we do, but I must say the value you receive and pay here is well worth the money. With that said, Welcome to Hawaii and I hope your stay here at Park Shore is pleasant and memorable. As they say in Hawaii, Aloooooha!!!

This wasn't our choice to stay in Waikiki but family had this booked as part of a package so we stayed here too. Its at the end of the Waikiki "strip" across the road on the side from a park and the Honolulu Zoo and in front is direct access to the beach. Still close to plenty of restaurants and shops and all that Waikiki has to offer but just not right in the midst of the madness. The hotel is fine - clean and decent service, but it could be so much more. The pool deck on the third floor as wonderful views across the park to Diamond Head and to the beach and ocean, but there are few if any amenities - a bar here would be awesome! We still spent a couple of afternoons here enjoying the sun and the view and the pool is fine. We had a regular room - clean and fine but very small. Probably would not stay here again unless I happen to see that it has been updated - it has so much potential

One thing this hotel does well is customer service! From the on-to-it guys on the bell desk, to the smiley faces on front reception to the polite and courteous house keeping staff. Going back to the hotel at the end of our busy days felt like we were being greeted by friends. Thank you for making our 9 day stay feel like home.TRANSPORT TIPS for those of us who refuse to drive on the otherside of the road: - Free shuttle to Ala Moana (although we tipped the driver a few bucks for 3 of us). - Catch the #22 bus ($2.50) across road by the beach to get to Hanauma Bay (this is also where the green and orange line trolleys stop). - Bus #8 stops right outside the hotel (as does a few others, check thebus.org). - Shark tours & PCC pick ups are at the Marriott Hotel on Paoakalani Ave (short walk around the corner). - Pink Line Trolley stops at the Aston Hotel just next door. - Swap Meet - Catch the #42 bus ($2.50) just down the road on the cnr of Kapahulu/Kuhio OR the Purple Line Trolley is $25pp all day OR for 3 of us, it cost $7.50 to get there on bus and $50 taxi back to Park Shore (because our shopping was horrendous!)- Walmart - the free shuttle includes a stop at Pagoda Hotel, close to Walmart, OR you shuttle there and it's a $15 taxi ride back to Park Shore + $3 tip (if you have to buy more suitcases!).Hope this helps your planning.Free wi-fi all over the hotel. Shout out to the guys and girls on the front reception who provided exceptional service! We'll be back for sure

The Park Shore is a pretty property. It is across the street from the beach and our room was large with view of the beach. The lobby is spacious and comfortable. They have a towel service with deposit of $30/towel which is completely refundable. We had a hard time finding the hotel. The GPS in our phone took us there but the lobby entrance doesn't face the beach, it faces the zoo. We had problems with the valet parking. You can't call to have a vehicle brought around. You have to go to the valet desk and give them your ticket. We were in a hurry but it took 25 min for them to bring our car. There wasn't even anyone else waiting. They refunded our money and we parked near the zoo, 5 blocks away after that. Our party had 4 rooms and none of our rooms were cleaned or made up for the 2 nights we stayed. The check in took a very long time with a long slow moving line. The front desk people seemed pretty harried when we arrived and were short with us but were very nice after that. This is a nice hotel with many things close, such as dining, shopping, and the beach. I'm usually pretty generous with my reviews but we would pass on staying here again.

This hotel was perfect! It's not the Ritz but it is a clean, comfortable basic hotel with a wonderful location! It is on the corner of Kapahulu (the front entrance is located here) and Kalakaua Ave. which runs along the beach. It is just steps from the beach and Waikiki Wall (a pier where you can walk out on the water a bit), the zoo is across the street, and most tours pick up just down the block on Kapahulu Ave. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, a Starbucks next door, several ABC stores (one inside and one next door) where you can purchase drinks, snacks, souvenirs, alcohol and a ton of other things and it has a great view of Diamondhead. Kapiolani Reg. Park and a small Waikiki Aquarium are within easy walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful, housekeeping did a good job. There is also a sushi restaurant and sandwich shop inside the hotel. There are 18 stories. We booked an ocean front with lanai and it was worth every penny just for the views alone. Our room, #1707, was a corner room with a window looking out on the beach and ocean and the balcony looking out on Diamond Head, the zoo, and another portion of Waikiki Beach. The rooms are a bit minimalist with just a desk and chair but no chairs for relaxing. The bathroom has almost zero space for your toiletries but it did have a mini-fridge, iron and board, hair dryer and toiletries provided as well as providing towel cards for taking towels to the beach and it has a pool. It is one of the furthest hotels from the airport since it is located almost at the end of Waikiki Beach but we had no problems with that. We did not have a car and everything we needed was within easy-walking distance of the hotel, and I mean easy as everything was probably within a block or two. It is a great location with reasonable prices and I would use it again in a heartbeat!

We recently stayed at Park Shore Waikiki and it was probably the highlight of our trip. It was a last minute booking as we had to move from our accommodation at Kailua due to noisy neighbours! We got a great deal and had a room with an amazing view towards Diamond Head as well as the ocean. Looking out over the park and zoo gave the feeling of being out of the city. It was nice to be at the quieter end of Waikiki, especially when going to the beach. The snorkelling was even good at the beach across from the hotel. Our room was very nice, with all amenities including a coffee maker. Bed was comfortable and bathroom had plenty of bench space and a great shower. We would definitely go back there.

So my friend and I had a chance to travel to Hawaii for a few days and we reviewed alot of different hotels. It was hard to choose being that we didn't know where everything was located but I found Park Shore and I couldn't have been happier. We were right in the middle of everything-restaurants & shops and the beach is literally across the street. The view from our room was amazing (big shout out to Roxy for helping us get our room. She is the best! :-D) We stayed in room 1508 so if you're not afraid of heights, I would recommend getting a high room floor. The rooms aren't super glitzy or anything but it's clean and comfortable. I would stay here again for sure. Thanks to everyone at Park Shore that helped us during our stay.

Last minute getaway for us. Booked on Hoteltonight.com for this stay.**A few Tips**-Valet parking only entrance is on Kapahulu St, drive all the way down toward the ocean and it's on your right hand side after Teddys Burger. Google maps is incorrect the entrance is NOT on Kalakaua ave.-check different on line travel sites the prices vary in waikiki based on season and availability. -resort fee is $20/night-in room on demand movies are $17.99PROS--If you're visiting Hawaii with kids, this hotel is so close to waikiki beach literally a few steps across the street to the ocean. If you have kids this is also directly across the Street to the Honolulu Zoo and walking distance to Waikiki Aquarium. Location is awesome so close to restaurants, beach and shops.-Convenient-there is a traditional Japanese restaurant in the hotel and another restaurant Lulus on property, Tucker and Bevy in the lobby for quick healthy items, Starbucks next door and Teddys burger next door. Lots of choices in the area to eat at.-our room (622) faced the ocean and the view was gorgeous, room had a refrigerator and safe and coffee maker but NO microwave. The front desk was really friendly they also provide free beach towels. Bed was comfortable and I enjoyed the complimentary cookies in the room.I would stay here again if the rates are reasonable. Great for families traveling with children or weekend getaway.

Arrived Saturday afternoon check in was easy and quick _ rooms was ok a little on the small side for the price we paid. Hotel us at the very edge if Waikiki beach but no matter what you do you will walk to the end of the resort and back again every night so in that respect it us ideally situated. Pool is a little on the small side with very few loungers and umbrella s so you will either just sit in the Sun or go elsewhere. Great view if the sea / beach from our room as well as the volcano. Would definitely go again. While you are in the resort check out Sam's Kitchen a little cafe that sells garlic shrimp to die for. Enjoy

Just recently stayed at the Park shore hotel Waikiki and an amazing stay, the Park shore is very central and has great views but you must ask for ocean front for the best view. The staff were fantastic and so friendly. I highly recommend this hotel.

this is the best value for the location on the whole of Waikiki bar none! Lulus is a fabulous spot for breakfast dinner drinks with a great view to people watch and view the beach. ABC convenience directly on first floor along with a Starbucks....Directly across from the Zoo....and with great unobstructed views of Diamondhead. There is always a taxi parked at the entrance for convenience. Beach towels and chairs are available for guests.

We booked an ocean view room for four nights in early October. We were given a room on the highest floor with excellent views of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. The room was in great condition and we were extremely satisfied.The location is perfect if you have a car. There is free parking on Monsarrat Ave nearby. We always found a spot available within ten minutes walk of the hotel. The hotel is also right across the street from the beach so it was very convenient. That section of the beach is walled off so it's always calm and you don't have to worry about windy days and waves. The hotel gives you free beach towels and chairs to use on the beach. Grateful for the free water and juice downstairs in the lobby. There is also an Expedia travel concierge you can use to book tours and tickets for things. The only complaints I have about the hotel are minor. There is free coffee in the lobby in the mornings but they don't provide milk or creamer. Not a huge deal as there is an ABC store literally connected to the lobby. Also to get beach towels, you have to exchange these towel cards for them and exchange the towels back for the cards. If you don't return the cards when you checkout you'll get charged per card not returned. This is fine except that I only ever saw at most two people manning the front the desk, most of the time it was only one which meant sometimes you had to wait awhile just to do the exchange. None of these complaints really impacted our stay negatively.Overally great experience, highly recommended, and for sure we would stay here again if we come back.
user_name:
shuynh21
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a lot longer than my typical review, but I urge anyone considering this hotel to make your way all the way through to the end. This was going to be a better-than-average review. But, unfortunately, I'm not able to totally give that review. And it's all because of a $20.94 charge. Here's my story . . . I found out only a week before our arrival that we'd be spending one night in Honolulu. Having never been there before, and only able to rely on TripAdvisor reviews, I chose the Park Shore Waikiki and booked it through the TripAdvisor site. And now, here's what would have made this a better-than-average review:Once we arrived and checked into the corner property, my husband and I were happy that the Park Shore was my choice. Waikiki Beach fronts one side of the hotel, while on the other side the entrance into Park Shore faces Diamondhead and Queen Kapiʻolani Regional Park (which includes the Honolulu Zoo and the Waikiki Shell, an outdoor concert/gathering venue.) Our room, a representation of 1970's Hawaiian-style minimalist design, was clean and comfortable. Our favorite part was the lanai (balcony,) which overlooked the pool and had a panoramic view that spanned from Diamond Head across Waikiki Beach. The location, for us, was perfect! The view was breathtaking! It's a less congested part of Waikiki Beach. Everyone at the hotel was very nice. We enjoyed Tucker and Bevvy for smoothies and had an amazing lunch in Lulu's Waikiki, a Japanese restaurant. Both are located just off the hotel's lobby. Park Shore not only has a secure baggage check room, but also supplies a courtesy room set up like a living room with an attached bathroom (with shower.) This is an added plus for guests who have already checked out, providing them with an opportunity to freshen up or relax before late flights or cruise embarkations. The courtesy room gave us the chance to check out, explore Waikiki and then freshen up and relax before our shuttle picked us up at 5pm to take us to the cruise port. Just to be clear. It is ONE room, open to any guest who requests its use. Chances are you won't be alone. So, those are all the reasons why this should have been a better-than-average review. Now here's my reason for my less-than-average review of our experience at the Park Shore Waikiki. And this didn't happen until I checked out. It was only then that I was informed that I owed (you guessed it . . .) $20.94 to pay for an activities fee. Let's backtrack. I had paid in full when I made my on-line booking and there was NO mention of an activities fee included on the reservation form. Instead, the fee was tacked on at the end of our stay as an extra added expense, after I had budgeted and already spent what I planned to spend on lodging. I was told by the girl who checked me out (I didn't get her name) that it is a (paraphrasing) 'DAILY charge that is mandatory for all guests. No ifs, ands or buts. And all the other hotels on the island charge the fee. Sorry, no waiver on the fee.' I was briskly handed a piece of paper and asked (told) to sign it as acknowledgement of the fee. I was not happy at that moment and vocalized that, asking if it was a standard charge, why wasn't I told about it up front. She didn't have an answer for that and I questioned her again, which set off all the other guests around me (who were also checking out) and then everyone was talking and agreeing with me about the fee. It felt like I was about to set off a revolt, so I told the other guests that I was begrudgingly going to sign the paper, let it go and get on with my afternoon in Waikiki. And I did just that, put it out of my mind and enjoyed the rest of our day, using the Park Shore as our base for exploring the area. If I was told that I was going to be assessed this fee at check in, perhaps I wouldn't have felt so ripped off when I was told I had to pay it at check out and then asked to sign a paper agreeing to the fee. Also, when I reviewed my credit card purchases from my bank, I found that I had been charged the fee at 12:51am EST on the day I checked out. (That's 6:51pm the previous day, the day I checked in, Hawaiian time.) Since my card was charged the day before I was told about the fee and then signed the paper agreeing to the charge at checkout, I believe the hotel owes me a refund. Charging a fee before telling a person that they will be charged is deceptive, and I advise you to change the way you handle this fee with future customers. Please post a response with an email for Park Shore's manager so I can contact her or him about my situation. Advising me of the fee and asking me to sign for it AFTER you had already charged my credit card for the fee, on the previous day, are, I believe, grounds for a refund. So, other travelers be forewarned! Park Shore is essentially a nice, moderately-priced (by Waikiki pricing) place to stay. But you seriously will need to budget for that activities fee, and it will most definitely be charged to your account once you check in. And remember, it is a DAILY fee, so it will add up quickly if you stay for multiple days or weeks.

As we all do ..... we pour through reviews and then stress about what it's all going to be like when we arrive. I can honestly say Park Shore has some of the best customer care I've had in a long time.
