After a 9 hour flight and arriving at the hotel around 7am we hoped we could leave our luggage somewhere safe until check in then just try and amuse ourselves until the normal 2pm check... WELL NO!! The WONDERFUL ROXY who greeted us warmly without any request or prompting from me said ....your room isn't quiet ready yet but let me see what I can do for you ..... and after a few clicks we were checked in and able to sleep straight away! After waking now feeling more human and being able to see the ammenities better I must say the place is great, the rooms may be on the slightly small size but more than big enough for a couple... no screaming air con, no road noise, great restaurants and easy access to food and shopping nearby.This place is a huge win and an AMAZING way for us to start our holiday! I highly recommend Park Shore!!

It was our first time to visit Hawaii. Since we didn't drive a car, location became our top priority when choosing where to stay. Park Shore Waikiki didn't let us down. Just a few steps away from the Waikiki beach, it provided gorgeous view of the ocean while mountain view on other side. Shops, restaurants, convenient stores and bus stops were all within walking distance, which meant we could easily travel to most famous attractions in Oahu. Staff members were professional and helpful. They provided valuable information you needed. The only less satisfactory thing was that hotel facilities were old and worn-out compared to its high price. However, its overall value for money was not bad in such an expensive area.

Hotel has nice lobby And good location and a roof .Hotel staff ok .I had to leave hotel due to a/c not workingAnd I got electrical shock from outlets .Owner refunded all monies after I called 911. I don't not recommend u STAY HERE .Also HOTELS HAVE LOWER standards IN Hawaii due to lack of maintaince.When you complain u receive only form letter back or waiver of resort fee .

Located at the end of Waikiki beach where you can access shops, restaurants swimming, hotels, bars etc within easy walking distance.Had requested a room high up by e-mail a couple of weeks before we arrived to be away from noise as recommended by Trip Advisor reviews. Got a reply saying that they would accommodate us on a floor above 15 but when we arrived we were disappointed to be put in room 720 above two large noisy ventilation fans. Put up with the noise for two nights and then requested a move. The staff at reception were very understanding and helpful and we were moved to 16th floor which is where we had requested originally.Throughout the stay (10 days) all the staff were polite and very helpful, couldn't fault them. The pool was great to swim in and relax by. There were always chairs, loungers and umbrellas available.Booked tour to Pearl Harbour from desk in lobby which was great. Free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre was very useful.Really good place to stay, would go there again.

The hotel is situated opposite the zoo and at the southern diamond head end of Waikiki beach. Used Johnnys cab from the airport very goodOur room was spacious and clean with large comfortable bed looking towards Diamond head and the ocean The adjacent Lulus American bar serves good breakfast at reasonable prices served by very pleasant staff. Great start to the day especially if you get a bench seat overlooking the ocean.Had a few evening meals there too, which were also good. Can get noisy if there are games on as the walls are full of tvs, breakfast and dinner as Honolulu is 6 hours behind usa east coast.There's complimentary soft drinks and coffee in the hotel lobby and pool towels are available at reception.Took full day Oahu island tour and the Pearl Harbour Arizona tourGood start to our Hawaian Islands holiday

This is a great place to stay. Friendly staff and comfy rooms. Close enough to Waikiki shopping precinct for a light walk but far enough away to get away from the shops and get to really enjoy the beach/parks. Well worth requesting an ocean view room, beautiful views of Diamond Head and the beach. Will definitely be back to stay here again. Family friendly but also a nice get away for couples of all ages.

Park Shore is right across the street from the zoo and park so it's at the end of all the tourist congestion. Starbucks is right next door and the restaurant Lulus can be accessed from the second floor. The room and amenities are what are expected at this price range. My husband likes to go out for a run in the am and this is away from the crowds. We stay here every time I have to come to Honolulu from Maui.

We arrived at the hotel to find we didn't have a room after booking and paying back in April. We felt sorry for the staff who had to deal with the problem, but after a couple of hours they finally located a room for us. From then on the holiday with Park Shore was faultless. The staff were great and so helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable and after a shaky start, we had a wonderful experience at Park Shore. A great location with ABC's on both sides, handy to dining facilities and shopping. A free shuttle to the shopping centre. Cool drinks always available in the lobby,and fresh beach towels at all times.

Stayed for the Mayjah Rayjah. Close to waikiki shell. Beds confortable. Rooms were quiet. Housekeeping was nice and helpful. Checking in was fast and easy. Valet was fast. Enjoyed that starbucks was right in front of the hotel. Waiters at the restaurant took awhile to serve certain tables. But over all the Hotel was worth the money.

We spent 5 nights here Sept.20-25, 2016. Hotel is located in an awesome location. We had an oceanfront room and loved it. Our view was perfect looking over Waikiki Beach, Queen's Beach, and Diamondhead. Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our safe wouldn't unlock and maintenance came up immediately and replaced it. Starbucks is right downstairs and an ABC store next door for needed items. Enjoyed our stay very much and would recommend it for a quiet and affordable place to stay.

Sorry, there's just not a better view than from this place! We had a room that looked directly at Diamond Head as well as 180 degrees of Waikiki. Room was bright and nicely appointed, and staff was friendly and accommodating. Nice lobby and two ABC stores in the building (you'll learn quickly enough about these ubiquitous hamlets of tourist convenience).

Stayed here for 10 days rooms are small but very comfortable. Staff alround are amazing and friendly. House keeping is great they change your towels every day. Hotel is close to zoo and walking distance to malls and some cheap places to eat food is expensive though. We will be back !!! 5 stars from me.

The location of the Hotel is at the end of Waikki strip. I think if you have a young family, the walk might be to much. Yes l have a few issues with the Hotel. I was very disappointed with the reception staff, they have no knowledge of anything to help your stay on the island, l asked questions about the public buses and the didn't know anything. l asked for recommendations about places to eat, basically wanted local knowledge and got nothing. The rooms are very small and the bathroom was a problem with space. There is no where to hang wet towels so you have to have clean towels everyday. Yes they replace your towels everyday and make your bed but in the 8 days there they didn't change the sheets. I did enjoy my stay but its the little things which can be a problem. If the staff had of been more friendly and helpful, our stay would have been perfect.

The Park Shore Waikiki was a pleasant surprise. After deciding on this hotel while traveling in Waikiki I wasn't sure what to expect. Well, my husband and I were very satisfied. Although the rooms are small, they are very clean and the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Loved the location as it was convenient to everything. We easily walked to shops, restaurants and Diamond Head. We visited the three restaurants within the hotel. And looked all of them, especially the authentic Japanese restaurant in the lobby.If you are looking for Fancy this may not be the hotel for you. If you are looking for location, friendly competent staff and a good rate - I would say give it a try.

Recently stayed two days here. Had a king room on the 18th floor with awesome ocean front views! Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was small, especially the bathroom. Only one person at a time. Single sink/mirror. But overall, nice room and experience. Great location at the end of Waikiki so not as loud and crowded but still a lot of people. Beach is right across the street. The only complaint that I would really have, and this is why I rated sleep quality poor, is the bed pillows are really flat and hard and made getting comfortable a challenge. Bring your own pillow if you have neck issues. If you drive/rent, its valet parking and be prepared for fighting the traffic!! A little patience goes a long way here.. :-) But it was a great experience, I would recommend Park Shore if you are not looking for the glamour and glitz and $$$$ of the larger hotels like the Sheraton or Royal Hawaiian.

This is the third time we have returned and we have enjoyed it just as much. The location is good , within walking distance of all that is happening in Waikiki yet is quiet at night. It is opposite the beach and is very easy to pop over for a swim. The beach chairs provided by the hotel are very useful as are the clean beach towels. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and it is wise to pay the extra to chose an ocean view room as the view is spectacular. The staff are very friendly and helpful (Especially Annie who's is amazing). The Alamoana shuttle is an easy way to go shopping although the buses are cheap and there is a stop outside the hotel. Overall the hotel deserves a 10/10 for value for money!!!!

Good hotel very well located, close to the beach. Confortable and big beds. But probably the best is the personnel / employees that are very helpful and friendly. Rooms are also confortable. Rooms on upper floors have better views. Good quality/cost balance.

Our stay at Park Shore was short and sweet because we were moving to a different hotel paid by my company for the remainder of the trip but I wish we could have stayed here. The location was away from all of the hustle and bustle and the views of Diamondhead were amazing. Tucker and bevy was great to have near by as well as LuLus and two ABC stores. The room was a little small but seriously who spends that much time in their room? The atmosphere was laid back and relaxing. If I had to pick a hotel in Waikiki again, I would come back!

My partner and I stayed here for a week on vocation. First the good. We got a ocean front room on the 11th floor also with a view of Diamond Head mountain. The view was fantastic and was a joy to wake up to in the mornings. The room was spacious and the bed as amazingly comfortable. Balcony was cool and we had good air conditioning. Another excellent feature here is that the free wifi is fantastic, and you can use as much as you want. The pool and surrounding area was also good. Now the negatives. Rooms are a little run down, this is especially noticeable in the bathroom. The service desk could be more friendlier. The location could be an issue with some as it is at the end of Waikiki beach near Honolulu Zoo and away from all of the main shopping, although this could also be seen as a positive. Also, guests at other hotels were able to get on the pink line bus for free which is great to get around, if you stay here you can only use the aqua shuttle which isn't nearly as good. We ate at Lulu's which was the restaurant attached to the hotel, service and food was average. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here, I would recommend that you pay the extra money to stay in the ocean front room with view of Diamond Head, it makes it all worth it.

My wife and I had an amazing time at Park Shore Waikiki. Right from the get-go, during the booking process, I had made a mistake and accidentally ended up making the whole thing a lot harder on myself.The staff at Park Shore Waikiki were more than happy to help. The whole thing got cleared up very quickly and with minimal fuss.The hotel itself has an amazing location overlooking both the ocean and an unobstructed view to Diamond Head. I took so many amazing sunrise/sunset photos from just the balcony alone!Any hotel situated on the waterfront in Waikiki has been there for a while, but due to recent renovations our rooms were very clean and modern.Overall, we were very happy with the price, location, service, and overall quality of our stay at this hotel. If we ever make our way over to Honolulu again (which we hope to do), we will definitely be staying here again.

Spent 4 nights here recently. Great stay. Staff were very attentive. Special mention to Joey and Risa who gave exceptional service. Only negative was that the hotel claims to have a business centre, but trying to scan a document to send to my email was met with "scanning is only for internal use" by a very arrogant manager. If you claim to have a business centre, then provide business facilities (which includes scanning). But for this negative, it would have been a perfect review.

This property was in a fantastic location being right across the road from the beach but still a great price. It was also in a quiet part of the street (clubs up the other side) and the zoo was just across the side road.The rooms were nice and there was 2 restaurants to choose from and a convenience store inside the property too.There was also free shuttles to the shopping mall Ala Moana

This was a great hotel. Right on the beach and if you get the right room an awesome view of the beach. Even if you don't get that view there are parts of the hotel to go to in able to see the beach. JUST GO TO THE BEACH! The employees are super nice and you get fresh towels every day. But book this hotel through the discounted hotel websites.

Just arrived, not in the oceanfront room we booked 9 months ahead as they say it isn't available! Offered side view and an 'upgrade' of diamond head mountain view suite and waiving the service charge for two nights. but NOT what we wanted for a 25th wedding anniversary romantic sunset views over the beach! How can they mess up when booked so far ahead? They didn't tell us they had messed up, they waited for us to find out for ourselves. NOT very good upfront honesty. Hopefully things can only get better.

My daughter and I enjoyed our night in transit at the Park Shore Waikiki.We stayed in a standard hotel room, which is the most basic room type. Our room was small and didn't have a view, unless you went on the balcony only and looked left. The room was clean. Other room types have ocean views. The decor was dated.Accommodation in Honolulu is not great value for money, and the same was true for the Park Shore. That said, the location is wonderful. The hotel is right across from the beach and on one side it zoo and park, so it's not packed in. It's a great balance having the park are and esplanade to walk along to one side of the hotel, and the busy shops and restaurant strip to the other.There is no hotel room service, however there are many restaurants that will deliver to the hotel.I wouldn't want to stay in the room we had for more than a couple of nights.The reception staff were very warm and helpfulIt was lovely going to a swim near the hotel, but not in the thick of it with lots of other people.

We stayed her for four days after a long holiday to break the trip home, and found that it was close to everything we wanted. Accomodation is showing signs of age but is clean and safe. Everything was normal until we went to check out. We were charged and extra $20 per day for "servicing" , being too exhausted by this stage of our trip, I didn't argue, but I thought is must have been for cleaning the room. We hadn't let anyone in the room for four days, so I'm not sure why we were charged for this. Also after checking out we were waiting for our airport transfer (about ten min) and realised we had left a small bag in our room. When we went back to get it the cleaning staff had already put in a store room, we retrieved it and went on our way. Half way through our fligh we opened the small bag to get some medication out and it was gone. We have still not been able to find the medication, so can only assume it was taken from the bag. We have tried to email Park Shore but can't seem to find an address.

This hotel was great.The stuff is pleasand and helpful. You will get the free towels from the desk, which is nice. The pool area is ok. The view to the Waikiki beach is amazing. The rooms are ok, not too small. It's close to everything, so the location is perfect.

We found the property quite central to all, clean and quiet. Unfortunately the price does not include breakfast which makes it on the expensive side. There are corners shops and a Starbucks along side the building which is very convenient.

We stayed here for 7 nights in September of 2016. It was clean and safe. Otherwise, very average. Staff wasn't very friendly or helpful (but the Expedia concierge was amazing but she did not work for the hotel itself). Small rooms. Very stingy on bath towels and beach towels. They don't change sheets often unless requested. Pool is very boring/blah (and there is a lot they could have done with the space but they opt not to). Would I say here again? No. Would I recommend it? No. There are tons of other hotels along Kalakaua Ave and I have to believe plenty of better options for the money.

If you are looking for a place that is a little bit away from the hustle and bustle, but still opposite the beach then this place is for you. Amazing location, great rooms within walking distance of everything. Stayed their pre and post cruise and would not stay anywhere else

This place is right on Kuhio beach and adjacent to zoo. The location was perfect for us travelling with a small child because we wanted to go the zoo and also go to the child friendly Kuhio beach. The free Kuhio hula dance is a short walk away. Bus stop right in front of the hotel and covers many routes, good for running errands. We had a room in the 15th floor. The place is generally clean and staff helpful. Check in/check out was seamless. We took the free shuttle to Ala moana center a couple of times. They also stored our luggage after checkout so that we can roam around during the day before our night flight. Overall a very good experience and will recommend this place.

The Park Shore Waikiki is a beautiful boutique hotel in prime location within footsteps of Waikiki Beach and shops/restaurants. I recently stayed at the hotel for a few nights in August and enjoyed a magnificent ocean front room with the best views of Waikiki. I could have sat on the patio all day and enjoyed the view, but when you're in Waikiki you have to see everything. The service was top notch at the hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

I've stayed at this hotel in the past and like it because of it's great location and reasonable good value price. The hotel is located at the quiet end of all of the Waikiki hotels, across from the beach and the zoo. It's one of three hotels that have nothing between it and a spectacular view of Diamond Head from the beach. There's a ABC Store just off the lobby of the hotel, with numerous casual, fine dining and fast food restaurants, along with bars all within close walking distance. The rooms are fairly large, in good condition, and quite clean. The front desk staff is very professional, accommodating and pleasant. Complimentary beach and pool towels are available at the front desk and in-room WI-FI is free. While there are very few "good deals" in Waikiki, this hotel offers guests a very good deal because of their fairly reasonable room rates and better yet, their location just can't be beat because it's quiet, just across the beach and has spectacular unblemished views of Diamond Head. Lastly, don't rent a car (parking costs $20+ a night everywhere), but instead take the bus to most everywhere for only $2.50!

My husband , daughter and I stayed here in August this year. It was lovely.The rooms were basic but clean and tidy. The hotel is at the end of the strip so not as noisy as closer to town but very convenient and just across from the beach. We had a beautiful view of the pool area and the beach from our room.The staff were friendly and helpful.We had a little problem with them taking 2 lots of money from our credit card but all was sorted.Over all great place to stay and I would highly recommend it.

Amazing hotel with good service. New beach towels every day and even beach chairs to loan for the day. Close to everything and not as noisy as closer to the center of Waikiki. Free shuttle to the shopping center ala moana as well. The beach is just across the street.

The hotel staff goes above and beyond to make sure that the customer is very happy with their stay. They were able to get me checked in about an hour early, I really like that the hotel is at the sound end of Waikiki , but also right across the street from the beach. They are also 2 bars and restaurants right next door. Great place.

We stayed at the Park Shore Waikiki for 3 nights in August 2016. The hotel was right on the main street of Waikiki but towards the quieter end (a short walk away from the very busy part of the beach and the high profile shops and restaurants).The room was quite expensive and I was disappointed that breakfast was not included (even with the more expensive rooms). There were a lot of cafes and restaurants surrounding the hotel though including a Starbucks, Subway and a few others. There was also an ABC Shop a few doors down.Our room was very nice and comfortable and we got a fairly good night sleep. The room had other amenities including a swimming pool with a nice view of Waikiki beach.The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and knowledgeable including the staff on reception, the valets and housekeeping staff.If you do not plan on hiring a car the Park Shore Waikiki is close by to trolley and bus stops and is also right in the heart of Waikiki. (I do highly recommend hiring a car though so you can get out of Waikiki to see other parts of Oahu).

We loved it here. It was the South end of Waikiki, so a little quieter BUT way better! We stayed the North end when we came back to Waikiki and really didn't like it compared to Park Shore. Park Shore has amazing views over the beach, zoo, mountains and diamond head. It makes you forget you are in a busy city. It is easy access to the beach and it's a great section of the beach as well. Lots of shops around to grab cheap food, groceries, dinner, and to go out drinking. We'll be back. I gave it only 4 out of 5 as it could do with renovating BUT most of Waikiki is like that. Staff were excellent as well.

A comfortable hotel right on the beach and close to shops and eateries, the staff were helpful and the rooms were clean and serviced daily. There was a good pool area and a café bar attached to the hotel.The only problem we had was noise from the air conditioning unit on the hotel next door.

Park shore had a fantastic location. Cross the street to beach and a block or 2 to bars and food.the rooms could use a little up dating and are smaller. But clean and we had a beautiful view of the ocean.I wish the doors had a better lock on them but had no problems. Had a great vacation.

We experienced excellent service from the staff from the minute we arrived until we left four days later. The most difficult thing about Waikiki is the parking. The valets here are well aware of that by immediately attending to you and your vehicle right when you arrive. The room has an excellent view of the ocean and had a pleasant balcony to enjoy the lovely warm evenings. This is our second stay here and The Park Shore will always be our hotel of choice to stay when in Waikiki.

We stayed here for 5 nights. The room was nice, clean, and quiet. I like how the hotel is close to the beach and other nearby stores. Parking was close too (if you didnt want to do vallet). They provided us with excellent service.

Was a very nice hotel. Bell guys were amzing and the costomer service at the desk were great also. We did have some issues with house keeping, but nothing major. They cleaned our room took all our Towels and didn't leave us any more. We asked for more cups and another chair for the balcony but didn't get any had to call to remind them. Rooms could be updated and a little bigger. Not much room between the beds. Would stay here again. We wish the pool hours were longer. After a long day, would have been nice to be able to take a swim when we got back to our room. Otherwise it was nice. Great location. You can not smoke in the room or on the balcony so would have to go out to the smoking area outside the hotel where homeless people would sit and try to bum cigarettes from you and if you don't give them one they would get mad and yell at you. Was really annoying when they can hang out by the hotel. My mom got matches thrown at her because she wouldn't give a homeless man a cigarette. This part was very annoying and frustrating.

Staff friendly, great food close by. When we came, we got upgraded to a room with a wonderful view over Waikiki beach! Cleaning everyday was very good, there was some hair on the sink and on the towels when we came, probably fell from the cleaning lady. We informed the staff at the reception and they gave us free breakfast and they were very sorry. No big deal though, everything looked very clean.

A adequate hotel for the price, the rooms were a bit dated and we only had one lamp that worked and one over head light that blew on the last night , long black hairs from house keeping were all over the bathroom , however the location was good, straight across the road from the beach and the Honolulu zoo

The location is amazing, the ocean view room offered a great view of Diamond Head and the Pacific Ocean, the staff professional and friendly, the beach just across the street.The hotel is very close to Honolulu Zoo, Starbucks and Cheeseburger In Paradise.

We stayed her for 4 nights. It is a block away from Waikiki beach so we went swimming each morning. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel has a restaurant and bar next door called Lulus and there is live music. One night one of the hotel guests joined in. They have free Yoga and exercise classed daily across the road in the park. A very nice friendly place to stay.

We've just returned from our second stay at this hotel, and again it proved a great place to stay. The rooms are clean and adequate and the hotel is quiet.The locality is excellent with the beach across the road and restaurants all within easy walking distance. There is a also a handy free shuttle to Ala Moana Centre, but the bus to Ala Moana is close by and the return from there stops right outside the hotel, which is great after a shopping visit. Also appreciated was the complimentary cool drinks in the hotel lobby.

Situated at the quieter end of town across the road from the beach and the zoo ( no worries as no smells from zoo )An excellent location, close to several great places to eat, and ABC store to stock up on water etc to store in rooms refrigerator . Lovely pool area on the 3rd floor with nice views of beach and Diamond Head.Valet parking available at added cost which we used. free shuttle service to local shopping Mall.24hr. Front desk, Staff are very friendly and helpful.Only fault was that the tiled floor becomes very slippery and dangerous if you drip water on it which we did as our room opened directly onto the pool area - plenty of towels to put on floor as stepping stones !!!We will certainly stay at this hotel again.

Stayed August 2016 in a room on the 17th floor (of 18). Rooms are adequate but not very large. Air conditioning in our room was noisy but provided cool air.Staff in Reception were friendly and efficient. Had to ask for an electric kettle and tea bags which were replaced only when requested. Cleaning staff visited each day to empty rubbish bins, replace any towels left on the floor and wipe down the bathroom. Bed linen changed after the 3rd night. A charge for services of $20 per night, but not sure what that was for?No bottled water supplied, the Wi Fi connection was spasmodic and slow. We used Starbucks to get a strong Wi Fi signal.However the big plus for this hotel is the location. Across the road is Waikiki beach with safe swimming inside the 'wall'. Also within walking distance of the Waikiki Acquarium which is recommended as a must see. Two ABC stores are in the same building and many restaurants are within walking distance eg Subway, Eggs'n Things, Lu Lu's, Pizza place etc etc.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Park Shore. The location is fabulous with the beach right across the street and restaurants and shops all within walking distance. The room was spacious, clean and well serviced. The staff were all friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Found a deal on the hotel website for an ocean view room with great rates. We were on the 15th floor with an excellent view of the beach and Diamond Head. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had a Junior Suite with a microwave, toaster and mini frig. The room was clean with a nice shower. We were right across the main road from the beach while avoiding the noise of central Waikiki. Good restaurants nearby. Elevator was fast. No hassles getting beach towels or beach chairs. Only complaint is WiFi not working on our floor but they removed service charge on our bill. We were only there two days and they were working on the problem. I'd check before reserving if this is important to you.

Decided on a last minute trip to Hnl and was unaware of the RIMPAC military exercise going on. Most hotels were either unavailable or had extremely inflated rates. Luckily I found this hotel. A pretty classy place. Excellent friendly staff, nice pool. comfortable if not a little small rooms. Great flat screen tv. What sets this hotel apart is its great location matched by a great staff yet away from the tourist trap that is Waikiki. We had an ocean view room fantastic view of the ocean and Diamond head area. Keep in mind rooms are smaller and the juxtaposition of the hotels ocean view and ocean front rooms means that your view is not completely private. Standard rooms I believe face another hotel. Very satisfied with our 3nt stay.

this is a great location and the rooms are good, we had a pool and beach view so really enjoyed that.The restaurant Lulus which was attached to the hotel was first rate and although we tried other places we always went back.

Friendly staff and good location. Room wasn't very clean. We checked in after a long exhausting day and went right to bed. When we got in, the sheets/mattress bed stunk! Musty/wet dog smell. I have no idea what from. We called and got new sheets, but we had to put them on ourselves. Strange.

Really good spot right near the beach and a few shops. The staff were always willing to help. Beach towels card is really handy, you always have clean dry towels. Great authentic Japanese restaurant in the building. The $20/day + tax is a bit crazy but all the hotels here seem to do it, it should just be included in the per night price so you know what you are paying. Activities eg surfing, diving etc can be booked in the hotel. Security 24/7 which is great too.

Excellent friendly and knowledgeable staff at reception. Hotel room very comfortable and had great view of the ocean even though it was only a partial view. Stunning. Location great as it looks over the park with the beach across the street.

After a few visits to Waikiki, like me, you might prefer to stay on the fringe of the action - close enough to walk to everything but not in the expensive and commercial heart of the area. The Park Shore is opposite the zoo near the beach volleyball courts and provides clean and simple accommodation on the beach front. Rooms were very tidy with excellent beds and bathroom facilities. Good breakfast and coffee options are just around the corner within 50 metres and the safe swimming beach across the road. Would definitely stay here again.

Loved the breathtaking view overlooking Waikiki Beach and over parkland to Diamond Head. Park Shore really is in one of the best spots on this busy tourist strip. Located metres from the beach, bars, restaurants shops and even the Zoo across the road. We were upgraded to suite on arrival a very nice surprise ... very spacious and clean room with a kitchenette. We certainly enjoyed our 5 day stopover on the way home to Australia.

This hotel is located the last hotel on Waikiki beach and just next to the zoo. We had a great view of Waikiki beach from our room. The room was small but very clean. The price was also reasonable at this convenient location. There is a Japanese restaurant on first floor. We wanted to take a surf lesson, and the school is located in the lobby. It was a short walk to the lesson area. Staff were friendly and we would like to stay there again.

This hotel is right up the end of Waikiki beach, opposite the zoo. We liked it because it was slightly quieter at that end of the beach. Just walk out of the hotel, walk 20 metres approx, cross the main road & you're on the beach. You have 2 choices, the ordinary ocean with waves, or the calmer sea inside the breakwater. Just buy a swimming ring pumped up already at the ABC store & enjoy the beautiful warm sea. Cold drinks are available in the lobby as a welcome relief from the heat. Comfy rooms, nice bed, great bathroom. All in all a great hotel in a great location. Bars, restaurants and shops right on the door step. It was nice to walk 'home' to a quieter area at the end of a busy day.Free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre.Free wifi
user_location: Bay of Plenty Region, New Zealand
user_name:
Sue P
Bay of Plenty Region, New Zealand

review_body: Park Shore is located at the southern end of Waikiki and is a little quieter than some other areas. It is just two minutes from the beach and there are numerous buses that travel close to the hotel. Its also opposite the zoo so you don't feel hemmed in like you would at some other hotels. The rooms are nice and airey and were very clean. The rooms were serviced every day to a high standard. The bed was very comfortable and the shower / bath was very good with plenty of hot water. There are numerous restaurants in the area, ranging from bargain to high end. The pool and surrounds are really nice and with a great view over the zoo towards Diamond Head, and the beach. All the staff were so friendly and made us feel at home. The Park Shore is great value for Waikiki.

Have to say Park shore is wonderful, Great staff and great location to everything. Also it had a restaurant above with the most spectacular view of the ocean and zoo which is right across the street. Air condition and if you're lucky to get a ocean view enjoy it. Beautiful. Price is worst all you receive.

Check in/out: Flawless, efficient, friendly and helpful. Ethan is the best! Perfect person for the front desk staff. He upgraded us for no extra charge to partial ocean view. Much appreciated!Location: End of main strip along beach, awesome location. Great view of ocean and walking distance to everything, including Diamond Head.Room and housekeeping: consistent daily cleaning, good fridge, comfortable king bed, quiet building. Consistent hot water temperature, but inconsistent pressure. Small washroom as can only accommodate one person at a time. Scenic views from balcony, which indluded two chairs and a coffee table.Price: excellent for the location and good value.Wifi: Inconsistent as it usually worked for my iPhone but rarely for my iPad.Parking: $25 per day is pricey, but parking is hard to find around there. Valet drivers were always competent, friendly and helpful.

We stayed here on our honeymoon and it was fabulous. They upgraded us to a partial ocean view when I told them we were on our honeymoon. We got a small room with a king size bed on the 14th floor with a balcony facing the beach. Waikiki Beach is literally across the street. There are tons of restaurants and shops within walking distance and there was a festival on the road in front of the hotel one night we were there. It was amazing. We ate dinner on the balcony and it was bliss. The staff was very nice. I would stay here again.

Upon arrival which was very late due to flight delays, we were welcomed with all the warm of Hawaii that you would expect. Much to our delight, we were upgraded to a partial ocean view - stunningly beautiful. The rooms were very clean, the king size bed wonderful and bathroom amenities good. We loved the location being right across from the beach. Staff were always very friendly and helpful. Thank you for helping us celebrate our 32nd wedding anniversary/honeymoon. We hope to be back in the future.

I'd say the Park Shore is on the very east end of Waikiki. Last tall hotel on that end. Not right on the beach, but only across the street with a safe crosswalk and then boom you're on the beach. We had a beach view room on the corner so we had great views of the beach and a eastern view with a great view of Diamond head. The staff at the desk was helpful and nice. The room was kept clean and the Bell desk was good too! Convenient ABC stores only a few steps away either direction from the entrance. Very good picnic food type place right next door with reasonable prices for breakfast and lunch items - good panini sandwiches!

Great location, well-appointed very clean rooms with a extremely king bed, the ocean view rooms have an uninterrupted view from the beach to Diamond Head. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great pool and sun deck area. 1 minute walk to the beach, bars and the zoo.

Our first trip to Waikiki but, certainly wont be our last - an amazing destination.This review is extremely late being posted but none the less, valid and honest.Park Shore was our home for 8 days in Jan/Feb '16 and that's how it felt, like home.Despite having to move rooms during our stay, which was unexpected and unappreciated, the Park Shore is a modern and quiet, full of features to make it top class in its price range. Important words - 'in its price range'! Park Shore doesn't have the tariffs that some of the beachside 5star places do and accordingly, I don't think it pretends to compare itself with them. It is fantastic value for money and I suggest you look for the 'Special' offers - we were lucky enough to get a great deal here.Anyway, the hotel. Very welcoming staff to greet you each time you enter the lobby without being overbearing. Nicely appointed lobby with plenty of lounges, fruit juice available, all the tourist info (including an agent) and access to the ABC store (one on every corner in Waikiki).Our room was outstanding, balcony and windows overlooking the beach and the adjacent zoo presented a beautiful passing parade all day and night. The level of cleanliness in the room was fantastic with room service being unobtrusive and very accommodating to our schedule. Room size was good and furnishings were excellent. Enormous range of TV channels available.The pool and pool area was adequate and appreciated and not overdone like many others. Plenty of lounges and tables to use, probably the only thing missing here were access to a shop to buy drinks & food due to the pool not being on the ground floor.Proximity to, well, everything Waikiki has to offer is fantastic and the city has plenty to offer in terms of public transport that lots of other cities could learn from. The hotel is over the road from an amazing beachside which seems to have something happening all the time if that's what your looking for, or plenty of quiet places if not (crowds excepted).All in all, thoroughly recommended and I would return in a moment to Park Shore. It was a fantastic experience and just what was needed to celebrate our 30 wedding anniversary.

We chose the Park Shore as it was at the end of the strip and far enough away from the main drag. Easy to get in and out of. You can be on the beach in 60 seconds and even better you can drive to a secluded beach in 20 minutes.Beach towels and chairs are provided by the hotel which is a nice touch. Check in was quick and easy and the room was clean and comfortable we have no complaints about that at all. Parking is via Valet only at a ridiculous price, I'd far prefer to park myself. On check out their was a resort fee that I'm not really sure what it was for? Someone mentioned house keeping and wifi however if so I'd expect that to be included in the night rate. Overall a nice stay.

My boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay at Parkshore. It is an older hotel, however location makes up for it. It is right across the street from the Aquarium and Honolulu Zoo. It also is directly across the street from the beach, and the hotel gives you a beach chair and umbrella if you like. Staff was incredibly nice and helpful, particularly when knowing about getting around the island as well as tours. One staff member if shared delicious hot Cuban donuts with us! It is close to awesome restaurants and on the quieter side of the island. It was my Boyfriend Bday, and they even gave him free champagne and chocolate covered almonds. We would definitely return to this hotel if we come to honolulu again.

Park Shore was our first hotel on our vacation to Hawaii. It did not disappoint and everything was out at ease. The hotel was clean and very well presented and the staff were absolutely lovely and helpful! Especially Michelle on Reception, she took care of us so much and every morning was interested to know what was on our agenda. Even when we came to say goodbye she welcomed us with a huge hug. The hotel is down the end of Waikiki but it's not far from main attractions in the heart of Waikiki, the beach is literally across the road and the zoo is directly next door, and only a short walk to the aquarium. You may be lucky to get yourself a view of Diamond head too, if not, you definitely need to go hike up there! It's only $1. Attached to the Hotel is an ABC store outside and a restaurant/bar called LuLu's which does amazing food and cocktails!All in all, Park Shore Waikiki was brilliant!!

We loved this hotel. There was a beautiful view of Diamond Head and the ocean. Just across the street was the beach and a grassy park with palm trees. There is a tiki torch lit pier. We walked to the Pink Palace, Mauna, Market, Duke's Canoe Club. Park Shore Hotel also has a restaurant called Lulu's. It is fabulous. Breakfast, lunch and dinner is available. We will stay here again.

My husband and I stayed at Park Shore on our first holiday to Hawaii. I chose Park Shore after reading reviews and we were very happy with our choice. Staff were extremely friendly, special mention to Gina at front desk...great customer service.We stayed in room 907 which was a corner oceanfront that also had views of Diamond Head. We we're disappointed at first that our room didn't actually face the ocean when we had paid for oceanfront. We spoke to reception and they were happy to move us when an oceanfront room became available but we decided to stay put and not go through the inconvenience of packing up and unpacking again. Only complaint with this room would be that there is no bench space in the bathroom for toiletries etc. The coffee, water and juice available in the foyer throughout the day is very handy. We loved our stay so much we are now in the process of planning a return to Park Shore next year with our kids and grandkids. Can't wait!

This was our first trip to Hawaii, and I was a bit worried about picking the right hotel. In the end I'm glad we chose this hotel, as it was on the quiet end of Waikiki and their restaurants were better than some of the resort hotels we visited while walking around Waikiki beach. It was easy to walk to all sorts of restaurants and Diamond Head.Beyond the great location, we really appreciated the coffee & juice service provided in the lobby. The coffee was surprisingly good for a hotel. We tried to eat breakfast in our room (the fridge came in handy), so the coffee was definitely appreciated! The pool deck was plain but nice, and the use of the beach chairs came in handy. We did morning yoga once, and it was great. Beachfront yoga with a very good instructor--what's not to like?The one main drawback is that in our room we got a pair of double beds instead of a king, which for a week was a bit of a pain. The gentleman that checked us in was apologetic, and I'm pretty sure he put us in a better location & higher floor than our booking was to compensate. We ended up having a partial ocean view. The rooms are small, but we were expecting this, so it wasn't an issue. The one thing I will say is that calling this a boutique hotel is stretching the definition; this hotel is neither small, luxurious, or independent. It is, however, a very nice hotel part of a larger chain.

The hotel is pretty average - nothing amazing and nothing awful. Its big advantage is the location - right at the beach but at the end of the strip. The pool looks fine but we didn't use it. The room was fine but like the rest of the hotel could do with an upgrade. Again nothing awful, just feels a little jaded. There are a number of food outlets in the building and a convenience store next door.

The location is amazing, close to the beach and next to the park. You could see the beauty of tHe island and not be enclosed by buildings. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable time. Glad we stayed there, would do it again.

I had a view of the building next door but who stays in their room in Waikiki? Renovated building with beautiful lobby. Nice pool deck. Very convenient to restaurants and beach. Excellent bell desk staff.

Two years since my last review - I booked an oceanfront room which is a higher category than my previous ocean view. When I arrived and realized that the oceanfront rooms are accessed from external entryways, I decided I would prefer to not have a room with this type of entry. The front desk gentleman was kind enough to find me an ocean view. The view was diamond head with an ocean view out the side window and from the lanai, really nice, perfect corner room, but the cost should have been adjusted to reflect the room change. The lanai, though not large, is perfect for two, but the lanai chairs are not comfortable. Pool area really nice, clean, well maintained pool. A different system needs to be integrated for the towel check out since it's the front desk so if the check in line is long, you're just standing waiting to pick up a towel and it could take a while. Here's the rub - at the end of my 3-day stay, I scheduled an in-room massage with the Spa the hotel promotes. The front desk was aware of this, and the masseuse checks in with them prior to coming to the guest room - I like that process. BUT - the hotel was having work done and within 15 minutes into my 60 minute massage, there was a scaffold outside my window with two men on it drilling into the wall above my unit. Soooooo, not only was I unable to enjoy my view during the massage having the draw the drapes, but the work caused my room to shake and the drilling had to have been over the allowed decibels one should hear without earplugs! I took a photo of the scaffold outside my window and showed the desk - they did nothing but apologize - ok wait, I just spend alot of money on a service promoted by the hotel that more than likely receives a commission since the service is charged to the room, and I was not at least offered a partial refund? The hotel staff was surely aware of this work ahead and should have offered a different suite for the massage. The only work guests were made aware of was a fire alarm test (the day before) and sidewalk work directly in front. Nothing about what felt like shoring! I waited a month to see if the update to the cost was made from oceanfront to ocean view and if perhaps they would provide a partial refund to the massage. Neither, i was charged fully for a room type I did not receive and a service that was disrupted by the hotel itself. I have since sent an email and three weeks later, not even an acknowledgement. So I am disappointed to say the least - the hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly otherwise, and I would hope that this type of complaint was escalated to management. I was so impressed by my first visit, I recommend this hotel to anyone, but this visit just soured the taste for me, which is too bad because it could have been corrected by now. Interesting thing, for the location, the cost, the service [aside from this experience] is really good. Disappointing that I may not return due to lack of acknowledgement.

Stayed here as a stop over on way to Canada so only one night. Arrived early .. Rooms were ready so we were allowed access (great news after a long flight). Rooms were reasonable size, clean and the bed was comfy. Friendly staff. Nice location .. 2mins to beach and Zoo and Starbucks coffee! Would recommend. Only down was it was on the outskirts of town which wasn't an issue for three of our party of four. The 4th having mobility issues it was just a bit too far for daily walks in and out.

We booked standard room for $250 a night and stayed for 6 nights. Upon arrival they offered a room with two beds! The lady who offered us the room was a little rude. We waited from 12 pm till 3 pm after a loooong flight to get into our room. We stayed on the 17th floor and had a very blocked view of the ocean and saw more of people staying at another high rise hotel. Room was comfortable and were attended to every day. 20 +94 cents per night as hospitality fee. Beach towels and chairs were available. All the bell desk staff were very helpful.

Let’s start at the very beginning; checking in was a breeze! The staff were very helpful and explained everything that needed to be. We then made our way up to our room (1508), which was a standard sized hotel room. We had 2 double beds (which were classic Australian doubles – 137cm x 187cm). They were big enough for 2 adults, but without a lot of space to move around during the night. The rooms have all of the basics; mini fridge (no freezer), laptop safe, coffee machine & mugs, desk, large flat screen TV, plenty of storage for your clothes, and self-controlled air-conditioning.Every room has a balcony and nice views of either the city, Diamond Head or the ocean, depending which one you booked. We booked a partial ocean view and it didn’t disappoint. Our balcony faced the hotel next door, with a partial view of Kuhio beach. Our room was at the end of the hallway, so we had an extra window along the side wall – which had stunning views of the beach! It would’ve made it just that much better if the window opened, but I can see that could be an OH&S issue.We did have a bit of an issue with our air-conditioner unit – we had to leave it on 25 degrees Celsius otherwise it would be freezing! Our front & balcony doors would also rattle at times – I’m guessing this was every time a gust of wind blew past – and it did get pretty annoying, but you kind of get use to it.The hotel offers free wifi, which I found really fast most of the time, although slows down in peak times. There’s no password required, just connect once you’re in the lobby/rooms.The bathroom was quite large with plenty of bench space, although quite low for the average person. The shower is over the bath and only had one setting as far as pressure goes, but it was really nice. I did manage to have a bath one night, but the water kept draining to half-full as the overflow valve was half way up the bathtub. I found this really odd, but it wasn’t nay fault of the hotels, just the manufacturer.The hotel offers a free shuttle bus to and from the Ala Moana shopping center operating every 40 minutes. They also offer daily use of their beach towels and beach chairs – both of these are included in the hospitality fee.I’d highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Waikiki, especially if you have an interest in visiting the Zoo (across the road) or Aquarium (a short walk along the beach).

We booked a Diamond Head Suite for the 3 of us. Totally worth the extra expense. Great view over the beach from our 14th storey room. Really comfy beds and great bathroom, best shower of our holiday. Easy walk to the shops and restaurants of Waikiki and right next to the zoo. Juice in the foyer is a nice touch when returning from the beach. Highly recommended.

It was my first time to stay at Park Shore Waikiki. We got there early and thank goodness, room is ready by 10am since i have a 3yr daughter with me.Thank you Ethan for accommodating us early. The location was PERFECT! One crosswalk away from the beach and it is surrounded by ABC stores, restaurants, the zoo. They have valet parking - $25. Our hotel has 2 beds, i think its 2 double beds, we have partial ocean view on the 17th floor. Mini fridge, wine opener, and TV with good channels. Coffee water and juice in the lobby, beach towels and chairs at front desk.

I have stayed at this hotel twice now after getting a good deal online. I would go back again anytime I am in Waikiki. The price is super reasonable, the rooms are nice and clean and the location is awesome. I liked that it wasn't smack dab in the middle of all the Waikiki chaos and you are close enough to the Zoo to hear the monkeys so that was pretty cool. Give this place a try if you are on the fence, much better so save your money for delicious food and fun adventures than a room you won't be spending much time in.

We really enjoyed our 4 days at the Park Shore, the room was really small but we had a lovely view of the shore and the ocean and the location was great - beach over the road and shops and restaurants in both directions.The tours we booked also picked up from the Waikiki Marriott which was a 5 minute walk away - very convenient.The coffee shop downstairs is lovely and although we didn't use it the pool looked clean (but was pretty small - who needs a pool when the ocean is steps away though!)Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Park shore was just the most perfect location! walking to the beach everyday, places to shop and eat all local. The staff in the hotel were fantastic and helpful- just perfect. We will return for sure! Diamond head 10 minutes in a taxi- north shore just about an hour away. Booked all trips with kev on the corner by tikis- fantastic and reasonable!

CONVENIENTOlder style hotel with smaller than the usual American sized rooms; small but clean and practical bathrooms. Balcony. Good bedding and towels. Beach towels provided at no extra cost. Reasonable cost for Waikiki. Staff courteous and helpful. The big bonus for visitors is its position on the east end of Waikiki with the park and the beach virtually at one’s door, so runners, walkers, cyclists have plenty of options. The hotel has almost daily yoga sessions in the nearby park. We had a “partial sea view” which also had a view of Diamond Head. Would recommend for couples and families (pool) that are not after the glitzy aspect of Honolulu.

Hotel put us on the 15th floor with views of diamond head and the ocean. It was perfect. I would highly recommend 1507! Best of both worlds. It is across the street from the water. The hotel offers towels and chairs at no cost. It is very convenient! The staff is very accommodating and makes you feel very welcome. Liked being away from the craziness of all the shoppers and across the street from the zoo. If we ever come back to Hawaii we will be looking at this hotel again. Would recommend!

The Park Shore was a recommendation from a family member. It has a great location. Right next to the zoo. Unobstructed view of Diamond Head. We had a corner room so had a view of ocean also. Beach is really convenient and right across the street. Staff was pleasant. Housekeeping was great. Pool looked liked it was well maintained although we never used it. Overall, this property is outdated and needs a remodel. Loved Oahu but would probably explore other lodging options on next trip.

Great location Waikki beach across the road. Lovely helpful and friendly staff. Plenty of room around the pool area. Everything about this hotel was excellent. Brought back some lovely memories, the boat trips, shows, Pearl Harbour

2 adults and 2 children, only stayed there our last night in Hononlulu before flying home, but enjoyed the room. Really good size, small fridge, sofa, playstation and 2 big beds. A little noisy from the busy street right outside.Short walk to Waikiki Beach.We enjoyed our stay, and the price was really good.

Hotel is situated in a good location across the road from the beach.It has a nice pool area with plenty of space. The rooms are quite small and nothing special. Staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival.
user_name:
bung5
Zahara de los Atunes, Spain

review_body: Just had a brilliant stay at this lovely hotel. The staff were super friendly and helpful, thank you all very much. We thought the location was amazing, the park on one side with Waikiki beach on the other, it felt really spacious and open. It was also perfect to have a Starbucks and ABC store just at the bottom of the building. From this location we walked to Diamond Head Crater and did the hike, it was about 2.5 hr round trip, which I'd highly recommend if your fit enough! Would definitely stay here again. Mahalo

We stayed at this hotel for 5 lovely nights. The room was perfect, the view was stunning, and the whole stay was absolutely wonderful. Comfortable, clean, convenient to everything. Unbelievable view of Diamond Head on one side and beach on the other. Valet parking was great although the traffic was horrendous! Starbucks right by the hotel was a nice plus too! Ate at Lulu's a couple of mornings and it was really good. The staff was so friendly and helpful too. I would highly recommend Park Shore Hotel.

Stayed for 11 nights, great location and great staff.Ocean View room was all that was expected with a great view of Diamond Head and over the ocean. Opposite beach, Starbucks and ABC store next door and tucked up the quiet end of the main strip near the zoo.Already planning a return trip next year and will be definitely be staying here again.

I am on the edge of rating this Hotel average. For the price we paid I really expected more but then accommodation is expensive in Hawaii so maybe I should lower my expectations. Location of the Hotel is great, right next to the beach. Service was pretty good and the room was normal. and very clean. I don't have anything too bad or great to say about this Hotel. AHHHH the pool towels smelt a little bit bad.

The room was a little small and so is the balcony but the staff were very nice and accommodating. At the end of the strip, but still part of the "action". With the right rate, would definitely stay there again!

We stayed here for 5 nights, compared to a lot of hotels that we stayed at on mainland US, we really enjoyed our stay at Park Shore. The price is a little higher than expected, but I think you'll get that anywhere along the main strip. The location was fantastic, at the end of the main road so you still have access to all shops and restaurants and lovely views of the quieter beaches and diamond head, which is walking distance as well (about 45 mins walk). It was great having the beach on your door step, and a beach which was a little quieter if you wanted to get away from Waikiki beach. Staff were really lovely and helpful. The room was a decent size, great view of the beach (although you do pay more for this - totally worth it), and the room was clean too. Some suggestions, some fresh milk in the rooms to go with the coffee would be great, and the towel racks needs replacing as they had started to rust- but really minor things and how much time do you spend in your hotel room anyway? Would definitely stay at Park Shore again

a very friendly staff on a decent property in a great location, but there is a public bus stop directly out front and right below the pool, so expect to be kept in the busy waikiki atmosphere. the sad part is that it really feels like a crappy hotel got an ok redeco and then pretended to be high end....nice views, but you can do better for the price

We have just returned after a lovely 4 day holiday in Waikiki. The location is fantastic away from the hustle and bustle with stunning views of the ocean and Diamond head from our room but the hotel is a bit tired and could do with a refurbishment. The room was on the small size but was clean and the staff were friendly. The staff gave us a great recommendation of Uncle Bo,s restaurant a short walk from the hotel which we loved.

Just recently stayed at the Park shore hotel Waikiki and an amazing stay, the Park shore is very central and has great views but you must ask for ocean front for the best view. The staff were fantastic and so friendly. I highly recommend this hotel.

I stayed here with my girl friend and we absolutely love this place. It's new, clean, well kept and very friendly. Connected to a Starbucks, abc store and a little lunch/cafe spot. Right above is a bar with an awesome view and a lively bar scene. This hotel is a few streets away from the busy and bustling Waikiki beach, which we appreciated. Less crowded, less traffic and less loud. They have a free shuttle that takes you to ala moana shopping center, near downtown. The view of the ocean was amazing every single morning we stayed there. It's very easy to drive to this location if you have your own car since it is away from the 1-way street roads in Waikiki beach. Fridge in room and microwaves are available for guests to use. Will definitely be coming back!!

We stayed in a Standard room at the Park Shore for 4 nights.It's in a great location, at the end of Waikiki strip, and just across the road from the beach.The hotel has a Starbucks and ABC store ( general store) on the ground floor, and there are many restaurants within easy walking distance.The heart of Waikiki is only 10-15 mins walk away along a main road filled with shops and restaurants.The hotel is also close to Diamond Head trail, we were lazy and took a taxi to the start of the trail which cost around 10 usd.This was before we realised Uber is available in Honolulu and we used Uber to get to the airport for the bargain price of 19 usd compared to the airport taxi we got when we arrived which cost 50 usd!The hotel and rooms seem a little date, stuck in the 70s but that didn't bother us as we weren't spending much time in the hotel. Plus everywhere in the hotel was super clean.Although the we had a standard room, we had 2 queen sized beds, but overall the rooms and bathroom were small in size. On a minor note, the complimentary toiletries In the bathroom were just lovely!I would recommend staying at the Park Shore, mainly because hotels in Waikiki are ridiculously expensive and you're not going to get much better in the location.

For us this is the perfect location. Walk to the beach, restaurants, stores, zoo, aquarium. The on-site restaurant and picnic food is fantastic. We were able to get towels and chairs for the beach. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We received a 4 day bus pass which is a great value. The room was great location as well. We sat on the lanai overlooking the pool and ocean. Double rainbows two mornings in a row. We had 2 beds but next time would ask for 1 king bed. Small refrigerator in room. Cork screw in room. Room service from many nearby restaurants with a $7 fee. Room was a bit small but we were hardly ever in the room except to sleep. On the down side note very much privacy on the lanai or if curtains open as other rooms could look right in. Pillows were not very comfortable we plan on returning next year! Aloha!

The staff helped us with anything we needed and any questions we had were answered. We were greeted with juice and a cooled towel for our faces and they brought all our luggage to the room for us. Any time we had a question, regarding anything, everyone was happy to answer. The entire hotel was extremely clean well taken care of. Everyday our room was cleaned, vacuumed, and all the counters were wiped down.

We stayed 7 nights at the Park Shore & were absolutely pleasantly surprised by the standard of the hotel. My daughter had won a prize to stay 5 nights in the Park Shore so we decided to stay too as we were on our way to Canada. Room - I booked a beachfront room R624 which was located at the corner of the building overlooking Diamond Head , Waikiki Beach & Honolulu Zoo. The room was generous in size with a good size balcony & bathroom. I loved the extra views which also took in Diamond Head from the side windows. (Unobstructed views). Location - Although not in the heart of Waikiki it was a good 10 minute flat walk. Honolulu Zoo was opposite & beach across the road. Facilities- Starbucks next door , lulu's bar , deli , 2 ABC shops for grog & food , Yoshitune Japanese restaurant , swimming pool , tour desk, & water sport rentals. Staff - all extremely friendly & efficient. A credit to this establishment. Overall - fabulous value for a comfortable well organised hotel with excellent facilities at your fingertips. Very homey hotel compared to others in Waikiki. Highly recommended if looking for value & comfort.

The hotel is a bit old and the drop off/pick up area out front is extremely small but they were doing some painting and refreshing while we were there. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and our room even had a view of the ocean. If you aren't looking for fancy but just a clean friendly place to stay, that won't break the bank, that is right at the beach this is the place. Outside you can see diamond head and since it is at the end of the beach, we found that it was less crowded. It is also right next to the zoo if you have little ones. There are plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance and the valet parking fee is a one day price, come and go as much as you want which is nice.

We stayed 7 days in September 2015. We picked this hotel mainly because of the location. We didn't want to be sandwiched in the line of Waikiki hotels. We had easy access to the beach with a perfect view from our room. The hotel isn't fancy, but it was clean and the staff was very friendly. Easy access to restaurants, shops, and the bus.

We got in late from our flight and we were greeted by a super friendly lady with no line up. Yay! We were given the low down of amenities and told about the service fee we would have to pay (after a lot of googling there aren't many places that don't charge). The following morning we went out to see our ocean view and it wasn't bad - it had chairs so you could sit out on your balcony area. Rooms are a little on the small side and in a time warp but they were clean and comfortable. On the final day we had a late flight and that is when they really impressed up. After checking out they fave us towels and let us hang by the pool - they even promised us showers!! What was it the guy said? You are still are guests until you leave the island. Hospitality was top notch - congrats!!

Our Park Tower room had a direct line of sight to Diamond Head and a good view of the beach. I could not imagine a better view! There was quite a bit of street noise that reached our room on the 11th floor, including the "beep beep beep" of numerous buses kneeling at the bus stop in front of the hotel. We ran a white noise app on one particularly noisy night.With no basis for comparison in Hawaii, our room was quite snug compared to average mainland hotel rooms. The bathroom was snug, too, with a shower only. It may be helpful to think of the room as a very large cruise ship cabin rather than a fairly small hotel room.The open-air lobby has coffee in the morning and a delicious punch in the afternoon/early evening. The lobby has a back entrance to an ABC (convenience) store, and the second floor connects to a back entrance to LuLu's.Beach towels are available for check out at no additional charge, which is great. The towels themselves aren't particularly large or plush. I would consider bringing my own.Parking is valet only. The valets were normally very prompt. We did have one 10-minute wait for our car.This hotel does not have any service elevators. We occasionally had to compete for elevator space with hotel staff, although they always deferred to guests.I would certainly stay here again, but would also research the square footage of competing rooms and choose accordingly.

We first stayed at the Park Shore 3 years ago and really enjoyed it so this time when we returned to Honolulu we chose to stay there again and it is pleasing to say that nothing has changed and it is still a great hotel.It is not big nor fancy and therefore may not suit people looking for something like a Sheraton or Hilton but for my wife and I it is perfect.There is no bar in the hotel but Lulus is adjoining and has a bar and serves great food.If you are into self catering there is an ABC shop which has a door leading directly into the hotel lobby.The lobby is not crowded with people and is inviting.The hotel is located directly across from the beach and the views from the ocean view and ocean front rooms are brilliant.It is located next to the zoo so not in the middle of the chaos that can be the tourist strip yet it is in walking distance to the heart of things.The rooms are comfortable although the bathrooms are a little small but still functional.The staff are very friendly and helpful.The pool area is a little sterile but being directly across the road from the beach compensates for this.If you are into shopping they have free shuttles to Ala Moana on a regular basis.Finally the room prices are very reasonable.All in all we think it is an ideal place to stay and we will certainly stay there again on future visits.

Our room was on 7th floor at far North End of hotel. We had a view of not only diamond head and the beach but also the Zoo. I watch the Pink Flamingos each morning. Over looking the pool as well, but the pool closes early due to rooms being right beside it. Every space is open air in common area and I loved the fill of this. Rooms were very clean and comfortable and you could walk very easy to downtown or the busy shopping areas. This is the last hotel on the north side and I liked the less busy area. Plenty of places to eat and you can catch "The Bus" for $2.50 that will take you any where you want to go. Hope to return to Honolulu again one day. Loved the Park Shore and would stay here again, No problems.

The room was very nice & completely adequate. Our view of Waikiki beach was great, along with a perfect view of Diamond Head. The beach was just across the street & all the "attractions" of Kalakaua Ave. at hand. We rented a vehicle & toured Oahu. My daughter & hubby also had a room here & were happy with their accomodaions as well. WHEN we retun to Oahu, we will certainly consider The Park Shore!!

Amazing helpful staff. The hotel is located right next to a starbucks as well as a tuck and bevy( amazing local baked goods and sandwich spot, with fresh smoothies). The beach view is amazing. The hotel is located right across the from the beach. And is about a 20 minute walk from all the main attractions like rock-a-hula and the Friday night fireworks at the hilton Hawaiian village. They have a pool. But no hot tub.

The recently remodeled rooms were very pleasant. The staff was nice, helpful and very accommodating. The third floor pool is nice and private. Lulu's restaurant is connected on the second floor and a great place for drinks and dining. An ABC store in the lobby allows you to get anything you might need for your room. I've stayed here a number of times and always enjoyed it.

I stayed here with my best friend, so there were just two (20 and 21 girls) on the trip. The staff were absolutely amazing. They made sure that we were OK and that we were safe. I got sick on one day and a lady on the front desk googled the nearest pharmacy, printed off a map and directions and offered to order me a taxi, she went the extra mile to ensure we were ok. They also rang another night to check that we were back from one of our activities safely. Being just 2 girls travelling alone they really made us feel safe. Everyone working there was so friendly and warming. We started on the 4th floor and the lady who cleaned our room always changed the sheets and gave us new towels and flannels. She was so friendly and loved to have a chat with us while she worked in our room. The room next to us was very noisey 2 nights in a row so we asked the front desk of they could please ask them to quiet down and front desk moved is from the 4th floor to the 16th floor which made our trip! We weren't expecting being moved up floors at all but the front desk always went the extra mile to ensure our stay was pleasant. The shuttle service they offer as well made life so much easier. I would 200% come back here because I know that the staff will look after me, the rooms are so clean and tidy. I personally think the staff make this hotel as amazing as it is! Location is also prime. I can not recommend this hotel enough! If there is availability, book here, of all the places I have stayed around the world, this hotel is the best one I have stayed at.

Located across from the beach, ocean views from our balcony. We stayed in a king room which was a good size. Good wifi. It's within walking distance of eateries, bars & shopping. The staff were all helpful and courteous.

I booked as seafront room for my wife and I at this hotel as it was a lot cheaper than other more "Well known" hotels in the area. When we went into our room (924), we found it was on the corner of the hotel and the balcony not only looked over Queen's Surf beach immediately to the front, but also Honolulu Zoo and Diamond Head to the left - absolutely amazing!!!! The room was clean and the staff very friendly. We both particularly enjoyed the free Yoga in the park provided by a lovely, very friendly instructor who dealt with all levels of ability (I had only tried it once!). We went once in the morning and again at sunset one evening which was wonderful.There is a very good store in the foyer offering really good breakfast Panini's, cakes and smoothies. There are ice machines on several floors to provide one of the essential ingredients for our pre dinner G&T's.Whilst other hotels may have "flashier" bars, reception areas etc. we were more than happy with our accommodation. It's location was perfect, being only across the road from the quieter Queen's Surf beach, Honolulu Zoo park and only a short stroll to the massive range of shops and restaurants. I think the $20/day hospitality fee is charged by all hotels and the hotel Wi-Fi was excellent. Beach towels, chairs and coffee refills were welcome benefits too.

Having gone to Waikiki every winter for many years, and staying at some of the larger properties at the south end of Waikiki, we decided to try something new, and we are very glad we did. The Park Shore Waikiki is located at the north end of the strip, in a much quieter, more pleasant location -- yet within an easy walk of everything on the strip. It's near the zoo, the aquarium, pleasant, tree-lined walks along the beach toward Diamond Head, and within 2 blocks of our favorite restaurant in Honolulu, Sansei Seafood Restaurant and Sushi Bar (located in the Marriott).The staff at the Park Shore are all exceptionally friendly and helpful, but one in particular, Ethan, made our experience at the hotel very special. The hotel is lucky to have him, as he is a terrific ambassador for the hotel.We stayed in an ocean front one-bedroom suite, which, while more expensive than the other rooms at the hotel, we thought was a very good value compared to what we've had to pay for similar rooms at the big-name hotels in the same area. The view is great, and our room was very quiet. The room was very clean and well-maintained. I should add that the housekeeping staff was very friendly and conscientious.The bed is quite comfortable. Ask for a room without a door to an adjoining room if you want total quietude.We had a great time and are looking forward to our next visit!

My family of five had two city view rooms for two nights prior to our Pride of America cruise. I thought the rooms were fine, our balcony faced another building but if we turned our heads to the left we had a view of the ocean. We actually saw our cruise ship come into port Saturday morning! Right next to the elevator on our floor(9th) was an open public balcony with stunning views of diamond head, the Honolulu zoo and the ocean. I found all the employees to be very helpful, front desk was great. I didn't see any bugs like other reviewer. As for weirdos, yes I agree but there are plenty in my hometown of New York too. It's a city on the beach people! Inside the hotel was a great restaurant, downstairs was an abc store and Starbucks!! I mean how much more awesome can you get. I picked this place without knowing the location, I was just looking for s pool near the beach, and across the street is the only sandy area beach on the strip- there is a sea wall to block the waves . Stay here!

Stayed here 4 nights before heading to Kauai. Back to Oahu I booked a different hotel. Place is not super nice, but the worse to me was the staff and management. On my last day I saw a beetle running on the corridor next to the elevators. I reported to staff at reception and they didn't seem to care. Once back it was still there, so I asked to talk to the manager. He literally said to me that it was something 'normal', he didn't care. Seriously?, normal to find a cockroach in the 6th floor corridor?Not very clean, I will certainly not recommend.Location is good for beach, but the area is full of homeless and weirdos day and night right at the frontdoor... feels unsafe

We stayed 4 nights at the Park Shore to break up our trip back to Australia. This hotel for the perfect choice for us.After check-in we were excited to see our room and were please that we were on the 17th floor. We even had a partial view which we were not expecting. The room was immaculate and the lifts were fast for our entire stay. The hotel shampoos etc. were very nice too. There was also an in-room safe which we did use for our stay.We enjoyed the complimentary juice offered in the lobby each day. We loved the system of handing in a towel card to get your beach towel. We were especially thrilled with the fact that the beach was a short walk across the road!We bought a round float from the ABC store and spent most of our time in the water floating around and it was so relaxing. We also tried out our hotel pool. The pool itself is basic but you get a fantastic view of Diamond Head and also a view of the beach. There are plenty of lounge chairs but not much shelter.I would definitely like to stay at this property in the future.

Positives - great location at end of hotel run next to the Zoo. Beach across the road with very child friendly bathing area. Easy walk into Waikiki centre with masses of shops and restaurants.
