Lu-Lu bar attached to hotel very goodtoo.Negatives - charge $20 a day for use of facitlites/towels/Wi-fi!!

I loved this hotel, I've stayed in a few different Waikiki hotels and this has been the best so far. The rooms are clean and ok, but that's not what makes this place great. The nice staff and the convenient location. I loved looking out my balcony at the view of the beach and Diamond Head. You are just steps away from the beach and the park.Room was on the small side, but it had everything you need – fridge and coffee maker with Kona coffee. Starbucks in near lobby and the ABC store next door to Starbucks is the better ABC Store.I was there primarily for work, but I did get to enjoy the Yoga in the park offered for free for those in the hotel. The yogi was friendly and it was a great class. The staff also allowed me to borrow a yoga mat for mornings I couldn't get to class. I used it in my room and my lanai was big enough to happily practice each morning.Travel was a cinch from this location and it was a lot quieter than being in the middle of Waikiki. If you're looking for simple and good this is it. Great coffee in the morning. Great towel service. Great staff. The bag hold was great along with the hospitality suite when you have a late evening flight. I worked all day and was able to head back at 5 and change and get ready for an overnight flight.

This hotel is located just across the street from Waikiki beach and a half-block from the Honolulu zoo. Lots of restaurants within easy walking distance. They have a very nice Japanese restaurant inside the restaurant but my wife and I took one look at the very high prices and decided to get sushi elsewhere...very expensive! Hotel staff are excellent and very helpful in arranging activities, taxis, restaurant reservations, etc. The hotel room was clean and functional but very outdated. Tile flooring throughout the entire room, perhaps to make it easier to clean up sand from beach goers. Price was okay but I was expecting a bit nicer room for the money.
user_name:
John V
Cedar Rapids, United States

review_body: Great location in waikiki. Everyone is so friendly except one of the travel agencies in the lobby (not Laura). We had ocean and diamond head view room, totally worth it. Had to pay hospitality fee and parking fee though, but probably the same for most of the hotels there.

The position of this hotel is ideal for getting around venues in Waikiki. We walked almost everywhere and when we couldn't walk we used the hotel shuttle. We were on the 7th floor, so no noise problems and we had a corner room looking out to the ocean and to Diamond Head. The room was clean, wi-fi worked well and beds were comfortable. We would definitely stay here again if returning to Waikiki. (And Zoo and Aquarium are over the road and very well priced entry for families.)

I have visited Hawaii about seven times now but this is the first time I have stayed at the Park Shore Hotel. It's location is excellent, at the quieter end of Waikiki and across the road from the beach. I had an ocean front room on the corner and it had outstanding views of the beach from the balcony and of diamond head from the side window. If you go with a breakfast package there is a choice of three places. - one is entirely Japanese, another is a horrible take away shop in the foyer with limited choices and terrible coffee. The best is LuLu 's which has fantastic breakfasts and beautiful views of the beach. The hotel is a bit dated and the pool area fairly bland and incredibly hot, surrounded by concerte I used the pool once but why bother with the warm ocean just across the road. My only complaint was an incident that happened very early one morning. I came down to the ground floor ready to go for a jog and tripped in a piece of plastic that was left on the floor. I came down heavily on my face and damaged my knee and bruised one eye. I was badly shaken and couldn't go for the jog so returned to my room. I had to ask them to bring some ice to put on the injuries and it seemed quite an imposition to the staff. The reception staff saw me fall! It took a few weeks to get over the injuries. I think they needed to show a little more concern.Anyway, it's s good choice in Waikiki and I may return but I have to say is missed my usual hotel - Moana Surfrider which is by far the best choice in Waikiki.

From the moment you arrive, the staff are friendly, helpful and the service exceptional. We had a slight problem with our room (I am afraid of heights and the room too high for me). They moved us immediately to a room with an amazing view on a lower level and this was done so quickly and they went out of their way to make me feel comfortable about my fears and told us "this is your holiday we want you to be happy" and we were. Exceptional service and attitude which remained throughout our whole stay.Our room faced the beach and the views were amazing especially watching the incredible sunsets from our balcony. The bed super comfortable, the bathroom clean and always fresh bath products and lots of towels. There is a coffee machine and small fridge and a kettle for tea available on request. Although some slight noise from the road, and sometimes some noise from Lulus it did not cause us any problems. There seems to be a few homeless people around at night but the area feels totally safe.The hotel is about 10-15 minutes easy walk to the center of town along the beach front and there are plenty of shops and restaurants all along the way. Close to the hotel are several ABC shops, Starbucks, bars etc. and Lulus where you can get a great breakfast or drink at night. It feels like it is close to everything but has a quieter feeling than many of the larger hotels which we wandered through during our stay.The service, the staff, the position of the hotel, the comfortable rooms and the amazing views and particularly the much more reasonable cost compared to the bigger hotels in the center of Waikki make this a fantastic place to stay. We are already planning our next visit to Honolulu and and will definitely stay here again.

This was a perfect location. Make sure to know that double beds only go up to floor 6 and get the ocean view. Staff was fantastic and so helpful. Give yourself extra time with the parking as it can take 15 minutes during peak times.We stayed in 607 and it was perfect. If you're on the lower floors, Lulu downstairs can be a little loud some nights. Also Keep your towel keys handy.
user_name:
Lmstravels2014
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I had the best room and great view....but only because of the great front desk team at the Park Shore Hotel in Honolulu. I cannot tell you how much they helped me keep my family on the same floor (young adults). I had called the toll free number months before and no results (no thanks to Natalie), but the minute I got to the hotel they were ready and WILLING to help me. Right away they made my accommodations as I wanted them, rooms with views and family all on one floor (it really took the worries away having family together). A big MAHALO to Gina and Kanai for all their kind help! David the manger was also great! Hope to see you all soon! Thanks again GIna and Kanai you are the best front desk team ever!

The hotel is right across the street from the Honolulu Zoo and the beach, so it's easy to feel like you can escape some of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. There are great views of the zoo, Kapiolani Park, Diamond Head and the ocean. We had a partial ocean view room, which was clean and bright. My only issue with the room was that the air conditioner unit was too powerful, and air seemed to keep blasting even when the thermostat was turned up.The hotel has a couple of ABC convenience stores right near the entrance, plus a Starbucks and other restaurants right nearby. We didn't have a car, so we avoided the valet parking fee of $25/day, but there is a lot that is in easy walking distance, plus there's a city bus stop right outside. There's a $20/day resort fee, which includes pool use, the use of beach towels and chairs, Wi-Fi (which worked well), etc.

I stayed here for a week and had a very comfortable stay. The hotel is at the quieter end of Kalakaua Avenue, the main drag through Waikiki. It is on the crossroads of Kalakaua Avenue and Kapahula Avenue, has good views of Diamond Head, is opposite Honolulu Zoo and across the road from Kuhio Beach. The hotel provides beach towels and beach chairs free of charge but I was warned not to lose my room card as it incurred a fee of $20. I paid extra for a room overlooking the ocean (an Ocean Front room, not an Ocean View room, which has a side window overlooking the ocean and a balcony overlooking the road) and I thought it was worth the extra. My deal included breakfast for which you're given vouchers for the hotel restaurants - a Japanese restaurant, a 'picnic' cafe (Tucker and Bevvy), and Lulu's, which is an American style bar/restaurant with a young, lively beach vibe. The vouchers give strict set meals and I was slightly disappointed not to be able to choose from a regular buffet style breakfast. The room was large, with a decent size balcony, good air conditioning and a coffee maker (though I had to ask for a kettle and tea bags) but this is not a luxury hotel. The room furnishings and bedding were only adequate, with the bare minimum of basic toiletries (soap, shower gel - not replaced, shampoo and conditioner) provided so don't expect luxuries like robes or slippers. The pool was quite small but in April it wasn't crowded and I easily found a sun bed and sun shade there. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and I enjoyed my stay here.

If you are traveling with small children and don't want to spend too much, this is a great hotel. The lobby and building are a bit dated, but the rooms are very clean. The hotel has towel service for the beach as well as the pool and they have 3 restaurants in the hotel. You can have breakfast on the second floor restaurant. They serve good pancakes, waffles, eggs... Dinner at the Japanese restaurant that is delicious (if you are a sushi lover); The beach across the street is young child friendly. They've made a natural pool so there are barely any waves and the water is clear for little ones to enjoy.

Was a bit worried before we got to this hotel that it would be a bit away from everything but once we arrived I was happy with the location - it's right across the road from the beach and the zoo and great views of Diamond Head. It's got one of the busiest bar/restaurants in Waikiki attached to it, who do great drinks and food!! They supply beach chairs and towels. Staff all really friendly and helpful! Rooms aren't huge but enough room for two and clean! Every Wednesday the manager hosts cocktails at the pool which was nice - and tasty! Not one of the flashiest resorts but I think we got value for money and good location away from the busiest part of town. A bit of noise at night from traffic and people but not too bad.....I would recommend to all.

We stayed here from the 12 to 15 April - Family of 4 - two teenagers. We stayed in the Pool side rooms on Level 3. For a family this was great. Pool generally empty most of the time and after sunset gets closed off except to those on Level 3 - so you have the pool and the great view over the beach all to yourself. Also no traffic noise unlike ones higher up.The other great thing about Level 3 is that there is a room just off the poolside with a table chairs and micro- wave - so great place to make your own breakfast - if you are like us and just want cereal. toast and tea/coffee. Rooms are probably a bit tired and on the small side - but again great value. This end of the beach we think is nicer - a bit quieter. overlooks teh beach and zoo and across to Diamond Head. Other recommendation: Breakfast is Tucker and Bevvy's - about 1km up Kapahulu Street - service and food and vakue is outstanding - seems to be local knowledge as nothing in the guide books about this place! Lunch/Dinner - if yiu are hanging out for some great wholesome natural (ie read low sugar meals) try Ruffage - Corner of Kuhio and Uluinu (the acia berry sorbet with banana and berrys is to die for - we went there everynight for dessert!!On our way back we stayed at the Aqua Oasis Hotel - more modern and larger rooms (pool is tiny) but in our view not as good as Park Shore for value and hanging around.

Thank you again Jara!! We will definitely contact you again when we are planning our holidays. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Everybody deserves a big thank you! The staff is so friendly. The hotel is clean. The pool deck and pool are well maintained.Not a fan of the $20.00 a day hospitality fee though.

Room was clean and nice, but on check out was charged hospitality fee plus tax.$20.00Fee was for basic TV in room a pool towel and coffee in your room which should have been complimentary. A bit disappointing !Yes and it is $20.00 a day so figure it into your cost!Sad

I've stayed here before, and was again mostly happy with my experience.Pros: Great location at the end of Waikiki beach, meaning that you can walk across the street to be on the beach, walk right and be in the middle of Waikiki or walk left to escape Waikiki and visit parks, the zoo and the Waikiki aquarium.Great views in Ocean Front roomsAttached Lulu's restaurant is great for breakfastComfortable bed and roomGreat shower headCons:Upkeep and maintenance seem lacking. Hotel was completely refurbished a couple years ago, but they aren't doing enough to keep it looking new.Housekeeping did not clean my room one day and was late on other days. They don't seem to have a sufficient housekeeping staff.$25 daily parking charge$20 daily "resort" chargeCleanliness was acceptable, but not spotlessStreet people (homeless) congregate in front of Starbucks connected to hotel and they setup hammocks and makeshift camps across the street from the hotel. To be fair, the homeless people and camps are all over Waikiki and Honolulu and is outside the hotel's control

It was nice to stay, close to beach and free toul. Small room and no bath, but clean and nice service괜찮았습니다 ㅎㅎ 허니문인데 방 업글을 기대했지만 않됬네요 ㅠ 그래도 만족합니다~ 파셜 오션 뷰였는데 괜찮았어요. 해변용 프리 타월 계속 바꿔줘서 잘 썼어요욕조가 없고 방은 조금 작은편 인듯 합니다

Once again, I had a wonderful time at my stay at Park Shore. This was the fourth year in a row I've stayed here and it's always perfect. The pool deck is the best! It's in a great location with a nice view of Diamond Head and the ocean. I will continue to stay here until someone tells me otherwise!

Our anniversary trip to Hawaii started here on a great note! This hotel does so much right! It's not a luxury or fancy hotel-but they pack a lot of goodness in! Rooms are not huge, but are laid out well to maximize space. Things we liked: it was quiet, ample drawer and closet space (and we always overpack), they have shower gel AND bar soap, super comfy bed, A/C that works well and maintains a constant temperature, pillows were not too "poofy"-they were sort of flat and sort of firm - just like we like them, coffee, juice, and water in lobby. Every staff person we met was friendly! Anytime I asked a question or needed something, they were helpful and pleasant.Location is wonderful-our partial ocean view was actually better out of our window than our balcony - we had a corner room. We had no car - which really is the way to go if you can do it. So many public transportation options - getting around Honolulu is easy!Loved Lulu's upstairs - we ate there twice in four days. All in all, we were very happy with this choice!

PROS: Great location, just have to cross the street to reach beautiful Waikiki Beach. Area has loads of shops & restaurants. Easy access to everything. Clean room with a comfy bed, mini fridge, safe, TV & small balcony. Friendly & helpful staff on front desk & valet.Beach towels & chairs provided. Pool has gorgeous views of the beach & Diamond Head. CONS: $20 a day charge for things like exercise classes, juice in lobby, wifi, beach towels etc is expensive & a bit of a surprise on checkout. $25 daily parking charge also pricey.Air con is a little noisy but didn't bother us. Still rated this hotel as excellent because the pros far outweigh the cons. We stayed here 4 years ago & feel the hotel has improved. We had a wonderful stay & would stay here again.

My husband and I stayed at the park shore for two nights on 8-10 April 2016 whilst on holidays from Australia. We were super happy with the location of the hotel, being directly across the road from the beach and towards the end of the insanely busy Waikiki strip, so it was fairly quiet at night with limited noise. The staff were super friendly and super efficient, the room was clean and tidy and bed comfy. Directly downstairs was a little healthy take away store called Tucker and Bevy, we got smoothies for brekky with delicious chicken and salad lunches. Also the park shore offers free kona coffee and juices in the lobby. The only negative was the extra fees that include workout sessions in the park which weren't offered over the weekend we were there, or any weekend for that matter. Being military though we received a $5 discount per day on valet so we weren't too bothered. Overall, we were happy with the hotel and would happily stay here again!

We had the opportunity to stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. The staff is friendly and the room was nice (a little small with luggage). We had a pool side room which was super. LOCATION was great, beach across the street and zoo and aquarium a short walk. Enjoyed Lulu's so much for breakfast returned for happy hour! Overall happy with our time at the Park Shore.

Hotel is at the end of the very busy wakiki strip so you get hardly any noise at night but you are only minutes from all the other bars restaurants that Honolulu has to offer also the hotel itself has a great little bar where you can eat from early till late staff are really helpful and hotel light and welcoming rooms spotless. And pool area also good with amazing views of the ocean we have stayed here twice and would stay there again

Stayed here for 9 Nights in March, and got a Ocean front room on 12th floor. What a view! The rooms are spacious and beds are good. There is a refrigerator in the room, which is perfect, as you can stock up water, soda, beer and wine in the nearby ABC store. Friendly staff, shuttlebus to Ala Moana shopping center every 30 minuttes, Lulu's on the 1th floor with party, food and drinks. Very close to the Beach and Honolulu Zoo. Will come back again.

Upgrading to a 'room with an ocean view' was extremely important for our stay to be memorable. Comfortable room, very helpful staff and excellent amenities. Do not settle for a small room with no view just to save some dollars.

We had a great experience at Park Shore. First of all we got a special rate from booking directly from their website. When we arrived we asked about upgrading to a ocean front, not only did we get it, there was no extra charge! The beds were very comfortable, there was a nice size lanai overlooking the pool and looking out on the beach. Lulu's is a great restaurant that we discovered last year attached to the hotel. We ate most days there, and when we didn't we were mostly disappointed. The only 2 things that were disappointing were the slow and difficult WiFi, you could pay more for better WiFi, and the fact that there is no guest laundry. We packed very light knowing that we did not need much, but that meant that we had to wash.

This hotel has the direct walk to a private beach and peaceful and great seating to have some shade and peace of mind....the staff is very attentive and greets you with a refreshing drink.....the room I have is oceanfront of course you have also the view of Diamond head Mountain....did I say "you also have!!!" What a great treat for the rigjt price....and it's all about location! location! location! They have a great place in the hotel that has great food and bar! And just a walk away from EVERYTHING!!!! I'm from NYC so I know about pricey places but Park Shore Hotel is affordable and convenient and delightful!!! I am happy to be here to celebrate my brother's Hawaii-50 theme and I'm 5 years younger so I will be back for my 50 and fabulous Hawaii trip....if willing....best recommended stay...but know the area it is a costly drive in a cab....love it.....Aloha

Stayed here from 19th-26th March on our first visit to Hawaii.On check in we were pleasantly surprised to discover that we had been upgraded to a ocean view room. The room was spacious with a gorgeous view. The beach nearby had lovely calm water as it is sheltered by a sea wall. Whilst not in the heart of Waikiki, the location is still excellent for getting out and about. We even walked to Diamond head one day from the hotel.We hope to be back soon!

Enjoyed our 7 night stay in November last year.Had a room on the 12th floor, right on the corner over looking the beach. Very conveniently located, everything you need is at your fingertips.Most of the staff were friendly and helpful. Unfortunately I did encounter one or two who were not so nice and to be honest rude! Special mention to the concierge in the foyer who helped me book a private tour, which was one of the highlights of our stay!I also liked the fact the hotel provide fresh cordial and cold water in the foyer for those who have been walking and swimming a lot it's great! Will return!

My wife and I spent one night at the Park Shore in Waikiki for our last night on Oahu. The hotel is beautiful and perfectly located. The room was very nice too as we opted for the partial ocean view and had a nice view of the ocean and Diamond Head.While we really liked the location, there were a few aspects we didn't like. On top of the room charges, you have to pay for parking and for a "convenience" fee. This was an additional $47. For this price you have someone valet you car and bring your suitcases up to your room. This sounds nice, but this is not what we are used to and all of this became more of a nuisance than anything else.As soon as we arrived, we were approached by 2 valet members wanting to help with our luggage and take the car away. After having spent a few days on the road, our car was a mess with stuff all over. We told them we needed some time to get organized, but they were breathing down our necks the whole time. So, we eventually piled everything on the luggage cart, hoping nothing was going to fall off from it. After checking in, we were ready to bring the cart upstairs ourselves, but were told it would be brought for us.We went up to our room to find out the maid was in the middle of cleaning it. She was very surprised we had been given this room since obviously it wasn't ready... She was very apologetic and worked as fast as possible. In order to stay out of her way, we first waited in the hallway. After 10 minutes or so, she asked if we wanted to go wait on the balcony as it was much nicer there. That's when we found out about the nice view! It made waiting for her to be done much more pleasant.About 20 minutes later all together, our room was ready. But in the meantime, no luggage...We had gone on a snorkeling tour earlier in the day, so we were in our swimming gear and really wanted to get into fresh clothes, but we couldn't... Waited a few more minutes, my wife called the lobby. They said the luggage was getting loaded onto a cart and brought up to us. She indicated that we had already loaded everything on a cart, so there was something goofy. We waited a little longer and eventually it all showed up. In the meantime it had been delivered to the wrong room, and had to be reloaded and brought to us. Surprisingly, nothing had been lost.So, all together, we liked the hotel for the location and the quality of the accommodation, but were disappointed with the level of service given that we had to pay extra for all of it, especially since we only spent one night, had arrived late in the afternoon, left early in the morning and couldn't use any of the services covered by the convenience fee, such as the pool, yoga, etc...

We stayed three nights at this hotel in February, 2016, and thought it was a great location, with a very helpful staff. Location was at the end of the beach strip and away from the crowds but still had easy access to attractions and restaurants. Our 7th floor corner room had wonderful views of both the beach and Diamond Head. Beach chair and towel service was extremely nice. No hesitation in giving this great hotel a very strong recommendation. Comfortable and authentic; not at all snobby or stuffy, but beautiful sparkling clean rooms and excellent services. Staff was very helpful in recommending local restaurants and things to do.

They have a mandatory resort fee $20/ day AND a valet fee $25/day! I don't see how the the resort fee doesn't include valet service. Average hotel. Too noisy at Waikiki beach area. Too crowded/ Difficult to get in and out of hotel- streets too crowded.

We stayed at the Park Shore 6 years ago with friends and had one of the worst experiences with a hotel in all of our travels. So why come back? Location. Add to that a TON of research and reading about the renovations, combined with of great reviews, we decided to come back and give it a try again. I am SO glad we did. This is NOT the same Park Shore from 6 years ago - this hotel has been completely redone, the staff is incredible , and the location is still the best. We looked at other hotels "on the water" but nothing really beats the convenience of Park Shore. Lulu's is attached to the hotel for an easy breakfast, lunch, or dinner option, the beach is across the street, and if you venture up to the 18th floor in the early morning, you get the most spectacular view of Diamond Head. I was worried due to our previous stay, but I am glad we took a chance to stay here again, it was worth it.

A few metres to Waikiki Beach... The end that's not overcrowded and has a shallow area for families with kids, or non-swimmers. Few minutes walk to bus to Diamond Head Crater, and trolley to other areas of Honolulu. Beach towel service is great and handy too. Free wifi. Hospitality room was great to freshen up and change until our room was ready. Expedia local expert in lobby was a lifesavers booking our tours and car rental for Kauai before we left. A bit further from the shops like Macy's and Cheesecake Factory, but always a pleasant walk on the strip. Worth it, a nice and pleasant stay.

My husband and I just returned from our visit to Waikiki. Our stay at Park Shore was perfect in every way. The lobby was clean and inviting and always had ice water and POG (pineapple, orange, guava) ready for thirsty visitors. The front desk and valet employees were always pleasant and ready to answer questions and help in any way. There was a nice girl, Laura, at the Expedia desk ready to help with any reservations needed for rental cars, buses, excursions, etc. Our room was cleaned and bed made every day. The coffee in the room was really good and there was also coffee every morning in the lobby. There is a Starbuck's and ABC store attached to the building as well as Lulu's, a great bar and grill that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Open from 7am-2am...you can enter Lulu's right through the 2nd floor of the hotel as well as the 2 street entrances. The pool area was clean and had a great view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. If you're looking for a nice, clean hotel at the quieter and less busy end of Waikiki, this is your place. For those that don't rent a car, the bus stops right out front...and if you use google maps for your destination, the routes and times of buses come up for you. The bus is only $2.50 and will take you almost anywhere of interest. Cheap and easy way to sight-see. We rented a car for 6 days of our stay and there is a $25 per day parking fee here at the hotel with valet parking services. We will definitely be back to visit and will stay here again. (As a nurse, in the service industry, I realize you can't please all the people all the time and that there will always be complainers. Some people are just miserable and impossible to please, so please don't take it to heart because I know how hard all of you work!) btw most reviews I read were excellent before I even booked this hotel. Just had to say this because I can't understand you guys having ANY bad reviews at all!

The hotel is just a street crossing of the main beachfront highway away from the sands of Waikiki Beach, right next to the zoo. Pros: Staff is great, coffee and punch available in nice big lobby much of the day, valet parking is convenient and available, beach literally steps away across the street, this is a very (relatively speaking) affordable option for beach-sited Waikiki hotel lodging. It is also pretty accessible to H1, the main interstate route into and out of downtown.Cons: Really have to think hard about this but it is not centrally located as far as "central" Waikiki (you'll pay more in every way to be there), so you may have some walking or traveling to do to access destinations in the center or the far side of Waikiki. Still even here, you have probably nearly a dozen eating options within two blocks, at least twice that many options within 4-5 blocks. Many of the upscale hotels have their own complexes with multiple great restaurants within and those might be a few blocks further away.Really, I have no complaints, there's no denying that Honolulu is an expensive destination. Great stay!

This was our second stay at the Park Shore and once again, it did not disappoint. We got an upgrade to a room with a small kitchen and a pull out bed for our daughter with a great view of the beach and Diamond Head. The location offers great unobstructed views of both. All staff were great to deal with and housekeeping even cleaned our dirty dishes which we were not expecting. There are great restaurants nearby and the city bus stops right outside the door. The hotel chain even offers a regular shuttle to the mall. Internet was quick and reliable, there is coffee, juice and water in the lobby, as well as easy access to a tour guide, surf shop and the ABC store. Will definitely stay here again.

Stayed there with Wife and kids.Had 2 adjoining rooms.Rooms were comfortable and clean.Didn't stay too much inside as we were either at the beach or shopping.Location was excellent, right on the beach!Nice service!

We booked this hotel though our travel agent as this was for our honeymoon. It was the middle priced option that we were recommended so were hoping for something special. We were a little disappointed that as we had expressed this was our honeymoon there was nothing 'over and above' that was made to make this extra special (as we were waiting behind 2 separate parties both of which received upgrades - one who was a lone traveller). That being said the hotel itself was pretty reasonable and we had an enjoyable stay.There is complimentary coffee served in the lobby in the morning and juice throughout the day which was great.Location is very handy which was just off the beach.Zoo across the road and Aquarium down the road. They apparently have a free shuttle to one of the shopping plazas which we found out about later on but there is a whole tv channel for whats on offer and to do in the area.Lulu's bar/restaurant next door was also very good and we visited a few times for happy hour for a few drinks watching the senery.Diamond Head summit is also very close.Overall - staff nice and friendly & good location in Waikiki (easy walk to shops along beachside)

First of all I want to say that the front desk and housekeeping staff at this hotel are amazing. They made me feel welcome, they were interested in how my day and hotel experience was ALL THE TIME, not just at checkin and checkout. People remembered my name, what I did that day, etc. It was really great. I got an oceanfront corner room which was pretty much heaven on earth. The ocean view rooms had great views too. The rooms are very quiet. There were people in the room above me and in the 7 nights I stayed there I could barely hear anything ever (once in a while some footsteps but that's it!). The rooms are not large but they are perfect for me. The coffee in the room was really good! They have beach chairs and towels which made my beach time even better. The only thing I would say could be improved was some of the valet parking staff did not share the same Aloha spirit as the rest of the crew. And sometimes it took a while to get the car. Overall this was a great place to stay and I will come back again and again. Call the hotel directly for room rates - you'll get a better deal!

We stayed at this hotel for eight nights. Very nice, but wish we would've booked a Suite. Bed was very comfortable, nice linens and pillows. No problem with noise. Very nice staff, professional, well groomed and polite. The hotel is close to everything you could possibly want to do. Beach is right across the street, many restaurants very close by. Public transportation at your front door. Excellent concierge. Cleaning of the room....excellent. All in all, if you want a decently priced hotel in a little bit quieter area of Waikiki, this is the place. We were very pleased with our accommodations.

I let my husband pick this hotel, but was disappointed to find such a teeny (maybe 11'x11') dark "standard" room. Pictures make the room seem bigger than it actually is. Dark carpet. Curtains wrinkled. Food from previous room occupants on the floor. Lamps from the 1960s (literally, not a retro redo).I was also disappointed to learn of a $20 resport fee. Huh? Hotels charge "resort" fees now? It supposedly covers an 8 am yoga class and coffee. No, really. Then, $25 parking. The Hyatt Place next door has 1) free breakfast, 2) no resort fee, and 3) $20 parklng. Walking around the lively area filled with Westins, Holiday Inns, and Hiltons only magifies the fact that chain hotels really are better bargains sometimes (the Hyatt Place is the same price when you consider the additional costs). What a mistake I made here.There are definitely better options in this area. This budget hotel's got nothing on their big boys competitors. Just compare lobbies (this one smells of fish. I was almost run over one of the multiple cars parking on the sidewalk, which sometimes blocks the sidewalk and the front door entry). Or customer service (compared to the one here, e.g. very basic, generally unhelpful). For instance, I needed a spoon. I was told "we don't have a kitchen, so we don't have a spoon." Really?I called ahead to reserve an ocean view room and was told I'd have to pay an additional $50 per night. The "standard" room I paid for apparently means staring at a wall of windows in an adjoining building. When I checked in, I again asked if I could be upgraded if an ocean view room remained vacant (without paying extra). The front desk clerk laughed at me. Literally!The TV didn't work the first night. After three visits from maintenance (after 9pm), they said they had do continue their work during the next day. No offer to change rooms. No offer to waive/discount the "resort fee" for a TV that doesn't work. Nothing. nada.Basic, boring pool without any services not unlike the one in a friend's backyard (no, wait. She offers services).Basic means different things to different people. In this case, it verges on backpacker rustic. Even there, a cheaper and nicer hostel option is right behind us. I definitely felt like I was roughing it here...and I'm no delicate daisy.

The Park Shore Waikiki is at the southern end of Kalakaua Avenue which we found to be a great location to be away from the "rat race" of Waikiki. It's only a few minutes further walk up the road but still across the road from the beach. We had a great ocean view room on the 17th floor with great views of Diamond Head. We regularly sat on the balcony both day and night looking out at the beach and ocean as well as the Honolulu Zoo. We could see the flamingos and in the distance elephants. When our flight home was "delayed" (more like cancelled - that's another story) they gave us an excellent rate for a further nights accommodation in the same room. I was expecting to have to move rooms or even worse find accommodation somewhere else, but thankfully we didn't. The rooms are clean with modern fittings. The only complaint I have was as it was very windy during our stay, the howling wind up the hallway was constantly rattling our door and whistling into our room. This was easily fixed by shoving a folded-up piece of paper into the door to stop the movement. Free Wi-Fi was great to be able to access although it was slow at times, but hey, it was free, so can't complain too much. You can pay for faster Wi-Fi but if all you want it for is to check Facebook or email, its fine. All interactions with hotel staff were friendly and efficient. There is an ABC store on both sides of the hotel making it easy to grab a drink, snacks or some souvenirs. Starbucks is also just outside the hotel as well as Tucker & Bevvy who sell sandwiches etc, great if you want to take your lunch somewhere. The free shuttle bus to Ala Moana shopping centre is an excellent way to get to this fantastic shopping centre. It comes past approximately every 30 minutes, with friendly, helpful drivers to get you there and back. There is a bus stop out front with a couple of different routes stopping there. We throughly enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!!

We recently stayed here and had a room with a great view. The room itself is maybe a 3 star but having that great view of the beach and Diamond Head added the extra star. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed comfy. Not much else to say about the room, standard fare but as we noted, it was the view that put it as a higher rated room. As for price/cost, one of the better deals in town. Anything this close to the beach would have cost us substantially more. A little off the beaten path as it lay near the end of the strip but not so much as to make it inconvenient. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and they have a guest room where we were able to change and shower before our late departure flight, very convenient. This will be our main stop when we return.

Wpnderful location and friendly staff made for a great stay at this hotel! The restaurants on and around the property were great and (even though most hotels on Waikiki have them) the ABC store in the lobby was very convenient. Fresh POG juice every morning, and a fantastic view from the balconies and pool.

Great visit! Nice & Friendly staff. Good prices. The zoo & the beach are literally across the street. Is around 15-20 minutes to walk to the shopping centers. Will definitely come again when my kids get older since they are 1 & 2 years. Over all I'll give it a 10

Our room was modern, comfortable, and quiet. Registration staff were friendly and efficient. The hotel is not in the center of the Waikiki area, but it was easy to walk along the street or trail to many shops and restaurants. We did not have an ocean view from our room, but we could see the ocean and mountains from the area near the elevators. A small pier, beach, Honolulu zoo, and bus stops are nearby. Diamond Head looms in front as you leave the hotel. A deli, convenience store, and Japanese restaurant are included among the shops in the lobby. We stayed 3 nights. This hotel met our needs nicely. We did not have a car so didn't pay for parking. They do charge $20/night "hospitality" fee for services we did not use.

REASON WHY NOT 5 STARS: Upon arrival I was disappointed by the room size as it was very small, in the website I see they have larger rooms but ours with one bed was not, we were there for 4 nights, the air conditioner temperature was set on automatic at 75 degrees and it never, not once went off even though it was cool outside at night, also the air conditioner fan is quite loud, we wanted to sleep with the door open listening to the ocean sounds however cannot be possible due to the street noise as hotel is located corner of two busy streets and not on the ocean but across the street, I knew this but was not aware of all the street noise :( WHAT IS FABULOUS ABOUT IT: The staff is amazing, best customer service ever, our room views were the best in Waikiki, we were lucky to have the corner room 1807 which is on the highest 18 floor, one window overlooks the ocean, the other Diamond head, the balcony is great. They provide chairs and umbrellas for the beach and you must eat at Lulus their second floor restaurant, the food is deeelicious, overall great little hotel if you do not mind the things I mentioned. Thank you to all the great staff and fabulous management.

We were very happy we picked Park Shore for our honeymoon. We stayed in an Ocean View room on the 6th floor and had uninterrupted views of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach across the road. We loved the location, it wasn't too far to walk to anywhere in Waikiki and wasn't as busy as the more popular parts of Waikiki. Also right next to Lulu's bar & restaurant (happy hour 3 till 5) for great food, beer and cocktails. The rooms were very clean and well serviced, no complaints at all.We saw whales from our balcony almost every afternoon while having sunset drinks, I'm glad I took my binoculars!The staff were great, they organised shuttles for us for the airport and Pearl Harbour. We also took advantage of the free shuttle that takes you to the Ala Moana shopping centre as well as a few stops along the way.I'm sure the pool was great, but we swam at the beach every day, making use of the free beach chairs available from reception.Great value hotel, would definitely recommend.

Stayed 3 nights here in a 2 double bed room. The room & bathroom were on the smaller side (we had 3 of us in the room). It was clean. Our room faced the ocean and the patio was a great place to be at any time. If you prop open the main door and open the patio door you will get a great breeze thru the room.The hotel offers guests beach towels and chairs, just ask. Valet parking only.Most, but not all, of the hotel staff were pleasant. The hotel is just across the street from the beach and the zoo. We did not try the hotel restaurant. We went to Lulu's just next door. Which was very good.

The place is at the far end of Waikiki beach but just a few steps away from the Honolulu Zoo. I think its nice because your just outside of the busiest parts of the beach. I also liked there beach towel program just trade your card in for a towel and get it back when you return the towel.

From the moment we arrived this hotel was awesome ! The warm Aloha from Desiree, the gorgeous views and it's proximity to everything. Abc store and Starbucks steps away.Wakiki beach across the street. The rooms were lovely and very clean .I wouldn't stay anywhere else on our stays in Oahu. Loved it!

I loved this hotel because it's the last on the "strip," and we had a beautiful open view of both Diamond Head & the ocean, which was perfect to wake up to each morning. The location is also great for walking anywhere in Waikiki, and there's a bus stop right by the hotel for easy exploring of the rest of Oahu. The staff were wonderful. We also stayed at a "fancy" resort in Kauai during our vacation, and while we loved both Oahu and Kauai, we much preferred this hotel in Waikiki to the resort because of both its lovely view and great location for easily getting out and exploring.

Service was excellent, Staff were very professional,responsive, personable and friendly. We were upgraded to a room with a partial view of the ocean without asking and with no additional expense. Rooms were nice but basic and very very tiny. Location was very very noisy being so close to the beach but then the proximity to the each was also an advantage so, overall, the hotel met our needs well and I would highly recommend the Park Shore hotel for the value and cost.

I only have good things to say about Parkshore hotel in Waikiki. It's located on the quieter side of waikiki right next to the zoo and to the beach. I booked a standard deluxe room and for the first 3 nights we were lucky to get a room with part view of the ocean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They kept our luggage for us when we went to Maui for 3 nights. Upon our return we had a couple or bad lucks such as our flight being cancelled we had to book an extra night and the staff did everything they could to make it better. We received complimentary chocolate and an upgrade to a partial view of the ocean although we paid for a standard room. The staff really did their best to go above and beyond expectations. The hotel is very clean and again I think it's situated at the best of Waikiki away from the noise and yet right next to the beach.Cons: the resort fees of $20 per night... And parking at $25 per night plus taxes etc. Bottom line I would definitely stay there again n would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Waikiki.

Not the biggest or fanciest hotel in Waikiki, but may be one of the better bargains. It is located right on the the beach and has a nice pool on the the third floor. Be careful of the add-ons however. Parking is an extra $26/day and they charge $20/day for other "service" like yoga classes, whether you use them or nor

Who? An Australian couple in our late-20s on holidays. Not party people, more family/nature orientatedLooking for? Comfortable accommodation, not too expensive, convenient location Where? Boy, I did not know how bad Honolulu traffic was, if you are a Sydney-sider it is comparable or perhaps even worse in peak hour. It took us about an hour to get from the international airport to Park Shore and cost ~AUD$50 with appropriate tipping. It took us about the same time back to the airport to leave, unfortunately also in peak hour. However on our way back we organised a shuttle through the hotel which only costs US$14 per person. If I did it again, I would look to see if the hotel could organise the same shuttle to take you into town from the airport on the first day. The shuttle only had to make 2 very close-by stops for another 3 passengers and off it went, it was quite comfortable and spacious in the van.I'm really happy I chose to stay in this area. Its on the quieter side of the Waikiki strip - less people and in my opinion, better beach with a nice park and closer to the well rated restaurants.We swam in the beach across the road, next to the pier which had great fish as close as 1m from the shore, and it was attached to a nice shady park with facilities. I walked the whole length of Waikiki (takes about 30mins) and shade is hard to come by! The crowds also got thicker and thicker as you approached the other end where all the big hotel resorts were. In terms of food, we had great burgers just a few doors down at Teddy's Bigger Burgers, and nice pizza at an Italian restaurant 2 blocks away. There is an ABC store downstairs and a Starbucks as well.The Room. I booked a twin room with no view at about US$260, which was in our price range. The room was very comfortable - the pillows were not too firm, the shower pressure was good with nice hot water and it was quiet for good sleep. I did not miss the view at all as the hotel was situated in such a good position you would just walk out for a swim anyway and come back to your room to rest. If you can afford the ocean view rooms I'm sure it would be beautiful though. The room was clean with modern decor. In terms of facilities - complimentary bath products, free WIFI which worked well, phone, safe, mini fridge, tea and coffee facilities.Bottom line: Reasonably priced comfortable accommodation, perfect location for us (loved loved that it was the quieter side), would stay again.

The location is at the end of all the hotels, it is near the Honolulu zoo. Noisy at night with club music, traffic outside and room doors. Rooms were comfortable, view was spectacular, but room keys never worked. Park Shore made my dad wait until 10pm for their maintenance to break the door lock so he could get in. Front desk pretended they knew nothing about the non working keys. Activity concierge was able to find us tours the day before, which were awesome. No good reasonably priced restaurant, just an expensive Japanese restaurant in the lobby. $20 resort fee. Might return, most likely not.

Everyone here was very helpful and friendly. Made our first night in Honolulu unforgettable. Place was clean. Pool wasn't open very late so that was disappointing and no hot tub. But you couldn't beat the ocean view!I would definitely recommend this hotel.

This is the hotel with the best location in waikiki beach. Michelle at the front desk is supernice! There's a travelagent expedia in the same building and also a surf school. Great location with a beautiful view over the beach and Diamond head. Best beachstrip located 1 min. walk from the hotel.Good foodplace Lulu's located next door. Starbucks close by. Fresh rooms with a big balcony! Good wi-fi.We highly recommend this hotel, would def. stay here again!

The staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a great ocean view. Room while not plush was very comfortable. Location very good with. One direction toward the other hotels and the other direction toward the park and Diamondhead so good for taking a long walk. Full menu breakfast available on open air overlooking beach.

My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. The staff were very friendly and the check-in process was very easy.We booked an ocean view room and the view was very beautiful and the room was nice and big.There's one Japanese restaurant inside the hotel and the price is not bad compared to other restaurants around the area.The hotel is on the main road and is across the road from the beach and a 10 minute walk from the main area, such as The Cheesecake Factory.On the second day I woke up with bites on my arms, at first we thought it was something I ate but the next day my partner woke up with the same rashes and mine had gone worse.Thinking that it was bed bugs, we informed the reception and they had moved us to another room. Although it was still an ocean front room, it was not facing the ocean and we thought that our previous room was slightly bigger (maybe because the previous room was more open)The hotel took photos of our rashes and told us that it was the first time that this had happened. The manager came and spoke to us (which I thought was very professional) and he told us that they have tried to check for bed bugs but couldn't find any traces so they have called professional pest control people to have a look at it (told us that they'll let us know about the report)He also agreed to provide laundry service for us (the hotel normally doesn't provide this) and offered to take us to see the local GP.We decided to see our local GP back at home as we were leaving back to Sydney in couple of days anyway (when we went to our GP he told us it's bed bugs and that bed bugs are usually hard to see in naked eye)I give this hotel 4 stars for trying to go extra mile for their guests, however, we did not receive the report and at the end of the day we still woke up with those bites!

This hotel is at the far end of Waikiki, therefore, it is a bit quieter. Rooms have balconies - we were on the 4th floor (out of 18) and were upgraded to an ocean view room. We overlooked the pool (on the 3rd floor) and the beach/ocean. Sunsets are GORGEOUS from the balcony. There were other people in the rooms next to us and above us, but we didn't hear them. Two double beds in the roon, and a refrigerator - what more do you need? Front desk desk was very helpful - from Jarra at check-in, to Ethan who answered all my questions and dealt with my requests to Joey the bellman. Beautiful hotel - can't wait to return!!!

A really genuinely friendly place with a great location at the quite end of Waikiki near Kapiolani Park and Diamond Head. The beach here is much better than at the swankier Honolulu end of Waikiki.If you want even quieter beaches try the Makalei and Leahi beach parks only 15 minutes walk along Diamond Head road.

This hotel is the last hotel on the Waikiki main drag. Transportation to other locations are easy. Lots of stores and restaurants nearby. The beach is across the street. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a room with an ocean view. The free sand chairs aren't the best, but you can get them at the desk. While the rooms aren't very large, they were great for the price. Great shower.

Nice hotel in great position .. Pool was lovely with great views of the beach , diamond head other side . Staff very nice and helpful . Lobby area great for sitting drinking free coffee . Had a standard room which was fine just a bit noisy from outside noise , air conditioners or something from neighboring building , also a bit smelly outside so couldn't leave door open .. Otherwise a great holiday will save and get an ocean view next time ..

If you want easy quick access to beach without having to pay a fortune, this is the hotel for you. We love Park Shore and this is our 4th stay. They recently renovated which makes it even nicer. Great customer service, small fridge, coffee maker and safe in each room. Offer beach towels and chairs. Literally out front door and about 20 steps to Starbucks and then about 20 steps to crosswalk to be on beach. We don't rent a car when we come as everything is in walking distance. You can do car rental by the day if you want to go out to Hahnama Bay or to North Ahore.

Excellent location and very helpful staff at reception. Our ocean view room a bit on the small side with the bathroom being especially so and looking back it wasn't worth the extra for that category of room. We went out on the balcony once to look at the beach, Diamond Head and the swimming pool below and that was it. Useful Starbucks next door which opened at 0430 so really handy for an early morning journey to the airport. However what really spoilt it for us was Lulu's restaurant. Coming from within the hotel you had to walk all the way to the far side where the receptionist took bookings. It felt as though it didn't belong to the hotel at all and was just there to attract people from off the street. Limited choice on the menu compared with most of the other hotels on our seven week RTW trip.Bottom line - would we stay here again - probably not.

Pretty much on the beach like all major Waikiki hotels, and the beach was not congested at that location. $25 per day for round the clock access valet parking is fair and convenient, although the tiny sidewalk-driveway can be restricting when more than 2 cars need access. Renovated bathrooms and showers were great and modern. Internet access was fast and flawless. I would definitely stay again.

If you decide to stay in Waikiki then this hotel is not a bad choice. It's not special but for the price (compared to other Waikiki hotels) we thought it was okay. We liked the location- at the very end of Waikiki Beach main drag. So with our rental car, I assume we avoided some congestion leaving the hotel to explore Honolulu. We hopefully avoided some noise from being more central on the drag. That being said... We did find it fairly noisy. Through the nite we could hear traffic and the odd rowdy group of people. Definitely woke up several times throughout nite. Also when we drove back into Waikiki from exploring the island, we had to fight traffic to get to hotel. There wasn't a direct route that would avoid some of the congestion we were hoping to avoid. One thing that surprised me was heavy police presence in area. I am not sure if that made me feel safer (wow look at all the police, I am so safe!!) or less safe (wow why are there so many police officers around all the time?!). Waikiki Beach is very busy and crowded. All the hotels on the drag/ strip are high rise buildings crowded together, packed, busy, noisy, tons of traffic. We only stayed a few days and used the hotel as a base to explore things on the island. We didn't even go down to Waikiki Beach once to use it! Went to other beaches. I used their free shuttle one night to Ala Moana Shopping centre. The trip was a little disappointing. About a half hour trip each way. The mall was just the regular stores I see all the time in other cities. I was hoping for a more "Hawaii" experience. We took a trip to Royal Hawaiian centre mall the next day and found some more interesting stores. If you want to do lots of shopping, I would get a hotel that is more central on the Waikiki drag/ strip area, close to one of the big shopping centres.This hotel is a good location to park, zoo and the aquarium. All within walking distance easily. On the main floor is a Starbucks. The restaurant Lulu they have attached to building is a great breakfast spot. We were glad to have a rental car to escape Waikiki every day! For at least a while! We did a trip to Hanauma Bay and Kuilima cove to snorkel; hiked the waterfall at Manoa (a highlight of our trip); did a Pirate Cruise mostly for our son's benefit; drove the entire east and north coast. Would we return here? Yes if the price was right. I would try to get a higher floor to reduce the noise at nite. One thing we really were impressed by was how fast the valet service was for the car. We came down probably 5 times each day, and every time got our vehicle within 5 minutes. Most likely if we return to Waikiki, we would stay at North Shore as a base instead of Waikiki. Somewhere away from crowds. And then just do a day trip to Waikiki to shop or explore.

Right at the end of the strip away from all the traffic noise and the usual late night party goers. Many local places to eat and drink the usual franchises. Starbucks next door. Walk across the road for boogie board and paddle board hire. Stayed in an ocean front room, not huge but comfortable enough, no complaints, friendly staff. If your a light sleeper try this place.

If the beach is your main activity then this hotel is for you! Directly across the street from the beach. Walking distance to everything Waikiki. Surf school in the hotel. The room was an average size with a fridge & a safe. Too bad we weren't upgraded to a partial/ocean view but we didn't need the extra cost. ABC Store on site, Starbucks just outside of the lobby. FYI; $30/day resort fee (what you get doesn't justify the cost) AND $30/day for parking.I would recommend this hotel!

We picked a room with a partial ocean view and it was awesome. The room was not too big but it certainly was spacious enough if you know how to store your stuff. There were enough outlets in the room for charging your electronics, and strong enough free wifi.The bathroom had no tub but has a small walk-in shower. It is small and will fit one person comfortably, a bigger person will fit just right but there's not a lot of elbow space, not a deal breaker though. There is a shower curtain but don't splash around too much or you'll get the floor outside the shower stall wet. Usual shampoo, conditioner, soap included.Room and bathroom was very clean.Private balcony for two facing the ocean, great place to hangout to watch the sunrise and the sunset. The higher the room the better because your view won't be obstructed by the pool and the veranda where the pool is. There is a beautiful view of the diamond head on the walkway leading to the room, but outside the room.Staff was very helpful and friendly. The driveway can be a little tricky to get into and is very short and narrow.

Just returned from a stay at this super hotel. Excellent location. Good sized room. Modern clean bathroom. Super friendly & helpful staff at reception - who even called the manager at home to help sort out my husband's wifi problem. Took advantage of the free yoga class on offer. Can only assume it a 3* star & not higher as it doesn't have conference facilities or dining - but as I needed neither, effectively got the same service as a 4/5* hotel. Lulu's next door do the most wonderful breakfast & will do a portion to share or half size, if you don't have a huge appetite.Come out of hotel turn left & walk about 20 mins to UNCLE BO's restaurant. It's just fantastic & a place where the locals eat. Again, order a dish to share - the portions are HUGE

Loved this place. definetly go for the gettogether with manager and staff. situated right across road from the beach. great ABC shop next door for supplies. beautiful views from our room. Loved watching the Flamigos at the zoo. terrific to get a room to chill before out flight home. we are still talking about this place and it was last august we were there.. We WILLbe back.

This is a pretty good hotel for Waikiki. That means it is pretty good value for a pretty expensive area. It is located at the east end of Kalakua Ave next to the Zoo. So you are a walk from the main area of the shopping areas and nicer hotels of the street. The beach is right across the street and there is good access to a Starbucks, restaurant and ABC stores and other amenities. It's an older property but nice and clean. Could not have asked for better hotel staff, all very helpful and accommodating If you are a smoker you likely already know how militant the Hawaiian govt is towards it. When you leave to hotel for your smoke outside the hotel, in front of the next door Starbucks be sure to bring extras. The many street people hanging around this end of Kalakaua will surely "befriend" you to get one of your clean, fresh smokes. They are nice and polite, but seem to have an insatiable habit;)If you can get (afford ) an "Ocean Front" room you will have a great view of Diamond Head straight east from the balcony and the ocean from the side window. Overall a good hotel property

We stay in Honolulu once or twice a year over the past two decades and we found this hotel a little tried but a good location across the street from the zoo and the beach.We received good service but only after fighting for it. We checked in only to be told there were only two doubles instead of a king but a good room on a high floor. We saw the room was looking straight into another building. We immediately requested a room change and were given a king bed and a view of diamond head.The interior is tried and relatively clean. They have a free shuttle to ala Moana which we just happened to overhear someone ask about. We found the price we paid should have given us a more updated room but it was a pro bowl week. They provided storage for our bags and a courtesy room to change.

I got lucky and got the Park Shore hotel when I booked through Hotwire at a great deal. We were greeted with cold fruit juice and hot towels. Staff were friendly, it was clean, and he location was perfect. It is right across the street from the beach. They offer beach towels, chairs and umbrellas included under the resort fee of approx $20 Canadian per day. Rooms were a little small but we had no issues with that at all. It has a great view of Diamond Head from the pool deck and there is a manager's cocktail party on Wednesdays late afternoon where they serve their signature drink which was delicious. You can get either with or without alcohol. The beach across the street was nice...not too busy and the water is great for swimming...not too many big waves. There are ABC stores everywhere where you can buy food, liquor, souvenirs etc. Lulu's restaurant is attached and very good. They have a hospitality room you can use after check out for late flights. I would definitely stay there again.

We preferred being at this end of the beach. Our goal was quality R&R and quiet nights were important to us for the 3 days we had. All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Yes - you do need to add on $20 'resort fee' per night, which as far as we could tell was to just keep fee per night in advertising lower - but a lot of Waikiki Hotels do the same. If you know in advance its OK. Pool area OK - good for kids. Closed at sunset. No pool side drinks available, no mini bar in rooms - not even water. But if you want a quiet hotel in quieter area, and happy to go out to eat and drink then it is perfect. Best thing was after we checked out there was a 'hospitality' room available - where you could sit, watch TV or take a shower. All free. Also they will store your bags. Ask for a room with a 9 or 10 - to get great few of sea and diamond head. Higher the better. (18 floors). We would stay again.

Stayed at the Park Shore Hotel for 5 nights and was very happy with the location. It is right opposite the quite end of Waikiki beach, had a great bar/restaurant overlooking the beach, tour desk, ABC shop, great service by the staff and the hotel had a lot more things to offerI would highly recommend spending the extra cash and getting an oceanfront or ocean view room. Each room has a balcony, so you can sit outside, enjoy a beer and watch the amazing sunsets each night. Make sure you request this when you make the booking. The rooms were beautifully presented and very clean.The only gripe I have is the bar area has a hospitality night for all the hospitality workers in Waikiki and the music pumped until 2am. This happens every Monday night and it kept me awake. We were on the 9th floor Ocean view!! Normally I would have just gone bugger it and joined them, but as we all know, holidays are very tiring and sleep is important.I am a senior manger in the Travel and Tourism industry and will be certainly recommending the Park Shore to future visitors to Honolulu. Thanks Gina for the room allocation !!

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in mid-January. The service was wonderful and all the hotel staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly! The room was small, but comfortable. We had a wonderful view of both Diamond Head and the ocean, I would highly recommend upgrading to the ocean view, that was what really made it for us! The only thing that prevented me from giving it 5 stars is that there is no room-service or jacuzzi. We never used the pool, who needs it when you have the ocean right there? But we would have liked a jacuzzi at night. There are the daily fees, which seem ridiculous, but from what I've seen that is inescapable pretty much anywhere in Hawaii, so be prepared! Note: parking is $25 a day, but I think there was free street parking right down Kalakaua street. Overall, we both decided we would definitely go back to the Park Shore on our next trip!

Just completed a 3 day stay at the hotel with a group of college students. As one of two professor we always worry about them and the hotel response. They were good, but the hotel staff was extremely accommodating of our requests for space. I would like to give a special shout outs to David Maciel the guest services manager as well as Annie, the evening manager and Gina and Kanai (sp?) at the front desk. Also want to acknowledge the Valet staff (only valet parking) who managed our four mini vans ectremely well.

We stayed here on our visit to Hawaii. Booked the partial ocean view room, the veil of the ocean is must greater then expected, it was beautiful. Rooms were a little small but worked fine as we didn't spend much time in them. Most of the staff were great, although one of the girls could use some tips in customer service but other then that everything was great. We landed early and I had tried to organise early checkin before our arrival but was told they couldn't pre arrange it and we just had to show up and wait, we ended up waiting 7 hours before we could check in, I felt as there was no urge to assist is. I found it a bit odd that they close the pool once the sun sets, unlike other hotels I've visited have much longer pool hours. It would be great if they had a bbq area and night swimming.

Excellent location and amenities.Reasonable pricing and fantastic happy service.Very nice second floor balcony swimming pool with great sunset views.Everything you need is in your immediate area.Beach is a minute from the hotel front door.Very nice room beach views.

I wish I could give this hotel more than 5 stars. I stayed here for 8 nights with my girlfriend. Our balcony faced the oceanfront and diamond head, we loved waking up to such incredible views each morning. The hotel was very clean, the staff were friendly and the lady on the information desk was extremely helpful. The pool was just the right size and we were always able to get a sun bed. The location of the hotel was perfect, only a few steps to the beach, hundreds of restaurants , bars and shops. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and do not have any criticisms at all.

We had a sea view room and loved it. The location for the price is great value and while it is no frills and the rooms quite small, it is very clean and comfortable and modern. We liked that it was out of the hustle and bustle of the main part of Waikiki but still close enough to be in the action if you want. The proximity to the beach is great and while the pool is fairly basic, it still has a great outlook. The staff were hit and miss with some being quite rude and unhelpful while others were fabulous. Having said that, even the rude staff didn't detract from our enjoyable stay. If you want a large glitzy 5 star hotel, this isn't for you but we couldn't fault the location and amenities. The view to the beach and diamond head were superb. The bar downstairs is also great and the perfect spot to watch the sunset. Would definitely stay here again - great value and very enjoyable!

Stayed two nights and only used the hotel to sleep. The room was clean and modern, the bed was quite comfortable, and the halls were happily quiet. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. Not much else to say...

We had a beautiful view of the Diamond Head and the beach. It was clean. The staff were amazing. Definitely a recommend. We were able to rent a car right at the front desk. Walk to amazing restaurants and stores. Our room was perfect. The lobby is light and airy. Hated to leave

Stayed here for my last day in Hawaii and was pleasantly surprised about how nice it was. Hotel is right on the beach, next to the the zoo and park. Service from the staff could be a little better trained on explaining the hotel features and amenities. The hotel is at the end of the main road in Waikiki and all shops and restaurants are accessible by foot.

I love this place! It's older but completely remodeled. If you require 12 foot high ceilings and marble everywhere this might not be the place for you but it has the best view in Waikiki. I am right across the street from Waikiki beach and there's a Starbucks downstairs, how much better can it be?

My wife and I had 3 wonderful days in this hotel.Our room was very clean, quiet and came with a nice view of the pacific and Waikiki beach, the pool area was very nice too. The staff was very helpful and pleasant, especially Michelle and Ethan at the front-desk. This is the last hotel at the main strip facing the ocean, making it a lot more calm than the rest of the hotels on the strip. The location in first row made the walk to the beach a short stroll, plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby and the free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping mall, which made car rental not necessary.We would definitely recommend this place and we would love come back, some day!Mahalo Amalie and Jesper

After all the great reviews we read about this hotel, we were not impressed. The hotel seems pretty tired and more than ready for a makeover. The lobby is ho-hum, although the front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Our room, was incredibly expensive at New Years, yet nothing special. We had asked for a single king bed, but were given a room with 2 queens. The room was so small that there was almost no free space. There were the 2 beds, a nightstand, and a dresser. No chair. The bathroom was fine, everything worked, and there were the basic amenities. We had virtually no view so there was no reason to sit on the balcony. The hotel was offering a 20% discount if you could show that you had cancelled at another Honolulu hotel for the same dates. Oddly enough, we had done just that, but the front desk would not give us the discount (even though we could prove it) because we had not declared that when we arrived. Things like that leave a bad taste. We were able to park close by for free (near the zoo) and save $25 per night. After the exorbitant price of the room, the bogus "resort fee" and taxes, we were happy to save a little cash. Overall, nice break on Oahu but the Park Shore wasn't the highlight.

This was a great affordable hotel. I think it was worth getting the Ocean view. It just makes the stay a little more special. We stayed in room 1407. It is a corner facing the Ocean--two different views in a window and a tiny balcony. So ask for the higher floors in the corner--it should end in 07 (1507, 1407, etc). Ask for the high floors and I really liked the location because it wasn't in the middle of the Waikiki upscale noise. Also ask for the renovated rooms. The rooms are ok, don't expect the most luxurious. They're kind of small, but typical of a beach house. Try to book as early as possible to get a good deal. We had two rooms, one for us and one for our adult kids. It seems like you'd need connecting rooms for families with young kids.

My 4 year old daughter and I stayed here for 5 days Jan. 2016. The staff was very friendly, helpful and pleasant. the beach directly across the street is a plus as well as plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby which was great for me because I chose not to rent a car. The zoo is next door. My daughter and I really enjoyed going there. There is a place within the hotel if you choose to purchase any expeditions and there is free transportation to and from. All in all we enjoyed our stay. Our room was clean and quiet.

This was our first visit to Waikiki and I was really happy with the location of this hotel. We had an ocean view room and we looked out on Diamond Head, the ocean, and the park (we could see the pink flamingos in the zoo). It is on the end of the strip of hotels, so you have easy access to everything, but don't feel surrounded by hotels. The hotel is right across the street from the beach and the hotel provides beach towels and very small beach chairs. There are good restaurants attached to the hotel if you need something convenient. The rooms were clean and well-equipped, but smaller than hotel rooms that we're used to. If we were going to be in Waikiki for more than a couple of days I'd try to find a condo.

My daughter and I stayed here in the middle of December. The hotel was very nice, it is right across the street from the Zoo and from the Beach and walking to distance to most of the places we wanted to go. The staff was friendly and the room was very clean. The Expedia concierge person was very helpful in helping us plan some of our outings.

What are people doing if they care about the view....go outside. Loved this hotel, employees so nice and great location. Will keep going back. Was woken up by the zoo animals...too cool. I have stayed in other places where we could not sleep because of the noise, nice and quiet here. Got up and sat in the foyer early morning and had a cup of coffee.....very relaxing. Have stayed in quite a few places in Waikiki and now have decided to keep coming back here.

We actually stayed here in November over Thanksgiving weekend in 2014. Fabulous location just across from the beach and we had a partial ocean view. We were able to walk just about everywhere local. The only negative is pulling into the valet parking driveway can be a pain but this would not prevent us from staying here again.

The hotel has cock roaches. No, they don't tell you when you are checking in but if you have stayed there recently, CHECK YOUR CLOTHING AND EVERYTHING. We started noticing the roaches when we were driving around in our rental car. We had all our bags in the trunk. The room they put us in was outdated and it wasn't even worth the $295 that the hotel charged us for one night. They probably put us in the crappiest room they had because the room was awful.

Stayed there for 2 nights before a cruise and the hotel as ok. we had a view of a brick wall and a parking lot which was a bit disappointing. the room was also very small but it was ok as we just basicially went there to sleep. The room was clean.located right across from the beach, walking distance to diamond head and close to restaurants. there is also a good restaurant on the main floor which is quite good. If i were to go back though I would book a hotel a few blocks away from the beach because they are much cheaper and really end up being really close. you can easily cover most of the Waikiki area on foot

Stayed here for a Christmas holidays day and it was perfect. The hotel let the families who did not have a tree use the one in lobby on Christmas Day which was sweet for the kids. Near almost anything in Waikiki.

A family of 3 stayed on the 10 floor and had an enjoyable time. Initially the room seemed quite small but then we were out most days until the late evening and didn't notice after a while. Had room tidied with fresh towels each day. Also had beach towels and chair to take to the beach just across from the beach. Excellent location and close to restaurants, and shops. A free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping and really friendly and helpful staff. Also had free Wifi and ice water/drinks daily.Third floor had the swimming pool so probably good for location if you like swimming.
user_name:
Helen F
Auckland Region, New Zealand

review_body: All hotel rooms in Hawaii are small, this is no exception but rooms were ok, resort is nice amenities are good, towel, chairs all included, nice people convenient to everything, beach, shopping, food, rooms Have amenities just small cries from room weren't great

A very pleasant stay at the far south east end of Waikiki Beach. Room 1820, top floor. Rooms clean and comfortable with basic amenities of air conditioning, mini fridge (empty), complimentary toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, gel, soaps). Free wifi throughout the hotel, no password required, with good reception and quite fast. Beach towels available for borrowing at reception. Hotel pool outside on the 3rd floor a little on the small and shallow side, but sunny with a backdrop of palm trees and ocean views. In the lobby there is a guest services desk which can assist with booking island activities. Reception staff were friendly and efficient. Thanks especially to Michelle for assisting with some card difficulties I experienced when checking in. While the hotel isn't especially fancy and lacks some of the bells and whistles you might find in higher end hotels, it was great value and in a fantastic location. Would stay again.

First off, this hotel has a fabulous location, right at the end of "hotel row" and offers a great view of the beach and sheltered "ocean pool" just across the street. Also, the zoo is but a few minutes walk. We had a room with a balcony that offered unsurpassed views of the main street, the ocean and Diamond Head.As for the room, it was very clean, albeit a tad on the small size. Comfy beds and good wi-fi and tv were included. The bathroom bordered on Lilliputian. There was literally no place to place personal items, except one small glass shelf above the toilet.
