I found myself using the toilet seat as a "shelf," but it worked out okay. The houskeeping staff and front desk staff were excellent. You must pay for parking and it is by valet only. If you come and go several times a day, it can get pricey just tipping the parking attendants. Be aware that Honolulu has some of the worst traffic anywhere, and you can expect delays about on a par with LA or Miami. The rooms do not have microwaves, so no heating up of anything -- not a big deal, but just saying.There are lots of restaurants within walking distance, including in the hotel property itself. All in all this was a great place to relax for almost a week. The balcony was great for having morning coffee as the sun came up, or having a snack at sundown.I took off one star because of the small bathroom, which by the way has a pocket door, not a hinged door.

This is the last hotel on the main strip facing the ocean. It is right next to the zoo and Diamond Head is beyond that. We had a wonderful stay here. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly and very patient with our many questions. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Starbucks is next door to the hotel and we got our coffee and enjoyed sitting on the balcony each morning and watching the day begin on the beach. I would stay there again.

David Maciel is the manager. He is super nice. He and his team will do anything to make your stay the very best. I requested a high, quiet room with the best view. I got it! David gave us (me and my husband) an end room on the 12th floor. We had a view of Diamond Head and the beach. We ate breakfast every morning on our balcony looking at both. The hotel is at the south end of Waikiki beach and next to the zoo. Both views were unobstructed. We walked about 300 feet from the hotel to the Pacific ocean. The beach at the south end has a short pier with a breaker wall. As a result, a large ocean-water pool is created. It is great! There are no waves and so the swimming is exceptional. In the room we had 2 beds, a dresser, a desk, a fridge, and a coffee maker. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The only thing I could wish for would be about 20% more space in the room and bathroom, but the location and the service made up for that. You have to pay for parking at all Waikiki hotels.

Hotel was lovely, great views of the beach, away from the busy Main Street but close enough to walk to where ever we wanted to go. There is a great bar/restaurant which is extremely cheap with a great atmosphere which you get to from level 2 of the hotel.
user_name:
Leonie B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We've been here before but they've done renovations since then and the hotel is now even better. We had a pool room so we access the pool directly which overlooks Waikiki and is right next to the park and the Honolulu zoo. The staff called us by name, were very accommodating when we asked to stay on the pool deck after closing to view the Pearl Harbor parade. Loved the coffee, juice and water service in the lobby and being minutes away from, well, everything.

The hotel is located close to the zoo and not to far from diamonds head. The beach is just across the street. We had breakfast at LuLu's some days with a view of the beach. A bit pricy but big portions. We had a smoothie and a wrap at Tucker and Bevvy and I think we were just unlucky with the strawberry smoothie that only tasted crushed ice because it all looked nice. Both eateries are in connection to the hotel.We were upgraded to sea view for free which was nice, but the safe was broken and the TV didn't work properly. These are only details but still it's generally nice to have both working. The bed was very good and the room was always clean. The lobby is nice, as is the pool but the christmas music played was way too high! We were happy with our stay and would stay here again.

Great hotel on the most eastern end of Waikiki beach, next to the zoo. Friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms with free wifi in room and lobby. Basic pool area but sufficient. Handy to have luggage storage and a hospitality room when your flight departs late in the day. 2 ABC shops attached to the building for all those last minute supplies, souvenirs or easy meal.

Great room with excellent view of ocean, also overlooked zoo. Great view of Diamond head right from the Balcony. $25.00 a day for valet parking plus $20.00 a day hotel fees. Heads up for those, this was above room cost which was high but is a great location to be in.....

We went on 4 th of July weekend and it was amazing. The staff are very friendly. My daughter left her favorite shoes and they send it back to Miami. I paid for shipping but I feel this is a nice service. I had a nice time there. This hotel It's located walking distance to the beach which make it really nice. I really enjoyed my stayed there.

I had a great stay at this hotel. The staff were wonderful! Always helpful and ready to answer any questions. The room was on the small side but modern, always clean and the bed was comfy. The view.... oh the view! The view of Diamond head and the ocean was amazing. I could have sat on the balcony all day and just watched!The location is good. Right across from the beach but it is a little down and out of the heart of the action. It is only about a 10-15min walk down to what I would call the city centre.

We booked only 2 weeks in advance and got a good room for a reasonable price. Our room looked towards diamond head and got good views of the beach as well (overlooking the hotel pool).Main thing to note was this hotel is at the very end of the Waikiki strip, my partner and I are quite fit so didn't mind walking to most places each day (but could add up for some travelers).All staff at the hotel were helpful and courteous. Water and juice available each day was a welcomed relief with the ever present humidity. A courtesy bus to main shops and destinations is handy and the beach is a 50m walk away.LuLu's is great downstairs - check it out on a Monday night!

Amazing hotel with nice personal and a great view from the rooms. The poolarea are very quiet and nice and is close to the room. Excellent hotel!! I can really recommend this to other families because our family had a amazing stay here. Hang loose!

I stayed at this hotel in September for 6 nights with friends. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is great, right next to the small zoo and the beach front just across the street. The rooms were always clean and good facilities. On our first night we noticed the safe wasn't working so I reported it to reception and it was fixed within 30 minutes, great service. Free wifi and good choice of TV channels in the room. I would definitely recommend this hotel and return there in the future.

We chose the Park Shore because it was at the end of Waikiki and bordered the beach and the zoo. The view from our room was great: Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. Rooms are typical size for Waikiki. Service at the front desk was great, very friendly and helpful. My only complaint was for a couple of nights the restaurant downstairs had a live band and was somewhat noisy until 1:30am. If the AC is running then you can't hear the band. You can't beat the location of this hotel though, about as good as it gets.

I have now stayed with our Park Shore ohana (family) twice. Once in 2010 with my mom (our last trip due to her dementia) and again for 11 days with my husband at the end of October 2015. There has been some great renovations done since our first visit. The rooms are clean and well presented. We were thrilled to have a lovely, unimpeded ocean view each visit and also enjoyed looking out (east) over the green belt and Diamond Head. This location was excellent for catching TheBus, was right across from the Zoo where we picnicked often and we had easy access to our pre-sunrise strolls along the ocean front walkways and evening swims. But the absolute best part of the stay was our connection with the friendly and helpful staff and management! These folks went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed - from supplies to information. And everyone had good senses of humour! We loved the laughs! We will always go back to the Park Shore! Thank you all and bless you for everything. Debra G and Ken from British Columbia, Canada

This was the second time at the Park Shore. Welcoming reception, lovely clean, comfortable room too. Excellent location for the beach, yet not too far from all central amenities. Coffee available in the hotel reception in the morning, and fruit juice in the afternoon a lovely touch. Beach towels and beach chairs available and also umbrellas if you are unlucky with the weather. All staff extremely friendly and helpful.

The location of the Park Shore is fantastic. Right across the street from the beach. It is also at one end of Waikiki so its slightly less crowded that the central part of Waikiki, but still in easy walking distance to everything. The staff was helpful and friendly, restaurants nearby were great. Overall a great stay. Only complaint, the beds weren't very comfortable and the doors to the rooms slam, so it can be a bit loud and tough for light sleepers.

Stumbled upon this place on a website. Check in was excellent. Friendly and helpful. Room was on small side but fine. Location is is major attraction. No gym. Free WiFi is nice. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Beach is across the street. Recommended.

We spent two nights at the Park Shore Waikiki. Big hotel with a pretty good pub that has an excellent view over Waikiki Beach. At first we were put in a very small room, but our security lock wasn't working and they upgraded us to an ocean front room that was twice the size. Great beds, nice linens... love the shampoos/soaps. The room was very clean with a great view of the ocean and a nice balcony. Didn't use the pool, but it looked very nice. This place is near the end of the strip, but an easy walk to everything. They supplied umbrellas when it was raining and beach chairs when it wasn't. Would definitely stay there again.

After a long flight 11 hour flight and 2 hours from airport due to traffic and rain we were dropped off at park shore Waikiki . It is a dated hotel but clean, excellent location and wonderful staff. The staff members were all very nice but a special mahalo to Ethan. He went out of his way to chat with us and had great suggestions. The rooms aren't anything special but are clean and the beds comfy . You can walk to resturants , shopping and the beach is right accross the street as well as right outside our door a beautiful view of diamond head crater .

We chose this hotel on trip advisor reviews. Having previously stayed at an outrigger hotel, budget determined we stayed somewhere cheaper. This hotel was at the far end of Waikiki, opposite the zoo and safe beach. Great rooms and a partial ocean view. Free shuttle to alamoana mall, great for bringing bags of shopping home. Very pleased with this choice of hotel. Was a little bit of a walk from centre if Waikiki but great way to walk off dinner and watch the evening activities .

Hotel was clean, nothing luxiourios but well equipped with a microfridge, coffee maker and complimentary coffe.the location is perfect right across from the beach and convenient to a lot of shops. The water and coffe on the lobby was a nice touch, very nice swimming pool that unfortunaly didnt have time to use.

When I was planning my trip to Hawaii I wanted somewhere clean, safe and inexpensive. I knew I wouldn't be spending a lot of time in the hotel so fancy wasn't important to me. This place was perfect. and had beautiful view of the ocean and Diamond head. Would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is ok - not very modern, but with great views to the beach. We had a total ocean front room, but I'd say the partial one is almost as good as the view is still to the beach, but slightly more to the east towards Diamond Head. The bed was great - firm and comfortable. Staff are mixed - some very friendly, one girl in particular not at all (she looked at me and responded to me as if I was a nuisance to her).On the same corner of the hotel is a great casual seafood restaurant / bar (upstairs) - try the Maui Wowie grilled tiger prawn salad - so yum! and also a little snack bar / take away for healthy food on the lower level. Local buses to various locations including Diamond Heads leave right outside the hotel (we must have missed ours, but then again it was Sunday and maybe services are les frequent).

Really important to have a quiet clean place to stay. Hotel centrally located to all places on Waikiki. Rooms a bit small but adequate. Nice to have small fridge in room. 2 ABC stores just steps away as is the Honolulu Zoo.

Good location, close to beach, Their Lulu restaurant was very nice, and good beach view. Staff were friendly and good service. Room was small and very small closet. Balcony was small, only good for standing. Bed was not comfortable,

Right across from the Honolulu Zoo and Waikiki Beach. Easy access to amenities and staff helpful.City needs to clean up small area just out front towards the beach as homeless and addicts seem to hang there at night, but police presence is continuous. Didn't really have any problems with it.Hotel staff need to know more about bus and trolley systems but we found that throughout Waikiki. They are trying to support the tour business but would be nice to know everything about the transportation system not just tour companies.

Our 2nd time visiting Waikiki, and staying at Park Shore, again our room was fantastic, we had views of the beach and zoo, staff were very friendly and helpful, couldn't fault the service, the room, we will definitely be back again.,

Nice hotel just a walk across the road to the beach with access to both surf and lagoon swimming areas. Hotel itself has a nice spacious pool area overlooking the beach with views to Diamond Head and evening sunsets. Staff were friendly and helpful. Plenty of dining and shopping options - all within a very short walking distance. Rooms were clean and tidy and nicely maintained on a daily basis. We would stay here again.

Be aware that this hotels router cannot provide internet for Microsoft cellphones, so no WIFI for us on the phones but the laptop was fine. Other malls and hotels (the Hyatt especially) did provide open connections.Not a quiet hotel, on our first night, a loud concert was on well past midnight. Other times: regular police and fire engine sirens, helicopters, revving motorcycles, cars, all added to the decibels. The bus stop outside does not help in that regard either. I had requested a quiet room on a high floor but got floor 8 (of 18 floors).Ocean view room not quite what I expected, has a view of the park, Diamond Head and the ocean on the right; check with reception if you want to see the ocean from your bed and you want an ocean front facing room (costs more). Really glad I did not choose a standard room without the sea view as some rooms overlook other buildings, carparks etc.Size of the room was fine for us, the balcony was great for relaxing on the afternoons. Champagne flutes, kettle & tea bags need to be requested. The resort/room tax charge is for amenities normally provided by other international hotels (but this is a standard charge by most Hawaiian hotels). Décor is very dated, colour schemes of the rooms, reception and uniforms need 'livening up', and especially the boring drab brown printed staff shirts. Michelle at reception is extremely helpful. Concierge services were not always able to help depending on request.Hotel does not offer its own bar or restaurant, there is Lulu's on 2nd floor, it is a large noisy bar restaurant separately operated; also dated and unhappy looking staff.Pool overlooks the beach, on 3rd floor so gets all the above noise.Location was fine for us, nice walk into shops and other hotels, eating places.

Currently staying at the Park Shore Hotel for the second time. We chose an oceanfront room for our 11 night stay.....not only are we are not disappointed in the room or the views - we love it! . From the get go all the the staff we've encountered have been fantastic, helpful and friendly. It's a 10 minute walk to our favourite bar, "Duke's" on the beachfront, which for us isn't long. We plan to come back next May to celebrate my 60th....I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Great location! Would stay here again just for the location! A good distance from where it's all happening, a good distance to walk off that full feeling of over eating. All staff were friendly enough. After reading so many reviews of people that got free upgrades I had hopes that after booking ocean front there may of been a chance of an upgrade to a diamond head sweet. After we took bags to our room we felt a little squashed for 3 people and went to ask if by any chance we could go to a slightly bigger room. We were told that because we had booked on a third party website they couldn't give a free upgrade. Whatever. We were happy to pay for the extra space. FYI Queen beds = double bed size and King beds = queen bed size. We were so tired from big days we slept comfortably anyway.

Upon arrival I was offered an "alleged" upgrade. Upon viewing the room it appeared that there was only one window facing directly the swimming pool (on the same floor). Therefore there was no privacy as people by the pool could see into the room. I went back to the reception explaining that I would rather stay in my booking class (standard). The hotel keeper then explained that there was no room (in this booking class) with a king size (which I requested during my booking). After a few minutes of discussion I eventually accepted to stay in a room with two double beds.Despite a (suggested) gesture from the hotel I would NOT recommend this hotel for the aforementioned reason but also considering that there were holes in the sheets, room was small, a resort tax ($20 per night) is added automatically and last but not least there are cheaper, better located larger and more modern options in Waikiki.

The only downside of this hotel is its distance from the Airport and downtown (Taking the bus took close to an hour.) Definitely a good stay if interested in a quiet location on the beach this is definitely the place to stay. The hotel is no more than a minute walk to the beach. They offer complimentary towels and beach chairs to all guests. Wifi is free, but open to the public, so it always runs slow. Lulu's in the restaurant next door, and they had wonderful food and live music. Would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Oahu.

Stayed here for our 3 last nights of our Hawaii trip. We booked this hotel as it was on the beach and not very expensive. Did not regret this in any way, as the service was great, the location was perfect and the room was very good (certainly for the price paid). Will stay here again next time.

I booked this hotel on hotwire and got a great price considering the location. The hotel is right on the beach, but at the far end which is very quiet. It was a bit of a walk to the heart of Waikiki. The rooms are spacious but my room faced a car park which wasn't great! Closest hotel to Diamond Head, and close to the 'pool' part of Waikiki Beach so good for kids. The Tiki Bar/ restaurant next door was nice and close to a lot of ABC stores, but everywhere in Waikiki is close to ABC stores!!The bathroom was a decent size and it had a sliding door which I found a bit odd.
user_name:
Hollings_85
New York City, New York

review_body: The location is great! It's a bit on the outside of the busy waikiki area but walkable to whole Waikiki area. Lots of good quick bites around the hotels. Two ABC stores less than 1 minutes away. After reading all the review, we request upper floor room with views for both Diamond Head and the Beach. It's just beautiful!!! Stayed at room 1011.I truly enjoyed having a cup of coffee in the morning sitting on the balcony and looking at the view! Best morning-time ever! Just keep in mind that the hotel itself isn't the most updated facility, so, keep an open-mind. The noise level is just ok, you can hear the neighbors if they are loud. It's a bit old fashioned, but it does the job. The staffs are super friendly! A total bonus! There are free coffee in the lobby in the morning and fresh water and juice in the afternoon. Good touch! Our shower curtain had a bit of a moldy wet smell on the 1st day, but once we told the front desk, they changed it for us right away. The free beach towel is another nice touch too! Overall good stay!

We just returned from our stay at the Park Shore where we had such a great time. When selecting our hotel we wanted something with a great location and this hotel did not disappoint! From reading previous reviews i was worried about the size of the rooms but we found them to be spacious and very comfortable. Everyone at the hotel was really helpful - we even booked our trips here so everything was in 1 place with great service. Was a lovely touch to have the drinks available in the lobby especially after coming in from the outside heat!For the price of this hotel you really cant beat the location! It was across the road from the beach, the zoo and within easy walking distance of all the restaurants and bars. We also used the pool and this area was lovely with comfortable sun loungers! We really had the most amazing honeymoon here and made the right choice with this hotel and would stay here again.

Employees were very friendly. They go out of there way to help. Upon arrival they informed us we were upgraded to a nicer room. What a nice surprise. It was a beautiful view from our room. Room was nice and comfortable. Great location.

Our stay started off well - we had been upgraded from an ocean view room to an ocean view suite. Very, very nice room with a large bathroom, king size bed, kitchen/lounge area and 2 lanai! Great views looking down at the beach, watching the walkers, runners, people on the beach and surfers. We had a great time and could find nothing to fault.

Stayed her for 1 week, what a great location and place. Right across from the beach, zoo and 5 mins walk to all the eateries.Great restaurant attached, Starbucks and a sandwich bar to grab those bites for lunch on the beach

This property is at the south end of Waikiki beach. Literally 40 steps and you are on the sand. Has 2 options for swimming, one in relative safety behind a sea wall (great for kids) and to the left of the jetty is a great surf beach. The rooms are on the small side but very clean and comfortable and reasonably priced. Great pool on level 3 and the rooms access the pool, I didn't enquire about cost, but it would be a great level to stay on. Staff are extremely friendly and knowledgeable. A must in my view.

The good: The pictures are just as you see, beautiful rooms, beautiful views, a connected juice bar/organic sandwich shop, free access to beach accessories, and a pool that overlooks the beach. They offer a free room that you can use to shower or rest in while you are waiting for your flight. They offer ice cold Hawaiian punch and water throughout the day. The bad: Our first room had a slight rotten smell when we arrived and after a couple of says it was stronger. We asked housekeeping change the bedding to see if that would help.confirmed the smell. It was worse and we asked staff to come up to our room and they did and could also smell it. We were moved to an upgraded room facing the pool (421) and that had a strong urine smell by the end of our first night there. We notified staff and they confirmed the smell. We kept the balcony door open as much as possible because at this point we had re packed and moved twice in less than a full week.

Ive stayed at most of the hotels on this block. Park Shore is a bit cleaner than the Waikiki Grand or the Queen Kapiolani, but the rooms feel a bit more cramped. Great choice for a trip on a budget. The main reason to pick these for your trip is the location, its about 30 feet from waikiki beach and walkable to most everything wikiki has to offer.

Stayed for 4 nights in August and had a great stay. The hotel is in a great loction across the road from the beach, bus stop out the front and plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from. They offer a free shuttle to the main shopping mall and lovely beverages in the foyer. Activities they organised were what they said they were, rooms clean

This hotel was just perfect for our family vacation! There were 11 of us which shared 3 rooms. Two were king suites with pull out queen sofa beds in living room and one room had 2 double beds. All were ocean front views for sitting out on the lanai at night, drinking wine and watching the surf. The beach area across the street from the hotel was perfect for the smaller kids because it was roped off and on the other side of the pier the older kids loved body surfing and boogie boarding. The location was perfect because you were at the end of the very busy Waikiki strip but my family said that they wouldn't want to have been at any other place. Could walk to the Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium to the left of the hotel and walk to central Waikiki to the right and have the perfect beach for all right across the street. Staff was friendly and helpful at all times. You can get towels from them for the beach and if you would like chairs, you can rent those from them. The only drawback was that we didn't know there was a charge for those chairs and that showed up on my bill and didn't notice until I got home. Also, it would have been nicer if the doubles had been queens for a little better sleeping. Would definitely go back again!

Once again, chose this hotel after reading reviews on TA. Excellent location, great staff, nice accommodations, good food, great views and exceptional value. Large, comfortable lobby with fast friendly valet service. Tucked away right off the beach roadway, easy to miss. Upon entering the lobby you know you made a good choice. Staff was welcoming, fast and pleasant. Upgraded to a Diamond Head Suite without us even asking and then upgraded our travel companions accommodations as well. Fantastic views, clean rooms, restaurant on premises with good food and great sunset views. Pool area could use some updating and upgrades but with beautiful beach across the street I'd have to believe many guests don't even venture out there. The perfect ending to our stay was the use of their courtesy suite. Checked out of room at 10:30 AM, left our luggage with the valet desk in storage and spent the day driving the island, visiting beaches on North Shore. Returned to Park Shore for dinner at LuLu's. Later we utilized the guest suite, everything we needed was on hand; soap, shampoo, towels, washcloths and blow dryer. Had an hour or so to kill before departing for airport, so we relaxed and watched a movie while sipping champagne to toast the end of a great vacation. No bums rush here...will definitely return for a longer stay when we come back to Hawaii.

This hotel feels more like a motel. I think the best part was the balcony with killer views. The rooms are too small and we were disappointed with the storage situation. This hotel does not offer a full dresser, and since we came for a week we ran out of room to put our clothes. We also did not like the $25 per day charge. The cleaning crew does an ok job-they make the beds, vacuum, and change towels. Throughout our stay they did not dust even once. We also did not use the pool so we felt cheated with the charge. Overall we felt average about the hotel. It wasn't luxurious and the staff was ok. Our first day the front desk girl gave us a room key to an already occupied room. Oops! Thank goodness they weren't naked and just looked at us like we were crazy. I'd recommend this hotel to people who don't care about space nor extra fees. The views and location are perfect, everything else just feels "meh".

We first stayed here in 1979 and had not visited Honolulu since. We booked in for old times' sake - as well as the good TA reviews. It's just as nice as it was then - nothing fancy, just clean and comfortable and right across the road from Waikiki beach and the zoo. We liked the hospitality room where we could relax and watch TV before we left for the airport. Could have used the pool too. Would recommend.

I took a lot of time choosing the Park Shore for our first two nights in Hawaii - in the end due to our 16 hour delay in arriving we only had one night there. I asked if in lieu of this (having paid for two nights but only staying one) we could get an upgraded room but they said "sorry we're full". A quick check online confirmed that this was rubbish, still they must get everyone asking for upgrades. In the end they only charged us one night's resort fee - so that was a bonus.Our room was basic but clean and comfortable and faced another hotel, but you could see the sea from the balcony, and there were excellent views of Diamond Head from the space by the lift. The main plus is the location, right across from the beach and within walking distance of Diamond Head itself. Wifi worked fine, rooms clean and quiet enough, big open reception with lots of comfy chairs. Didn't use the pool. Staff friendly and helpful enough.

Located closer to the Diamond Head side of Waikiki, this hotel is just excellent! Speedi Shuttle service from the airport will drop you at the door. My sister and I arrived way before check-in time and the staff on the front desk were extremely accommodating in checking us in hours earlier. Our twin double bedroom was spacious and spotlessly clean as was the swimming pool. It was a bonus to have beach towels provided by the hotel, as it was the complimentary shuttle to and from Ala Moana Shopping Center. A great hotel in Waikiki and the best value for money considering it is located across the road from Waikiki Beach. Oh, and there's good wi-fi, free coffee and cold water/drinks in the reception area all day round.

We were "assigned" this hotel by Priceline at the price of $135/night so were expecting an old room with a view of a parking lot or air conditioner. Surprise, we had a lovely room and the hotel was perfect for our needs! Location: The corner of Kalakaua (the Waikiki beach strip) and Kapahulu (the local food strip) with a direct view of the ocean, boardwalk, and Diamond Head. Kuhio Beach Park is across Kalakaua with a breakwater providing areas for both calm swimming and surfing. The zoo and its gardens are across Kapahulu. It is much quieter than further down the beach but there is access to everything. A bus stop right in front (and Waikiki's bus goes everywhere). Food on site: Starbucks, picnic/sandwich/smoothie store, Japanese restaurant, American surf restaurant with views of the ocean, 2 convenience stores with surprisingly good prepackaged but fresh food, fruit juice in the lobby. Other amenities: beach towels and folding chairs, microwaves and vending machines, hospitality suite for checkout day. If you don't have a room with a balcony and view, there are lots of views to enjoy.Bonus: we were given a slight room upgrade which made us very happy.

Located at the south eastern end of Waikiki and close to many shops and restaurants. There is the open air lobby that is very welcoming along with friendly staff. If you get a oceanfront or ocean view room, you will have a beautiful view of Waikiki beach. The rooms are small but comfortable. Keep checking web sites as their prices constantly change.

Great location, lovely hotel.Stayed in partial ocean view room for 5 nights. Part of Waikiki Beach but at eastern end, near Diamond Head, (opposite Zoo) so slightly quieter, which we found ideal. Room was spacious and housekeeping good. A problem with the in-room safe was swiftly dealt with by maintenance.Only slight negatives - 'resort fee' $20 per night (becoming increasingly common) and customer service, which we felt could have been a little more pro-active on occasions especially at the Concierge/Bell desk. No restaurant as such but LuLu's bar/grill, accessible from 2nd floor, with views and tables running around 2 sides, live music in the evenings and a good menu was excellent. Ate here 3 times as so excellent. ABC store (next door) also ideal for groceries, souvenirs, (& just about anything). Bus stop outside ('The Bus' No 20 or 42 stops include Pearl Harbour/Arizona memorial - $2.50 each way?). Waikiki beach across the road.Also ate at Teddy's Bigger Burgers (a short wait, but freshly prepared and excellent) and got 'take away' shrimp form the shrimp shack a couple of hundred yards back along Kalakaua Avenue one evening.From earlier reviews we noted that hotel can arrange car hire, but we did our own through Budget, online from UK, (based at the Hyatt 2nd Floor), which we found to be excellent value, with no queues either on pick up or drop off (late drop off up to 9pm is a plus).If you like to be near everything but also away from it just enough to get some good sleep this is the place.

This is a well kept, clean hotel with attentive service and a price that is low enough to make staying on the beach affordable for almost everyone. It is plain and without the fancy touches that characterize some of the other hotels nearby, but we had a modest sized room with two queen beds for about $125 a night.

Just returned to NZ after a trip to Hawaii stayed at the Park Shore Waikiki great place right on beach pay the xtra and upgrade to a sea view room well worth the xtra Scott and his team very helpful everything you need is within walking distance and if its something different you want or need the team are very knowledgeable and helpful .We made a mistake and booked our trips from NZ through the travel agent we could have and should have booked our excursions from the hottel much better trips and better prices . If your going from Aus/NZ make sure you have a phone adaptor to charge your phone Wifi was free much appreciated as the cost of mobile comms was prohibitiveSCOTT was able to charge the phone for us in his photo copiers usb port thanksfor thatTop spot all you could want great location and really friendly staff

This is the second visit to this hotel and it was even better. The staff were delightful and helpful, the rooms were clean and well serviced and the location is superb.We were late arriving and the staff made it very easy to check in. The front desk staff were always happy to oblige as were the concierges. The manager has a wonderful ethos as regards his staff and the service he wishes to provide to the clients.

We were more than satisfied with our stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. We had a Partial Ocean view on the top floor (18th), while my parents had an Ocean View room on the 9th floor. Both were very nice rooms with king beds and lovely views. The hotel is directly across the street from the beach and the park with a wonderful view of Diamond Head. We were so close to the beach that we had breakfast on the beach for several days during our stay. The staff was helpful and friendly, even recommending good restaurants and landmarks. I would not hesitate to stay here again, and plan to.

After much research, we decided to stay at the Park Shore hotel and are so glad we did. It's at the end of the street, across from the zoo. Our mornings were filled with sounds of the animals awakening and the ocean. The view front room 1207 was phenomenal. Both Diamond Head and Waikiki beach were right there from our lanai. The staff was outstanding, courteous and helpful. The room, while not fancy, was very clean and well maintained. Housekeeping did a great job!There are two ABC stores right by it. If you've never been to Waikiki, they're found on just about every block. But there were two to choose from in our case. There's also a Starbucks right there along with other tasty restaurants and sandwich places.I would stay again if I go back.

We wanted beachfront Waikiki on a budget. Whilst at the far end of the Kalakaua strip, this hotel was perfect. Right opposite the beach, less crowded, easy walking to everything. Hotel was very clean and staff friendly. Free coffee and cool drinks in foyer all the time. Pool was spotlessly clean and overlooked the ocean. Really enjoyed our stay.

At the Diamond Head end of Waikiki with views of the beach and Diamond Head. Perfect location for a before-breakfast swim. Slightly removed from the Waikiki rat-race but an easy walk to it. Newly-renovated. Friendly staff. Everything about this hotel is very good. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Great location, we had a partial ocean view room, which was a misnomer really, as this room, 1617, to be exact, had a massive ocean view, plus a totally unobstructed view to Diamond Head. And because we were relatively high up, the street noise, was lessened. Rooms attended to every day, by Excellent staff. Brilliant balcony.Lulus is over rated, just a very average pub, however, the health food shop on the ground floor, is five star - thank you Ladies.Would we stay again - Unreservedly YES!!!!!!!!!!!!

The location of this hotel is so awesome, across the street from the beach! Most other hotels that close to the beach in Waikiki are so expensive, this was really well priced considering.Staff were lovely & friendly, & the girl at the travel desk downstairs was super helpful!Pool was nice even though it closes at sunset which seemed a waste as were were usually out all day & an after sunset swim would have been great! Compendium could have done with some more info on Waikiki, things to do, & especially info on the buses around Waikiki, Honolulu & also around Oahu/to the North Shore etc. Rooms were spacious, tidy, comfy beds, & housekeeping were great!Handy hint: there's a great view from the ice machine on the top floor :)Would definitely recommend this hotel & we will be back!

This hotel is located very close to the beach on the calmer side of Waikiki, yet still within walking distance of shops and restaurants. With the busstop around the corner, it was easy to get around Honolulu without a car. Rooms were clean with comfortable beds, hotel staff was very helpfull and friendly. Breakfast was not included, but Lulu's bar on the 2nd floor offers great dishes with superb ocean views while having your morning coffee.

Easy to find and even though we are usually too cheap to use valet we added it to cost of stay and it was very useful. Hotel clean/nice, we got a free upgrade to an ocean view room, and service was great. Our room had full view of ocean and a side view of the zoo; which my husband loved. With the shape of the hotel we could see into other guests rooms and noticed a man on another level taking pictures of women in their rooms (wrapped in towels out of the shower), so be aware if you are in a south facing room someone might be able to see you. Great shopping, restaurants, and access to the beach. The location is wonderful and we enjoyed our stay very much. AC worked great and the staff is very friendly. No free breakfast, but there is a little cafe just outside the front lobby, a restaurant in-house, and a Starbucks around the corner.

Chose this hotel for its location across from beach and park and its reasonable price. 4 night stay booked thru Trip Advisor for a "hotel room with lanai" but at checkin were given a fee upgrade to partial ocean view. Wow, the view of the beach from 6th floor was stunning. Thank You! A fine value for a clean, simply but nicely appointed comfortable room. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The pool sparkled. Plenty of eateries of all sorts nearby. Fun bars like Hulas and Tiki Grill close by, too.

This is a great option if you're looking to be on Waikiki Beach (or across the street as is the case). The partial ocean view rooms are very nice and you can get one that has a view of Diamond Head in addition to the water! Perfect combination in my opinion. The only downside was that for my room the deadbolt didn't work on the door and you had to really shove the door to get it open. I called the front desk to have it fixed and they said they would send someone up but that night it still didn't work. My other friends did not have this same problem so I assume it was just fluke in my room.The location of this place was excellent, on the far or "quieter" end of Waikiki right next to the Honolulu Zoo. Still within easy walking distance of all of Waikiki.

I totally recommend this hotel. Down the 'quiet' end of Waikiki, but so close to everything. across the street to the beach, the park & the Zoo, you don't really need to go any further. In the lobby is the 'tuck n bevvy' picnic bar. I have significant food restrictions and this place was a god send. I had been stressing about finding food i could eat but it turned out I didn't need to go anywhere. Taking some food and drinks to the rooftop pool and relaxing on the daybeds was dreamy!We stayed on the 6th floor, no view but we did have a deck, not that we used it. The daily servicing was good, the amenities were all fine. Having a fridge in the room was very handy. The hotel offered free Yoga classes on Monday's and Friday's which was great, the instructor was fantastic. Also the bus stop is right outside the hotel, which is perfect, I took the airport bus which ended up as door to door service, and at only $2.50 a great price!
user_name:
Lilly J
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: 5 night stay. Room was sufficient for two people. Paid for partial view but would advise people to request that it doesn't face another rooms Lanai (no privacy). Disappointed with what we got for the resort fee cost. Pool hours limited and only a vending machine for snacks and drinks. Water, coffee and morning juice available in foyer but later in the morning and not in the late evening. Staff were great. Bed was comfortable and room was clean.
user_name:
Vickie B
Nelson-tasman Region, New Zealand

review_body: Great hotel down the quiet end of Waikiki beach. Easy to walk to all the main shops and restaurants, right opposite the zoo and 5 minutes walk from aquarium .eould def stay here again. Nice friendly staff and good facilities. Has a free bus to Alo Moana shopping centre running every 45minutes.

I would highly recommend this hotel to those who wish to be just a little further away from the real hustle and bustle of the larger Waikiki hotels. At the Diamond Head end of the beach it marks the end of the high rise strip and gives excellent access to a good beach and protected swimming area. But it is still within easy walking distance of the big hotels and best shops. We stayed for 8 nights in an Ocean Front room and the extra cost of this is well worth it. The views of the surf breaking in the morning when you first open the curtains are just outstanding. We were on the 8th floor and I wouldn't want to be much lower. Hotel staff were great in all areas especially housekeeping and front desk who were excellent in handling the frequent requests for clean towels to take to the pool or beach. This is a great service.For those who need gluten free food, it was very pleasing to find that the Tucker and Bevy shop on the ground floor had several choices including a nice gluten free bread which they were willing to use for sandwiches and paninis. The many ABC stores within a very short walking distance also provided many simple food choices including good salad and fruit choices, but they don't usually have tomatoes. Beer is cheap! The only thing I found strange was the difficulty in finding out how to dial another room number in the hotel. Usually this is printed on the phone itself but it seems that this was forgotten when the phone system was installed. I pointed this out to the manager at the weekly managers happy hour and he was also surprised at this oversight. Eventually we found that the details are printed on Page 15 of a near 200 page untitled coffee table style tourism book located in each room. And they are shown on the TV set if you can navigate to the hotel services page. I would never normally look at such sources to find this information so I would encourage the manager to to put a simple sticker on each room phone. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it to other travellers.

After a few weeks of researching hotels to book for our first Hawaiian experience we decided on Park Shore due to reviews, prices and location. Did not disappoint! We loved our stay. The staff are very welcoming and friendly as well as incredibly helpful. I really enjoyed the managers meet and greet on wednesday, you can tell all the staff enjoy meeting thier guests and welcome feedback about thier experiences during thier stay. A very personal touch which is great.We booked most of our activities/tours at the expedia desk in the reception area which was handy and the staff was so helpful and knew exactly what we were wanting and picked perfect companies for our wishes. The room was fabulous. Everything we wanted plus more since we were surprised with a room upgrade upon check in. We felt so blessed for our entire stay! We never "win" anything so a huge thankyou to all the staff!We stayed in room 324. It is spacious and has a fabulous view of waikiki beach and the great pool just outside our sliding door. Will be asking for this room again when we return. This hotel is perfect for anyone and everyone. Perfect location, ticks all the boxes in our book with lots to do and see a short stroll away. LuLu's downstairs was a favourite breakfast visit as well as happy hour for a mai tai or 2. Nothing to worry about but relax, enjoy and emerce yourself in everything Oahu has to offer.

Booked this at the last minute because we planed to attend the Okinawa Festival at Kapiolani Park. Attending this festival has been a tradition and sleeping over enables us to really relax and cool off.Anyway, all of the local friendly hotels were booked except for the Park Shore. The only room available was "ocean view" at about $40 more than the cheaper rooms. What the heck, i thought, after all this is last minute!Well, what a wonderful experience it was for us! We had early check-in so we could cool off from the extreme heat we've been having! The view was magnificent! There was a big south swell so we could watch tge waves from up high!The renovated room was clean and had all things you would need!The only thing is dining is not available. We were going to eat at the Japanese restaurant, but they had a "conditional pass"! We went to Teddy's Burger which was a huge fiasco! Never again!But this still didn't dampen our great experience! If you are traveling from out of state give this Aston property consideration, you will not be disappointed!

We had a corner room on the 15th floor facing the park and Diamond Head on one side and the ocean on the other. The view was so spectacular we didn't even want to go anywhere else! It's definitely worth the extra money to get the higher ocean view rooms and the corner rooms are the best! Hotel staff is very accommodating.This is the last hotel on Waikiki so it's just beautiful views on one side with no buildings. It's a botique hotel so not too big. Location is wonderful - right across the street from Waikiki and the Zoo. And the prices are extremely reasonable! Best value in Honolulu.We cant recommend this hotel enough.

We stayed here the day before and day of our wedding in a gorgeous ocean front room. I had mentioned in my reservations that we were getting married, so they had chocolates and champaign waiting for us in our room. They brought all of our bags up and dropped them off, so no lugging around the suitcases. We really did feel like we had a special experience thanks to the staff at the Park Shore. We ate at the Lulu's and it was fantastic.

My fiancé and I had planned our trip to get married in Oahu. We checked in and used the hotel provided valet service. Upon checking into our room, the hotel provided a bottle of champagne and local chocolates as a congratulation for our marriage. The hotel is within walking distance of a ton of shopping and food. Local food is less than a 15 minute drive. If going to the beach, check in with conceierge and they will provide towels, chairs and boogie boards. (Just return them )Cons: mattress was very hard. We tossed end and turned by the 4th night. If you are here as a family the rooms are meant to only shower and sleep. If you are coming in as a family ask for double beds. Much more roomy. Served its purpose for us though. There also are no bath tubs. Just a stand up (very nicely tiled) shower. The hotel is kind of hidden and was a little hard to find. The conceierge was wonderful at retrieving our car whenever we needed it multiple times a day.Would return for future trip. Room 1019 was our room, killer view of the beach. Just a helpful hint.

We got a great feeling for Park Shore right from check in. We were on the 16th floor the room was a standard (possibly small for some) it had all we needed. The rooms were serviced daily, and the air conditioning worked very quickly to cool the room when we turned it on. The surrounding area has all that is needed for supplies, dinning out and beach action- it was less busy than further down the beach but still plenty of people around. Being able to access towels for the beach was a bonus. Michelle on reception is delightful and so helpful. The people who work in the concierge department knew their stuff and were very honest about the tours. We will be back,
user_name:
kyle and corina c
Hawkes Bay

review_body: Very nice vies. Staff friendly but housekeeping did not do a good job of cleaning and 4 out of 6 days I had to beg for the room be made up, sometimes waiting to 4 pm until the got around to us. Room shows a lot of wear and tear, especially the doors. Valet parking staff excellent. Several talks with hotel manager did not resolve the issues. We will not return which is a shame since we did a lot of research to find this hotel and it failed most of our expectations.

Stayed Jul 17 - Jul 25.
If you are looking for an inexpensive, clean place on the beach this is the place. My husband and I stayed for 8 nights in a standard room on the 16th floor. We had a partial view of the ocean which was wonderful. The staff was excellent! Michelle at the front desk conviced me to switch and save. Look into that! We got a great rate by doing this. Michelle and Leny thank you for all your help and for making my vacation memorable! The hotel is in a good location at the end of busy waikiki and quiet. We walked from the hotel to Diamond head 2.5 miles from the hotel to the top of Diamond Head. The shuttle takes you to the mall and to other locations in waikiki. They also have an in house car rental which was awesome for us because we did not need it for the entire stay. The WiFi is free! We were looking for a nice place too stay but inexpensive and we found it. The also have suites which are nice and big if you want more space. People say thr pool is small but there is never anyone in it so you have it to yourself. No complaints from me. My husband and I stayed at the pool the entire day and had no issues. Everyone is at the beach. This is the hotel for those who want to explore hawaii and are looking for a standard room which is small but they have other options. Pictures on the website are exactly what you get. We had a wonderful time ecploring Oahu and paid little for our hotel. It does not have more than 1 restaurant in it but it is literally 100 restaurants on the strip so who cares.
user_name:
Shonda1066
New York City, New York

review_body: I booked this hotel on Hotwire so expected that our room may be fairly basic. Most hotel rooms that state that the beds are double size are usually queen size so I was a bit shocked to find two small double beds for our family of 3 adult size people!I returned to reception and asked what options were available for a larger room with different size beds. I was only offered one choice of which I reluctantly took (for an extra charge). The room had bigger beds but was very noisy with doors banging from early morning and the pool deck right outside the door. The next morning I could no longer stand the room and went back to reception. The girl was very helpful and gave me a further two choices, one of which was a king size corner room with room for a fold out bed. It was great and cheaper than the pool side option. We enjoyed the rest of our stay from that moment on. In fact we have stayed in Waikiki five times now and I would have to say that the Park Shore is the best place to stay. Breakfast at Lulus or Starbucks was great and the beach across the road was easily accessible. It was good value, friendly staff and the shuttle to Alamoana was also great. Will be back soon I hope and next time will book direct with the hotel and ask for room 808.

This property is kind of basic but it absolutely has the most breath taking view of Diamond Head and of the ocean. Handy for the bus route and events in the park.Front desk was nice. The rollaway had sand in ti.

The pictures make the room seem like a nice size, and it couldn't be more wrong. The room is so tight you have to walk sideways to get into the bed. (We had a room with 1 queen size bed). Everything was small and tight about the room. Thankfully, we didn't stay in the room much because we were doing so much on the island. The other down side was the SMELL! The lobby and hallways everyday had this weird moldy smell. (even though the lobby is open to the outside).Only plus side about this hotel is how close it is to the beach and the parking lot across the street is only $1 per hour. (So don't valet!)

I am not sure was why this hotel is maintaining such a high score on Trip Advisor. Granted, the hotel is close to the beach, but it is an older hotel with few amenities, small rooms and most rooms have no view. I was totally disappointed with this place. It's like the "Motel 6" of Waikiki hotels. Not comfortable at all and a bit over priced. Do your research. You can find much better at a more reasonable price.

We selected the Park Shore due to the fact that it is right across the beach and is basically the last hotel on the busy Waikiki strip. While it is a little further out to other parts of Waikiki and Honolulu, we really were within walking distance to everything we needed. The beach is literally a couple hundred feet outside the front door, and the beach here was much less busy than beaches a few blocks away. The zoo and a large park are also across the street, giving lots of space to stretch out and enjoy some quieter time. Great routes for running in the morning. Lots of good local places (Leonards, Rainbow Drive In, local coffee shops) within walking distance of this hotel as well. If you are able, pay a little extra for a view. I don't normally say this, but it is worth it. All staff was very friendly and helpful the five days we were there, and the free Wi-Fi worked great. The only things that kept this from being a five star review were little things like limited hours for the pool (not open after dark, rarely opened before 9 am) and very minor tired edges around the hotel. A good hotel and good value compared to many of the other hotels we looked at in Waikiki.

One of the older hotels, with outside entry to the rooms but magnificently maintained. It has an old charm about it. Besides great staff & free Wifi it is has the best location of any hotel in Waikiki. On the northern most corner of Waikiki it is only across the road from Waikiki beach & the Honolulu Zoo. Diamond Head is only located just up the road. An ideal location for ideal viewing. You get all this at one of the best for value hotels in Waikiki. It has Lulu's bar attached to it on the first floor again overlooking the beach.

My husband and I chose the Park Shore Waikiki for our Honolulu stay for our first night in Hawaii. We had an ocean view on floor 17.We were greeted in a friendly manner later at night due to our delayed flight. We were quickly given a room and the staff gave their full attention to our check-in even though it was late. The room was clean and comfortable. The view was breathtaking. Being slightly away from the hustle and bustle of the beach walk and closer to Diamond Head provided a different and more relaxing Waikiki experience than we had 6 years ago when we visited. We were so impressed with the hotel that we booked our last night back on Oahu in the exact same room and paid in advance. We had to leave early the next morning due to running a race and were leaving for Maui, but we were excited to return for the last night of our trip. Upon returning to Oahu, the experience was as positive as the first. We were able to check in extremely early, which wasn't even a request of our own. The staff informed us of the unfortunate sewage spill and advised us not to go in the ocean. Even though it rained and we weren't able to go in the ocean on our last day, Park Shore helped us to wind down and get some rest before our long flight back to NJ.

Lovely room and front-house staff. Very clean and comfortable, with spectacular views. An easy walk along kalakuala ave to all the main attractions and restaurants. Only problem with this hotel is no room service for meals. Would definitely stay here again over other Waikiki hotels!

We just returned from a week's stay at the ParkShore. We were travelling as a family with my 2 teenage boys, so we booked the ocean front suite. We ended up on the 9th floor with a stunning view of Waikiki Beach. The suite had a nice bedroom and small living area with pullout sofa. My main reason for booking the suite was for the separation it offered in addition to the kitchenette. I wanted to be sure we could eat breakfast or snacks comfortably in our room. Worked out great. Pros:GREAT location at the less crowded end of the beach. Kitchenette with dishes, microwave, refridgerator and sink. Ocean front room offered stunning view.Comfy bedsSuite is priced rightValet is convenient when you have a car ($25/night charge)Cons:Main con was that its corner location had a bus stop on it. (Good if you're taking the bus, but horrible for noise in the AM.)Floor wasn't as clean as I would have liked Small pool areaOverall, I am happy we chose the Park Shore. We did so based off the reviews here on TA and once again, TA did not steer me wrong.I would definitely consider staying here again.

We purchased one of the nicer room options ( I forget which one) which put us at the 15th floor overlooking the beach. It was beautiful. Hotel offered free wifi, a paid valet service and towels/beach rentals.

This hotel is beautifully situated right across from the beach and the zoo and aquarium are within walking distance. Gorgeous lobby area and very welcoming and helpful staff. We had a standard room for just one night but ended up wishing we could stay longer. Would definitely stay here on my next trip and go for a higher grade room, just for a bit more space. They were happy to arrange a late check out for us as we were catching a night flight and also had a hospitality room you could use after checking out, including use of the pool, showers and towels. The pool was large with great views of the beach and Diamond Head.

We had the chance to stay at the Park Shore at the end of July. The hotel was clean and the staff was very kind. When we arrived, they updated us to a ocean view hotel too! That was a great bonus. The internet was great too. The lobby was more updated than the rest of the hotel and the rooms. But I had no complaints about the cleanliness of the room. When we got to the hotel, we noticed our fridge wasn't working, and that night it was serviced with no problems. The beach was right across the street, surf shops around the corner, it was great.The hotel is right on the strip. At night we would stroll the entire Waikiki strip. To get to the other end it is solid 15 minute walk, but it was great.

I just spent a week at Park Shore with my family in a Diamond Head suite. Although it was the smallest suite in which we've ever stayed, it had the necessities - clean bathroom, comfortable bed, wifi, little fridge, microwave, tiny sink, etc. Calling this room a "suite" is somewhat deceptive because it lacked counter space and a table on which to eat. These are the ONLY negatives we experienced, but they will not stop us from returning because there are many positives about this hotel. The location is perfect if you want to avoid the chaos of Waikiki. It is situated across from the zoo and across the street from the calmest stretch of beach in Waikiki; so it was perfect for my 2-year-old son. Snorkeling is also good just to the left of the wall across the street. Yoshitsune, the Japanese restaurant in the lobby, is very authentic and delicious. Tucker & Bevvy, which is also accessible from the lobby, offers quality sandwiches, fresh juices, and coffee. There are also other great dining options within walking distance. Overall, our stay was fantastic. The view from our balcony was quite stunning with Diamond Head in direct sight and picturesque Waikiki Beach directly across the street. The beds were very comfortable, and the room was quiet. We would definitely return. Mahalo nui, Park Shore!

My previous review was titled, "good hotel with a few problems". The hotel management contacted me and made a gesture of amends for the lost reservation. I can honestly say I feel the management does their best to make the customers of the hotel happy. Great job! If you have any questions, I recommend contacting the management directly for ensured satisfaction.

Checked on to this hotel for my bi-annual business trip. Brought my son along for this trip as he was still on his summer break. Picked this hotel because of its close proximity to Waikiki Beach. Upon arrival, I reminded the front desk "girl" that I requested for a room with 2 double beds when I made my reservations. I was informed then by the front desk "girl" that my room was not ready yet, and it would probably take about 10-20 minutes, and she would call me on my cell once it is ready. No problem. My son and I decided to wait it out in the lobby, since we were both tired from the flight in. About 10-15 minutes passed, and I noticed that other guests checking in were being processed and getting their room keys handed to them. I then walked up to the counter and inquired about the availability of my room. At this point, the "girl", just asked for my credit card, and drivers license, had me sign, and handed me the room keys. No "thank you for waiting", No "sorry for the wait", NOTHING ! Now the Valet Staff, on the other hand, are great ! Very friendly. Very accommodating. Always making themselves available for directions. Great Guys ! A few days prior to my departure, I had to print out my Boarding Pass. I asked the same "girl" about the use of a printer. She pointed out the Business Center, and was told that I would have to pay $5 for the use. I know it's only $5, but I was told that the use of the Business Center is included in the $20/day resort fee that I am charged. Didn't want to deal with her, so I paid the $5 to print 2 pages. Ridiculous !

I have just completed my 3rd stay at the Park Shore. The hotel is located at the very end of Waikiki Beach's strip of hotels, so the surrounding noise level is greatly reduced (versus other Waikiki hotels). The location is excellent in that it is only one of three hotels in Waikiki that has no major buildings between your balcony view and Diamond Head. It's only steps away from the Honolulu Zoo (located right across the street). You are close to everything - the beach, restaurants, shopping and the Honolulu Aquarium. There is an ABC store located in the hotel, as well as another ABC Store located about a 30 second walk from their front door. Lulu's Bar & Grill is open-air (with air conditioning) and located on the second floor of the hotel and offers good food, good prices and great views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Regarding their rooms, as with most all of the HNL hotels - you get what you pay for, so if you book a standard room with "partial ocean view," that's what you're going to get. However, if your dream room is of the ocean, then book and pay for an ocean view room and you will be very happy because you will get both ocean and Diamond Head views; Oceanfront gives you spectacular ocean views. The hotel is clean, the rooms are pretty well updated, the staff is very nice and accommodating and price compared to most decent Waikiki hotels is good. The reasonable room prices (on ocean view and ocean front), free WiFi, the hotel's location and room views are the best selling features of this hotel.

I was in Waikiki for a business dinner and the Park Shore was a great experience. All the parking is valet which is actually kind of nice (it's $25 a night but that's standard). The hotel is right across the street from the Honolulu Zoo and Waikiki Beach, but it's at the East end of the Waikiki strip so you avoid a lot of the foot traffic - overall great and very convenient location. The staff was very helpful and cheerful - all were pleasant to deal with. My room had a nice view of the pool, Diamond Head, and the beach. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Overall I very much enjoyed my experience and would return and recommend the Park Shore.

Although we only stayed 1 nite in this hotel by the ocean it was great. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Our room was upgraded to an ocean view from a standard room. In addition to that we found it very helpful that the hotel had room set aside for use by guests who had later flights. This room was utilized since we did not fly out until 9pm. We were able to not only use the hotel pool for the remainder of the day we were also able to take a shower and rest in the air conditioned room while watching football. We also at lunch at the restaurant attached to the hotel Lulu's on the 2nd floor. The nachos were HUGE!
user_name:
Marc A
New Brunswick, New Jersey

review_body: I booked this hotel several months ago based on reviews from tripadvisor. I was looking forward to experiencing all the great things about the hotel. We stayed from August 7-13. First, I will talk about the positives. As many have stated before, the location of the hotel is excellent being on the far western side of Waikiki. It is a little quieter than other parts of Waikiki. Most rooms have excellent views of the ocean. My wife and grandson really enjoyed the pool and pool deck. The room we had was clean, and well decorated. The deck was a decent size that could easily accommodate 4 people who want to sit and see the view and have a drink. The lobby of the hotel is large and nicely decorated. We enjoyed the coffee in the morning and the juice and water during the day. I would recommend that the hotel provide real milk or cream for the coffee. Using powdered creamer is not great. Go to the ABC store and buy a little real cream and keep it in your fridge to avoid this problem. I really liked the use of towels for the beach provided by the hotel.There are a few minor problems that should be mentioned, but should not affect your decision to stay. The elevators were a little slow. No big deal, but it is hard waiting 1-2 minutes for the elevator to arrive during busy times. Be aware that there is a $20 resort fee. This is annoying and I would rather pay a higher base rate for the hotel and not pay the resort fee. I think if the hotel advertised that they do not have a resort fee, they would have more happy travellers.Unfortunately, there were two serious problems that prevented me from giving this a 5 star review. First, when I arrived to the hotel, I found that they lost my reservation. This is confusing as I booked directly through the PARK Shore website. Also, I received an automated email from the hotel three days earlier about my reservation. They admitted that it was a clitch in their system. They honored my reservation after I provided proof, but this was incredibly stressful for me and my wife. I guess if you do book this hotel, please call several days before the day of arrival to personally confirm your reservation. An email confirmation is not enough obviously. The second major problem has to do with the hotel's room categorization. The hotel provides ocean front,ocean view, partial ocean and rooms with no view. Ocean view rooms face west towards Diamond head and also provide a great ocean view. The Ocean front rooms directly face the ocean. Ocean front rooms cost more. I decided that I would like the direct ocean front view and paid the higher price. The problem is that we were put on the 7 floor of a 13 floor building. Also, the room (721) was located closest to the Shore building so privacy was slightly infringed on. I paid the highest price and did not receive the full value for it. Any person who comes to this hotel will immediately see that corner rooms and higher story rooms are the best. What did I have to do to get one of those rooms considering I already paid the highest room rate? I should not have to call and beg for a great room. I want to pay the money and get the best room. At the very least, the Park Shore should make corner rooms a separate category of room and Ocean front rooms should be at least on the tenth floor or higher. If you are booking this hotel and getting a Ocean Front room, you are taking a risk and may not get the value you would hope for.I really wanted to give this hotel a 5 star review. There are many great things about this hotel, but the problems are serious and force me to only give a four star review.Good luck!

We arrived pretty late at night and had a really difficult time finding the valet entrance. We had to call them twice to figure it out. It's probably the tiniest valet spot I've ever seen. Oh and it's $25/night mandatory too. When we finally arrived at the front desk (admittedly we were all a little cranky) but the front desk person barely greeted us. It was, "Checking in?" Followed by questions of are "you are aware of our $20 daily hospitality fee right?" I barely responded, before she was making me sign an agreement confirming it. I asked her what it includes and she handed me a document to review later. It basically covered pool towels and Internet, both of which I didn't need. Then she reminded me of the valet fees. I felt it was overkill and her delivery was poor. We got a partial ocean view room. The room was small and the balcony was awkwardly small especially when you step out and your neighbors are right there too. I feel everything about this place was minimal. Only one wall picture for the entire room. Just seemed more like a motel room experience and I'm glad we only stayed two nights. Other complaints, the front desk not once greeted us when we arrived in the building (any time of day) and twice in two days a bus parked in front of the tiny valet parking strip so we drove around and around each time till it moved. I was not happy about that. Really, the only positive thing I can say is the valet staff who were very nice each time and it's a great location. There's two convenience stores and a Starbucks next to or attached to the hotel. And the hotel is next door to the zoo and within walking distance of restaurants and other stores too. Our checkout didn't go smoothly either as they wanted us to return pool towel cards that we never received. I think maybe the guy was new because someone else had to step in to see that we declined the extra towels. The whole overall experience was not great and the next time we go I'll consider one of the many other hotels in the area.

Great location on Waikiki beach and easily accessible to restaurants and bars. Directly across from the beach, and awesome that they provide beach towels and chairs upon request. The staff was 100% friendly and attentive. would definitely stay there again if visiting Waikiki beach.

Booked this hotel with an oceanfront room. Upon arrival they said they had upgraded us to a jr suite. We were impressed....arrived at room to find an ocean view....as well as an ugly rooftop view NOT ocean front. Room was clean but tiny and had a handicapped bathroom with fold down seat and almost no lip on the floor so entire bathroom would get wet during a shower. Best thing about the place was Lulus restaurant/bar downstairs. Beach across the street is also nice but feel like they overbooked then lured us with the "suite" word and gave up the ocean front we were promised. Won't be back.

The hotel's position is ideal, as it is across the road from Waikiki beach and close to the zoo. If you are interested in a beach holiday extra towels etc are provided for the beach, although I never took advantage of this service myself. My room was quite large with all the expected facilities, TV, desk, refrigerator etc, with a clean and well appointed bathroom. The king size bed was very comfortable with a supportive, good quality mattress. Housekeeping was excellent and each day I returned after a day out and my room would be magically restored to a pristine condition. I booked into an ocean view room and was not disappointed as I had had a wonderful view of the beach from my balcony. The chairs on the balcony are an ideal position in which recline, take in the view, have an evening drink, watch the sun set over the water, or to observe the night life below. From the other side of the hotel on a public walkway there is a wonderful view of Diamond Head.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The view of the park and the the beach was amazing. Plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance. Easy shuttle service to the airport (Speedi shuttle). The Waikiki area was far better than I expected. It was a clean beautiful city with a beautiful beach. A nice place to walk around in the town, the park, or along the beach.
user_name:
Mike M
New Windsor, New York

review_body: What a beautiful location. Since it is right at the end of the strip of hotels, you aren't surrounded by tourists. The Honolulu Zoo next door and Diamond Head park gives a wonderful view of nature as well. But you aren't deserted either. Pickup locations are conveniently close and there is a sandwich shop and Starbucks right next door. The greatest thing about this hotel is its concierge Francis! She is amazing. My friends and I sat down in front of her on our first day with nothing reserved and only vague ideas of what we wanted to do. She seemed to sense immediately what we desired and helped plan a wonderful trip for us with just the right amount of pacing so that we never got too tired. She also remembered us as our vacation went on. When we passed she would ask how everything was going and even remembered little details we had told her about our lives and gave suggestions based off of that. Park Shore is lucky to have her there, she is definitely the best part!

Having found this hotel on the internet after trolling through hundreds I was a bit concerned whether I had chose the right one. Location Location is all I can say.. Absolutely awesome! The staff are extremely friendly and gave us a big wide smile on arrival, we were also upgraded to a partial ocean view room with a king bed and it was fabulous. Right across the road from the rock pool and food, shopping etc only minutes away.. Great little tuck shop underneath which sell sandwiches, paninis etc at very reasonable prices. Loved it and wouldn't stay anywhere else on return to Honolulu.

I was pretty excited when I booked this hotel on Hotwire. It had good reviews and seemed like an excellent location. Here's what's wrong...1. Upon checking in, I asked for a room on an upper floor with a view (as many on Trip Advisor recommended).2. I was given a room on the 8th floor of 18 floors. Yes, I could "upgrade" for $55 a night." Huh? This defeats the purpose of using a discount site.3. My view was of another hotel some 50 feet away. Yes, I could look out on people drying their bathing suits and underwear on their lanais.4. There is a lanai, but you cannot sit out on it. It is too small and there are no chairs.5. Can you imagine a hotel room totally without a chair? This was the case. If you wanted to check your email, you had to sit on the edge of the bed. I asked for a chair and one was delivered but that was it. Not very comfortable.6. Worst of all is a failure by Hotwire and the hotel. When Hotwire tells you that you have gotten a great deal, they ignore the fact that they failed to tell you that the hotel will charge you $20 a night extra for 'resort fees." $20 a night! This is a rip off that allows the hotel and Hotwire to deceive people into thinking they are getting a bargain when they are not. Shame on both!7. When you read reviews for this hotel, be aware that the positive reviews are for the so-called premium rooms. Standard rooms are a joke!8. I did give the hotel two stars since it was clean. Would we stay here again? Absolutely not!

Stayed here in April 2015 with 2 friends and had a wonderful time. The staff were fabulous, very friendly, welcoming and accommodating. We asked for a kettle and extra pillows, as well a roll away bed and they were very quick to accommodate us.I have stayed at other hotels in Waikiki on 2 previous stays and the customer service did not compare. The WiFi was very good and not only worked in the room, but also by the pool. Less than a mile away is Diamond Head Bakery, I highly recommend it especially for the Blueberry Cream Cheese Scones, which are amazing! Also highly recommend Lulu's which is the restaurant at the Front of the hotel, the food was really good and the Mai Tai's are the best! Am returning in January 2016, this time with my husband to celebrate both our 25th wedding anniversary as well as my 60th birthday and definitely want stay at the Park Shore again.

On the western edge of the Waikiki strip - steps away from the beach, zoo, and park. It was nice to be out of the mainstream Waikiki beach area with all the benefits of the beautiful coastline. Also close to diamond head (which is worth a visit). Rooms were small and basic, but clean and well stocked. One of our rooms was ocean view and had a nice balcony. Good system to get beach towels. Very helpful and friendly staff.

Waikiki beach has been a family favorite holiday destination for as long as I can remember. We have traditionally favored the bigger, more "centrally" located hotels. I recently took a friend to Hawaii for the first time, and due to our budget restraints, we were looking for something smaller and down the quieter end of the beach. We booked Park Shore on recommendation from friends who had loved it. I was expecting basic, simple and tired. Instead I was met with a fresh, modern hotel with exceptional staff, clean and comfortable rooms, free yoga, one of the best pool decks I've had in Waikiki with simultaneous views of the ocean and Diamond Head, and the Strip right on our doorstep. Highlights included the Managers Night on the pool deck, 'Tucker and Beve' the cade downstairs, and having access to the Hospitality Room on our last afternoon pre-departure. We were treated like guests until the moment our shuttle arrived...not like other hotels where check out is goodbye! I will absolutely be back! Thanks Park Shore!

We purchase our Hawaii travel through Costco Travel service. Several other hotels with various rating were offered.
