We selected this one because it had a 4.3 out of 5 rating in the customer reviews and the location seemed to be ideal. Park Shore was an excellent choice. I strongly recommend for several reasons. Location was perfect. It is on the quieter end of the Waikiki Beach which is just a step out of the hotel and across the street. The hotel lobby area and the room decor was tastefully done. The hotel had such a nice warm feel,not so large that people were everywhere. The room was a bit on the smaller size but ample. It was well appointed with refrigerator, coffee maker, and safe. The entire staff was most hospitable. We paid for an ocean front room view room. I called ahead of time to ask to please give us a nice room as were celebrating our 50th anniversary and it was our first time to the island. Management made sure we had what I considered the best room in the hotel room -1607. Our view from the corner room was just awesome. From one set of windows we had Diamond Head mountains and a ocean view from the balcony. On the other corner window we had a complete view of Waikiki Beach. The balcony was large enough for us with two chairs and a table to comfortably.enjoy and watch sunrise and sunset. Our pleasant surprise was the bottle of champagne with two champagne glasses and a box of chocolate that arrived shortly after arriving to our room. Thanks so much to the night manager who checked back with us to see if everything was delivered and if we had any other need. On Wednesday we were invited to a afternoon meet and greet reception with management staff to see how stay was going or any suggestions we could offer for improvement. We were unable to attend because we had to catch the bus for our luau. It was just nice to be invited. Another great reason to stay here is that the hotel provides round trip transportation to the Ala Moana Mall. It really was convenient to have the ABC store adjacent to the hotel. Car rentals are also available right from the hotel site. The food was good at LuLu Grill upstairs over the ABC. Since we were on the 16th floor we didn't here any noise from the nightspot.Our stay at the Park Shore Hotel was really awesome. I definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here on any return visit. I wish I could remember names so I could personally thank them.
user_name:
Carrie H
Memphis, Tennessee, United States

review_body: My brother and I stayed 8 days and unfortunately we couldn't get above the 4th floor however it was not a problem. The noise from the street nor from the pool bother us. They close the pool at sunset so there's no noise to disturb you if you're going to bed early. We loved the location because it was not so congested as other hotel further up the street. Not so many tourist although the hotel was full. The hotel staff was very helpful especially Joey at the valet desk, he's a weath of info. The proximity to the zoo, aquarium and beach will be an excellent location for my grands' next vacation. We witness an incident the day of our arrival, an eniberated female was singing at the top of her voice in the lobby, David, one of the manager, went over to her to quiet her down. He asked if she was a hotel guest, asked her name and where did she live. He was so courteous and kind to her. He didn't speak to her in a threatening manner at all. He was so courteous and kind to her. We did have an issue with rental car. It wasn't there at the time it was promised but it wasn't the hotel's fault but Volvo's who wasn't respond to phone calls.

Rooms were quite small compared to other places for the same price, however, it was very clean. Located right at the end of the strip, away from the popular restaurants and shops, and was quite a walk after a long night. Balcony was small and unfurnished, so couldn't even enjoy it. Staff were great though. Less amenities than other hotels. Overall would find better value for money at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.

Good location opposite beach and zoo. At the end of the hotel strip so not as noisy and crowded as some other hotels, but still close to some good eateries.Upgradedto an oceanfront room, well worth the view. Balconies big enough to sit out and enjoy the view.Efficent and friendly staff, checking in and out was easy.Would stay here again

We had stunning views from the 16th floor during a week's stay at the Park Shore for our anniversary trip this July. Most of the park Shore's rooms offer coastline or direct ocean views for a reasonable tariff with floor to ceiling windows and large balconies. The coastline views were wonderful with balconies that offered plenty ofshade throughout the day. The 'wow' factor remained off the chart for our entire stay.The rooms are on the small side, but are well appointed and there was plenty of storage space for a week's stay. The bed was comfortable and a large, wall mounted TV was a nice touch. The bathroom was small with only a shower, but the shower head was nice and the water pressure good. The single sink and counter were a bit low, but pleasing to the eye and clean. Housekeeping did an excellent job all week. Our room stayed lovely all week. The room had a small refrigerator and access to a microwave (pool level), so drinks and even boxes from restaurants can be managed. A coffeemaker is provided (we never used it), and the hotel provides fresh coffee in the lobby beginning around 7:00AM. Water and a tropical punch are available for guests in the lobby throughout the rest of the day. An ABC store entrance is off the lobby of the hotel making shopping for convenience items a snap (including liquor at reasonable prices). Lulus is a quaint, beachfront open air restaurant that can be accessed from the hotel's 2nd floor foyer. We enjoyed made to order breakfast at Lulus daily. There many eateries and shops of all kinds within walking distance of the Park Shore. Waikiki beach is at your disposal. Parking is a premium at the Park Shore. The hotel's driveway is tiny and on a busy corner which keeps the valet staff hustling, but they did a nice job of retrieving the car quickly and were always helpful at the curb. Beach towels and chairs were provided as a part of the 'resort fee' attached to the room tariff. A shuttle to/from a local mega mall was also provided. Access to Honolulu and the rest of Oahu from the Park Shore by car was very good...bring a GPS!We highly recommend the Park Shore.

The service was amazing. Each day we returned, the room was tidy. We were provided with beach towels to use at the pool, beach and road trip. Beach chairs were also available. The front desk was helpful when inquirying about taking a bus to the Swap Meet at Aloha Stadium. I was able to rent a car through them on short notice and was pleased with the Volvo SUV. The location was perfect for shopping and walking to great restaurants for any budget. Best of all was my 9th floor view of the ocean and park. My 3 days were tranquil.

We just got back from a week at the Park Shore Waikiki. Loved it! The staff were wonderful, the room (we got upgraded to an ocean view) was very spacious, had all that we needed and the view was spectacular. Starbucks on site, as well as Yoshitsune where we had dinner one night (amazing authentic Japanese food) and Lulu's where we had many a meal - you can't beat the view from there either. Loved the pool area and proximity to the beach is second to none. Just a short stroll into the heart of Waikiki, yet far enough away to be deemed the 'quiet' end. Would definitely recommend Park Shore Waikiki and already planning to be back next Feb!

I am planning a trip to Waikiki, Hawaii. I did a lot of research and decided that the Park Shore Waikiki was the best place to stay for our week. I made arrangements through David Maciel. He did the absolute best reservation for us and demonstrated his wonderful patience more than once. My husband and I are thrilled at the prospect of staying at Park Shore later this year. We haven't even been there yet, and we are so happy with the fantastic service provided, especially by David. Thank you, David!

Very nice hotel.Close to the beach. The room was nice. I would highly recommend the Park Shore and I particularly would like to thank you Leno for all of her help during our stay. I would totally go back.

The Park Shore is one of the many high-rise hotels and apartments lining the famous Waikiki beach, across the road from the Honolulu zoo and park.The welcoming reception included cold towels and fruit juice, plus a room 'upgrade' - which resulted in nice expansive views of the surf, but also happened to also include a large disabled bathroom, with fold-down seat in the shower and no shelf for toiletries near the wash-basin. The room itself was quite small, with minimal facilities, e.g. no wine glasses, plates or cutlery (only a bottle-opener). We were reasonably comfortable for our one-night stay, but would've found the room a bit cramped for a longer period.Although there is no hotel dining facility, there are four restaurants conveniently located adjacent to the lobby.

We stayed at this hotel for nine days 20/6/201 - 29/6/2015. It is an older hotel in a quiet location with ocean bath across the street and walking distance to restaurants. We paid $440 AUD per night for an ocean view room and for that price we expected breakfast or airport pick up or that get our linen change everyday or every second day. None of these were included in the rates. Our friends stayed in Hyatt Place, around the corner from us at the same time. It is newer hotel, better bathroom facilities, larger rooms with lounge area, breakfast and airport transfer included for the same rate. If you compare the hotels, the service and amenities I will not be staying in Park Shore Inn again.

My husband and I were visiting Oahu as part of our babymoon, and I found it really hard to find an affordable place in Waikiki that was also clean and well-maintained. The Park Shore Waikiki was the nicest hotel that was in my price range and by the beach. It's very basic, meaning no frills--room was tiny, bathroom cramped (hard to shave legs in), pretty sure no room service although a lot of local places deliver. The bathroom doesn't even have a proper locking door, just a pocket door. The lanai was nice (we splurged on an ocean view room), but was somewhat ruined by noise from the pool below (even though we were on the 15th floor) and from the beach across the street. the hotel in general was very LOUD. There's a fairly major road right there so you get traffic noise, including some really loud trucks at night. Then there's the beach noise--music, kids, etc. This is definitely not a hotel you come to for a relaxing retreat. Still great views from the ocean view lanai, though. And the staff was great and very helpful. Location is pretty ideal, right on the edge of Waikiki. It was still very touristy, crowded, and noisy, but at least on one side you had the park and the Honolulu Zoo, so you weren't surrounded on all sides by Waikiki craziness. There's a Starbucks literally steps away, which was great for breakfast--but keep in mind, the line was ALWAYS almost out the door, literally. Plan accordingly. There are two convenience stores, one on either side of the hotel! Tons of restaurants a short walk away. The beach is right there, easy to get to...just very crowded, but that's Waikiki for you. This is not a romantic hotel at all, just FYI. The room felt really cramped compared to the other two hotels we stayed at on this trip, and we were among the only guests without kids here. The pool is basically useless because it's overrun with small children, and their screams echo from the pool...so relaxing on your lanai is difficult, even from the 15th floor like I said! You also hear kids at the beach across the street (amazing how far sound travels). DEFINITELY don't get a lower-level room if you're trying to have a relaxing vacation. I would also avoid the third floor in particular because that's where the pool access is...so you'd have people constantly streaming by your room.The mandatory valet parking is annoying ($25/day) but it makes sense once you realize how crowded Waikiki is and how expensive parking is. I can't imagine what the hotel pays for the lot. The valets were always friendly and got the car pretty fast.This was a fine stay and was "affordable" by Waikiki standards. I am just used to bigger rooms I guess, and to hotels that aren't quite so family-friendly (nothing against kids of course, I just don't necessarily want to be outnumbered by them when I'm on vacation). Honestly, that's just Waikiki though--it's a mix between Disney World (with lots of families) and spring break (with lots of oiled- and liquored-up beachgoers). To be fair, we were there over the 4th, so I'm sure it was crazier than usual--the crowds did subside a little once the weekend passed, but the North Shore or other parts of Oahu were much more our speed. On a sidenote, definitely rent a car or you'll miss the magic of Oahu--there are so many gorgeous beaches, cliffs, and vistas--don't limit yourself to Waikiki!This hotel is fine, just a little cramped and dated, and definitely not quiet or relaxing. But I think you'll have to spend a fortune or just leave Waikiki altogether if you want that! It's a fine place to stay if you want to be close to the beach and shopping, restaurants, etc. Just don't expect a lot of space or peace and quiet and you'll be fine!

My husband and I loved the Park Shore, its located right in the mix of all the fun Waikiki has to offer. It is a few steps from the beach, the zoo and bus stops for tour's. The staff and service they provide is excellent! they treat all there guest like VIP's.They have the best restaurant and bar called Lu Lu's right on the property. I couldn't recommend the Park Shore enough!!You do have to pay $25 a day for the valet parking and the resort fee, but other that that there wasn't any nickel and dimming going on.

My wife and I stayed there in May of this year. Wonderful staff at the desk. We had an ocean view room- beautiful view of the beach and ocean from our patio, wonderful view of Diamondhead from our door. Comfortable and clean room. Great patio. We loved looking out over the Pacific. The Park Shore is at the southeast end of Waikiki, right across the street from the beach. It's the next best thing to a beach front hotel. The lobby staff were very friendly and helpful. One woman even brought my wife some of her Hawaiian cookbooks to have. My wife and I will stay here any time we come to honolulu.

This place is a find! Great location on waikiki beach and right by the zoo but the main thing I want to rave about is the staff. Such wonderful people working here that want to accommodate guests and make them feel at home. This hotel offers 5* service at a 3* price- which is a rare find! Tip: they offer beach chairs and umbrellas at the front desk to bring down to waikiki which is super convenient!

I booked this hotel to propose to my girlfriend. I called reservations and spoke to Natalie who was very helpful and proactive in finding me a nice room on the property. Afterwards I reached out to David, the manager, who asked that I call him to discuss the special occasion. He found me a really amazing package and upgraded my room. We were overlooking the beach and diamond head. It was very lovely and a great value for the special occasion. David was great to work with and I regret that we didn't cross paths through my stay.The room was comfortable, clean and had good amenities. Staff were wonderful, especially Michelle at the front desk, who remembered us through our stay and was very excited for our engagement. The ABC in the hotel, little breakfast shop and attached bar make this feel like a true resort. And the beach is literally RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET!.

Excellent! Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms always clean and comfy. Will be back! Enjoyed our 5 day stay . Exceptional views of diamond head and beach. Great location. Easy walk around Wakaii. Great shopping.

Stayed 3 nights with my husband and two teen boys. Our room on the 12th floor with an ocean view was great. Even though you are across the street from the beach you are up so high you only sea the amazing surf out your balcony. We loved it. When I called to book two rooms I found out they have a two room suite not on their website. It was not only cheaper than two rooms but it had a really nice living room plus a small kitchen with a fridge and microwave. No place to really cook but was a nice surprise. The beds were nice and comfortable. The only issue was they didn't provide feather pillows as an option and the ones they had were too hard. I tried calling one day and the front desk said they never have them. After another night I decided to try again and escalate to management if I needed to. We loved this place and they had great service so it didn't make sense. Turned out that the next front desk person was more optimistic and was able to s rouge some up. Yeah! The bathrooms in each side were great and our master suite even had a bidet! The products were all nice and they were spacious enough although our master bath was much bigger than the standard double room our sons had.One night they had a reception with just chips and pretzels and punch but it was nice. Their pool is an ok size and they usually always had chairs available. There is no poolside service or jacuzzi. The interns worked everywhere without a hitch. We would have liked a gym but with e beach and walking paths so close we got plenty of exercise. This is a relatively small hotel with plenty of restaurants nearby. We at at Lulus next door 4 times for different meals. We loved their upstairs open views of the water. Although this isn't a luxury hotel we fell in love with our suite and that it was in a great location with good service and activities. We could hear some traffic noise below but with our sliding doors closed at night we slept just fine Some rooms have outside entrances and some have hallways.

We stayed here for 8 nights and had two rooms both overlooking the ocean/zoo. It was a great location on the strip and cheapest hotel with ocean views.The rooms themselves are nicely sized with a small balcony with two chairs, many a night spent watching the sunsets over the horizon .

I travelled with my 19 yo daughter and my girlfriend and her daughter,so girly trip.We book ocean front room that cost us $1500 for 3 night,so what did we get for it??View is stunning over waikiki beach and Diamond Head,very close to shps ,restaurants..everything else was total disaster.Hotel is very old and worn out,rooms are small and bathroom minimal with no cupboard or shelving to put your cosmetics not to mention make up-we had to pile all on small fridge cupboard The room was clean but out-dated, daggy curtains and valence had old stain marks on. Sheets were of such poor quality that I had to check 3 times that they were actually fresh ones-all crinkly.

Friendly and helpful staff at check-in through check-out. Fantastic room, although a little small, with beautiful view of the OCEAN and POOL. Celebrating 40th wedding anniversary and 2nd visit to Oahu. Could have paid more elsewhere but not had anything better. Could walk to anything on Waikiki in minutes. Two minutes across the street to the beach. WOW!!!

My girlfriend and I upgraded to a beach view room and it was well worth it. Outstanding views on the beach, diamond head and the sunset. The pool was clean and crisp and the restaurant had exceptional food. Walking distance to beaches, pools and lots of shopping.

Coming from Los Angeles in an American Airlines 5.30 hour trip with a bunch of young couples with tired and shouting kids , we finally arrived at Honolulu Airport in Oahu , capital of Hawaii , the Aloha State .From the very first moment on land , my daughter and I felt relaxed with that typical mixture of heat and a high degree of humidity .That feeling reminded us of vacation .We headed to Avis counter in the airport to get our red Mustang Convertible … Nobody was there. It looked as if it were closed for ages . We were told that we’d rather get a van to get to the outdoors office . So , that is exactly what we did . A nice man helped us with the boring burocracy and we went to the hotel . Park Shore Waikiki is nicely placed , just in Waikiki beach . Our car was taken to the underground garage and we walked to the front desk . And --- I must warn you … If you do not take elevators because of claustrophobia like me … You have a problem … We were told that the use of stairs was difficult since the doors that led to them were locked . We were given the chance to tell anyone on the front desk whenever we needed . But finally I just made my best and sweating more than ever I could do it going in the elevator at least twice a day , one week long … . It is important and fair to say that I was given the chance to go upstairs and downstairs as often as I wanted . But I didn’t want to disturb the employees once and again .Breakfast is not included but never mind as you have a Starbucks next to the hotel where everybody queues since early .Waikiki beach is overcrowded with lots of people and orange/yellow sun umbrellas are scattered everywhere. Waikiki’s main road is a nice place to stroll . There , you will see almost everyone carrying their surf board all along the street when coming from the beach or when heading there . Awesome !Besides , you will see shops with the best brands ever . Though the humidity is very high I felt in Heaven … At midnight , having dinner at a nice restaurant , facing the waves with a light dress. Nice music …Waikiki , is ok but follow my piece of advice and discover the island . You will find virgin beaches with turquoise waters , amazing mountains with luxuriant vegetation , a difficult language with never ending words like ” Kamehamehai “ a former king in front of an official building . A statue in black with golden bonnet and clothes that will sound familiar to you as it appears in all episodes in “ Hawai-5.0 “ …Summarising , the hotel is a nice choice for a one- week trip with a perfect location and affordable prices

Just finished a very comfortable stay at the Park Shore. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite which was perfect for the two parents and 18 year old twins. Pros:1. Perfect location. Across the street from the beach and next to the zoo. Sitting on your balcony and being able to see green space and beach instead of high rises makes the the room the best in Waikiki. Diamond Head is the next tall structure east.2. In the building is an outstanding sports bar with ocean views, a very authentic Japanese restaurant, Starbucks and a very healthy breakfast/lunch takeout place. All the basics that are needed for a casual and affordable eating experience. Also the surfboard rental office is off the lobby as is the ABC.3. The 1 bedroom suite was renovated with a decent size fridge, a queen comfortable couch which the 18 year olds were fine with in the separate living room, and wonderful master bedroom. The bathroom was well appointed.4. Staff was very friendly to us and always helpful.5. They have a discounted rate at the 24 hour fitness which is 4 blocks away.6. Blackout drapes in both rooms. Amazingly many hotels lack this.Cons:1. Regular rooms are basic size and some have lackluster views. 2. No self parking.3. No fitness room in house.If you are looking for a comfortable well appointed hotel that has a boutique feel to it, then this is it. If you are looking for a more expensive and pretentious hotel, then there are plenty others in Waikiki to pick from. Would definitely stay here on our next visit to Waikiki.

Arrived tired at 10-30pm Saturday evening after a long plane flight, only to be met by a rude receptionist. The porter asked if he could take our bags to our room, the receptionist told him, NO they can do it themselves. Welcome to Hawaii, this is how they treat their guests. Then for several nights at 3am woken up by the loud air conditioning fans outside the building, the noise, yet we were on the 17th floor. Again the receptionist couldn't care less. The adjoining restaurant does not reserve seats for hotel guests even though the website states its part of the complex. Great place to stay - NOT.,

Step outside of the hotel and you'll find a Starbucks, two ABC stores (one is inside the hotel and has more inventory), a bus stop, Waikiki beach, the zoo, the aquarium (10-minute walk), and of course restaurants. Inside the hotel you'll find just the necessary basics, but the views of both Diamond Head crater and Waikiki beach simultaneously make it a location difficult to beat!

Stayed here 5 nights. The hotel itself is on the older side but it makes up for it by having a fantastic location. It's located at the end of the strip by the beach and next to the zoo so it's relatively quieter and less busy, and has a view of both the beach and Diamond head. There's also some great food right downstairs (Lulu's and Yoshitsune).Just some notes, there is a $20 hotel fee per day and no included breakfast.

We booked Park Shore 7 nights via a mystery bid on HotWire and we couldn't have been happier. We didn't get an ocean view room, but from our balcony (which faced the back of the Aston Waikiki, see photo) we could look through the two buildings to catch a glimpse of the ocean. We had a corner room, which also had a view of the back of Waikiki. We were on the 16th floor and had a room near the lifts, I was worried about noise, but aside from someone incorrectly knocking on our door one night, we never heard a thing. There is a balcony off the lift area that has a brilliant view of Diamond Head, over the zoo, and the beach.The pool on level 3 is brilliant - has a gorgeous view of the beach and Diamond Head.Service was friendly. Wifi was brilliant. Rooms were always clean and cool. Towel access was great too, though sometimes you would have to wait for staff to notice you waiting.Location-wise we love that end of Waikiki. It is quieter, plus you have quick access to the baths at the beach. There are 2 ABC Stores underneath, and internal access to one of them, and Lulu's restaurant/bar. We could walk out of Waikiki to Rainbow Drive-in and a few restaurants/shops in 10 minutes which was great. Also, just a 10 minute walk to the centre of Waikiki.

We didn't book until we arrived as we had a day before we went on a cruise and needed to book for the week after, we wanted to stay at the outrigger and was hoping to get a deal with them, but when we turned up if was so congested and touristy ,so my husband suggested the parkshore ,he'd looked it up before we went so it was about a 15 min walk, when we got there they showed us a room and we loved it ,right opposite the beach and as we were at the end of the strip ,no hotels to block the view. Wifi was good and the Zoo is right next door. Bus stop at the front so you dont really even need a car cause everything was still in walking distance and it was just so relaxing. Lulus upstairs has amazing food, the only downside is no room service as my husband hurt his back and we ended up having to stay another 7 days ,he was stuck in the room but the service was amazing they even brought us a microwave so we could heat his heatpack. We are going again Sept 2016 and will be definitely staying here

For an International quality traveler Waikiki is soooo overpriced for the service you get. This hotel can be found last minute at good price, and I would say much better than many mega hotels around. I have never been bothered by people at this place, even at near- full capacity you'll have your privacy. It's right across the street from the not- so- crowded Waikiki Beach area, much faster trip to the beach than from the " Mega Hotels" 20th floor.. Good place for " People Watching" near Starbucks downstairs. Everything is within reach, and walking distance from here. If you're not fancy- I recommend Park Shore after 3 stays here , and an experience from Hilton Waikiki Village (way too crowded and impersonal for me)...This hotel offers just enough of quality to be in the middle of the Waikiki activity...

We had a great corner upper floor room with views of te ocean and diamond head. Perfect location for our 30 anniversary. We will be back. Good snorkling accross the street at the beach. Night life was great. Good food and drinks at hotel restaurant.

Very nice hotel across from park and Waikiki Beach. Staff were all very good. Had a Diamond Head suite on the 17th floor. Beautiful views! Lulu's Restaurant and Bar is attached to hotel and many nice eateries are nearby. ABC store is also attached.

We chose to stay at the quieter end of town for this visit and were delighted with this hotel. The staff are accommodating and genuine and there is convenient access to the popular Lulus and Hulas bars. The hotel is located on a main street corner and a bus route so expect some traffic noise during the day. Makes for watching-the-world-go-by from the balcony though. Good sized pool on the 3rd floor with plenty of chairs, with a nice view of the beach too. The rooms aren't opulent but are comfortable, clean, and everything works including the hassle-free WiFi. The balcony is a good size with comfy chairs & table for those sunset drinks. We expected the oceanfront rooms to be at the very front of the building, but they are actually corner rooms - still facing the oceanfront but with the added bonus of a fantastic view of Diamond Head, the park & zoo to the other side/around the corner. Just lovely.

To begin with, note that their address is false. There is no hotel or anything, or even a building with the number 2586 on Kalakaua avenue. Strong desire to present themselves as located on the most prestigious Kalakaua Ave forced the Park Shore owners to misrepresent their true location, which is actually on Kapahulu Ave. From Kalakaua you need to turn on Kapahulu, pass the Starbucks and only then you will find youself at the entrance to the Park Shore hotel. Quite confusing.Misi at the check-in was very pleasant and helpful, checked me in quickly. My room on the 10th floor was small, but nice and very clean. Shower stall was tiny and reminded me of toilets on airplanes. The bed was comfy, the flat screen TV worked fine. All rooms have very small (yes, again this word: small!) balconies. They are too narrow to put even a single chair in it, so not much use of them. And the view was straight into the wall of another building, with a glance of the ocean visible on the left.The following morning, around 11 am, a fire alarm sounded, followed by a loud, harsh warning: "FIRE! FIRE! Leave your room immediately! Do not use elevators! Climb the stairs down to the lobby!" What a shock!!! The scary, stressful warning was repeated multiple times. I ran out of my room and started my 10-story descent down with my heart pounding badly (I am a 65 years old cancer patient, also suffering from a serious heart condition). In the lobby we were told that this was only a drill, that there's no fire. Really?! So I've paid $220+ per night, hoping to have a relaxing, comfortable stay, but instead suffered a stunning shock, was forced to run 10 stories down via a stairway, for no reason at all? (Don't tell me they wanted to teach their guests how to run down the stairs).I expressed my dismay to the management and was immediately offered an apology and a promise to refund one night stay to me. They claimed a flier with the information about the upcoming fire drill was distributed to all occupied rooms, but in reality it was shoved under my room's door only about 10 minutes after I returned to my room from the outrageous "drill". Why then still 4 stars? Well, I really received their promised refund in a couple of days, seemingly managed to recover from all that stress. All employees were very nice to me. Everything else was just fine.The location is perfect. Beach is across the Kalakaua avenue. Honolulu zoo is across the Kapahulu Ave. Plenty of eating places right there.

Stayed for three nights (well 2 and a tiny bit as my flight was delayed and I didn't arrive until 2:45am) in June 2015. It is located right at the southern end of the strip near the zoo. An easy stroll to the nightlife when you want it but you can escape the hustle and bustle if you desire.We had booked an ocean view room and we were upgraded to a suite on the top floor which was nice. The staff were helpful and it was good value for money ... for Waikiki.Rated as 4 rather than 5 just because the room was clean and comfortable but just felt a little 'tired'. The elevators and common hallway were the same ... not totally up to date. But overall, very good.

Booked this hotel six months ago for our silver wedding anniversary. Asked for a high room with a view when booking through travel agent. Brochure suggests that rooms face either the beach or Diamond Head, but don't mention that a proportion of rooms face the back of the hotel. We faced the hotel next door and were greeted every morning by aussies hanging out their beachware on their balconies. If we craned our necks over our balcony we could just see the beach. Asked to change rooms when we checked in but were told by reception that occupancy was high and there was little they could do. If we wanted a view then we would have to pay an extra 55 dollars per night and for 10 days we found that price unacceptable. We were told that we had booked a double room and that was what they had given us, but we only needed one double bed and we had two so surely we were in a family room. No attempt was made to move us in 10 days. It wasn't the romantic location we were expecting. We could have stayed at the Hilton for less and I bet we would have got a better view!

We stayed for just one night before heading back home. They are really friendly and happy to help. The room is nice and clean. The crib provided for our son is comfortable and he slept well in it (not all hotel cribs are so good - looking at you Aston Banyan!). They stowed our bags until our evening transfer arrived. Would definitely recommend.

I stayed here one evening after my daughter and her family departed. The rooms are small but they are clean , modern, and comfortable. You would be hard pressed to find similar quality at this price in Waikiki. The beach is across the street as is the zoo. The aquarium is a little further down the road.I would have rated it 5 stars except for the size of the room.

This hotel is situated at the quiet end of Waikiki beach. Although rooms are small, they are clean, quiet and beds are very comfortable! Staff at service counter very friendly. Also able to book day tours, eg. Pearl harbour tour, from hotel lobby. Fast wi fi. Pool side relaxing. We struck it lucky booking here!

Although there is nothing fancy about this hotel, it is a great find in usually very expensive Waikiki. Our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 teens) had a large room overlooking pool. They were out of rooms with 2 queens, so without hesitation, they arranged for 2 cots (with pretty nice mattresses for a cots). Location across street from zoo, park and beach. The hotel provides beach towels and beach chairs. Parking here is also only $25 per day compared to $35+ at other hotels and resort fee only $20 per day..much less then other hotels. Very clean hotel, friendly staff, great location. If we are every lucky enough to return to Oahu, will definitely try to stay here again.

Yes, the rooms are small. But they are comfortable and very clean, with refrigerator, coffee machine, and great bath products. We paid a little extra for ocean front and had a corner room on the 12th floor with views of Diamond Head and Waikiki. All the hotels on Waikiki are across the street, but from inside the room, it appears as if you're right on the beach. From our balcony we could watch the Women's Beach Volleyball Invitational. We wondered who those tall, blonde girls on the elevator were Our room faced west, so we kept the curtains closed while we were gone during the day to keep it cooler. As people have mentioned, this end of Waikiki is much quieter. Just walking a few blocks north the crowds and noise increased. But everything was very convenient. We walked to dinner all three nights and paid numerous visits to Starbucks and the ABC stores. But the highlight of the Park Shore are the people. The staff all were helpful, friendly, and went out of their way to assist with dinner reservations or helpful advice. They suggested a dim sum restaurant whose parking lot would be a safe place to leave our car with luggage in the trunk. And it was delicious! Mahalo to everyone at the Park Shore!

I stayed at two hotels due to personal reasons for this trip. One is the pacific beach hotel with partial ocean view, one is the park shore Waikiki with ocean view. Although at about the same price per night, Pacific Beach Hotel is much better in terms of facility, staff, and room type. Will never come back to Park Shore.

Essentially a great place right on the beach at Waikiki (well, across the road). Great part was Lulu's Bar elevated to get great view of the sea and great sunset view. Good part was the spacious entrance foyer and relatively friendly staff. OK part was the size of the room (could have done with enough space to put a comfy chair or 2. Not so good was the room on west side looking straight into another hotel and the sound of air conditioning system coming up the "canyon". At least it had a balcony and views north and south from the small balcony.

Stayed in June for special occasion. We were on the 18th floor (with a balcony) overlooking the zoo, the beach & with a view of Diamond Head. The hotel is across the road from the beach & has a great restaurant attached + ABC shops either side. The hotel has free shuttle buses to Ala Moana shopping centre & provides free towels & chairs for the beach. Nothing was a trouble for the staff who made our stay memorable with a special mention to Michelle. We will definitely be back.

I spent hours searching for the perfect hotel by reading countless reviews, but to my surprise the Park Shore-Waikiki was just what my husband and I was hoping for... especially being that it was my first trip to Hawaii. The location was incredible; the beach is right outside the hotel on the main strip, however, very peaceful. The rooms are a bit smaller than what we are accustom, but very nice. The staff was awesome: professional, kind, helpful, and courteous. I took the liberty of gathering a few of the employee names: Ethan, Leny, and Macy [kudos to all of you]. We're looking forward to our next visit. P.S. My husband became addicted to the juice. Lol (laughter out loud)

Stayed here with my boyfriend for our anniversary from June 1-8. We booked an Ocean Front room with king bed through West Jet Vacations. We arrived near 11pm after a long day of travelling from Toronto and were told we were assigned an Ocean Front with 2 queen beds (room 921). Apparently it is hotel policy that bed types within a room category are not guaranteed (if this was mentioned on the West Jet site it must have been in tiny print and the photos were of king size beds). We were offered an "upgrade" to the Diamond Head suite with one queen bed - but this only had a partial ocean view and a queen isn't really comfortable for sharing because my boyfriend is quite tall. So we stayed in 921 for the first night. This is ocean front but the L shape of the building meant we could see directly into the opposite rooms! This room was also very noisy from the bar downstairs (apparently only on Mondays). Luckily, Dylan (I think?) on the front desk demonstrated creative thinking and great customer service and switched us to a king ocean front room beginning our second night (1224). This room was AMAZING! Direct ocean front view with no obstruction, and a second window facing Diamond Head. The bed was comfortable, A/C worked well, room was clean and it was very convenient to have a mini-fridge in the room. In summary: Cons: -not guaranteed the bed type you choose-rooms even within the same price category vary wildly in view/privacy-no room service, but there is a flyer for ordering from external places-shower head is very low - it was uncomfortable for my boyfriend to wash his hairPros:-customer service - everyone we encountered was friendly and willing to do what they could to make our stay comfortable. For instance, we left a small bottle of milk in the fridge when we changed rooms and housekeeping found it, located our new room and delivered it-quieter end of Waikiki; beach was never busy

This is not the first time I have stayed at the Park Shore and for good reason, it is nearly impossible to beat this hotel for location and value for money. The rooms provide fantastic views of Waikiki, Diamond Head and the beautiful Kapiolani Park. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful, the lobby provides access to car hire, activity bookings, surf lessons, ABC stores and restaurants. The rooms are clean and very comfortable, rest well, play well!!

Myself and my friend flew to Honolulu to take part in the Hibiscus Half Marathon and we stayed at the Park Shore for 4 nights in May. I chose the hotel because of its proximity to the start line as we had a 5.30 a.m. start. And yes, the hotel was as close to the start line as you could possibly get, but it was so much more. The staff were wonderful, helpful and friendly, the rooms and bedding were very comfortable, the trolly ride to Ala Moana was handy and a great opportunity to talk to other people on holiday, the beach towels and chairs came in very handy. Overall it was a fabulous place to stay, and I will be back there again. Congratulations Park Shore Waikiki for getting it so right.

Stayed at this hotel recently and I can highly recommend. Staff friendly and helpful. We stayed in an ocean front room so view was perfect. We were also lucky to have stayed in a corner room so also had a view of Diamond Head and the Zoo. Located on the beach but being the last hotel on the street it was nice and quiet. Housekeeping were great and all appliances were in working order. We booked our tours at the tour desk in hotel and had no problem. Starbucks was attached to hotel and next door was an ABC store but there were also ABC stores on every corner. Also in hotel was a cute little sandwich and salad takeaway. The bar and restaurant Lulu's also here and serve great meals with a great view of beach and people watching on the street. If your not a beach lover the hotel has a nice pool. If you like shopping there were shuttles from hotel to shopping centre and outlets. Highly recommend and hopefully will be back soon.

Had an awesome stay at Park Shore for 9 nights that I was there. Room was neat and clean right opposite the beach for an awesome price. Highly recommended at a reasonable price and across the road from the beach. Highly recommended and will definitely be back.

The location on the end of the Waikiki strip, beside parks and the Honolulu Zoo, and also on the beach, make it superb. Both times we've stayed there we've been lucky enough to have ocean view rooms on the 10th floor, 1024 and 1007, which made our views fantastic. Lulu's Bar and Grill in-house is also really cool, looking over the beach. We will return. Back facing rooms, I didn't see. Front desk clerk Michelle was outstandingly friendly and personable, but everyone there was nice.

Great location with easy access to beaches and away from the most popular tourist's area in Waikiki. Rooms were equipped with all the basis and very clean. The bed was slightly on the soft side. I stayed in a lower floor room at the beginning. I could only see the ocean between tree top. Then I moved to a room on the higher floor and got a great view of the ocean and Diamond Head. It was worth the extra cost. Stuffs at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again for my next visit to Honolulu.

This is a terrific hotel and the service is outstanding! I am a very, very seasoned and demanding traveler. I work hard for my money and expect that to be honored where I choose to spend it. The Park Shore Waikiki Hotel 100% honored and valued my business. From the moment I spoke to Jara at the front desk to discuss my reservation; I knew that I was going to be happy and I certainly was. My room was great. The view was awesome. The service was excellent. The beach is right across the street. Everything you need is within walking distance. Staying at this far end of Waikiki is great- it is very easy to get to wherever you want to go.

This is our second visit to the Parkshore and was impressed yet again. It is a great location away from the bustle of the big resorts, but close enough to walk everywhere.and still only 100 steps to the best part of Waikiki Beach. The Tucker and Bevy shop attached is great for food and juices etc. thanks to Michelle who gave us great service.

Stayed here in October 2014. It took until now to catch my breath and write a review...lol. Location is impeccable. The convenience of the Waikiki Strip with the tranquility of paradise. Located at just the end of the strip, the area was quiet and absolutely beautiful. We chose an ocean-view room with a lanai. We had a view of Diamond Head volcano and the ocean. We slept with the sliding glass door open every night and all we heard was an occasional car going by and the tranquil sounds of the ocean waves breaking. Staff are very friendly. You really do feel like you are staying at your "cousin's" house. Room was not very large, but in a location like that, the only time we were in our room was to shower, change and sleep. I don't think we ever even turned on the TV. There was always a nice breeze. The lobby was open and inviting. Great all natural restaurant just downstairs (Tucker & Bevvy) with great staff and the most delicious smoothies and healthy snacks. The ABC store for all of your needs was just steps away. Honolulu Zoo is just across the street. The restaurant adjacent (Lulu's) to the hotel was always delicious. We would sit at the table overlooking the ocean and eat breakfast every morning. By Day 3, they would tell us what we were ordering...loved that! This is a perfect place to stay and has everything you would want for a hotel in Hawaiian paradise. I hope I make it back to Hawaii one day and if I do, I will NO DOUBT stay here again. Absolutely AWESOME!

This hotel is located at the nice end of Waikiki, across the road from the zoo and its associated parkland. Many of the rooms have views across the beautiful beach to the ocean just across the road. It is a really nice walk up the coastal road / beach to the centre of Waikiki, where great restaurants like The Cheesecake Factory are located. It's also within easy walking distance of Maceys and lots of other shops but there is an ABC shop in the same building as the hotel. There is a bus stop directly outside which can take you to Ala Moana or even to the cruise ship port or airport (although you apparently aren't allowed to take suitcases on it). The included shuttle to Ala Moana was OK but very circuitous and irregular, stopping at several other hotels along the way - I would rather catch the public bus. The room was fine - showing age but clean and functional. The staff were helpful and the in-room included wi-fi worked well. One small gripe is the almost compulsory hospitality charge of about $US20 which we weren't aware of before checking in. Having cool fruit punch and water available 24 hours in the foyer was good.

Staying at the Park Shore for the second time, confirmed our opinion of the hotel. Last one on Waikiki, across from zoo and Diamond Head off your lanai!! Parking, clean, close to everything. We'll be back! Awesome restaurants close, Starbucks downstairs, beach towels and chairs to use right across the street!

We stayed here for three nights on our way to Australia for a cruise and then stayed again on our way home to Michigan. The front desk was very helpful and the bell desk was also. The room that we had was with two beds and really no view. We didn't care about the view...the room was clean and the beds were comfy. We went to the pool most days...very nice and it overlooked the beach and the zoo which is right across the street. There were ABC stores on either side of the hotel so if you wanted anything it was a handy place to get what you needed. the lobby is nice with plenty of places to sit and if you want to walk a couple of yards to the beach, they have chairs you can take with you if you prefer to use them to sit on the beach. The pool is a nice size and there are plenty of loungers to use with umbrellas also. There is a toilet area nearby and also a soda machine as well as a snack machine. One of the other nice things about the Park Shore Hotal is the fact that a very nice bar/restaurant is right next to it....good food and a great place to eat and watch what's going on out on Waikiki Beach! It's called Lulu's and we ate there a few times. Also nearby is a Wolfgang Pucks...dine in or take out. You will not go hungry. We enjoyed it very much and when we go back, we will be booking there again.

This hotel is in a great location. And it's right across from the beach too. Our room was on the 8th floor with a direct view of the ocean. The room was very clean and comfortable. Our stay was made even more special because of the great staff. A special mention to Ethan who greeted us when we checked in. He was so warm and friendly and it was then that we felt the warmth of the Hawaiian spirit. Melia who works the concierge/travel desk was so helpful in helping us plan out all our activities. And Gina who made sure we got to the airport in time for our flight when our shuttle did not show up.Without a doubt, we will be coming back to Hawaii again and when we do, we will be checking back in at the Park Shore....for sure! Mahalo Park Shore.
user_name:
michelef147
New York City, New York

review_body: We Booked on Hotwire, got a good deal. Hotwire didn't mention that there's a $25/day parking fee. They have mandatory Valet parking. Also a $20/day resort fee. Anyway, just be aware of that. My wife checked in and got upgraded to a beach view while I was getting stuff from the car. The hotel is awesome, beach towels and chairs are there to use. Great pool area. Location is awesome on the end of the strip. Everyone working here is friendly. It's a different experience in Honolulu, everything is expensive. They take care of you past checkout time, with a hospitality room to shower or relax.

I had a great stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with every interaction from check-in to questions to check-out. The room was clean and comfortable and although I didn't opt for an upgraded room, I had a partial ocean & city view from the balcony. Everything you could possibly need is within a few steps - the beach, Starbucks, ABC store, restaurants - so it was very convenient. It was nice having free wifi and you can have your laundry sent out or walk to a laundromat nearby. LuLu's restaurant on the second floor was very good as well. Housekeeping also did a great job leaving the room spotless. I would stay here again.

If you want to experience the true "laid back" style of Hawaii, the Park Shore wont disappoint. From the views, to the beach location it cant be beat. Its location is on the quiet side of the mass of humanity of Waikiki. Its a smaller hotel but just as large as the big boys when it comes to service, friendly staff, and dedication to their guest. Look out the Diamond Head or ocean view rooms and see how Hawaii was meant to be seen. You can spend several hundred dollars more and stay at the "resorts" but you will not leave feeling that you got more than you paid for. At the Park Shore you will leave with a heavy heart after experiencing Hawaii as it was meant to be. It proves you don't need to be the biggest to be the best in Hawaii, your the best because you are the Hawaii n experience.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Great location, especially handy for the Honolulu marathon – the buses to the start go from the park across the road, the race route passes the hotel (we went back to the room for a toilet stop instead of queuing at the portaloos!) and the finish is 500 metres from the front door. It’s a little less touristy down this end of Waikiki and there are some great restaurants within a short walk (including Uncle Bo’s – don’t miss it!). Staff were very friendly (especially Violet who looked after my Mum before we arrived) and check in and check out was quick. Hoping to stay again – and soon!

This was a great hotel right at the end of the strip and across the street from the beach. Great designer stores and restaurants close by. Very reasonable price for the location. Clean, nice rooms and a great onsite casual restaurant.

Park shore was perfect, hotel lobby massive clean comfortable free coffee juice Internet , 50 metres from beach. I love being at the end of Waikiki it's not so touristy the beach is incredible ABC and Starbucks just outside hotel - perfect - I'm coming back in a week.

My daughter and I were very happy with our stay at Park Shore. We had a great time and it certainly had everything we desired. I do have fairly high standards in hotels but I was very comfortable here. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Check in and out was very efficient. We found the room quiet and the A/C worked well. All the rooms have nice furnished patios you can enjoy. Yes the rooms are a little plain and perhaps a little outdated but they are more than adequate. And we aren't really there for the rooms anyway lol. The one issue we had with our TV was dealt with and we were compensated nicely.The pool is smaller but very quiet and it was never busy. Most people tend to hit the beach and that left plenty of chairs at the pool. Speaking of the beach...it was amazing! The location of this hotel is probably the best of the hotels that are not directly on the beach. About as close as you can get for a reasonable price. The thing I loved about this beach was the retaining wall which kept the stronger waves to a minimum. This is a great thing if you are travelling with little ones or more elderly or a daughter with recent surgery on her foot! The area surrounding the hotel had everything you could need. The zoo is right across the street! The aquarium is also close. The busier area of Kalakaua Avenue is just a nice walk further up with lots to look at in between. You have beautiful views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Lulu's had great food also! The one thing we missed though was room service. Would have been great to have that. For all you Starbucks fans there is one right outside the front door. We did rent their convertible Volvo for a day and really enjoyed that. It was so easy to rent from them and not have to worry about parking etc.It was a fabulous vacation and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again! And again! Thank you Park Shore!

Stayed here for 2 nights and was very pleased. The first night we were exhausted after a 17 hour trip and really needed sleep.The beds were very comfortable and we heard no noise up on the 16th floor. Our room did not have a good view but we weren't interested in spending time in our room. The next day we got up early and only had to walk out the front door to get Starbucks, walk about 20 steps from there and there was the ABC store where we could buy almost anything including the sunglasses we forgot. Right across the road is Waikikki beach - not crowded at all like I expected. On the second floor of the hotel is a wonderful open air restaurant called LuLu's with live entertainment at night. We had breakfast along the front of the restaurant which is open to the street and faces the beach...nice view for breakfast! The staff was very friendly - thanks Ethan and Joey!

This was my second trip to this hotel and it was just as pleasant as the the first one. I think it's the best location in Waikiki, right at the end. It is fabulous. The staff are above and beyond anything you could expect, and it's the only hotel in Hawaii where check in and check out were always speedy. This is one of the best hotels in the world, and the value for money you get (especially when the peak is over and the prices drop back to normal) is astounding. I will probably never stay at another hotel in Waikiki as long as I live, and I hope to return to Waikiki once every few years. Getting high floor rooms give you a view of diamond head that no other hotel can give, seeing as this is the last hotel along the strip and nothing is between you and this world famous land mark. Don't stay anywhere else. Book this hotel was fast as you can :) I love this hotel. End of story.

We stayed here for 3 nights and found it to be great. It is across the road from the beach, great ocean views from your room. The rooms are outdated but very clean and welcoming, the staff were also amazing and available 24hrs. We stayed at this hotel for Halloween and its was great to see the amount of decorations that went up around the hotel, and you could also watch the Halloween street parade from your balcony amazing experience!!!

We were thrilled with a lot of the positives about this hotel. To name the most important one: the location is excellent. The Pacific is literally 'next door' after crossing just one street (no other buildings in between). We hiked Diamond Head Crater (a Hawai'i State Park) twice during our stay. That is in good walking distance. Be early to experience the sunrise and beat the crowdier moments. The view from ocean front rooms is breathtaking. The Pacific looks very photoshopped (but is not). This hotel is the last on the 'left side' of Waikiki Beach outside of the busiest parts of Waikiki. We had no trouble in finding nice places to eat and the omnipresent ABC-Stores (left ánd right of the hotel is one of the 40-plus ABS-Stores on the island) caters for your every need. If you want to do some serious shopping then consider going to Ala Moana shopping center. The hotel offers a shuttle bus that takes you there (and back). We enjoyed our stay on Oahu in Waikiki a lot and would consider the Park Shore Waikiki (one of the Aqua hotels) as our hotel a possible next time.

We stayed here for 3 days to finish off our road trip to have a beach break . It's at the quieter end of wakkiki beach which to be honest is nice , visited the start of May and the beaches were pretty quiet ,weather was lovely as are the people on the island . The room we had was small but adequate and the view which they said was partial was stunning and you could not ask for more . When ever we enquired about anything they were always eager to help and even let us phone a limo company on their phone as I could not get thro on my UK mobile . Morning there was fresh coffee in the lobby , then after 11 to 7 pm a nice punch drink or lemon water on tap ,all included there is free wifi , altho you have a $20 a day tax added to your bill which is basically a tourist tax , you also get free towel and drop off and beach chairs to cross over to the road which is nice . Lulus restaurant is attached to the side and turned out to be a gem of a place for either breakfast , lunch , dinner or drinks or all . We booked pearl harbour trip in the lobby down stairs and was the going rate and I advise anyone visiting the island to do it it, it's a very moving experience . I hope this helps you if you are thinking or looking at booking I always try to give a honest review as I would like to read the same when I'm looking to book .

This hotel is in an AMAZING location! It's at the quieter end of Waikiki beach, while still having all the restaurants just a short walk away. The wife and I spent a week at the Park Shore for our 5th Anniversary. Let me begin with the staff, prior to our arrival I reached out to to hotel to request a possible upgrade to make our stay even more memorable. Not only did I received a reply within 24hrs, the upgrade itself was complimentary. This level of service continued on from the moment we check in until we departed. I must say that this location is perfectly suited for anyone renting a car during their stay, if you ask me this is a MUST. Their is plenty of parking near the hotel and they also offer their own valet service. The location, the cleanliness of the rooms and the superb service leaves absolutely nothing to be desired......Well maybe a return trip!!
user_name:
Greg0005
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here for a week with my husband. We stayed in a sea facing suite and before our arrival we asked to be on a high floor which was accommodated without any issue. Staff were very helpful and friendly upon checkin and overall everyone was very polite and friendly. Unfortunately our stay had a couple of sour notes. We'd run short on smaller $ bills when we arrived so when our bags were taken to our room we weren't able to tip as much as we would normally. My husband handed over a few $ to the bellboy who helped us with our bags to our room, and was about to explain this and say we'd cat h him again later, but before he got a chance the bellboy was pretty rude and sarcastic about his tip...needless to say he didnt get anything else from us!! Room was spotless. Maid service superb. The hotel is perfectly placed on the beach at the quieter end of the resort. We lovely that you could use the hotel's complimentary towels and chairs to chill out on the quieter beach area. Its also perfectly placed for enjoying the zoo and the aquarium. Visited both and would recommend. We didn't experience any real problems with noise. Cant recommend a sea view room enough - loved watching the sunsets on our balcony with a cocktail before heading out at night. Upon our departure we took advantage of the hotels secure room to store our cases snd the complimentary freshen-up room. The freshen-up room was very busy so if you plam to use this give yourself plenty of time to wait on your turn. Secure room for cases was helpful but on departure my husband accidentally left behind an expensive sweater Id bought him as an anniversary gift. It was sat in the room while he collected our cases and he forgot to pick it up. When I contacted the hotel to organise it being sent on they advised it wasn't in the secure room, which I found disappointing as the room is secure and I'd not have expected another guest or staff to take something that wasnt their property. Obviously dont know what happened to the sweater but I think it would be good for the hotel to have looked into this further than they did. Overall though great holiday but cannot give the hotel 5 stars because of the issues we experienced above.

My wife and I spent our First wedding anniversary at Park Shore back in Oct 2013!! it was our first visit to Hawaii and hanging to get back this year!!The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, and the hotel room was perfect with an amazing viewAlso it was a prefect distance from the restaurants with a nice walk after the monstrous feeds haha, with starbucks and a nice little cafe directly below for alight breaky.Have already recommended to friends and had them stay here liking it just as much!!

A good hotel just off the Waikiki Beach strip. Close to shops and restaurants. The rooms are clean and comfortable but are basic for the price. Suggest ask for room on a high floor away from the pool, as music is played in the pool area. The lower floors are also susceptible to traffic noise. Meals can be bought at a restaurant on the 2nd floor but as it is also a bar it can be noisy. Hotel has free WiFi.

Nice clean hotel on the beach, a bit cheaper than some of the other options out there. It is down the other end of the beach from the shopping area but it's only a 20 minute walk. There is a pool but we didn't go there as the sea is right outside the door. You can borrow towels from reception. We often got freshly squeezed green juices from the cafe that joins on to the lobby.

This is our last night of an 11 night stay and i have not found anything that has not been good. The room was perfect with a partial view of the water and city, just what I had asked for. Mahalo Jara. Everyone is so accommodating and welcoming. My thanks to Michele, Jasamine, and Desaire for all their kindness and help. To the Manager: you have a complete staff that reflects great on you and the hotel. I hope you are very proud. You all made our 20th anniversary a memorable one. We hope to be back in two years. Look forward to seeing you all thenDebbie and Manny

We stayed four nights at the Park Shore Hotel on the 5th floor with views over the pool and beach. The room was relatively small but nicely renovated with a small balcony with room for two chairs. The L shaped building meant balconies were quite open and visible to other guests.Pool area was nice but seemed as though there were very few other ammenities on offer. Hotel was directly opposite Waikiki Beach with the beach area seeming to be less crowded then further down the strip which was excellent.Our travel agent made us aware that we were at the far end of the main section of Waikiki. However the walk was less than 30 minutes with plenty to see and enjoy to get to the opposite end of the main resorts. The Aqua Hotels free bus service to the mall and other Aqua hotels enabled access to other areas of Waikiki without having to walk as far.There is free wifi which worked fine the first night but hotel staff could not fix when i had problems and directed me to tech support instead.An enjoyable experience for four nights but an extended stay in Waikiki would not be for us.

Hotels location is great for Waikiki. Just across from Queens Beach and the views are amazing of Diamond head and the ocean. Room are very average 3*. This place is all about the view, the value and the location! Good sushi place in lobby and Lulus restaurant is supposed to be good but I didn't try.

We expected average, and got way above average!! We stayed on 16th floor room 1607, it is a corner room with awesome views of the beach and the Zoo and Diamond head. We had rented a car so we used the valet parking and they were very quick and courteous, as was the rest of the staff. The rooms were layed out nice, we had a king bed that was very comfortable. We had drinks at LuLu's the in hotel restaurant, very reasonable( the garlic fries are to die for)!! Perfect location as we walked down to the other end of Waikiki beach and Diamond head would have been an obstructed view.

We stayed at the Park Shore as a family of 4 on a 2 night stopover on our return to Sydney from our visit to New York City. The hotel was perfect - helpful friendly staff, very clean and comfortable with beautiful (?recently refurbished) rooms. The location is brilliant. We were booked into a 1 bedroom oceanfront with a king bed and a queen sofabed plus a balcony which was the perfect size for a family. The views from an oceanfront room are amazing and well worth the extra money. The hotel is not a resort which makes it affordable. Highly recommend the 1 bedroom oceanfront.

The location was ideal,across from the beach and the zoo ,which was totally delightful and definitely worth a visit.The Aquarium was a little way along the beach,small but fascinating,very family friendly.The concierges were all very helpful arranging side tripsThe hotel's free shuttle goes to the Ala Moana shopping center., The room was fine,the bed was comfortable,the bathroom was safe,very important for older guests.The restaurant Lulu's looks out over the beach,which is a plus.All in all ,just great.We would love to revisit.

I Stayed here on the last night of the trip. The reason for this pick was a super close location to watch the sunset at the beach, a bed and a 3 star plus hotel that I will be able to sleep without the fear of bugs or bustle. Pros:-This is as close to the beach as you can get with this class of HOTEL. I will explain the bold font later.- Valet parking was super quick and super helpful.-Right next to the zoo and diamond headCons:- Resort fees. I asked why? The answer was: Amenities provided. What are they? ...(Cricket sound)- I asked for a king bed explaining that the infant who rolls like a ball while asleep and not safe alone in a double bed. Response: Show me the Money ( I summered )Hotel vs Resort (As I see it): Lets face it. This is an 18 floor building with rooms as big as the size of my walk-in closet. They don't offer activities, yoga classes, or swim lessons, or music performances, or free breakfast, or guest entertainment. I don't buy the resort tag or the mandatory fees calling it a resort. But, in my experience, it was no different than a 3 star hotel with an average set of beds and a fresh coat of paint. Parking is an additional $30/night with unlimited in/out for valet parking option.

We had a short stay at Park Shore. It was a really good experience. Some of the best highlights: comfortable bed / pillows; sofa bed in room; mini kitchenette; very clean! Above all was the view! We had a full view of Diamond Head and the South Waikiki Beach! I would stay here again! One word of warning. If you are looking for a full service hotel this may not be the place for you. The hotel does not have in room dining service. Staff is friendly and they have a tour / event person on site to help with fun on the island. Location is perfect and beach access is directly across the street.

This is not one of the more expensive hotels on the waikiki strip. I picked the hotel for its location and expected it to be a bit tired. Pleasingly I was very wrong. We were upgraded to a room with a lovely ocean view which my surfer husband and son greatly appreciated. No need to get out of bed early if there is no surf!With the large window to the ocean and the small balcony the fairly small room was light and airy and didnt feel overly crowded with twin doubles. The furnishings were quite new and a there was a handy fridge in the room for salads and cold drinks. A moderate sized clean, fairly new bathroom completed the space.The hotel is in an excellent spot with the beach and volley ball nets directly across the road with restaurants, bar and great shopping right out side the front door. We hired a car, through the hotel concierge, to drive to the premium outlets (a disappointment) and to take in some scenery. This turned out to be very convenient and a reasonably priced way to hire a car for the day. If we came back on a family holiday again I would be happy to stay here again.
user_name:
cvz3
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: At last! A hotel that gives you what you knew you booked! Having been to many places over 30 plus years, sadly I now expect to have to wrangle on arrival, to actually get what I booked and paid for in the first place.So a massive 'Thankyou' to the Park Shore and to every single one of its staff, for not only delivering what you promise, but going way beyond this. We are currently still at the hotel, and it is absolute Paradise! A MASSIVE bonus is that it is right at the end of the hotels on the beach and thus has stunning views that are not blocked by any other hotels. Be sure to book an ocean view or ocean front room though, and if you can, ask not to be in the rooms that meet in the corner of the two blocks.We booked an Ocean View room and not only do we have a gorgeous ocean view, we also have a stunning view of Diamond Head too. Our room is second column in from the ocean front and the only thing that could have made it even more perfect would have been for the bed to have been the other side of the room - so facing the ocean - but that's just a small thing and down to pot luck (the rooms alternate in terms of which side the bed is on) and certainly does not ruin the experience!The hotel staff are fabulous, the Manager holds poolside receptions so that he can actually TALK to his guests (I have NEVER known this happen anywhere else we've been!) and nothing is too much trouble.The hotel provides towels to take to the beach or pool, sand seats for the beach, body boards to play on, and beach umbrellas. These are handed out until they run out, so don't get up too late!Best place we have stayed in for a very long time!Sue Harris + Jane Chapman Southampton, England

It was a wonderful experience. The staff was so accommodating & helpful. We were always greated with a smile. The rooms were clean and a great value for your money. We plan to come back next year. Our flight arrived way before check in time and they stored our luggage while we went to the beach. We were also allowed to use a courtesy room to change our clothes while waiting for our room. Aloha to all

I have stayed at the Park Shore going on 3 years in a row now. I love it. The staff is friendly, location and amenities cater to everyone, and pool deck is fabulous. It is at the end of the 'main' road in Waikiki but truly, it is a walking area so I do not mind. Diamondhead, beach, zoo, ABC stores, other shopping are all right there. I will return next year, as I feel this is a wonderful spot to spend your Hawaiian vacation.

From the minute we checked in the staff was wonderful. We had 3 rooms and needed 2 beds in each. They had every request met and each day had free beach chairs to take to the beach across the street. We also received a partial ocean view on each room. Lulu's serves a breakfast that was so unique. We had a stuffed french toast that I am still dreaming about. It was just the best. I would highly recommend this hotel. Close to everything. I can't wait to go again.

Having stayed at the Park Shore for the first time last year, it was lovely to return this year to find the hotel even better than before. The complimentary coffee, juice and water is still available in the foyer each day, the staff are still wonderful and my room was still clean and fresh and comfortable, however, there is now also a free shuttle to Ala Moana Shopping Centre ( every 30min approx. ) and free yoga classes ( Monday and Friday morning ) for hotel guests, which takes place in the park across the road from the hotel. Before booking this year, I did a search on central hotels and still found the Park Shore to be excellent value for money considering its location directly across from the beach and the quality of the accommodation.

When we first arrived at Park Shore Waikiki, every representative working there was so nice and genuinely cared about our stay at their hotel. They made sure that we were alway happy and always asked if we needed anything else or help. The room was very spacious and clean.We had a balcony as well which was very nice to be able to have. Chad was so nice and helpful to us whenever we needed help with where to eat or places to go. He definitely made our trip more enjoyable.

I stayed at the Park Shore a year ago, having found it on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. So, it was an easy decision to book there again when passing through Honolulu a few days ago. This year, the room we stayed in was quite small, compared to a room looking out on the pool last year. And the air conditioner was noisy and was uncomfortably cold. But we turned it off and were quite comfortable all night. Neither of these minor issues would deter me from staying at the Park Shore again. The location is outstanding, the staff are totally service oriented and friendly and there are great amenities like Lulu's bar, a terrific little breakfast take out place, and a Starbucks. The value for Waikiki is also excellent. What more could anyone want! I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

My wife & I stayed at the Park Shore for 7 nights in March. We booked a Diamond Head suite on the top floor.The views are amazing, also being opposite the zoo, there was very little noise.The staff are very friendly & helpful.So close to restaurants & bars.Well worth the money.

My friends and I are all residents of Hawaii some live in the north shore and others right here in Waikiki. We were celebrating our friends bridal party and it started off at the park shore Waikiki. From the minute of our arrival we were greeted by Vince from valet and he greeted us with such a warm welcome. He was attentive! Once we got to the front desk Kevin,ethan and David were ready to check us in. They were quick, helpful and most importantly polite and efficient . David even went one step further by coming up to our room to make sure everything was as it should be. The rooms were so nice with lots of space and very clean!!! I would also to recognize violet, jara,Desiree and leny for their aloha spirit . What a great staff !the GM is doing a great job with his staff!!!

This is such an awesome place to stay in Waikiki. Located right opposite the park, and Waikiki shore (hence the name 'Park Shore') this hotel offers something quite different from the crowded resorts along the shoreline.It's nestled right on the corner of the end of the main strip, opposite Waikiki Beach and is a much quieter and relaxed area of Waikiki. It is the quintessential Hawaiian resort, with it's high rise building, central lagoon style pool and endless balcony views. I loved the little touch of authentic Hawaiian music playing in the rooms. It was so comforting and reminded you that yes, this is paradise.The rooms are very spacious and quite luxourious. We were staying during a quiet period and I was so excited when they upgraded us to an ocean view! We were able to watch the volleyballers competing on the beach and admire the stunning Diamond Head crater from our balcony.I'm not the type to just hang out in the hotel all day when I'm in a place like Hawaii, but this hotel was certainly the one place that made me want to chill here for a while. We had planned on eating lunch on the beach, but once we saw our view from the balcony we set up and had a picnic there instead. Pretty awesome, I'm telling you.The bed is ridiculously comfortable and the bathroom is bright and spacious. There is a great little minibar area with coffee maker and a sizeable fridge to store any treats you've brought with you, including the ingredients you might need for a tropical cocktail by the pool.We teamed our one night stay with a visit to Lulu's Surfclub which is accessible through the lobby of the hotel. We got there just in time to watch the beautiful sunset along the front of the restaurant over cocktails. It might seem cliche everywhere else, but in Hawaii, the tropical experience is authentic. Palm trees, ocean, cocktails, sunset. Perfect.The hotel amenities are excellent and the staff let us start the check in process earlier than the official time by storing our luggage, letting us borrow beach towels for the day, and offering the computer services so we could check in for our flight and print our tickets in the lobby. It was all very easy and the concierge was fabulous.Valet parking is pretty much a necessity if you have a car and like all the resorts, it's not really cheap. $25 overnight, which seems to be the going rate. There is a big carpark at the park opposite but I'm not sure what the cost would be or if it's even available overnight. There isn't a lot of street parking available and we were warned about leaving your car with any valuables in it, so I'd rather just be safe by putting the car in the hotel's facilities.Park Shore is a beautiful resort in a quiet spot overlooking Waikiki beach.
