It's an easy walk to restaurants, shops and all the main things Waikiki has to offer. A beautiful and luxurious place to stay.

My wife and I tried to fly back to Tucson on standby but couldn't catch a flight. We went online and quickly booked a room for one more night in Waikiki. We couldn't have been any happier with our hotel! The location of the Park Shore is amazing, right next to the Honolulu Zoo and with a stunning view of Diamond Head and the beach right outside the balcony! Everything from the valet service to the front desk to the Teddy's restaurant right next door was fantastic! I would definitely stay there again!

We had an ocean view room and the view was spectacular! Straight out to the ocean with a view of Diamond Head too. Every afternoon we had a beautiful sunset. Although the clock tower interrupted our view slightly. Staff were fairly good. They don't have a restaurant although they do have a walk through to a restaurant/bar which was great.As it was at the end of the main strip towards the zoo and Diamond head - it was a great location for all the shopping and restaurants. We has a bus stop right outside the hotel which was great, we also had the trolley stop just around the corner.Great affordable hotel.

we really enjoyed this hotel, from the open air lobby to the guava juice welcome drink. We had a spacious room, although others we saw were smaller. Ocean view you can just sit on your balcony and watch the shore. Right across the street from the ocean and close to restaurants and stores. No hotel restaurant, but connected by a corridor to Lulu's, a lovely seaside restaurant with good food, including breakfast. Price was good, too. It is on a busy corner, so can hear loud motorcycles and vehicles going by, but I used earplugs and it was fine. Honolulu is the noisiest city I've ever been in, tons of traffic everywhere. they have a hospitality suite, so if you have to check out early and then have later activities, you can have an hour to rest or shower or whatever.

There were 2 main reasons why I chose this hotel: location and price. I wanted to be as close to the beach as possible with a view of the ocean without spending a fortune. I may have received an upgrade at the nearby Marriott but I wanted a guaranteed great view for our last few nights in Hawaii so I went with an ocean front room at the Park Shore after reading all the good reviews here and other websites. Compared to similar rooms at other hotels it was much more reasonably priced. Yes it was small but I did not go to Honolulu to hang around the room. But it was very comfortable and had a roomy lanai where we could watch the sunset every evening before dinner. We also happened to be there for the end of the Honolulu Festival and could watch the parade and fireworks from our lanai.It is really the service that prompted me to write this review. As other reviewers have noted, the staff - front desk and bell service - are very helpful and friendly. Desiree made us feel very welcome when we checked in and Michelle gave us good advice during our stay. Being right across the road from the beach is a big plus and the hotel has some beach chairs you can use if you get them early enough. I would have preferred the pool temperature to be a bit warmer but it is refreshing if you get really hot sitting in the sun on the pool deck. Plenty of restaurants in the area you can walk to.My wife and I had a great stay and we would not hesitate to go back.

My wife and I stayed at the Park Shore for a week and loved every minute. We've stayed several times in Waikiki at various places and this is our favorite. The hotel is on the edge of Queen Kapiolani Park, one of the largest and prettiest municipal parks in Honolulu, with a zoo, aquarium and miles of paths for strolling. A few minutes the other direction is downtown Waikiki. And across the street are two beaches, one open, the other sheltered and ideal for small children. Our room (1509) had a superb view of Diamond Head. We enjoyed several breakfasts and lunches at the casual restaurant / mini-market, Tucker & Bevvy, off the hotel lobby. And Lulu's Restaurant was a great spot for happy hour and dinner. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, especially the concierge, who helped us arrange two great excursions. On the downside, the room and the pool were both on the small side, and rather plain. But given the wealth of attractions within an easy walk, we would happily return to the very same room.

It's the last hotel on the "strip" with uninterrupted views of Diamond Head and Kuhio Beach. Feels like the locals prefer this side as opposed to Waikiki beach. Enjoyed watching the locals play beach volleyball almost daily and locals jumping off the Waikiki Beach Walls.Whilst not realising it was the end of the strip, the walking up and down the strip did us good. It also means you're more likely to explore.The pool is adequate. Didn't get overly busy. Nice place to have a dip and catch some rays.Service all around was friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.If you don't end up with a room with a view, head up to level 15. There's a small outdoor corridor that gives you a great picture opportunity of Diamond Head.

We stayed at the Park Shore at the end of January, 2015. The room was a bit on the small side, but the views of Diamond Head and the ocean were amazing from the spacious lanai. The room was clean and comfortable and the service was excellent. The safe in our room stopped working at 9 pm on a Saturday and the maintenance man was there within five minutes to replace it. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The restaurant on the second floor, LuLu's, served great food with open air beach side views and terrific staff. We would definitely stay there again.

The Park Shore is an older but clean and well located hotel with FREE Wi Fi at the end of the Waikiki strip. Service was always prompt and staff congenial. An easy walk into Waikiki and plenty of restaurants to choose from. The local buses cost $2.50 and get you to Sea Life Park, Diamond Head hiking track (impressive) and Manoa Falls (bus 5 from Ala Moana (catch the pink trolley - $2 EW). Hotel supplied a jug for making tea on request. Airport shuttles can take time as Park Shore is last on the strip. Taxis are quick but $20? more expensive. Be wary of street hawkers peddling FREE diner cruises and Luau performances - these involve sitting through a 90 minute sales presentation for Time-Share type schemes run by extra slick operators!! If you attend DO NOT SIGN UP until you have googled the company and seen the long list of complaints!

This hotel offers stunning sea ocean views. If u get a decent room.....the location is end of waikiki beach next to the zoo and the diamond head crater... Pool is nice clean,but wasn't heated.....wifi is free and available all round....staff are always friendly and helpful... Rooms are ok space wise...hotel is just across from the beach...very handy.... Will definitely come again..

We walked in hot and tired. They handed us a cup of cold water or Juice along with a cool washrag to run over our face. This is one example of a staff that is focused on the customers. The room we got was smallish, but we weren't spending much time in the room anyway. It was comfortable, clean and the beds slept well. Coffee pot in the room, hair dryer in the room, Flat screen TV in the room.. One special service that was very nice was when we checked out. We had a late flight out but had to check out by noon. They stored our luggage and allowed us access to it multiple times during the day. They also allowed us access to a special room including a shower to get cleaned up before heading to the airport. It made our trip home much more comfortable. The hotel location is right across from the beach and next to the zoo. The bus to Diamond Head stops right in front of the hotel.

Great location right across from the beach and zoo staff excellent arrived at 6 am from oz they gave us a room lunch time check in was 3 pn room not good 5 th floor no view only air cond and car park asked to be moved no problem moved to 18 th floor much better room seemed brighter loved lulu for breakfast and dinner table overlooking beach good abc shop and Starbucks down stairs book direct had s great rate

We spent a week at the Park Shore Waikiki and were very happy with the hotel. I'll start with the cons of this location, but as you'll see it's a short list. Cons: Room size was pretty small with limited dresser space. I like to unpack and had to fill up our night stands with clothes in order to get everything out of the suitcase. Closet space was also limited.Light on frills. There was coffee in the lobby and it was delicious but they didn't even offer the little half and half containers. Instead they had little packets of non dairy creamer. Not very good. At the end of the Waikiki strip. This is both a pro and a con. The con of it is that it was kind of a hike to a lot of different restaurants, hotels and activities. Pros: Service. The service was truly beyond my expectations. Michelle at the front desk went out of her way more than once to provide us with excellent service. For example, I needed to print a coupon and asked if they had a business center. Michelle said that they did, but you had to pay for it and if it was just a one page thing I could email it to her to print. I emailed it to her and she printed it immediately. There was a problem with viewing the image on her screen however and the coupon hadn't printed. Rather than just saying, "well, I tried," she fooled around with the settings on her computer until the image appeared and re-printed. I thought this was great. She also was very good about giving directions and making restaurant recommendations. We were there during the Honolulu parade and even McDonalds had a line out the door. We wanted to grab something close by without the wait and she thought for a moment and then suggested a fantastic restaurant that was kind of tucked away so was not busy. It was perfect! Finally, one day when we came back on a windy night, still damp from the beach she called us over and replaced our towels with dry ones so that we would be warm on the way up to our room. I really wasn't expecting such great service and was very pleased. Location - this hotel is right next door to the Honolulu zoo and directly across the street from the beach. Though the beach is a little rockier than some of the Waikiki beaches, you're only another couple of steps to other beaches. The bus stops right outside the hotel. There is an ABC store in the hotel as well as a cute little sandwich shop which also serves smoothies and juices. Cheeseburger is only two blocks away and has great happy hour specials. Though we were way at the end of the Waikiki strip and had to walk quite a ways when we visited other restaurants and beaches, we loved feeling like we were away from the major action at night. Cost - We got an amazing deal on this hotel - staying for 6 nights for only about $100/night. It was by far the most affordable hotel that close to the beach. We saved a ton of money. Because of this our room was just "standard" and the balcony was too small for a chair. Nevertheless, we were happy to see that when we were on the balcony and looked to our left we had a great ocean view! Manager's Reception - On Wednesdays, the hotel hosts a manager reception. It was fun to get to talk to some of the other guests and get a couple of drinks and snacks for free. David, the manager, was extremely friendly and even sent us home with some punch! Beds - I was so happy with our bed! I'm pretty spoiled by my bed at home and the last couple of hotels I've stayed at had pretty uncomfortable beds. I slept great on the King size bed. It was very comfy. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will probably stay here again the next time I'm in Oahu.

The hotel deserves a rating of 3.5 stars but as this is not an option, I erred on the generous side. The hotel is in a great position, at the end of the hotel area on Kalakaua Ave, which means that the quieter beach areas are accessible. The rooms have been refurbished and the beds are very comfortable. The service is erratic and check in disorganised. We reserved one king room and one double room but when we arrived were told that 2 double rooms had been booked. Despite arriving before 9 am, we had to wait until 3pm for check in. No flexibility was offered. We had different representations from different check in staff. The staff were friendly however. The concierge was a bit long winded and our room was not serviced. The view from the ocean view rooms was lovely, particularly at sunset but the noise on the lower floor was very disturbing from buses and trucks particularly. Ear plugs are recommended. The rooms facing the adjacent building were quiet but looked into other hotel rooms. Would stay again if the price were right.

Fantastic location - it's right at the end of the Waikiki strip, so you can escape to the quiet parks and zoo across the street to the south, or hit the fun locales to the immediate north. Attentive staff. Unbeatable views. Quiet. Immaculate. Comfortable bed. New HD television. Michelle at the desk was so friendly and helpful, and our bellman Chad went the extra mile to make sure we were taken care of. It's a no-brainer - we will always stay here when visiting Honolulu. It is wonderful in every way and the price can't be beat!

The Park Shore is perfectly located at the end of the strip for Waikiki. It is across the street from the zoo and just a short walk from the aquarium. The staff was great. The room was a nice size but fairly ordinary. It only had one desk chair and 2 patio chairs on the balcony. But who is going to sit in their room much when in Hawaii. We paid for a partial view room which was well worth the extra money. We were at the end of the hall and had a view of the street which was great because we could watch a parade and see fireworks one night from our balcony. And of course, the view as mainly for the ocean. I'm so glad we didn't get stuck in the center of the strip which has become full of shopping center type stores. Also the restaurant associated with the hotel is Lulu's which we ate at almost every day. Good staff there and decent food. If we ever return to Hawaii, we will certainly head for the Park Shore.

Picture yourself in the ocean, looking at the Waikiki strip. At the far right, just before a large park containing the zoo, is the Park Shore. The beach is across the street and that beach area has a break water so it is completely calm. It's perfect if you have kids. Walk maybe ten more paces and you have access to the open ocean.We had a "partial ocean view" room. It was actually at the end of the hall on the corner of the building. Out one window was the ocean. There was nothing partial about that view, which was perfect for the Honolulu festival fireworks. Our balcony was on the other side of the room and faced the neighboring hotel across the alley. But, we turned our chairs "sideways' and there was a more limited view of the ocean. You can walk directly from the hotel to Lulu's Restaurant which was also excellent. Every employee of the hotel we had contact with was cheerful, positive and polite.I don't know if I will ever return to Waikiki again. But, this is where I will stay.

We loved our stay at Park Shore Waikiki! All the staff were friendly and welcoming, the hotel is very clean and well maintained. Beach is right across the road! Views are breathtaking :-) Hotel services convenient.Complimentary coffee each morning in the lobby was much appreciated and delicious! Expedia staff in lobby are great too :) free shuttle to Ala Moana is available too.Hotel ticked all our boxes! Five stars!!

My husband and I were on our honeymoon and they graciously upgraded us to a beautiful ocean & Diamond Head view! Beautiful views from our lanai. Waikiki pier and beach right across the street and many shops and restaurants are within walking distance. We would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here at the end of a 15 day trip to Hawaii with the first 13 on Maui and it was wonderful. All the staff was very friendly and extremely welcoming. We liked the location right on the end of the Waikiki strip which allowed for an easy escape from the madness as needed as the valet parking was very efficient. Room was not overly large however was still very comfortable. We spent a whole day at the pool which is set up perfectly to watch all the action below on the strip and beaches.

Today is my last day at the hotel. I've stayed at this hotel several times and on the island many more. This is my favorite hotel on Waikiki strip. For the price, you cannot get a better hotel that is right on or directly across the street from the beach. Front desk receptionists like Jara continue to make my stays here exceptional. *JARA* went above and beyond many times for us during our trip. I believe standard rooms go for about $150-$250. Parking is $25-$30/day, as is usual for a hotel on the strip, so build this into your budget. It is only valet parking, and *VICTOR* is one of the friendliest valet people you will ever meet. If you can afford to get a partial view or full ocean view, I fully recommend it. The restaurant hotel is Club Lulu and it has great food. Starbucks and an ABC store are on the first floor. There is also a deli, surfboard school, and traditional sushi restaurant all connected to the lobby. Jamba juice is a football throw away as is Waikiki beach. From the pool, you are right next to palm trees, the Pacific Ocean, and the Honolulu Zoo. The Diamond Head creates the backdrop for your swim in the pool. The hotel is on the quieter side of Waikiki Beach, which we really enjoy. The whole strip is about a mile, so it is easy to walk anywhere. The nice part of this side of the beach is that there is a breaker wall which makes the beach front very kiddy-friendly; the breaker walls make the waves tranquil, the bottom sandy, and the temperature a tad-bit warmer. I believe you can get late check-out until 1pm and it's $10 for anytime after, which we may exercise this option today. They have complimentary pool towels and beach chairs. They invited us to a manager's reception in the pool area on Wednesday night, which we couldn't attend. They offered yoga one of the mornings in the park/beach. They have complimentary ice-lemon water and coffee in the lobby. Overall, for the value, you will not find a better hotel.Stayed March 2015

Park Shore is a very nice hotel near the Diamond Head end of Waikiki Beach. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. They offered us an upgraded room when we checked in. The room was larger and well kept up. The location is right across the street from the beach, yet the hotel had a nice pool area as well. You are easily within walking distance of many shops and restaurants, and we walked to Diamond Head as well. Our room wasn't ready when we checked in, but they offered us a hospitality room to change from our travel clothes, and they took care of our luggage.I would say the only drawback to this hotel is the bathroom was very small, but hey, when in Hawaii, who is spending a bunch of time in the bathroom?! We would definitely stay here again, the price was very reasonable for this hotel .

we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and the view from our room (1108) is stunning. We are partially facing the ocean and it is very nice to wake up in the morning with this kind of view. This hotel is located at the end of the stri and across the zoo and few minutes away from the aquarium. Location is very nice. The room is a little bit small and the washroom has no drawers to put in your toiletries but it is clean and bed are comfortable. Staff are nice and very accommodating.

We were extremely happy with this hotel. We checked into this hotel and asked for an upgrade to and ocean view room. We were with two other couples and they upgraded all of our rooms for a modest additional cost. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. It is at the end of the hotel strip,where it is a bit quieter. It is right across the street from the beach.

The Park shore is the LAST hotel on Waikiki Beach as you head towards Diamond Head. it's SO convenient to just about anything in Waikiki, including shops & restaurants.The best part? since it IS the last hotel, you have a stunning view of Diamond Head AND the beach. Rooms are small but well appointed and comfortable. There's not much drawer space, but we were only there for 4 nights. Valet service was exceptional. We never had to wait more than 3 - 4 minutes for them to bring the car around.Lulu's next door is a great place for any meal, or cocktails at sunset. Just fabulous. We had breakfast and dinners here and were not disappointed. There's an ABC store off the lobby as well as around the corner. (there's one on just about every corner!) I wish we had ABC stores at home! you name it, they probably have it for the tourist. I got most of our 'souvenirs' there. They also sell beer, wine and liquor.

Overall this was a decent place to stay. It's on the end of the Waikiki strip, which was nice in some ways, and not in others. Less touristy, but a bit of a walk to downtown. The hotel is clean and updated, which is good. We had a good view of Diamond Head from our room on the 18th floor, which was pretty cool.However, the front desk staff are not overly helpful- when we checked in, they did not tell us about any of the hotel events (yoga, manager's reception, etc), and forgot to get our credit card, so called our room at 11:30 pm to ask us to bring it down...a little irritating as we were in bed already.The valet parking is a bit annoying as well. The pool closes at sunset. All in all, I think this hotel is overpriced and under-delivers.

We have just returned from a weeks holiday at this hotel and it was excellent. It is located at the "end of the strip" but that just means walk out of the door, turn the corner and you are on the strip. It is directly opposite the beach with fabulous sunsets and opposite the zoo on the other side (which we did not visit). Staff very welcoming and always smiling. worth paying for seaview as some rooms look directly onto adjacent hotel (which is very close).

We loved this location because it was on the end of the beach by the zoo-- much less congested etc. It was very clean and the staff was very nice. Would recommend you not get a "standard" room as you will be looking at another building, and if it is a lower level standard room, you can barely see the sky! The hotel did upgrade us to a partial ocean view and it was WAY nicer. Get as high up as you can! Would return here..........

The hotel is not bad, we got an upgrade to ocean view upon arrival which was nice. The service was good, the receptionist jessica was very nice. Great location as shops are just around the corner. Could do with complimentary bottles of water though!

Great little hotel with awesome diamond head/beach views that is close to everything U want at waikiki without being in the middle of the tourist madness! Staff are very obliging and the activities manager helped us book some excellent day trips. The beds are also super comfy!!

Choose this hotel for location and our needs, our return visit, beach across the street, not noisy outside, inside different story. Closing mechanisms on doors very loud when doors left to close on their own, inconsiderate travellers at 5am not appreciated!! Room very adequate for us however, room was not tended to until after 3PM, always last on the floor, could have been alternated, came back for lunch to an unkempt room every day. Coffee and juice in main lobby very appreciated, however, needed a bigger signage for patrons not to fill personal mugs directly from dispenser to prevent germs spreading. We were never asked if we wanted to be upgraded even though we knew there were empty rooms facing beach or Diamond Head. Nice that beach chairs and towels are available every day. Staff very friendly but could have been more informative with the " freebies". Will stay here again and have already recommended to friends to join us. Diane, Canada

The room was nothing special, and the bathroom was small, but the view was great! We were in a corner room on the 7th floor, and the lanai overlooked the ocean, the other window had a great view of Diamond Head. I liked the hotel's location at the south end of Waikiki. It was right at the corner of 2 main streets for easy driving access, but across one street was a big park, so not as noisy as it could have been. Staff was very friendly, helpful, and nice. Hotel adjoins Lulu's restaurant, where we ate 4 meals in 5 days! It was really good, and casual, too. Starbuck's is next door, which is nice for grabbing a quick breakfast when heading out for the day. There's an upscale Japanese restaurant off the lobby, which was fabulous! Be prepared to be the only non-Japanese customer there. The Park Shore was a good price.

My wife and I stayed here for 10 days during our wedding/honeymoon. Our room had a terrific view of the ocean (room 1422). But it was the staff that made our stay memorable. Eric & Jessica were exceptional at the front desk, and Chad the bellhop/manager was truly remarkable. We were consistently met with a courteous staff offering assistance and warm smiles. The location is great, as well: across the street from the beach (towels and chairs available from the hotel), end of the busy thoroughfare, etc.)HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!

Good location across zoo and beach - basically end of hotel area. Clean well maintained hotel. We were "upgraded" to beach view room - if you hung over the balcony rail you could see the beach. Nicely furnished. Nice toiletries Nice pool area. Welcoming efficient front desk staff. Close to coffee shops and restaurants. Two ABC stores "attached" to hotel. Would stay here again

Had booked an ocean view room but were on 4th floor. Quick call to reception and were upgraded to an ocean front room on 3rd day. Room1007. Brilliant to look out and see Diamond Head and the ocean. Could even see whales from our balcony tail fluking and breaching etc .Leny on reception always smiling chatting and asking about our day. Expedia desk great for booking tours etc. Will be back. Thank you. Great end of town to be in.

We arrived after midnight and were taken care of immediately (thank you Dylan!). During our stay, everyone at the front desk was friendly, efficient and informative.Our room on the 5th flr was disappointing. After reading many of the reviews (of course, not every room can have a view of Waikiki Beach and/or of Diamond Head), we had a view of another building, the parkade  and the loud hum of air-conditioning units.However, the beds were comfortable, we had great water pressure and lots of hot water. Only one coffee pkg is provided in the room (not quite enough) but there is complimentary coffee in the lobby (mornings). When we were there, the coffee carafes usually ran out – so time your visit!Very convenient location – right across from the Honolulu Zoo and steps from beach, bus stops.I’d stay here again but would ask for a room on a higher floor.

Quieter end of Waikiki with great room. We had a partial ocean view room - could see both the ocean & Diamond Head - a lot of each (not just a slivver). Close to trolley stop & tour pickups - helpful Expedia staff with tour bookings & organisation as well. Also hiring a car through the hotel was a breeze. All the staff were very helpful & friendly. Can definitely recommed this one

We recently spent 11 nights on the famous Waikiki Beach at the Park Shore. We had glorious views of Diamond Head and the ocean everyday from our balcony. The view overlooks the Honolulu Zoo. You see no other hotels from "the strip" and you feel more secluded than you actually are. This end of Waikiki is quieter for sure. Our room had been recently renovated and the bathroom was nicely done with a spacious shower. There was a safe and mini-fridge as well. The staff was very friendly and responsive to any requests. If you want to stay on Waikiki this is a great choice as you feel more out of the hustle and bustle.

We stayed at the Park Shore for 9 nights in February 2015 for our honeymoon and had a fantastic time there. Our room had a great view of the beach from the bedroom window with the lanai having a partial ocean view. Our room was a wheelchair accessible room so was very spacious. I would recommend asking for an accessible room particularly if you have booked a partial ocean view room as they are on the street front corner so you have a full ocean view from your bedroom window. The one negative about our room was that you could hear everything going on in the room next door through the inter-connecting door. The Park Shore's location cannot be beaten - it is at the quiet end of the beach but still a short walk to all of the action. The seawall in the beach directly opposite the hotel perfect for swimming. There is a bar called Tikis at the hotel next door which is a great place to unwind in the evening. The pool area is one of the best features of the hotel. The pool area was quiet and peaceful while we were there and being on the third floor it has amazing views out to the ocean, the park opposite and out to Diamond Head. The one negative is that the pool closes at sunset (approx 6.15pm while we were there) which is very early if you are out and about all day. Another tip is to go to the 18th floor ice machine - there is an amazing 180 degree view of Diamond Head and the ocean from there.

This was our third trip to Waikiki, but the first time at the Park Shore. Although the most basic and aged of the three hotels we had stayed at, the location can't be beat. It is across from the beach on the main Waikiki street with easy access to all types of restaurants, shopping, and transportation (taxis, buses, car rentals). Right in the lobby is a tour desk, sundry store, surfing school, and small japanese restaurant. Starbucks is just outside the lobby. The park with a zoo is nearby. Even a popular nightclub is steps away but amazingly does not provide noise for the guests. The best part of staying at this hotel, however, is the staff. They are friendly and very helpful. They actually seem to want you to have a good time. Big shout out to Violet and Joven! The only down to staying here is if you do rent a vehicle, you must use the valet service, and the cost for parking is rather steep. But the free Wifi takes the sting out of the parking fee, a bit at least. We would definitely stay here again.

The valet parking guy is very very rude! It destroys my experience with otherwise fine hotel. He was accusing me about losing the valet ticket and very impatient. He so stands out from other friendly Hawaiians. He should learn how to smile and speak not in an intimidating way.

The Cons:Yes, the hotel may look dated, especially the corridors and some walls.The pool is small, located in the third floor, which is not very ideal.The hotel has no shuttle service from the Honolulu International Airport (more on this later).They charge a 20 dollars fee on top of the reservation price for several things. This is per reservation, not per day.No food included (which is the norm in the hotels in Waikiki)The Pros:Service! This small hotel is among the finest we´d been in terms of quality of service. Front Desk personnel is way beyond helpful and resourceful, empowered to cover all ccustomers needs.Location! The best part of this hotel is its location. Just in the end to the Waikiki strip yet close to everything, literally at walk distance to any place. Next to the Honolulu Zoo that you surely should visit, with the beach just in the other side of the corner.Free Internet access: Vital for you, techies.The $20 Hotel service fee is less than other nearby hotels.If you need to stay in Waikiki but your budget is not quite ample, you won't regret staying at the Park Shore. This hotel offers a great value for the price.

We stayed 8 nights. Simple room. Quiet. Accommodating. Great location. Friendly staff. A bit dated, but don't all hotels look the same when you're sleeping? :-) We probably would stay there again depending on the circumstances.

Myself and 5 gfs stayed at park shore for 1 wk. location was perfect! Close to everything. Zoo right across street. And beautiful ocean right infront all the staff was VERY FRIENDLY and super helpful!! Always greets us when we walk in and out!! Decent size room with safe and cooler in it ☺️ Highly recommend this to anyone!! Will surely return again!!

I loved everything about this hotel, but mainly the location. My husband likes it because it is so close to where he can rent a surfboard and get to the beach easily. The rooms are very attractive, and very comfortable. I liked that I could just lounge around the pool and see the sunset over the water. There is a little sandwich shop next door, which came in handy, and an ABC store practically connected to the hotel. What's not to like?

This hotel is unique in a number of ways but the location really does feature as the best.It is located almost at the "end" of the Waikiki strip next to a park and the Zoo but with Ocean views. It is quieter than being in the heart of things and our room was located on a corner giving us a view of the ocean to one side and Diamond Head crater the other.Strangely, the Hotel has NO front door - just an opening where you stroll in. very welcoming, just like the staff who were ALL welcoming, helpful and gave useful local information which really assisted our stay.Hotel room was a good size with 2 doubles, wi-fi, fridge, coffee maker and a great balcony overlooking the pool, the beach and views of the country side. It was shared with my 2 youngest children and I did not find it too cramped in any way.Valet parking and we hired a car via the hotel whilst we there.No question of returning to this lovely hotel

We visited the Park Shore Waikiki in January with our family. My wife, 2 year old son and I stayed for 13 nights, and my aunt/uncle, and parents stayed for 20 nights.We requested all to stay close together in the hotel. Because our room, and my parents room were both Ocean Front, we were located next to eachother. My parents room was 824, which was on the corner, so they had an Ocean Front room, as well as a view of Diamond Head. My aunt/uncle were also located on the 8th floor in a Partial Ocean View room and they loved it. Anyone with an Ocean Front room, I would recommend staying on a higher floor. Because there are rooms only on one side of the hallway, you can hear all the service vehicles in the morning backing up, or hearing the garbage trucks. We requested a lower floor due to having a young child, so we didn't want to be too high, so the little bit of noise didn't bother us.The rooms were nicely appointed and recently renovated. Mini fridge, safe, etc. Nothing was over the top, but it was comfortable. They supplied us with a crib for our son. Lobby is very nice, with free coffee and iced lemon water in the mornings, and then an iced punch, and iced lemon water in the afternoons. They have beach chairs and towels for you to use at the beach which is directly across the street.Front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. Every...I think it's Wednesday evening they had a managers reception at the pool, where they asked for feedback and suggestions, and provided punch and snacks which is a nice touch.Some of my feedback would be to enhance security. ie. I noticed other hotels, you need a room card to gain access to the elevator, which would be nice. Maintain your elevators better, as we had 2 break down in our 2 weeks at the hotel, and improve the pool area, as right now it's simply a pool. It would be nice to have a hot tub, and a pool bar serving drinks and food. This would keep guests at the pool, instead of going to other pool bars for happy hour.Oh, and location is great, immediately across the street from the beach, and the Zoo (took our son multiple times to the zoo), and a great location overall.Next time we are back in Waikiki (hopefully in 5 years), we will definitely be staying here again!Mahalo!

We stayed at the Park Shore in November and had a brilliant time.The hotel has an excellent location at the bottom of the main strip. The beach is just across the road there's plenty of bar/restaurants along the strip. The hotels own bar does good food too and the service is friendly. In fact all the places we ate or drank had really friendly staff.The lobby is open to the front with plenty of nice seating areas to sit and chill and enjoy the view.The staff were all really helpful. The room was nice and clean and light.The hotel provide towels and chairs for the beach which is really useful.There's so much to do in the area. Taxis are expensive but the bus system is easy and cheap to use and there are bus stops right near the hotel. Loved our stay here
user_name:
Ninja B
Newton le Willows, United Kingdom

review_body: Our family stayed for ten days in January with our 2 teenager daughters 14 and 18 we had 2 rooms, great location beach just across the road, fantastic running up to Diamond Head each morning fantastic views, great walk into town probs 1 km from hotel to main part of town just eneough to digest dinner at night. Rooms comfy location great very friendly staff, far away from busy side of town, you can book tours from hotel and hire surfboards and bikes great spot

This is at the end of the main strip in Waikiki, but that shouldn't put you off as the shops and restaurants start immediately, so you don't spend any time in the wilderness. Also, you just cross the road to a great beach where you can hire boards or snorkels and see what is going on out in the sea.We hired paddle boards and saw turtles on three days. Also caught some great waves, but careful of the coral as it can cut and sting.

First, I was hesitant to book at Park Shore given how far away it was from main area on Waikiki and downtown Honolulu as a walking distance. I was booked for the Hilton Waikiki first, then moved here because of the great reviews and because the Hilton's pool had been shut down.First, the hotel is at the very edge of Kalakaua Ave, which is fantastic you are not too isolated from all the action, but not in the midst of all the noise either. The location is great also if you're driving because you don't have to fight through the traffic on Kalakaua everytime you leave the hotel.First, the hotel reception is quite grand, comfortable couches. The reception staff were very helpful and courteous. They gave us tips about what things to visit/activities to do, or where to get food for good prices, etc. I have to say that the elevators here are kind of slow sometimes, but that was ok. We were on vacation anyway.This is a 3 star hotel, and is in great shape. Our room had a clean bathroom, minifridge and a safe, spacious queen bed with clean linens. The linens were changed every 3 days I think. Each bedside had a lamp with 2 power outlets. We had partial ocean view which was great since we were able to see Diamond Head and the Ocean at the same time from our balcony. There is a pool in the hotel, but we never used it because the beach is literally 20 steps away. The AC worked great, but the weather was so awesome that we just slept with the balcony doors open.There is a food delivery service, but that is really unneeded as you are surrounded by many dining options. You can walk for 10 minutes into Diamond Head to go to Diamond Head Grill & Market or Ono Seafood, or walk west on Waikiki for many other more touristy options. Waikiki is lined with ABC stores and other supermarkets if you want to buy food and store it in your fridge as well.The beach is public access like all beaches on Honolulu and is almost never empty. You can take towels from the hotel to use at the beach then return them. Be sure not to lose your towels because there is a 30$ replacement fee. The beach is great for snorkeling, sunbathing, and surfing. There are phenomenal sunset views here too. If you are around on the third sunday of every month, there is the Kapiolani Artfest (http://www.gohawaii.com/en/events/waikiki-artfest/) in nearby Kapiolani Park if you want to buy some authentic Hawaiian art and/or crafted goods.I made the mistake of taking a taxi from the airport to here. If you call the hotel, they can get you a shuttle from the hotel to airport or vice versa for 13/person (much less than the 40 for a taxi).Overall, the hotel had great facilities, safe, well maintained and its location and views are probably one of its best charms.

My husband and I loved the Park Shore plaza. It's right across the street from Waikiki Beach. Guests can sign out some beat up very low beach chairs. Better than nothing. The sunsets are priceless. Rooms have mini fridges in them. There's an outdoor pool on the 6th floor roof, but we went to the beach instead. It's next to The Zoo. There's an ABC convenient souvenir store that's all over the islands. The restaurant has an open air plan and the food was real good. Try their coconut pancakes!! It's not near the bulk of the high rises, where fireworks & luaus are but, it's a duable long walk.I would recommend this property, mostly for the value.

I was a little put off on how far this hotel was from the main part of town, but in the end, I loved it! We initially had a very small room facing the south end tower, but I asked for an upgrade, and they happily complied. Our new rooms faced the ocean, and it was such an amazing room! The staff were really accommodating, and it was such a perfectly situated hotel right off the beach, and shopping. I would definitely love to go back to this hotel, and I would recommend it highly to anyone looking to have a hotel situated right in the heart of Waikiki.

Great location. Being at the end of the strip, you will have legitimate ocean and Diamond Head views. At this end, too, you will have easy beach access. The beach further down by the other hotels is narrow and difficult to access if you aren't staying at one of the beachfront properties. Also easy to get in and out of town if you have a car. There are plenty of restaurants, gift shops and amenities right out front. And a bus stop right out front, too.Hotel staff were all friendly and accommodating. The prices for tours arranged by the concierge were about $10-15 more than you would find elsewhere. The yoga class is good for beginners.Rooms are average size and freshly updated. The only complaint is that the doors are incredibly loud when closed. Expect to be awakened several times by your neighbors. Ocean view rooms have spectacular views, but are noisy when the sliding glass door is open. Expect to hear the buses more than the waves. Rooms on the other side may be quieter, but have views of other buildings. All told, I would consider staying here again.

Our travel agent booked us here for four nights, and it was a great choice. We were upgraded to a 14th floor suite with a balcony that overlooked the ocean, the park, and Diamond Head. The mattress was comfortable, the AC was soft, the shower was great along with lots of conditioner, lotion, shower jell, and soap. We also loved the helpfulness of the front desk and the concierge lady at the Expedia desk. She was a BIG help. At night we sat on our balcony and heard the street musicians. We liked this spot because it is at the end of all the hotels and restaurants. Turn right out of the hotel, and you can walk to restaurants and entertainment; turn left, and you can walk in the park and to the zoo; walk straight, and you're in the water. Lovely spot.

I just checked in......I am only staying for around 12 hours but decided to splurge for an "Ocean Front" room.....after being put in a room with a view of the "back yard" ....I went straight back to the front desk......they moved me very quickly and the clerks were friendly----however, I am looking at a nice view of the pol and a very very limited "Ocean view"......I paid premium price and got a room that is advertised on the website for $100 USD less......beware! I won't be back.

I've been bringing university students to this hotel for about 10 years on and off (sometimes the prices are too high), and have to say it's my favorite place to stay on Waikiki. Right at the edge of the strip, it's not down in the center of things, but that's a feature, not a flaw. It's a modest hotel with three star accommodations, but the staff this year was amazing. They were all just wonderful in every way, and I couldn't help but think they've had some training, because they were responsive and gracious with every request. The rooms were recently refurbished, but it's still not the Sheraton, so if you need that level of service this may not be the place for you. Lots of food options close by, Starbucks right outside the door, and the beach right across the street. I love the "neighborhood" and want to stay here every year. Also, check out the car rentals here before you go anywhere else. Volvo convertible for $94 is hard to beat.

My husband and I stayed at the Park Shore Waikiki for one night, and we were comfortable there. The room had the amenities we needed and a lovely view of the beach and a park from the balcony. The bed wasn't the most comfortable but it wasn't too bad. Very close to the Honolulu Zoo, which was nice.We checked out of the hotel for our transfer then discovered it wasn't coming for another two hours. The hotel stored our luggage away safely for us so that we could wander around the zoo until our ride came. We were charged a daily amenity fee, but that fee included Internet, room safe, and coffee maker in our room.

We like being off the main (noisy) strip in Waikiki and this was a good hotel for what we were looking for. The property is older and shows its age a bit. The rooms were comfortable, the bed was okay (not great). Even being on the end of the strip it was a bit noisy (even on the 10th floor). The service was good - be sure to ask for use of the beach chairs or beach towels so you can cross the street and enjoy the beach!

I read ALL the reviews on this hotel after I booked. Typically, we stay at any of the Category 6 and higher Marriotts or the Fairmont. This time, based on what was available for packages, I chose this location for the cleanliness rating, courteous service, quiet factor compared to all other touristy hotels, and proximity to waikiki beach.The value (worked out to less that $100 per person per night by booking Air Canada Vacation package 6 months in advance) for what we received was worth it. Our 210 square foot room (1208) was a corner suite with an unobstructed ocean view Juliette balcony and a spacious partial ocean view, partial mountain view facing the Aston Waikiki hotel. Bathroom is spacious and has plenty of counter space. On the 12th floor, the noise level from the Lulu bar below on a Saturday night is barely audible. Very peaceful. Toiletry amenities were very nice. Plenty of clean dresser drawers and a good size closet with luggage rack for storing your clothes. Yes, the balcony chairs are a bit dusty but I simply covered them with dollar store rain ponchos and that's where I hung our wet beachwear to dry overnight. The bedside lamps have two plug-ins each in case you like having mobile devices, readers, iPads, and such plugged in near your head. In the welcome material for your room, it states that linens are changed on every 3rd night of your stay. You can talk to housekeeping if you need other arrangements.We booked Scuba Diving (intro) and the Roberts Hawaii Pearl Harbour/North Shore day trip tour with the Expedia agent located in the lobby. She was very knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful (as with all staff at Parkshore). They offer good rates but only take credit card. Coming from Canada, the exchange rate (1.22, currently) is bit of an owie but the discount via Expedia offsets and there is value. Don't forget to bring extra cash to tip your tour director/driver.Beach towels and beach chairs were plentiful and readily available when you exchanged your beach card. We also enjoyed the pool area which was never crowded; at most, 80% occupancy on any given day and perfect view of the beach without actually being on the beach.If you want hotel room service for food, there is none. However, there is a service available with a list of places that will delivery to your door for a small service charge. We never used this as there are endless number of places to eat within walking distance, and open very late to cater to tourists, and large american sized servings. We gave away our doggie bags to some of the homeless people sleeping near the beach. There aren't many, but a few who have been forced out of their homes by rising apartment rental rates.They don't cause any trouble to tourists, and their are daily outreach workers who help support them. A local police presence is also right on the beach.No gym, but there is a 24 hour fitness located 2 blocks away on the main strip. The hotel can provide a pass for $15, or you can buy a weekly pass at the gym for $69 which offers a locker and access to showers whenever you want. Great for cleaning off at the beach or storing your wallets/valuables.There is a no-charge in room safe that is easy to use, and mini-fridge below it. We shopped a few blocks inward at Food Pantry for ready made salads, cheese and crackers, for midday snacks. The hotel offers complimentary early morning coffee water and juice midday until early evening in the lobby. Bring your water bottle/coffee thermos and get your free refills there.We met the manager, Scott Pauli, at the one hour, pre-sunset meet and greet on Wednesday, on the pool deck. Staff pours alcoholic and non-alcoholic champagne punch and serves up light savoury treats (e.g., maui chips, pretzel mix) while the manager comes around to introduce himself, asks how your stay has been, and for your feedback. Our only comment was that we would like to see blue recycle bins in hotel rooms for plastic water bottles, newspapers, etc. The trash bins are small and the housekeeping staff have to manually sort through our garbage for recycling.I booked an Island Express shuttle via the hotel to take us back to the airport on friday night. It is $13 per person with cash collected at the end of your ride. Cheaper than the $35 flat rate fare that is usually offered by taxis. The shuttle is a 10 person-seating van and arrives in a timely fashion, on the :45 every hour provided that you book through concierge.Our check out time was at noon, so we stored our luggage, ambled about, relaxed at poolside, went out for one last dinner and sunset, and then waited a couple hours in the nice lobby to charge up our mobile devices. There is access to bathrooms and a hospitality suite so you can change back into winter clothing :)I would recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys friendly service, a comfortable bed with nice view, clean towels and big bathroom, a "quieter" experience compared to other Waikiki hotels, and value for their money. The noise is everywhere as it is a major tourist hub and that can't be avoided unless you head away from Waikiki. To create the "Fairmont" type of indulgence, I booked a spa treatment at the Westin Moana Surfrider. It's a 10 minute walk away without the quadrupled hotel room bill. For eats, Tucker and Bevvy is convenient for a quick and nutritious smoothie, but Jamba Juice is a mere few feet away and always has coupons or a promotion (buy one get one free; check the star advertiser daily, or ask for a coupon when they provide samples). Starbucks is open until midnight, but if you walk further down 15 minutes to the main hub of activity, there are a couple artisanal coffee houses with better tasting lattes. Tips: The Saturday KCC (Kapiolani Community College) Farmer's Market is a 15 minute walk away, or you can catch a bus right outside the hotel. Worth it for the authentic Loco Moco and artisanal, locally made eats. Diamond Head, round-trip from hotel to crater and back on foot with a stop off at the park for Shave Ice and a burger is 2.5 hours. It's a 30 minute walk from the hotel to the no-charge US Army museum. You can take the bus back, but the walk along the beach with a stop off for dole whip or Honolulu Cookie sampling is worth it.Some reviewers commented that the rooms are not cleaned well, too small, too loud, bad view, not getting what they want, service unresponsive....first, you arrived safely in Waikiki. That should be a good start. You are steps away from a beautiful beach - that's the perfect view you should enjoy outside, and not from your window, although that is a plus. Ocean front is nice, but not necessary. If you want housekeeping to do more, talk to the manager any time, or at the wednesday reception and voice your concerns. If the balcony chairs are too dirty, ABC Stores are on every block for a 2 square mile radius, walking distance. Cover it down with a beach towel or plastic and then sit on it...or, perhaps use a small towel and wipe it down. Lots of things one can do to make their stay more enjoyable, but at it was, for us it was perfect.Thanks to the staff at Park Shore for helping make this trip so seamless and enjoyable.

My husband, two adult children (one male and one female) and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights which included New Years Eve. We had two rooms and both were comfortable with two double beds in each even though our room was supposed to have a king bed but more importantly suited our children as they shared a room. The beds were very good but the rooms were very compact. They both had a small balcony and if you turned your head to the left you could see the beach.We found the staff to be very courteous and helpful. As mentioned many times, the hotel is at the very end of the strip but that was fine as the noise levels were non-existent and it was still an easy stroll to Dukes Bar and The Royal Hawaiian. The other good thing about this hotel is that a lot of the tours appear to leave from the hotel next door which is the Queen Kapiolani so that was handy. Further, the hotel is right across the road from the beach where the fireworks were on New Years Eve. The fireworks were spectacular!We hired a car for the last day to see the rest of the island and took it to the airport when leaving for home. We were able to stop right in front of the hotel to load our luggage. We never saw the car park as the valet handled it the whole time.We ate breakfast at the bar in the hotel. Very good quality food. Shame it wasn't included in the price though as that would have been a nice touch.Would I stay here again? Yes I would as we all enjoyed our stay and it was reasonable for where it was but perhaps next time I would spring for a bigger room.

We chose the Park Shore from a friends recommendation. When we checked in we were upgraded from an Ocean Front to a Diamond Head Suite on the 14th floor. Our view is not the crazy atmosphere of Waikiki but a georgeous view of Diamond Head and partiical ocean view and overlooking the gardens of the zoo. Our suite includes a wet bar with mini fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker and a set of dishes. We have a king bed, a sofa sleeper and a long narrow deck, which looks over the pool below (3rd floor location). We have two chairs and a table outside biut would be nice to have a lounge chair too. Housekeeping service has been great and the front desk employees have been very nice to deal with. The hotel is located at the end of Waikiki strip but easy access to all the shops and restaurants with bus service just outside the lobby. There is also a Starbucks next door and a picnic sandwich shop along with Lu Lu's restaurant where you can get a burger or salad with a view of the beach. This has been a good choice for our needs.

Stayed there last year in peak season for two weeks. For top peak rates the Park Shore needs more to offer more value.With a small pool and no gym or spa they could offer suits at a lower rate. Also regular rooms are on the small side. They do have the beach chairs but they are old and very low to the ground. I would return, but only if the rate was in line with what they offer. On a side note, the Japanese restaurant in the lobby put us in the back rather in the front with the Japanese guest. Food was good but did not allow us in the front.

Good location but rooms lack sitting options fridge also smelled and again staff were polite but they didn't,t seem overly happy. We hired a car and travelled there from elsewhere on arriving there was no where to park without blocking entrance and everyone cranky because we were unloading and checking in. There was parking onsite but vallet only at $25 per day that didn't suit us as we were returning the car so had to drive two. Blocks to park car. I too was really sick well there and everything close by but beds really uncomfortable. Very dusty under bed and behind bedsides not good if you are asthmatic. gave a 3 star for the view which we paid extra for probably wouldn't return

Great location, reasonably sized room, lovely view. Both daughter and I became ill while there, so ABC sundries store and Starbucks on the first floor were lifesavers!!!Rented a car for the day through the hotel, which also saved a lot of hassleNice to be out of the rat race on other end of Waikiki

Located at the end of the busy shopping strip, away from all the crowds and shops but close enough to the beach and 10 minutes walk away from the activities.Facilities are average but lacking sitting options. There is only one stool and we had to sit on the bed. Closet door opens and blocks bathroom entrance. Coffee machine doesn't work well and mini-fridge smells.Front desk people are okay but not overly cheerful or helpful. Not sure if they are too lay back or tired of seeing all visitors coming and going.

Stayed in ocean front suite. Would highly recommend as you are garanteed unobstructed views of waikiki!Staff are excellent, and location is great. Would recommend if you wanted to stay away from the busy waikiki bustle while still being a 10 minute walk away from downtown. Right next to honolulu zoo, and teddys burgers next door is a must!Across the road the beach is much quieter than further down waikiki and you have the option of going in the water with concrete walls or without. Bus stops nearby can take you to pearl harbour or the trolley can take you to the ala moana shopping centre (about 40-60mins to get to each location).Rooms are cleaned daily. The air con can be abit loud but overall would stay here again if i came back to waikiki!

After a frustrating four-day stay at another Waikiki hotel last year, Aqua properties (who own both hotels) graciously moved my family and I into the Park Shore Waikiki for the remaining two weeks of our Hawaiian vacation. The entire staff - especially Front Desk Agents Crystal and Daryl Lynn - was absolutely remarkable in making sure that my family had the perfect Hawaiian vacation! We were placed in a spacious corner suite on the seventeenth floor with a breathtaking view of Waikiki Beach, Kalakaua Avenue and Diamond Head! I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who desires a Hawaiian vacation; situated by Diamond Head, and the bustling Kalakaua Avenue, and just feet away from Waikiki Beach the location of the hotel was perfect, and within walking distance (or just hoping a trolley) to any of Waikiki's abundant tourist hot spots. And when my family left Honolulu to fly back to Saskatoon, Canada, Crystal and Daryl Lynn greeted us with a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts in the lobby as a goodbye - so thoughtful! Thanks again to the Park Shore Waikiki for your service, I'll never forget it!

My husband, my daughter and I stayed here for a week. We had a great stay in general. The views were amazing - of the beach and Diamond Head. Generally fairly quiet during the day because it's at the end of the strip. Room was a standard hotel room but comfortable enough. The only problem we had was the bar downstairs that played very loud music until 2 pm nearly every night. We were on floor 12 but we could still hear it like it was in the room next to us. I rang the desk to ask when it might start to slow down and they said 2 am. When we went to discuss other room options the next day the desk staff could have cared less and suggested we might like to try another hotel. At the end of the conversation I felt very frustrated and moved onto my next question which was about gym access. There is no gym there but I appreciated them giving us two free passes to the local gym. To the hotels credit, they did hold a drinks reception by the manager to gain feedback on how the hotel could improve their service but I didn't make it. I was on holidays. Besides that I felt I had already given my feedback. I would suggest the desk staff need training on how to address client concerns in a more engaging way and would ask the hotel to consider their target demographic. If it is going to have a night club going until 2 pm most nights, maybe they should market themselves as that kind of hotel so the rest of us who are not seeking that kind of holiday can go elsewhere.

We booked our own hotel, in hindsight we should probable have opted for a hotel and flights package through our travel agent. For the price we paid I felt we got a very average hotel. Rooms are simple, the one we got was at the back and ended up being really noisy from alley noise. In saying that the hotel is essentially beach front and has easy access to public transport etc

The Park Shore is the closest hotel to Diamond Head. We had an ocean front room which had the balcony facing Diamond Head and the Juliet balcony facing the ocean. Every morning we were greeted by finches chirping on our balcony.We left both sliding patio doors open all night as there were no moths, flies or mosquitoes at all. The gentle trade winds blew through our room and kept it cool so fans and AC were not necessary.This hotel has updated all their rooms in the past few years and everything is fresh and clean.Walking through the lobby I notice there were openings to the building, but no doors to close. This hotel really gave us the feel that we were actually in paradise. We will return; hopefully for a long, long stay.

I chose this hotel for my family and they have praised me again and again for my choice. We stayed these for 5 days and 4 nights, in 3 rooms. The largest room requirement, for me and 2 sisters, was assigned on the 3rd floor right next to the pool. Quite amazing! My parents' and brothers' room were just okay on the 6th floor. Not so much view of the ocean but I guess it worked out fine for them. They care more about privacy above everything else. My sisters and I on the other hand didnt mind that there would be so many people outside our window. We loved the view and the pool accessibility too much!Quite a fantastic location! There's a Starbucks below. The bus stop just as you exit the building. I enjoyed Lulu's, the restaurant next door and the breakfast place. The Japanese restaurant inside the hotel wasnt that bad either! The beach right across is possible the most quite area in that strip of beaches. If we had children we wouldve taken them to the zoo right across!Great great place! Don't expect anything fancy from the interiors but goodness the simplicity worked really well for me in my opinion! Book here now!One last thing: The Expedia booth in the lobby and the lovely ladies who man it were very very helpful and patient. Grateful for them. The staff of the hotel were very helpful too!

We ended up at this Aqua hotel via Hotwire. Similar hotel brands in this rating bracket of 3.5 stars included Hyatt & Doubletree. Rate was $120/night, early January. LOCATION:The far east end of Waikiki at the corner of Kalakaua & Kapahulu. You're still in Waikiki but far from the crowds. There are tons of eateries & nightlife nearby as Waikiki isn't huge. There's an ABC Store right next door which is super convenient!PARKING:Pull up onto the sidewalk/driveway and there should be a valet there. Rate was $25/day with unlimited in's & out's. LOBBY:You're greeted by a spacious seating area with a nice view of Waikiki Beach. The small reception desk is off to the right, a 2-stall business center (pay for) and activity desk are left, and a Japanese restaurant is aft. CHECK IN:The female associate was friendly, pleasant & professional. There was no line at 5pm. ROOM 520:You could tell the room was clean as soon as we entered, as there was a whiff of bleach. Hawaiian music was playing on the telephone-radio. The room is on the small side. There's a king bed, desk area, flat panel TV, 2 balconies though the smaller of the two wasn't accessible and is used for window washing I presume. The concrete edging on the wall of the balcony was cracked pretty badly. The direct view is of a neighboring high rise, and ugly rooftop of the hotel. If you look left you can see a sliver of the ocean. To the right is the Kuhio Avenue skyline. I wasn't expecting more due to booking through a wholesaler. The king bed was firm & comfortable. The pillows were flat & firm which I prefer. I hate those overly puffy ones that fall flat with no support. The a/c was strong, controllable, and pretty quiet. WI-FI:Free with a strong signal. BATHROOM:There's a single basin, toilet, and shower tub. Shower water pressure was good with a quick drain. The shampoo and soap were nice & mildly scented. AMENITIES:All the usual including a coffee maker and free Star Advertiser newspapers located at the elevator banks. CHECKOUT:Again no line. Female associate was friendly and professional. She told me to book with them direct to get a frequent guest and kamaaina rate. VALET/BELL:Each employee I encountered were very friendly and welcoming. We even got a "thank you for staying with us" from a female associate. OVERALL:Good pricing, far from the crowds of Waikiki, great service & location. We're fans!

4 day and night stay at Park Shore. As soon as we got there we met Desiree, a front desk assistant. She was amazing and was always interested in helping us in any way she could. Made nice suggestions and really CARED about our happiness. She was a big factor in our hotel satisfaction! Location was convenient to everything and Lulu's restaurant was a lot of fun. All around terrific experience!!

Stayed 5 nights prior to cruise ,clean friendly ,room ( standard) small ,tiny wardrobe, pool small only hotel I have ever stayed in with no pool bar !! Good location nothing special on for New Years ,ok for short stay wouldn't reccomend for longer.

I have gone a lot of places with family and friends and this is very low on my list. Basic hotel. It does the job of housing you for your trip but no nice amenities that make you go "wow". They are all very basic. Pool is simply an oval. No poolside service. No jacuzzi. The best part of the hotel is the location next to Starbucks and lulus restaurant. Tucker and Bevvy is a little cafe next to the lobby which has amazing smoothies as well. Rooms are very small. Housekeeping is by far the worst of the hotel. Literally all they do is come in and replenish towels and make your bed they do not clean anything in the bathroom or on the floor. Definitely better hotel options in Waikiki.

Park Shore is one step above a Holiday Inn (at least they have free breakfasts) and can charge high prices b/c of it's location on Waikiki. There are several amenities that make it worthwhile- free wifi and towel service for the beach, but nothing special. The rooms are basic and the pool is small. It is a convenient location, less than 100 feet from the beach. Valet parking is ridiculous, but commonplace (unfortunately) in Waikiki (there is a pay parking lot across the street that supports the zoo for less money).

My first trip to Hawaii and was not disappointed by our choice of park shore. Away from the very crowded hotel scene yet close to everything! The room was clean and comfortable, kept slider to balcony open all night even with the noise from street. Had room 1707 which is the BEST view!!! Expedia agent onsite was convenient for booking excursions. Loved this hotel and would stay here again but next trip will choose a different island.

We had a wonderful view from our king size oceanfront corner room. The staff were all quite helpful and the location is the best in Waikiki in our opinion and we have stayed in Honolulu on quite a few occasions and never in the same hotel! We will return to this one for sure!

This was a really nice hotel mainly because of the price and location. It's right across the street from Waikiki beach making it easy to have beach time every day. You can also check put towels and beach chairs from the front desk, which was a nice touch. Since it's a bit off the main shopping area of Waikiki, things are a bit quieter overall which we enjoyed.While the rooms were definitely updated (nice tiling, granite), the actual interior of the hotel has an older feeling. The doors are very heavy and almost slam shut on you while getting in and out.Didn't really spend time at the pool but did note that there's no lights in it so it's not open past dark and there's no hot tub. Lots of nice chairs + a pretty view though.Staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the manager's drinks + snacks event. We would stay again (especially for the price compared to other hotels nearby)!

We took our vacation the end of Nov. This is a great place to stay. The front desk People are awesome and very accommodating. This was our 5th year stay at this hotel, I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. A lot more quieter across the road is the beach.

We really enjoyed our stay at this gem of a hotel. The staff was very professional and courteous. Our suite was very roomy and comfortable, and had an amazing view of diamond head and a partial view of the beach. They provide towels and beach chairs. Since we had a late flight, they allowed us to stay a few extra hours after checkout for an additional $10, which I though was a great deal. The rooms were well kept and clean. The location is ideal. The beach across the street has a seawall which makes it great for families with little ones. It's right across from the Honolulu zoo and a short drive from diamond head. It's away from the crowds, and the noise, but also a very short walk from the shops and restaurants. Oh the premises, it's Lulu's cafe, which we thought was wonderful, and had more than a few meals there. The food is very good and it's inexpensive. The Japanese restaurant on the first floor is pricier, but had very authentic Japanese cuisine. I did a lot of research prior to booking this hotel and I can honestly say it's one of the best values in Waikiki. We ended up staying at the Marriott, which is one block down from the Park Shore, after our flight back home got canceled. I am a Marriott rewards member, but I am glad that we chose the Park Shore for our stay, as our experience at the Marriott did not compare. The Park Shore exceeded my expectations. I would highly recommend it and if I ever go back to Honolulu, I know where I'll be staying.

My wife and I and our 2yo were looking for a quiet hotel that is away from all the hustle and bustle and decided on Park Shore Waikiki.We arrived at 8am and the (smiley) staffs were super accommodating and provided us with a room upon our arrival (instead of waiting till the usual check-in time of 3pm (mind you, we were travelling during non-peak season I might add). Lucky for us, every single one of the staff were really nice, super helpful and always wear a smile (this is before tipping!) - some even remembered us by name, how good is that?!The size of the room is on the small scale (esp if you compare it against those in Asia) but adequate for the 2.5 of us. The large King size bed occupied most of the floor space and the wardrobe was small enough to fit our 2x suitcases. The large TV with good cables selection kept us occupied during down time and the bathroom (with jet like shower head) was simply great. The room was clean and simple yet impeccable. Just a word of warning, if you are one of those who likes to sleep-in, try and find a room away from cleaner's amenities (ours was right next to it) as they start work early and there's not much soundproofing between rooms. Having said that, the cleaners were really nice and wears a big smile like everyone else.We didn't spend all that much time at the hotel pool as the beach is just a skip and hop from the front door of the hotel. The hotel provides free access to beach towels which is a welcoming touch, oh and free internet too (but don't expect super fast down/up-load)! There are plenty of simple, no-frills eatery and small shops around the hotel (e.g. Tucker & Bevvy, ABC Store, Starbucks, Lu Lu's, Jamba Juice, etc).Location of the hotel is perfect for us as we wanted somewhere away from the crowd - it is at the pointy end of the strip (literally) and across the road from the zoo (awesome zoo I might add). It's a bit of walk to the crowd centre (say, to Cheesecake Factory) but not difficult. All in all, we had an awesome stay and if there's two things we really have to pick on - 1) book a room away from cleaner's amenities and 2) the hotel scale is inaccurate (our luggage weighted at 29lb at the hotel vs. 26lb at the airport... we could have shopped more! lol)

This is the last hotel on the strip and it probably always will be, since the zoo is next door. The disadvantage of the location is that there are less places within a short walk. The big advantage is that it is less crowded. The beach is the best of both worlds. To the right of the hotel, the beach is protected by a breakwater, so the waves are calmer and there are almost no coral reefs to accidentally kick. On the left is the raw ocean, with all the excitement of the massive waves, but with much more coral.All the staff was very helpful.Even the guy pushing the laundry basket went out of his way to press the elevator button.We kept in contact during our delayed flight and they kept our specially reserved room available for us.The hotel is big enough to have the standard amenities, but it is small enough where the desk and valet staff knew us after just two days.Bed – very comfortable – 4 pillows on the bedDesk to set up a laptopDue to the layout of the hotel, you can ‘accidentally’ see into other people’s rooms if they happen to leave their curtains open. The rooms nearest the center of the hotel (closer to the inside of the ‘L’ shape) are more vulnerable. The ones at the far end of the wings are harder to see into.Bathroom had all the needed items including a blow dryer. A really great shower head with consistent water pressure all the time.Hint #1 – Rooms ending in 24 have a great view facing Waikiki Beach and a side window with a beautiful unobstructed view of Diamond Head. None of the rooms have a full 180 degree view of the beach due to the layout of the hotel. But what view you have is awesome.Hint #2 – You can save a few bucks by parking in the zoo next door. Check out that option before you check in to the hotel

Coudn't have found a better accomodation. Right in front of the beach, with beautiful Diamond Head view, and far from the late night noisy area of waikiki.Everything is walking distance, there are several breakfast options at the doorstep.Great service, but not too fancy, will make you feel welcome. The room was quite confortable and had everything we needed.I got a great deal on hotwire, but wouldn't change it even I had a lot more money to spend.The internet is free, but slow.

My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at the Park Shore Waikiki earlier this month. We loved everything about our stay at the hotel. When we booked our reservation, we had booked a room with a King bed. Unfortunately when we arrived late at night, they didn't have a room with a king bed and we were put into a room with double beds but the front desk agent immediately indicated that they were going to move us the following day. When we showed up the next morning to let them know we had packed up our stuff so we could move into our new room, the staff at the front desk immediately knew the situation and made the necessary arrangements and they did so with a smile. While both rooms were a little cozy, they were definitely comfortable. My husband and I have different preferences when it comes to beds and pillows and were pleasantly surprised that we both were very comfortable with the beds and pillows.The housekeeping staff did a great job always making sure our room was clean and fully stocked with the necessary toiletries and towels. The front desk and bell desk staff were always helpful with providing information and providing beach towels when we wanted them. The location of this property was great! We liked that the hotel was not in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the strip but was accessible to anything we wanted to do. While not right on the beach, it is right across road from the beach which makes the location very convenient for those that like to spend time in the sun and water. The property also has a nice pool on the third floor for those that don't want to deal with the sand. We really appreciated the hospitality suite that the hotel offers so that we could clean up before we left to catch our late night flight back home. Being able to shower after being out all day long before the long trip home was a nice touch. While it didn't matter to us because we weren't spending much time in the room, there are some rooms that don't have much a view or look into the hotel next door. Scott and David and all of their staff were always welcoming and ready to assist with any questions or requests with a smile. Mahalo for making our trip so memorable. We will definitely be back.

My husband and I enjoyed are stay at Park Shore the location was perfect the staff is amazing the cost was great.The room was a little small but it was clean with nice decor. I highly recommend Park Shore!

Firstly, this hotel we believe is almost in the perfect position, last hotel on the beach before zoo, 30 seconds walk from the beach and only minutes away from shops and food. There is a bus stop almost immediately outside the entrance to the lobby which we used several times. So as far as location goes it's ideal.We paid a little extra for an Ocean Front room which I am very glad we did as the views we had from our room were fantastic.The room size was adequate, although larger rooms are always appreciated. We decided to unpack our suitcases into the furniture as there wasn't really space to leave two suitcases on the floor.The bathroom was on the small side with no bench top to speak of which meant we left our toiletries bag on the floor, no big deal but if you are the type who travels with your entire bathroom in a bag, you might struggle with this room. (see photos)The bedding was very comfortable and we both slept well our whole stay.We had read reviews saying that on Sunday and Monday nights, the noise from the bars downstairs (outside the hotel) can be heard in the rooms and we can vouch for that. The music went on until close to midnight and I didn't manage to get to sleep until after that.
