We were on the 14th floor so I feel sorry for anyone on a lower floor in this hotel or neighbouring hotels because it would drive you mad.The room had tea and coffee facilities but nothing else. A toaster would have been appreciated so that we didn't have to eat out for every meal.House keeping seemed to come at random times during the day. Some days we would come back at 10am to find the room cleaned, some days at 2pm they still hadn't been through.This room certainly wasn't cheap and I would say was okay in terms of value for money but I would be searching the web for the best prices for this hotel.Staff were always very friendly and helpful. Check-in and out was easy and hassle free and we were very lucky to be able to access our room much earlier than the 3pm standard check-in time which was very much appreciated.We would look at staying here again.

We stayed in room 1507 on the 15th floor. The view of Diamond Head must be the best. Also view of Waikiki Beach was wonderful. As everyone has said everything was perfect and within walking distance. We shall be back.

Had the most relaxing holiday. Room was just right for two of us with the amazing oceanview on the 15th floor room no 1509 and breeze coming through without being windy. Room was very clean with all the necessary utilities with comfortable bed and was quite roomy. Room was serviced everyday. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Loved going to Lulus - one of the eating places in the hotel. Food was excellent but serves are hugh so maybe order one entree and one main and share as the entrees are quite big too. Is on the quite part of Waikiki Strip but in working distance to other restaurants. Very nice to go for your walks as it is closer to the park and Diamond Head. Recommend the hotel for families also as the beach across the hotel is very handy and safe.
user_name:
Pushpa N
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: The Park Shore is in a fantastic location. It has the beach on one side and the park on the other. It is a little bit quieter down the end of the strip but still in close walking distance to all the Waikiki restaurants and shops. There are a number of cheap and convenient food options right next to the hotel where you can get an array of foods - fruit,sandwiches, ready made salads,coffee, etc. All In all a great place to stay.

This was my second time staying at Park Shore, and it didn't disappoint. When me and my partner arrived we were lucky to get upgraded to a one bedroom suite, much more room than the normal suite. It had a larger bed, bigger bathroom, two balcony's and big kitchen, although we didn't use it much as we only stayed 4 nights and ate out every night. The room was very clean and modern.The location of the hotel is further down the strip, closer to Diamond head. We like this better as it's not as busy as the main part of town. The view from the hotel of Diamond Head and the beach is the best in Waikiki, no other hotels blocking the way. The beach, shops and transport are all in walking distance. Any future visits to Waikiki and we will be staying at this hotel. Not only for the great location but the friendly reception staff, if you ever have a problem ask to speak to Jara, she is very helpful and such an awesome lady she will go out of her way to make sure you have a wonderful stay.

This place might be at the end of the strip, HOWEVER, dont let this fool you, its also close to Diamond head, and Kapiolani Park , and the beach on that end is pretty sweet. Rooms: 5 Stars! This place is clean, roomy, and for some reason, the ocean view room really had a sweet breeze coming on in. Strong one too. Location: As above, end of strip, but peaceful! Amenities: 5 stars. Grab a drink and some ono grinds at the cafe and call it a day!
user_name:
Akira221
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Overall, this was a good value considering the great location across from zoo and beach- pool side has great views of beach and diamond head. Not crazy about $25 /day parking charge, but is unlimited 24 hr valet, so guess it's not so horrible. Room is quite small but very quiet and good views, and very clean- staff are very friendly as well.

This was my fourth visit to Hawaii and the best hotel pick. It is a moderately priced hotel that is actually better situated than some hotels that are double or triple the price. We were two friends travelling together and didn't plan to spend too much time in the room, so we opted for a park view double, which was less than $170 a night. Call the hotel directly for best rates. We still enjoyed a sliver of an ocean view for the price. Staff are friendly, knowledgeable and eager to please. If you're interested in taking public transit, several buses stop directly in front of the hotel -- including buses from the airport. The bus system is very easy to navigate, so consider this as an option for getting around the island. (App available for download before you leave will give you the schedule). You can even take TheBus to the North Shore and Hanouama Bay. Park Shore is directly across the street from the beach and the hotel provides towels and beach chairs. Lulu's for breakfast is a must.

This hotel is in a perfect location in Waikiki. Directly across from the beach, with a ocean view! A nice pool and a beautiful lobby complete with coffee and juice all day. It is near the zoo and a beautiful park perfect for walking, jogging, and they have concerts there and craft shows. It is an older hotel but rooms are nice. I opted for the possible "upgrade" of $17 per night in order to get an ocean view room...and it was successful! We had a view of Diamond Head out our balcony and the Ocean as well. We could not have been happier. They have beach towels as well. All-in-all a great deal for the price. Our room had a fridge, safe, coffeemaker but no microwave.

My family and I stayed at the Park Shore in Waikiki in July this year. We loved the location and the facilities were good for the price. The convenience of being able to walk across the road to the beach or going downstairs to Lulus for breakfast was fantastic. However a few weeks after we departed, I was contacted by the manager who indicated that we had not paid the balance of the bill and asked me to call them to arrange payment. This was despite the fact I was advised the balance would be taken off the card I had provided at check in. I reviewed the transactions on my card and not only had I paid, the hotel had charged me twice. I contacted the hotel to confirm this and asked that the funds were refunded to me. The manager indicated he would look into it and get back to me. This was in August and in November I have still not heard from the hotel despite numerous follow ups. I contacted my bank and they refunded the duplicate charge but it was quite a hassle and I was really disappointed with the lack of response from Park Shore management. This is the reason for the poor rating I have given. Loved the hotel and the location but would be very wary of providing them with my card details and for this reason I am unlikely to stay again. If you do stay, make sure you check the charges as soon as you return and query any additional charges with your bank immediately to make sure you are not out of pocket.

I read many reviews for a number of hotels and settled on The Park Shore. I am so glad I did! Arrived today after a long travel time and weary from long hours at work to be met with kindness and warmth. The very wonderful Annie made sure I got a dream room, I could not have asked for better service. Thank you Annie!!! Another lovely staff member I didn't catch his name (jet lag) dealt immediately with a question that I had and also followed up to make sure every thing was OK.Stellar service, gorgeous location. Can't wait to see what the rest of my time here brings. I'll be a repeat visitor to the Park Shore for sure!

We have been visiting Hawaii for over 20 years on a regular basis ~ however, this is our first stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and efficient. We arrived early from Australia, our bags were stowed away safely and our request for a high floor with an amazing view was met and delivered with a smile ! Our room on the 12th floor had an uninterrupted view of Diamond Head and the Pacific Ocean. The Hotel is clean and well kept and quite modern. We loved every minute of our two week stay and look forward to returning to the Park Shore Waikiki.

I stayed at the Park Shore back in 2010 and couldn't wait to come back. Returning this year, the hotel was just as good as I had remembered, and with some new added extras as well.Arriving in the morning from Australia, our bags were stowed away safely and we were offered a hospitality room so that we could shower, relax etc until our room was ready. We were very thankful to have showers after flying for 9 hours overnight!Our room on the 15th floor (partial view) was great, quite spacious and a lovely bathroom. I loved the Paya toiletries! It was great to open the curtains each morning and have our room flooded with blue from the ocean.I liked the pool area as it was never too busy. Front desk staff, concierge and Expedia staff were always very friendly and helpful. I loved the constant supply of fresh water and POG juice in the lobby, such a nice touch!There was only one small noticeable thing during our stay and that was that you could tell when there were different maids servicing our floor - on a few days when our beds were made, the sheets were never tucked in. This wasn't a huge deal though, I would just tuck them under myself before I went to sleep (i'm definately a 'sleep tight' person!)I still give the Park Shore a 10/10 and I cant wait to return again!

We spent 8 days at the Park Shore Waikiki and were very impressed with the service, our room and the VIEWS! Lenhy met us when we arrived and was very efficient in checking my family in. We asked for an upgrade to an Executive Suite which was done with a smile.I am glad we upgraded the views were magnificent! We had Diamond Head, the beach and the Zoo all in our sights. We could see the Flamingos and Elephants from our balcony.The room was clean and a perfect size for the three of us. Our daughter slept on the sofa bed in our room.I will definitely stay at the Park Shore again.

We stayed a couple of nights, firstly having a room on 6th floor looking towards the sea, the second stay we had the 'city' view! The city view was normal, but the beach view was nice and pleasant. Rooms were a sensible size, everything worked and staff were helpful. Facilities at the hotel were find, we didn't use the pool or restaurant.The hotel offers parking for usd 25 per day, but there is on street parking which is free from 7pm to 7 am, which was good for us given we were out looking at sights all day.Location is good, at the end of the shops on Waikiki and just across the road from the beach.Overall, at the price, we were happy.

We recently stayed at the Park Shore hotel on Waikiki. The location is great, next to the Zoo and at one end of the Waikiki beach area. The rooms are somewhat small but clean with a nice view of the beach. The hotel staff are quite friendly and helpful. The price is about average for this beach strip.

Overall, a good hotel with a beautiful view (if you get a Shore room) in a great location, with great customer service.The GoodThe price was great, though 2 different employees implied we could have gotten a better deal had we booked directly with the hotel. When we arrived, we asked to move up to get a better view and less noise. The front desk employee didn’t move us up much, but since it was our first time in Hawaii, she moved us from a Park room (view of either Diamond Head or the city) to a Shore room (view of the ocean). The view was absolutely fantastic – words really cannot describe it. Beautiful sunsets over the ocean from our balcony, and beautiful sunrises over Diamond Head from the outdoor pathway right outside our door. The customer service was very good. We were greeted upon arrival and given free juice (juice and water are always free in the lobby). Throughout the stay, everyone was very helpful. We were even invited to a managers’ reception at which some select guests were given free drinks (with alcohol, if you choose) and snacks, and they asked for our feedback. The location was great too – just a quick walk across the street and we were on the beach. From here, you can either walk down to the end of the Waikiki Wall for some great views, go right for a calm ocean with a breakwater, or go left for a more realistic ocean environment with no breakwater. They give free warm towels and chairs (don’t lose the towels or you’ll be charged a fee). Or if you’re in the mood for shopping, just don’t cross the street out of the hotel – walk West down Kalakaua. The room itself was clean and had a modern phone system, which was easy to use when the front desk left us messages. Housekeeping was great. The room even has a hair dryer, which might not seem like a big deal, but it was for us since our luggage was packed to the brim without one. Each room has a small refrigerator, as well as central air conditioning (or heating, not that you’d ever use that). There is a door on almost every balcony that will allow you to connect 2 rooms. There is a small but clean pool that the staff cleans every morning around 7:00. The rooms all have free WiFi.The BadMy biggest concern is probably that the beds are small. They advertise queens, but they are actually fulls. The pillows were not very comfortable. Also, there’s not much storage, nor many hooks to hang wet stuff on. The bathroom had a very low showerhead, but this is pretty standard in most hotels. The noise was pretty bad throughout the night. We could hear a lot coming from the ocean side, but even more from the city side, which I think was due to the fact that our door didn’t really seal very well. There is an ABC Store just outside the door (there’s one on just about every corner), which is great during the day, but noisy starting at about 4:00AM when they begin to restock. To be fair about the noise, this is probably the case with just about any hotel near Waikiki. Also, we were on the 5th floor and the noise would have been less were we higher up. One of the elevators was broken when we first arrived, but it was repaired and functioning perfectly within a few days. One of my biggest complaints about the cost is the fact that they nickel and dime you to connect to the Internet or print in the Business Center. Also, the parking charge is very high, even relative to other hotels in this area. It’s valet only. Also, there is a community microwave, and no washing machines/dryers, though they say you can get housekeeping to do your laundry, presumably for a fee (don’t know for sure as we didn’t use this service). The WiFi is slow, unreliable (the connection drops and sometimes won’t reconnect automatically), and, last but certainly not least, unsecured.

We have stayed at the Park Shore many times. The location is perfect for us with it being at the end of Waikiki; we can get in and out of Waikiki quickly by going through the quaint town of Kapahulu (which has great local places to eat). Waikiki Beach is just across the street,Honolulu Zoo and the Aquarium are within walking distance. The Shell, outdoor auditorium, and Kapiolani Park sometimes have concerts or festivals about 2 blocks away. There is a fee for parking and they have valet always available to bring your car. There is a restaurant/bar on the second floor that has good food and sports on TV screens. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Our stay here was wonderful. Lovely friendly staff, very clean, enjoyed every minute of our stay would reccomend anyone wishing to stay here a lovely time. Great location. Kevin was very helpful. Cannot fault hotel just beautiful .

My family of 4 stayed in this property Nov 14' and were very pleased. The hotel is located at the end of Waikiki (the diamond head end) so I found it to be a bit quieter than the other Waikiki hotels yet close enough to restaurants. The hotel has great service (though one elevator was down for maintenance, one day of our stay). The pool is not an attraction but who need a pool when Waikiki beach is right across the street? The hotel has great eateries including Lu's Lu's which has great food and service and a Japanese restaurant.The parking is valet only, but the staff was very quick.We splurged for a room with a view of the water and diamond head and were not disappointed. There is a convenience store next door too.I would love to go back to this property.

This was our first stop on our big holiday - we chose to stop in Hawaii from Australia, on our way to the US mainland, as the time difference isn't so harsh... also - what a great place to stop. Park Shore Waikiki were great - we had a view of the beach from our room (from our bed, in fact), we were close to the main attractions on the beach (including the beach itself, of course!) and the staff were very helpful. I would return, especially considering the reasonable price.

We spent 5 nights here, having booked an oceanfront room ($$$). The staff were great, the pool deck was spacious with lots of loungers, umbrellas and a few tables. The view is stunning and the proximity to the beach is the big selling feature - 100 steps from door to sand. The big downside is that it is right on a very noisy corner where buses loop incessantly. I like to sleep with the lanai door open. It was just not possible, even with ear plugs. If you sleep with the door & window closed, air conditioning running, this might be just for you. Or there are some non-view rooms that look into another hotel that would not get the same noise.

This was my second visit and it was as nice as the first. I love the location and amenities. The beach is much nicer than those at more upscale properties. You can choose the protected area or right next to that, the beach is open to ocean, (my preference). Seems like the locals like this beach too!

My mom and I stayed here for a girls week long getaway. We arrived a few hours late for check-in due to a delayed flight, but were met with no problems and even received complimentary chocolate covered macadamia nuts. (I think the receptionist felt bad for us after sharing our story of an unexpected 7 hour layover!) ALL of the staff was kind and welcoming at ALL times! I feel this is such a rarity anymore. Throughout our stay, housekeeping did a wonderful job of straightening up for us daily. Clean towels were always hung up for us, and extra towels and beach chairs could be picked up at the front desk when needed (complimentary). The hotel is located on the end of the main strip, but everything is within walking distance (1 mile or less). The city bus picks up across the street, and the Pink Line picks up one street over. The Zoo is located directly across the street, there is a Starbucks and ABC store located next door, and Tiki's Grill and Bar is right around the corner (a must!). The location is quiet, has an outdoor pool, and is a one minute walk from the beach. Also, the Wifi was always working! If I ever make my way back to Waikiki, I will definitely stay here again.

Arrived here as our first hotel during our two weeks around the Hawaiian islands. Couldn't have asked for a better room with views along Waikiki Beach all the way to Diamond Head. Staff were friendly and everything within easy walking distance.

Travelling with our teenage girls in September we booked the 1 bedroom oceanfront suite. Everything was clean and well laid out. The airconditioning was great on the really hot days. The view from the room is FANTASTIC! The staff go out of their way to be as helpful as possible. The beds are super comfortable and the bathroom spacious.The hotel is in a great location - right down the Diamond Head end of the beach - where there is more sand and less people. The pool, though not large is sparkling and refreshing and it's elevated position offers peace and privacy.

We stayed for 5 nights in october, we did ask to change rooms as I have a bad leg and wanted a walk in shower this was done for us with no problems. The rooms are small but nice and clean its in a good location for the beach , zoo and shops, we eat at lulus everyday either for breakfast or our evening meal you have got to try there cornbeef hash it was so nice, the pool was very nide with great views across the sea. Only disappointing thing for me is that why we was there it was my 50th birthday and the hotel did nothing for me my travel agent said the hotel knows we r there for a special birthday and might upgrade us or get some fruit or something in the room but no nothing at all , all they told us when we ask about a nice restaurant to celebrate was to go to uncle bos which was nice but it was more like a cafe very disappointed as this was not the type of place I wanted to spend my 50th birthday, dont think I would stay here again.

There was a huge security issue, some inconveniences and we were disappointed with our experience after reading the mostly positive reviews. Arrived early due to only flight from home city arriving late morning. We were given a swipe card to a guest courtesy lounge while waiting for a room to be ready, which took three hours to be an hour after check in. While we were in there asleep (jet lagged after international flight), two other groups came in to use it too, it is a shared space, but was uncomfortable to be in such intimate surroundings (and sleeping) with strangers. We only got our room after I rang reception to follow up, goodness knows how long it had been ready for. That's a problem with arriving earlier than check in, I acknowledge that, but the hotel didn't seem that busy and full to have to wait three hours for the room to be cleaned once they knew we'd arrived, and they weren't pro-active in letting us know when it was ready.However, the worst was to come. My teenage daughter was alone in the room having a shower while we swam in the hotel pool. She had just got out of the shower when someone not only tried to open the door, but did open it - with a key card for the room! My daughter encountered them when they were standing IN OUR ROOM. Reception had issued new guests with a swipe key card FOR OUR OCCUPIED ROOM. We had already been there five days, it wasn't like it was a mistake on check out day. Thank goodness this newly arrived Japanese couple went back down to reception without incident to get another - unoccupied - room. To me, that is just totally unacceptable and dangerous. How does a hotel allocated an occupied room to new guests and provide access to that room?Reception didn't even call to follow up. I had to call when my daughter told me what had happened and go down and ask for new coded swipe cards for our room. It seemed no big deal to them. It was to us! We were worried about leaving our belongings in the room after that, lest more new guests "check in".My other comment would be about the room itself. We paid the extra for a Diamond Head "suite", and yes, it had a magnificent view of the beach and Diamond Head. However, to call it a suite is a stretch. There was a very small kitchenette - we either had to use the toaster or the kettle as neither could fit the space at the same time, there was a small bar fridge and a little sink - and nowhere to sit to eat our toast and coffee. There were three of us in the room - to eat you had to sit on the bed or the lounge (which stayed folded out as the second bed) with your plate on the low small coffee table. There were no chairs to sit on inside. There were two chairs on the small balcony (lanai) - when I called to ask for a third chair so we could all sit in the room or balcony, I was told no, only two chairs for the balcony, fire regulations. And there were no chairs inside. If you are going to market and sell at a premium a 'suite' with rooms to suit families, then the occupants should at least be able to sit together. The three of us could not, we had to take shifts in the chairs - or eat sitting in bed, not what we expected of a suite.On the positive side, the location is good, away from the hustle bustle and housekeeping staff did a good job. The noise from Lulu's and revellers on the street does travel up and kept us awake one night in particular (and we were on the second highest floor). My daughter was disconcerted by the comments of the homeless based outside the hotel as she walked past, but that's not the hotel's fault. The pool is good for cooling off but nothing fancy, the view is the best part.I would love to be able to give the hotel a better review because it is in a good location but I can't overlook the negatives of our experience, particularly having other guests being able to enter our room as a teenage girl just stepped out of the shower. She still has nightmares about what could have happened.

We went to Waikiki to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday and stayed at the Park Shore. What a great location, the staff was excellent. and the beach was right across the street! We couldn't have asked for more! We loved that it was at the end of Waikiki Beach and away from the hustle and bustle. There were no other hotels in front or beside us, which gave us an amazing view of Diamond Head when we woke up and of the beach when we sat on our lanai. The other reviews mentioned small rooms, but for a couple the room was great and who wants to stay indoors in Hawaii anyway? We will most certainly stay at the Park Shore on our next visit to Waikiki!
user_name:
Jonna I
Petaluma, California, United States

review_body: I stayed only overnight to get to New Zealand. Went out the next morning and came back a bit late for putting back everything I took out from the luggage. After an overnight flight, at my New Zealand hotel, I remembered that I forgot to take my iPhone charger off from the lamp power outlet at Park Shore. Two weeks later, when I returned to Honolulu on the way home, I went to grab my iPhone charger and was told that nothing was found in that room the day I stayed. Sure, who doesn't wanna a spare iPhone 5/6 charger. Other than that, the hotel is really outdated. You can spend roughly the same money for a night at Marriott right across the street, and they do bump you up to an ocean view room free of charge if the hotel is not busy. The room is small, you literally need to put your luggage on a bed to get your stuff. Hopefully it was the just the room I stayed in. No public washroom at the lobby unless you are still checked in and have the facility key in hand. Free internet, quite slow. The two star is for the location.

After spending two weeks, without air conditioning, in a VRBO home in Kailua, Oahu it was indeed a pleasure to spend out last night on the island at the Park Shore Hotel at the end of the strip in Waikiki. I had called a couple of days before our reservation when I learned we needed to be out of our house earlier in the day than I'd expected. I requested an early check-in, which I understood may or may not be possible. When we arrived, 4 hours before the designated check-in time and 1 hour before the designated check-out time, we were told they would call my cell when a room opened up and that we could stash our luggage in their secure room in the meantime. Before we even got the opportunity to translate that conversation to the valet parking folks, a nice young man named Kevin had an early check-in and an upgraded room ready for us! It was such a relief and we truly appreciated his work to make this happen so quickly. I certainly didn't expect it. Because the hotel is located across the street from the zoo, park and aquarium, it has less of a busy feel. The room Kevin booked for us had a beach view and a view of Diamond Head. We had a third party with us for the day who was waiting for an evening flight back to the mainland. They provided us with a beach towel for her as well at no charge so we could all use the pool. The first time I stayed there was in 2003 and was treated well, thus the choice to go with them again. I'm sure it won't be the last time we stay there.

Great location across the road from the beach. Well worth purchasing an ocean view room; I suspect the city views will mainly be of the wall of adjoining hotels. Ocean view rooms look towards Diamond Head and not down the main Waikiki Beach. Rooms ending in 07 are on the corner and should be rooms which give you a view in both directions. Yes it is an older hotel; yes the rooms are small. And yes, I would definitely stay again. Staff were friendly. An open sided restaurant (Lulus) connects with the property and we enjoyed breakfast and dinner there. Book a bar side seat if you can - it looks across the road and out across the bay.

We have stayed at Park Shore several times and always enjoyed our stay.The location is good still on the main drag and across the road from the beach but away from the hustle and bustle of the busy section of the strip.Service is very good and they have on multiple times been able to meet our request for an early check in.Pool is basic but does the job. We spent most our water time at the beach anyway.Get a corner room to have views of the ocean, Diamond head and the zoo.Overall a good value hotel.

This is an older hotel - although many of them are in Waikiki - but the location is great, just away from the main area but close enough for all the action. Directly opposite Waikiki Beach. We had a renovated Ocean View room which faced the ocean and looked down at the pool area. The room was not huge but was clean and tidy, the King Size bed was comfy and the shower worked well. We had to pay extra for valet car parking which for the price of the room should have been included but it did have free wifi. All the usual amenities were provided, so no surprises either way. The pool area was fairly average and should be beautified a bit more. The staff that we dealt with were all friendly and accommodating. Tucker & Bevvy is a little sandwich/coffee shop next door and is awesome! Would we stay here again...not sure. I would have rated good if this was an option as I felt it was better than average but not quite very good. There was nothing bad about it - maybe we had just been spoilt with other hotels on this holiday and didn't feel this was anything special.

The location is good and if you have a ocean view room it will be very nice. It is a nice place to stay if you want to enjoy the waikiki beach but want to stay quiet. However, the room itself is quite small especially the bathroom. There is only on microwave inside the entire building.Room service is just average. Sometimes forget to refill the shampoo, soap..etc.The wifi is quite slow unless you pay more which is not stated during booking.

The hotel is ok. Old but ok.What top hotels have shower curtains?? This one does.We got a really nice room with a great view so can't complain there.Staff were nice.The pool is crappy.I just don't rate this place.Meh

We stayed here with teenage children so had two standard rooms on the same floor. Rooms were clean and well serviced. Not having an ocean view was not an issue for us as beach is just across the road. Caught the bus to Diamond Head from bus stop outside hotel and buses into Waikiki from a block up the road. Beach towels and a limited number of beach chairs available.

Not what I expected for the money we spent on a partial ocean view room, however clean and good location. For the same price can get better value also next to the beaches. Don't use the surf shop below - terrible service!!!

the great thing about Park Shore Waikiki is that it's a few seconds away from Waikiki beach, but just a building away from the corner thus giving it a little bit of a chill vibe away from the noise of the main street. The room was quiet and sufficient, service was excellent as well. Beside the hotel is Lulu's a restaurant and a bar that serves the best buffalo wings. Parking is at $25 a day but across is the Honolulu Zoo which has a more affordable public pay parking. Tucker and Bevvy, a nice restaurant that serves excellent sandwiches is at the lobby of the hotel as well. They also lend you beach towels and chairs at the lobby. Thanks Park Shore for a fantastic stay!

My husband and I came to Hawaii in July for the first time. We loved the island lifestyle. This resort was great if you like the busy Waikiki area. The hotel is within walking distance of all the great shopping and restaurants. There is a valet parking fee every night you stay here, just like every other hotel on Waikiki beach. Rooms were extremely clean, and the staff was wonderful.

This was an ideal spot to stay in Waikiki. There are plenty of restaurants and convenience stores nearby and the beach is right across the road. We jogged up to Diamond Head, caught the bus to the shopping mall and did a tour to Pearl Harbour. Everything is accessible and easy.The lady on the expedia desk was helpful.We checked in about midnight and there was a party going on next door, but our room was lovely and quiet. It wasn't a sea view room, but we could just see the ocean from the (small) lanai.I liked the café downstairs, it had some healthier food options for breakfast or lunch. The complimentary juice in the foyer was appreciated - lying round on the beach can be thirsty work. The hotel pool didn't look very exciting, but it didn't matter since we just went to the beach. There were a few beach chairs and boogie boards to borrow from the concierge. A really nice, relaxing stay.

This hotel is at the end of the strip next to the zoo, opposite the park, looking at Diamond Head and opposite the beach with uninterrupted views of the ocean. There is no better hotels if you want views of the beach. We booked an ocean front room and it was our second visit to this hotel. The view is to die for and we spent many hours people watching and sunsets from our balcony with a cold one in our hands. The staff go out of their way to welcome you, make sure you are happy with your stay, give helpful advice about anything you want to know. Even the manager came to the pool and asked if everything was going good and even asked if there were any problems and asked our opinion if they could do anything better. Managers only show their face when they know the hotel is being run very well and I believe this hotel is spot on. I believe this is the best hotel for the value for money and one of the few that has space around it and not overlooking other hotels up in the concrete jungle where they are more expensive. There are buses at the door, cabs in plenty of supply, good restaurants nearby and a good swimming pool in the hotel grounds.

We stayed at the Park Shore for a week in a corner room. I would definitely recommend booking a corner room. We stayed on the 15th floor, facing the ocean and overlooking the zoo and up toward Diamond Head. It was lovely sitting on the balcony as the sun went down and watching the surfers out on the breaks or in the afternoon, with a cool breeze blowing in from the ocean. Extremely handy to the beach - just across the road and handy to a couple of the bus stops for the different tourist bus routes and pick up for attractions too. We caught the loop bus to Diamond Head - stops about 500 metres up from the hotel on the beachfront and the bus to one of the popular shopping centres - stop just around the corner outside the hotel next door. Price was extremely reasonable for the location. Room was a good size with windows looking both north and west.Staff were helpful and pleasant.Restaurant/bar downstairs was reasonably priced with a good selection of meals. It was also popular with tourists, especially for breakfast on the weekend and evening meals. Either book ahead or expect up to an hour's wait for a table.ABC stores downstairs and the coffee shop off the foyer were handy for picking up a cheap lunch sandwich or snack later in the evening.I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is not classy but it fits the bill. Rooms fairly small but beds comfortable and clean. Bathroom small & dated. Nowhere to put anything at all, however there is a counter top just outside the bathroom. Good shower and nice towels. Coffee maker and fridge. We had an ocean front room which gives a nice view of the ocean and Diamond Head. At first we had a straight on view to the beach but the afternoon sun was so hot that the room would not cool down. However, the lovely lady at reception changed us without any problem at all. She was extremely kind and didn't make any bones at all at changing even though we had used a towel and the cups. She is a real asset to the hotel. Quieter area of Waikiki but plenty of abc shops and other cafes etc nearby. Also close to buses if you need to go anywhere else.

We booked a zoo package, which gives you a ocean view room and Honolulu Zoo tickets. The room rate was cheaper than normal ocean view rooms, so very happy to find the package.We were given a corner room where we could see Diamond Head (very nice) and the ocean on a lower floor (this is the reason why it was cheaper), so we saw people in the pool and people on the street, so not much privacy. Also, being on the floor we heard a lot of noises early in the morning such as garbage trucks and delivery trucks, so definitely recommend to stay on a higher floor.As soon as we walked in the room, we could smell stale / moldy, and saw some hair on the floor and in the bathroom which was a real turn off.The hotel is located just across from the zoo and the beach. There's a bus stop just outside of the hotel, and the trolley bus stop around the corner, so very convenience place to stay. You can access to Lulu's Waikiki restaurant from the second floor, so it was handy when it was raining.

I highly recommend the Park Shore to anyone wanting a great location. It is out of the main hustle but quick to access everything you need including the trams/buses.We had 7 adults staying in 3 rooms and they were all clean and tidy throughout our stays. The cleaning staff were very friendly. Reception were happy to answer any queries we had.Tucker and Bevvy cafe in the foyer is a don't miss for healthy and tasty salads,sandwiches and juices with the closest thing to real bread we tried.We had breakfast at Lulu's or Tucker and Bevvy most days and it was delicious! We celebrated a birthday at Lulu's and we all had the Surf and Turf and it was so good we returned for more of the same the next night.My family felt this hotel had everything you could need for your stay-comfortable beds, bathrooms with all you need, ironing boards, great air conditioning but pay for the Ocean Front room the view is brilliant!We will be back to this hotel when we return to Hawaii! Aloha

Nothing fancy. But it has been remodeled. Rooms small but comfortable. Greetes to you room with Hawaiian music. The views from the higher floors of Diamond Head and the beach could not be better. Hotel is at perfect location on the strip.

Great location, friendly staff and hotel is right on the ocean. I booked a partial ocean view room and was very happy with what I got; however if you can afford it, consider booking ocean view accommodations.

Pros:Good size room.Fast and free wifiGreat location near the beach, park, Zoo, Diamond Head and Aquarium. Room DécorQuality beach towels.Cons:Limited storage for clothing. Limited to a few coat hangers and bedside tables. Hotel lobby and hallway décor outdated (but clean)Summary:All in all a good hotel for what Waikiki has to offer. WE got it at a special rate and not sure its worth the full rack rate, but find me anywhere in Waikiki that isn’t overpriced. We did get upgraded to an ocean view (from partial view) but the view was still only partial. However the view was overlooking Diamond Head and we felt this was better than the ocean view any way, even though we couldn’t see the sunset from the room or balcony. We found most sunsets we were out and about any way. The Staff were friendly enough and there is an Expedia salesperson in the lobby area where you can book most activities for all your islands, but there is of course a small commission on that. Research and booking yourself through the local websites will save you 10-20% but convenient if you don’t have time to research and book everything yourself. Hotel has a swimming pool with deck beds and umbrellas but its nothing spectacular. We found the hotel contracted airport shuttle service cheaper than speedi shuttle and provided a much better service.Would stay here again at the price I paid but not for the whole rack rate.

we loved this hotel. we were here for our honeymoon. We liked the location at the quieter end of waikiki, near the park, we had a lovely partial ocean view. the room was clean, beds comfortable, excellent WIFI, great balcony, nice toiletries. exactly what we wanted. staff were super friendly.

The hotel was very good, well located, nice staff. It was not super clean, the linen was not changed for days but we complaint and the manager and all the staff had a wonderful attention with us. Overall it was very good.

Waikiki can be an expensive place especially in the middle of the main precinct and beachside so in looking for a place to stay consider what is important, a good clean place slightly removed or being right in the heart of the action. For a small compromise this hotel delivers most of what a budget conscious traveller requires. It represents excellent value for money and is a stones throw from the high end hotels and stores with a good range of restaurants in the locality.Clean rooms comfortable bed and friendly staff get this place a recommended hotel and I would have no hesitation staying here again

The hotel was pleasant, clean and the staff all seemed friendly and helpful (except the tour/ excursions ladies) however if you have a phobia of elevators then this hotel is not for you ! The only way to get to your room is via the elevator as the stairwell is alarmed and may not be used . The pool area was always pretty quiet which was nice and the maids done a brilliant job of cleaning the rooms. Overall this hotel couldn't do much more to improve on.

Have just returned home from a fantastic 6 night stay at the Park Shore - what a find!!! We have two young children who love swimming so I booked a room on the Pool Deck, this location was ideal for us - we just opened the door & there was the pool, no lugging towels etc downstairs :) I also found it a great pool for kids as it has a long step & good sized shallow end - buy a couple of floats from the ABC store in the lobby & your children will have tonnes of fun.The room size was fine for the four of us, had modern furnishings & was kept very clean. The coffee in the lobby of a morning & lovely juice throughout the day was a nice touch & very welcome. It was great to have an ABC store attached to the hotel & we also enjoyed a lovely breakfast at Lulu's on the 2nd floor. We loved being at that end of Waikiki - the beach across the road wasn't totally crowded & it really isn't that far to walk to the centre of Waikiki (even with kids) plus the trolley stop is just around the corner.We really enjoyed our stay & would book the Park Shore again in a heartbeat - I booked this hotel purely because of the rave reviews on here & am now happy to say I can add my own too.

Considering the location and the price, you won't be sorry for choosing the Park Shore Hotel. Be sure to ask for an upper floor, corner room for the best view of the water and the beach. The hotel is quiet at night and the beds are super comfortable. All employees are extremely helpful, courteous and professional and the location is great if you don't mind walking the length of Waikiki beach and checking out every hotel and bar along the way. Suuuuuuuuuper!!!

If you want an ocean view without the price tag this is the place to stay. Be sure and request an "Ocean Front" room, the higher the floor the better. Many hotels in Waikiki are very ambiguous as to what constitutes an ocean view, so be careful.Slightly above average sized bathroom, bath with shower over. Room size a bit above average with a good sized balcony (lanai). Good air conditioning. Clean.Reception staff very good. Good location adjacent the zoo, easy walk to shops and just across the road from the beach.The Park Shore is not a flash hotel but at its price point it represents exceptional value for money, particularly if you are after an ocean view over Waikiki Beach.

Terrific location directly across from Waikiki Beach and next to Honolulu Zoo and city parks. Very clean room. Beautiful sunsets. Much to do and see. Great restaurants. Diamond Head in the background too. Loved convenience of "ABC" store in hotel for snacks, t-shirts etc.. Great coffee too. The room's location faced another bldg so only able to see city view by looking left on balcony, ocean view would be much prettier. Coffee avail in room as well as daily newspaper. Canceled rental car because THE BUS, was $2.50 and just across the street from hotel and took us to everywhere.

Just stayed a week at the Park Shore. Check in was a breeze, I had requested 2 rooms that were close to each other prior to arriving and was given 2 rooms side by side on the 17th floor. Our view was that of another hotel and their balconies so the curtains were closed most of the time. Not sure what room we booked, I just took what they had on their website as this was a very busy week in Honolulu and many hotels were sold out.The rooms are clean but definitely on the small side. I'm usually used to at least having a desk and chair to do some work on the computer. The AC units work well and cool the room in seconds since the room is not large but they do run a little on the loud side when the fan kicks on. You'll be watching tv at normal volume and when the AC kicks on, you will have to turn the volume up.One thing that I noticed and mentioned to Scott the manager is that it seems that the room doors all have a lot of play in them once their closed. Every time someone on your floor closes their door, you will here a loud slam which can be annoying. I think a .10 piece of adhesive foam could do the trick. Scott mentioned that they are aware and are in the midst of replacing the door assemblies.The room was always cleaned well other than one day the attendant missed one garbage bin (not a big deal) Internet is free in all rooms but you get what you pay for. It's fast enough for checking email but anything more than that will seem to take forever. You can however opt to pay for a higher speed. I did notice though that I could pick up the wifi signal even at the beach and at the zoo across the street so perhaps the speed or lack of speed could be the result of others surfing on the open network.There is a Japanese restaurant in the lobby area , Lulu's which is on the second floor and is kinda attached to the hotel yet its not, and Tucker and Bevy, a Panini/Smoothy cafe. We ate at all except the Japanese and they did not disappoint. One thing that I did miss is a lobby lounge. I really enjoy larger lobbies with a bar and sometimes live music. You will not get that here.The pool area is not as small as I thought from what some other reviews said. There is no bar or anything though other than a vending machine on the same floor. Seriously though, We didn't see any point in using the pool when the beach is just steps away. This part of Waikiki beach has an artificial reef to block the waves and its the perfect depth for lounging around.I would say that the Park Shore is a solid no frills hotel that prides itself with great service and location. I love the fact that the beach is right across the street so we did find ourselves spending way more time at the beach than we normally do (we come to Waikiki every year) Would l like to see the Park Shore with a nice lounge and maybe a restaurant with room service? Absolutely but would that stop me from coming back, probably not. If your looking for something as close to the beach as possible without being on the beach, this hotel will work for you. The location is great as it's not quite as busy at this end of the strip yet you can be in the heart of the action with a short 15 min walk.

My husband and I visited Hawaii for our small honeymoon. Hotel was great. Great location . Close to everything and right across the beach. Couldn't be happier with our stay. I will definitely recommend it to friends and family. Will soon be back and will be staying here again. Staff is also nice and helpful.

The Park Shore Waikiki offered an excellent bang for the buck. The room was pretty standard, somewhat dated, but very well taken care of and cleaned. The location is about as good as it gets, we had a great view from the room. Even the hotel restaurant was good. Would stay here again for sure!

Stayed 6 nights in September and loved the hotel. We had an ocean view room with a stunning view looking down Waikiki beach and diamond head. The room wasn't huge however it was plenty big enough for a couple and our big suitcases! The room had been renovated and the bathroom was lovely with lots of bench space. The staff at this hotel were very helpful and friendly and we loved the free juice in the lobby each day. Didn't try out the pool as the beach across the road was so beautiful. Easy walking distance to the heart of Waikiki however plenty of food and drink places and shopping right at your doorstep. Happy hour downstairs at lulus highly recommend. Bus stops right outside. We loved the hotel so much we cancelled another hotel reservation to stay here on our very last night before flying home, we also got a great rate as returning guests. Will definitely stay here again.

Spent 10 nights at this hotel - amazing location across the road from the beach, good sized rooms, spotlessly cleaned, if slightly dated decor.The porters are the best source of hints and tips - Violet has got to be one of the nicest people we have ever met in Hawaii!Great views from the balcony, and the pool deck and pool was clean and quiet on the days we had to use the pool due to jellyfish (do not ignore the jellyfish warnings! They only put them out when people have been stung!)

We visited Hawaii for the first time and stayed at Park Shore after being recommended.The location is fantastic with easy walk down to central town area and beautiful views of beach and Hills,We had a partial ocean view room, Would highly recommend these rooms as you get morning sun , but not the setting sun into your room. We had 17th Floor, with great views.LULUS Bar and restaurant was excellent with great service,food and drinks. The pool on 3rd floor had views of the beach and had plenty of shade if you need it. Pool is not huge , but is more than adequate,

This hotel is great value in location and service. The room was spacious with amazing views over the beach and Diamond Head. The beach was so close that we didn't even use the pool. It was a quieter position which suited us but was close enough to walk into the centre of Waikiki easily during the evening. Every night we had a wonderful view of the sunset from our balcony.The staff were always helpful,polite and friendly.Bevy and Tucker and the ABC stores were great and provided interesting food when we didn't want to eat out.

Stayed here during school hold and selected it deliberately based on reviews that it was not a "holiday resort". Not disappointed. Had a very quiet stay. Even the pool was relatively uncrowded and peaceful. We had an ocean view room on the 8th floor with a view over Diamond Head, the Zoo park, and the beach. Our room faced the side street, not the beach which would have been ocean front view. Loved it. Room had balcony, TV, free WiFi, fridge, a comfy queen bed, iron, & hot shower. Everything was clean. There is no laundry just a service. The foyer was huge & welcoming and fresh coffee was served in the mornings here & juice and water throughout the day. They also had a tour desk, direct access to a convenience store & a Japanese restaurant we did not try. Parking was valet only & I think was $25 daily. The hotel is at the eastern end of Waikiki with easy walking access to the strip. The staff were welcoming & friendly. What I didn't like. Our room was not made up until after 2:30pm day one & I asked about why it was so late. It was intimated that this was normal. I let the desk staff know that I preferred to have my room done early & it made no difference, our room was made up around 3pm the next day. We were also in residence during hurricane Elissa. At no time did hotel management contact us to let us know what hurricane procedures we could expect, or need to follow. At one stage we asked at the front desk & the staff seemed surprised that we would want to know anything. Fortunately the hurricane was a non event but I honestly believe I would have felt better knowing the hotel had contingency plans for its guests. Overall the hotel provided a fabulous Hawaiin relaxed atmosphere at a competitive price. I would recommend it without reservation.

Situated on the edge of Waikiki the maps don't do it justice this place is a great value. We took the whole family and got a double queen room on the lanai. It opened up to the pool which was where we spent most of the time. Of course we went to the beach which was right across the street but with kids the beach can be rough. The pool overlooked the beach and part of diamond head. Also right across from the zoo although we didn't bother. Our friends (a couple) upgraded to a view room and we're glad they did. Views of Diamond head and the ocean. Otherwise they would have been staring at the hotel next door or perhaps a sketchy alley. I'd stay again.

The location of this hotel is truly one of the best in Waikiki. It is located at the far end of Waikiki, facing a park containing the Honolulu Zoo, Waikiki Aquarium, and completely unobstructed views of Diamond Head.I am a little confused about the difference between the various room types. They have rooms listed as "Ocean View" and "Ocean Front". The website makes the "Ocean Front" rooms look much better, with balconies that directly face the ocean, while the "Ocean View" rooms seem to face Diamond Head and the beach on the south end of Waikiki. I reserved the "Ocean Front" room, yet when I got to my room, the balcony was facing Diamond Head. I went back to the front desk and asked the difference between "ocean front" and "ocean view", and as suspected, I was told that the ocean view rooms are facing Diamond Head. I then asked the clerk why my "ocean front" room was facing Diamond Head rather than the ocean. He then seemed quite annoyed, and said, well, my room had a window that faced the ocean, so it was "Ocean Front". I was not happy with this answer, but there were no other rooms available that night. After settling in, I grew to enjoy the Diamond Head facing room, but I still feel I was mislead by the hotel and charged for an "Ocean Front" room but given a cheaper "Ocean View" room. Ultimately, I decided that it didn't matter, and that I wouldn't let it affect my vacation. Again, the unobstructed view of Diamond Head was incredible, and I did grow to like it very much.The room seemed newly re-decorated (as stated) and did include a mini-fridge and free WiFi (slow). The room was on the small side, but big enough. Lulu's restaurant is located adjacent to the hotel, and we ate breakfast here 3 times during the week, and it is recommended. The beach to the south of the hotel is wonderful, with trees and grass behind the sandy beach. I never had any trouble finding a great spot with very few people on this section of the beach. The beaches in the middle of Waikiki are so crowded and loud, I was very happy to be on the south end of Waikiki.I did appreciate the wonderful recommendations of two of the front desk clerks, one I believe was named Linda and I regret I don't remember the other lady's name - they both seemed genuinely interested in offering helpful suggestions and made the effort to always greet us and make us feel welcome.I would stay here again, I would just be careful to make sure that I really did get the room type reserved and paid for.

We stayed here for two nights and it was great! Fabulous location - right across the road from the beach and minutes walk to good restaurants and there is an ABC in the building which is pretty handy. There is a bus stop just outside the door that takes you to Diamond head which is close by but beware the bus is not regular and you can be waiting for AGGGGGGGGEEEEESSS ( which is nothing to do with the hotel but good to know!).The staff were really friendly, the room was clean and when we stepped out on the lanai we had a nice view of the beach. Standing in our room we had a view of the building across from us but that didn't bother us in the slightest ( we didn't go to Hawaii to sit in our room!).We didn't hear any noise at all from the restaurant below at night.We checked in before lunch and our room was ready even though check in was at 3pm - completely awesome after a 9 hour flight!I think this hotel is very good value if you want to be close to the beach in Waikiki!

Stayed here for one week and had a fantastic time. Really nice location just across from the beach at the quieter end of the beach but still within walking distance to shops etc. We arrived early and they let us have a room right away. We had a pool deck room which might not suit everyone but we loved it! Would be really nice for families with young children. Room was fine, really clean, with a small fridge which was very handy. Staff were really nice and very helpful. Booked a couple of trips with the expedia desk in the lobby lady was really helpful. Attended the managers pool deck gathering on Wednesday, what a nice touch. They spoke to everyone and asked how we were liking the hotel if we had any complaints etc. We thought this was a really good idea. Another thing we found was that all the other guests were so friendly and everyone seemed to like this hotel. Would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend this hotel. Had a wonderful time and thank you to the Park Shore for making my birthday special. Hope to return to Honolulu and the Park Shore.

At the time of writing this review, this hotel is ranked 9 out of 82 hotels in Honolulu, which seems to be a little overrated. It's a good hotel, but not a great one.Upon check-in, we were told by a male staff member that we had 2 rooms with two double beds booked under our name. Surprised by this, we explained we'd only booked one room (there were only two of us, why would we need two rooms with two double beds each??), but he insisted that he had 2 listed on the computer and in not so many words, that it was not his problem and we would have to take it up with hotels.com who we had booked through. We were certainly not paying for a second room so we rang the company, who in turn rang the hotel and the issue got sorted. The check-in guy was quite unfriendly following this and we got the impression he held a certain disregard for us the remainder of our stay.I read on another review that no-one mentioned the 10% discount for Macy's on the back of the hotel room key card - this was also not mentioned to us, but fortunately we discovered it for ourselves early on in our stay.The room itself had free wi-fi and was a small to reasonable size, but did not have a lot of desk space to put things. The beds were comfy enough, the balcony only big enough for one person, with a lovely view of another hotel and its balconies, but with a snippet of ocean front. The toilet in the bathroom had the weakest flush ever - we had to call for maintenance late one night when it would not flush and was filling up with water. A plumber turned up not long later to fix this issue, though the power of the flush left a lot to be desired.The hotel has a small, quiet pool with a nice view of the beach, an ice machine, an ABC store attached, an activities & tour bookings desk, and is directly opposite Honolulu Zoo and a walk across the road to the beach. The location is great for the beach, shopping and restaurants.Don't bother bringing a beach towel. The hotel gives you a towel card and you can change your towel as needed at the front desk. Just be sure not to try and hand it to the concierge, who will step back and react in a repulsed manner. Instead, drop it in the chute over the counter as directed before receiving your fresh towel.Overall, it was an average stay - the room was quiet, the price is reasonable and the hotel is in a good location. But should it be rated number 9 out of 82 hotels in Honolulu? Probably not.

Hotel is across the road from a great swimming beach and within easy walking distance to central Waikiki. We had a ocean front room with a nice balcony and fantastic views. They are a good size as are the bathrooms. They are clean and well serviced. Check in and out is painless and the staff are great. A special mention to David on the front desk(excellent service) and also to the lady services the rooms(great job). There is a bar on the 2nd floor which serves both food and drink. Didn't try the food but the beer is good.

Stayed here with a friend for 3 nights in May 2014. The hotel isn't far from the airport and most of the shuttle services would know this spot. We arrived really late but was warmly welcomed by the team at the front desk and bell services. There is a large lobby area and the couches were very comfy. In the mornings, we could always find a lightly flavoured juice and ice cold water available in the lobby as well. We had a partial ocean view room which was directly facing another hotel room's balcony (only negative point). The room was luxurious and the beds were comfy. All the necessary basics can be found in the room even free Wi-Fi! The hotel has a tiny swimming pool and a couple of restaurants but we never had time to use them. There are ABCs at every corner of the hotel (and all of Waikiki) plus a Starbucks right outside for that quick fixer upper. The best thing about this hotel has to be its location. Although it's right at the end of the strip next to the Honolulu Zoo, we loved that the beach right opposite was always empty; more space for everyone! The Royal Hawaiian Centre is about a 15 mins walk away and some Waikiki's famous restaurants (shout out to Marukame Udon & Eggs'nThings!) are just within walking distance as well. If I ever visit Waikiki again, I'd stay at Park Shore Waikiki in a heart beat!

Right across the road from the beach and right next to the shops and food. Real handy spot. We chose to stay there again on the way back as well. The staff were most helpful and the rooms are all clean modern and tidy. There is a pool on the 2nd floor.

It's right opposite the beach, couldn't be a better location. We had room 1219 which is a partial ocean view, problem was though directly opposite was a balcony (literally 6ft away) so we had absolutely no privacy. Luckily we didnt intend on using the room very much.Also this is not a resort style hotel, there is a pool but it's small and there is no pool bar/food. Only vending machines. The pool was quiet though (which I like) and it didn't seem there was any children in the hotel (which I also like).It looses a star for it's ridiculously overpriced valet-only parking which is $25 per night.

We stayed at Park Shore Waikiki based on the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and we are happy we did. Magnificent views from our Oceanfront room. View of DiamondHead on one side- ocean on the other. The view of the Honolulu Zoo was nice too. The end of the strip location was perfect for everything. The staff were all friendly & helpful and guest manager, David, went out of his way to personally welcome guests. Nice! Leny at the front desk was always helpful and ready with a smile. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Lulus, right in the hotel, had great drinks and food! We chose the ParkShore because so many reviewers said they would go back again. We wholeheartedly agree. The Park Shore location is perfect and the staff does all it can to make sure you enjoy your stay.

Can't say enough good things about this hotel, right by the beach,lulus for breakfast, ice punch or iced water in the lobby by day,, hot drinks in the morning ,,nothing to much trouble for hotel staff,,I asked for a kettle for my tea,,no problem ! Great views of the beach and ocean,,lovely clean rooms , Mahalo to Josie our room maid, lovely bathroom toiletries, great bathroom, loved the shower,, comfortable bed , I just loved this hotel, A big Mahalo Park Shore for our Awesome stay back in June I'd recommend your hotel to anyone. See you again someday ,❤

We recently stayed at the Park Shore with another couple that we travel with. Perfect location away from the crowds but still with everything close by. The view from our beach front room was beautiful with a good size balcony with a little table and a couple of chairs. We loved lying around on the chairs by the pool which was never over crowded. The staff were so friendly and helpful and nothing was ever too much trouble. I would definitely stay here again when next I visit Hawaii.

I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and chose it because of the excellent recommendations it got - I really wanted to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian but it was over budget. I am glad we didn't stay there now as we walked up there quite a few times and it was always so busy and crowded and long lines at check in. Park Shore however was so chilled out and never felt crowded. The staff couldn't do enough to help you and always had a "Aloha" attitude. When we first checked in I was disappointed with our room so asked to move up a few floors and we were moved the next day without any issues. Our bags were taken care of and we were told to just go enjoy ourselves whilst they changed the rooms over. It was worth moving as the second rooms views were amazing and we spent most evenings watching the sunset from our balcony. The rooms are small but they are clean and refurbished - who spends time in their room anyway! the TV was great with many channels to pick from and the beds really comfortable. We were very happy with our decision and loved our stay at Park Shore and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

We recently stayed at the Park Shore -- a party of four with two teenagers. The location was perfect -- because the hotel is at the end of the strip, we didn't ever feel that we were boxed in by other hotels -- the hotel is across the street from a public park and beach so the children were able to run across the street and be in the ocean in minutes. The facilities were excellent, the decor was great, cleanliness and housekeeping was excellent. The lobby was always cool and calm and the offering of juice was a nice touch on returning to the hotel. We would definitely stay here again -- excellent service, easy access to amenities and the beach just across the road, in addition to the hotel pool.

Often I am drawn to places because of its beauty. Staying at this hotel before, I was drawn to return and am giving it the best review I have given a hotel in years. First off, I was extremely impressed with the decor, friendliness, and pure Aloha spirit of the customer service agents, house keeping, and activities reservations desk. If you are traveling single, on business, with friends, or with family, there is everything here for you at your convenience. They have a lovely restaurant, LuLu's, which offers an Island/Asian/American cuisine. They even have a happy hour from 3-5 pm daily. Try the coconut shrimp for a taste of heaven. What sets this hotel apart from the others: new renovations, very comfy beds, excellent customer service, and one crosswalk between you and the most amazing beach in the world. Are you loaded down with beach toys and strollers? Not a problem. You're steps away from family beach time. Have an aching back you're trying to heal in the sun?(this was me)...no problem, you're maybe 20 steps from heaven. Literally. Want to go shopping? It's directly outside the hotel. Need some tylenol at midnight? Not a problem. Want to jump on a bus and go to the farmer's market or Diamond Head or even the North Shore? Right outside. Everything you need is a breath away.You can even take surfing lessons and book it in the lobby. No matter if this is a honeymoon, friend's trip or a staycation, you will love staying here. The amenities like the pool, eatery, valet parking and convenience to the beach are bonuses. The Honolulu Zoo is also directly across the street!So whisk your worries away by booking this hotel. And keep returning again and again. Trust me, I have visited many and never loved one like I love this one.

This was a great place to stay! Wonderful views, the staff was amazing! Our AC broke at like 11pm but the repair guy was down and ready to fix it right away! Highly recommended, did not try the sushi downstairs but I'm sure it was amazing as well.

The Park Shore Waikiki is in a great location, its right across from the beach with great veiws without the huge price tag. The Zoo is just across the road for the famalies and Lu Lu's Restaurant is just on the corner with great food and service all day long.The staff at the hotel were friendly and very accomodating to the guest's needs.The rooms are clean and some have been revovated ie- new carpet, bathroom fittings and some paint.The pool area is fairly baron, no palm trees or even pot plants but has a great veiw come sunset wich makes you not worry about the rest.An abc store and starbucks is just down stairs, it also has valet parking, they were very prompt and courtious.All in all it was a nice place to have stayed..

We travelled with another couple from New Zealand and were holidaying in Hawaii to get married. When we checked in we were given a room on the top floor (level 18) and the staff were very friendly and welcoming and wished us all the best for our upcoming wedding. The view from our room (we had booked a Diamond Head suite) was amazing, great views of both ocean and diamond head from our lanai and also could see elephants in the zoo down below. The room was very clean and well set up, was great to have mini-kitchen facilities (microwave/toaster) as it meant we could do some minimal cooking and entertaining in our suite. We would definitely recommend this hotel as best value in Waikiki.

After a long flight we arrived at our hotel, they let us check in early albeit in the wrong room. We didn't say anything as we were all jetlagged from our flight and our little man needed some sleep as well. The next day we asked about our room as we had booked an ocean view, we were told we hadn't and would have to pay extra if we wanted that. As it was my partners first trip to Hawaii we paid the extra $55 a night and moved rooms. The staff were all very helpful and friendly during our stay, we loved the close location to the beach, starbucks and the many restaurants on the esplanade of Waikiki Beach. We spent a day walking through the zoo, directly across the street, which our little man loved. If you are looking for great location and decent rooms, albeit small, then this is not a bad option.

We spent 6 nights here in August, 2014. We had a great view of Diamond Head and the ocean. The room was nice, but as others have noted, not huge. Convenient location directly across the street from the beach. The staff was very helpful. We would definitely consider staying again, although there is a walk the core of the Waikiki area.The in-house Lulu's restaurant and Starbucks were very convenient and provided good food. If you go to Lulu's, the bar-style seating along the outside "railing" provides a great view and fresh air.The valet parking provided fast service - our car was ready within 5 minutes each time.Very convenient to Diamond Head, if you want to hike.This hotel provides a very good value. You are right at the beach in a nice facility, but the price is less than the big hotels.Some reviews have mentioned noise. Waikiki is a city, not a country resort. It has all the noises of a city. The hotel is at the intersection of two major roads with a bus stop outside. Some reviews have mentioned the homeless. Again, this is a city. Unfortunately, in our society, there are homeless in every city. There was nothing out of the ordinary and we felt completely safe.

Second time at this hotel, newly renovated, still the same courteous service nice and clean, best location skip hop and jump to the beach and if you like shopping nice and close to all shops....Love it coming back again

I admit that i was a bit hesitant to stay here because it seemed like a budget and dated hotel but I was beyond impressed when we got here. We stayed here 3 nights earlier this month and could not have been happier. i spent numerous hours researching all hotels in Waikiki. We had three goals: 1) Oceanfront View with balcony 2) decent price 3) good location. We got ALL three with this hotel and the staff was so friendly and helpful everynight of our stay. I was always greeted when we left and arrived back in the hotel everday and i made it a point to talk to the front desk staff who would always recommend places to go or try. Desiree was a memorable front desk member whose personality shined!This hotel has everything you need in the room which are remodeled. Our View was simply amazing with an unobstructed view of Diamond Head and a picturesque view of the Oceans Blue Water. The Waikiki Sunsets were unrivaled as we spent it on our very spacious balcony over a beer! It's fantastic. We were on the 21st floor and i would agree with everyone that the higher the better, and yes splurge a bit for an oceanfront room, you will not regret it! Image waking up everyday, turning over to the side, and seeing the ocean as far as eye could see. Almost like you were on a ship. It was amusing to see the other hotels i researched along the avenue and am glad i didnt reserve them because what they touted as oceanview was a side view facing the beach such as the Marriot and Hyatt for prices way higher than what i paid.We did not hit the pool although it seemed ok.. but why not just cross the street and be right on the beach itself and be sure to get the free beach towels they let you borrow at the front desk. There is a breaker divider along one side of the beach and open on the other. It's perfect for a non-swimmer like me to hangout and wade in the breaker reef section. The water was perfect and i could stand in it. It was like a private pool in the ocean with an unrivaled view of the city along the coast.The hotel has a connected ABC store that has everything you need and a Starbucks so it worked for me. Also stopped by Tucker and Bevvy for some sandwiches for the road.. Location location- This place really is still central to everything along Kalakua Ave.. everything within walking distance within a few blocks and i never felt unsafe as some had mentioned. Waikiki is a bustling loud city but you really do find some peace at Park Shore. Also the street to the side of the hotel led us to many places that were on our Foodie List!!- a few blocks from Leonards, Rainbow Drive In, Zippy's and even Alan Wong's felt like an easy drive plus it takes you to the freeway if you drive all the way down. If you are adventurous you can even walk to Diamond Head to take the trail!Bottom Line- If you are looking for a good priced hotel that is central to Waikiki yet you feel like your still on a relaxing vacation. this is the place for you! Should definitely keep this high on the list of considerations. oh and free fast WIFI!I can go on and on about this place but I'll leave that to the next patron!Aloha!

This is one of those hotels that flies under the usual radar. Is it a wow factor hotel ? Well depends on the room you select, and based on the ocean facing upper level room we booked , there was lots of WOW factor.Rated around 4 star, Park Shore is well located opposite the beach, yes ocean front location. Quieter end of the beach front near the zoo, but close enough to the action if you don't mind 15 minutes walking to reach Waikiki's central hub.Our double room was clean, in good repair and large enough to have space for the normal dance of 2 people with suitcases etc . So, there is also an ABC store adjacent, also a Starbucks if you like their style of coffee and ditect access to Lulu's bar bistro. Enough choice to keep you interested andMany more food choices within a comfortable distance.If you would like an Aussie connection, try Tucker and Bevvy next door, providing fresh and thoughtful food that is a welcome non-fried food option that is owned and managed by a friendly Aussie.Give this hotel serious consideration and book directly as this allows options to discuss room choices and preferences that online providers do not offer nor guarantee. Thank you Park Shore from a 3 time patron.

I was lucky enough to get a corner with Diamond Head view from one side and Waikiki beach from the other. The balcony was small, no more than 2 people, but what a place to sit and have morning coffee and evening drinks, the views were incredible. The room was clean and well laid, with a coffee station and small fridge. The bathroom was quite large but there was no counter space. The pool area was clean and the chairs were comfortable but you need to head to the front desk daily to sign out a pool towel and sign it back when you're done, which can get inconvenient during busy periods and those slow elevators. The convenience store attached makes buying water et al convenient. The front desk staff were professional and friendly.

It's all about location and price staying here. Although I must say the staff were brilliant. They were very friendly and we were allowed to check in earlier than expected. We asked for a toaster to be added to our room, as we're not big breakfast eaters and they obliged straight away at no extra cost. Can't complain at all.

We spent 7 nights in the hotel in a high floor oceanfront room with amazing views. Overall we thought the hotel is good value for money in a good location and we will stay here again next time.Pros:- The oceanfront rooms on the corners of the front building have incredible views- The location is great as it's literally on the water, a stroll into the centre of the action but not too noisy- The cafe, restaurants and bar underneath are easy eating options- The concierge was great, very friendly and helpful- Clean rooms, comfy bed, no neighbour noise - Had no problems with wifi, amenities etc, the hotel also provides beach towels at no charge - Good value for moneyCons/Tips- Make sure you get a room you're happy with, there seems to be a variance even in the same category, get a high floor and go ocean view- Air con is noisy- It's not super flash, their website pics are very well done :)- Yes the room keys are fickle!- The pool area isn't amazing but it's tidy and the loungers are comfy, it's a good spot in the afternoon for a quiet swim if the sun, beach and crowds get too much

We stayed there for 2 nights before boarding the NCL Pride of America. Clean and walking distance to Diamondhead. They even upgraded our room for free. One of the more affordable hotels on Waikiki Beach.

I stayed 7 days in Hawaii, and chose this hotel, due to is location.And the choice couldn´t be better.
