Is is perfect ,located in the begining of Waikiki, just in front of the beach, na besides Honolulu Zoo.My room had an incredible view of waikiki beach, and is well equiped with all of you need. The only con is the old furniture.It´s important to underline that the hotel doesn´t provide breakfast, but you can book the package with it included, and they give a voucher to use in the coffeeshop just beside. Also, there is a strabucks few steps away.Location is perfect, close to everything, but out of the parties disturbance.And the best: price were unbeatable to this level of hotel.

We stayed at Park Shore for our honeymoon. Upon check in, we were advised we had been upgraded. The room we had booked was an oceanfront, which we did have (and it was amazing) however the upgraded room also had a view of diamond head. the room itself isn't huge, however it was more than satisfactory for the 5 nights we stayed there with 2 big suitcases and 1 small case. The bed (king size) was comfortable. The shower pressure was fine, bathroom bench was huge with lots of space however the bathroom wasn't modern. The pillows were hard however we called reception and requested other pillows, which were a little softer. Nice big pillows. The hotel had an expedia travel desk downstairs in the reception, which we booked 3 trips through. Malia on the desk was really helpful and friendly, however one gentleman we struck wasn't so much. I had emailed Park Shore twice in the month or 2 leading up to our stay, to ask if they had a hairdryer on site, as I couldn't see anywhere on the website that said they did. I never received responses from them.. I ended up having to ask on a forum on trip advisor, and previous guests advised me of the answer. I thought it was pretty slack of Park Shore not to respond to two emails. In saying this, the staff at check in and check out were helpful and very friendly, as were the porters and the cleaner was also lovely. Pool at hotel is nice, has a view over the beach. The hotel is at the end of the strip, so is in a slightly quieter area which is nice, yet only a 10-15 minute walk to the cheesecake factory, dukes, macys etc.

We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise . It's a nice hOtel it's not a huge Vegas style hotel more a local hotel. I thought this part of the beach was best as it had a breakwater so it was quite safe for children. The rooms were not huge but the beds were comfy and clean. That's what I'm most bothered about. There's a fridge in the room, the balcony is very small no furniture on it but I was facing another hotel so I wouldn't have used it anyway.the swimming pool is just that, it's not big or fancy but there are plenty if loungers and it was very replacing around the pool. The staff are the most polite and friendly I have come across. There are complimentary cold drinks in the foyer and the rooms have coffee makers. If I was to go back to honalulu I would stay here again .

The Park Shore was recommended to us by a friend on Kauai. We are so very glad we listened to his recommendation! The Park Shore was close enough to everything, yet far enough away from the crowds! The rooms were extremely comfortable, and the view of the ocean was simply amazing! The staff at the front desk were very courteous, and helpful, the concierge was too. The concierge also gave us helpful information about the best time/s to get to Pearl Harbour and also some good advice on places to eat close by. We will be staying here next time we visit Honolulu, and we will also be recommending this place to all our friends. Thank you Park Shore, you made our stay in Honolulu one to remember. :)

I am extremely disappointed with my stay in Park Shore Waikiki and I will not come back to this hotel. I would rather pay a bit of premium with big hotel chains like SPG and Marriott because you get better facilities and service from well-trained staff. I found this hotel online (booking.com and hotels.com) but made direct reservations in the hotel website although the price is $10 higher as reviewers commented you get a better chance of upgrade if you check-in directly with the hotel. The only reason I chose this hotel is because of its location (closer to quieter beach and the diamond head) and they claim that rooms are newly renovated. I first booked a one night stay and booked two rooms (one for me and another one for my friend who is a resident of Hawaii and I'm visiting in Honolulu prior to flying to Maui). When I checked in, the guy at the check-in counter Erick was not very friendly and accommodating (which is so unexpected in Hawaii). I asked if the rooms could be right next to each other and he said the other room is at a different price point. Fair enough since I booked that in the hotel website which offers additional discount for Hawaii resident (since my. Friend is a resident of Hawaii); hence, it's at a different price point than the room I booked (an ocean view room).Anyway, they put as close enough on the same floor (18th) so that was fine. We went up to our rooms as soon as we're checked in and none of the keys worked for BOTH rooms. We tried a few times and they did not work. So, here I am very tired from flying from NY and I had to go back down and ask of another set of keys. I went back up and the room keys still did not work for BOTH rooms. I was so tired (and my friend has two little kids) so I decided to just call the front desk on my cellphone because they have no hotel phones on the floor. They said they will send someone up but it took so long that we tried and tried the keys until the door for both rooms finally opened. When I went back down to ask why the room keys were not functioning properly, apparently the batteries of the door locks need replacement. If these staff people were trained properly, they should have already told us that as soon as we were given the keys so I did not have to waste my time going back and forth from the 18th floor.On the facilities, while it is considered newly renovated, it seems not so newly renovated. The bathroom had rust on the drain and the carpet already looks not so clean. I got an amazing view on the ocean view room and that was the only thing I was happy about. The hotel lobby and floors have no air conditioning so it was really hot and I was sweating and feeling disgusting by the time I checked into my room. I have not read this point in prior reviews so would have been helpful to know that this hotel property is using fresh air than air conditioning. Therefore, it is a consideration during really hot weather, which was the case (89 deg) when I checked in. The pool is so basic and nothing attractive about it except the view of the ocean. Useful if you're tired of salt water from the beach.Upon checking out, since my flight is at 5pm, I asked if I can keep one of the rooms for a late check out so me and my friend's kids can still enjoy the beach or swimming pool at the hotel and have a place to shower before I need to leave for the airport. Since I paid for two rooms, I thought they will be courteous enough to let me keep one of the rooms (even the cheaper room). The woman at the front desk (Leny) said late check out to 3pm costs $30. I agreed to it because I needed the room to shower. I have never been charged for late check out at SPG or Marriott hotels!I was already disappointed with this hotel but I know after a few days in Maui, I will be back in this hotel with a friend. Since it's already too late to cancel and find another hotel within my friend's price range, I did not switch to a different hotel but would have liked to. So, today I checked into this hotel again after 3 nights at the Sheraton Maui, which was a fantastic hotel! My friend and I was on an early flight (7:30am) from Maui to Oahu so I know it would be impossible to check in early but I was hoping especially since I got injured in Maui. We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 am and Leny (Uggh..) was at the check in counter. I was trying to be nice so nice and friendly even though I already had a not so nice experience with her before. I asked for an upgrade and she said with a smile that there's no Ocean view rooms as they are fully booked tomorrow (which is a Saturday). She gave me a partial ocean view on the 6th floor. I asked for a higher floor because I read from reviews that it's very noisy up to 7th floor because of delivery trucks and street noise but she said, again with a smile, that there are no other partial ocean view rooms. I asked if I can check in already and they said the room is not yet available as the customer has not checked out and may not be available until after 12 noon as that is their check out time. Meanwhile, I checked their website if I booked today and check in today and check out on Sunday and booked 3 rooms, there would have been 2 rooms with double beds (one standard and partial ocean view) and 3 rooms with Ocean view. So, I'm extremely tired, injured (with an obvious bandage on my right ankle), limping and disappointed so I gave up on asking for anything because I'm not getting anywhere. I left and had breakfast with my friend. We came back at around 11:30 am and the room was still not available according to Leny. I wanted to go to Safeway to buy some groceries and Leny said it's only 15 minutes walk or take a bus at Marriott which is 2 minutes away on foot. She already saw me injured and limping so I just asked for a cab. Thank God I did not listen to her because it was actually a 10 minute cab ride. I came back from Safeway at around 1 pm hoping the room is finally available but she said the customer just checked out. I said "I thought your check out time is 12 noon?" So she changed her story to the housekeeper is still cleaning the room. I sat down at the lobby feeling pissed and a couple walks in to check in. I then overheard Erick say to the couple "today is a good day because your room is ready, two double beds as you've requested" and he offered the warm towels to freshen up. I was fuming deep inside because I wanted a room with two double beds and I checked in with him before after a long flight and he has not offered warm towel to me and I checked in today early with Leny and she's not offered me a warm towel either. So, as soon as the couple left, I went up to Erick and Leny and asked them why the couple got checked in really fast while I'm waiting since 9:30am and why I have not been offered warm towel when I checked. I said do I have to be a certain nationality or ethnicity to get a decent service? And all Erick could muster was the couple was is a standard room and if I wanted some fresh towels. He obviously did not get my point and this boils to untrained staff or not conscientious, which is a stark contrast I got from Sheraton. Their price difference is not extremely more than Park Shore but the level of service is definitely different. I think I would stick to my SPG hotels since I do get the service that I pay for. On a separate note, while I was waiting in the lobby, a woman slipped because there was water on the floor and there was no sign. She was very upset because she hurt her knee. They gave her ice and made her file a written complaint. I heard her asking for some sort of compensation. I would do the same if that happened to me. Again, my point on the service level at this hotel. I'm going to be here for the next two days but I'm done being nice since I don't get anywhere being nice to these people. The only saving grace of this hotel is the amazing view if you get an ocean view room.
user_name:
Liz1023
New York City, New York

review_body: It took three trips to Honolulu for me to realize that this is the ideal place for me to stay at Waikiki Beach. It's not lavish, but the price is reasonable and the location is ideal, right on the ocean and right at the end of the developed beach opposite the also scenic Honolulu Zoo, which I like very much. The rooms are fine even if in the interest of keeping costs down you choose one without an ocean view. Buying breakfast or takeaway lunch is a snap. There is a Starbucks and a great sandwich place right off the hotel lobby. The Starbucks opens very early in the morning when as I luckily discovered, not being a morning person, there is a lot of activity in the area with early risers up for jogging or surfing or some other appropriate challenge for that time of day. If you want a sitdown breakfast go to Lulu's off the second floor of the hotel, but Lulu's is kind of expensive so we did not do this often. Finally, the staff of the hotel were very nice and responsive. What more can you ask if you are on a budget.

I was traveling for work and was looking for a place with a good location, and I found it. This place is right across the street for Waikiki beach, and was able to give me a good price. I will break down the review on a few key points.1: Staff- The staff at the desk and valet were very friendly and professional. They would take the time to great me, and ask about my day in a way that felt much more friendly than professional. Three people that stood out as a highlight were Dylan , Violet and Averi. On top of being friendly all three of them were always willing to take the time for a brief chat, or recommending some great local places to eat or visit. 2: Location- Like I said earlier it is right off the beach, and by the Honolulu Zoo. All kinds of shopping and restaurants are with in walking distance as well as public transportation. This is a great bonus because the traffic here is horrible.3: Room- The room I had was nothing special. It was comfortable but could have fit in almost any decent hotel any where in the world. The biggest downfall was the poor wifi. They had an option to increase the speed, but to be honest it was very over priced. I do a lot of work on my computer, and a bad connection can make even the simplest task feel like a chore. Although there is a big part of me that is telling me "why are you complaining about stuff that keeps you in your room when the beach is right across the road!??!"All in all I really enjoyed my time there. Like most places I have stayed the room will be removed from my mind before my flight takes off, but the impact the staff had on me will be remembered, and I will be coming back.

We traveled here for the March Break 2014! After a long flight, and very late check in, the staff was very helpful. They made us feel at home and were so friendly. We were given a complimentary box of chocolates at the front desk when we checked in also. The room was large, spacious and had an excellent view of Waikiki Beach. This hotel is located at the end of the Waikiki beach and wasn't as loud and busy as the rest of the Kalakaua Ave. hotels. The wifi access was great, the room was clean and the staff went out of their way to give us good advice for restaurants and local attractions. The only drawback was the valet parking. The price was not included in the room but was one of the cheaper valet options compared to the rest of the hotels on the street. There is an excellent sandwich/panini shop right beside the hotel that offered breakfast and lunch options. Ted's Burgers two doors down is a must try also. We would definitely stay here again!

Once in a while I run into hotels in trip advisor that are overrated, this is one of those, in my opinion. First of all, I did not get what I paid for: We booked 2 rooms ocean front king bed. One room was oceanfront, 2 doubles, the other was ocean view (with an entire building of the hotel blocking half of the view) and 2 full beds, when I complained they told me that was ocean front (there is not way to compare both rooms we got, for the same price, ridiculous).For the rest is fine, but nothing great, rooms are old and small and you don't get any extras that come with smaller hotels. Location is fantastic, that is for sure, but that is it, and the price I paid was not cheaper than the big resorts.Reviews talk about the service, everybody was nice, but so was everyone else I talked to in Hawaii. In the middle of our check in, the front desk guy started talking to some other "potential client" that was inquiring about a room, and I have to wait a while to continue my check in (I would even rate that as rude).I would not come back here, and if you decide to, I recommend that you get the cheapest room since it is possible that they will not honor your reservation

This hotel is the southern most hotel on the Waikiki strip and has beach access across the street. The hotel itself is a little old and run down for the price. We were disappointed because we paid ~$300 for a ocean front room and it was a partial ocean view room with 2 full beds rather than a king as pre-paid for. The staff was friendly and and it is close to bike rental, awesome sandwich place (Tucker and Bevvy), and an amazing japanese restaurant in the lobby. I would have loved it if it would have been a good deal but the rooms were much too old and run down when for close to the same price you could stay at several of the nicer hotels farther up.

We stayed at this hotel 8 night for our honeymoon. This hotel was booked by our travel agent. Our vouchers clearly stated honeymoon couple. We were given no congratulations, no upgrade, no note....nothing! The hotel itself is average the rooms are very small! Literally a bed with a bathroom. Our shower curtain absolutely stank of musty, wet material. The most annoying part of our stay was the fact that we paid a $50 deposit on the room upon arrival, which is standard and we authorized. We hired a car and parked it overnight at our hotel for 1 night. We clearly told the valet it would be for 1night only. We were told we would be charged $25 to our room, which we accepted. 3 days later a little over $100 was taken off my credit card. When I questioned this with reception the lady at the front was rude and told me that it was because we parked our car. She answered a phone call mid conversation to "assist another guest" and spoke with them for 5 minutes before returning to me. Which I found extremely rude given I was mid way through trying to sort out my issue. The lady at the front desk admitted that the money should not have been taken off my credit card however was "unable to release the hold until we checked out". This was because it would take 7-10 days to return. She did offer to release the money as soon as we checked out but that was 3 days later and did not help us given that we had budgeted to use that money during our stay. So all in all the hotel held $150 of our money for the time stayed, $100 of which I did not authorize. I mentioned to reception I was concerned that the hotel had access to my credit card and were taking money whenever they felt like it and all she could offer was "I'm sorry" I was no reassured it would not happen again. I was genuinely concerned but could not do anything about it. Not acceptable in my eyes when my credit card security is at risk!!Definitely would not stay here again. So annoyed as we could not participate in one of the tours we had budgeted for as we did not have enough money. We didn't bother to complain about our smelly bathroom given the reception and low level if service regarding our credit card authorization. There are much nicer places than this one around! Shop around!!! Wouldn't recommend this hotel!!!!

We had no complaints. Really good. The staff were helpful and friendly. This hotel is close to the zoo and ABC stores. Lots of really good places to eat. The room was clean and a good size we got upgraded to a partial ocean view because it was our wedding anniversary. We had our own balcony.

Stayed here for 5 nights 4 days. I got a really good deal online.I arrived at midnight to check into my room. I called the hotel earlier on that day to let them know I would be checking in really late. The agent I spoke to was very friendly and made a note of it.I had no problem checking in so late. The front desk clerk was very polite.The room was a little small, which really didn't matter..what was important that it WAS CLEAN :) There's a mini fridge in the room, good WiFi and air conditioning. I was there to just sleep, shower, and get ready. Everyone who worked there was extremely nice and helpful. Really great customer service♡The location is great! Right across from the beach. Lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Would love to stay here again on my next visit.
user_name:
floracupcake
New York City, New York

review_body: You will not regret staying here! Please make sure you pay the little extra to procure at least a partial ocean-view hotel room. We paid just a little extra and stayed in the rooms ending with 07-above the 10th floor. We had an incredible view of the entire Waikiki, oceanfront and facing Diamond-head. The view is breath-taking and if you just arrive from the Honolulu Airport after an exhausting flight you will be happy you are staying at this hotel. There is also Starbucks, ABC Stores and a great Japanese Restaurant on the premises. The service is excellent overall from everyone at this hotel. We will continue staying at this hotel and also continue to recommend this hotel to at least over a dozen friends and family members. TOP OF THE LINE HOTEL!!!

After extensive reviewing of hotels in Honolulu, we stumbled across the Park Shore... What a find!The room was fantastic and the view was incredible. We reserved a junior suite with the most incredible view of Diamond Head and Waikiki. I could have just sat on the balcony for hours. If you're looking for a well priced, wonderful hotel with great rooms and spectacular views, look no further.

This hotel location is very good, not as flashy at the others on Waikiki strip, nice view of Diamond Head and the beach from higher floors. Surf lesson shop in the lobby, Starbucks and Wolfgang Puck Express next door. Lulu restaurant on the 2nd floor is pricey for the barely OK food.

First time in Waikiki. We chose this hotel for the price, and not as many negative reviews as other similar hotels. The hotel is located at the end of the beach across the street from beach on one side, and the zoo on the other. Fairly quiet considering location. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. They have paid parking with valet. A restaurant on the second floor with one of the best people watching areas we found--open air. Very good food. Breakfast is outstanding. Depending on bar tender, the drinks are excellent. We had a partial ocean view--hang over balcony and look down an alley. The view of the hotel in from of our balcony was excellent. To be fair, we did not pay any extra for the room over any non view room. We stayed at other ocean front rooms on Oahu, so no big deal. We REALLY liked the view from the restaurant. Very friendly staff in the hotel and restaurant.

This was the first stop in our stay in Oahu so we decided to stay somewhere a bit cheaper at the start and then splurge a bit more when we returned to Oahu after a visit to other islands in the last few days. It turned out that the Park Shore ended up being the better of the two hotels mainly because it was less busy and has a less crowded beach. We booked an ocean front room which was well worth it as there's nothing like sitting out on your balcony in the afternoons and watching the sunset. We also made good use of Tucker and Bevvy which is located within the Hotel and has a great supply of takeaway or dine in sandwiches, salads and juices. The hotel is a short walk to the main part of Waikiki so is accessible to shopping, restaurants and other attractions. I definitely recommend it.
great location for body boarders. only minutes away. little far from main area.

We stayed in an Ocean Front room and the view was perfect! We could sit on our balcony and look out on the zoo & parkland, as well as the beach & ocean - just sensational. I'm sure there are fancier hotels in Waikiki and I wouldn't want to stay at the Park Shore without a room with a view, but our experience was great. There is a good organic food place off the lobby - Tucker & Bevvy - so you can have a very economical stay by eating their delicious breakfasts and take away salads. The hotel is located just across the road from the beach and they give you the use of hotel towels which is helpful. Others have complained about small rooms and this surprised us as our room was plenty big enough. Similarly, others have mentioned noise from a night club. Maybe we were just lucky but we slept with the balcony doors open so we could hear the ocean and never experienced any noise problems.

This hotel is all about location. It is close to the beach, restaurants and cafes and shops. The service was great. The views were terrific. The only minus from making it above average is it is close to a night club which was noisy one night - even though I was on the tenth floor.

Talk about a sweet score. Hard to get more beach-front than the Park Shore. As others have mentioned, rooms are fairly small (think NYC size) but they are more than enough for your stay. Yes they are also spotless and very welcoming. I was given an upgrade to an ocean view room and enjoyed the sunset every night from the balcony. Keep in mind, this is a narrow property as my wing only had rooms on one side. The other side of the hallway going to the room is open to an alley which happens to be where many trash trucks and delivery vehicles visit at ALL HOURS of night. I did hear it at 1am, 2:30, 4, 5am. Bring ear plugs just to drown out the BEEP BEEP BEEP that you could hear.Even with the truck noise I would still highly recommend this property for your stay.

Arrived at the hotel was greeted by staff very friendly , along the way we have asked questions about restaurants and shopping and they gave been very helpful , the rooms are clean , tidy they have a great Japanese restaurant ground floor , star bucks on the corner and is located across from Waikiki beach , very kid friendly staff and hotel the zoo is just across the road and staying in this hub it's only about a 10 min $10-$15 ride to the big mall They have booklets for food you can order from restaurants .. No room service but there is so much surrounding this hotel it's a great find we will stay here again!!

We are coming to the end of a week stay and are glad we stayed here. I wanted a hotel on the beach with a lanai with ocean views. The view from our room (1007) is spectacular stretching from Diamond Head to a great expanse of Waikiki Beach. As the hotel overlooks the zoo the view is uninterrupted and you are not overlooked in the 07 rooms by any other room. Complete privacy. The lanais fit 2 chairs and a side table easily and are very large for a lanai. I was worried about the size of the rooms given other comments but we have 2 double beds and there is plenty of space. The 07 rooms also have a second window which overlooks the ocean to watch the sun go down. Lu Lu's the bar downstairs was noisy at night but shutting the doors cut out most of the noise. The airconditioning is very good and stays cold all night. The shower head and water pressure is superb. All round highly recommended.

There are more luxurious (and expensive) hotels elsewhere in Waikiki, but my wife and I agreed that the Park Shore offered the best location for us; a clean, not-overlarge, but quite satisfactory room (1121, I believe) with an eye-pleasing view of the beach and ocean; relative affordability; and very helpful staff. We found it quieter and less frenetic to be at very end of the Waikiki hotel strip, across the street from the zoo and a park, a walkable distance to Diamond Head. Nice that the beach area across the street from the hotel was sheltered by a breakwater. LuLu’s, the hotel’s second-floor open-air dining restaurant, seemed to have a varied and reasonable menu, and the sandwich shop adjoining the hotel entrance offered a quicker alternative. On Thursdays, for a more casual meal you might try the farmer’s market held in the courtyard of the Hyatt Regency up the strip. Overall we had a very pleasant experience at the Park Shore, and would not hesitate to recommend it. Though we lost a full day on Oahu thanks to United Airlines, the hotel understandingly modified our reservation from 3 nights to 2. We were still able to visit the Arizona and Missouri (with E Noa Tours – mahalo, Carlos!), and we did hike Diamond Head (took a cab to the entrance lot, but walked back to hotel), each of which should not be missed.

We stayed in July and I booked three nights in partial sea view room to hold down cost and then move to a full seaview for last two nights. Staff upgraded us on arrival to a seaview room on 11th floor so that was nice. We assumed we would stay there but after three nights they upgraded us again to a king sized seaview room on 17th floor. Staff were helpful to all that we saw in the lobby and there's a good price shuttle to the airport. The Zoo is opposite and is the amazing Diamond Head view and lovely beachfront. Not as noisy as central Waikiki but easy to walk to main area. An ABC shop adjoins the lobby and a woman assists with tours within the lobby. A great experience so thanks. If you like tea, ensure they give some teabags!!!!!!

We stayed 3 nights in June. We arrived a few hours before the check-in time and I was nervous that we'd be sitting in the lobby for hours with our luggage. But we walked right up and they told us our room was ready. I was very pleased. Facing Diamond Head and the beach, the view was breath-taking. We looked right over the zoo and could actually see the flamingos around the lagoon and hear the monkeys(?). The room was not large but was exactly what I expected in a city where space is at a premium. It had everything we needed including a large lanai where we spent most of our time when in the room. The room and, more importantly, the bathroom felt clean and the bed was very comfortable. The only issue we had was on Monday night when the noise from Lulu’s club next door went into the wee hours in the morning. We like to sleep with fresh air but that night we had to shut the door and go with a/c. Even with the glass door shut, it was loud. Luckily it was only that 1 night. The other nights were perfectly peaceful.We rented a Volvo directly from the hotel for one day on a last minute decision. For a last minute car rental decision, the price was fair. They have only a few available so be sure to inquire as soon as you can. The car was really nice. Getting to and from the freeway from the hotel was also extremely convenient. On parking, there’s metered parking on Kalakaua Ave as you head to Diamond Head. After 6pm, parking is free until sometime in the morning. It might be tough finding a spot during the day but if you wanted to park your car overnight, there were plenty of people leaving as it got later in the afternoon. We parked for a few hours about a 5 minute walk from the hotel and from our room, we could see the car. The bonus was we found a meter that still had time left in it and didn’t have to pay! It might be worth checking out the parking situation on that street.Overall, the location being across from the beach was such a plus! And the people working at the reception desk were very friendly. Although when I asked about the best way to get to the airport, the girl was strangely unhelpful. She just said the best way depends on the person and how long they want to take to get there. Uh…thanks, but I kinda figured that out myself. One tip: Right around the corner from the hotel, The Cookie Corner shares a space with Subway (between the Aston Waikiki hotel and the Starbucks). I would highly recommend the cookies. They were so delicious! We went there every day. And just before I climbed into the cab to take off for the airport, I ran over there and bought a dozen to take home.

In all fairness I must say up front that we only stayed overnight to catch our plane out the next day, however, from what we experienced at this hotel, it was very nice. We found the rooms comfortable and ample in size, although not near as nice as some of our other stays on the other islands. The beds were a little harder than I am used to, but not uncomfortable. We did not eat in the restaurant because it was way too loud for us. We like to party as much as the next person, but when I eat dinner, I like to be able to talk with our friends without screaming. However, a younger crowd was having a great time. They were helpful storing our luggage until we left, although one of the people at the desk were a little surly, overall the staff was helpful. I would stay here again, and I can recommend it. Based on other reviews, perhaps a longer stay and more use of the amenities would make for a fairer review.

OK, listen, I never write reviews, but this hotel needs to be given high praise, so here you go. I spent two weeks in room 1407 from July 2nd - July 16th. Oceanfront and Diamondhead views off of the lanai are spectacular! Sunsets, no words.The room was very clean. TV was great. New phone with radio. Beds are very comfy. Bathrooms are a little small. But huge rain shower shower head made it no big deal. From checkin to checkout the staff was top notch. Housekeeping did a nice job every day. The location is a 3 mile run to Diamondhead, which I did every morning. Very scenic. Rented a car, and they did not have the basic model available, so they gave me a Volvo convertible for the same price for a week! Lots of good food nearby, including Tommy's burgers, which is the bomb! Get the Garlic fries with your orders for sure. Wolfgang Puck Express is right there as well, and is delicious. And there was a Jamba Juice being built right there as well. Starbucks is right next door too. And you are just a very short walk to Dukes, and Rumfire, which are two of my favorite spots on the strip. I stayed at The Park Shore for two weeks oceanfront for what it would have cost me to stay one week anywhere else. And I MUST be oceanfront! This is the only review you need to read. If you get room 1407 or higher in the same spot, you will not beat the views anywhere for the money PERIOD. The Park Shore is my resident hotel in Waikiki from now on. Mahalo! - David

Had previously stayed at this property before it was taken over by the Aqua Resort chain and renovated. The location opposite Waikiki beach is the absolute best and the renovated rooms are light and airy although not very large. However, the location and price does make up for the size and the front desk personnel were very nice and accommodating when we asked for late check-out. We were also there for the weekly Manager's "Meet & Greet" with free refreshments one evening which was a pleasant surprise. Pool are could be spruced up a bit and the elevators do appear to be in need of a bit of an upgrade - but they worked and never had long to wait for them. Starbucks just around the corner is nice to frequent even though there is free coffee supplied in the room. Unfortunately, our small fridge froze the milk we bought for our in-room coffee and there did not appear to be any way to change the setting on the mini-fridge. All in all though a good location - wonderful "coffee table" book on the Hawaiian Islands - would love to buy one to take home. Cost not bad for location.

Best location in Waikiki. It has been updated since we were there, but we Loved it even with the old furnishings and carpet--because it is the last skyscraper on the King's Beach. It has the Best View: the best beach in Waikiki is right across the street, the Honolulu Zoo is across the other, with an awesome view of The Pacific Ocean, Diamond Head, and the local Mountains. Make sure you get the Diamond head side, and not the dumpster side (we got that first, and I cried in the shower the first night). Lulu's surfer Bar & grill is downstairs, Starbuck's, an ABC store; and restaurants and shops galore within a few short blocks away. The International Market is ten minutes walk away. The Aquarium is a 7 min drive away. And it is not to far to drive to Hanama bay for awesome snorkeling ( or just cross the street with Snorkle Bob gear (about ten blocks to rent by the week; including prescription mask which I could see through better than my own glasses---and experience some of the best snorkeling in the world. Eat at Lulu's (with 1/2 off coupon); Shorebird for buffet breakfast (look for coupons); the best Buffet dinner EVER is right next door at the Marriott . I was there in 2008 with a second honeymoon, and it was one of the greatest highlights of our lives!!Very helpful Concierge when we were there and I had a problem with my room.

My wife and I stayed here as a celebration of our 40th Wedding Anniversary and we couldn't have chosen a better hotel. Everything was just right for us, especially the view of the Pacific and Diamond Head. Lulu's for breakfast was spot on and every member of staff was courteous and friendly. Just the right location for access to the beach and a nice walk into the heart of Waikiki. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - if you are looking and can't make your mind up....stay here!

We started our vacation at the Park Shore before moving to the Hilton. I was pleasantly surprised since I knew nothing about the hotel. The staff was very nice and helped us out with anything we needed. The location was great right next to the Zoo with views of Diamond Head and the beach right across the street.

We found rooms to be on small side because we had been travelling for several weeks so it was the three of us along with 5 large bags. We were moved to handicapped room which was bigger for us and all of our stuff. Beautiful view, right above pool. Beach right across the street. Lovely for families. Towels and beach chairs available at front desk. Lulu's on 2nd floor... Great breakfast. Starbucks, ABC store for snacks, necessities, and souvenirs. Great burgers behind hotel at Teddy's. The best food all made to order. Long lines, but worth it and they work hard to serve people quickly.Hotel in quieter area.. Locals do hang around, but police try to keep things peaceful. For great tours...see the travel coordinator in lobby. Enjoy your stay... If not happy with size of room see if they can help you find something that best suits your needs.

This hotel is outstanding, spacious rooms, comfortable beds and a staff that is second to none. You walk out of the hotel, cross the street and you are on the beach. Obviously on Waikiki you are near numerous restaurants and bars, and anything else you might be looking for. The Honolulu Zoo is also across the street. I hope I can stay at this hotel again soon.

Coming from the hectic life of Las Vegas, this hotel's location was a perfect getaway for our family, my son was right in picking Park shore, yes there is some road noise but then this is the kinda last hotel on the northern side of the strip, so on your balcony not only the ocean view wen joyed but the perfect view for Diamond head and State Park which is next to the Honolulu zoo. It's a great walking distance to restaurants and shopping area. Downstairs in the lobby, I enrolled my 17 yr old son to their 2 hours Surfing lesson for a good reasonable price & he had the best time of his life according to him. I know he did, coz I've watch him the whole time he was surfing with the rest of the group. We upgraded to 12 th floor from the 5th floor, the sound of the ocean waves were music to my ears and the singing birds are my alarm clock in the morning. Starbucks is right outside 12 steps from the hotel lobby, the Lulu's restaurant above the Starbucks has reasonable price menu.We've asked for towels and chair for the beach each time, sometimes we go 2-3 times a go and return it afterwards. We decided to rent car on our 3rd day after we explore the strip by walking around, yes the valet fee is $25.00/day but we go in and out of the hotel 2-3x a day, parking then is not a problem when we had someone parking our car for us, beside we got a good deal of $26.00/ day @ Alamo car rental. Overall, we are definitely coming back to Park shore hotel in our next Trip to Hawaii.

We'd expected two queen beds. The manager explained that a standard room is a room without a beach view and with two double beds or a king. While some staff smiled through clenched teeth, some were great, like Violet, who was extremely helpful BIG PROBLEM with the shuttle service that the Park Shore Waikiki referred guests to in the welcome email. Speedi shuttle is more expensive than a taxi if there are more than two riders. Our ride to the hotel included an expert and knowledgeable trainer who knew her way around Waikiki and attempted to guide the driver on his first run. We are unsure why Speedi shuttle does not assign new drivers to shadow competent drivers and learn where the hotels are prior to driving. The trip to the hotel was a nightmare. Furthermore, having let ourselves be talked into a round trip payment at a slight reduction, before even boarding the shuttle, we were dismayed that their credit card machine did not function and we had to use cash. This left no way to get out of the return trip. People walk in and out of the open and breezy lobby, tracking sand and water, and spilling their Starbucks or Tucker and Bevvy purchases on the carpets. It is to the hotel staff's credit that they keep the carpets as clean and dry as they do. The Park Shore location is ten steps from Starbucks, Tucker and Bevvy, two ABC stores, the beach, Lulu's, and a block from Tiki at the Westin.Public buses and shuttles are no more than a block. The gentle beach across the street from the hotel is excellent for small children.We would definitely stay here again (and arrive by taxi or public bus, NOT Speedi shuttle).

My wife and I spent one night here before flying out in the morning to Maui, we pulled in got out rental valet parked as $25 is well worth the headache avoidance of a parking ticket let alone the car getting vandalized &/or getting broken into. We were greeted with friendly smiles and alohas! Check in was very fast and easy, we were also upgraded to a partial ocean view room on the 18th, the room was decent, clean, a/c working just fine, clean beds, lines and bathroom as the wife is very particular to all of this. Although the room was a "partial" ocean view the balcony near the elevators and ice machine had an amazing view looking over the ocean, Honolulu zoo and Diamond Head. We walked outside to explore and all the expected stores and shops just within walking distance. Overall great experience and would see myself staying here again.

Just completed a 7-night stay with my wife and 4 kids (ages 12-17). This isn't Trump Tower or the Hilton, but it doesn't pretend to be. It's perfectly located at the "quiet" end of Waikiki and as others have noted, is directly across from the Honolulu Zoo and beach. The hotel is clean and the amenities are above average. Customer service is where this hotel shines! They know you by name, always greet you with a smile and bend over backwards to make your stay enjoyable. I had an issue with one of my rooms on check-in which, even though the hotel was fully booked, was handled with a smile and to my satisfaction. Needed a roll away bed (no charge BTW) and more towels.....in 10 minutes someone was at the door. This hotel appreciates your business and the staff is uniformly friendly and efficient. Perfect place for those with kids.....has concierge in lobby to book activities (most hotels do) and there are many dining options literally steps from the hotel door. Starbucks, Tucker & Bevy (for fresh smoothies and good sandwich options), LuLu's restaurant (kids loved their breakfasts), Wolfgang Puck Express, Subway, Teddy's Big Burger to name a few. There is also a Sushi place in the hotel lobby.Valet parking is the only option but I never had to wait long for my car. Charge is $25/day, which is reasonable in any city.I would definitely stay at the Park Shore again if/when we return to Oahu.

My husband and I spent 17 nights @ Park Shore Waikiki and we just loved it. The staff was friendly, helpful, authentic and absolutely sincere. We got an upgrade on the 2nd day (Mahalo again for this :)) and had a very nice partial (amazing) sea-view room with a lanai on the 11th floor. It was always clean and we slept very well in the king-size bed. We couldn't be happier with our choice and we were extremely sad leaving this place. The location is perfect for Honolulu, it is very close to nice restaurants like Duke's (Mahalo for the tip for the Hula Pie and the Tropical Itch ;)), Cheesecake Factory or Roy's. The shopping possibilities are also very close. We even rented a car at the hotel and used it for a whole week so we could explore the whole island. We would always choose this hotel again and we recommend it to everyone visiting O'ahu. Aloha

Enjoyed my stay at park shore.the good: great location, nice views of diamond head and beach from lanai. We liked having coffee each morning on the balcony. Coffee machine in room, but better coffee downstairs in the lobby provided each morning for free. Also in the afternoon, free juice. Refreshing on a hot day.Next door at tiki's great fish and chips.Valet parking was $25/day, but was very efficient. No resort fee.Comfy bed.Room rate was reasonable compared to other hotels.they provide beach towels and chairs to use at no charge.the so-so: We were on 16th floor, but still a lot of noise from traffic and buses, even with the balcony door closed.Room is a little on the small size, but works fine for me. We didn't spend a lot of time hanging out in the room.

The location is perfect, and Diamond Head view is awesome! Staffs at front desk have very kind hospitality. A staff at reception gave a toy to my daughter. It is easy access to Alamoana center by trolley or the bus.日本語が話せるスタッフはみあたりませんでしたが、日本人の宿泊者もあまり見かけなかったです。ABCマートが建物内にあり非常に便利。ホノルル動物園、防波堤付きのビーチは目の前なので子供連れの家族には移動が凄く楽で良かったです。次回はオーシャンビューの部屋を確保して泊まりたいホテル。空港からタクシーでチップ込みで50ドル程度でした。

I stayed here for four nights in late May prior to an inter-island cruise. I had done a LOT of research on Waikiki hotels and my priority was finding a clean, well-run hotel with an ocean-view balcony at a decent price. Waikiki is not cheap, and ocean-front properties (and views) come with a premium. But I really wanted to have a balcony where I could chill in the afternoon and look out at the ocean. Park Shore offered this at a reasonable price. Best of all, they charge NO RESORT FEES and have FREE wi-fi. That's a big savings compared to a lot of the big chain hotels. It's not a luxury property -- most room access is from outdoor corridors, and there is no room service or plush robes. But that's not what I was looking for. After reading many reviews and seeing photos of the renovated rooms, I decided to book at the Park Shore Waikiki. While this hotel is at the end of the "strip," it's plenty close to dining and shopping, and the beach walk is wonderful! I booked an oceanfront balcony -- my room was on the 12th floor and had an incredible view -- the ocean before me, and views of the Honolulu Zoo to my left. From the walkway outside my room, I could see Diamond head. My room/bathroom was clean and recently renovated. I was traveling alone, so I had plenty of room for storing my things. There was even a small refrigerator. I loved sitting on my balcony, and was often visited by some small birds -- I'd advise against leaving your balcony door open just in case one decides to fly inside. I liked having a Starbucks downstairs, and I enjoyed several meals (breakfast and dinner) at Lulu's on the second level. I loved the open-air environment, and the beach views were great. The food was tasty and very reasonably priced. There were also a couple of ABC convenience stores in/adjacent to the hotel. I had read quite a few reviews mentioning the presence of homeless people, and I spotted a few camping out across the street at the park, but they were no problem whatsoever. I did see law enforcement quite a few times cruising the area, and felt very safe, even traveling alone.I'd also read about traffic noise. It was there, for sure, since the hotel is just across the street from the beach. I'd hear a tour bus come by quite regularly with a recorded message. But I just tuned it out. It really didn't bother me or keep me awake at night. If noise is an issue, bring some ear plugs!I attended the manager's poolside reception on Wednesday and got to meet the manager and other staff. It was very informal and not a "must," but something nice that they offer. I didn't actually swim in the pool but it was nice having it there. I think I might have used it if it was open at night.There is so much to see in Oahu! Pre-cruise, I did not rent a car. I booked several excursions that picked up near the hotel (Circle Island tour, Pearl Harbor tour, Sunrise Photography tour, and Germaine's Luau) and walked the rest of the time. So I didn't have to pay to rent or park a car.I hope to return to the Hawaiian islands some day and spend more time at some of my favorite spots. If I return to Oahu, I will book the Park Shore without a second thought, and strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, modern property facing Waikiki Beach at a very reasonable price.

The hotel is brilliantly located opposite the beach on the very northern end of the main strip. Opposite the Zoo.It was very clean and efficient and this area is quieter than further south where there are more restaurants, night life and some red light happening. The hotel has no bars (private bar on the beach at the front) , no room service and the pool area is basic.We originally had a room facing the hotel next door, which had a tiny balcony (one small person ) and no real outlook. Got upgraded to a room on the side at the front which had a 2 person balcony and nice beach outlook. I imagine the views of beach and diamond head would be spectacular from the font and north rooms. Service was fine when you asked for something but not pro-active. For instance we didn't realize there was a Macy's 10% discount on the back of our room card until too late.

We chose this hotel because it is at the end of the beach and overlooks the zoo and so we hoped for relative quiet. The hotel were helpful and put us in a room at the end of a corridor which had the added bonus of a side window which gave a view over toward Pearl Harbour which meant we saw the 4th July fireworks from our room. Unfortunately it also overlooked the cafe attached to the next hotel which on our last night held a party with drums that went on until 2am! Not the fault of the Park Shore but it blighted our stay which was otherwise good especially considering the large number of guests for the holiday.

I searched high and low for the biggest beds on the beach for the least cost. This gave our party of 3 girls the opportunity to not get too cozy. Tile flooring and right across the street from the beach and zoo. I was quite impressed with how none of the hotel smelt like mildew. All beach hotels seem to get that smell every once in awhile, but Hawaii was the exception.

We recently had 11 nights at the Park Shore. The location is ideal! Walk across the street to the beach, up the road for restaurants and shops, and across the side street to the zoo. We loved waking up to the sounds of the monkeys each morning! We had a ocean view room with a balcony and the view of Waikiki Beach and also up to Diamond Head crater was awesome! Didn't want to leave the balcony! The rate was really good too and our room a perfect size. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Perfect place if you are trying to stay in Waikiki on a budget. It's a little dated, but clean, quiet, comfortable and the rooms are moderately spacious. The staff here are 5 star folk - very kind, helpful and polite. It's also a great choice if you are intending on being out of the hotel most of the day. The beach and Honolulu Zoo are right across the street. If you have a car, the valet allows free in/out privileges and will leave your car by the door if you are just running in and out. The hotel will also allow you to store your luggage at the hotel before or after your check-in/out time if you need them to. Free Wi-Fi in the lobby. A sushi bar is also in the lobby. There are 2 ABC stores nearby - 1 accessible from the lobby and the other near the hotel's valet. You're just 6-7 blocks from the Waikiki Strip (lest than a 10 minute walk). The hotel is a KOA member and part of the Aqua brand of hotels.

The Park Shore Waikiki is situated at the end of a long strip of hotels along the Waikiki Beach which is wonderful because it is quiet and still a great location. You literally walk across the street and are at the beach. The hotel provides you with beach towels which is a great service since once you are done for the day, you trade them in for clean ones. They also have beverages in the lobby; coffee & water in the morning and guava juice & ice water in the afternoon which is wonderful after coming back from enjoying a day at the beach. The staff was super-friendly & accommodating and you can plan & schedule tours with a representative from Expedia in the lobby. We had breakfast twice and coconut shrimp for lunch once at Lulu´s which is located on the second floor which was really good and we had dinner once at the Japanese restaurant located in the lobby & enjoyed some really good traditional Japanese cuisine. There is also a sandwich shop adjacent to the lobby of the hotel and a Starbucks a few feet away. The only reason why I gave the Park Shore 4 out of 5 stars is because of the layout of the room. I felt it was a little tight and there was no table to sit at to enjoy a snack, etc., and I would highly recommend they add a clothes line with a retractable cord in the showers to hang wet swimsuits, but for the price (we purchased a flight+hotel package) it was a great value and the location was perfect. The rooms were very clean and I was impressed at how clean the lobby and elevators were kept since the beach is right there and I would have thought there would be sand everywhere. I would definitely go back to and highly recommend the Park Shore Waikiki.

Stayed at this Hotel for a family holiday with teenage kids late June 2014. Nice rooms, nice location, close to beach and shops, helpful straff. Nice pool area. Could not ask for more. We were were happy and would recommend this hotel to anybody.

We had a quick 2 night stopover here on our way to New Zealand to visit our son. We loved this hotel! We arrived early but were able to check in and were even upgraded to a Diamond Head Suite, which gave us a fantastic balcony view of both Diamond Head and the beach. This room had a living area with sofa and large flat screen TV, kitchenette area with small fridge, microwave, and sink. It appears that everything has been recently renovated. We spent many hours just sitting on the balcony and enjoying the sights. We could even see the flamingos floating on a pond in the zoo, and hear the monkeys and the elephants! One small negative of the Diamond Head suites is that they also overlook the large air conditioning units on the roof. This doesn't affect the view, but they are noisy. We ate breakfast one day at the restaurant, LuLus, with seats overlooking the beach. I really enjoyed the pineapple cream stuffed French toast with Macadamia nuts! We also frequented the Starbucks that was right next to the hotel, as well as the ABC store for quick souvenirs. The hotel had valet parking for our rental car, which cost $25 a day/plus tip. I've seen other reviews refer to this location as the 'quiet end' of Waikiki. I don't think I would call this area quiet by any means,although the traffic did slow down later in the evenings.

We were fortunate enough to choose to stay at this hotel which is at the other end of the beach from many of the others to choose from. It was the best choice we made as we not only had the views, the beach and access to the attractions at Waikiki we had some wonderful staff to help us, including the cleaning staff, and these factors made this the trip of a lifetime.

This hotel is located right on Waikiki beach, at the Diamond Head end, next to Honolulu Zoo. The result of the location is that the feeling is more peaceful than the centre of the hotel strip, and there are uninterrupted views of Diamond Head as well as the beach. We stayed in the "one bedroom ocean view suite" which several staff told us was the best room in the hotel - it was certainly the most expensive, but still very competitively priced when compared with the more famous hotel options on Waikiki beach. The view is not 180 degrees, as it is blocked on one side by the other wing of the hotel - but it is still an absolutely stunning view and made us happy spending plenty of time in the room. The "one bedroom Diamond Head Suite" would also be a good choice - less ocean but a great view of Diamond Head. The suite has a properly separate living area - doors can be closed between bedroom and living area, meaning we could stay up after our three year old went to bed. You can sit on a comfortable couch and gaze at the sea. This is worth the cost for this room. The two generously sized lanais both have great views. The quality of the interior furnishings and fittings is very high - the room has been recently renovated and is maintained to a high standard and scrupulously clean. In terms of furnishings the only thing missing is for one of the lanais or the living area to have a table that one could sit upright and eat at, rather than eating our cereal on our laps!Despite being described online as an apartment with a kitchenette, this is a hotel suite not a condo. In particular, the kitchenette consists only of a microwave, toaster and smoothie maker - no real cooking facilities or equipment - which would not answer the description of a kitchenette in Australia. However, when we complained about this to the hotel staff and pointed out the online description, every possible step was taken to address the issue, including lending us the portable hotplates used to cook staff meals! Also, we were told the online description would be changed, and hence I have not let this point affect the high rating that this hotel otherwise deserves. The free wifi worked well, except for the fact that it was too slow for camera/ipad connectivity, and there was no way to fix this. The hotel staff were very helpful and followed up well on any issues. There is no room service but the kitchenette was sufficient to allow self catered breakfasts, and the (rather Aussie named) "Tucker and Bevvy" shop downstairs sells great quality, though not cheap, take away sandwiches, smoothies and snacks.The hotel pool is not fancy but was nevertheless a hit with our three year old and has a nice outlook over Waikiki. In general the hotel is of an older style, but well kept up and with rooms renovated, so that the general feeling is laid back and pleasant. The beach directly opposite the hotel is enclosed by a sea wall, making it good for toddlers but to have a real swim in the waves you need to walk back towards the centre of Waikiki, but this did not bother us as it's a very short distance and a pleasant walk. If you want to catch the "pink line" trolley to Ala Moana shopping centre, the length of the journey will be shorter if you take it from near the hotel rather than walking into the centre of Waikiki. The smell of cooking meat from the ventilation systems of nearby restaurants was an occasional annoyance, however it was something we noticed frequently elsewhere in Waikiki as well.

This hotel is right on Waikiki Beach, which was very convenient. The rooms are small, but clean and quiet. When we arrived we were informed that they only had a room with double beds even though we had booked 6 months in advance for a king (our anniversary). They informed us that the beds were conditional on availability upon arrival (first come first serve). We asked if an upgrade was possible and they said for a fee and said they could be fired if they helped us ("I could lose my job"). We asked for a manager and they were able to "make it work" for no extra cost. This was greatly appreciated, but the soured the first impression of the hotel. Our hotel room was facing Diamond Head and the beach. It was a gorgeous view. I did not like that valet parking was the only option and mandatory, but it is understandable given the location. They allowed us to have a courtesy room after we checked out since we had to wait for our flight. This was we were able to clean up and relax before hitting the road to the airport. Very helpful.

My husband, myself, 23 yr old son & 18 yr old daughter stayed here June 15-20 & we loved the location on the quiet end of Waikiki. Parking was no problem, easy to walk just about anywhere & the staff were truly helpful. Will highly recommend this hotel to our friends & family.

Great location for everything in Waikkiki. Just a walk over road to beach. Free safe and wifi. Shop attached sells everything, great to buy snacks drinks and alcohol to eat and drink on your balcony. Had to upgrade to get balcony with table and chairs plus ocean view $55 per night. Bedroom ok Big tv on wall, King sized bed, great shower. Would recommend

We needed a room for just about 8 hours before we checked into the Hilton Hawaiian Village for 6 nights. We arrived at midnight and the staff was alert and friendly. Our room was the least expensive of their offerings. It had a bed, a view of another hotel and its balconies; no chair, sofa or desk; a mini fridge, and a clean bathroom WITHOUT a shower curtain! The next morning the front desk could hardly believe we didn't have a shower curtain. But they did tell us our rate had decreased by $17 since I had made the reservation. Our daughter and her family arrived at the same hotel in the early afternoon for a 2 night stay. I booked an ocean-view high floor mini suite for them. The front desk was kind enough to upgrade them to a full ocean view suite on a high floor (maybe because we didn't have a shower curtain). WOW, what a difference many more dollars make. The view was spectacular - Diamond Head and the beach from two balconies with table and chairs. The furniture, rugs, lamps, etc. were very nice. The grand kids thought the fancy TOTO toilet was awesome. There was a mini kitchen complete with dishes and a toaster. You could also see the flamingos at the zoo from the balcony to the room's entrance. If you want an amazing room here, get the FOV suite!!!

Hawaii is such a wonderful place overall. Initially we thought finding a hotel right near the beach would be expensive but Park shore hotel was surprisingly well located and within our budget. Nothing beats going down the hotel and crossing the road for an early morning swim as if the pacific was the backyard pool. The hotel was also close or the zoo and a couple of restaurants. It was a little far from the shopping areas, though, so buying a lot of stuff would mean a pretty long walk. We booked one of the rooms facing Diamond Head which was a tad small, but ok. I spent most of my hours in the beach anyway. The staff were excellent and very accommodating. More importantly, they offered free wifi. (This is Hawaii, after all who doesn't want to share pictures of the place?)Will definitely stay here again.

We were in Waikiki last year and traveled there via a flight/hotel package which was how were were introduced to the Park Shore Hotel. It is situated at the base of the very busy Waikiki strip, across from the Zoo. We got a lovely balconied room facing away from the strip, with a stunning view of The Diamond Head mountain, greenery, and the ocean. Thus, at the Park Shore, we could easily access the strip, the beach, and yet in our room, felt pleasantly removed from the craziness just north of us. We just visited Hawa'ii again, this time for a cruise and didn't think twice about returning to the Park Shore to 'bookend' our trip! They gave us a nice little discount as returning guests, and bent over backwards, to accommodate us. We returned from our cruise early in the day long before the check in time, and they didn't hesitate to let us in early. Again, to another room with a stunning view!! Furthermore, they have a hospitality suite that is available to guests with later flights, so we were able to leave our luggage in their holding area, go to the beach, then have a room to go to and get cleaned up before heading out to the airport. Nice perk! I want to give a big shout out to Leny and Annie, at the front desk who were wonderful, friendly and oh so helpful. They helped make our trip one we will never forget! Mahalo! :)

We had our honeymoon in Waikiki 30 years ago and this was our first trip back. Thanks to good reviews on Trip Advisor we booked an Ocean front room at Park Shore Waikiki for 2 days pre and 3 days post cruise on Pride of America. Great choice! We emailed the hotel prior to booking about our 30th Anniversary. Great idea! We were given room 1707 and 1607 on return. Huge room on the corner of the building with beautiful views of Diamond Head and whole length of Waikiki beach. Amazing sunsets! Fantastic! The zoo is across the road too. Nothing was a problem. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had breakfast once and dinner once in Lulu's Bar and restaurant. A very popular place. We did have a car for the first two days and unfortunately found out why Honolulu is rated one of the worst American cities for traffic jams. The Valet service at the hotel was excellent. We'll definitely suggest this Hotel to our friends. Make sure you book any ...07 room.

After a 10 hr flight from Australia we arrived to be greeted by Jarrah(hope I spelt that right) at the front desk, how lucky were we. Our rooms weren't ready which I didn't expect since it was only 9am and check in time is usually after lunch. Being a family of 6 we had booked 2 rooms asking for inter-connecting only to find out they don't have internal connecting rooms except for the suites. Jarrah said to leave it with her. In the mean time we headed up to the hospitality room the hotel offers and got changed ready to head out for a swim. Once we go back downstairs Jarrah asks us if by opening a door on the verandah would this be suitable for us, we were more than happy with this solution. To our surprise the rooms were ready for then and there. She also asked if we would like to have a look to make sure it was 100% ok for us. Once we got to the rooms they were fantastic. Were they the biggest rooms I've ever stayed in?? No, but they were very clean and offered us everything we needed and in one of the rooms my 4 children 16,14,10 & 6 yrs, the older 2 being teenage girls, had more than enough room for the 4 of them. Although only being on level 4 the view was amazing and we were nice and close to the pool as well. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends to stay in and was worth every penny being across the road from the beach. The beach across the road is a fantastic beach for anyone with little children or have no need for some waves. We did tend to head a little further back down into Waikiki to swim due to having renting a surfboard from the lobby for a week. We also rented a car through the hotel. I did ask someone who was working the night shift about car hire and she said they didn't hire out cars. I was pretty sure I had read something about that on tripadvisor so the next morning when we saw Jarrah we asked her. 2 days later we were driving out in our 7 seater Volvo for the day. Any questions from then on, like what was the best way for us to get to diamond head, were to stop on our travels around the island we just waited until we saw Jarrah at the reception. This hotel being up the other end is a little further up then I would like if I went back to Waikiki but it was worth the extra block or 2 of walking to get out of the heart of Waikiki to get away from the craziness of Waikiki and and the high end shops. It had more of the feel that Hawaii had years ago before it got more about highend shopping centre's. Yes there are a lot of homeless people out the front but they are everywhere in Waikiki. I hope this has helped and yes I would stay here again, 100% YES!! Thank you Jarrah and Park Shore for a helping make our holiday wonderful. The Hadfield's xxx

We were unsure of choice of hotel for our trip, our agent recommended this one. On arrival (very late at night) the staff at the desk were helpful and patient. The first room - awful, roof view and tiny. Quick trip to reception, within 5 minutes a new room was allocated, better view and better size. Only 5 days later did we understand that we had been upgraded, at no charge.. brilliant.Room service - we gave them the option of cleaning every morning at 09.00; taken and prompt and a fabulous job done, every day. Excellent.Problems? Queries? Advice? just ask. The Expedia desk girl was also very, very good - queried without suggesting a no don't do it, gave exceptional advice.Lulu's bar (not part of the hotel we found out, but you can room charge) very good service, wide range of beers and cocktails, and clearly a haunt enjoyed by locals and tourists alike - reasonable prices for excellent food.All up, very impressed by this place and we will be going back..
user_name:
Greebles
Hawke's Bay Region, New Zealand

review_body: spent our 2 last nigth on oahu in this hotel Friendly staff that go the extra mile to make you feel comfortable! you can barrow beachtowels. Some rooms are smaller but clean and efficient. We were able to get an upgrade. thank you so much! We hade a late flight home and where able to borrow a room to take a shower before our flight. a real value for money.

Spent one night here before heading to the North Shore. Wish we had stayed longer. Great view of Diamond head. Across the street from beach. Just moments from trendy shopping on Waikiki. Staff was very helpful. Valet parking was worth price. Never waited more than 3 minutes for car. Great staff.

Park Shore Waikiki was a great choice for us. We were cheerfully welcomed and found the staff to be friendly, helpful and efficient. Our room had two queen beds with a refrigerator, coffee pot and a safe but, unfortunately, no microwave. Important for me when I travel are the pillows. They were wonderful so I didn't toss around. The ocean is right across the street and visible from our room as was the pool, zoo and Diamond Head. We did not use the pool but watched the crew clean it thoroughly every morning.There are restaurants within walking distance for every taste including Subway and McDonald's. We almost didn't get a full ocean view room but it was worth the extra expense. We took bus tours around Waikiki and Honolulu and actually felt sorry for the vacationers staying at the ritzy places. Who needs a designer label? We didn't!

We have visited Park Shore twice. If you choose a cheaper room you will have a direct view of the hotel next door, whereas if you pay for a view, you not only get a front row seat across from Waikiki Beach, you may also look out over the zoo with Diamond Head in the background. The rooms are fresh and clean, though they are tiny. The staff is friendly enough, and we liked the open air lobby. We liked the location at the end of the strip. You are literally across the street from the beech.

Situated on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, the hotel sits across from the zoo, the beach, and an attractive stretch of park and private housing. One almost felt secluded from the bustle of Waikiki. The room was adequate for the price, clean, and quiet. Excellent view of beach and park. The restaurant/bar offered lots of food and drink options. Very friendly and attentive staff.

I stayed four night at the Park Shore Waikiki Beach. It is perfectly located in front of the beach and close to everything you need. The room was small but spotless with a very comfortable bed. Their pool is not that big but has a nice terrace and the beach view. The hotel is connected to Lulu's a bar next door great for cocktails. There is also a nice Japanese restaurant in the hotel. I was worried because I booked it bidding in Priceline, but it was a nice surprise to find such a comfortable and well located hotel for that price.
user_name:
Karin M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were originally booked into a room on the third floor right off the pool. Since the pool was having work done, we were moved to the 15th floor to a room with a balcony providing a beautiful view of the beach. However the accommodations were not what we originally booked. Instead of a second full sized bed, we were given a sleeper sofa that did not meet our needs as well, but the hotel honored the price of our original reservation. Upon moving to our new room we found dirty sheets on the one bed in the room. After calling the front desk, we were told someone would be up to address the problem. When the knock came, we were simply handed sheets. We were told that we would have to change the bed ourselves since the maid wasn't on duty at that time of the evening. I find it a bit much that for the price we were paying we had to change our own dirty sheets. However, the desk staff during the day was wonderful. There is not a restaurant that serves breakfast in the hotel, but there is one that is connected to the hotel. We did not get a chance to eat in the restaurant in the hotel for dinner.We would stay at this hotel again, but there are limited rooms that seem to be suited to families with children.

Absolutely loved our 2 week stay at Park Shore. If a beach location is important to you but you prefer not to be in the noisy end/middle of the Waikiki strip than Park Shore is for you! There is a child friendly beach right across the road or you can use the lovely pool on level 3 of the hotel. We got upgraded to a king ocean view room and it was lovely...view was great and the room was nice and clean. It's a bonus having Tucker & Bevy next door and we loved getting fresh juices and breakfast every morning. The staff were amazing and nothing was too much trouble...house keeping went above and beyond when we asked for something and are a credit to your hotel! We cannot wait for our next adventure to Hawaii and Park Shore will be our hotel of choice once again. Tori from Australia.

I would like to personally thank each and everyone of the people employed of the Park Shore. I recently stayed there 6 nights and everyone was so nice. I especially liked talking to the front desk ladies!! I was vacationing with my parents (super fun when your 31!). I would come downstairs and laugh and vent with the girls!! And I personally liked the homeless people in front of the building. Made for good people watching!I would recommend Park Shore to everyone!!! Thanks for putting up with me and my parents!a++++++

We recently spent 4 nights in the Park Shore Waikiki. It was a lovely clean hotel and the view from the Ocean View room was great! It's located down the end of the Waikiki strip opposite the zoo which and is across the road from the beach and close to all the restaurants. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Only negative was that the pool was closed while we were there for re-painting. Otherwise, a very pleasant stay.

Stayed at the Park Shore Hotel in Waikiki on my visit to Oah'u in January. This hotel is outstanding in so many ways. Our room was beautiful, clean and we had a great view of the beach! The staff was friendly and helpful (especially when my flight out was changed). The room was very clean and maid service was there to clean. I was very pleased. The location was perfect! At the end of Waikiki and away from all of the hustle and bustle of traffic. And even better...across the street from the beach. Close to the Zoo and just down the street from the Waikiki Aquarium! Best hotel and location. And a lovely out door bar "Lulu's" and (didn't make it to there) the Japanese restuarant in the lobby, Oh, and I cannot forget how helpful the activities desk young lady was. Definately Hawaiian Hospitality all the way around! I highly recommend the Park Shore!

What a great find for affordable accommodation in Waikiki. We were upgraded to a one bedroom apartment upon check in and it was a fantastic room. Beautiful ocean views right across the road. Staff are very friendly as well. Don't let the great price deals fool you; this is a quality hotel at a great price. Would definitely stay here again when in Waikiki.

We had an ocean-front room, and were fortunate to be on in a corner room, so we had a beautiful view of both the ocean and Diamond Head. The room was on the smaller side, but not horribly so, and the views more than made up the for the size. The only problem was that on Monday nights, Lulu's (on the second floor) has "service industry night", and essentially turns into a club. If you plan on getting a full night's sleep, and don't have a white noise machine or app, good luck! We were on the 7th floor, and could hear the music clearly in our room with the sliding glass door closed. Fortunately, we sleep to white noise, so we were able to drown it out.Another slight issue is that the A/C only works when the sliding glass door is shut completely. Sounds like it's not that big of a deal, but the A/C would decide that the door was apparently not shut enough, and turn off fairly often. Apparently, being shut and locked isn't always enough.Also, there's no parking at the building. They charge $25 per day for valet service, which when added to the constant tipping if you're driving around alot, can add up quickly!The front desk was very accommodating and allowed us to leave our luggage there on the last day, as our flight wasn't until that night and we didn't want to lug everything around all day. They also let us check in a little early when we arrived, which we didn't expect to be able to do.Top marks for the views and the staff, but -1 for the A/C issues, small rooms and expensive valet.

Personally, my wife and I just came home from 15 days in Hawaii, a first for us, and our hotel, (The Park Shore Waikiki Part of the Aqua Chain now), the staff and the whole holiday in general certainly exceeded any expectations we had. This hotel sits on a corner lot, and has some amazing advantages none of the "Big Name" hotels have. This is NOT a Hilton or a Trump or any of the "Best Known Names" hotel, but for us it was so much better... it was absolutely fantastic. Quiet, clean and comfortable, with out-of-this-world views...Our room was an "07" room which means the number ends in "07" and as such is a corner room with one view looking right down and across the street at the beach, and the other across the street to the Zoo, which is more like a lush park, and in the distance an amazing view of Diamond Head, especially at sunrise.The lady I talked to at the desk (her name was "Kiblai" ), late one night, when asking about the hotel and eventually making our reservation was so very helpful and patient and attentive, I would give her a 99 out of 10, ( yes, 99 out of 10, not 100) as she certainly was beyond professional, and personable, and If I were a hotel manager I would try to scoop her away in a heartbeat. She sealed the deal with us. Her personality and helpfulness and complete attention to detail was exactly what we were looking for.. call it hand holding if you like, but for us, we were exceptionally pleased.
