All the staff from the concierge to the cleaning staff, were very friendly and the room was always spotless. The restaurant attached was great and you can read my review about that too. If you are a Starbuck kind, there is one on the ground floor of the hotel along with two ABC stores for just about any need whatsoever. Breakfast/lunch place also on ground floor serves up the best in healthy food, and absolutely delicious "built before your eyes" sandwiches and platters to die for. Two minutes walk to the scooter rental place, and trolly pick up is one block away. Bus stop is right across the street.Lots and lots of very close nearby places to spend some time and of course, Waikiki Beach is directly across the street. Aquarium is maybe 5 or 6 minutes easy walk down the road.Sunrises and sunsets to die for, and probably the only hotel that has rooms that don't look out onto another hotel...go figure!Not saying it might be the best choice for you or your guests, but it certainly was exceptional for us. An amazing holiday from every possible point of view, ESPECIALLY from the Park Shore Waikiki.Eldon.

Great location and very friendly staff. The room my wife and I stayed in was a good size with a very comfortable bed. The Park Shore is located at the Diamond Head end of the beach and we found it to be quieter in comparison to the centre of the Waikiki strip. The beach is twenty metres from the hotel's main entrance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning on staying in Waikiki.

Stayed at this hotel for business May 2014 and location is at the end of Kalakaua St ( better known as the Waikiki strip.) Chose this hotel because most major hotel chains were booked and I'm glad that I chose this hotel instead. Starbucks is 30 steps away from the main lobby while Tucker & Bevvy Picnic food is next door. They serve amazing smoothies to help you cool down during high humidity days. Restaurants are within walking distance and ABC store is right next door.Rooms served its purpose which is for rest, sleep and take a cold one; who stays inside hotel rooms in Hawaii anyways. Valet is an extra $20 per day or you can use the Honolulu Zoo parking lot but I've seen a lot of undesirable people just walking around at nights. Spend the extra money and save yourself some headaches with the police and your insurance company. Will definitely stay here again.

Very small rooms a balcony with no balcony furniture. My view was of the hotel next-door and all the air-conditioners down below, terrible! The showers were nice and there was a small refrigerator to put two beverages in. I would not recommend this hotel.

Bit late in writing this review but my husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in March. We booked it on recommendation of our travel agent who had stayed here many years in a row and she was right it was fantastic. The only slight negative was Due to plane troubles we ended up getting in really late and despite asking for a double and travel agent saying we were on honeymoon, we were initially put in a twin room over looking another hotel. The night staff were really friendly but were unable to sort anything. The next morning the hotel were able to move us to a partial sea room (but we had a full on view of the sea). From then on we were a very happy honeymooners. We loved being at the end of Waikiki and being able to walk into it along the beach. Fab 7 nights, clean, comfy, good sized room.Lovely touch of the manger putting on drinks and coming round to everyone on Wednesday by the pool. Lulus next door brilliant pale for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Would come back most definitely and recommend to anyone going to Waikiki

I stayed at the Park Shore for 13 days . The staff are very friendly and attentive. My room was small but comfortable, didn't have an ocean view room something I would insist upon if I were to return. But can't be choosy on a business trip. Over all good experience.

We stayed here for 10 nights while attending a conference at Kapiolani Community College. The staff here make this hotel a wonderful place to stay. They are extremely polite, helpful and friendly. We appreciated the coffee, water and juice in the lobby. The cold drinks were iced and much needed on most days. The wonderful ladies who cleaned our room made our return to our room in the evenings, a delight. WiFi in our rooms and the lobby was great as we needed to work while we were there. Beach towels were provided and they were always warm! Our room itself was very average (but always clean); bit on the small side with no desk to work at. The bed however was very nice; crisp linen; fluffy towels; toiletries refreshed everyday; large comfortable pillows. A real treat. I visited the pool area once - for drinks. Management have an evening a week to meet and greet guests. They provide their special 'cocktail' and snacks. I thought it was a very nice gesture. We never used the pool; too small (great for kids though) and we prefer the sea. Our room had no view which was disappointing given the proximity to Waikiki beach. That aside, it's a nice place to stay when holidaying or conferencing.
user_name:
Robyn M
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed 7 nights in early March- it was the best value I could find and we liked being at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki- a nice walk into the main area but quieter and less hectic. It was clean and the staff were efficient and friendly.The best part was Lulus restaurant downstairs- live music at night and great food and literally accessible from within the hotel.

We stayed 3 nights at the Park Shore Waikiki and were very pleased with our stay. The staff was great (Eric who checked us in was so helpful!), the managers very accessible (they even had a manager's reception one night we were there with some punch (leaded and non-leaded) and snacks.), and the room was clean with a very comfy bed. We did not have a car and the hotel arranged for a shuttle for us to go to Pearl Harbor for the day (this is a do not miss experience!). We took a city bus to Diamond Head...and it was easy and quick. (Enjoyed our hike up Diamond Head.) We also took a bus to Bishop Museum...and while we highly recommend the museum...we do not recommend taking a city bus there from the hotel as it took over an hour to get there! We took a cab from the museum to a restaurant and walked home from the restaurant...much better option. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Park Shore Waikiki again.

We stayed here for 7 nights in April. Location is good as it is right on Waikiki beach but on the end close to the Zoo which means it is not as noisy as the other hotels at night time = good sleeping! Very close to restaurants, bus stops etc and very walkable to the rest of Waikiki. Staff were very nice and the girl at Expedia was very helpful in booking tours etc. Free beach towels and chairs (but limited amount of chairs). Suggest you swim at San Souci beach (where the locals swim) - it is about a 10 minute walk in the opposite direction from the happening part of Waikiki, just past the aquarium - really nice beach and not very busy (hotel recommended to us)! Room small but clean and comfy. Balcony has ocean view which was stunning. Wifi worked well. Pool very small - we swam at the beach instead, why not when it is right across the road!! Enjoyed our stay.

We stayed at the Park Shore in November and loved it. Travelling with a 3 year old daughter, being down at that end of Waikiki is perfect because it has the best stretch of beach for small children on the whole strip right in front of the hotel. Of course, it's not one of the super-luxurious hotels further up the beach, but comparatively, the value you get at the Park Shore is excellent. The service was great and everyone that works there were super friendly to us and always went out of their way to help us when we needed it. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but they are clean and changed well daily. We spent most of our entire trip either at the beach, shopping, or exploring Waikiki, so the size of the room didn't really concern us that much. The only downside that I found to this hotel is that the sound travels through the walls quite easily, so if you have noisy neighbours (like we did for a couple of nights), then it might be an annoyance. Other than that, it's a great hotel, and we'll definitely be back again!

Stayed at the park shore for 11 nights.. work staff is VERY friendly always greet you on arrival back to the hotel room. Hotel room small but was enough for the girlfriend and I. View from level 10 partial ocean view is amazing no hotel's obstruct our view from looking out to the mountain across to the ocean is simply bliss right across the road from a park which connects to honolulu zoo (zoo's awesome!) Room service daily freshly made bed and towels. Booking activities was as simple as going to the lobby and booking. awesome stay!!

I stayed here on the 3rd May-10th May and loved it. Excellent location, opposite Waikiki Beach, within easy walking distance of the main shopping area, and on the public bus route to Ala Moana-$2 bus ride.I had a room on the 7th floor, which was very clean, modern, and had everything that I could have wanted, including free Wi Fi for those that need it. I didn't have a view of the beach etc, but then again, I didn't spend that much time in the room anyway.If your looking for a nice hotel for a Solo or a Family, then I would suggest this hotel. Friendly staff, excellent location, Waikiki Beach accross the road(and protected swimming area) Expedia tour office/ Hans Hedemann Surf School within the hotel lobby. The hotel also has some very nice cars for rental, at excellent rates.I will be back again.

The hotel was great for the price. Location was good, it was at the end of Waikiki Beach next the view. Rooms were clean & plenty of shops & restaurants nearby. Also the bus stops next to the hotel & is a cheap way to travel around if you don't have a rental car.

This property is in an awesome spot. It is away from the hustle and bustle of the main shops on Kalakaua but only take 10 minutes to walk to all the big shops etc.Free towels and sand chairs great. Pool area great and not busy at all.Having the ABC convenience store attached is also a plus.Decor slightly dated but is clean and tidy always.Staff were fantastic when our shuttle failed to show up by organising a FREE taxi to the airport! Thanks Scott the manager!I would recommend this to any one, just get a partial or full ocean view room. And it is only 100 steps exactly to your first foot in the sand on the beach!!

We researched many hotels in Waikiki before deciding on the Park Shore and were not disappointed. We prefer a smaller property and this one was great. Our beach and pool view was wonderful and we also could see the zoo and park next door. The walk down the beach to all of the restaurants was not long and transportation options were good. We enjoyed swimming at the beach which is right across the street. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend this property

This was my 8th trip to Oahu and the Park Shore was one of the best I've stayed at. My husband and I recently stayed there early may to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. I've stayed at 7 other hotels but I never got the "Aloha" feeling from them like I did here. Leny, Desiree, Violet and a few others were always helpful at the front desk. This hotel is smaller but had all the amenities you will need. Every staff member (maintenance crew, maids, valet, etc.) said hi to us with a smile. The rooms: We originally got the ocean front room (such a bargain for the incredible view). The room was on the small side but perfectly comfortable for the two of us. On the 2nd night, we had an issue with our room, the staff and manager on duty were quick to correct the issue and relocate us to a different room. We ended up getting the Jr. Suite that was almost double the size with an amazing view of the ocean and Diamond head. Definitely get a ocean view, ocean front or Jr. Suite rooms, totally worth the upgrade. Beds were comfy, plenty of space in the bathrooms.Perks: You can borrow chairs and towels from the front desk, so no need to bring, buy or rent any. They also offer a car rental service (all Volvos) for $63/day for sedan or $71/day SUV. If you keep the car for multiple days, you do not have to pay for parking ($25). We ended up getting a sedan for two days, it was a lot of fun to drive and pretty good on gas. Lulu's is a fun place to go and have drinks in the evening. There is a pool but we never used it, the beach was right across the street. Cons: You have to pay to print your boarding pass downstairs in the lobby, but it was only $1 so not a big deal. Other posters complained about the homeless people out front but that's a city issue that the hotel really has no control over. Other then that, I can't think of anything negative about our stay, that's why they get 5 stars!

Just returned from our sixth year in a row to Hawaii .Changed to the Park Shore from its sister hotel at the western end of beach and worth the change .Hotel recently upgraded , in a great location with plenty of eating options close by .A walk to the main shopping area is a comfortable 10 to 15 minutes .The beach directly across the street is great for those who only want a quick dip in either the lagoon of the ocean proper.If the beach is too much then just relax around a very good pool area .Towels and chairs provided free of charge Wifi works great all the time .Buses stop literally at the front door which makes getting around very easy ,especially the Ala Moana shopping centreHotel staff all excellent especially those in the sometimes difficult activities planning area.Only thing missing is tea making facilities in the room .Filtered coffee is provided daily .Will be returning next year

Our family have been guests at the Park Shore since 1974...it has it all for a wonderful family vacation or if you are just there for a few nights! The staff are customer service guru's...call for room reservations now! We walk to the Aquarium and beach is across the street! Starbucks is on the first floor and something is always happening at Lulu's. Our rooms are clean and the beds smell fresh and flowery! Thank you for great trip Scott and team! See you soon, The Gallighers and Tammy Cook

This hotel is located at the end of Waikiki right next to the zoo. Our room overlooked the pool and had a view of the beach and diamondhead. The location is a little noisy, so if you need total quiet to sleep you may want to choose another hotel. We were able to walk to the Diamondhead Market and Grill for a breakfast of delicious coconut pancakes.

What a great find! I was just in Hawaii to celebrate my birthday it was a last minute trip and I have to say Park Shore was the perfect hotel for me! It is located at the east end of Waikiki - less than a 5 minute walk to the beach, great juice shop next to the lobby, and the rooms were perfect! Everything was clean and the room was big with a view of the ocean. The pool is also nice, but who hangs at the pool when there is a beautiful beach just outside? Overall this hotel was a steal in my opinion. I would come back again!! Mahalo Park Shore!

Back again for a second year and this time took an ocean front room. Well worth the extra money. It's great to sit out in the morning or evening watching the surfers or just the world go bye.. Location is great with buses at the door to the beaches , the shopping centres and the Arizona Memorial. The beach itself is just across the street and the hotel supply beach chairs, towels and beach shoes so just bring your swimsuit and sun screen. Staff are really friendly too so what more can you want? Also free wifi, fridge, coffee, safety deposit and iron and ironing board. Here for two weeks and wish I could come every year but three flights from Scotland make it a bit difficult. Still fingers crossed.

Park Shore Waikiki is very well situated at the east end of Waikiki beach, just across the street from the beach and with the perfect view onto Diamond Head . Hotel is nice, clean and the staff is very, very friendly and helpful. Room was big and clean with a balcony with side wiew to the ocean. The free wireless internet was working perfect. In vicinity is Starbucks, bar and restaurant with fast food but also any other attraction (zoo, aquarium...) and Waikiki beach are in walking distance.If you get a good price for room in this hotel, I highly recomend this hotel.

PROS:-Not one bug found in room in over a week's stay-Strong central air con.-Could open Lanai door for a great breeze-Nice pool area-Great location across street from the beachCONS:-Homeless hanging out on the corner at night-Busy bus-stop right in front of hotel entrance-The least expensive rooms have views of the hotel next door so we had to keep the curtains closed when changing which was often upon waking up ,getting dressed, changing into pool attire, and later into beach wear.-Staff begins closing the pool 20-30 minutes BEFORE sunset.-Pillows all too soft
user_name:
BeginningTrekker
New York City, New York

review_body: Parkshore hotel is very well situated at the east end of Waikiki beach and looks onto Diamond Head the extinct volcano. Mid range priced, the hotel has a fine pool on the third floor. Some rooms have a sea view, others a part sea view and some a park view. Rooms comfortable and well managed and cleaned. Great staff who will go out of their way to assist. Valet parking. This was the third time we visited (from Scotland) and I am sure we will use again. You will go a long way to find an all encompassing hotel at these prices.Alan Jones

This hotel was perfectly located right at the end of the Waikiki Beach strip; a small stroll along the street to the hub bub of Waikiki. The room was clean and comfortable; with good bathroom and aircon working well. Concierge were very helpful with the valet parking (quick collection) and loan of beach chairs (great for our drive around the island). Beach towels are available for sign out at no fee. The pool in small but perfect for a dip watching the world go by on the beach.

I would highly recommend this hotel. From the moment we arrived to the time we left the staff were very friendly and helpful. One staff member in particular Violet made our stay here very memorable, Violet was very helpful, friendly and also went the extra mile for us. The rooms modern, neat and very clean and we had a lovely view of the beach and also Diamond Head. We loved that the hotel was end of the Waikiki strip and that you were at the quieter end but still an easy walk to everything. Loved that you had free Wi-Fi which kept our 17 year old daughter happy. When we come back to we will definitely stay here again.

We had a one night stay over on Waikiki after a week in Kauai. Stayed in the one bedroom suite. Our two teenage boys bunked in the living room on a roll away and sofa bed. (no charge for the roll away). Nicely appointed room (nice bathroom and shower as well), spacious, and great view of the ocean. Hotel staff was friendly and informative (A+ on every account). Can't remember the name, but the deli next door to the hotel serves healthy vegetarian and non vegetarian fare at a reasonable price. That was a huge bonus, as we often struggle to find fresh health food on the go. The Park Shore put a superb finishing touch on our first family vacation to Hawaii. Will definitely stay here again.

i went wanting a great view of the ocean from my room i got everything and more, the staff are great and helpful, the room is roomy and i got the best view of the ocean and diamond head from the balcony. when i checked out they stored my luggage and more than willing to call a cab for me. the lobby is beautiful and good location to at least one trolley stop lots of bus stops the beach and zoo

We picked Park Shore because of its value and close proximity to the beach. Its location at the East end of the Waikiki strip turned out to be very convenient to get away to other parts of Oahu like Diamond Head, Koko Crater, Hanauma Bay, Kane'ohe, etc. The Waikiki strip is a traffic nightmare at times, so if you plan to explore beyond Waikiki, this could be the perfect hotel for you. Even if you plan to spend your entire trip in Waikiki, its still a decent choice.Note: we were celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary and were given a "free upgrade" from a standard room to a partial ocean view (see photo).PROS- Steps away from Waikiki Beach (the "slightly" less busy end too!)- Convenient location to 'escape' Waikiki to other parts of the island- Wonderful "picnic food" shop (Tucker + Bevvy)- Bar & Grill is one of the most popular nightlife spots on the Waikiki strip- Surf School, ABC Store, Expedia expert, Starbucks all in lobby or adjacent- FREE WI-FI (a must for all hotels I stay at)CONS- Small room (not a huge deal as we didn't spend much time there)- Busy street corner, noisy on lanai or with door open- Pool faces same busy street corner - Wifi is a bit slow unless you pay for upgrade (its enough for email and browsing though, just don't try to download an iTunes movie in under 24 hours!)

Stayed here for 5 nights in April.Booked two separate rooms (Junior Suite and a standard room for our two teenage daughters).Both rooms were located on the 18th floor with the suite having a beautiful view out to Diamond Head.Check in was very efficient thanks to Eric who went out of his way to provide information about the hotel and surrounding area.The rooms were clean although the bed and pillows were on the firm side.There was also no electric jug (kettle) in the room.The pool is nice but we found the streamed music somewhat monotonous.Overall this is a great hotel in close proximity to the beach and shuttle pick up/bus service.Highly recommended.

We stayed at the Park Shore the first part of April and were so pleased with our stay. GREAT location, walk out the front door and across the street to the beach. Far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but close enough to walk anywhere you need to go. Beach was far less crowded at this end! Valet service was great and fast, under 2 minutes each time to get the car. We stayed in room 1224 (ocean view), great corner room with views of the ocean and diamond head. Second floor from the top. Room service every day was nice. Free towels to use for the beach. The only downfall I would say is that the room is a touch small but for all we needed it for it was just fine! Will for sure stay here again.

Perfect. I was tasked with finding a hotel for myself and several friends - a scary proposition considering the expectations of a Hawaiian vacation. But the Park Shore met them all!I booked the Partial Ocean View room and got just that and more. I was in room 719 which is in the corner of the building facing the ocean. While my balcony looked directly at the balcony on the opposite side I still had a fantastic view of the ocean, pool and zoo. My friends were in 608 and they had a window (no balcony) that looked directly at the ocean and a balcony that looked directly at another building but when you sat on the balcony you could look between the buildings for a nice ocean view. I liked my room better!Lobby is bright and open. Rooms are modern, clean and spacious. My room was a bit smaller than some but it was a fair trade off for the view. All rooms come with a coffee maker and mini fridge. Perfect for those yummy finds at the Kings Village Farmers Market days. There's also a communal microwave on the third floor and complimentary coffee and infused water in the lobby. Speaking of lobby, the front desk people, Brian, Jessica, et al, were always helpful and friendly. They offered us the use of a hospitality room when we had to check out but still had time to hit the pool. Oh, the pool. Yes, small but we liked it that way. Calm, nice pool chairs and a great view of the beach. On Wednesday the Management had a "get to know you" party at 5:30pm at the pool. I didn't go but sat on my balcony watching it and it looked like fun!There are two ABC's, one on each side of the hotel, along with a Starbucks and a great little sandwich shop. Tiki's is just up the street. The food at Tiki's is a bit pedestrian for my taste but the views can't be beat. We ordered the edamame here and it came floating in butter and garlic. Super yummy but not your traditional healthy treat!The hotel is directly across the street from a beautiful stretch of Kuhio Beach. The hotel has a limited number of beach chairs and towels that you simply sign out for (complimentary) at the Bell Stand. I first went to the right side of the pier where the beach is protected by a rock wall. Schools of beautiful fish swim through here and it's the perfect place for children as there are no waves…just a beautiful sandy beach. A bit tame for my taste so I spent more time on the "surf" side of the pier.The Hans Hedemann Surf School is located in the lobby of the Park Shore and they have a stand on the beach where you can rent snorkels, boogie boards, etc. Take the surf lessons! We also booked a tour at the Expedia Desk to visit the USS Arizona and were not disappointed.Overall, I think the happy, friendly vibe, the location and the clean, updated rooms made this hotel more of an "experience" than just a stay.Things to do while at the Park Shore:* Walk up Kapahulu to the Corner Kitchen for some good grub and fantastic local music from 6:30pm - 8:30pm each night but Sunday.* Shop for a vintage Hawaiian shirt at Bailey's on Kapahulu (one block north of Corner Kitchen)* Eat malasadas at Leonard's Bakery. They come straight out of the kitchen, warm and ready to eat. Eat them immediately for a heavenly treat! (oh, come on, you're on vacation!)* Hike Diamond Head (a 3 mile walk from the hotel). Views are unbelievable. * Have an authentic plate lunch at Pioneer Saloon* Eat breakfast or dinner at Goofy's. Eggs Benedict with pulled Hawaiian pork was to die for.* Go to MarakameUdon for the best noodles EVER. You will have to wait in line, it goes fast and is worth the wait. Have the #5 and then have some of the tempura on the side. So delish!* Shop at 88 Tees for some of the funkiest, fun t-shirts ever. Plus just the store itself is worth the visit. I, and my friends, will make the Park Shore Waikiki our first choice for a hotel when we return to Waikiki. And we will return!

We stayed here in mid April as a family group of three parties and had a very welcoming and supportive visit. We received early check-in on the morning of our arrival and were all on the same floor which made quickly seeing each other so easy. Our views were all different but equally gorgeous and being on the 10th Floor kept us away from any real noise below. We hired an SUV for the day to drive around the island and it was organized through the hotel - delivered to the door and dropped off in the same way so it made for a hassle free process especially as we had a young child with us. The child friendly beach right outside was perfect for us all and we enjoyed many days relaxing there too. The Honolulu Zoo is just across the way and a terrific little zoo which the family enjoyed. Tucker & Bevvy the downstairs cafe had great healthy wraps, sandwiches, fruit, yummy smoothies and especially catered for the gluten free needs we had for a child - a rare treat!

There seemed to be more rooms without a good clear view of the beach than with, so we weren't too disappointed when our view of the ocean was at an angle (i.e. looking down the side of the building). We also had a view of Diamond Head from the window, and it's a great view. It was handy to be so close to the beach, out the front of the hotel and cross the road at the lights and you're on the sand (well, on the footpath that leads onto the sand). Although the room wasn't huge, we had a bar fridge and a safe, which were two things lacking in many of the other rooms we stayed in over the course of our four week US vacation, so we were happy with that! The bed was large and comfortable and the rooms were well maintained and clean. The staff at the hotel were really helpful and friendly, anything we asked for was no problem. We hired a car from the hotel, which is a new service they have started and made it very convenient. We'd been advised by the shuttle driver that it was cheaper to get a car from the airport, but that would have meant a cab or shuttle ride back to the airport to collect it and then either a fee to drop it in town or another ride back after dropping it off. The price to hire a good quality car (they are all Volvos) direct from the hotel is reasonable ($63 for a sedan or SUV and $71 for a convertible) and you don't have to pay valet parking at the hotel if you use one of their cars. Make sure you check out the Japanese restaurant in the foyer of the hotel, as it was certainly not standard hotel fare. The food was fresh and delicious and the restaurant was full of Japanese people, which I always think is a good sign, and the prices were reasonable.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in an excellent location at the end of Waikiki beach. We spend one night and were able to experience the whole beach scene. The hospitality room was awesome to freshen up for our flight to Maui! Cheeseburger in Paradise is down the street with an excellent progressive happy hour. Our room had an awesome view of diamond head, the zoom and the ocean!

Stayed here for 3 nights in a partial ocean view. Room was very clean, though it was small. Location is excellent, as noted in other reviews, sort of away from the noise and congestion of Waikiki. We walked pretty much everywhere. The even gave us beach chairs and towels.

Have stayed here 10 nights. Very clean and comfortable at quieter end of Waikiki.Had both beach and diamond head view. Staff so friendly nothing too much trouble! Highly recommended. Rooms excellent. If you want a great place stay here.

we had ocean view 10th floor room. great views of diamond head and water just up from Waikiki beach (the main part). we found free parking in the street so didnt pay the $25 valet parking fee. there is no breakfast at the hotel but many choices nearby.easy access to everything in Waikiki yet away from the main area which was what we wanted. staff were helpful and friendly. Bed was very comfy and air con ran all night with no interference to sleep.

We LOVED this hotel and had a great couple of nights there. We had a partial ocean view, but we had an amazing view of the water because of the building's location. Pros: great restaurant options, easy beach access, beautiful lobby, friendly staff, awesome pool with great viewsCons: room was a little small, a little far from the main drag (but very quiet)

Great views, right across from beach, clean, comfortable, friendly and helpful staff. Recently renovated, we had a king room with Diamond Head and beachfront views on one of the top floors. In-room fridge, safe for locking up valuables, 42 inch TV, good-sized lanai. Unfortunately, there was no vanity in the small bathroom and no place to put toiletries. It was more like an ensuite bathroom. Great central air conditioning. King bed was not the most comfortable, even for a king, with no pillowtop mattress. Property is on the south eastern end of the Waikiki strip and there are a lot of homeless on the streets in this neighborhood. About a 10 minute walk to the main strip area, however, there is a Starbucks, Tucker & Bevy and Lulu's Restaurant is attached to the hotel.

I am speechless. My friend (23) and I (22) wanted a hotel that was close to the ocean, Diamond Head, and downtown Waikiki area, had a nice pool, relatively updated rooms, and easy on the wallet. This hotel EXCEEDED my expectations by a long shot. We used the "Show Your Shaka" for a 10% discount on the hotel room. The staff was extremely helpful the entire trip. We hiked Diamond Head one day - walked up there without renting a vehicle or getting a taxi - and when we got back they suggested we go to Koko Head one day of our trip. They gave us the bus route and times to get there. Koko Head was by far the best part of our trip and we wouldn't have even thought of going there without the suggestion. You are able to rent out beach towels - free of charge - and can return them after using. The pool area and vending room were always clean. The pool area overlooks the ocean and Lulu's. Our room was clean and had an updated bathroom. The cleaning woman, Juanita, was super nice and even if we had the 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door, she would come back later on and ask us if we needed any clean towels or toiletries. The room also had a balcony that overlooked a part of the ocean - which was nice considering we didn't have an oceanfront room. The hotel is also attached to Lulu's, which was our favorite restaurant/bar and had acoustic music each night. The hotel is the end of the block for the hotels, so the views of Diamond Head are wonderful because there aren't any other buildings blocking it. Even when you go to get ice, you have a beautiful view of Diamond Head and the city. The only downside to being on the end is the homeless who lay out on the street at night. There aren't that many and they are harmless - they don't do anything to you. In that regards, my friend and I would walk to the beach area by the Royal Hawaiian (pink hotel), because it was more family oriented and we didn't feel bad leaving our backpacks by our towels. There was one homeless man who sold leis on the sidewalk. If you see him, you should buy one - he is a great guy.All in all, this hotel was fantastic and a great find. There is no doubt in my mind I would stay here again. Additionally, Eggs N' Things is worth the wait if there is a line, the crepes are amazing.

If you're looking for somewhere a little quieter than the rest of Waikiki, then choose this hotel. It's location across the road from Honolulu Zoo means you're still right in Waikiki but without the noise. The rooms are lovely, excellent views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Clean, tidy and modern rooms with comfortable beds. The staff are friendly and helpful.

From the moment my husband and I arrived at the hotel to the day we left we have nothing but good things to say about this wonderful place! The staff are so friendly and helpful! I especially would like to thank Jara for booking us into an awesome room with a spectacular view!! You rock!! The hotel was very clean - which is a big thing for me! The location (across from the zoo and the beach) was awesome! You get good value for your buck - and no resort fee! The manager and staff care about their guests and it shows!! We will definitely stay at the Park Shore again!

Park Shore Waikiki is on the eastern edge of Waikiki Beach. It has fabulous access to the H1 without going through the Waikiki traffic (King Street exit going to Hotel, straight up Kapahulu getting to H1). It is STEPS from the beach and this part of the beach is protected by a breakwater and is not as crowded as the beach center. Restaurants and shops are all within a 10 to 15 minute. I thought the valet parking would be a pain, but the valet attendants are friendly and quick. We never waited over 5 minutes for our car. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful, offering directions, printing boarding passes and ordering a last minute airport shuttle when flights were changed without any problems. When I made the reservation, I was fortunate and happened to get the manager who reserved an ocean front 1 bedroom suite (for my husband, son and I) which has a king bed in the bedroom and sofa sleeper in the living area with a kitchenette and a connecting double room for my mom. It worked perfectly. He even reduced our rate with a special came on line a few weeks later! The kitchenette has dishes and silverware allowing us to eat breakfast in the hotel although a Starbucks is conveniently located next door. The bath area was nice sized with plenty of towel racks. Also in our suite the bathroom sink was located outside the toilet/shower area which really helps with the morning routine. Our only minor complaint is that the pool closes at sunset and the evening is when we were looking for a relaxing swim. To be fair, it appears many hotel pools close early. Also my teenage son says the sofa bed is fairly comfortable but is close to needing to be replaced. While it costs more to be on the beach, in my opinion it is worth the extra cost at the Park Shore Waikiki.

I have stayed in Waikiki on several occasions but was searching Trip Advisor for new ideas and came across the Park Shore. It was an excellent choice. Once again, traveller's reviews on Trip Advisor are reliable and worthwhile. The hotel is in an outstanding location, somewhat away from the hustle, bustle and busyness of Waikiki but across from the beach and the park, and very close to the zoo. We had a room on the third floor adjacent to the pool, with a sliding glass door on to the deck and a view of the ocean. It was excellent value, the staff are friendly and the amenities near the hotel are terrific. I will make this my hotel of choice when I return to Waikiki.

My husband and I, along with our friends, came back from our holiday yesterday afternoon. From the moment we saw the great position of the hotel, then the great rooms with a great views (which were partial ocean view rooms 708 and our friends in rooms 608 & 1008) and how helpful the staff were, we were planning our return trip back!! We did a lot of research and this hotel ticked all the boxes and we were not disappointed. In lots of the reviews that I read, they mentioned that the rooms were a little small, but our room was a good size, but I am not sure if the were talking about other rooms that were in a different positions to ours.Thanks for making our holiday a memorable one !!

This hotel was the last one on the Waikiki beach strip, which may explain why it was a bit less expensive than some of the others. However, it is still a great location and a very nice hotel. The beach directly across from the hotel is fine; but it is only a 10 - 15 pleasant walk on the beach to get to some of the more popular areas. The pool at the hotel is fine, but rarely used. Rooms were clean, the hotel provided towels and chairs for the beach, and staff was very helpful. The expedia travel agent in the lobby was also quite helpful. There is a Starbucks and Bevy and Tucker take out right next door. Well worth staying in.

Did my research for best location and price on the waikiki strip and we landed here. Stayed a week, perfect location, such a helpful and friendly staff! Lulus for breakfast was delish, and we loved jimmy buffets for dinner! Park shore even has its own car rentals now, which was so convenient! Our ocean view room was a little small but really, youre only in there to sleep so is not an issue! Staff helped us plan the best spots to stop on our day trip around the island, with great suggestions! Had such a wonderful time, if we are ever able to return, this is where we'll be!

We just returned last night and can't wait to go back! The view from room 1424 was amazing! Diamond head and full ocean view! Best place to watch the sunset is on your own balcony. Awesome hotel for an affordable price!

We spent 3 nights here before a cruise around the islands. The rooms are kinda small but they were very clean. The staff we met and interacted with were very nice.. It's in a great location because its at the end of town so get the right room and you can see Diamond Head & the beach.

From the time we checked in, til we checked out. It was pure professionalism. Jessica at the front desk corrected our minor room issue, and it was done in a manner that did not interrupt our trip at all. Fast, friendly, courteous, and just a nice group of folks working hard at their jobs to make one to remember their vacations the right way, and want to return to stay at the Park Shore Hotel. I haven't even mentioned our room view was breathtaking. The folks getting our car everyday was fast and very helpful in every way. We even bought some malasadas from Leonard's Bakery and handed them out. Next trip will be a repeat at the Park shore.

Right by Waikiki beach, with views over the beach and Diamond Head. Bit disappointed as a honeymooning couple that whilst we got a 'congratulations', the honeymooning couple after us got a box of chocolates as well (were we not paying enough?). Not all rooms have a great view (we had side of neighbouring hotel and sliver of ocean), but the rooms are comfortable, the staff are great. We did have issues with the keycards not working in the room door, and had to get them recoded 4-5 times during the week. Hotel pool overlooks the ocean. Great location on Waikiki beach. Don't worry about the homeless people, they're everywhere in Waikiki, and don't cause any bother. Absolutely nothing to be worried about.

Location fabulous across from beachcomfortable roomsnice pool with sun all daystaff very nice & helpfulFantastic restaurants Tour desk.Malia so helpfulWifi excellent Beds comfortable Ciao ELISA. Australia

Very pleased with the convenience. Restaurant and ABC store, Starbucks and other shops pretty much on the premises. Beach is just across the street, Honolulu Zoo as well. Wonderful Aquarium in the park just south of us. Room was clean and kept up very well throughout our stay. View of the ocean and Diamond Head....spectacular. This is not a fancy hotel but perfectly acceptable and way more affordable. Would not hesitate to return to this Hotel....would be my first choice.

Spent 7 days in Oahu and chose the Park Shore from the reviews on Tripadvisor. WOW we were stoked with the service and what must have to be the friendliest people in the world. Nothing was a bother and our room was cleaned every day. Loved that it was out of the noise but close enough to walk everywhere!! The most beautiful view of Diamond Head and the ocean and we loved waking up to it every day. We stayed on the 9th floor and traffic noise was barely noticeable. Not being used to heat such as this the A/C was bliss!!!!! When we come back it will be to the Park Shore with our kids in tow!!!!!!! Cant recommend highly enough especially with a Starbucks and restaurant underneath. Everything we wanted for our first overseas trip!!!!

I usually stay at The Equus in Hawaii, however, due to the increasing noise from Ala Moana Bvd ( I'm a light sleeper ), I decided to splash out on a hotel by the beach. This was my first stay at the Park Shore and if I return to Hawaii again I would definitely stay here again. My room, 1720, was well away from any street noise ( heard two sirens during my week stay ) and came with views of both the ocean and the hinterland. It is obvious the rooms have been recently renovated as they are clean and fresh, with no signs of any wear and tear. The room had a comfortable king size bed, large television and refrigerator ( although I lost half a tub of ice cream to the freezer, which isn't ice cream friendly ). I've read several comments regarding the size of the rooms ( small ) however compared to a London hotel, they are ample. There was enough room opposite the bed, against the wall, for my suitcase which still allowed plenty of space to walk between bed and suitcase to the balcony. There are large drawers in the desk and a cupboard for hanging clothes near the bathroom. The vanity in the bathroom also had plenty of room for toiletries etc. The bedside tables were also a decent size and lighting was very good. In the foyer in the mornings there is complimentary coffee and during the day cold water and juice, a lovely bonus after a day out in the sunshine. I did not use the facilities however did read on the noticeboard in the elevators that there were microwaves and food/drink vending machines available on the third floor. I can recommend the pineapple smoothie from the café at the entrance to the hotel's foyer. The local paper is also provided each day, outside the elevators on each floor. There is a bus stop directly outside the entrance of the hotel, however, if heading towards the other end of Waikiki or Ala Moana the bus stop at the corner of Kuhio, one block over and a couple of blocks inland, is a better option. This hotel is directly opposite the beach, all you have to do is cross the road, and also faces the entrance to the Zoo. The Kahala Mall is also only a short bus ride away ( number 23 ), for Wholefoods, Longs Drugs and Macys. I chose this hotel partly on price, location and the comments on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed.

Park shore hotel has great service and friendly staff. Located opposite the beach is a perfect spot for family vacation. the downside is there are so many homeless people now living on the streets and they generally live at that end of Waikiki beach.Choose a pool or beach view room as the standard rooms are facing another building and all you will hear from your room is the air conditioning vent from other hotels. After making a complaint about this i was moved level 4 with a pool view which was great....not noisy at allThere is an excellent dine in or takeaway shop below the hotel - Tucker & Bevy ...and this place has the best take away healthy options in the area at reasonable pricesThe Hotel also have Expedia Tours to organise tours around island - a bit pricey. shop aroundBuses stop at door to take you to the shopping mall however its a nice 30 minute walk. www.alamoanacenter.com/Center-Information/Hours-Directions.asp

Spent three days before taking the 7 day island cruise and stayed another 3 days after the cruise. The front desk personnel could not be any nicer both times. Leni at the front desk was great. She remembered our names when we checked in the 2nd time. She also remembered it was my 50th birthday too. The hotel is right across the street from the beach. It's at the end of the strip so it's quiet there especially at night. Was able to sleep with the sliding door open at night. Very clean rooms. Loved the afternoon juice they had in the lobby. 2 ABC stores in front and behind the hotel. I've stayed at several other hotels in Waikiki as this is my 9th time visiting and by far this is my new best hotel to stay while there. We didn't have a car so didn't have to pay parking. Good resturants are in walking distance from the hotel.

With the Waikiki beach right opposite the hotel, you cannot go wrong with staying here. You can see the Diamond Head from upper floors and take some great photos.The restaurants within the hotel are pretty good, especially the authentic japanese restaurant. Downtown is a 10-15 min straight walk from the hotel and you can do some Hawaii shopping along the beach road. The rooms are small but adequate for a short stay. You can request for a car rental service from the concierge within the hotel if you would like to explore the Island ( strongly suggest it since there are much better beaches than Waikiki on the eastern side of the Island). And though the hotel does not seem to have parking, you can always do short term parking at the Zoo next door which is pretty cheap.

Very small room, king-sized bed and 1 chair at a small table. Paid for Ocean-view room; it was kinda-sorta (if you leaned way out). Lots and lots of street noise and we were 6 floors up. 6th floor had been painted earlier in the day and the whole floor smelled like paint. Tiny bathroom, skimpy amenities, okay towels, shower NEVER got above tepid. (Tried to shower when we got in, and again the next morning, hoping 12 hours would allow the water heater to fill up again.) Pool area very small. Right across from "Sunset Beach", which filled up with vagrants and homeless as soon as the sun set. 2 ABC Stores very, very close by, 1 of which was attached to the hotel itself, so I picked up yogurt and bananas, etc. to put in the fridge. Coffee in the room was terrible, so husband dumped it and went to the Starbucks 1/2 block up the street - absolutely surrounded by homeless and beggars. Concierge's information was inaccurate about required valet parking fee, store hours and availability of rental cars. I ended up renting at the airport and after paying the fee, the airport rental was still cheaper than the "only available" rental in the area. Valet drop-off very tight area, as driveway is one-way, facing the ocean, which means you are stuck on the street in traffic waiting for 2 cars ahead of you to clear out, which isn't easy to do in the traffic.

We were upgraded to a Diamondhead suite. Amazing view of the ocean and Diamondhead. Nicely decorated, clean, pleasant staff and great location. Most other hotels charge $400+ for an oceanfront room. This was $245 + tax.

I wanted to say how much I enjoyed another trip to Hawaii and my stay at the Park Shore. The staff were so friendly and accommodating and location and pool are fabulous. I want to especially thank Annie again for my same room. I will for certain return again next year. Mahalo, Park Shore and Honolulu!! An

Dated hotel that smelt funky and had poor security. It's one street up from the beach. Many of the competitors on the strip offer better quality for a similar price. Felt unsafe the whole time, avoid this hotel, there are better options.

Our second time staying at the Park Shore, and another great experience! This is one of the best locations in Waikiki -- directly across from the beach and outdoor movie screen (movies on weekends), and also right beside Queen Kapiolani Park and the Honolulu Zoo. The beach and zoo are about a 30-second walk from the lobby. Stayed in a "Partial Ocean View" room in the "Park Wing", which we expected to have a *sliver* of actual ocean view... But instead we had a gorgeous sweeping view from Diamond Head to the park to the ocean. BIG ocean view, not partial. Had a smallish balcony with 2 chairs and small table, and ate most of our breakfasts out there. Starbucks right beside hotel, along with two ABC stores, and a great burger joint, "Teddy's Burgers." The restaurant Lulu's beside hotel is also great, even for kids. This trip we brought our 8-month-old baby; the hotel was stroller-friendly, and provided a good crib (playpen size, but with a much thicker mattress, and bring your own baby blankets as the room gets chilly with A/C). Mini-fridge in room, and microwave available in 3rd-floor vending room. Beach/pool towels available at front desk, along with a limited number of beach chairs (gotta ask first thing in morning to get a chair!). Negatives: rooms are quite small, very little floor space; no suitcase stand; no hottub in pool area; no pay-per-view movies; no room service. But really, people don't go to Hawaii to hang out in their room watching movies and eating room service. The price is middle-of-the-road for Waikiki, but we felt the value was there for location, cleanliness, great neighbourhood, and view. Positives: very friendly staff, free Wi-Fi worked great during entire stay, and location, location, location! Can't wait to go back. :)

My friend and I stayed for 6 nights, our first time to Oahu, Check in was quick, room was clean and quiet. The beds are so comfortable. Every morning there is water and coffee in the lobby and in the afternoon, water and juice. Great location on the south end of Waikiki beach, a bit less hectic than further down the beach. Close to shuttle, bus and trolley stops. Walk out front of the hotel, cross the street and you are on the beach. Great swimming area. Check out took less than a minute. All the staff was friendly. Our only little problem was the battery went dead in the door lock, but maintenance was there within 5 minutes to fix it. If I go back to Oahu, I will stay there again!

I originally checked in and didn't have the best experience with the reception desk. I made a complaint and was called the next day by the General Manager. He heard my concerns and realized that I needed a bigger room for my family size. A family of four, two adults and two small children. He upgraded me to a pool front room so we could not only enjoy the pool but also the views of Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head. They had beach towels for us to use, along with a mini fridge in the room for drinks and snacks. This room was perfect for our family size and I will definitely stay here again on our next family trip to Hawaii.

Wrote a review about 2 wks ago but have not seen it published..perhaps because I was not pleased with the reception. The room was adequate but small....no real dressers, just 4 small drawers in one and a second small 2 drawers in other with 3 people and two queen beds. Hardly room to walk around, especially since I have a walker. The best thing about this hotel is its location for those who can walk distances. Good beaches across street and found several good, but somewhat expensive, restaurants within 3 blocks. Lulus has great food. One problem many hotels and businesses have are the homeless people setting up camp in front of them. They are a real eyesore and hopefully police will be more cognizant..although I have stayed at this end of Waikiki many times and this has been happening for at least 5 years.Housekeeping could speed it up a bit, especially when guests arrive at 12noon and reception does not make an attempt to get room available until right at 3pm. Knowing this is the actual stated check-in time, I suggest Management look into having them accommodate those people who have reservations as fast as possible...especially since I had to sit and wait for my room until 3pm...I am sure this a ploy because everyone who sat waiting for a room, even a couple who walked in off the street, were given their rooms within 1 hour of when I arrived. Since I use a walker, it wasn't possible for me to "sit by the beach" or take a walk......They were very uncaring at reception...and I assume housekeeping as well. FYI, worked in the airline industry 32 years, have taken more than 150 trips to Hawaii and have never been treated so rudely. And, I was NOT traveling on a discount. I am planning a trip in early April and doubt I will stay at Park Shore this time.

We had an ocean view room with views of Diamond Head and Waikiki beach. We sat on the lanai for hours just watching whales, people and cars. It was a little loud, but I assume the whole beach is when there are cars. We got to hear birds and monkeys from the zoo during the day as well.The staff was so polite and courteous! We never had any issues in this hotel. Don't be dissuaded when people say it's small; we were able to meander around our room perfectly fine with 2 suitcases full of clothes. We had a refrigerator and there is a communal microwave on the third floor. We got there early and left late so they held our luggage. The valet was $25 a day with in and out privileges, which we were happy with because it alleviated us from having to find parking all the time. Overall a great value, it's less busy on this side and there is a small sandwich store, Starbucks, and ABC store nearby. My advice though: skip the Starbucks and get Hawaiian coffee from the ABC store! Much better!We plan on coming back next year and are going to request the same room; it was breathtaking and I felt amazing watching the sunrise everyday over Diamond Head.

We had a wonderful stay, the rooms were a little small, updated and clean. the hotel staff was wonderful. our room had a closet, coffee, refrigerator, large screen tv, plenty of towels, comfortable pillows, and organic soaps in the bathroom. We stayed in a beach view room on the 15th floor across from the zoo. there were flamingos in view from the balcony at the zoo. The sushi restaurant had excellent sushi(a bit pricey), and I do recommend the teriaki chicken which melted in your mouth

I selected this hotel based on reading other people's reviews. But what really put this place over the top for me, was the fact that every single review was responded to by the Park Shore. That indicated to me that the hotel really cared about what people thought of it & that they had a good experience. Like others have indicated, this hotel is very conveniently located. So many things are either within walking distance or accessible by bus/trolley. Didn't need to rent a car. I found the hotel staff super friendly, and ready to answer any question. I can highly recommend staying here !! I hope to be back again someday.

The Park Shore is the last hotel on the "Waikiki Strip" so to speak, and across the street is the Queen Kapiolani park. It is close to my favorite beach, and also easy walking distance to bars, restaurants and clubs. I am an avid tennis player, so the free public tennis courts at Queen Kapiolani park are great. The staff treat their guests very well, and I would say that Jessica at the front desk was my favorite person at this hotel. She was kind, helpful and eager to be of assistance.

Since being upgraded this hotel deserves much better reviews - - not fancy but big bang for your buck. Location was tops - - across street from walled swim area - - plenty of nearby eateries - - 10-15 minute walk to other end of the strip. Zoo right behind and Aquarium just a short walk. Bus service at the door. Comfortable beds - - friendly staff - - concerge in lobby very helpful. We had no complaints whatsoever!We certainly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

This hotel is in a great location for several reasons. First if you book any tour or shuttle its the last pickup in the morning so you don't have to get up before dawn. Secondly it's at the very south end of the strip so it has unobstructed views of Diamond Head and the beach. Staff were super friendly and helpful including a cocktail party on the pool deck with the manager. Would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is in a superb location right at the end of the craziness of Waikiki and across from the zoo. Our room was on the 8th floor with a view of Diamond Head and the beach. There is a bus stop on the corner and you are also close to several trolley stops. If you like, be sure to take the free Hi Lo Hattie trolley to the store and they will drop you on the way back at a few locations for shopping.This high points were the location, view and the pool. Things I would change are turning down the music in the lobby and poolside so you could have more quiet time, have half and half for the coffee in the lobby and softer pillows. It was good coffee but they only had chemical creamer. The pillows were small and hard.There are a couple of fine local restaurants nearby that we were told to check out. If you walk up Monserrat to the left about 12 minutes you come to Bogarts on the right in a small strip mall. The crab asparagus omelet was enjoyed by my wife and I can tell you that the acai bowl is one of life's great food items for a cool morning bowl of fruit. A few blocks further up Monserrat you have the Diamond Head Grill. We ate multiple desserts from there and they have a lot of great take out.The Park Shore has a very nice pool. It is busy during the day but if you go early and towards sunset you can have a nice swim. It is kept quite cool but feels good on a warm day.The men by the front desk who handle taxis, luggage etc. were very helpful. The woman who checked us in made us feel very welcome. Some of the morning staff were not quite so friendly but did provide the requested information.You can check out nice pool and beach towels and return them when you are done.All in all, a very good place to stay on Waikiki beach.

Keeping it short and simple.. I think.We stayed here from Feb. 21 to the 28 2014. Got a package deal with Westjet (love this airline too.) We always check the reviews on tripadvisor first. This hotel got really great reviews so we deceided to stay here. We stayed in room 1517 which at first seemed a little underwhelming when we first got in. We soon warmed up to it though.. and I should explain by underwhelmed, I mean it seemed small. The room itself was clean, had a safe, fridge and the other standard amenities. Loved, loved, loved the views. If we were one floor down in same room we would have only been able to see beach as it is in a corner.. Could see Diamond Head and the beach from our room. This hotel is literally across the street from the beach. The hotel was clean, lobby clean and bright. Staff were friendly, helpful and talkative. Liked having the free coffee, juice and water down in the lobby everyday.We used towels and beach chairs from hotel too. Nice.On last day we stored our suitcases in a locked room in lobby and were able to use a hospitality suite free of charge as we were a late check out that evening. (Could still go to beach all day etc. then get changed for flight later that night.Price is a little high but not out of line with other hotels at peak season.We would recommend this hotel and it has now become our new favourite on Waikiki.Oh ya, we did eat at Tucker and Bevy a couple times. It is kind of a deli. Great sandwiches and smoothies for a reasonable price.*Tried several times to add photo on tripadvisor but for some reason it won't let me.
user_name:
Peter A
Fort McMurray, Alberta, Canada

review_body: My spouse and I stayed at the Park Shore for 4 nights on early March; I had researched hotels quite a bit online and we were delighted with our stay. We had an oceanfront king room; I had sent en email request for a Diamond Head view. We ended up with a corner room with the lanai facing Diamond Head, and the beach off the side of the lanai. There was also another large window facing the beach directly. The simple contemporary style was very attractive. The bed, ventilation, climate control and shower were all excellent. The only minor complaint was that there wasn't any place to put your stuff in the bathroom- another shelf would have been welcome. The location of the hotel was ideal for us- overlooking the beach and park, and out of the fray of the busier part of Waikiki. Others have commented on the homeless problem; no one bothered us and I did not think it was any worse than in other big cities that I have visited. If we are lucky enough to return to Oahu, I would gladly stay at the Park Shore again.

The front desk service was fantastic. The valet and bellhop service was also very good. The hotel is older but it has been updated and we had no issues. The pool was clean and very useable. As some people have mentioned there are a lot of homeless people outside on this end of the strip. They are not aggressive but they are there. I dont think that they are really anything to be concerned about. The door slamming issue also still exists but it wasnt that bad. We had a 6 month old with us and she never once woke up from a door slam. I think that the hotel was very good value for Waikiki. The price point is definitly not cheap but its Waikiki afterall and there simply are no cheap hotels. The location across from the beach was fantastic and there was plenty to eat within a few blocks. Overall I would rate it at great and we had a great visit.

We stayed at the Park Shore for 4 nights on our way back to Australia. The hotel is located at the very end of the Waikiki strip which makes for stunning views of the ocean and Diamond Head, we could even see the flamingos and elephants in the zoo from our room (which was an ocean front). The walk into Waikiki is short, we also walked to the Ala Moana mall on the other side of 'town'. The hotel itself is nice enough, more like a nice motel for hotel prices. We were on the 10th floor and the traffic noise at the intersection (bus announcements etc) seemed loud and continued late into the night. Room service timing was below average: our room wasn't made up until around 4 pm each day however the overall cleanliness of the room was good.

My wife and I stayed at the Park Shore hotel for 9 days in March 2014 and would definately stay there again The service from reception was excellent. We had 3 minor problems which were attended to and fixed within 5 minutes on each occasion(radio,safe and kettle)Our room had spectacular views (9th floor) of ocean and Diamond head.Room was not large but adequate for our needs. We had twin queen beds.I am claustrophobic and the least time spent in elevators the better. Elevators were quick and no problems.Situated away from the main Waikiki area it was ideal for our needs..On the Monday evening the noise from the night club below was the only negative I found. Excellent value for money.Ray,Rye. Australia

After a 10 hour flight from Australia, we took a taxi to our hotel and it was a relieved to finally arrived and shown our room straight away.We stayed at Park Shore hotel with my husband & 3 teenage children for 11 days in February 2014. We booked two bedroom in level 15 as we just decided to go to Hawaii at the last minute and we couldn't find a hotel anywhere that could accomodate a family of 5. We found the hotel really good and handy to everything as we did a lot of activities, we got picked up from either right infront of our hotel or just around the corner at the other hotels. We didn't hire a car because we didn't need to. The hotel is so close to everything, my children went to the beach almost everyday if we weren't out all day. The hotel was very clean & comfortable for the price we paid. Bed sheets changed and room cleaned every day by a lovely lady that look after level 15. The front desk were very helpful even the guys in the front desk the Concierge were very helpful, always willing to help us. There is a very nice restaurant in level 2 at the hotel,we had dinner there a couple of times. The pool area is ok, they put on a free happy hour every Wednesday afternoon at the pool side when we were there. You can catch the best sunset from the pool side, just make sure you have your camera with you. I took some beautiful pictures of the Sunset from there. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone as its very cheap, clean & closer to everything. We will stay at Park Shore Waikiki again for sure if we go to Honolulu again.

I stayed there for a few days with my mother. Although she didn't seem to like the hotel (she's a grumpy woman) I found it ok and I thought it was beyond average so I'm going to give this a four star. The location is great, right on the waikiki and a few minutes walk from the Center and everything else. The Cons: $25 parking fee and each time you come back, tipping is quasi-necessary or else the people get unhappy. The reception was always busy and that was really annoying.I do like how they let us borrow free towels and how they have a good japanese restaurant on the first floor. Very reasonably priced, too.

We have stayed at the Park Shore Waikiki hotel for 2 weeks, this being our last day, coming all the way from Norway. It was totally worth it, we loved our stay.• Room looks nice and it's definitely big enough for two.• Bed is very comfy. There's some noise from the street, but we slept like babies :)• The fridge was empty, so we filled it with drinks and cheesecake.• It's really clean here and they keep it clean for the entire stay.• Location of the hotel is perfect, easy walk across the street to enjoy the beach.• Shops, restaurants and bus stops are also nearby. • The view from our room is amazing, we're going to miss it!Also from the day we arrived the service has been great because if there was any problems or questions, they would always help!Thanks to everyone at Park Shore Waikiki for making our stay the best.We hope to come back some day.Mahalo! :)

I stayed at the Park Shore for 2 days following a guided tour before flying home to Australia. What a great position. I went to the Zoo, across the road to the beach, and saw a beautiful sunset. My biggest thrill was walking around to the ice machine and seeing an amazing view of Diamond Head. Room was small but comfortable except for the too thin pillows, and I loved the shower head in the bathroom. If i ever return to Waikiki I would stay at the Park Shore.

If I was going to stay in Waikiki again, I'd stay here. The location is perfect. At the end of the main strip of high-rises with a fantastic view of Diamond Head. There were really only two downsides that I can think of. Even though we were on the 16th floor, noise somehow carried quite well, enough that we decided to use a white noise app on our iPhones. This included noise from the restaurant/bar on the 2nd floor, as well as just general street noise from buses & garbage trucks. The other issue was a lack of counter space in the bathroom for two people.I may not have looked close enough, but I was surprised we ended up with a mini fridge in the room that was not a mini bar. The balcony view from the ocean front room and the location made up for any other shortcomings.

Just in front of the zoo, it was an excellent and not that expensive alternative. You still can walk all over Waikiki attractions. The hotel was comfortable, bedding, shower, etc.Service really good. Valet parking available. We had a partial ocean view, from the balcony we got excellent pictures of the sunset and of our main view that was Diamond Head. Excellent!! We were very pleased with the location, service, and comfort.Totally recommend this hotel. If you want to hit the beach it is just in front of the street. There are plenty of alternatives to get a snack or a good meal around.The only downside, and it is not a hotel problem is that just around the corner there were some characters (people) that stayed all night out and one of the nights was a bit noisy.

I spent a night at the Park Shores and just like other reviewers say, the location is excellent, right across from the beach. That was great to be able to get to the ocean so quickly. There are also good dining and some shopping options nearby as well. As far as the hotel itself, I enjoyed the big, airy lobby. The hotel staff seemed very friendly. But when you go up to your room, you will probably notice that the hotel looks quite average. Our room was quite small -- there wasn't much to brag about there. What was kind of funny is that our room had a piece of furniture in that that the coffee pot stood on. I didn't notice until the next morning that the stand had a door on it that held a microwave and a small safe. Although our room was small, it was clean.

Excellent stay in the hotel. We loved the location (quiet), wonderful views, very helpful staff. The only negative would be that our reservation wasn't as we reserved, however they moved us to the appropriate room the next day. We just had to stay in a room without enough beds for one night.We would definitely book at the Park Shore again on our return to the island.

We loved the location of the Park Shore. As many people have written, it is on the quieter end of Waikiki Beach with a stunning view of Diamond Head. If you like to walk or jog the park is to the left and is extensive. The beach is across the street and minutes away. The front desk will provide you with beach towels/chairs. Request an upper level room for more quiet and maximum views—we were on the twelfth floor. We chose a partial-ocean view room and enjoyed sitting on the balcony and reading the complimentary newspaper. Rooms are clean and newly renovated and have a coffee maker, hair dryer, safe and free wi-fi. (Bring your own hair conditioner!) You don’t have to travel far to find fun: Lulu’s has great drinks and American food and is connected to the Park Shore on the second floor. There is an excellent Japanese restaurant in the lobby. Starbucks and ABC stores are on the corner. Trolley and buses stop in front. I liked the lobby and it’s nice to sit there and have a glass of complimentary juice, read the paper and watch people come and go. The pool area is clean and well kept. Valet parking is $25.00 a day. Very nice staff.

Our stay at this hotel was enjoyable. The pool view room we rented was both comfortable and clean. The hotel staff was friendly, informative and helpful. Best of all the hotel is located directly across from Waikiki beach and the Zoo. From the hotel we could clearly visualize the Diamond head landmark of Oahu and also the beautiful sunsets on the beach. Park shore is also within walking distance to major shops and eating restaurants which are mostly located at the other end of the waikiki strip. The parking rate is a bit pricey at 25 dollars per day but If you are not planning on going very far out in the island you may not need the added expense of a rental car. If you decide to rent a car be warn the traffic in Honolulu is considered the second worst in the United States so plan around the rush hour traffic and enjoy the adventure it is definately the best way to see most of the island. Shop around for car rentals prices before getting to the island since you can usually get lower car rental rates from local tour operators. My suggestion if staying at this hotel request a high floor, we stayed in the third floor pool view/oceanview which was great however, I am a light sleeper and I could hear the late and early morning noise coming from the street.
user_name:
Laura C
Miami, Florida, United States

review_body: Stayed here before and after a 7 day island cruise. The use of a courtesy room to freshen up and regroup before we left for our nite flight was great.Rooms were small but the price was reasonable. Everyone was very helpful.

Liked the hotel...the staff were very friendly and helpful... upgraded our room location. The location is good...and the end of the beach on the Diamond Head side. Easy walk to everything. Overall a good value. Use the shuttle service for transportation to the airport...it's half the price of cab service.

Spent 5 nights here on our vacation to Oahu. The location was perfect - close to all of the shopping and restaurants of Waikiki, but also at the "quieter" end of the beach. We had a view of the ocean as well as a view of Diamond Head, which is exactly what we wanted. Several buses stop right in front of the hotel, making it easy to get around. A couple if ABC stores are within a few footsteps of the front door, which is very convenient for getting a cheap cup of coffee early in the morning, basic sundries, snacks and souvenirs. The room was clean and comfortable. Highly recommended. We would stay here again.

The room I stayed in had a strong urine odor. As long as the balcony door was left open it wasn't noticeable but if it was closed for any amount of time the odor began to resurface. I wanted an 'ocean view' and there were no other options available so I just dealt with it. Thankfully the weather was cool so keeping the balcony door open 24/7 wasn't much of a problem. Although small, the room was otherwise clean. I enjoyed the balcony and view. I thought the location was great with good food options nearby and the beach is pretty close. The front desk staff and the concierge were above average. I might stay here again if I could stay in a different room.

My daughter and I stayed here for 5 nights. The staff were wonderful and very helpful. The location is convenient at the east end of the Waikiki beach strip across from the zoo. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Price was reasonable for Waikiki with no resort fee! Rooms are a little small, not a problem with just 2 guests, had I brought the whole family we would have needed more space than this room. City view did look out on hotel but we were not staying for the view as the beach is just across the road!

This was the best hotel we could have picked. We did a lot of searching and finally decided on this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and so glad we did. It was a clean and quite hotel not to big and the staff were excellent. We were upgraded to a suite with a view of the beach and Diamond Head from our balcony. It was very quiet and tucked out of the way enough so we did not have to be on the crowded part of the beach. The restaurant in the building LULU's was excellent food with good prices, we only ate breakfast there. There is an ABC store in the hotel and if you forget anything they have it there even travel size items such as sunscreen, shampoo, etc. including a large assortment of Liquor. No need to wonder where you can buy wine. Would definetly stay there again.

We were in Honolulu for a weekend stop-over before heading to Maui and Kona. We picked this hotel based on other reviews here, keeping in mind we didn't want to spend $400/night. The rooms are small, but ours had a great ocean view (worth a little extra money since the rear view isn't appealing). There is a decent pool on the 3rd floor, also with ocean views, and a full restaurant on the 2nd floor. The beach across the street is nice and is kept clean. The hotel sits on the far end of the "strip" meaning it's not in the full hustle-bustle of tourist town. It's close to the zoo and the aquarium, both worth a visit if you're traveling with kids. Staff was okay, as were the beds (neither gets a great review though). The v-shape of the hotel means that most ocean front rooms will not have "private" lanais. Overall good, but still pretty pricey for what you get.

My wife and I spent 3 nights here and very much enjoyed our stay. The location is outstanding, IMO, right next to the Honolulu Zoo, and within walking distance of all of the shops and restaurants in Waikiki. We had a partial ocean view on the 16th floor (1608), but the window next to the bed might as well have been ocean front, as well as the lanai. On top of that, if you walk around the side of the building once you step off the elevator, you get an amazing view of Diamond Head - perfect for photographers wanting to get a shot of the sunrise.The restaurant attached to the hotel, Lulu's, was one of the best features, as well. We found their food to be considerably better than most. The room was clean and upgraded, and except for the fact that I didn't care for their pillows, everything was terrific. Should we visit Oahu again, we're definitely returning.One thing to mention, which I found odd, was that they give you a better rate on the room if you call them over the phone rather than booking online.

I stayed at the park shore waikiki fOr two nights and it was wonderful. Rooms were very nice and clean. I had a fantastic view of diamond head and the ocean. The beach is right across the street and so many great restaurants nearby. The staff were very nice also.I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.
user_name:
Bello2luv
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at Park Shore two nights . We booked an ocean view room, but were upgraded to an ocean front room. Our room had a great view and we enjoyed sitting on the lanai. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We had a problem with the lock on our door and called the desk for assistance . A maintenance worker appeared in under 5 minutes, amazing!The location of the Park Shore is the best! We loved being at the quiet end of Waikiki to enjoy a less crowded beach. The hotel is still within walking distance of nice restaurants and shops . A win- win situation.

This is the third hotel we have stayed at in Waikiki and found it really good. The location is brilliant, 2 min to the beach and 6-7 min to the heart of Kalakaua Avenue. The room is of normal size of a hotel room, from our balcony we had an excellent view of Diamond Head as well as the ocean and the beautiful park in front of Honolulu zoo.The reception staff helpful, friendly and always with a smile.
