The bed very comfortable, very clean and the bathroom looked brand new. We found the location to be quieter than where we had stayed previously, and the daily trip to the beach was very easy. 2 minutes and we were on the beach. This part of Waikiki beach is a little less crowded and if one does want to go to the really busy part of Waikiki beach it's a 5 min walk.We stayed at the Park Shore for 7 nights and no complaints at all. There are homeless people on the streets in Waikiki regardless of where you stay and this did not make our stay any less enjoyable.

We chose this hotel to unwind after cruising the Hawaiian islands and found it be a decent value for the money. The room we were given was boxy and faced other hotel rooms with no view of the beach or the area. It was recently renovated and had a 42" LCD TV. The king bed was comfortable and the room clean. We were disappointed that ice machines were located 2 floors away. The free wifi is completely open and should not be used for secure transactions. The "internet stations" in the lobby where one would go to get your boarding passes printed were NOT free. When I went to the desk to complain, they offered to print them for me. This hotel is located at the end of the shopping district across from the Honolulu Zoo. The beach across the street is clean but busy. There were an inordinate number of homeless people on the sidewalks near the hotel and while they weren't threatening, their appearance certainly detracted from the neighborhood.

pound for pound...dollar for dollar...a great place to stay. Staff is very engaging and smiling with eye contact between them and the guest. Renovations are nice as well. I have stayed here before...and will continue to.

My daughter and I just returned from Honolulu and doing college visits, where we stayed at the Park Shore. We got a decent discount on the room (the "shaka" deal) and liked the location near Diamond Head. We were very pleased with our stay! The room was a little "plain" looking, i.e., we certainly didn't end up with any of the promo rooms shown on the website, but we were on the 3rd floor overlooking the pool and facing the water. The room was comfortable and extremely clean; the housekeeping service, although often quite late in the day, was very satisfactory and they did a good job of keeping our room stocked and made up. The lobby area was pleasant and the desk staff was friendly and helpful. I loved the location - that end of the strip of hotels is much "quieter" and more relaxed, and I loved coming out of my room in the morning (our room opened to an outside balcony, as I think most if not all of the rooms do) to the sound of the siamangs in the Honolulu Zoo across the street! The pool area was nice and clean and seemed to have ample chairs and tables. A few "not great" things - the air conditioner was very loud, necessitating my wearing ear plugs at night (you couldn't turn it off at night because the room got stuffy). The "business" (i.e., computer) area was quite small, and I was a little put off that it would have cost me $$ to use the computers and $.70 per page to print our boarding passes, tourist directions, etc. Also, and I realize this isn't the hotel's fault, there are a LOT of apparently homeless people that hang out on the streets around the hotel. We arrived in Honolulu at 2:30 am and my daughter was hungry. The closest open restaurant was a McDonald's a few blocks away, and I was more than a little nervous walking by people sleeping on the sidewalk, sitting on the benches talking to themselves, etc. I think Honolulu needs to do a better job of caring for these people. All in all, though, we had a marvelous stay at the Park Shore Waikiki and would not hesitate to stay there again!

This is my second stay at this hotel,the hotel is newly renovated and super clean!It is right across from the beach and when you are at the pool you can see the ocean or Diamond head.Everything is close by,the staff are fantastic,valet service great,a very safe place to stay.I recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay there again!Lorie Ross Prince Albert,SKCanada

Staff go above and beyond just to make our holiday great for us, we go to hawaii because it is paradise, we return to Park Shore for the comfortable hotel and wonderful staff !Love the location, right across from the beach, pool is nice. Since the renovations have been completed the hotel is updated, so nice.Oncce again we had a wonderful holiday, looking forward to the next!Many thanks!

I just got home from staying at the Park Shore, Waikiki, and it was a great stay. The hotel is directly across from the beach and if you get a room on one of the higher floors and ask for a view you can see the lush green Diamond Head, along with a beautiful park and zoo, which is directly across the other street from Park Shore, and overlooks the sandal shaped pool. It was beautiful!There is one downside to staying on the scenic side and that is the traffic noise. It would have been fine but public transportation had a high pitched beep that bothered me the first night or so but I got used to it quite quickly.The Park Shore is located near wonderful shops, restaurants, shops and well, shops!Obviously, I really enjoyed my stay at the Park Shore and I will stay there every time I go back.

Park Shore is at the very end of the strip, on the Diamond Head end. That makes their prices a little lower. You can still walk to most places you want to, it’s Hawaii, take your time and enjoy all the sights. The rooms were nice and comfortable. We walked out our room to the most beautiful view of Diamond Head every morning and sat on our lanai and looked at the ocean every evening, WONDERFUL!!! It has 2 ABC stores, a Starbucks and Lulu’s on the 2nd floor. They also keep a refreshing water pitcher and a punch pitcher in the lobby. Get you some of that punch and some island rum from the ABC store and make your own mai tais. YUMMY!!! They have a small refrigerator in each room and daily papers are available on every floor. They have a safe, hair dryer, free wi-fi in the rooms also. Our floor was on the 8th but they had 18 floors. Wish we had had a room on a higher floor to take advantage of the view even more. All the tour busses pick up right around the corner along with the Hilo Hattie trolley. The beach out front is protected by a beach wall but if you prefer the waves they are just a little further down. Yes, there was lots of homeless in this area, but I found this to be the case in most of Honolulu. They did not bother anyone or ask for anything and I never felt threatened. There may of seemed like more on this end because the middle of the strip is so crowded there is no place for them on the sidewalk. My husband came down sick and we needed a late checkout so he could rest till we had to leave the airport they arranged for this even though they had someone coming into our room that day and even waived the fee. I can’t thank them enough for this. I would recommend this place to anyone. With that being said I don’t recommend asking the concierge Averi anything. We asked her the best way to get to Chinatown and she was too busy visiting with the porters to answer other than get a bus or rent a car. I stopped on the afternoon we were to leave and asked how did I call for a porter to come get my luggage and she couldn’t tell me, really? There was a gentleman concierge and he was very helpful and nice the day my hubby came down sick and I wanted to go to the swap meet by myself. He arranged for me to catch a shuttle. If you do need information go over to the Expedia desk and talk to Stephanie Shirley. She will help you with anything, whether it is help figuring out what buses to take, arranging a tour, or helping you in any way. One time there was a couple from the hotel next door. They said their concierge was so rude at their hotel they just walked off from him and came over there. They were real impressed with how helpful Stephanie was also.

Slow check-in. Ice available 3 floors away. Microwave available 9 floors away.Promised 2 rooms adjoining or next to each other; got 2 rooms on same floor but opposite directions from elevator in different towers. (One room was an adjoining room - to strangers.) Paid additional fee to get oceanfront, but got partial ocean view.There was NO vanity in the bathroom - just a pedestal sink.

Away from the mess of people on Waikiki. It is right on a bus stop and a very short walk to the beach. A Starbuck's, two ABC stores, and a neat takeout eatery are right there. Great view of everything from a suite.

I traveled to Honolulu solo for a much-needed recharge & relax vacation. Booked at the Park Shore Waikiki based on other great Trip Advisor reviews & good price compared to other top rated Waikiki hotels, and I was not disappointed.If you're looking for top-notch luxury and romance and/or five-star quality...this is not the place for you. I was looking for a reasonable price, good location, and a safe/decent place to call "home" for a few days knowing I'd be spending plenty of time at the beach and outside. This hotel delivered on all of those fronts, and on even more that I wasn't expecting.The good: -Service: Nick at the front desk and Mike in the lobby were the first two staff members I encountered upon arrival, and both were very friendly and helpful. I arrived on a late flight, and they got me checked in quickly, explained all of the amenities I might need (pool, dining, wifi, etc.). Them along with a few other staff members I dealt with during my time there were all great...very friendly, nice, etc. They all went above and beyond and it was noticeable. -Unexpected amenities: beach towels...you can just check them out and return them at the front desk which means 1) you don't have to pack your own and 2) you don't have to buy any while there. I literally used them every day and loved this service. Hospitality room: I deliberately booked a late flight out on my last day so that I could have the last day to spend at the beach, etc. What I didn't think so much about was how I was going to get cleaned up after that (since I'd have checked out by then). The answer came from Nick at the front desk (again) as I was checking out: "did anyone tell you about our hospitality room." I responded with: "hospitality room??" It's basically a room there at the hotel that guests can use to shower, get cleaned up, change, etc. even after you've checked out. Aka...awesome! So, I was able to spend pretty much my whole last day at the beach & swimming in the ocean, and then was able to come back, shower, change clothes, and freshen up before going to dinner, or waiting for my shuttle to the airport, etc. I would already have stayed at this property again, but that one amenity was a game-changer...it allowed me to have an awesome and comfortable last day on the island, which was the perfect end to an already great stay.-Location: perfect. Literally across the street from Waikiki beach. The property is on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki right across from the Honolulu Zoo. Easy to walk to most everywhere - took abut 10-15 minutes to get from the hotel to the Royal Hawaiian shopping area, etc. Lot of other places were an even shorter walk. I only rented a car one day to be able to drive around the island and up to the North Shore...you don't need one at all if you're planning on staying right there in Waikiki area. There's a 24 Hour Fitness center less than 5 minutes away on foot. I even walked to the Diamond Head Trail from the hotel...though, I will warn you that was a very lengthy walk and not at all hard, but something to plan for. It was about 2 miles to the trail itself, and the trail is a moderately strenuous mile...so, about 6 miles total round trip. Good workout, though!The Average:-Room: was nothing amazing, but it was comfortable and worked for my purposes while visiting. Small, but functional with a small lanai, mini fridge (a major plus), comfortable bed, 42" flat screen tv, etc. Free wifi that worked really well, good air conditioning, etc. Overall, decent room at a great price. Only thing I would change is I booked a room with a city/partial Diamond Head view. Would have been worth the $20 or so per night to upgrade to a partial ocean view room and I would do so next time. Not the end of the world, though. -Pool: was pretty small and nothing to write home about...I personally never used it. That said, though, the beach is literally 100 yards from the lobby and the walled area (makes for very easy swimming/wading, etc.) is right there...so really convenient. The Bad:-That I only had 5 nights here! I could easily have stayed another week and been happy :) Overall, great experience at the Park Shore Waikiki (even better than I'd expected), and I will definitely return when I make it back to Honolulu next time.

We had an excellent time during our stay at the Park Shore,and the hotel was the best part.The location is amazing,and the Staff is great.Our room was a oceanfront/diamondhead view on the 16th floor(I could see the flamingos and the elephants at the zoo from our lanai).Add the beach across the street and you have all you need!Probably the best value on the beach.I

This is a great hotel, not a resort, just what I needed. They have a nice pool area and services like beach towels, morning coffee and daytime flavored water, as well as a travel desk and restaurants and an ABC store accessible from the hotel. What more do you need? Why pay a resort fee for services you won't use? My room was on the 9th floor and I had a beautiful oceanfront 2-room suite with a great view and comfy lanais to sit on. Perfect location as you are just across the street from a very nice beach area and no hulking high-rises to block your views of the city, beaches or Diamond Head. Very nice ladies that take care of your room too. Thanks to manager Scott Pauli for arranging a late check-out rate so that I could stay in MY room on the last day before starting a very long trip home. Room wise: good hot water, good water pressure, nice sized little refrigerator to store snacks and drinks, large flat screen TV with good selection of channels (really enjoyed the local channels with Islands info and replays of the Volcom surfing finals), good bed for a bad back, room key worked on 1st or 2nd try (never had to rekey) and 2 ABC stores close by (one accessible from the lobby) for all necessities. Really liked the Japanese restaurant as I had the best Bento box lunch I've ever had. Lulu's is good for breakfast, didn't try it for other meals but smelled good.

I picked this hotel because of trip advisor reviews so I felt I should contribute one. The great things about this hotel are: 1) The views from the rooms. We had a partial ocean view the first night then an oceanfront room the remaining four nights. If you can spring for an oceanfront room, do. Though the views from each room were beautiful (of both Diamond Head and the beach), the oceanfront room's view was exceptional AND the room was considerably bigger. The first room we stayed in was small enough for me to feel a little claustrophobic, though we didn't spend much time there. 2) The staff was amazing. A special thank you to Jara and Honore for helping us so much with getting a great room and for being so polite, personable and fun. Also, one of the managers (I think), David, was awesome, too. 3) Park Shore is definitely an excellent value. Way less money than other hotels on the strip. The not so good things: 1) The hotel is decidedly not a luxury hotel (though it does not claim to be). I like a little pampering on a vacation and my boyfriend's only requirement is a room with a roof. Park Shore was a good compromise for the both of us. Just little things here and there were kind-of bummers, like the fact that I had to travel down three floors to get ice, etc. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again and I would book an oceanfront room on a high floor.

I stayed for 16 nights at Park Shore and I traveled alone. From the moment I walked in I felt like I was home. My check in was late yet I was given a temp room so I could shower and freshen up as my flight was early. Right from the start I was happy.The staff knew my name and were so helpful. I loved the towel service also, it was nice being able to grab warm quality towels from reception.The internet and cable were fast and had lots of channels. I actually was sick for 4 days over there and the comfortable room made my time easy, fresh and bearable.Jessica on the front desk was just gorgeous, she was helpful, responsive and always checked in on me as I passed through the foyer.I recommend Park Shore to all people. Mahalo!

We stayed 7 nights at Park Shore. Great location right across the street from the beach and next door to the Honolulu Zoo. Great views of Diamond Head. Rooms were clean and comfy, staff was excellent and friendly. We would absolutely stay there again!

Just got back from a trip to Oahu. We spent most of the nine days at my BIL's, but we did spend one night in Waikiki at Park Shore.The hotel was convenient, clean, and close to everywhere. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The view of the beach and Diamond Head was spectacular! The bed was much firmer than I would have liked, and the pillows were thin. I probably could have asked for more pillows, but we only stayed one night so no biggie.Would probably stay again if we went back.
user_name:
Jeffrey S
Santa Fe, New Mexico

review_body: The Park Shore Waikiki is highly recommended. Our ocean-front room met all our needs and had a wonderful view. The room was spacious, tastefully decorated, extremely clean and quiet. The staff were extremely attentive and efficient, from the front desk to the parking attendants. Mahalo, Jessica at the front desk for your professional care and friendly smile!

We stayed one night in this hotel before taking a cruise. The location is great right on the beach. The pool is really nice but a little cool. Our room was ok. A little small and dated but clean. Lobby and main areas were updated. I think there are rooms that have been updated that cost a little more. Restaurant has a great breakfast.

Stayed for one week in January for vacation with my mom. We had booked a two double bed room with city view, and we got one on the 8th floor. View is limited by the neighbor hotel, but if you lean out a little bit from the balcony, you can actually see the ocean and beach as well.Reasonably priced as well, and the location is absolutely amazing. Just a few steps, literally, from Waikiki Beach and the Pacific Ocean.Pool is on the 3rd floor, can get a little bit noisy from the traffic nearby, but didn't bother me too much.The rooms are newly renovated and where very clean. No complaints there. The only thing is that I felt the room was a little small, with limited space to put bags and suitcases. There are no chairs in the room, you have to sit on the bed to watch TV. But hey, you don't spend too much time in the room while on vacation in Hawaii?!?? ;)Tip: Wednesdays they have Managers reception, with drinks and snacks in the pool area. Very nice to meet the general manager and have a little chat with him about the hotel and our vacation. Genuine guy who really took pride in the newly renovated rooms!We were very pleased with our stay, and would definitely come back next time we're in Honolulu.

Other reviewers have said it all. This place is the best! We had an oceanfront, corner room, that not only overlooked the beach, but Diamond Head to our left. Just breathtaking at sunset. The staff is EXTREMELY friendly and accommodating, and the location perfect with everything you need within steps or minutes. A BIG thank-you to the front desk manager, David. We appreciate everything you did for us!

Excellent location far from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu/Waikiki but in a good way. Staff was excellent and friendly and on par with far more expensive hotels. The value is great and it worth paying a bit more for a suite (Diamond Head view) since they come with microwave, fridge, toaster, plates, etc... and can ease the pain of eating out all the time.Room, pool and lobby were spotless. I would not hesitate to go back.

This hotel is convenient to the beach and has lots of amenities around it.The "City View" hotels are not "city view" however, but rather you have a view of the hotel across the back lane, or in our case, being on the fourth floor, the parking structure of that hotel plus a large metal shed.We had requested a king bed room and none was available the first night. We were told one would be available the next night on a higher floor. After moving our things into storage for the day, we got the king bed room, but on the same floor. We had booked this hotel as part of a package and I believe that the less desirable rooms are allocated to those packages and the better rooms reserved for independent travellers.Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.This is a budget hotel, so you basically get what you pay for.

Wonderful time. Everyone was so friendly and helpful! The housekeeper was so sweet! We had an awesome time! Loved the shower! The bed was so comfy! Everything was great! Thank you for such a great experience!

This is a great hotel for all of the above reasons! It's a great location and our room was clean and comfortable and we had a great view (for being a "partial view"!) I will definately return to Park Shore Hotel! The staff was most helpful and courteous! Looking forward to my next visit! Aloha and mahalo!

This hotel is located at the end of the Waikiki strip. It's close to everything. The only downfall is there are not many healthy eating options nearby. We were there for 9 days. Tucker and bevy next door is nice but expensive for the amount of food. Lulu's has a great breakfast but it's a very large portion. Maybe order to go and split at the beach! You know this hotel is in the right spot when the locals have their crossfit meetings on the beach out front. The staff is very nice and will even help print the bus routes! Definitely take the bus while moving around honolulu. The locals are hilarious and it's so cheap. Definitely, rent a car and drive to North Shore as it's so beautiful on Sunset Beach and Pipeline (Ekahi Beach). Taking the bus to Kailua (eastern side of the island) will take 1 hour but it's our favorite beach. Have a lava flow, enjoy hula music/dancers at Tiki's on Thursday night (next to the hotel). Split a hamburger and garlic fries at Teddy's burgers next door and you can bring your own beer/wine. It even says it on the menu board. I wish we had brought a car phone charger while driving around the island as we needed navigation and the ability to take photos. Have a great time! Definitely stay at this hotel!

Stayed 6 nights on the 15th floor with a partial beach view. loved the room nice balcony with table and chairs where we sat and had morning coffee. Staff were very friendly and helpful, gave me extra coffee sachets when requested and always replaced the toiletries every day. Beach towels were great and you only had to cross the road and you were there. Had dinner at Lu Lu's very nice food good value and had a great band playing on a friday night. A couple of ABC shops downstairs so easy to stock the fridge. Didnt use the pool but booked a couple of trips with the tour desk, Stephanie was very helpful.

We enter into a clean nicely appointed lobby. The staff is friendly and professional and we are greeted with a friendly "Aloha" and handed cool wet washcloths which we greatly appreciated. Check-in went without any problems. The bell service is very good. The valet service greeted us and let us know they are there if we should need them which of course we used, they are great! We also used the services Expedia Local Expert for a few of our activities which were awesome! It's best if you book activities ahead of your arrival because some activities are on specific days and or times! Our room is clean and has a stunning view of Diamond Head and the beach! The king-size bed is very comfortable, we slept great! The night tables had a drawer and a shelf.There is a flat-screen TV over a desk with two drawers and a small shelf and a chair. There is a refrigerator in a cabinet with a coffee pot and ice bucket, coffee cups and drinking glasses on the counter top. The down side is inadequate storage space for two for a seven day stay, The closet didn't fit our one large suitcase so it was next to the slider door and there wasn't enough drawer space for both my husband and I, and I didn't really take notice until our last evening that the tile floor had never been mopped as there were dirt smudges from the previous days in the entry and tissue that I had noticed that morning under the counter in the bathroom was still there when we returned from our final day's excursions. The night table lights were seriously over-bright so I couldn't read because it disturbed my husband. I thought the room size itself was good but my husband felt claustrophobic. He is disabled and rented a scooter while we were there. He was going to use the valet storage downstairs but the only way to recharge the battery was to leave it out in the lobby. My husband didn't want the staff to be responsible for watching it while it charged and chose instead to take the scooter up to our room. So it made the room feel very crowded for him. There was one night where the odor of Lulu's grill became overwhelming and when I thought I might call and ask about it the smell subsided. We had a great time while in Hawaii and we'll be staying again at the Park Shore next time we come to Waikiki.

This was my second stay at the Park Shore Waikiki. I go to Oahu for business a few times per year and will now always stay at this hotel. Staff is very friendly, beach is right across the street, getting to the highway is very easy, and the view of a Diamond Head is incredible. Would recommend this hotel to everyone. You are away from the congestion of the tourists, but are close to the shops and restaurants to enjoy all Waikiki has to offer.

this was our 4th year coming back to the Park Shore . We had a fabulous of Diamond Head and the Ocean. We were on the 16th floor. We try to stay between the 14th and 18th floors for the view and privacy. The staff are always very cheerful and polite. We are looking forward to our return next January!!

This hotel is literally across the street from Waikiki Beach. Diamond Head is in the distance, upscale shopping and restaurants 2 or 3 blocks the other direction. Rooms were clean, well appointed, and include a small fridge. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Valet parking is your only option, double beds instead of queen beds, and the view of the alley and dumpsters was not very appealing. We did the package that included a crappy rental car - should have made our own rental car arrangements.

We recently stayed at the Park Shore for two nights prior to a cruise and one night after. There are fancier hotels along Waikiki but we were delighted with our choice. The rooms were large and comfortable (our's opened into the pool deck which we liked), the location ideal (across from the beach at the "quiet end"of Waikiki and across from the zoo with its beautiful grounds, but the friendly and helpful staff really made our stay memorable. Be sure to have dinner at the Tiki Grill and Bar right around the corner.

This hotel is a great value for its location and quality. Not only is it right across the street from the beach but it is the last hotel on the Waikiki beach strip so your views of the ocean, the zoo and Diamond Head are fully unobstructed. It has a nice (albeit generic) American style restaurant attached to it, however the hidden gem here is the Japanese restaurant in the lobby of the hotel. We ate here twice on our trip and it was incredible.The biggest drawbacks (and the reason the hotel is not getting a 5 star rating) are the size and comfort of the rooms and the quality of the amenities. The bed was extremely hard and super uncomfortable for me, though my husband quite enjoyed the firmness of the bed. Also, the pillows were uncomfortable and the sheets were thin and lower quality. The bathroom amenities were on the cheap side and the hotel is definitely no frills - no jacuzzi, no gym, no room service...just a pool and a vending machine area with a microwave.Despite the drawbacks, I would still recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Waikiki who wants a compromise between a good value and a great location. We looked at a lot of hotels online before deciding on the Park Shore and we were not disappointed.

Our vacation was perfect, thanks in part to the great staff and the ideal location of the Park Shore. We were able to get a complimentary upgrade, so we had an incredible view of Diamond Head and the beach. The hotel is a one or two minute walk to the beach and the Honolulu Zoo, and another few minutes to the aquarium. We were there for a week, and had plenty to do and see within walking distance. The hotel is well maintained, and the room (with two of us) did not feel crowded. The balcony was well used for enjoying the Hawaiian breeze and view, and as there isn't another hotel on the side we stayed on, we overlooked the zoo, and plenty of trees and green space. Great value for the price...free wifi, free daily paper...no downside for us.

Our stay was wonderful! On the 12th floor,[Ocean View room] with great views of ocean, beautiful park and the Diamond Head mountain.Great location!!!! We had king size bed which was sooo comfy!!Beach just across the road and restaurant down stairs was handy and food goodStaff was 10/10

Park Shore is on the quiet, beautiful side of Waikiki. Recently updated with big, comfy beds, big flat screen TVs, mini bars, and coffeemakers. Microwave on 3rd floor by pool. Some rooms have microwaves. Look over the room choices. They are not all the same size or view. Fantastic views of the ocean across the street. Last and certainly not least is the staff. Super friendly and helpful. If Jara can't get it for you, it can't be done. Wonderful trip because of Park Shore!

Spend the last night of our trip in the Park Shore. Excellent location at the end of Waikiki Beach (good access to the beach, a lot of restaurants nearby, not too noisy). Room was "partial ocean view". View was good. Room was a little bit small. Facilities ok, but nothing outstanding. Staff was - compared to other hotels in Hawaii - a bit cold. Not the "Aloha"-feeling. Service was efficient. Overall good value for money.

Located at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki beach, this hotel was fantastic. Friendly staff, room clean and just across the beach. The hotel restaurant had great food at a great price with a great atmosphere overlooking the beach. Highly recommend.

This is beachfront, and we got great value. The room is smaller than some other hotels, but nicely decorated. Each room has a small balcony. We enjoyed our stay there and would like to stay again. There are safes in the rooms, and there are pool towels from reception which you can take to the beach or use at the pool. The sheets are a little coarser/ more worn than expected, but still ok.

Been coming to PS for years - because of location, however this stay 12/30 to 1/9 was excellent - right from the start with the front desk, to the housekeeping and the little details - late checkout, extra towels, and many other simple requests. Thank you Jessica (FD) and Nelda (HK). And the hotel has been totally renovated! What a great Hawaiian experience!

From the minute you walk in, you will find a staff that is ready to make your stay a good one. Leny at the front desk was very friendly and helpful and had a great smile. All members of the staff were excellent to work with, friendly and professional. Our room, though smallish was excellent, clean and quiet and comfortable. The Park Shore location at the end of the "strip" was perfect for beach views, and Diamond Head views, since no other hotels blocked the view. There are shops, and food just out the lobby doors, and the beach is just steps away. We spent most of a week there and will stay there again on our next trip. We recommend this hotel.

We stayed at this hotel 5 nights as our first visit to Honolulu, room was ocean view.Wonderful location just a few steps to the beach, room has good views of ocean, convenient to shopping, food,etc.Room is very clean and kept well. Facilities very functional. Staff very helpful and nice.Very pleasant stay. Would recommend to all.

The Hotel Staff made us feel welcome from check in to check out. They were wonderful. Room was clean. the hotel is in a good location for beach, shopping and dining. It was relaxing to sit in the lobby and watch all the activity. Nice place to stay for the price.

The value for your money is EXCELLENT here. Crystal at the front desk was incredibly helpful and went out of her way to get my husband and I a room on a high floor. All the staff was courteous, prompt, and kind. I really loved the location of this hotel at the end of Waikiki near the park, the zoo, Diamond Head, Hanauma Bay, Hauna Blowhole and Hauna Cove Beach. Lulus, Starbucks, and 2 ABC stores are connected to the hotel! Free coffee every morning in the lobby, towels and beach chairs readily available, delicious juices every afternoon. We'd never want to stay anywhere else. Seriously, look no further for an excellent place to stay.

We stayed at the Park Shore over New Year's, for a week. We travel a lot, and stay in many high-end and low-end hotels. We really enjoyed Park Shore and would highly recommend it. The location on the south end of the beach is great, with excellent beach access that's not crowded. Our view of Diamond Head was stunning. Staff was very attentive to our every need, with special kudos to Jessica who got a great room for us, and helped us out through the week. Top floors are best, looking either south or west. The hotel is recently renovated, so its fresh. Not high-end, but great middle-range value. Starbucks downstairs is very convenient. Make sure to grab some beach chairs and towels from the front desk and head across the street to the beach. No fitness centre; the pool was good; but the ocean for a morning swim is the best! We will definitely come back again.

I stayed at the Park Shore with my family over the New Year after a week on Kauai (and could watch the fireworks right in front of us from our nice sized balcony). The hotel is neither grand nor overly luxurious but straight forward, conveniently located and pleasant with efficient and friendly staff. On two mornings we had breakfast in the Japanese restaurant which I can recommend.

We really enjoyed staying at the Park Shore for our first visit to Honolulu. The location was great--we were able to walk throughout Waikiki with ease, and yet the location on the edge of Waikiki was nice to be a little less crowded. We could walk to the protected, calm-water beach within two minutes--it is directly across the street. Beach towels are provided by the hotel. So is free wireless internet access. There are many, many restaurants and stores within walking distance.We had a Diamond Head suite on the 15th floor, and had a great view of Diamond Head and of the ocean. The lanais are separated by concrete walls, allowing them to feel very private. The only complaints I had about the room were tiny details relating to the bathroom--no conditioner was provided and the shower head is mounted kind of low on the wall.What stood out for us most about this hotel was its staff. We received excellent service! The front desk staff were always extremely helpful and friendly. Additionally, the valet parking staff were friendly, welcoming, and always very quick in retrieving our vehicle.We had a great experience at Park Shore and would definitely stay here on a future trip to Oahu!

My wife and I were married at Waimanalo Bay and Honeymooned with the Park Shore. Weddings of Hawaii (search wedhawaii on google) helped us plan the wedding. We chose the Maile Package and bought additional (traditional) leis from Linda B Flowers (search lina b flowers on google) in Honolulu. We could not have been more pleased with Weddings of Hawaii, Linda B Flowers, and the Park Shore Waikiki! The Park Shore was clean, comfortable, and the employees were world class. The hotel is across from the ocean and beside Diamond Head. We originally booked a standard (no view room) and I upgraded to the ocean view room to surprise the misses. Our upgraded room had a view of Diamond Head and the ocean and was worth every dime! The view from the lanai was breath taking. The hotel is within walking distance to everything; the ocean, restaurants, park, and zoo. The attached photos are all of the view from the lanai. I did not think to take photos of the room but they are as they appear in the hotel (professional) photos. We will be back and we will stay with the Park Shore!

Location is great and definitely the high point. We were generally happy with the hotel on our recent three night stay. The only negative is the noise from the closing of other hotel room's doors. As there always seemed to be guests departing first thing in the morning the doors begin to slam at 6am. If you are a light sleeper you will also hear the garbage trucks at that time and will likely then be up for the day. Also a warning on breakfast at Lulu's. It still feels like a bar in the morning. Suggest Wolfgang Puck Express next door at Aston where you can sit outside. Makes for a more peaceful morning.On positives,: Our group had a diamond head suite and a one-bedroom suite. These were great rooms.Also dinner at Japanese restaurant was great.

This was a great hotel for our first stay in Waikiki. From the time we checked in to the time we got on the shuttle to the airport, we were treated well by the friendly and helpful staff. We would definitely stay here again.The location was fabulous. Right across from the beach and the park with the zoo. Great views of the water, the city and Diamond Head. We were there days before Christmas and Waikiki was overrun with people but I do think that the hotel is on the quieter end of the famous beach. The hotel lobby is big and airy and there is a little area they’ve designated as the business center with a couple of computers but there is also free wifi throughout. The nice thing about the business center, though, was there was always ice water with citrus and juice available and there was coffee in the mornings. The pool is open during daylight hours only and has a great view of the beach and Diamond Head. In a room just off the pool, there’s a couple of vending machines and a microwave guests can use. The pool is small but refreshing if you don’t want to be on the beach but you still want to enjoy the sun and some water. The hotel is well maintained, I know it was just renovated but still, and staff seems to take pride in it. We were on an elevator with one of the maintenance guys and he asked how our stay was and seemed genuinely proud when we told him we were enjoying it. He thanked us and said they all work hard to make the place as comfortable as possible.As has already been mentioned in other reviews, there are two restaurants (we did take-out from Lulu’s one night and ate in our room. It was very good food), two ABC Stores and a Starbucks more or less attached to the hotel. There is also a store with sandwiches, smoothies and other “picnic” type things called Tucker and Bevvy and a great hamburger place called Teddy’s Bigger Burgers (one building over, next to the second ABC Stores). If you’re new to Hawaii and you don’t know about ABC Stores, they’re ubiquitous in Waikiki! Really! More so than Starbucks on the mainland. Basically they’re a convenience store that sells snacks, drinks, sweets and a few drugstore items like band-aids and sunscreen but also has clothing and beach stuff like mats and floating devices. The prices are quite reasonable as well. Oh and did I mention... they are EVERYWHERE. We checked in quite early because we were just off a cruise so our room wasn’t ready. Annie was checking us in and was very helpful. She saw to it that our luggage was safely stored and asked if we’d like to use the hospitality suite while we waited. We decided to look around Waikiki for a little bit so we declined. A little later we came back to see if our room was ready and when it wasn’t Crystal, who was at the front desk, offered the Hospitality suite again. She saw that we were wilting under the hot Waikiki sun and as she sent us up to the room, she also gave us some cold, jasmine-scented face clothes to cool us off. Crystal was around the other days we stayed at the hotel and was always cheerful and very helpful. She and Annie really helped set the tone for our stay. Our room was ready a little early and we were able to get into it around 2:30 or 3pm. The room is not big but it was perfectly adequate for the two of us. The bathroom was a good size and the shower had very good water pressure. The balcony was very small but it had a nice view of the water to one side and the hotel next door and the city on the other side. There was a very good sized safe in the room that easily fit my Macbook and cameras and other valuables. There was also a mini fridge to keep cold drinks and snacks. The bed was very comfortable and the large flat-screen tv was on a wall mount to allow for a little more space in the room. We were on the 16th floor and we didn’t find it particularly noisy but I can imagine it might be on lower floors. We have only two complaints about the Park Shore and they have to do with the room. They are minor but annoying nonetheless. First issue; there isn’t much place to hang things. Once you have a couple of towels, you’re hard pressed to find a place to hang your wet bathing suits and anything else. The second issue was a little more annoying and that is the room key cards don’t work very well. I know this is a wide spread issue, others have mentioned it here and we heard other guests complaining in the hotel as well. It took us four or five tries sometimes to get into our room. It didn’t detract from our stay but it might be something management should look into.Just a few final thoughts… you can sign out beach towels from the front desk and return them by 8pm. We usually signed out a couple of towels in the morning and then swapped them out for fresh ones in the afternoon. The hospitality suite is fantastic, especially when you have a late night flight and nowhere else to go for several hours. Probably shouldn’t say this since there’s only one room and I wouldn’t want to have to share it the next time we go back. There’s a shower and tv and it opens on to the pool and you can get a towel if you want to go to the beach.Thank you very much, Park Shore, for helping to make our first stay in Waikiki so wonderful. We’ll be back.

Great hotel! Staff all super friendly, bright clean facility, fresh juice and coffee daily in lobby, bar fridge in room, microwave in pool area, free wifi, amazing views of waikiki beach and great pool! Can't ask for much more than this!

We stayed at the Park Shore for 9 nights and spent Xmas in Honolulu. The hotel is fantastic close to everything but at the quieter end of Waikiki. Stayed with Husband and 20 yr old daughter and her best friend. Stayed in a Ocean Front 1 Bedroom Suite , perfect for us girls had lounge room with sofa bed and we had separate bedroom, Had 2 large screen tvs and Kitchen area with fridge and microwave and blender and crockery and 2 balcony's.Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Will be staying here again on my daughters and my return trip in July.

We traveled to Hawaii in oct 2012 we stopped off in San Francisco to two nights on the way over. When we arrived in Honolulu it was incredible !! We arrived at the park shore to be greeted lovely we upgraded our room for free on the front desk and was given a much bigger room the partially over looked the sea but did have a great view! We were very worried and nervous about the hotel as we found out that there was lots of building work going on! Luckily this didn't effect us! The work men were working from the 15th floor upwards so occasionally we saw one of them but nothing was effected! Thank goodness!!! :) .........we done so much on our trip we visited pearl harbour which was amazing we went to the wet and wild water park that was great it was very quiet as it was not in peak season so there was no queues! I expect in the summer it would get very busy! We also hired a car and drove up to the north shore which was absolutely incredible! Words cannot describe it! It was also so quiet we were sat on the beach with only about 3 other people around us and no one was in the distance! We ended driving around the whole island which was a great experience!!! .......shopping!! ....the shopping is amazing!!! Make sure you have lots of money with you! There are lots of shops along the strip but there is also a shopping mall near by it will be in leaflets but unfortunately I cannot remember the name of it sorry! ...but you can catch the bus there and back and it will drop you outside the hotel which is good! .....food......food is lovely as you know it's a lot of burgers, chips, ribs and greasy food! But I did have the occasionally salad at a restaurant called chillis! I also recommend the Outback Steakhouse (the best steak you will ever taste!!!) I regret not writing this review sooner as I cannot remember half of what I wanted to tell you all!! .....but on the whole our trip to Hawaii was out of this world and would defenetly recommend!!! The park shore was also brilliant and has now been fully refurbished and looks great I would love to return back as the hotel was located at the end of the strip so you are away from all the busyness ....amazing hotel and people and WILL return again one day!!! :)

What a great experience we're having at the Park Shore Hotel in Honolulu. Everyone at the front desk has been so kind and helpful. Close to bus stops and major attractions. Close to restaurants and shopping. Would we stay here again? In a heartbeat. What a way for my wife and I to celebrate my 60th birthday! The staff even remembered my special day. Mahalo! We'll be back!

All of the positive reviews here are indeed accurate so I will not rehash them. I take lots of time researching the best place for me to stay. I was hesitant to believe all of these reviews at first but after 10 days here I can assure you the positive reviews are quite true. Anything negative must have been a fluke. Nothing's perfect in any industry. I would most definitely return to the Park Shore and sooner rather than later if they built a nice hot tub at the pool area and offered a free breakfast, even a simple continental would be fine by me. Thank you to Crystal and David for their exceptional customer service!

If there is any better bargain in Honolulu, we didn’t find it, and we sure looked at many options. The hotel was recently renovated and it shows with a large almost open-air lobby that was attractive and welcoming; good size, clean rooms; and extras like free newspapers, coffee (in the room and in the lobby) and cold drinks. Better yet, it is a perfect location, being right across the street from Waikiki beach and around the corner from the main tourist street in Waikiki -- lots of shopping, souvenir stores, and, especially, restaurants. Maybe the best of all, though, were the staff, who genuinely appeared to enjoy their jobs and go out of their way to make guests feel welcome.Although we booked the least expensive room for the pre-cruise stay, we were upgraded to an Ocean View room. It was better than we expected given the hotel’s location and cost. Better yet was our post-cruise stay when we booked an Ocean Front (not just ocean view) room. As we said above, we were especially pleased with the staff at the hotel, and Crystal deserves an extra pat on the back, and not just for upgrading us to the Diamond Head Suite (although that would have been enough for us to rave about her). The suite was clean and spacious, with a balcony facing Diamond Head with no tall buildings between us and it, a couch and table, chairs, plenty of closet space, and a small kitchen with a microwave, refrigerator, sink, plates, utensils, and more. The only downside? It was TOUGH to leave to go home!

We stayed here for a week and it was great. We loved the location as it is away from the noise of "downtown" Waikiki, but still so close. There are ABC shops, a Starbucks, a cafeteria, a restaurant/bar and more places close by. We stayed in a suite with views of Diamond Head and the ocean. Beautiful!! Every night we would watch the sunset from the balcony. The suite has a sofa, a little kitchen, 2 cupboards (ideal to put the suitcases in) and a very comfortable kingsize bed. The bus stop is just outside the hotel. We got invited for drinks on the Wednesday afternoon in the pool area and met the Scott, the manager. Nice touch!! The staff is also a great asset to the Park Shore as they are all so friendly, knowledgeable and always trying to please you!The only thing we didn't like was the homeless people hanging around in the area, but we realize that is has nothing to do with the hotel.

The location for us was everything, cause we were running the Honolulu Marathon. This hotel is just by the finish line and in front of the spot were the buses leave in the early morning to drop runners to the start line. And it is right on Waikiki!For the rest we were really satisfied of service, room and staff. The pool looked quite modest. THhe small cafeteria downstairs is just great for sandwiches, muffins and smoothies. Highly recommended .

This hotel is well located. Closed to the beach. Easy walk to all entertainment. The staff is really friendly. I arrived really late but Nick welcome me with a great smile. When I asked him about a room upgrade he told me that was too late but that I should check back the next morning. Next morning, I went back to the reception and Jara told me that Nick told her about me. She upgraded me to a partial ocean view. The view was wonderful. Lanai was facing building but second window was full ocean view so nothing to complain about it. I will definitely stay at the Park Shore again.

We were very leary of changing hotels but we took a chance. From check in to check out everyone we came in contact with was friendly and smiling. We had the best view ever of the ocean and diamond head. The room was comfortable and clean. The location is perfect, within steps of starbucks, lulus and Tucker & Bevs, (we had many of our meals there) from smoothies, wraps, breakfast sandwiches, etc.The one and only negitive note is the homeless in front of Starbucks, but that is not the hotel's fault. We would highly recommend this hotel. It will be the only place we stay from now on.

Chose the Park Shore from all the Trip Advisor reviews and were glad we did! Had a wonderful view of both Diamond Head and the ocean! The lanai was perfect to enjoy the sunrise and sunset. Rooms were perfect even though we were disappointed the last morning when there was no coffee in our room - went to the front desk and I guess they were out of the packets but he went in the back and got us fresh grounds. The concierge was wonderful and planned out our whole stay for us - very convenient to sit there with her, plan it, pay for it and get our tickets all at the same time. We will definitely be back (hopefully).

Great location, located at the end of the busy strip, opposite the Zoo which is quite handy. There is a Bus stop outside the hotel, so easy access to transport. And there is a Starbucks at the corner of the street. Overall, we were happy with our 2 night stay. The room was quite small, no extra furniture for sitting or to have a meal. I would stay here again.

After splurging for the Moana Surfrider, I stayed at the Park Shore Wakiki for my last 2 days in Honolulu and I can honestly say the great reviews for this place are accurate.It doesn't have the bells and whistles of the Surfrider but what it does have is friendly staff, very clean rooms and a great location at the end of the strip. I had a lousy view of a building right in front of me which was unfortunate after giving up an ocean view at the Surfrider but I got what I paid for as my room was $120 cheaper per night.I would not hesitate to stay at this property the next time I'm in Wakiki but I would upgrade to get a better view.

I loved the location at the end of the strip in Waikiki near the zoo. It's quieter on this side than the shopping area of Waikiki where there are just too many people. The rooms are very modern and comfortable, and very CLEAN. The view was awesome. The only comment on the room is that it is rather small...but it didn't bother me too much as I spent more time on the beach than being in the room. I didn't get to enjoy the pool because it closes surprisingly early. The main thing that will bring me back is the friendly staff. The woman at the front desk was wonderful. Everyone else made sure to smile and greet me.

Dec 8-15, 2013 - Family Vacation - We all had a wonderful week at the Park Shore! We sought out a location that would be out of the high rise's and the Park Shore fit the bill perfectly. All 3 Rooms: spotlessly clean, nicely equipped and in perfect order. The staff are most attentive and welcoming. The pool area overlooks the ocean & sun sets.) A great place for just relaxing, swimming and enjoying an unobstructed view of Diamond Head and the sea. Across the street is the beach; to the left you can enjoy the waves and to the right is a breakwater that shelters an area keeping it calm for little ones as well as for those who like to do swim laps. We plan to stay at the Park Shore again.

We have stayed at the Park Shore for 3 nights in a Standard Room (no views). The rooms are smaller than in any of the other hotels we stayed in Hawaii but the location makes it up for it.The rooms are clean and well kept. The service of the rooms are rather late in the day and when returning from an excursion or trip after 2 pm and the rooms are not serviced you feel rather disappointed. All up we enjoyed our stay but would most likely not return and rather try a different hotel

We last stayed at this hotel when it was undergoing room renovations. The new rooms are beautifully (and very comfortably) furnished; the view of the Pacific Ocean, Kapiolani Park and Diamond Head are gorgeous. Everyone on the staff was friendly and beyond helpful. Highly recommend this as a place to stay when visiting Waikiki.

We were at the Park Shore for one week Dec 4 to 11 and thouroughly enjoyed our stay, our room and the Staff. It is located in the best location of beautiful Waikiki. On Kapahulu, right across from the zoo, not only is it quiet but is right across the street from the beach. Our last day we checked out at noon and weren't flying out until 12 midnight, not only did the Hotel store our bags for free but also gave us a courtesy suite to get cleaned up and changed before our flight free of charge. I would highly recommend this Hotel for both value and location.Aloha!

Excellent value for the money. Great views of ocean and diamond head. Staff was helpful and friendly. they went out of their way to make you feel welcome and secure. Hotel was clean and in good condition. Rooms were quite and comfortable. Location was convenient to shopping, zoo, aquarium, shell stadium, and restaurants. We had a ocean view room but did not have any children with us or visit any fitness center

I don't know if we would have found this hotel if a friend had not recommended it, but are so glad we did. There are so many hotels available in Honolulu that we had no idea how to choose, not having been to the city before, and we feel we really lucked out. Park Shore is at the end of the boulevard with the zoo across the street, so there's nothing blocking views of Diamond Head, or views of the Pacific. Excellent beach just across the street, and the hotel provides beach chairs and towels. Staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. A fraction of the cost of the pricier hotels just down the street.

We really want to love this hotel at the quiet edge of Waikiki with unobstructed views of Diamond Head and Waikiki and beautifully renovated and immaculately clean. The problem is there is no aloha or welcoming spirit from the staff here - from the front desk, to the valet, to the odd reservation practices. The most welcome we felt in our 3 night stay was when we were leaving and the valet bid us farewell. When we arrived, it was several minutes before the valet even acknowledged us even though there were no other cars in the drive and no one offered to help us with bags. The front desk clerk seemed annoyed to be there, and muttered commands at us as she checked us in. This involuntary service attitude was the vibe we got the entire stay from all of the staff - they must have an awful work culture at this place in paradise!Also, beware of some shady reservation practices if you book an oceanfront room - despite being able to book a new reservation for the same dates for this room type, upon checking in - you might get 'upgraded' to a jr suite that has a view of a wall or your neighbors' lanai which - if you then step out onto your lanai and look right you'll see the ocean. They claim this is an upgrade because the rooms are bigger - but come on, if you book an ocean front room, view must be important to you. This happened to us and another guest, with the excuse that the rooms were oversold (despite the fact that they're continuing to sell them) - so I'm guessing it's practice and a bad policy.If this happens to you or you book a jr suite, just ask for a room on the outer tip of the building - the three rooms farthest from the center have nice views from the lanai (park views from the room).

we booked at the park shore for our honeymoon, we are arrived from australia at 9 am in the morning and could check into our room straight away which was great after the long flight. The staff were friendly and helpful, Stephaine on the tour desk was an amazing help we ended up booking all our acitvited through her,we had a great view of wakiki.the only down side was having a private sign on our door and housekeeping still coming in without annoucing themselves or knocking.other wise it was a great stay and convievnt location

Stayed at Park Shore during November 2013. From the moment you arrive you are greeted with such "Aloha" spirit from the staff, making you feel incredibly welcome. Management and staff at the hotel work hard to make you feel special and it's genuine. The facilities and the rooms are clean and very comfortable especially the awesome one bedroom suite with double balcony. The views are to die for, the position of the hotel in our opinion is the best along the beachfront strip. We would especially like to thank and to mention Jara at reception. Jara is an absolute asset to this property, showing us the friendliest Hawaiian service with such efficiency.Park Shore will always be our choice when visiting Oahu in the future.Thank you all at Park Shore for contributing to our first but not last Hawaiian Holiday, it could not have been better.Judy & Gary (Aust) rooms 1422 & 1022

The staff at the Park Shore was wonderful! My wife and I booked the hotel for our honeymoon based on reviews, price and location and we were not disappointed! From the valet staff to the front desk, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful during our stay. Beyond the awesome staff our room was well kept and as expected, the location of the pool on the third level, with views of both Diamond Head and the beach, was a great place to relax and enjoy the view and the location at the far eastern end of Waikiki is perfect! You're close to all the action on the water with the added benefit of less foot and vehicle traffic (within reason, this is a major city and a busy one at that).We will definitely have Park Shore high on our list for our next trip to Hawaii!

We booked this hotel from the great reviews we saw on tripadvisor. It was perfect. The staff were very welcoming and helpful at making our stay as comfortable as possible. It was great that we were able to use their "Hospitality" room as we arrived early one day and our shuttle pick up was very late another. The activity desk was very useful at helping us choose a great snorkel trip. Our room was great...was upgraded the first few nights and had a great large room the last few...both with a view. My parents stayed here 30 something years ago and I am happy to say that we stayed here as well. Keep us the good work guys!

The hotel as well as the staff was wonderful. It was my first time at this hotel but, it will not be my last. Right across the street from the beach. The pool was excellent, very clean and lots of lounge chairs to sit around during the day and work on your tan. The price was excellent. Also, loved the free wifi. Lots of restaurants and other places close by to choose from in going out to eat.Could use a little more storage space for clothes.

We had 3 rooms for 7-10 days in Nov. Excellent location across the road from the beach at Diamond head end of Waikiki. Much quieter than the other end but still walking distance to international market rat . Great bars close. Accommodation has recently been updated and very clean and tidy. Staff friendly and free wi-fi.

Hotel rooms were a little small but that was fine. The view was amazing from the lanai. Right across the street from the zoo. On the less busy side of Waikiki. Walkable to most of the places around there like restaurants and shops. Great price and very nice staff! No fitness center which was disappointing. They should add a dresser since there is not very much storage space for all of your stuff. Overall a great place to stay.

My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in November 2013. It is straight across from the beach and very convenient. It is at the quieter end of the Waikiki beach, towards the Zoo. We liked the relative quiet of that end, away from some of the very big resorts. It has free wifi and you can pick up a beach towel at reception on your way to the beach. We wanted a king bed room, but on the first day they only had the twin doubles. While the rate didn't guarantee the king, they were able to move us after the first night to a lovely king room on level 17. It was quiet, clean and very comfortable. The room was light and airy. There was an area power outage one morning. The hotel has a generator that kept the TVs and lights on in the rooms, but mains water pressure dropped so we had no water in the bathroom for a couple of hours. It wasn't clear whether the staff had practiced how to manage in such facility incidents. They only made a couple of announcements on the PA to inform guests of the situation. More information may have made it easier to understand what was going on. Otherwise the staff worked consistently to assist with all of our needs in a professional and helpful manner. I'd definitely stay here again.

Park Shore isn't the nicest hotel I've stayed at in Waikiki, but the location suites me. I like being very close to the beach. This hotel is on the Diamond Head end of the beach and right next to big Kapiolani Park. The park is a nice place to walk or run and attracts lots of locals. When I checked into the hotel, another couple was having a discussion about the size of a roach in their room. I found my room to be clean (no insects) and it was large. Towels were nice, bed sheets were just OK. It included a small fridge, small lanai which didn't have any chairs (too small) and looked right at other adjacent hotels. I think the room could have used a chair. The style of the hotel isn't hip like Hotel Renew, but it is adequate. Also, they didn't add on "Resort Fees" as does Renew. I was in the 16th floor and my room was reasonably quiet. Only noise was from outside, and this can be masked by using the A/C. There is a sushi bar in the hotel; it's good, but very overpriced. LuLu's is next door. It's "open air" on the second floor with a nice ocean view. Good for breakfast, but dinner wasn't that great. Oh, and if you tire if the food in Waikiki, walk up the street about 15 minutes (towards Honolulu) and eat with the locals (Uncle Bo's or a tiny take-away place with fantastic poke - Ono Seafood, among others).

This is our second year here and this will be the only place we will stay. Great room right by the pool all around great location. Very friendly and helpful staff.Also there is a bus stop right out front our the trolley around the corner. You will have a great time if you stay at the Park Shore Waikiki.

We loved this hotel! The view from our room of Diamond Head, the zoo, and the beach was amazing and the staff are some of the nicest people you could ever hope to meet. There is a Starbucks a few feet from the hotel entrance and Lu Lu's Waikiki restaurant is on the 2nd floor, and is a great place to eat. The pool, on the 3rd floor, has a wonderful view of the beach, and was not crowded. Also helpful is an ABC store which can be accessed from the hotel lobby. Wifi was wonderful and no problems connecting at all (unlike the hotel we stayed in the first two nights). The A/C was great as well. We will definitely be back and will recommend this hotel to friends.

Aloha! The location of the Park Shore has always been perfect. It is located on the corner across from the swimming beach and park/zoo with 2 different bus stops within a few feet. Recent remodeling has the rooms in like new condition. Staff was exceptionally nice and helpful. Our view from 907 was excellent. We've stayed in other rooms before and even the view from the partial view rooms are very good. I've lost track of how many times we've stayed at this hotel, more than 20, but in this case the hotel has aged beautifully and is in its best condition ever! Mahalo!

Wonderful hotel, excellent location - had room overlooking zoo, diamond head & the beach.I would highly recommend this hotel & would stay here again if lucky enough to return!!The staff is friendly & helpful & they provide beach towels too. There is a wonderful, healthy breakfast/lunch cafe and a starbucks on the first floor, and a good restaurant on the second.

This was my second stay at the Park Shore. 2010 we had an ocean view room. This trip just a standard room but top floor and still had great views. Pool was great, lots of room, chairs and umbrellas. Rooms have a mini fridge and coffee maker, microwave on third floor. The rooms are small but it's enough and the shower had great pressure. The hotels has towels and chairs for the guests take to the beach, which is steps away. Staff was great very friendly and rooms were clean. ABC store, StarBucks, LuLu's and Tucker and Bevvy all located at the hotel. The only down side is the homeless that seem to set up in front of the hotel/ ABC and Starbucks but seem harmless, just doesn't look ver good. Zoo across the street and the aquarium just minutes away as well.

I have been to Waikiki six times over the years staying at the Outrigger Beach, Marriott and Sheraton) and my stay at the Park Shore was the best. Upon our arrival, a young lady welcomed us as we got out of the shuttle and she walked us to the reception desk although it was only a few feet away. Crystal at the front desk was awesome. I had made reservations for an ocean view room as I wanted both city and ocean views, not just ocean front views. It was late in the evening when we arrived and the hotel was booked. We were put in a very nice room but not quite what I wanted. The next day Crystal was able to move us to a room with a spectaular unobstructed view of Diamond Head and the ocean (room 1509). All but one of the employees appeared happy to be working there and projected that into our interaction. Crystal always made a point of not just smiling at us but would also call out to us when we walked through the lobby as if we were friends.The pool was located on the third floor which made for wonderful views of the ocean and the park across the street. My only recommendation would to have the pool area open in the evening. It would have been nice to sit around the pool in the evening and listen to the music either overhead or coming from LuLu's. I would highly recommend this hotel.

It was November 1969, exactly 44 years ago, when my wife and I got engaged at the Park Shore Hotel and we have not been back to Hawaii since. So when we decided to return this November we were happy and excited to know that the Park Shore was still operating but at the same time we were a little apprehensive about what time had done to this hotel as well as to Waikiki. Of course, our beautiful memories of the past were definitely colored by the fact that we were a young couple in love and everything was wonderful in this paradise like setting, including the Park Shore at that time. We remembered that staff as being very friendly ..,but what about now?? Now, when personal concern and kindness in general appear to be diminishing in this world we live in.As soon as we arrived at the front entrance we were met by a happy and friendly young lady with a bright smile, named Desiree who sincerely welcomed us and then almost immediately Erik a gregarious, portly attendant arranged to care for our luggage. So far so good, but how would check in go with so many visitors at the busy desk? Would we just be another number? An exceptionally keen, considerate and alert Krystal quickly processed our information but also asked some tactful personal questions about us. When she learned how long it had been since we had last been here she immediately contacted the manager Scott Pauli. After a little discussion Scott proposed a beautiful upgrade for us to a one bedroom suite facing the ocean. Needless to say we were taken aback as we had not expected this and it was not something they needed to do. The room and view was fantastic! But this gesture did give us an idea of the spirit here. As far as the hotel was concerned, it has just recently been totally renovated so it feels fresh and clean . The location is still great next to the zoo and Diamond Head and a little quieter being just a little ways away from the noisy, bustling strip. However, on the negative side, the room doors are heavily weighted and slam shut with such a thunderous thud that can be heard almost throughout the building. Disturbing especially If you are light sleeper.The Guest Service is super! Annie and David were not only thoughtful but very kind. They went out of their way to ensure that we were well cared for. In fact, Annie even gave us her own personal boogie board to use at the beach.Not just that first day, but on each day of our stay all the staff that we had dealings with, including the housekeepers, willingly went out of their way to be helpful and shared many useful tips, including letting us know about cheap but good places to eat. It was indeed enjoyable to be a part of this familylike atmosphere. And it speaks volumes when many of the staff say they have never worked for a better or kinder manager than Scott Pauli. He indeed has a big heart.But one major negative change for us was to see the number of homeless (many drunk or drugged) sleeping and begging on the main street, some quite close to the hotel. Some are sleeping literally in the middle of the sidewalk and you need to make an effort not to stumble over them. This was disturbing and is a blight/shame on this beautiful part of the world. We were also sad to learn that the famous International Market will soon be torn down to be replaced by more high end shops.But aside from that and a few other (progressive?) changes, we were delighted to be back again and especially to enjoy the warm, friendly and genuinely considerate hospitality of the staff at the Park Shore. Though this review may sound subjective, we did observe the same friendly helpful service shown toward the other guests as well. We are glad we chose to stay here again (brought back some warm memories of 1969) and would heartily recommend the Park Shore to anyone who wants to stay at a clean, friendly hotel that won't break your budget.We would certainly come back here again but definitely before another 44 yrs goes by!MahaloReino

We stayed in an oceanfront room that had an amazing view of the beach and ocean and a bonus view of Diamondhead on the side of the balcony. I have included a photo that shows the ocean view from our balcony. It was amazing. The location of the hotel was great. It was away from all of the tourist trap shops, but you could easily walk to them if you wanted to. The room was small, but perfect for what we needed. The shower had great water pressure and temperature control. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job and the front desk was friendly. There are many shops, restaurants and bars within walking distance and the beach is right across the street. If I returned to Honolulu I would stay here again in the same ocean front room. I loved it.

We enjoyed our stay here. Clean, updated, and good customer service. Best feature was the hospitality suite. When you checked out of your room you could use a hospitality suite with a shower and big-screen TV. This allowed us to enjoy the day at the beach and still shower before we got on our plane. Excellent free service. Beach access was right there! Great restaurants and shops near by. We walked to Diamond Head (40 min) and took the city bus 23 back. The section of the beach was a bit dirty. We walked down to the Outrigger Hotel (10 min walk) and rented an umbrella and two chairs for $50. It is a crowded, loud section of the Waikiki strip. However closing the patio door kept most of the noise out! not a luxury hotel but a good value.

I stayed at the Park Shore for two nights with my mother during the Okinawan Festival (Labor Day Weekend) so we wouldn't have to drive home each day after volunteering. The location was idea for this purpose since it was only a block away from Kapiolani Bandstand Park.The rooms had everything we needed, including a good sized fridge and free newspaper. The room was recently refurbished and was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and we had a very nice stay for a reasonable and affordable price.

I Did have an experience that was corrected immediately after reporting with front desk on day of checkin with the young lady at the front desk .On arriving and entering the room no 807. Room had a very strong smell of cigarette smoke and I therefore attempted to ventilate room by opening balcony and front door. The wind slammed the front door and shut me out of the room! Gratefully the young lady transferred me to room 1707 and I have to say was what I was expected as an ocean front room and what I was booked in for. Room 807 was not an ocean front as it was located in front of the pool.During my stay I witnessed smoking on balconies which caused discomfort. Overall because of the room transfer I am satisfied with my stay but would like to make sure that the management check smokers more strictly and to advertise more accurately what are ocean front rooms at reservation.

The Park Shore is located on the Diamond Head end on Waikiki Beach accross (Kapahulu Ave) from the Honolulu Zoo. Cross the road (Kalakaua Ave) and you are on the beach and can walk the pier. The beach on this end has some calmer section due to seawall break. (Kuhio Beach)The rooms are nicely done and have been recently renovated. We had a standard double room on the 12th floor which looked over the pool and had an ocean view. Stayed 3 nights. The other side of the room outside the door was an open air hall with a view of Diamond Head. We had no issues with noise from the street. The staff was friendly and courteous.This hotel is on a public transpotation route (The Bus) there is a stop right in front of Hotel so you can easily take the bus to downtown Honolulu and visit the sites like 'lolani Palance and Chinatown. (Use stop on Kuhio Ave to go Downtown)Just to orient yourself - Waikiki is NOT Downtown Honolulu. Do not expect to walk from Downtown Honolulu to Waikiki and vice versa.We took the bus up to Leonards - twice as the Malasadas were fantastic!!!If you want to see the Hilton Fireworks walk down to Fort DeRussy Beach early - it is about a 30 min walk.Kakakaua Ave is the main street and is filled with High end retail and all the hotels.If you are going to visit Pearl Harbor save yourself some money by booking/buy your ticket for the USS Arizona Memorial online , must be purchased in advance. You can tour the Vistior Center for free! Otherwise you will pay at least $80 to get tickets and tour through one of the tour companies. The Bus (pulic transportation) does stop right at the Pearl Harbor Visitor Center. We were very happy with the hotel and would consider staying there again if ever back in Waikiki.
user_name:
Brigidanne
Castleton On Hudson, New York

review_body: Stayed in early Nov for 10 nights, my 14th vacation in Hawaii normally stay at Fort De Russy end at Parc hotel (8 times) roughly around same price. Chose this hotel for the large pool deck and good size pool and beach right across road.Had any ocean view room on 18th floor.This hotel has major issues with Homeless and Vagrants which no one seems to be worried about. They (up to 20) camped 24/7 on side walk outside of hotel and at times you have to step over them as they lay across side walk. One night at 830pm there was a violent verbal confrontation btw them and it was disturbing with profanities flying around whilst families walked past. I felt unsafe. I reported this to hotel front desk next day. They said I should have done it immediately and that they normally dont have issues. Isnt this loitering isnt this illegal why does the hotel and city allow it!! It's embarrassing and unacceptable !! I have never seen this anywhere in the world so close to a hotel entrance and certainly not in any other hotel in Hawaii.The hotel is very lax with security as opposed to other hotels. Any person off the street can gain access to any floor it is very very open. The hotel needs card key entry to hotel floors simple as that to protect guests.The biggest gripe I had was the heavy slamming of hotel room doors all day and night. They are massively weighted and fling shut behind you so fast before you can control them. The noise was intolerable at times, all night with the constant banging and I am talking LOUD !! Noise from the corridors filter into the room like going through tissue paper very badly sound proofed but btw rooms was totally fine.Wasps !! If you go to the pool deck be aware of Wasps. I had 4 to 5 land on me they are massive and they stick to you like glue. One stung me on the hand my first sting ever in my life. My hand swelled up and the pain was intense. I stuck my hand in the pool and then iced it. It was fine but itched for 5 days. Take repellent.This hotel is the far far away from Ala Moana s/c which is the 3rd largest in America. Allow around 45min each way with the bus as the traffic can be a nightmare. I knew this going in and did not bother me at all. Just a tip really.
