PRO'S-Hotel staff a lovely super friendly and helpful-Was given my room immediately upon check in (730am) wonderful service !!!-One of the best pool and sundecks in terms of space and no casting of shadows-Pool seemed almost new the finish on it and very clean with complimentary pool lounges.-Huge size tv and balcony-Newish room very nice finish and furniture-Great shower albeit very very tiny the bathroom, the shower was great.-Tonnes of natural light all day flooding room and tonnes of lamps at night, the most light I have ever seen in a hotel room at night awesome job !!-Tonnes of power outlets I counted around 12 !!-Great a/c !!-Very firm and comfy beds and nice pillows.-Ice machine right near the pool was great to top up your drinks and keep cold.-10% off macey's shopping on back of your room key. Clever initiative.-We had a black out one night/morning with no water in hotel or the whole block due to massive storm. Hotel had generators for lighting and the water came back on in 1 hour so great job.-Bus no 8 from Ala moana shopping centre drops you off directly in front of hotel entrance, the last stop so that was very very convenient.-When I got to my room I noticed ceiling panel were lose and rattling. I told the front desk, Nick and it was fixed immediately and they checked the next day to see if I was happy. Super service.CON'S-All the major points listed above. Plus-Pool is on the 3rd floor and I noticed a lot of road street noise pervading the area but after a couple of days you got used to it when weighing it up with the great pool, its not a deal breaker.-Rooms are teeny weeny, I was shocked how small they were. For one person worked out okay just. But I felt claustrophobic at times. The bathroom is tiny too but adequate.-This is very minor but you had to return the pool towels to the front desk every day but why not have a dump bin on pool level like every other hotel ?? It was just unnecessary pain in butt.-No security latch on the room doors, the ones with the lever you can open ajar.-Closet was so tiny it was a joke enough for one person and that is it.-Saturday is bin day and after they empty dumpsters in the street the smell of garbage wafts up to the pool deck for hours very pleasant.-No cordless phone or second phone on desk would be handy was hard lying on bed and conversing for long periods. -No laundry facilities in the hotel which is utterly ridiculous that they dont have a communal laundry room like every other hotel I have stayed in. You have to walk 4 blocks to a laundromat. I used the sink and made a clothes line on the balcony which was fine for me.-No fitness centre. I knew this but something they can work on I think.CONCLUSIONI call a spade a spade. May be I have very high expectations but for $250 per night I expected a little more. The hotel overall is very good but could be great with some improvements. My experiences may not be those of others. I would give it a couple of years before I stayed here again I think.

We had a standard room with the ocean view. Room itself was on the small side, but hey you're not supposed to be in the room much anyway right?! View was great, ocean and Diamond Head. I was a little worried what we'd find when we got there since I got such a good rate and it's steps from the beach. But I was pleasantly surprised at how well-kept the hotel was. Nothing over the top fancy, but it had everything we needed, was clean, and again, you cannot beat the location. Had a bar/restaurant next door with great food and good beer selection. Highly recommend!

This was my third business trip to Oahu and I wanted to stay closer to the water. The Park Shore is next to the zoo and across the street from the beach and the pier. The rooms are simple and small, but it was fine for the price. The location is great since it is at the end of the Waikiki strip. You can walk to the zoo, beach, International Market, restaurants, and shops in five minutes or less. I recommend paying a little extra for the ocean view room so that you aren't looking out at the hotel next door for the duration of your stay. It's definitely the place to stay for a short trip or if you are on a budget.
user_name:
Erica K V
Upper Arlington, Ohio

review_body: My fiancé surprised me with a trip to O'ahu for fun and we stayed in a lovely suite here - listen to the tips and get an ocean front room on a high level floor, you won't regret it - and we had a perfectly lovely stay! The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious and clean, and the services are great. The location is ideal, within walking distance of everything you could possibly want in Waikiki and the shopping is unending. The beach and zoo are literally right there and you really don't need a car - although we did have one for trips to the North Shore. LuLu's, the resturaunt downstairs, is great for breakfast and tips for the day as well. We had a blast over our Halloween stay at Park Shore - can't wait to come back!

Me & my spouse went to Oahu, Hawaii in 2010. We went with Travelocity for a vacation package and we were very pleased with Park Shore Hotel. Waikiki beach was right across the Hotel which was so great! The room was small but very clean. The queen bed was very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and they had a tour guide inside hotel lobby to purchase tours around island. The tour busses are around the next block which was so convenient walking distance. The pool was very nice. Overall our stay in Park Shore was wonderful! It was close to all attractions in the island of Oahu Hawaii. Will definitely go back!

Went over for a few days to visit my sons. My oldest lives there ans recommended the park shore.Great location, across from beach. Much nicer beach than down the way a bit where the big hotels are. I was impressed and will be back again!

We stayed at the park shore for 3 nights. The hotel itself is in a great location, right across from the beach, and the rooms were very clean and updated. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Would highly recommend to anyone who is looking to travel on a budget.

This hotel has everything you could want in accommodation. We were so happy with everything at this hotel, in fact we wish we were still there. The staff were friendly and helpful. The view of the beach and diamond head from our balcony was exceptional. A quick hop skip and jump to the beach. The rooms we had were clean and spacious with kitchenette facilities (Ievel 18) in the suite as well as coffee making machine and small fridge in our other room(level 12). The expedia rep was able to organise all tours we wanted to attend, We had to extend our stay by a night which was not a problem. The pool area was spacious with ample seating. The hotel is at the end of the main strip of Waikiki beach which means you are not in the middle of all the hustle and bustle which we appreciated. Would stay again in a heartbeat

Loved this hotel, upgraded to a room with a view of the pool and ocean.The room was small , but who's in there room in Hawaii.Love having the coffee maker, had my coffee in the morning on the lanai with a wonderful view of the ocean. the staff was awesome, with help on what bus to take what restaurant to go to,They even gave us chairs to watch the parade.Love the connection to the Lulu restaurant n ABC store.(I would get a Mai Tai from the ABC store to enjoy by the pool. If we go back to Waikiki this is where we'll be staying

I had a very enjoyable stay. The rooms were nice, the staff attentive. I have one complaint. At approximately 9:00PM on Saturday evening, We were returning from a wonderful evening in Waikiki, when just in front of the ABC store entrance there was a man urinating in public. I immediately complained to the front desk, where I was told that this was not there problem. I insisted on a leaving a message for the manager, but never heard back. No other hotel allows homeless to take over the sidewalk in front of their hotel. Public urination is disgusting and against the law. Why does this fine hotel permit this?

Fleed from a bedbug hostel to Park Shore with a friend, and the best choice we ever did. Clean and fresh! The staff was great, helped us with everything and was so polite. Great view over the beach and Diamond Head. Actually wishing I was laying in the bed there this very moment. Pool area was clean and nice, and just steps away from beach and stores. Can't really say anything bad about it.

This hotel is located practically walking steps from the beach. . This hotel is located at the edge of Waikiki near the ZOO and a Park. The hotel faces the Diamond Head Mountain and the beautiful beaches of Waikiki. You will not be disappointed. We had a wonderful time and will return again. There is a bus stop right outside your hotel.

This hotel is in a great location across the road from the beach in a quieter area, a short walk across the park to the Honolulu Zoo and has a Japanese restaurant attached as well as an ABC store. Loved it, perfect stay in Waikiki

I can't say enough good things about the staff and service at this hotel. Nick and Leny at the front desk were awesome, and Stephanie at the expedia desk went above and beyond to help with our excursions. Everything was top notch. Great location, great view, great price. My only suggestion is larger trashcans in the rooms. If we're ever fortunate enough to make it back to Oahu, this is where you'll find us!

We stayed at Park Shore for a couple nights and it was very nice. We enjoyed the location with the beach literally across the street, a beautiful park next door, and an easy walk to lots of shops and restaurants. Our recently renovated room was nice and very clean and all staff members we dealt with were very nice and helpful. We enjoyed our stay. I would definitely recommend Park Shore to anyone who plans to stay a couple nights. The rooms are quite small though, so if you are planning a long stay you may want to look elsewhere. They also have a shuttle from the airport, which was great. It was kind of expensive, but cheaper than a cab and very convenient. When we left the hotel we needed to leave on a cruise and they shuttled us right to pier. The front desk also arranged our transportation to visit Pearl Harbor.

What a location, right on the beach. The hotel is at the quiet end of Kalakaua Avenue, the end closest to Diamond Head. You walk across the street and you're on Kuhio Beach, which is protected by a breakwater and has no waves. There's a pier which projects beyond the breakwater. Nearby Queen's Beach is not protected and has more waves-- not much sand but you can sit on the grass. The hotel provides beach towels for guests. There is an adjacent restaurant ( Lu-Lus)which is great for breakfast. Our oceanfront room, with balcony, had a great view . The room was nicely decorated and comfortable. The hotel has free WiFi in all rooms. There's valet parking with unlimited in-and-out for one daily fee. It took only a minute for them to bring up our car. We wanted a late checkout, and the hotel allowed us to stay past noon for $10/hr, with max of 4 hours.

We had a WONDERFUL time at this hotel. We celebrated with friends and had a small family reunion. Everyone is so friendly and truly extends the Aloha spirit with genuine care in their hearts. I will definitely recommend this hotel to many of our friends and business associates.

I and my husband just recently celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary and we decided to celebrate it in hawaii. We stayed in this hotel for few days. The location of this hotel is pretty cool cause its just right next to the famous waikiki beach. Our room is pretty small but its still not bad. Pretty small bathroom too but still works for us. the staff are nice. The valet parking is a lil bit a pain but no choice. you have to pay for it too. Overall its not a bad hotel to stay and the cool thing is the beach is right across. I love the queen size comfy bed of our bedroom though!

We had three rooms with a total of seven of us as guests of this fabulous hotel. We flew in from the Big Island after a stay at the Waikoloa Hilton. In comparison, we had to wait 1.5 hours for our bags to be delivered to our rooms at the Hilton. Our luggage was brought up with two porters trailing us in the next elevator in minutes after our check in at the front desk. The front desk and reservation service is SUPERB and OUTSTANDING!!! Annie is truly one in a million and troubleshoot a problem we had with one of our rooms as well as handling our reservations quickly and efficiently. Our rooms had views of the beach and Diamond Head. It is really worth if to upgrade your rooms to ocean view or oceanfront. It is nice and relaxing to sit out on the balcony and see the beautiful blue ocean and Diamond Head. We have stayed at this hotel prior to the renovations, although we still had fun staying here prior to the renovations we really, really, really enjoy staying in the new renovated rooms. The GENERAL MANAGER of this hotel has done an excellent job of managing the front desk, housekeeping, maintenance and bell captain departments. I would say we've stayed at 100's of hotels, although my profile on Trip Advisor profile does not reflect this. I wrote only two reviews previously because we were upset.However, we just wanted to take a moment to share our wonderful experience with this hotel and their staff. EXCELLENT OVERALL! BEST STAFF!!! TO US...THIS HOTEL OFFERS ONE OF THE BEST VIEWS OF WAIKIKI BEACH AND OF DIAMOND VIEW. WE HAD A FABULOUS TIME!

Upon arrival you're presented with a pleasant lobby. Whilst the corridors are a little dated, the rooms are modern and tidy. The hotel is in two wings. One is 12 stories high and the other is 18 stories high. The smaller block has room access along an open pathway whilst the taller block has an internal corridor.Hotel wifi is easy to access and the standard speed was fast enough for my smartphone and iPad. Expedia desk staff were very helpful and seemed to genuinely want you to get the best deal. Shout out to Stephanie who was wonderful to deal with. Reception staff were efficient and helpful, especially Crystal who helped us choose a great room.A nice touch is the iced water and tropical punch available in the lobby during the day.The hotel is right at the end of the Waikiki strip and overlooks Honalulu Zoo. It has an open feel to it because of this and is quieter but you are further away from the main shopping area (An easy 15 minute walk). The beaches at this end are less crowded and you are right across the street from the lagoon and the pier, and have great access to Kapiolani Park.The rooms are quiet with the balcony slider shut, we tried sleeping with the slider open once but utility trucks through the night and late night/early morning buses at the stop immediately outside the hotel made for an interrupted nights sleep. The bed was very comfortable. The air conditioner was a little noisy and intrusive which was more noticeable at night.Buses to Diamond Head could be caught right outside the hotel, and buses to Ala Moana were a few minutes walk away on Kuhio.An issue with housekeeping was more than satisfactorily resolved and management seem very approachable and keen to ensure you have a good stay.

This is the first hotel we visited on our two week honeymoon and we really enjoyed our three-night stay. The location is great directly across from the beach. We were treated to an upgrade (paid for standard, got a partial ocean view room) because it was our honeymoon--THANKS, Park Shore! To us, there was nothing partial about our ocean view, though! The window looked directly at the ocean and we were so happy. This place is a great place to stay and we would love to visit again. We also loved LuLu's for breakfast (Tip: Their portions are huge so just get one meal and split it with someone to have a very reasonably priced breakfast).

I usually stay at Hiltons, sheratons, etc. I stayed here because others were full or prices were jacked up too high for week I wanted to stay. This hotel was $100-200/day less. The rooms were fine. Location convenient and was the restaurant/bar next door but connected thru hotel. The desk staff were very good & prompt for check-in/out & printing boarding pass for plane. The hotel rates make staying extra days easy.

Ideal location for shops, beach and restaurants. Friendly service, clean comfortable rooms, small but adequate. Reasonable valet parking, close enough to the main drag with out the noise. Starbucks next door opens at 4:30am great for breakfast! Good value.

We stayed in room 509 for five nights. I was very disappointed by the location of the room. It was our 25th wedding anniversary and I had really hoped for an ocean view. We had a peek-a-boo view of the ocean through the trees and a lovely view of Diamond Head and the pool neither of which we were excited about. We visit the Rocky Mountains frequently so Diamond Head was not particularly interesting for us. Having said that, the hotel itself is a great place to stay and having read the reviews I know that lots of people are lucky enough to get an upgrade to an ocean view room on a higher floor that is not obscured by the trees. Our room itself was lovely, everything was new, very clean, and we enjoyed our stay there. We would definitely stay there again if we could have a room on a higher floor.

Our first stay at the Park Shore in 2012 was a desaster. Nevertheless we decided to give them a second chance one year later after the renovation and that was very good idea. The hotel was very clean. Our room on the 18th floor was very nice and had a great view. It was an oceanview room facing Diamond Head. The location of the hotel is unbeatable. Waikiki Beach is just across the street. The staff is very friendly and helpful.Dear Mr. Pauly, thank you for your generous offer. We had a wonderful stay.

Stayed for for 7 nights, and had the BEST ROOM on the 16th floor! Our view was great and we woke up every morning at 6 am to see the sunrise and views of Diamond Head and the ocean! We went boarding almost every day before 7am. Being so close to the beach made this great! Yes there area few homeless/house less folks nearby on the corner, but they were actually pretty friendly, and you do find several along the main drag of Waikiki, just FYI. Park Shore staff was pretty great, and helpful. The sushi restaurant is very good, although more traditional than your usual sushi joints, so be prepared for a more authentic experience. Lu Lu's is a great place to go with good steaks and a mean Ahi Poke appetizer, great for watching games at ANY time of day, yes even early in the morning! Two ABC stores nearby for snacks, and fair priced general souvenirs and beach needs. I will admit we did NOT want to leave, and we will come back to the Park Shore, hopefully sooner than later!

Lew & June spent 6 nights at Park Shore Waikiki. Had a great room on the 7th floor overlooking Diamond Head, the swimming pool was just below us; plus a great look at the ocean across the street. Our room was great. The only thing's missing was maybe a microwave & a small dining table & extra chair. Other than that it suited our needs plus the view was absolutely great.

Stayed at the Park Shore Waikiki Hotel in September 2013 for 7 nights. Very convenient location, at the east end of Waikiki Beach, just across the street from the beach. The room and bathroom were small, but in very good condition, and kept very clean every day by the friendly hotel staff. The free WiFi in the room worked perfectly fine, except a bit slow during peak times (just like anywhere else). There's a Starbucks, an ABC store, and "Lu Lu's" Bar & Restaurant literally 50 feet next to the lobby, on the way to the beach, which is very convenient as well. I'll go there again! No doubt!

Stayed at park shore for 9 nights had great time crystal s lovely and very helpful on reception . Had corner room oceanfront 11 th floor beautiful made our holiday . Would also like to say malia concierge for expedia is lovely it seems people forget to mention her. Fab location.

Waikiki is only a small part of Oahu. The Hotel was great staff perfect. Street noise and traffic but hey it's Waikiki There are a few "homeless" but not aggressive. Anyone who stays here will be happy. Rooms are small but views are the best!!!!! Visit the Westside for the finest snorkeling on the island right next to the power plant clean warm clear water. Spinner dolphins turtles it's all there.
user_name:
Paul H
Ventura, California, United States

review_body: We booked through wotif and specified a higher level and partial ocean view. When we arrived staff were lovely and welcoming, our room was clean and comfortable, however we didn't get a high level room and the balcony was overlooking the back lane carpark and rubbish area which was really smelly and disappointing, we did have a partial ocean view but it came at a cost of looking at air conditioning vents, paint tins and junk so whilst some things were great, those things spoiled our overall feeling of the hotel. Having said that I would stay there again if our room was higher and not overlooking junk, rubbish or the back lane.

Me and my wife visited the park shore hotel for 10 nights from the 23 September to the 3 October it was our first time in hawaii from the moment we arrived we knew we had made a good choice in choosing the park shore we were greeted at reception by jeramine and crystal with a warm and friendly welcome they asked us if we had a good flight and if it was our first time in hawaii they gave us a free upgrade to a partial sea view room which was a very big surprise to us in which we were grateful they also explained to us were all the hotel amenities were and not to hesitate in contacting them with any other information in which we wanted to know our room was on the 10th floor it was a corner unit tastefully decorated very clean and wonderful views it was just perfect in everyway the hotel is in a prime location with everything you need and shops and restaurants within walking distance but what was a massive selling point was that the beach was just across the road the zoo was on the other side of the road a must visit I highly recommend the aquarium was a 10 minute walk away again I would highly recommend this to and if you take your room key and show the cashier you get a discount another plus we found for the park shore is that you can get deck chairs from the porters in the hotel to take to the beach with you same as beach towels you can pick these up at the reception another great service provided by the hotel free of charge ovehrall we enjoyed our stay at the park shore the staff were wonderful a real asset to the management because you can see that they take great pride in making sure that you come first we will return to the park shore and will recommend to our family and friends we truly had a wonderful stay thank you

This hotel is amazing.This hotel is in a key location, close to many tour provider stops, right across from the beautiful Waikiki beach, and beautiful views of Diamond Head. The rooms are very clean and tidy, and are relatively modern. The staff are absolutely wonderful and helpful. Services provided within the hotel are outstanding. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and would gladly stay again. Don't miss this opportunity.

Great location. The renovation to the hotel was really nice and modern. Perfect refresh. Parked at the hotel which was fast and easy. Elevators were always empty and quick. And the front desk staff were all very nice. It was a great stay.

I stayed here with my family including a 2 1/2 year old. We arrived late and I was disappointed at first because the rooms are so small and although remodeled, did not have the quality I would have liked. We stayed here 6 days and the place grew on me and I didn't mind the small rooms anymore because we were never in there except to sleep. Overall, I would stay here again because of the renovated room in this hotel class price range. If you want something fancier, you will have to pay more money per night at a higher class hotel. PROs: Right across the street is a beach with a sea wall which keeps large waves from coming up. Its perfect for families with small kids. If you want the waves, you can walk past the sea wall and you will be at regular beach. I loved that we were right on Waikiki strip so was able to walk to all the shops, most of which stayed open till 11pm. Room was renovated so newer bedding, flat screen TV, granite counter in bathroom, good water pressure in shower, housekeeping did a good job cleaning daily, Free Wi-Fi, LuLu's restaurant is on the 2nd floor for a great breakfast, Starbucks is on the first floor, ABC on the first floor and also outside the main doors. There is also an agent in the lobby who helped us book some activities. We were there during Aloha Festival 2013 and was able to watch the Floral parade right outside our hotel, fun to watch. Valet parking staff was fast and friendly. CONs: Parking with tax is about $23 per day; Valet parking only but is included with the daily parking price; no breakfast included, Small rooms; ice machines only on 3rd,7th,10th, 14th, and 18th floors. We were on the top floor (18th) so liked that we were close to the ice machine; no microwave, very small refrigerator; small coffee maker in room; hallways are small and seem dated. Friendliness of front desk staff was hit or miss, depends on who was working but overall they were ok.

We stayed at the Park Shore Waikiki for the last two days of our 11 day trip around the Hawaiian islands. With each island our stay was even more beautiful, comfortable and perfect. The hotel is located just across the street from the quiet end of Waikiki beach with a Starbucks, ABC Store and LuLu's restaurant just below the building. It is within walking distance to most everything without feeling disconnected from the heart of Waikiki. We reserved a regular room but quickly upgraded for $45/night when we were allowed to view the rooms with a partial ocean view and full view of Diamond Head! Our room was perfect, a little on the small side, with a nice big balcony! Clean, classy and beautifully kept! The bed was extremely comfortable, in fact, the most comfortable bed we slept in the entire trip! A very upscale feel with very personable staff! Valet parking was $22/night which was very reasonable especially for the wonderful service provided. I spent weeks researching hotels in the Waikiki area that were within our budget and not rundown. We finally settled on the Park Shore and are so happy we did! I would revisit in a heart beat!

Just returned from two weeks holiday at Park Shore Hotel. The staff are brilliant at this place, all so friendly and helpful. Rooms are great, lovely big comfy beds. Wednesdays between 5 and 6 you are invited to the pool deck for drinks and snacks, it was really lovely. Lovely coffee downstairs in the morning and cold drinks in the afternoon. The Pog was delicious and very refreshing. We couldn't fault the place, everything was brilliant.

Right across from the beach, zoo, & shopping! Walking distance to everything. Nice pool, but not that big. Small rooms, but clean & great views. Great for an Aqua hotel, which I thought I would never stay at. Another plus, Starbucks is connected to the hotel.

I was here for a week and every employee was courteous and friendly. I was staying by myself, meeting a group while in Oahu, and often singles are "invisible", but not here. Terrific location, able to walk to many places. Loved being near the zoo and aquarium and a bus stop. Free Wifi was a plus! Morning coffee and newspaper made it seem like home. The deli next door is fabulous and, of course, adjacent ABC store was convenient.

Reservation: I found a discount code on TripAdvisor, but booked through the hotel website. I think this helped me get the room I wanted (and I highly recommend this approach - many "bad" reviews complain about not getting a good view). When making my reservation there was a "special request" box. I asked for a corner room as high up as possible (I'd booked an "ocean view" room). I was prepared to sweet talk / bribe my way to a great room. No need. I started my spiel and the hostess told me I was one floor from the top, on the corner - with a balcony view of the beach and a side view of Diamond Head. When I walked into the room I literally said "Wow!"Location: Great location at the southeast end of the main strip of hotels on Waikiki Beach. Just cross the street and you're on the beach (right across from the jetty by Queen's Beach). Easy driving access (you avoid having to drive down the very busy Kalakaua Blvd and instead have quick access to Kapahulu - for arrival and departure). Shopping and restaurants are a 1-5 minute walk away. I saw some homeless people in the vicinity, but not in great numbers and they certainly weren't aggressive. Google map directions had me twisting and turning - just take Kapahulu towards the ocean - you can pull into the valet parking from either side of the road.Hotel: I walked through several other hotels during my stay. Some were very opulent - water features and large statues. Park Shore doesn't have these. No biggie - the lack of opulence didn't keep me awake at nights. The lobby is large, with comfortable seating - some right by the door for when you're waiting for pick up for tours.Staff: The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. The valet / bell staff were equally friendly. Cleaning service was effective - they did tend to visit early to mid-afternoon, but were willing to come back if you happened to be in the room.Room: Clean. Reasonably large room. Comfortable bed. Large closet with plenty of hangers. Drawer space was a tad limited. Plenty of counter space in the bathroom. Shower was consistently hot and easy to control the temperature. Room safe was large - could have held a laptop and everything else you might want to lock up. Mini-fridge was of adequate size. No microwave. Well lit. Lots of electrical outlets.Did I mention the view? Definitely pay for the ocean view room and mention you want a corner room on a high floor. I loved the views of the ocean. Very relaxing.Parking: $20-ish dollars per day. Valet only. This was the only slight annoyance. Do you tip when you drop off the car? Do you tip when you get the car back? How much? I freely tip valet parking when it is a convenience, but valet is forced on you here (I think this is consistent with most of the Waikiki hotels). I don't know the rules in that situation - and I'd rather pay an extra $5 per day and be told tipping isn't accepted.Summary: For the price you get great views, great location, and all of the amenities you could ask for during your stay in Waikiki. I don't know why you'd stay anywhere but the Park Shore!

The hotel is located on the main street right across from Waikiki Beach, the section of the beach is called Queens beach. on the side of the hotel is a big park, and if you have a room with a side view of the beach, you get to see the Diamond Head as well. The hotel itself has great staff, everything you need in the rooms, including free wifi.Hotel has a great pool! Definitely worth the price!

We decided to stay here after reading other reviews of trip advisor and were definitely glad we did. We got upgraded to an ocean view room and we could see waikiki beach and diamond head right outside. Very handy with a Starbucks and Abc store downstairs. Front desk staff were always friendly and accommodating and porters were able to help us who the getting our shopping to the room. There's usually a taxi outside the hotel which is great. Very affordable and nice restaurant lulu's next door. There is also a authentic Japanese restaurant downstairs which is beautiful and affordable. Would definitely recommend this hotel to all visiting waikiki. Thanks to everyone, we had a fantastic stay here. Mahalo.

Our honeymoon and our first time to Hawaii...and what better than a nice, comfy, and friendly hotel to stay in. Conveniently located in the tourist section of Waikiki, walking distance to EVERYTHING. From the start, it was welcoming and friendly, staff, and all. The only one thing I do have to say is that if you are flying in from far, you better plan your arrival to the hotel at or after 3pm, good luck in trying to get in your room before that. Also, I was impressed by the comp. upgrade from the hotel since I was there for my honeymoon, even gave us a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts...so instead of a regular mountain facing room, we were put in a partial ocean view room, which really was ocean view if you ask me. Definitely will stay here on any future visits to Honolulu. Way to go Park Shore!
user_name:
Hmtz837
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: We looked at many options when making our decision where to stay in Hawaii. And we were glad that we chose the Park Shore. The staff was helpful and friendly. Located right across the street from Waikiki Beach, which we had a nice view from our room. The hotel was right next to a park and the zoo, we could see the elephants from our room 16 floors up. Lots of shopping and eating establishments nearby. Lulu's Restaurant is an open air restaurant and bar on the 2nd floor of the Hotel, with views of the beach. We ate there several nights during our stay and we were never disappointed. ABC store is right on the corner in case you forgot anything. The room was big enough for two but when our daughter came, 3 was a bit cramped. The shower was handicap accessible so it was hard to keep the water in. The room had a fridge, a small kitchenette with dishes, a microwave, and a safe. Pool was nice, but we preferred the beach. If you ask the front desk sometimes they have extra boogie boards that others have left. Check before you rent or buy. I would definitely stay here again. Loved the location at the end of Waikiki.
user_name:
Jamie T
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: We had an ocean/Diamond head view room on 12. No problems, even had a paper every morning by the elevators we grabbed as we went to breakfast. Front desk and bells were very friendly and helpful. Only complaints would be the large gathering of homeless on the corner, especially at night (no fault of the hotels tho). And sound carries through the rooms well, luckily we didn't have a lotta loud people on our floor. We would stay here again with no worries.

We really liked the Park Shore. It's been recently renovated. Staff is nice. It's next to the Honolulu Zoo. It's right across from the beach. Beautiful sunsets. Surfboard lessons on beach. Lulu's restaurant was reasonably priced. Food was real good. Our room was small and was a corner unit turned into a handicap room - 707. (No bathtub). It had a mini fridge but no freezer. The ABC store is in lobby. Great for souvenirs, snacks, beer, tee shirts, wrap skirts and more.

The staff of frontdesk are friendly and their services so quick & adiquate. Our 14th floor Diamondhead Suite has a GREAT view of mountain, park and ocean. But 15th or higher would have a whole view of mountain. The bathroom is a bit small but very clean and functional. There was no bottle opener so I bought it at a ABC store by $5.5. Wifi service was not gotten through somehow by my Smartphone. But no problem because I rented a mobile wifi router. Newly opened store Tacker & Bevvy picnic food is strongly recommendable to lovers of natural foods. They made a freash juice by a latest slow juicer. Overall, a stay at this hotel fullfilled our wish to feel natural refreshment of Hawaii.

My husband and I stayed at the Park Shore for four nights in mid September. When we originally booked this hotel we wanted a location away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We found that this hotel located at the end of the strip was perfect for us. We did not want to spend our vacation shopping on the strip and rented a car to get around the island. We were able to jump in the car and head out exploring with minimal traffic to and from the hotel.  A few words about the staff. We have stayed at five star hotels that did not provide the level of customer service that we received from the staff at Park Shore. The front desk was helpful, professional, kind and courteous. They asked how we were enjoying our stay, made recommendations and provided directions when they saw us trying to navigate a map. The valet service was fantastic, I am a smoker and I always kid my husband when we valet park that I have plenty of time to smoke because it will take forever to get the car anyway, but this was not the case at the Park Shore. These guys were on it! We waited an average of 2-3 minutes to get our car EVERY time. The cost of Parking was $22 a day but after driving all over Oahu, I can tell you that cost is a bargain. We parked at the Sheraton Waikiki one night for a catamaran cruise we were taking and it cost $20 for 4.5 hours! The housekeeping staff was exceptional. Everything was clean and replenished daily and always without interrupting us. The one suggestion I would make here is that in the room there is a card saying if you hang up your towels you will reuse them, if they are on the floor they will be replaced. I expected the same type of notice in regards to bed linens, but did not find one. I don't need my bed linens changed everyday and would like to see that option as well. They have an activities desk in the lobby (this might be expedia) and they were very helpful booking us last minute tickets to the Paradise Cove luau. The Luau did not have any front row seating left, but the activities director requested they bump us up if they had a cancellation. When we got there we were seated in the front row! Fantastic! I give kudos to this team for helping to making our stay wonderful. I work in the property management industry (managing apartment communities) and if anyone of the staff members at the Park Shore wanted a job on the mainland they could call me!

We stayed at this hotel about a year and a half ago and it was awesome. This time around everything was great too, but we had a bit of a mix up with our booking. We reserved an oceanfront room (probably one of the best rooms on the strip for the price) and got a suite instead. The suite was VERY nice, but not an ocean front view. When we called the front desk to ask for a downgrade back to our original booking we got put in a corner room which, while still technically ocean front, was facing diamond head. Still haf an absolutely awesome view, but it wasn't as great as our room last year. Still, if you want a nice hotel for a good price, Park Shore is a safe choice!

We stayed here as a part of our honeymoon to Hawaii in April 2013. This hotel is value for money when it comes to location, clean rooms and friendly staff. If you choose Park Shore you are not expecting a standard as some of the more premium hotels but the hotel delivers very well in its segment. Location wise its right there close to Waikiki with close proximity to Diamond head and the more "relaxed" eastern part of the famous beach. I would reccomend Park Shore to everyone that needs a clean and nice place to stay but does not want to spend to much money to be on Waikiki.

We booked two nights (Sept. 6 & 7) in a 'Standard Room, Ocean View' with the preference of a king bed through hotels.com for about $250/nt including taxes. The front desk initially put us in a king room on the 10th floor but it was too close to the wing facing the ocean. We couldn't see diamond head and the room/lanai was just feet away from a room/lanai on the other wing.We went down to the front desk and asked to be moved makai (closer to the ocean) and they gave us keys to a king room on the 8th floor that had an amazing view of diamond head and felt more private. We moved our bags to the new room and dropped off the keys to the first room. Both people who helped us at the front desk were very helpful.The room was very clean and comfortable. The bed and pillows were not too firm or soft for us. All linens were decent quality. I found the electronic thermostat easy to use and it automatically shut off when the sliding glass door was open.We used the valet and they were all very friendly. We were told to just show up at the valet stand when needing our car. No call prior necessary and they were very quick all three times we needed our car. Make sure to give them an idea how long it will be before you need your car if you can to speed up the process.It was nice to have the lemon water and pog in the lobby. There's a simple sign-out sheet for beach towels at the front desk. People sometimes leave boogie boards and floats near the elevator when checking out.

We stayed at the Park Shore for our honeymoon. Upon check-in we were told that we had been upgraded from Ocean front view to ocean and Diamond Head view. When we got to the room we discovered it was a handicap accessible room, no bath tub, wheelchair accessible shower. Room was very small and I was terribly disappointed. My husband suggested we call the desk and ask for a different room. They wete, thankfully, very accomodating. They moved us to a lovely room on the 17th floor. We had a view of the ocean and Diamond Head. The pool at the hotel was treat! We ate a couple of times at Lulu's which is on the 2nd floor and the food was great. The location of the hotel is awesome. Right across the street from the zoo, right around the corner from Starbucks, and right across the street from Waikiki. Great hotel!

We booked an ocean front room for our 10yr wedding anniversary during the first week of September. We had a late check in and were very tired from the flight. To our surprise the lady working front desk knew it was our anniversary and upgraded us to a suite! It was large, clean and very comfortable, we didn't realize how spectacular the view would be until the sunrise that morning. It was breathtaking! Our room was 1811 and we highly recommend booking this suite. You have unobstructed views of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach! So calming and relaxing! Lovely to sleep with the balcony open to hear the ocean waves. The service at the Park Shore is fabulous, everyone is very helpful and always happy! I've been fortunate to have been to Hawaii several times before but this was my first time at the Park Shore and can honestly say it was the best hotel with great service that I have experienced there. Everything was perfect and so very memorable. We will defiantly be back!

I can't speak highly enough of the Park shore Waikiki, It is such a friendly and well run Hotel and I would recommend it to anyone for location,cleanliness and staff friendliness as well as the quality of the room itself. PS We have been to Waikiki 5 times and this is my favorite Hotel. We will definitely come back.

This can be one of the best choices you can make situated at around 20min distance drive from the airport.The hotel is just across the beach, right place if you want to enjoy nice sunsets from the balcony or the beach. Rooms were ok, clean. AC was working fine. Staff was helpful. I would go back there again.

Imagine waking up every morning to a breathtaking view of Diamond Head, the Pacific , and a verdant lush park! Look no further, you've found the right hotel.Without a doubt the Park Shore occupies the best piece of real estate of any 3 star hotel on Waikiki, and I know the area well. I'd first found this property a few years ago prior to their just completed renovation. The location on the makes for unobstructed views from the oceanview and oceanfront rooms. (We had oceanview - 12th floor.) There are a few in the partial oceanviewcategory that do provide a decent view as well, though you might find the proximity to your neighbor's balcony a bit disconcerning. I found all of the descriptions of and photos of room categories on the property's web site to be quite accurate. The very adequate pool on the third floor overlooked the ocean and a spacious stretch of beach just across the streetRegarding the renovation, our room had a well sized bathroom with tub and good counter space, a private lanai, and comfy king size bed with new "Perfect Sleeper" mattress. Rooms are on the small side (as is the case with most 3 star Waikiki hotels), but was fine for two on a ten day stay.Oceanfront rooms are slightly larger, as are the poolview rooms, the later furnished with two queen beds.A big plus was the quiet central air conditioning system, a feature not always found in more reasonably priced properties. The flat screen TV had a good assortment of channels. The coffee marker was fine for just that, though the many Australian guests longing for a spot of tea will find it just as inadequate for the purpose as all American models. The mini fridge was fine for beverages.We found the staff to be friendly and quite approachable. Any requests for information or services were immediately addressed. Should you require a king bed, you may want to make that request known to the property in advance.Rate wise, the Park Shore is one of the more reasonably priced 3 stars in Waikiki. In fact non oceanview rooms can be a bargain. These still have a lanai, and while they face another hotel, I've seen far worse in Honolulu. When comparing prices do note that the property does not charge a resort fee ($25-$30/night), nor do they charge for internet, often adding another $10-$15 nightly. Valet parking is very reasonable in the low twenties per night for those with a car.Aqua, the management category does work with traditional travel agents, so if you're booking far out, this may be a moneysaving option if you find one knowledgeable about Hawaii. Close in, shop around with their website and an agent. Rates do vary by season and overall hotel occupancy in Honolulu. The Park Shore Waikiki won't disappoint for those looking for a modern room with a view in the three star category. On our September visit we found mostly guests traveling as couples in a mixture of age groups. The hotel is definitely gay friendly.

Me and my husband just stayed at the Park Shore hotel for 4 nights. Everything was excellent!! I almost didn't want to share this here... But I owe them a 5 star review for the great stay :)When I travel the two things I care about most are cleanliness and location. And I think I hit the jackpot as they delivered on so many levels beyond these two!! It all statred at check in when we were upgraded from the standard room to the partial ocean view as it was a trip for my birthday. And the view from the room was AMAZING!! We were on the 6th floor looking over the pool and Waikiki. The room was not big but perfect for two people. Hotel had been recently renovated and in excellent condition. There was a small closet, iron and board, coffee maker, fridge, safe, flat TV, cold a/c, hot shower, toiletries, plenty of fresh towels. The lanai was spacious with two chairs and a table to enjoy the view while having a glass if wine... Room was very clean, housekeeping service was great. Front desk staff was really nice also. There wasn't much noise while in the room but I think the hotel was not very busy during our stay. Free wifi all over the hotel. They have lemon water and juice in the lobby. They also provide beach towels. You get them at the front desk, up to four per room and must return by 8pm. Now let me tell you about the location. It was the BEST!!! Hotel is half block from Waikiki beach, across from the zoo. You can see the beach sitting on a chair in the lobby and it takes you literary less then a minute to get there. What do you say about that?!! :)) It's on the end of Waikiki away from the busiest part of it. Next to the hotel entrance there is a ABC store where you can get pretty much anything you may need during your vacation. There is a sports bar on the second floor that we only checked out but did not like. On the lobby level there is that awesome place for sandwiches and juices Tucker and Bevvy - great for breakfast (to go or you can sit in, they have some tables) and picnic food. Starbucks next door, plenty of restaurants all around. Yes, there are homeless people sleeping on the streets but they are pretty much everywhere by the beach and hotel can't control that. Felt safe any time of the day or night though. They have a room where you can change and take a shower even after you check out and they store your luggage. So if you are lucky enough to be on a redeye flight you can enjoy another beach day after you leave our room :)Overall great stay, great hotel. So happy I found that place. Thank you Park Shore! We'll definitely be back!!

This hotel is just as nice (even better) than the postcard pictures. Thank you to the friendly hotel staff & the manager who happily placed us in the room we requested. Its a 50/50 chance to get the room you request so we were pleasantly surprised when it was available for us. Its in a great spot in Waikiki especially if you want to be in the mix of things without the noise of loud crowds... please don't pay attention to the silly wingers complaining about homeless people.. seriously why would you bother mentioning that?? This is a world wide issue, not just in Hawaii and it has nothing to do with the hotel! Besides, its not even a concern for guests, you rarely notice them when you're too busy taking in beautiful Waikiki beach & breath taking views of Diamond Head. The beauty of Park Shore is that its really fantastic value, most other hotels in such a popular tourist area will charge so many hidden extras, while Park Shore gives you extras at no charge (free internet, free use of beach equipment which is so handy.. grab a chair & umbrella & walk 20 steps to the best part of Waikiki beach, free cable,, free ice machine which is great on the way to the beach & an expedia expert in the lobby to help with tours etc it was actually cheaper for us to book our car through them than book online ourselves). Yes it's not 5 star, but it is 5 star for what you get considering the reasonable rates.Tip: the higher rooms with views of Diamond Head & Waikiki Beach are amazing, pure bliss!We loved Hawaii & its people so much, we are planning another trip soon & will be back at Park Shore. Thank you team Park Shore!

I chose the snooze-n-crooze package because I had a 10 day reunion to attend so car was essential. Arriving at Honolulu international airport I had no Idea where to go for vehicle pickup, I fudged it and walked across to the middle carriage way and noticed vans with rental logo's on them, 15mins later my van showed up I hailed it down and was taken to pickup my rental car. I have no issue with this company they were polite and return was as simple as hand over keys and that was it. Nothing like the horror stories from past reviews.My room was the room that faces the other hotel no sea or Diamond Head view, a bit on the tight side for space but this could have all been forgotten if the coffee machine could just make boiling hot coffee. It could only make lukewarm at best and the icebox was not working, I complained and instantly they were replaced but the replacement coffee machine was the same lukewarm coffee, I gave up and bought coffee. Why don't they just have a hot water kettle and microwave oven? Parking valets were polite and cordial, I would stay here again.

This booking was excellent from the point of the location and less noise than the rest of Waikiki. The 11th floor room facing the ocean AND Diamond Head was very nice. A quirky thing about the AC: it stops if the balcony door is not closed completely. I suppose this saves on electric energy and loss of efficiency to cool, so I think this is a nice thing to have.The parking was very expensive, but then again, where else can one park in that area? Certainly not at the zoo across the street. Still, at $22 per day, it is not what I would call a bargain,There are couple of ABC convenience stores at both corners and a Starbucks with a nifty deli place at the ground floor.I was not happy with the vending area, where there was a single, filthy, microwave oven with no utensils or crockery near by, The entrance is very close to the beach, but there was a number of homeless sleeping along any benches or close to the pathways leading to the hotel. Not a pretty or safe sight, either, but I suppose this is part of the territory.This hotel is definitely to be used as a base to visit Honolulu.

The hotel is literally steps to the Kuhio Beach Park in Waikiki. The location is fantastic. The hotel has been renovated so the rooms are updated and quite nice. The beds were comfy, the showers had the rainfall shower heads. It would have been nice if the bathroom had the clothesline that you could hang wet bathing suits to dry, as the balcony was likely to blow your drying items off. The front desk staff was fantastic. Nick helped us out a ton. One really nice touch was that they offered you the use of their hospitality suite to shower and change after we checked out since we had such a long time between check-out and our flight. This allowed us the opportunity to go to the beach and the pool and take in more fun. It was hard to figure out where to turn in for parking when we arrived, but we figured it out.

I must preface this review by saying that I understood the hotel was not 5 star when I booked, thus I did not expect 5 star service or amenities. I just needed a base for myself and my 5 year old daughter to sleep while we explored the island. I did not want to stay in the middle of Waikiki, so the location near the zoo was perfect for us. And I did not need tons of amenities since I knew we would not be spending much time in the room.Let's start with the room. I have stayed in Waikiki before, but I have never had a room this small. There was literally no place to put our suitcase. I ended up stacking them on top of each other and still had to move them to get to the beds. I don't think there was even 2 feet between the two double beds in the room. The size of the room definitely called for 1 king size bed instead of 2 doubles. In addition, there was not enough bedding, just a super thin blanket and sheets. A thicker blanket is needed.Another problem is the noise. The doors are self-closing like most hotel doors are, but these were extremely heavy for some reason. Not only were they difficult to open, but if you did not hold on to the door as it closed it would slam VERY LOUDLY! We were woken countless times at all hours of the night be people's slamming doors- so loud in the echoing hallways it could almost be mistaken for a gunshot. Not to mention that the walls were incredibly thin and we could everything our neighbors were doing and everything that was being said in the hallways.Now for the service. The front desk staff were pleasant enough, but the people working valet were rude and did not seem to want to be there at all. And if you have a car, you have no choice BUT to valet. I misplaced my valet ticket and was berated by the valet attendant who proceeded to show me the cabinet of keys and asked me how I could expect him to find my key among the ones in the cabinet. I have never been spoken to in this way by a hospitality employee before. In addition, when I would pull my car up to have it parked the valet attendants would often just stand there doing nothing. I would have to get out of my car and ask them if it was okay to leave the car. And yes, I tipped every time I used valet, even though that would not have been a good excuse for this level of service anyway. AND I had to pay dearly for this daily "service".The location was good for what I wanted, but the driveway was extremely hard to get out of when driving. The zoo is literally right across the street, and there is decent beach in front of the hotel. There are several convenience stores and places to eat nearby as well. However, this street corner seems to be THE place for local drunks and bums to congregate. I am aware of (and used to) Waikiki's homeless problem, and I am not unsympathetic to the unfortunate, but this particular spot was inhabited by some very aggressive and very drunk people on a daily basis. We did not walk outside of the hotel after dark because of this. I know the hotel has no control over this, but it is something you should be aware of, especially if you are a solo female or traveling with young children.I will not be staying here again.

We went to Park Shore Hotel in 2011 and we loved it! clean, beautiful oceanview, just across the street of a small cosy and quiet beach, a nice pool on 2nd floor, restaurant and all amenities within 100 feet of walk, and service is very good, interior parking too, beds just as comfortable as should be: not too soft not too hard, and in 2013 all rooms are renovated, they were already nice before, now they are gorgeous and inviting! Prices are similar compared to hotels around. You can get better prices sometimes if you call by phone. Recommend!

Liked the location of Park Shore. Close to beach and a much quieter location than other places in Waikiki we have stayed in. Pink Line trolleys stop just around the corner for shopping. Nice pool area but hours could be longer and closes at sunset. Rooms very nicely remodelled.

I was supposed to go last December/2012, but cancelled when I found out they were in the middle of remodeling. The hotel is in a great location and the housecleaning staff was great. Front desk staff was hit or miss, because when I had problems I didn't get to speak with the manager, even though I requested to. I was there for an extended stay each time and loved the restaurant Lulu's downstairs. The Diamondhead view is outstanding and the beach out front is the best in Waikiki. My last visit was March 2011, but it didn't give me the option for that date.
user_name:
Wendy G
Panama City Beach, Florida

review_body: So we stayed at this place with very high hopes since we were spending high $s! Nick at the front desk was very nice and confirmed that we would get the roll-away bed that we had originally asked for. Then they called us and told us that they couldn't give us the extra bed and one of us was forced to have a not-so-restful night. When he went downstairs to hang in the lobby at 3 AM because he wasn't able to get a good night sleep given the change in plans forced upon us, he was confronted by scary big guys who stood around to intimidate him. We asked for a refund for the second night and all the nice PR person could do was to give us a very small fraction of our money back. Great location, but service is poor and I think I'll just go to the big island next time and not be squeezed out of every penny because there are 5,000 other tourists competing for my same accommodations!

So happy that this hotel accommodates the "locals" who have stayed here pre renovation. The price remained reasonable and they did not impose a minimum night stay. We like staying here during the Okinawa Festival because of the proximity to the fair site. While the renovations were going on my thoughts were that the prices would be "jacked" out of local people's range. Pleasantly surprised that price was reasonable, staff was cordial as usual and the room was fabulous! Room was nicely done, very clean and while still small it didn't seemed cramped.Hope to stay there again!

Everything was good about this hotel-remodelled,clean,good staff,comfortable.i had booked this hotel through the manager of Flight Centre Manakau,Esther Paparoa who always over past ten years took care of me and gave me the best advice-so when she booked this hotel for me it was all good.

I wish I could give the Park Shore 4 stars, it's really convenient and the staff were pleasant. What was unpleasant was our key, which never really worked without 8-10 swipes even after we rekeyed it, and our balcony door which took a lot of jiggling to get to stay closed. Nice pool. The onsite restaurants were good (we really liked the calamari at Lulu's). Overall a good value and we would give them a second try.

I stayed at the Park Shore Hotel for 5 days. The location is great across the street from the Honolulu Zoo and 1/2 block from the Beach. The hotel itself is very clean and has been remodeled. I stayed on the 6th Floor, my room had a large screen t.v., 2 double beds, safe, mini refrigerator,balcony and full bathroom and was nicely decorated. The perks of the hotel is you get a free news paper daily, free wi-fi, you can request towels to utilize for the beach/or pool at the front desk and beach chairs. The pool is on the 3rd floor and is very clean and is not crowded, you can overlook the beach from the pool area which is a nice scene. You have a local Starbucks, ABC stores and new health food cafe next door which has healthy juices, gelato, sandwiches, hummus, etc for really reasonable prices for the location. Valet parking is good, you may come and go it is $22 a day. The freeway is a few blocks away from the hotel should you want to venture out. Another advantage is there are no resort fees. Many of the hotels in the area charge resort fees, but Park Shore does not. Also there is less noise in the location of the hotel, compared to other hotels on the strip and down the block. My daughter and I enjoyed the hotel and would definitely recommend it to others.

I liked this hotel because of it's location, rooms, and staff. Parkshore is the last hotel on east end of Waikiki strip to be away from the crowds and traffic. It is directly across the street from the beach and adjacent to Honolulu Zoo and Kapiolani park. I got a 14th floor room overlooking the beach but a smidgen of Diamond Head. The room was comfortable for myself and sons (12 & 16) with a king bed and full size pullout. The room was clean and I liked the minibar with utensils, sink, mini-fridge (which looked brand new). The staff and housekeeping were friendly and helpful. The pool was closed on a couple of occasions which we did not use because we were at the beach, snorkling excursions, shopping and dining. I rented a car for one day at the Budget located 2 blocks west in the Hyatt Regency and booked at Costco travel. I rented a car from Dollar for the last 2 days (Dollar picks you up to go their Waikiki location). I parked on an hourly basis at the zoo which meters $1/hour and allowed overnight parking. This was a cheaper option to valet because I was coming and going. You can checkout the hotel towels. The Starbucks next door was convenient but busy. LuLu's Restaurant is upstairs from there which offered open air dining from morning to night. The restaurant had an authentic surfer decor with great food and service. My kids liked that Stonecold Creamery and Subway were a few doors down. Teddy's Bigger Burgers is the opposite side of hotel which is an inexpensive option for good food (they also do take-out). Restaurants on the opposite end of the strip has long wait times for dinner. There is a grill on the beach that serves breakfast to dinner. This is my 5th trip to Oahu and 3rd stay on Waikiki. Don't expect a 5 star fancy resort with spa, buffet, exercise rooms, etc. I liked that this hotel was low-key and uncrowded. You can get inexpensive inflatable rafts and tubes from the plentiful ABC stores and lounge on the tranquil waters of Waikiki beach. I got on the Aqua Hotels email list and they sent me a discount code for first timers that saved $$$$.

I was recommended to this hotel by friends. For vacationers wanting to stay in a quiet but convenient location across the road from the beach and out of the hustle and bustle of the centre of Waikiki yet within easy reach this hotel "spells" relaxation. The room which I stayed in was a renovated room which could not be faulted. It was an "oceanfront" room so the view was magnificent. The hotel does not have room service, gym or some of the other amenities of larger hotels but makes up for this by virtue of it's good value, location and intimate atmosphere. There was a small refrigerator supplied so that it was possible to keep snacks and drinks to be enjoyed during times on the balcony reading, watching the sunset etc. I stayed for over ten days and have no complaints about my stay.

We stayed here at the beginning of August for our honeymoon. Upon checkin the staff was extremely friendly and we were given our room keys right away. They upgraded our room to a high floor for free because it was our honeymoon which was really appreciated. The location is amazing. I've been to Hawaii at least 20 times and I love staying at the far end of Waikiki. It is much quieter and Kuhio and Queens Beach aren't as crowded. I have seen an increase in the homeless population over the past 10 years but they didn't bother us. Would definitely stay here again if we have it in our budget.
